It took some heated demanding but they did send someone eventually to check.....though certainly did not act immediately. GUESS WHAT....we were right, no hot water. After lots of banging etc it came on and cleared the blocked drain. YEH! Our coffee/tea maker was broken so we had exchanged it for the one in our previous room. The downstairs stair door was outside our room so very audible most of the night from being used because the lift was so slow and bumpy. Even their own staff gave us the heads up that the stairs were quicker to use. The bumpiness was normal apparently. Staff had to use one of the 3 lifts so you could wait ages before one arrived. On each floor large linen baskets would remain near the lifts full of wet, soggy linen and towels. These baskets seemed to have a life of there own constantly obstructing the lift door or the passageway so you had to constantly move them to get by....Breakfast was a whole other bad adventure. It was next door by an adjoining door in a Chinese restaurant. The Continental bfast consisted of 1 juice, 2 sugary cereals, 1 fruit, a banana and a very limp, totally sugary, starchy, no taste pastry. Even remote outback Australia has a better, more wholesome selection. The Gallivant staff were not friendly, totally dismissive, unhelpful and obviously did not like their jobs. when there own staff tell you what is wrong with the place you know you are doomed. By the way we also had scaffolding outside the building and trolleys going up and down outside our room most of the day. A large glass panel above the front door was broken and secured by tape which had been there for sometime by its appearance....so they were obviously not in a rush to repair it. Could have been a potential hazard l’m thinking! This hotel was supposedly a 4 star but having now travelled extensively over the last 6 years in my opinion maybe a 2. Better suited as BACKPACKERS not a hotel. And for all the student groups that were there at the time l would say that is the type of patronage it gets. Actually l have been to much better backpacker accommodation than this certainly with far more friendly, approachable, helpful, obliging staff. Sadly this was not only our complaint as we met an English couple at a nearby pub who were also not satisfied with there room and were having to move. Because we all had paid upfront, to move elsewhere would have been exorbitant as we had paid $510 AU per night for this absolute appalling facility. We had booked it through a travel agent in WA/ Australia and once home put in a complaint to the wholesaler EXCITE HOLIDAYS, that fell on deaf ears...So for all you Aussie travellers please do not book anything through this company. BOOK direct to the USA companies if going to the USA who seen to look after their customers Also do not trust the photos you see on Gallivants website they are completely not trustworthy and they should be fined for false advertising. BE WARNED!

Arrived Christmas Day and was told we have been downgraded, as the room was given to another customer... we booked this in October. Then the next day we were moved to another room, this had no electrics and moved to the 3rd room, this time there was only luke warm water, they wanted to move us again, but we refused. The place was really dated, the staff rude, the front desk very unhelpful, paid the Urban tax and the refunded a days worth due to the downgrade, however less that 5 minutes later checked my bank and the took this back and is still showing on my statement. To make matters worse they also take a security deposit, of £198 this was taken 3 times refunded once and again still showing on my app as out going. Disgusting place. No one cares in the Hotel many, many complaints, and plus we were told by the front desk staff that we pay for the location not the room cleanliness, or style.... what a comment. Anyway, back in the UK and now putting a claim together for BA to deal with. Never again will I stay at this Hotel, rather stay at a Premier Inn. BTW the room cost over £250 per night. And only worth £20 in my opinion. The bed was stained, sheets dirty etc.Please book somewhere else.

This hotel was in a great location. Not right in the midst of all the Time Square traffic but close to all the theaters. The hotel was clean, staff was friendly and the attached restaurant had the best curry chicken !! I will definitely consider this hotel on my next trip to NYC.

We have been doing this tradition of NYC for 5 years now and the last 2 we have stayed at the Gallivant in Time Square. This year we messed up on the date and my daughter called the hotel and spoke reservations. It couldn't have been nicer and accommodating. He was able to switch the date for us with no Hassle.The convenience of this Hotel to Times Square is perfect. It was a perfect weekend,

We stayed in the Gallivant from 22nd to 28th Dec 19. The hotel was very nice and the staff very helpful. Excellent location for Times Square. Our room was a decent size and cleaned daily (including Xmas day). Plenty of places to eat and drink nearby but no bar on site. The shower was powerful but took a while to heat up. Wifi was available but could be quite slow. A few people had commented on the rooms being small but it was great for what we needed and the bed was really comfortable. Small wardrobe but there were drawers for storage. Iron, ironing board and hairdryer all in the room. Before going we had read mixed comments re fees to be paid. We were charged 50 usd per night deposit for breakages and the resort fees were approx 37 usd per night. We had to use a credit card and were told we will basically pay the deposit amount then about 7 days after checking out we would be credited the difference back, rather than taking both payments and refunding one back. Would recommend this hotel however if crowds aren’t your thing I would avoid Times Square at Christmas

Overpriced, Overheated and underwhelmed! Its near Times Square thats it! Not the best location. Room was tiny couldnt even turn around in the bathroom without knocking your elbow! The amenities fees includes water (but you have to ask for it) a gym heated to 40 plus Celsius so forget it! So pretty much you get wifi for s couple hours you might be jn the room. Front desk staff pompous! Would never recommend this hotel!

We stayed in The Gallivant for 2 nights at the end of Oct 2019 pre cruise and I can honestly say it was probably the worst hotel we have ever stayed in! The staff were all really unhelpful and rude and made you feel like you were incoveniencing them. Even the manager was full of attitude and couldnt care less about the issues we raised with her. She just didnt want to listen to our concerns. Customer service was majorly lacking at this hotel!The photos of the hotel online really don't reflect the cleanliness or condition of the hotel at all. Our room was small with battered/damaged furniture and wallpaper peeling off the wall. The room was far from clean. There was hair etc all over the floor where it hadn't been swept (laminate not carpeted). There was hair in the sink and had several small moth like insects in the bathroom each day. My sister had blood stains on her bed sheets in her room which didn't get changed, even after it was reported to the receptionist. The windows appeared single glazed with plastic film stuck to them so the room (at the front of the hotel) was very noisy all day and night. As well as the general outside/street noise there is a fire station right on the corner so there was constant noise during the night from fire trucks coming and going.The only positive thing about this hotel was the location but everything else was awful. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Our stay at this hotel really put a downer on our first experience of New York city.

Every staff person we encountered was friendly, courteous, and very helpful. Great location to the theater district which was the purpose of our trip. Excellent dinners with reasonable prices. Perfect!

I hate to be taken for a fool. Like many of you we see a hotel and go strait to the reviews in some of our favorite review sites. For this hotel every comment was great, I couldn’t wait to make my reservations. Oh boy was I off for a trip down hellhole paradise. This place is awful, Dirty rooms, heaters did not work properly, Need major repairs, front door do not close shot completely (could see the hall way lights thought the edges. Cockroaches, yes big, nasty life cockroaches. We complaint about all this to the front desk but they only switch us to another room (worse). The rooms are very noisy but for the area (Time Square ) is expected. On the bright side is steps from the Time Square attractions but this is not an excuse, they should provide clean, well maintained properties specially for the money they charge. Please, Please, Please, go some place else. Do the research even after visiting the reviews sites, they don’t seem reliable any more.

In summary a good experience, I was not very happy with the charge when checking out I recomended, if I return to NY I will stay in the same placeThe elevators are old and very small when it came down to breakfast was full and we had to use the stairs

We stayed at The Gallivant Time Square in early December and had a fabulous time.It is so well situated, a few steps away from Time square in one direction and the other way a few steps from places to eat. We had a standard room which was booked as part of our package. we could have upgraded our room to something bigger, by, although the room was small it was immaculately clean and adequate for our needs, which was basically just to sleep in. It was comfortable! We had the coffee machine replenished every day and fresh towels daily. The staff were all really pleasant to us and very helpful. We really had a great stay at this wonderful time of the year! Thank you!

We came up with our family and it was wonderful. The hotel and people working and helping us were excellent as well. The location and accessibility to town was great. They staff was so helpful and so nice to us, being newbies

Room could have used some work. Stupid things like the light switch being chipped like someone hit it with a hammer. Great location and very friendly staff! Thank you for an enjoyable evening with my girlfriend

Great location for this hotel to get out and about to explore this lovely city. The room we had was small and basic but very clean. Problems getting the elevator in the morning so ended up walking down the stairs and on the day we checked out we waited at least 10 mins for the elevator as we didn’t want to go down 6 flights with our luggage.

This was my first trip to NYC, but I was expecting the noise and a small room. My biggest issues were the heat constantly running (and would get hotter if the heat or A/C were actually turned on), hidden fees, and the staff. I saw the concierge once during my stay. She was helpful, but some of her recommendations were closed that day. The shower was clogged and there wasn’t a door, but the water was hot. You also have to wait up to 10 minutes on the elevator at certain times.

Fantastic location to explore all the sights of NYC- round the corner from Times Square and was only a short walk to Empire State Building and the Music Box theatre where we watched 'Dear Evan Hansen'. Cleaners did a fantastic job of cleaning the room every day (we often left towels on the floor etc and room was always spotless when we came back every night). Yes it is a bit noisy but that is to be expected in NYC and we thought it added to our experience (plus we were so tired every night it didn't keep us awake!). We knew there was an urban fee before we booked so this wasn't a surprise, although it would have been nice if the staff checking us in explained that $150 will be taken and the excess will be returned as we were confused as to why this much was taken. Melanie at the concierge was also very helpful in helping us organise a shuttle to JFK on departure and $2 to keep our luggage for the whole of our last day was very good. Overall, had a great experience and I will be back! Thank you.

I am travelling to NY every 2 months and staying in a different hotel every time in Times Square but this hotel should simply closed down. It's wrong at every level. DO NOT BOOK a room in this hotel!When I entered my room, and I could see right away how badly cleaned and maintained it was. I found on the floor, dirty socks, used tissues, a bottle of soda and dust everywhere. My windows were covered in plastic and taped with duck tape . The condensation was dripping all over the floor and the AC/Heat unit was unplugged because it was a hazard! So no heat & the shower handle stayed in my hand. I asked to change room immediately , and after apologizing, the person at the reception apologized and gave me a new room. The new room had a queen bed but so small!!! Also the mattress felt very old and bad quality.The worst part is also the noise. Again, I slept in many hotels, and have never heard so well every single noise of the streets of New York! Insolation is so bad. When I checked out at 4am in the morning, I was confronted with the most rude person ever. I asked him if I needed to do anything for check out (but every was fully paid already) and he tells me that I have to pay $200 of no show fees because I didn't checkin my last night? We argued and he was simply not helpful and really mean honestly. Then I told him that my wake up call didn't work, nobody called me, and the guy just tells me without a care in the world that the phone system is broken. No apologies nothing.

Shower handle broke off Light taped into holder!! Tiny bathroom. Tricked into giving them my bank card. Lies. an “Urban Fee” was taken without my knowledge!! Noise horrendous (but I know it’s NY). Unfriendly staff. I would advise against.

Came here with the family in December to enjoy Christmas in NY. Pro’s: - GREAT Location. It’s within walking distance to Times Square, Rockafeller, Broadway, Empire State Building, & Central Park. We walked everywhere which was perfect. - Bunk Beds - Made it really easy for our family of 5 to stay. We didn’t find a ton of family options in this price range which is why we chose this place. - Room is small but it does the job. It was clean. Not brand new but we had no major issues with cleanliness. - Tons of great food options. Starbucks & Dunkin are right around the corner. - The staff was really sweet. The housekeeping service took care of us and made sure we had what we needed. They told us to grab towels or cups from the cart as we needed. Cons: - Sirens & Honking Throughout the night. It’s near a fire station so if you’re a light sleeper, bring earplugs. We slept ok but it definitely is loud. - Heater is loud & controls did not work. It was so hot we slept with the window cracked (with 30 degree temps & sirens outside) not ideal. - FEES: $30 Urban Fee, per day! Hikes your room rate way up. Total “extra fees per day” including taxes and urban fee came to an EXTRA $87 on top of the room rate. It adds up and although it’s not entirely hotel fees - travelers should know what to expect. All in all, I think if we could score a better deal on the room price, we would stay again for the family accommodations and location. But bring ear plugs.

The hotel is just round the corner from times square..the rooms are small but you can upgrade for an extra fee per night very clean staff very nice you pay a 50 dollar per night deposit on arrival which you get back when you leave and the city tax is 34 dollars a night paid on departure.. a bakery is across the road and there is a restaurant one side of the hotel and a bar the other side..

Fabulous location in busy Times Square, perfect for Downtown and Uptown trips. staff friendly and very helpful, good size family room,with large shower, bedding changed every day. Will definitely be back.

Having read some reviews we were initially concerned but had a fantastic stay. The hotel is ideally located right in time square. The staff are fantastic and we paid extra for a king room on the 14th floor and it was spacious with coffee making and a decent shower. The lifts were fine there are 3 of them and we never waited long. Great bar next door

I will first say, check in went smoothly however the gentleman at the front desk was NOT friendly OR helpful. When I asked about valet parking he said it was a waste and I didn't need it. (So why advertise it?) We checked into a family room on the 15th floor for a group of 6. Immediately at check in we asked for an extra set of towels to be placed in our room. Then a 2nd time. Then a 3rd time. Then finally we approached a female front desk attendant who assured us she'd have towels in our room upon our return from dinner, which she did. The room was spacious enough. The bunk bed looked like it was about to fall of the wall, so that was concerning. The elevators take forever and they are incredibly SMALL ... 4 adults with luggage would be max. The property itself is a little outdated and needs some TLC but the location was excellent for our needs. We were with 10-15 minutes walking distance of Rockefeller Center, Times Square and Radio City.

This is a hotel that you feel creeped out to even be sleeping in the bed. Upon arriving we booked the top KING room. After we were checked in we were told our room had been given away but not to worry, we were being upgraded to a queen “DELUXE” Room. The lock was falling off the hinges, the paint is falling off the walls, the room is the size of a walk-in closet... The mattress was lumpy, and you’ll be starting at your neighbors. I’m quit positive the AC unit’s filter hasn’t been changed in years, and the fan in the bathroom doesn’t work. Chances are these guys are violating several fire and safety code standards.The front desk attendant who checked us in was unhelpful and pushy, providing little to no help and when asked about any type of room offsetting compensation I was told that it is impossible because I had already paid for the room. But I DIDN’T PAY FOR THIS ROOM! So that makes no sense... My recommendation is do not stay here.And leave yourself plenty of time for elevators as they are small.The only upside, Larry the bellman is really nice and helpful.

Just stayed in a family room, it was very clean and tidy, tv was huge as was the bathroom, clean towels every day, didnt have a problem. With the lifts (as per some reviews) would definitely recommend, we didnt get told they would take a 200 doller deposit for breakage before our trip so was a little annoyed about that but that was my travel agents mistake not the hotels

We stayed here for a week in early December and it was a terrible experience! Our first room, shockingly small and barely big enough for the tiny double bed let alone anything else, had a broken window and was on the main road where they were having building work outside! The scaffolding was loose and banged and clanged all night long so we got zero sleep after travelling for 24 hours!! Exhausted we requested another room to which we were sent to the other side of the hotel. The room was still tiny but less noisy and so we stayed there for the duration. The wall paper is coming off in the room, there was no handle on the drawer and out toiletries were not topped up each day so by the 3rd day we had nothing. On the third day at the hotel, we came back to our room after being out all day to find a towel in our toilet, after the cleaner had been. In the lobby, the toilets flooded one day making it horrible by the lifts, another day one of the lifts was broken, and on multiple occasions there were cockroaches everywhere. I’d like to say that people should avoid this hotel. Here’s just a snippet of our experience:-The bell hop was insane and argued with himself!!- the toilets didn’t flush - there were cockroaches everywhere to which the response was “hey whatcha gonna dooo” - we complained to the manager but didn’t get any response Awful and ruined our first ever visit to NYC!

Great location with friendly and helpful staff. Can be noisy but being in the middle of Times Square this is to be expected, and to be honest it never disturbed my sleep. Wouldn’t use the concierge though, way more expensive. Rooms are small but this is NYC.

Family holiday, let down by poor hotel and rude staff. Room was not clean, paint peeling off the ceiling, bunk beds where not level, and only a "safety" bar less than half way down the top bed, blocked shower with a handle that kept falling off....the list goes on...The strangest thing was that they have no duvet covers over the duvets, just a sheet wrapped around it. So the actually duvet which I doubt has ever been cleaned was easily exposed....We had a "premium" family room. It was anything but premium. Any issues we had where ignored by the staff, who didn't really care. it is worth knowing that the hotel is virtually on top of a fire station so if you have young children the fire engines are constantly using their horns and sirens 24/7 and as there is no double glazing you will be woken up constantly through out the night.The only thing the hotel has going for it is the location, whcih is good, just off times square, but I would have preferred a longer walk back to a better hotel.

The room was basic but does the job for somewhere to rest after a long day in New York. We booked via a travel agent in the UK and paid resort fees in advance as part of the booking. The Gallivant later mentioned us paying resort fees at check in which we queried and were assured they were paid and would not be charged again. On check in we only paid incidentals and were told we would get it back at the end and no mention of resort/urban fees. However on check out the woman told us that they were keeping urban fees from the incidentals, despite us telling her countless times that we had already paid she just shrugged and couldn’t care less telling us to ask for a refund from the travel agent. Completely misleading and borderline theft, will never use again.

The best thing about this hotel is location! We have just left after a 5 night stay at this hotel and honestly I don’t know why there are bad comments about the hotel. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Yes you will get noise at night as your right in times sq but I am a very light sleeper and I slept every night without any problems. The bed was very comfy and the room had everything you need. The room was a little tired and could do with a little improvement here and there but it wasn’t an issue and for the location and price you pay you can overlook little things like that. A brilliant stay and will definitely stay here again on my next visit.

Our room was very basic but not unexpected for where it is. The location of the hotel is superb for exploring this amazing city.Friendly staff at reception and a nice atmosphere. We would definately stay again.

This hotel is in a perfect location for exploring New York. The only downside is that the central position means it’s noisy at night. Better double glazing would help resolve this issue. The other thing that would improve this hotel is that the extra city tax, which is $34.50, should be included in the room price so that when booking, visitors would be immediately aware of the true cost.

Our over all experience has great. We came up to NY for a show and dinner. Only spent minimum time in the room however, it was clean and presentable. The wife and I traveled with friends that had stayed at The Galivant before and I would definitely recommend you to friends as well.

We arrived at the Gallivant after a bad experience at the airport to be then greeted by a member of staff who hardly spoke to us but was happy enough to hold a deposit on my credit card. It was my mums birthday on the day we arrived too we hardly even got a hello. Not the best start to our trip. Is a shame the hotel didn’t have a bar as my dad rang the hotel to see if we could get a bottle of champagne for our room to surprise my mum for her birthday but they wouldn’t arrange anything which I’m sure they could off. The another bad thing I would say is our shower leaked badly and there was not always hot water in the morning for a shower. On the plus side our room was nice and clean the bed was very comfy. The location is the best thing about this hotel.

I was a bit worried before travelling at the mixed reviews but i will be honest in my review. This is my 8th visit to New York but my first time taking my 3 kids with us ages 6,10,13. We had a family room so had previously read that these rooms were much bigger than the standard rooms. I knew all about the fees we had to pay on arrival so was prepared for this. My kids all used the wifi and never had any problems with the signal. The reception was beautiful and nicely decorated for Christmas. Not once did we wait anymore than a couple of minutes for the lifts. This was never any problem for us. Our room was massive especially for NY sizes. We had two double beds and bunk beds. Bathroom was also very big with a big walk in shower, two sinks and very clean. We had a mini fridge, coffee machine and plenty of sachets topped up every morning. My only gripe would be the rooms need a wee tlc. Chipped paint, handle missing from the drawer but we were more than happy with our visit and wouldn’t let this put us off returning. It was cleaned every day and the maids were very friendly. The location is perfect for Times Square. We would definitely return.

Stayed for 3 days and while the room is small, the location was awesome. You are steps away from Times Square and a 5-10 walk to Rockefeller Center. The staff is friendly from check in to check out. I would stay here again.

An excellently situated hotel to explore The City. Our room was fairly spacious for our needs,exceptionally clean and tidy. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. One minor fault,rooms could do with double glazing,to help full the traffic noise.

Stayed at the gallivant dec 2 to 6 deluxe queen room 1025 nice size with a cupboard for the cases great location walked times square at 6 am very quiet the lady on reception with the long black hair was great very helpful and I hope she enjoyed the malteasers we left the room cleaners were good it's a 3 star hotel and our experience was good I can see how other people's can differ but my overall experience was great we will be back

The staff are very polite and the room is clean but visitors have to be warned that the room is LITERALLY a small bed with walls wrapped around it. You have to be a small person or a contortionist to use the bathroom. It's criminal to rent rooms this small. It ruined my stay.

Hotel is in a great location. Friendly staff and clean room. Room was very small and very hot, air con worked but was too moist to use! Room number was 1301 but it’s possible other rooms are not this small....sadly we’ll never know I’m afraid

We stayed seven nights at The Gallivant and it was our first time in New York. The rooms were okay relating to size but the bathroom was incredibly small. I would recommend the Hotel for value for money and location. Some of the staff were not as friendly as they could have been but it all depended on who was at Reception at the time. My suggestion is not to have your breakfast in one place. There are many great options which will be clear on consecutive days after your arrival. The location made it great for photos first thing in the morning when most people were asleep. Great holiday!!

Not our first time staying at the Gallivant. Great location friendly staff and great Vietnamese restaurant next door. It is noisy if staying at the front of the hotel but you are just off Times Square so to be expected. Would definitely recommend.

upon arrival we were greeted with bIn bags outside the hotel doors stacked 4 bags high which wasn't a great sight or smell as well as scaffolding all over the front of hotel (i understand this is not avoidable however it is a bit of an eye sore). after checking in and waiting over 5 minutes for a lift to take us to the 9th floor we opened the door to our room to be greeted by the smallest so called 'queen sized' bed. it was the size of a large single bed. myself and boyfriend could not fit on this. when booking my holiday i paid for a standard room with a 'full size' bed as it says on their website which is ideal for two travels however going off photos on their website the room we were given was the single room which has a smaller bed and smaller room altogether. We could not open the wardrobe as the bed prevented was too close and could not be moved. i understand you will never get a big room in New York especially not the center but this was ridiculously small. i should be able to open a wardrobe door and fit on a bed for goodness sakeWe decided to go speak to reception as there was no way we could stay here. we spoke to reception and got told that there was no other rooms available apart from a room with two single beds which there was no way we were staying in, i did not bring my boyfriend on holiday for his 21st and spend all that money for this hotel only to be told we had to sleep in different beds and we would have to wait half an hour for the manager so we did and he told us we were in standard room and i explained there was no way that room is what is shown on your website for a standard room and that i would like to be moved rooms. got told i would have to pay for an upgraded room to which i explained that will not be happening as i have already paid for a room that i have not received and i was also on the phone contacting british airways during this as i was far from happy. and then as if by magic the manager said he can give us a room the same size as previous but the bed is bigger. We agreed to go view the room as it was the only one available we got told and we would not be able to move anywere else. the new had a proper sized double bed and the room was much bigger. not massive but large enough for two bodies and two suitcases so we decided this was okay. the bathrooms are so small you cannot move in them, i am 5ft 5 and when sitting on the toilet my legs were touching the wall in front it was very small even for New York. the wooden floors in the room were disgusting even after allegedly being cleaned, the room was facing onto the street so we had scaffolding out of our window which made the loudest noises throughout the night but as this was the last room we could not be moved. Our whole first day was wasted trying to sort rooms and wait for a manager who was extremely rude to us, told us we were wrong (which we were not as the photos on the website proved that), he was not helpful in the slightest until he released i was contacting British airways and i showed him the photos on HIS website to which he initially said was wrong and i said they are fro your website stating the size of rooms with photos. He was the most rude person!! the cleaning staff were lovely however, full of compliments and would always say Also to mention you get charged $34.42 per night per room as an 'urban fee' and 50 dollars per night per room deposit. This deposit takes 5-7 days we got told to go back on a debit card so they take it off and then you have to wait to get it back if the room is left with no damage, far too much money for such a shockingly bad hotel. they say the urban fee is to cover access to the business center which no holiday maker will be using, the fitness center and water upon request. also discount in the Chinese next door that is attached to the hotel discount off flowers, yoga class and mini bar delivery (THERE IS NOT EVEN A MINI FRIDGE IN THE ROOM AND NO ICE DISPENSER ON EVERY FLOOR SO YOU HAVE TO RUN AROUND THE HOTEL LOOKING FOR AN ICE DISPENSER AND TRY FIND ONE THAT ACTUALLY WORKS) we did not use any f these facilities so i don't understand why we had to pay such a high 'urban fee' RIDICULOUS!!!!. Absolutely no way would i recommend this hotel. worst hotel experience in my life and really ruined my holiday!!

Ideal hotel in a great location. Close to all the attractions including Central Park, Madison square garden, Rockefeller and more. Not in the hotel other than to sleep and wash so it was perfect. Plus definately stay again.

location is awesome being just half a block from Times Square so it's easy to get around, this does have a downside of it being a busy and noisy area. if you get a room that's not on the front they are quieter. standard rooms are very small but for the price are plenty good enough

Stayed here last week, no problems with it except on arrival the man on reception a bit rude and trued to charge me more on the room tax.I has it on my print out that the tax was $29 not $36 but he kinda laughed at me.When we came to check out though we got a lovely lady called Suny who sorted it fir us. She really is a star! The room was small but clean and the location is excellent.Would stay here again because of that.

Do not stay in standard room if going as a couple they are very small and very hot.. We had to upgrade to premium room which was much better.. The pictures they have for standard room on there page is not what you get when arrive..

This hotel was great if you're wanting to stay in times square. It was a 2 minute walk and you are in the centre of the city. I recommend getting the deluxe king room as it was spacious for 2 people with luggage. Not sure how all the other rooms would of had space. The showers were great!! finally found a hotel that didn't have a shower curtain and a tub! loved the shower.If you're wanting to request an early check-in i wouldn't bother as none of the rooms will be ready until 3pm, you will just need to leave your bags in storage. Over all was a great stay and i look forward to staying here again!

I had a Petite Single and it was what it said. However, it suited my requirements perfectly for the time I spent in it. Hotel staff were extremely helpful and their assistance was genuine.Would definitely stay with them again

The room we were first given was quite small and located at the lift which made it very noisy. However once we said it to reception we were moved straight away with no hassle. I was also extremely ill after checking out and the lovely woman at reception allowed me to pay for a room for several hours before the airport!Would highly recommend if you want to stay in timesquare!

Hotel is in a brilliant location for exploring the city. Our room was clean, comfortable and modern - the shower is fantastic! Would certainly book this place again, but would request a room on the first or second floor, as we were on the tenth floor and our only issue with this hotel was the waiting times for the lift. On some occassions it was 10-15 mins!!

I wouldn't take much notice of the bad reviews on here as we stayed here and the cleaners never stopped and it is only a *** star maybe if your looking for a bit more like a ***** the crow plaza is over the road the only bad thing I have to say about this hotel is some of the staff are a bit grumpy and could smile a bit more but we would definitely stay here again as the saying goes if would the best you have to pay the price once again thank you for a fabulous stay,one more thing breakfast at the restaurant is a bit expensive tho

Arrived here on 25/11/19 some staff are miserable but one lady on check out 29/11/19 was so nice did not get her name but out of all the staff she was fabulous. Right room’s we stayed in 825 nice room a bit small but ok for us clean and well kept. Hotel is in a very good location right in Time Square and lots to do taxi from JFK is $62 and $10 tip for the driver we are coming back in 2020 and hopefully will be staying in this hotel again well u have seen my review have a fabulous time in New York.

The "deluxe queen" room we paid for was the size of a large cupboard, the ensuite door scraped both the toilet and sink when closed, the elevators were tiny and we had to wait 5+ minutes for them to arrive and our room was on the same floor as an ice and vending machine. We were constantly awoken by drunk people getting ice through the small hours of the morning. Ice machine broke at five am and started beeping.

Rooms not clean - very noisy- blinds broken beds broken ladders for bunk bed taped up - staff not helpful - no glasses in rooms -garbage outside front door now approximately 3 bags high at main entrance to hotel

Great hotel, on the edge of Times Square, walking distance to main attractions, fantastic helpful friendly staff. Christmas atmosphere, beds are slightly small for a double but you only sleep in them.

Whilst I’m an utterly in love with New York, I would not recommend The Gallivant to my worst enermy. The hotel is incredibly unclean, the windows are single glazed which isn’t desirable in the city centre and caused sleepless nights and I found some of the staff very rude. Our first room seemed ok, the beds were small but it was fine. However the bed was broken on one side as though the springs were missing so my partner had an awful nights sleep so we explained to reception and they changed rooms for us. However the next room was disgusting, it was unclean, it had other people’s hairs, the door in the room was going onto a construction site and yet again the bed was broken. So we then moved rooms again and had the same issue with both cleanliness and the beds. We then spoke to reception and they begrudgingly offered an upgrade and one night without the tax, which was appreciated. (I might add that the tax was unexpected and around 35 dollars a night so be prepared). I will also add that Rachael was so helpful & lovely, however we were then passed on to Cassandra who was very bolshy and spoke to her manager on the phone in a sarcastic tone about our reasoning for wanting to change rooms which was quite demeaning. The upgrade wasn’t hugely different, however it was slightly cleaner and this bed wasn’t broken, so after changing rooms 3 times we sucked it up. As a final point, we bumped into a fellow guest in the elevator who was extremely angry due to a number of live cockroaches he found in his room. If this doesn’t demonstrate the lack of cleanliness I don’t know what does - this is so disgusting and should not happen. The only positive of this hotel is the location, but I would not recommend nor would I visit again.

lovely hotel, great service, lovely staff, in all it was a fantastic holliday and hope to return one day, all the staff was very helpful to me,i could not believe how many bars and restaurants there are.

Fabulous accommodation for the price. The room had everything we needed and was clean and tidy and well equipped. The location is 1st class, 2 minutes from Times Square. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. Would definitely recommend.

Nice place , not plush but very clean and tidy at the end of the day it’s a bed for the night and could fault it for the money we paid ,people vey helpful , didn’t try the food as went out every night for food

unbelievably small bed, would consider it to be a single bed more than anything even though the room was quite big wouldn't have done any harm to fit a double bed in there. Shower was tiny and took at least ten minutes on for the hot water to start running. Upon check in we were greeted by the rudest most horrible man I have ever encountered in my travels over the course of my life he barely spoke to us and snatched my card out of my hand when he asked for a credit card, put it into the machine and took the security deposit without even telling us what it was for and how much he was going to take. I am still yet to receive this deposit too which is frankly ridiculous. I would avoid this hotel at all costs there are budget hotels that are much better equipped with much friendlier staff.

Gallivant rooms and staff are always great. Only wish all rooms had a full length mirror and that the elevators ran a little quicker. The rates are very reasonable considering the proximity to the heart of Times Square. Besides the mirror, if you are pressed for time, you need to know the elevators are very slow, but if you know that going in and plan accordingly, you’ll enjoy your stay. Plenty of great food right outside the door including Hurley’s (pub) La Masseria (Italian) and Ding Hot Pot (Chinese) which is super convenient.

Nice hotel and the staff is friendly. By check in, we get a room that was not clean. A mistake from the housekeeping. But the reception called immediately the housekeeping that this was not acceptabl and we get an another room. Service was good. The bed and room was perfect! It was clean, good shower and a good bed.

If I can give this hotel MORE stars, I would! The room was extremely clean, the location is perfect and the staff are super friendly! I was greeted by Rob as I entered the hotel, which I loved because I immediately felt welcomed. I proceed to check-in and was helped by Adelina. She was friendly and provided us with suggestions on what to do around the area. She did not seem irritated, instead she was more than happy to help. We were given 2 small complimentary waters at arrival. All in all, this is a GREAT hotel, with the PERFECT location and AMAZING staff! I look forward to returning! I encourage you to book here, don’t double think it!

Our stay at this hotel was nothing short of a disaster, our heat in the room was set to about 80+ degrees. We were unable to control the temperature. Our shower was clogged. Called twice to have someone come service it. No one showed, I had to get washed at the sink. Housekeeping showed up at 8 am to clean. I wouldn’t recommend staying here.

have been staying at The Gallivant for around 10 years; Great location: Friendly staff: clean-modern facilities.....smallish rooms but OK overall....in the centre of the theatre district . Also easy to get taxis

Came here for my 30th birthday. Having been to nyc once before I expected a smaller room, however the first room we were shown to was diabolical, certainly not the 'deluxe queen' we had booked. After speaking with reception we were moved to a better room, however the bed had a sagging mattress and the air con was unbelievably noisy. However, we put that aside as we were literally there to sleep, and I asked at reception if I were able to get an extra pillow to counteract the sagging bed- to be told they dont have extra pillows, they have the exact amount of pillows for the rooms and thats it... very odd for a large hotel. Putting all this aside, the location was superb and the shower was good. BUT I am still yet to be refunded the $200 holding fee I was charged on arrival, despite emails to them highlighting this. Its been a whole month and have been ignored!

The positives about this hotel are its location, comfortable beds and the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. We booked a standard double room and were allocated room on the 7th floor. It was very small and very shabby. The ancient heating system was difficult to regulate and the window opened onto a jungle of noisy ventilation shafts from the hotel and other surrounding buildings. The window was also single-glazed and provided little protection from the noise of a New York night. We complained and were allocated another room on the 12th floor. This was slightly larger and a bit less tatty (although the bathroom tap was hanging on by a thread). The windows were also single-glazed and locked shut because of tatty plastic sheeting that had been stuck to the outside (presumably for insulation). Like the previous room, it was very noisy. There was a thermostat for the heating but it didn't seem to have much effect. Water spilled out of the (otherwise good) shower and flooded the floor. In addition, the lifts were too small and not always operational - which caused considerable delay and frustration at times. This is not a hotel that I would go back to.

We booked for 3 nights, including our Wedding Anniversary. I have a fear of heights and requested a room on a lower floor. On arrival, I was delighted that we had been placed on the third floor. The hotel was excellently located for all the things we wanted to do - especially the show Tina just a couple of blocks away. The Receptionists, Concierge and Bell Captain and his team were excellent.

superb location/clean rooms very attentive service Suny on reception was very good,we stayed at the hotel the first week of October in room 710 ,What we did not like was the extra urban tax$34.42 pr day pay which we were only informed about 3 week before arrival as we had booked in may we should have been told then, we did say we did not require it but they were having none of it, this was also on top of state/city/occupancy tax . The aircon heater was very noisy in our room we asked for an eng to inspect he could not alter , as the thermastat was broken and was awaiting for a few of them, so we lifted the cover off and turned on and off when required.The other fault with the room was the door lock one evening my wife was in i was outside and could not open the door on rattling and banging the door i freed it. They inspected the following day found nothing wrong, On 4 th day it happened again when i was inside, my wife was outside lucky the housekeeper was there to help on rattling the door it freed itself .And found we had to slam the door.as the lock was jamming.

Arrived on the Monday evening and it was quiet at reception, the man on the desk spent more time arguing with another member of staff than attending to us! The rest of the staff throughout our stay were lovely and always big enough. On the 8th floor directly outside the elevator which was handy.Perfect location for Times Square and central to everything and had a brilliant bar next door (Hurleys) would certainly recommend and would stay here again

Having read some of the reviews prior to our holiday, I was very nervous about what to expect. However, our experience could not have been better. I was travelling with my teenage son and although (being cheap!) had booked us a double room. I asked at the desk if there were any twin rooms available. Cassandra, who checked us in, was really lovely and friendly and explained that there weren't any twins but if we came down the following morning and asked again there should be one. We went up to our room (very clean double, we knew to expect small rooms in New York so weren't disappointed), literally 5 seconds after walking in Cassandra rang the room to say that a twin had become available, so we moved. Our room was lovely, comfortable, clean and absolutely perfect for the two of us. If I have any criticism at all it's that there wasn't much of a view, but then we literally just slept there and there are plenty of other places to go for a good view of the city! A fridge would have also been nice but it wasn't a problem. Every time we went to or walked past reception we were greeted by really friendly staff (Suny and Cassandra in particular are a credit to the hotel) and given bottles of water to take out or to take back to our room.It was my third time in the city but my sons first time (we were there with my sister and her family for her 50th birthday) and we both had such a wonderful time, it was so nice to have some mum/son time together before he goes to university next year and staying at The Gallivant really made it special. We WILL be back!

It’s a good job your not in your rooms long . I was disappointed in this hotel for the price we paid and 172$ tax on leaving, which in my eyes it’s not justified seeing you have paid for the hotel already. It is very dated and the picture below is the rotting bathroom door , not acceptable. On leaving the receptionists was extremely rude to us . Such a shame our first visit to New York , expected better quality.

I paid twice by mistake. The hotel made no effort to refund me for one of the bookings. I was and still am shocked at how the hotel was happy to bag and benefit from my mistake. Using policy as a reason is not an excuse because policy is man-created and there are exceptions even to the biggest policies. Also when I booked I was not told there would be an extra 34 dollar charge.

Don’t be fooled by the reception, the ‘niceness’ ends there. Looking at some of the photos you wonder where the hotel have taken theirs? Certainly no comparison to the customer ones. Many problems with our room, air con not working, extractor fan in tiny bathroom not working, deadlock on door not working as door had ‘dropped’ - no chance of entering the room quietly as door made a horrendous scraping sound as you entered. Blinds tatty and not fit for purpose. Dust bunnies under beds, paintwork dirty, tiling in shower needs a good bleaching and scrub. I see some of the rooms had the luxury of a dressing table - ours went AWOL, so had to use window sill to store stuff. Nowhere to store empty cases, so had them stacked by the door and had to move around them, carpets in corridors tatty and filthy. All in all I would definitely up the budget next time for a better hotel - not a nice experience having to complain every day and still things never got sorted out.

Great room, comfy bed and was very clean! Couldn’t hear any of the noises from outside so always had a fab sleep! Great location too with Times Square right at the corner. Staff were lovely and attentive

The hotel itself is in a brilliant location. 2 mins walk to Times Square. Lovely modern rooms. We got upgraded when we arrived to the top floor suite which had a huge roof terrace with great views. Most of the staff are lovely. Especially Suny on the front desk. BUT... the concierge lady with the ginger hair needs to learn some customer service, the way she spoke to us when we asked her for advice was appalling, made us feel unwelcome and stupid to be asking the question! It wasn’t only us that experienced this either, another elderly couple that we got talking to had the same treatment aswell. So my overall 2 score is because of this treatment otherwise it would have been a 5. Just one person can make all the difference.

Location is directly in Times Square and a short walk from everywhere. Rooms are small but nothing smaller than I was expecting in New York! Room was clean and modern. Bathroom was tiny though so was a real struggle getting a shower all in all was a fab place to stay in New York City and I would definitely return!

We good a friendly welcome a nice upgrade and a few bottles of water at reception when we checked in. The room was compact enough but clean with tea and coffee facilities and good towels which were cleaned everyday during our 3 night stay. Lifts were very small and only a few occupants at a time and during busy periods this could be an issue. Staff were pleasant and willing to help with airport transfers. We didn’t live in our room as it is New York and there is so much to see so I felt we paid a reasonable price for a reasonable stay.Great location but if you don’t want to hear the fire engine every night then not for you (fire house is at the end of the block) personally I loved this sound as it added to our NYC experience.

Stayed 3 nights, bed was comfortable, good shower, room very clean. Staff were helpful and professional. The hotel is in a great spot to go out and explore Manhattan, could get a bit noisy but that's not hotels fault, your in the middle of a 24hr city you gave to expect it!Would definitely stay again.

Read a lot of bad reviews for this hotel prior to our visit to NY and was quite apprehensive if what we were going to. On arrival we were informed at reception that we were being treated to an upgraded room which turned out not to be true as looking at the photos the hotel posts of it's rooms we were allocated a basic standard room so not a good start. On going to our room we were immediately disappointed in he size of it given the money we were being charged per night. There was no chest of drawers where you could store your clothes, he wardrobe for hanging clothes was no more than a cupboard which also contained a wall mounted iron, ironing board and a safe so not a great deal of room to hang clothes. The bathroom was about 6 X 3.5 feet in size and this contained the walk-in shower, toilet and sink so if one person was in the bathroom all space was taken. If you were seated on the toilet your knees just about touched the wall in front of you so don't think about trying to read a paper while in the loo. So if thinking about booking this hotel don't believe the room photos you see online. This hotel also charges an urban fee for a variety of things you don't really need apart from WiFi which was okay but you had to reconnect every time you wanted back on. On a positive note the rooms were clean and well tends by the maids but don't respect to see much out the window - these were filthy on the outside probably due to the volume of traffic passing by every minute of the day.

Stayed here with my boyfriend for 5 nights. Grabbed a yellow cab from the airport to hotel which was about $60.00, cheaper in an Uber but we wanted to experience it properly! On arrival check in was pretty simple and hotel was lovely. The room was nice and beds were amazing! The only issue was the lighting in the room.. Very dark, not the best to get ready in and they were quite small but perfect just to sleep in! There's no restaurant, or Atleast I didn't see one? The hotel was just off Time Square, perfect location. There was some noise but if you do New York properly with all the walking, sight seeing, eating and having a few drinks in the evening, the noise is not an issue as we were so tired by the end of the day we fell asleep as soon as we hit the pillow! It was actually quite nice to wake up to the sound of "new york" in the morning. The rooms were lovely and warm which was what we needed! The weather was painfully cold during our visit!

Avoid this place, rooms are tiny and poorly decorated, furniture is all scratched and dented, stains on all walls and ceiling, lifts are awful, staff unhelpful. Very overpriced for what you get. Have emailed complaint to back up my verbal complaint, that don’t respond.Would give zero if I could

We recently stayed here for 4 nights and after reading the reviews we were dreading it, however, we never shared a lot of the bad experiences of some previous customers, our tv worked fine, never had any issues with the lifts, the room was a good size and reasonably clean (could be doing with freshening) Location was excellent and service was fine. Downfalls.......they do not explain urban tax to you upon arrival, we were handed a sheet and told the WiFi and bottled water from reception was free but when we got to the room and read the sheet it stated we would be charged an urban tax of $34 per night (this was to cover the “free” water and WiFi) luckily we knew about it from reading reviews. They turned the heating up while we were there due to a drop in temperature so we had to use the ac to cool down which impacted the quality of sleep we had , it was either lack of sleep due to the loud ac or lack of sleep due to the unbearable heat. All we needed was a good base for exploring the city where we could get a good nights sleep and a shower but due to the issues with heat/ac the room never served its purpose

I had booked the Gallivant hotel based on a recommendation from a friend. I then started to look at reviews on social media and trip advisor and gave myself a fright. I was nervous going to the hotel as I had read such poor reviews on cleanliness.However my experience couldn’t have been further from that. We arrived in the afternoon and were greeted by SUNY who was very friendly and helpful.The lobby and lifts are a bit shabby but that doesn’t affect your stay.The room itself was smaller than seems in pictures - however most places are like that. It WAS clean!! And tidy!! And sheets and towels were replaced daily.This was a standard room - no need to upgrade.On arrival we were charged a damage deposit of $50 per night - this was never actually taken from our credit card so I assume they only take if damage is caused. We booked through booking.com which included all fees and taxes however you can be charged a “urban” or “resort” fee which I think is $35 a night. Double check you haven’t already paid this when booking as I think they may take twice when given the chance.We were almost charged $2 per case to be held whilst we waited to go to the airport - however my husband refused (after all we had just spent €1300 to stay) and the man agreed. Other than that, the stay was enough to rest our heads and shower each day. What else would you need in the city that never sleeps?

Standard double is very small you have no room to move about, had to pay extra to upgrade to a larger room which then had big noisy fans right outside the window so had to be moved again, no spoons, milk or tea bags either, and problems with the heaters

I won’t be staying in this hotel again. Aside from the extortionate resort fees, this hotel failed for me on many issues. Issues I raised whilst at the property but weren’t addressed at all by management. Very poor experience for such a pricey hotel

Cleaning wasn't good (the floor had pills on it, and the bathroom walls had hair on it). The bed had 2 big sags. we ordered some itens on Amazon after getting there, and asked the concierge if it was possible, and no one told us it was going to be charged. They charged 2 dolars per package. If we knew that, we would select the option "send items in as few bags as possible". The internet rarelly worked and the room was really small.

Our family of 5 was very pleased with this hotel. It is modern decor, great location in Times Square, and HUGE family suites! The bunkbeds were great for the kids, and we even had 2 double beds as well. Plenty of space to walk around and put our bags. Bathroom was big too. I highly recommend for families traveling to New York.

When we arrived to our room we were taken a back a little as we had thought we had been given the store cupboard. The furniture was chipped and the decor looked very poor. Due to our late arrival we were so tired we decided to just sleep instead of raise with reception.After a good night sleep we assessed the situation, luckily we were only staying 3 nights and we agreed that the room was clean and we weren’t going to be in the room much anyway. The view out of the window was just air ducts so we kept the blinds closed. It was ok but I guess we were paying for the location which was spot on. Just the room was probably a 2 star standard rather than the 3.5 star that we believed. I will certainly come back to NY but might try a different hotel. Friendly reception and housekeeping staff.

The staff was very nice, we had a very tiny room at first but they moved us to a bigger one. But, on the last day I got a weird rash and I also saw little blood marks on the bedding when we checken out. I did not think anything of it then. When I googled it at home, it were bed bugs. I am washing everything at high temps and the luggage is still outside, waiting for freezing nights.

The room need some additional upgrades. There was mold/mildew in our 1st room and then we were moved to another room with the same issue. The TV didn't work for the majority of our stay and it took several calls to the front desk to get someone to come up. The HVAC was making loud noised which made it hard to sleep comfortably. The staff did not do anything to accommodate for the inconveniences. On top of all of that, they had the nerve to charge additional fees for wif, business center, and fitness center. The wifi didn't work consistently. The business center and fitness center were not used at all.

Nice and very clean, everything worked well. Service personal nice and helpful. Somewhat noisy (coming from outside) during the night because of the older windows. Otherwise perfect. The location is awsome.

Dear Mrs Sargeat,Hereby I would like to thank you for your response to my claim after the first very difficult night we spent at your hotel. As I described to you we arrived late in the evening after a very long journey 1am.. and after being allocated in our room we had to wait more than 45 minutes to solve the technical problem with the airconditioning. Then we changed rooms to two beds in a room that was freezing cold. After that I explained to you how unacceptable this was in our culture, and how we felt regarding the treatment of the hotel so far. During our meeting I felt heard and that you cared about our situation. Thank you for acommaditng us in a nice room without air conditioning with one single bed, we did not need king size and view, but we appreciated it.Thank you very muchIn gratitude,Miryan Wodnik

Lovely hotel, literally a 2 minute walk from TimesSquare. We had a room on 10th floor overlooking front of hotel. Room was quite small but warm and clean. Bathroom on the small side but again clean. Being so close to Times Square you hear the constant buzz of the city so if your A light sleeper maybe not for you.

If you need to spend a night in nyc an need a cheap place to crash and take a shower this is serviceable. Nothing fancy but clean. The location is perfect if you like the Broadway scene. Tons of European tourists. Beware, elevators are very slow... stay on a low floor just in case

the hotel experience was Good service and facility the hotel might need some renovation otherwise the team make every thing lovely they need to do better I highly recommend the hotel for stay in New York good value for money and location

We are back one week from NY and the Gallivant was perfect to stay in! After reading some reviews I was apprehensive. The central location let us walk to nearly all attractions and take in the NY life. The room was small but clean and comfortable. You are there to see the city, not to sit in your room. The shower was amazing! The only (minor) fault is the air-con in the room was buzzing all night. I couldn’t fault the Gallivant for anything! I would 100% recommend to a friend and would stay again!

Service at reception was really good. (antonio) but the rooms are old, small, not 10% of pictures which are shown in booking.comLocation is 100%.I would not come back again. But I have to say, the price for one week at this location was good, just the pictures are not real.

Excellent client service received from Suny at the reception of this hotel. Suny helped me with the booking and room accommodation from the first moment. I’ve had a pleasant time at this hotel thanks to her. Thank you very much for your kind attention to me and for all of your help! Very much appreciated.

Old,NoisyDirtyBrokenThis was not a cheep hotel, and has a good location.However it is very run down and in need of a complete refurbishment.It is on Time Square so noise was to be expected. But the windows offered no insulation from this so sleep was nearly impossible with the constant roar from surrounding air conditioners and of course traffic.The room was very small and again in need of a complete overhaul including the furnishings that were old and broken.The rooms were far too hot and with no way to cool the room as the air conditioning was so noisy it could not be used.My advise is the location was very central, but it is a noisy area, so that has to be considered, but the Gallivant could do a lot more to insulate you from the constant noise. For instance:Better glazing to stop traffic noise.Soft Close doors. Constantly banging day and night.New air conditioning. It was like lying next to a jet engineCleaning and maintenance of shared areas was very poor. However the housekeeping did try their best in the rooms.

I recommend this hotel. I got a nice room on the 14th floor. Everything worked fine, including the AC. The area around times square is loud, but the only noise I could hear was from the Fire Department Station that is close to the hotel.

The hotel is located perfectly for a New York trip, if you want to be in the heart of Manhattan. Service was good, rooms were small and in poor condition. Considering the fact, that room quality was a lower quality, prices have been too high.

Set just off Times Square in the middle of Mid Manhattan this is perfectly placed for trying to see all the sights - though unless you’re there for a month or more that’s pretty unlikely haha!! Close to Hells Kitchen for a great variety of eateries, subway just a street away, Broadway & Times Square just around the corner. 5th Avenue about 15 mins walk away and quite honestly I can’t fault the location. Hotel itself is clean, well set out and more than adequate for a city break. You don’t need loads of extras in a room all you’re doing is sleeping in. Beds are clean - though ours were very soft! Bathroom has an amazing shower and you get more than enough towels. Our first room was noisy - a/c unit of next door’s restaurant out the window and ice machine just outside the bedroom door! Hotel staff happily moved us to another, far quieter room, next morning without any quibbles. They even moved the suitcases saying ‘go out and enjoy your day, leave us to sort everything’ !!!

A nice hotel - superb location, close to subway, Times Square, theatres, and an array of great diners - with courteous staff. We stayed on the 2nd floor (1st if British) and it has to be said the rooms are a little tired - dints on paint, bedside lights not working, no safe present (the last 2 were corrected the following day upon report) and a large housekeeping trolley was permanently parked just beside the door for the whole stay. Can't fault the hotel itself - although they do apply the "Urban Tax" which more and more hotels in NYC are doing. This is - basically - an additional security deposit which allows the hotel to advertise lower room rates - your card is pre-authorised a specific amount per night and, providing you don't trash your room, this is released within a week of your last night. The Gallivant fully refunded/released the pre-authorisation on my card in under a week - which was great service. Some people find this practice dubious but if you're in NYC with insufficient credit on your card - perhaps that's not the place for you because EVERYTHING costs a small fortune and THEN you have to tip! Not a bad place and very clean, good location, decent price - ticks all the boxes.

The only positive about this Hotel is its location being close to Theatres and Times Square. The rooms are in a terrible state of maintenance and the bathrooms so tiny we couldn't sit straight on the toilet as we couldn't stretch out our legs!! The shower is ridiculous, it floods every time you use it. We couldn't open the blind in our room which on one hand was a good thing as there was scaffolding outside the building during our stay and men working there all hours. There is no bar fridge in the rooms and one of the lifts kept breaking down making it hard to come in and out quickly. Luckily we were on the third floor so could walk down the stairs easily. The lobby is fine but one thing that puzzled us was that for a couple of days there was free small bottles of water available in the lobby and then not. We stayed there for five nights and our bed linen was never changed. Can't believe they charge you an extra $25 per day on top of what you have pre-paid. For the same cost there are many better Hotels in New York to stay.

The gallivant is very very close to times square and it's a very nice hotel. It's got almost everything you need. Good beds, your own private bathroom and a coffee maker with coffee. Big screen TV and airco. The only thing I was missing was a little fridge in the room to keep your (left over) meals fresh or collect your next day breakfast.

I stayed here for 4 nights whilst sightseeing in New York with a friend. We booked a twin room. The website seems to make the rooms look a lot larger than they actually are - upon arriving at the room I was quite surprised at how small it was. Despite this, it was clean and comfortable and had an iron and ironing board too. The bathroom was however extremely small and was difficult to shower without the whole bathroom flooding each time!! Also, the location of our room (room 105) meant that our window view was of the courtyard of the hotel with big noisy generators outside - this didn’t really bother us as we only used the hotel as a base but may be disappointing for some. Sadly, upon arrival I was quite disappointed with the service of the gentleman on reception, it was clear that he was struggling to juggle all the jobs and responsibilities he had and it seemed very under-staffed. He was quite rude and abrupt which left a stale taste to the start of our adventure in New York, especially after travelling so far from the UK, it was rushed, not personalised and a bit of a let-down. The WiFi was good in the hotel and was free. Location wise, it was good and only a stones throw away from Times Square and close to subway stations. The hotel also offers a luggage hold facility for $2 per bag - good for those with later flights. All in all, a good hotel which we only used for a base, but if I was to return to New York I would choose a nicer hotel (maybe the Ritz which was right next door, if I win the lottery!)

Good hotel, perfect location.Nearby times square. Small room but have a balcony.Very clean.Every day clean the room and change towels.Good stuff.Free stoarst luggage and box.Recommended.I enjoyed the stay.

Very please with the hotel and staff. Can't beat theater district and Times Square location. Rooms were on smaller size, but had all the amenities that we expected. A buffet breakfast offered at connecting restaurant.

We stayed in the premier room , which had damp and bad condensation, you could smell the damp when you opened the door . The noise from outside was not good and if like me a light sleeper will keep you awake . Did not really use the hotel service so no comment on them.The location was great , right next to the main area of time square but overall value for money then it’s a no for me , although I guess it’s expensive everywhere in New York.

It was cold in New York so I wanted a nice warm shower but we were welcomed with an icy cold shower. I informed the staff on the front desk about this 4 times for them to finally get it sorted. All they said was we will get an engineer to have a look. It did come on at the end but it was the end of the holiday so too little too late. The phone in the hotel did not work. The bed and the bathroom were tiny. The lifts in the hotel took ages to come up to your floor, it took about 5-10 mins, most people walked the stairs. Our TV did not work for the first few days we mentioned this to the staff and they just give us an paper with instructions on how to use it which didn’t help. My boyfriend had to tune it in himself. We couldn’t get the heating to work, the hotel room was freezing all the time. We had to confirm the booking of our shuttle so we asked one of the girls at the front desk to phone them for us (we thought it would be easier) and she didn’t seem very happy to help us out. She even got our flight time wrong even though it clearly said it on the shuttle voucher and then had the cheek to say we told her the wrong flight time but we never. All the information was on the voucher, she was just too lazy to look. The house keeper came round early morning 7:30, 8 and if you didn’t answer your door she would try your door, which I found annoying you could be asleep or in the shower. Only positive thing I would say was the hotel is right in the heart of New York, Times Square is on your door step, Central Park is only a new minutes walk away, Rockefeller isn’t far and the Empire State Building was only 30 mins away. I wouldn’t stay here again and I wouldn’t recommend anyone to stay here either. I never write bad hotel reviews or any reviews. But I thought people should have an idea of what this hotel is like before booking. It looks nice on pictures but don’t be fooled.

I gave this hotel a rating of 4 stars as I couldn't give them a 3 and a half stars. OK, as per previous reviews, The Gallivant is all about location, location, location. Just a 2 minute walk to Times Square, 8th Ave food and shopping outlets, a 5 or 10 minute walk to Theatres, Broadway shows, Jazz clubs, restaurants etc, etc etc, The beds are very comfortable and clean and our bathroom was quite large. Now, the hotel itself; a bit old, our room was "refurbished" however it appeared to be poorly done but new and clean. Yes, the AC is noisy but bearable; we had no noise from outside. Overall very quiet (except for the AC) Elevators were sometimes out of order (not all of them) so was very manageable. Oh, and the Rooftop area is only available for certain rooms....disappointing.The Gallivant is all about its location.The Staff were great, the amenities awesome, and the location was PERFECT so overall I would recommend The Gallivant for your New York stay.

Reasonable hotel in the heart of times square, the best pictures of rooms etc have been used for website bathroom tiny , shower not very good and we had a couple of roaches in the corridors. Ok if you just want a place to get your head down.Really in need of a refurb and could be 5 stars. dont go for breakfast in the chinese next door $22.00 not worth it.. Hurleys Irish bar next door recommend and breakfast at Juniors diner 100 yards away.

I've booked a Queen Delux, but it was more a standard room. The room's picture are not corresponding with the reality.The position of course is very good, because are 3 minutes walking from Time Square.

First, the less-than-good things - we had a room with a view out to a brick wall. The safe inside the wardrobe was on a shelf so high that anyone around five foot four or less could not see the contents inside and probably have difficulty operating the buttons. The good stuff - friendly staff, especially the Chinese-American staff on duty at breakfast, who may give you a discounted deal on breakfasts if you stay for longer than a couple of days. Excellent breakfasts too, but in an American hotel, surprised to find no hash-browns and no choice of eggs other than scrambled. You might find a banana if you are up early enough. Our room and bed were not large but comfortable and had all we needed. Best thing about the Gallivant is its proximity to good places like Times Square, many theatres and Central Park ( south end ) was only a short walk...Empire State Building , Top of The Rock and further down to Greenwich Village - along Broadway - or the High Line were all walkable, if you like reasonably long walks, but there are no hills to climb. In short, stay at the Gallivant for its location, and I don't think you will be too disappointed in its other features.

Hotel has a great location, but could definitely do with a refurb. However is was very clean. Beware some rooms can be very noisy from the A/C and we changed our room as soon as we got there, the front desk staff handled this with ease as I guess this happens every day. Furniture in the room was showing it’s age. A 3star hotel at best.

What a lovely hotel!! We were a bit worried because of some of the negative reviews but we didn’t need to be. From Aziz checking is in, to Suny checking us out, it was awesome. We had a lovely room, yes it was pretty small and yes it was sometimes a little noisy but you’re in the middle of the city that never sleeps!! What else would you expect?! It was beautifully clean, there was plenty of room for 2 and the street noise was not loud enough to keep us awake. Honestly, it was in the perfect location with Times Square at the end of the block, all the Broadway shows around the corner, a subway station across the street and the bus terminal a few streets away, what more do you need when in NYC. We’ve been home less than 24 hours and already have recommended it to a few people. I’m glad we ignored the negative reviews and made our own minds up.Hopefully we’ll visit again one day.

Really nothing good to say about this place. We left and forfeited the cost. Huge mistake overall. Tiny rooms, loud outside the windows, noisy hallways. No redeeming qualities at all. What else? Oh they hand you a tiny bottle of water at check-in.

This was a nice, quaint hotel and offered all that I needed for a single person occupancy. It was very clean, one block from times square, bars on each side of the hotel, walking distance to night spots, theaters and restaurants. It was great!

We booked the Gallivant for its proximity to Times Square and the Broadway shows. We read the reviews before hand so we thought we knew what we were getting ourselves into but were very disappointed. The staff were professional and helpful and the foyer was okay.The rooms however were a different story. There was simply not enough room for two people. Rooms were VERY small and decor beyond dated and tired. The furniture was actually quite worn. Bed was comfortable enough but the room was hot and air conditioner worked intermittently which was a problem. Bathroom was likewise TINY with no room to place anything. Toilet blocked up and had to be unblocked by us. Complained about aircon issue but no action taken.If you are prepared to overlook the incredibly small living areas the location is very good. There is a great bar next door called Hurley’s which proved our saving grace as it gave us a place away from the crappy room when we weren’t actually out doing something. Cold beer and good food. Bar tenders were excellent.

Travelled back in June 19, hotel was ok, looking tired and room not the best. but the biggest issue is hidden charges and then in Oct 19, despite be back in the UK, they feel it's acceptable to charge my account, with out permission and then They hang up and wont and don't return calls - have had to pursue fraudulent charges through with my bank.

BEWARE .... we stayed at this place in June this year 2019, today 4 months later we have had over £50 removed from our account, with out permission, we have phoned to discuss 1, why 2, why they still had our card details After going from a to b several time they hung upNow they are not answering our calls, Please be careful and avoid

On first impressions the foyer looks ok but what a disaster the rooms are !Room 1: large noisy extraction fan outside window and a view of scaffolding and building materials .Room 2: rubbish on floor and toenail cuttings on bedside table.Room 3 : cannot even begin to explain the damp musty smell in room and noisy bed springs .Room 4:: fed up now so put up with adequate room , shower took 10 minutes to heat up , shower didn’t drain shelve in bathroom was hanging off, the antiquated air conditioning was old and noisy , damp patches on the wall and generally filthy and an uncomfortable mattress. We have stayed at hotels all over the world and this is by far the filthiest, run down hotel we’ve ever stayed in , paint work was damaged and furniture falling to bits . The only positive thing is the location .Staff were rude and ignored me when I asked to see the manager . The photos online are nothing like the rooms available so book at your peril !!!

Just back from a week long trip at this hotel. Super location and really nice room. (605). Lovely foyer and reception area. Very nice oriental restaurant flanking the hotel.
