The staff are always friendly and helpful, in particular Antonio who is part of the night staff! He is right on the ball for everything and anything you might need at any time of the evening/night! I would recommend the hotel for families who are looking for convenience and not luxury!

Hotel is in a great location staff are very friendly. Rooms are small but adequate. Cleaner comes round every day with fresh bedding and clean towels. I’d definitely stay here again. Well worth the money

This was my first trip to New York for my 40th Birthday. I was expecting a nice room but we got a small basic one. The only good thing about the room was the comfy beds. Rooms are tiny but I don’t know if that is the norm in New York.Also I do not drink coffee and when you are thirsty in a morning there is only coffee available. The staff were friendly with us and helpful. Hotel is in perfect location for everything. I just think the rooms do need updating a little and surely they must be able to afford raking all them dollars in.

We stayed at the Gallivant with friends prior to a cruise.The hotel was very basic. We had a room on the 5th floor facing the road. It was extremely noisy,so do nor expect to get much sleep. Arguments outside, rubbish collectors, etc. We expected some noise but this was ridiculous! I had to check that the window was closed! Noises from the plumbing and no hot water on several occasions.I was unable to connect to the WiFi, and asked a male receptionists for assistance. His response was " mine is working fine",his whole attitude to customer service was non existent.On checking out we were charged $96 urban tax, yet our friends were only charged $86. On questioning they said it was because we had booked after our friends,yet in reality we had booked months before!Eventually they adjusted the bill to $86.I will not be returning. I now know why New York is the city that never sleeps especially if you stay at the Gallivant !

Great location, so convenient and practical, will definitely stay again when I return, room was very clean when we got there and was was cleaned well everyday, couldn’t ask for anything more! Thanks for making the trip great!

The whole staff there is always welcoming and friendly starting with the Bellmen. Everyone at the front desk are so friendly and helpful, but Suny is AWESOME!!! She is the main reason why we stay at this hotel when in the city. Trisha at the front desk also. These ladies make you feel at home and like family. There is nothing they wouldn't do to make you stay perfect. The housekeeping staff also very friendly and helpful. The rooms are CLEAN very clean. This is the best in the area!

Me and my partner got this hotel at a great deal, photos looked very promising but the reviews were a bit mixed. Bit the bullet and went for it anyway. Location is excellent, Times Square not even a 5 minute walk. Receptionist very friendly, nice interior. Room overall okay, modern design however definitely lacking a few touches- paint cracked and peeling on the skirting boards, felt tip pen on the white bed headboard?!, didn’t get a great view from the window. However these were only minor things, particularly as when you visit New York you barely spend any Time in your room. Only let downs were that one day our hot water was not working so my partner couldn’t have a shower, we did report this to reception who said they would investigate. The TV only had one channel which was news and that as an extremely awful picture, but again not major as we barely watched it. Only last grumble for me was the whole issue with city tax. The rate is $34 a day, which seems pretty extortionate. This is apparently for WiFi, gym and drinking water. The WiFi worked fine in our room, however we did not use the gym so not sure why I should be paying for this? Also the drinking water was not made known to us, only discovered on our last day that we could go and collect water from the desk- why not put it in the rooms and change it when the maids replace the toiletries? Upon arrival you are required to give a bank card for them to hold your details, was told no charge would be made. Upon check out the receptionist handed me a receipt for the city tax which they had already taken from my card. I didn’t mind as I would of paid this tax on card anyway, however I do think they should check with you first how you would like to pay, as people may want to get rid of their dollars on the last day. Also wanted to raise the issue that I wasn’t very happy about paying this whole amount as I didn’t use half of the services (water and gym) and one day we had no warm running water. A good stay, value for money but just keep in mind about the city tax, as it may not be great value for money by the time you have added that on top.

That folks about sums it up No Bar in the Hotel Sometimes no Hot water either,Our room 1025 was clean but no control over the heating, the city that never sleeps this is it sirens all night every night!!! Would I return maybe maybe not, Better places to stay at a better price with friendly staff in NYC a city i Love To Visit ❤️

We were a bit apprehensive having read the negative reviews but needn’t have been.We had emailed the hotel before our visit to ask for a room on a lower floor as my husband is recovering from a broken leg we were given room 204 which was perfect.The room was small but had everything we wanted and was clean and the maid came in every day. We had no problem with the aircon and found the receptionists very friendly and polite. The location is perfect 2 minutes walk to Times Square there was some outside noise but this is New York and we had no problem sleeping. Overall a great place to stay and would stay here again.

Booked a trip to New York through my travel agent to stay at this hotel to celebrate my 50th and my friends 60th birthdays. We were greeted by an abrupt and extremely rude receptionist. Many, many complaints with the room such as leaking air conditioningunit, dirty, leaking shower, bad and noticeable repairs. Been back home a week and still awaiting pending money they immediately took on arrival. Phoned the hotel and was abruptly told it would take over a week as phone was put down. I have complained through my travel agent and would never ever recommend this hotel. New York is incredible but this hotel was awful. There were many, many people complaining throughout our stay. If only I had read the reviews before booking. They only appear to respond to the good reviews and not the majority reviews. Please take caution

Stayed here 5 nights from the 13th of February with my fiancée. After reading reviews on this hotel months before hand I must admit I was dreading arriving at this hotel. Its my 3rd time to New York but my fiancée's first so I didn't want anything to ruin it for her. There was absolutely no reason for us to be worried. on arrival into reception we were dealt with by a very professional bloke who only charged us the city tax fee and not security deposit that I have read that other people were charged. We were handed our room keys and went straight up to the room on the 5th floor. The room was so much better than I expected, you would think people were sleeping in the back lanes the way some people have went on about them. The room was very clean, bed was so comfortable, TV signal was perfect, Shower pressure was perfect allow we didn't have any hot water. the next morning I went down first thing to get this fixed and within 2 minutes of being back in my room the handyman was knocking at the door to fix it which was brilliant service. Room is a bit warm and the air con didn't seem to blow out cool air so I just cracked the window open slightly and it was sorted. People are right you couldn't swing a cat in the bathroom but luckily I left my 2 cats back at home so no issues there. Rooms cleaned everyday and towels refreshed. Location is absolutely brilliant.On the last day we went out for a few drinks before returning to hotel to collect our suitcases, i cant believe ive seen people complaining over the 2 dollars it costs per case, people just moan over anything. Private taxi was arranged for us direct to JFK which was cheaper than the yellow cab we got from JFK to the hotel when we arrived. having got this hotel and return flights from newcastle via heathrow with BA for 650 quid each i can not complain whatsoever. Great Stay.

Great location at Times Square. Standard of room was good, bit on the small side and bathroom quite small, but on the plus side both very clean. No bar facility available and breakfast served in the next door restaurant

Very nice hotel, location was spot on, with easy access to Times Square, The Rock, Central Park etc all close and walking distance to loads of great food and bars. Service was great, from check in to check out. Room was good, after a long day out exploring in the coldness of NYC it was nice to come back to a warm room and a comfy bed! The location will give you some street noise with the odd siren or two going off but nothing too intrusive. The charges for wifi/gym use etc at the end of my stay were a bit of a downer as I barely used the wifi (use of data was faster) and never used the gym at all, but I knew the charges were coming before hand so it was all good!

Stayed here from the 13th until the 18th February on a visit to New York.First off, we arrived at around 11pm and were immediately checked in quickly and efficiently by the hotel staff. A great plus when you have just stepped off a 7 hour flight and endured a 2 hour transfer!Rooms were spacious enough for New York. If you are expecting a vast room with a huge bathroom and walk in wardrobes then you will be dissapointed as New York is not the place for this.Beds were comfortable and the room was cleaned every single day without fail. Couldn't fault the staff at all. Decided to give the shuttle a miss on the way home due to the long transfer times to the airport. Booked a taxi with the concierge and he could not have helped more. He stored our bags for the day and the taxi arrived bang on time. He is a great credit to the Gallivant!Only small issue was that the first couple of days the shower in the room was extremely slow to warm up, hence the 4 star review. Left it running for 10 minutes though and then it was perfect. Please don't let any of the negative comments put you off. It is more than adequate as a base for exploring New York. As said before, the location could not get any better! Great value for money. I look forward to returning again soon.

There are no refrigerator, no water in the room, no bottle opener and no cup.Front desk did not answer the phone.There are few things in the room.Moreover, WIFI is very very slow...The only advantage is location...disappointed..

Staying for a couple of nights?Well, that's alright then.The staff are very polite but the hotel is a little dark.Not bad base for the theatre district and for a short trip but not a lot of space to spread out.

Ok we got upgraded and we had no view only off a wall. But this was a bed to US and a view is unnecessary I we only sleep here. Are room we big enough for us as we were upgraded. Room was on second floor and was very quiet. Cleaned daily

We stayed in the Gallivant for 5 nights returning 5th February.... hotel is ideal location....it actually couldn't be any better. We upgraded to a double room as we found the single room very small and no where to unpack your clothes. The hotel is perfect, reception area is lovely, rooms are perfect, warm, clean lovely comfy beds and fab showers. Everything about this hotel was good... staff were very helpful. Cannot recommend this hotel enough...cannot wait to return.

Reception is impressive! Rooms are small, clean and the bed super comfy! Perfect for anyone looking to explore and sleep in New York.... except sleeping is a challenge in the extreme heat of The Gallivant. The radiator in our room couldn’t be turned off, even on the lowest level resulted in tropical temperatures whilst sleeping. We decided to turn our air con on, which can only be described as sounding like a jet engine starting. We decided to toss and turn in extreme heat, as the noise was keeping us awake.We asked reception to turn the heating off, which they did briefly, but sure enough come sleeping time it was back on! Mixed with the shower blasting cold water only 2 days out of 4 and the urban tax they charge on departure (it is highlighted on the website, but is painful with such an unpleasant experience) I wouldn’t be looking to stay here again! Great location! Average staff! Ridiculous heat!

I have been to NYC before so my expectations are not unreasonable and I am definitely not one for leaving bad reviews!We arrived on Sunday to find that we had to pay $143 urban fees which is apparently for the use of the business centre, fitness centre, bottled water and WiFi.... firstly I am not here on business or have come on holiday to use the gym!! Secondly, the bottled water is not put in your room daily and something you have to ask for, and when you do, it’s warm (there is no fridge in your room)!! Thirdly, the worse ‘high speed’ WiFi I have ever seen... it really is hit and miss as to whether it works! Sunday evening the internet wouldn’t work, yesterday morning we were able to make WhatsApp calls and this morning our messages won’t even send, so we’ve had to use our phone data to use the internet (ie to post this review) and make phone calls back home!! The room is small, I would say the the bed is more of a double than a queen. The bathroom you can’t even swing a cat in!!There is no kettle for tea drinkers in your room but you are ok if you like coffee!I would say the room is clean but we cane back to find a used tissue on heating system which we did not use nor did we leave it there!! They have ice vending machines located on 4 floors, last night we went to three of those floors and found.... floor 10 was a broom cupboard with no ice machine and floor 15 the ice machine was not working. We did not try floor 4 but floor 7 we were able to get some ice!! To be honest if we were not hit with the unexpected urban tax I probably would have accepted the issues above but advertising free high speed WiFi is morally wrong. On a positive note, great location!!

We booked a single room online with the understanding that this was going to be a queen bed and big enough for two. What we walked into was basically a broom closet with a children’s bed. To top it off, there was a huge puddle in the middle of the floor. We went to the front desk and they ignored the puddle but moved us to another room for an additional charge, which was on top of the price for the room we would not be staying in. The next room was standard, but when we went to check out in the morning they wanted to charge us again the full price of the room. Management was slow and unsympathetic in solving the problem, which still resulted in only a slight reduction of the charge. The hotel was loud and the services offered didn’t match the price. Overall, it was a disappointing and stressful stay. If you were looking for a romantic weekend getaway, this is not the hotel you want.

Not often I give bad feedback(average in this case) to hotels, check my reviews out, but this is 2 in a row.When we arrived all seemed normal until we entered "our room". First we came straight across a bag of rubbish, then 2 discarded key cards and then discovered the bed was still in a state of undress. Fair enough the guy at the front desk moved us immediately and was very apologetic.The wifi which is apparently part of the city tax was below pathetic. There were 3 tiny lifts and this was WAY too inadequate for a hotel of this size. When waiting to check out we had to let 4 lifts go without us as already full. Eventually choosing to go down the stairs. Not really a major issue for us but needs mentioning. We had a similar problem yesterday but had no suitcases. 3 lifts between about 450 rooms just doesn't cut it.

We stayed here for 5 nights in room 518. The staff were lovely and friendly, the decor in the hotel was nice and modern, Perfect location too!The room was nice and clean, everything worked as it should. The power shower was great and the bed lovely and comfy. No noise apart from the constant sirens of police cars and horns in the distance but that can’t be helped. If I were to return to New York I’d book this hotel no problem. Another thing I noticed was the maids had been and gone every time I went back after breakfast-I’ve stayed in hotels were they turn up at 3 o’clock. The beds were always imaculatley made too with fresh clean sheets and towels, I couldn’t fault the hotel at all.

Just got back from a 5 night stay at the hotel.Was taken away for valentines week buy my boyfriend were he proposed to meHotel is a fantastic location and great hotelHotel was clean and staff very friendly and very modern rooms and lobby Really worth a visit

I booked a 1 night stay with this hotel, and I was sadly disappointed. The lobby was beautiful and the night staff was very friendly, however as soon as I got my room everything went wrong. I was given room 310 and as soon as I walked into the room I immediately noticed it was not cleaned. I took a picture and went downstairs to show the staff. He took full responsibility for the matter and also offered to take 30 dollars off the amount due and I was given a new room. The second room, 308, was cold but I decided it wasn't that big of a deal considering I'd just been move and I didnt want to seem like a problem guest. We bundled up and made the best of the night considering the temperature. The next morning I woke up around 9:15am and proceed to start getting my things together and jump In the shower and wash my hair. As I'm washing my hair, eyes closed & fully under the water, I noticed a slight temperature change in the water so opened my eyes to adjust to find that the water surrounding me was Dark Brown. I was bathing and washing my hair in completely dirty brown water. I immediately jumped out of the shower disgusted and began drying myself of the dirty water leaving large brown stains on the towel from the dirty of the water. I threw on my clothes which I was hesitant to do because I only had an all white polka dot dress. It took me almost 8 min to even get downstairs because the elevators were so congested. Once I got to the front desk I stood unacknowledged for about another 5 min white the staff was on the phone with an attitude. Once she finally hung up I was greeted with yes.. I told her I needed a supervisor to come up to my room immediately. I waited covered in filth for another 15 mins, come back down to see what was taking do long and was met by Robert upon going back up. He assured me my night would be free someone would come in clean and my check out would be extended. Cleaning staff justed picked up the towels and left cleaning nothing. I packed my things informed the front desk Trisha about the cleaning staff and left.

Amazing stay at this superbly located modern clean hotel. Fantastic value for money and would highly recommend. Friendly helpful staff. This is my 7th trip to NY and this hotel is amongst the best i have stayed in. Hope to be back next year :) Thank you Gallivant

Was a bit worried before we went due to the resort fees and some bad reviews but honestly was fine, the fees for 5 days were $143 which in hindsight I would make sure were included in the cost of the holiday in future. Rooms are big enough and clean, also cleaned daily by maid. The room was a bit hot, you couldn't open the window and couldn't get the air conditioning on, kept going onto heat. Beds are extremely comfortable and the location was great

We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel and would never return.. firstly when arriving at the hotel as a married couple we were told they would find us a twin room tho we booked a "deluxe queen with balcony" The hotel reception was about the cleanest part of the hotel. When we got to our "deluxe queen with balcony" the room was extremely Hot and very small. The bed was covered with hair from the cleaners and dust and dirty clothes from the previous occupants were still in the room. Towels were stained and the cooling unit so dirty we were scared to use it. The shower backed up with drain water as soon as the shower was used. There was no way to cool your room as the heating was always on even tho switched off. This hotel rooms are dated and need a deep clean. We will never stay here again and will be speaking to our holiday provider.

Honestly, staff couldn’t have been friendlier! There where in hand to help with subway tips and even printed some tickets off for us! The room was good, bed was super comfy! They are a little warn but who cares when your 2 mins away from Times Square, Rockerfella and Bryant Park! This location is almost perfect!! The bakery across the street does a good coffee and breakfast for $6! On the last day the water took about 20 mins to get hot.... but again... a minor issue and all during our stay the water was great and the pressure power was fantastic! Yes there are only 2 lifts.... in the morning and evenings it doesn’t matter they tebd to be quick.... what we did notice is what slowed them down was staff using them during turn down service in the day. Noise levels... your in NYC.. deal with it! Yes you can hear sirens in to the night.. but bring ear plugs and that’s that sorted! All in all, we would 100% come back! Don’t listen to reviews... it’s a good pit stop for a good price with a fantastic location!

We stayed at The Gallivant for 4 nights in a twin room. On arrival we were a few hours early for check in, you could leave your bags and head out or just relax in the comfy reception area, we decided to wait for a short while until our room was available. Lifts are a bit slow and they are small but i wouldn’t say this was an issue. Our room was a pleasant surprise, smallish but it’s New York & we got it at a good price. Good closet space for storing your luggage leaves it handier for moving around, beds comfortable, heating was adjustable to whatever you desired, bathroom again on the small side but had everything you need, good shower with hot water when needed. Housekeeping were great, plenty of fresh towels each day and room left tidy. Coffee machine, TV, hairdryer, safe, iron, & ice machine just down the corridor. All the staff we came across were very pleasant & helpful. Location wise, just off Times Square, Irish bar next door - what more do you want - as for noise we heard nothing, maybe that was the 30k steps a day! I would have no hesitation in staying here again, would actually be delighted to do so.

I have recently got back from a Trip to New York. I was visiting with some friends however I added on at last minute and their hotel price went through the roof so ended up booking The gallivant which was great value for money. First impressions The hotel does have some scaffolding on the outside but do not let this put you of. After walking into the lobby the hotel looked clean and stylish. The reception staff were excellent and efficient and the lady gave me a room on the 12th floor. I went straight to my room. Lifts were fine! So many people must be so impatient if they can’t wait for a lift for a minute or 2 like in all the reviews. RoomsMy room was clean and tidy. Yes they are small but this is normal for New York. It done the job and the bed was very comfortable. The rooms are basic (like a premier inn or ibis styles standard. I read up on previous reviews that they had no hot water. I had 2 hot showers a day and had no issues. Room was cleaned daily. There wasn’t much noise disturbance on the 12th floor just the odd Siren. LocationPerfect! Perfect! Just a couple minutes from Times Square! There is a very nice Irish bar next door that does great food and drinks! I will be back!

My friend and I stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel’s location was perfect, so close to Times Square. Our room was warm, comfortable and cleaned to a high standard everyday. Good coffee machine was a bonus. Reception staff along with doormen were efficient and very pleasant. All in all a most enjoyable trip. Have stayed in numerous hotels on trips to NYC, I will definitely return to the Gallivant.

This hotel is in the perfect location. Walking distance from everything a visitor would want to see around Times Square. The elevators and bathrooms were very small but i think that’s just New York. It has a great Japanese restaurant down stairs and Starbucks a block away.

The location is very good, near tourist points, restaurants and subway station. The room is good, but the heating system is too noisy. The shower and bed are good. The cleaning could be better, a lot of dust under the bed. Apart from these small problems, I recommend.

Hotel was clean but basic, no bar and restaurant was Chinese or Vietnamese which was very limited. Great location and warm. Charged our credit card with $150 security deposit and said we’d get it back on departure however they took an urban charge of $25 per night plus taxes from it and only refunded us the difference. The hotel was originally good value for money until they added these extra charges on which we were unaware of. Reception staff were nice but not sure if I’d return.

Great location, couldn’t fault anything about our recent stay, we needed a fridge in our room so they upgraded us immediately, very friendly staff, nothing was too much trouble. Would highly recommend.

We stayed in a family room. The room was spacious and not too noisy. It would easily accommodate a family of 5. Located just a block or two from Times Square. Perfect location with a great little Italian coffee shop across the road. They do a good latte and offer lovely pastries also.

We stayed in a 6 bedded family room, excellent beds, nice big bathroom & comfortable surroundings.Would highly recommend for a group or family, very reasonable and so close to Times Square, exactly what we wanted

This is an ok place to stay most of the staff are pleasant enough some damn right rude and condisending The rooms are basic  Far from 4/5 star ... but the location can’t be faulted ... would I stay here again NO

We had a 4 night stay jan 2019, would highly recommend staying there, staff were lovely , real helpful and friendly, rooms were cleaned every day! First time in New York and was made to feel very welcome, fab location too! 5 mins away from Times Square!

Well were do i start, the hotel was superb & clean and so comfy, few minutes away from Time Square excellent location, couldn’t fault the hotel at all, the staff were great & polite...Thankyou for a lovely experience!!!!

On first appearance seemed like a nice hotel, the lobby was clean and spacious and staff were friendly. The room was fairly small but what you need for a comfortable nights sleep. The room had a Safe, coffee machine, iron, hairdryer and a travel extension lead. The room was cleaned daily however they seemed to restock the cups/coffee but not the milk & sugar. This wasn’t a problem however we asked everyday for new and it was only the last day they finally gave it to us. We also had a blocked toilet which we asked for someone to fix it to return 4 hours later to it not done. Seemed to be a breakdown in communication between the front of house staff and cleaners/maintenance. Gym is as basic as it gets, a few free weights, a bench and 3 cardio machines. However it’s like a sauna in there. Overall a nice stay as we weren’t in the room long as we were out exploring. The hotel is perfectly central location which easy access to Central Park and downtown Manhattan. Would recommend using the subway nearest to the hotel it’s very easy to use and cheap.

expected a better quality given the reviews. very good location and staff were very nice.our family room was big but needed a fresh lick of paint to freshen it up a little.cleanliness was average. restaurants on site were good.

If you want a hotel close to Times Square, this is it! Rooms are very dreary, the bathroom floods when the shower is used and the trash pick every night between 12am-2am makes it very hard to sleep. Spend the extra $50 a night and go elsewhere

Great location, as with all nyc hotels space was limited but perfect little comfy base to explore! Modern amenities and lovely staff make this hotel fab! Lifts and communal areas really lovely with a chill out vibe.

Perfect trip. Amazing location, Vee central and exactly as described. Bathroom a little small, but why would you spend that much time in the bathroom?! Bed extremely comfy!! Staff so friendly and helpful, answered and helped all questions we had. We asked if they could take the city tax out of the security deposit, and they did. Definitely recommend. From UK!

We stayed in this hotel as part of a Royal Caribbean package as we’re cruising out of New York the next morning. The room was already paid for but a credit card was demanded for a security deposit and took around 8 days to re credit is. The room was small and quite outdated for what you expect for central New York. TV worked fine and was able to catch a Premier league match before we left. Location is excellent for Time square but would probably look elsewhere if was staying longer than x1 night.

Comfortable rooms in a very nice and up to date hotel. Has all the comfort you need without excessive features you'll never use.The location is fantastic, right by NY's theater district. Staff is friendly and helpful.

Having read previous reviews about the hotel was a bit nervous as the same as most people the trip was a bucket list to tick off and i can honestly say the hotel was excellent in every way, perfect location for Times Square 2mins, Central Park and 5th Avenue 20 mins walking , rooms although on the small side are perfect everything you need in a place where you not going to spend much time in. Everyone from the doorman,reception to the cleaners professional and faultless.i am sure some people could find fault but for us they all made the trip a great memory by being helpful without being intrusive thank you again Phil and Sabbie

The lifts had a mind of their own, you would press a floor and it would go up and miss your floor or go down and miss your floor, its quicker to use the stairs sometimes. The staff were really nice, very friendly overall it was a great experience.

Having just stayed at this hotel I found it excellent for location, clean and tidy. The only problems I had were a few things. House keeping came daily (a good thing) however too early. It was always by around 9.30am. Being a traveller this was slightly unacceptable due to being out late at night to enjoy the city.Also, whatever time of day you are there you can hear room service wheeling their trolleys around the hotel. (This was VERY noisy) The room was nice, however way too small for friends sharing. It would be more suited to couples or lone travellers. The Tv's reception was very bad and the screen was always grainy and unwatchable.I would stay again, however only with a partner or by myself. As a frequent traveler, location is very important to me. Overall I think if the hotel tweeked a few things it would be a good choice if you are looking for basic needs like somewhere to lay your head, shower and change! Next time I visit New York, I will look at other options first but may use this place again.

Having booked it for my fiance’s Birthday we did our research and wanted to be central to Times Square, this ticks the box for starters.however, on initial entry on checking in i found them to be rude and was then informed of the ‘urban tax’ they pre authorised my card for $250! Yet on checkout hesitant to tell you when you’ll receive your funds back!The rooms are tiny but clean very noisy of an evening due to single glazing! We were there during the first week of Feb, asked why the room heater didn’t work and got bluntly told it wasn’t cold enough yet to allow heat!We wouldn’t stay again.

The hotel greets you asking a $250 deposit. What for? To make sure you've paid their stupid $25 per night so called urban fee that has nothing to do with the state or city tax. It's just another way to charge you extra. They advertise one price to lure you in, and then charge you $25 on top per night. That's a disgraceful approach I can't appreciate.The bedsheets and the bed itself were beyond terrible - forget about good sleep there. The room was dirty. There are drain flies in the shower.Dreadful experience not worth the asked price.The only good thing I can think of is the location of the hotel - very central and convenient. Otherwise - terrible.

We recently stayed for two nights at this hotel. It was perfectly situated for Times Sqaure, the closest I’ve ever been. The rooms were small but had everything you needed for a couple of days stay.The staff were particularly helpful. Sadaat arranged for transport for us to the airport at 3am for our ongoing journey to Vegas. He procured a limousine that was cheaper than the yellow cab we’d had when transferring from the airport to hotel two days earlier. He was especially helpful and I felt he really cared about doing everything he could to make our stay a success. A1

We had a superior room for 11 nights which although very small ( it is central New York !) had everything we could want, very comfortable bed. New bathroom with shower and plenty of hot water. Lovely fresh new towels. Staff at reception always polite , courteous and helpful as are the maids. Irish bar next door excellent and good menu.We had an issue with tv reception not great which didnt get sorted but we were in New York with a whole city to explore so who cares! the lifts can be a wait during peak times, ( we would go up to come down to ensure we got in!)The location is perfect just off Times Square close to Hells Kitchen and an easy walk to Central Park. Subway station couple of minutes away so the perfact base to explore this wonderful city

I’m not usually one to moan, hence why this is my first review but for the first time in my life I’ve felt the need to leave one! Currently still staying here. 3rd night and just about had enough. No hot water for a shower. Small room with wallpaper peeling away. Dust all over the furniture! Air conditioning unit is louder than the traffic outside! Unfortunately the room gets too hot so needs to be on. Bathroom is tiny and only one person can be in at a time. Upon arrival the equivalent of $200 was taken off my credit card without warning or telling us what it was for. When we checked in we were given a sheet of paper also stating that we are going to be charged a nightly fee of $34 for urban tax. Staff are clueless, we asked for a pizza delivery menu and the one they gave us is for a place that is now shut down!! I would rather stay in a prison cell than this place! Joke of a hotel! Would rate ZERO if possible Great location however and the bed is comfy! AVOID AVOID AVOID

We enjoyed our stay in this very pleasant bputique hotel in the heart of Broadway with Time Square within a couple of minutes walking distance; yet so quiet to enjoy a calm and good sleep. Excellent location, very helpful and welcoming staff, nice restaurants around and rich breakfast. WE DO RECOMMEND THE GALLIVANT TS HOTEL.

Stayed here from the 3rd to the 7th December. Found concierge staff extremely friendly upon arrival. Went through all the checks and information really well. Room was brilliant when we went to it. Rooms are compact but no where near a broom cupboard. Great bathroom and fantastic shower. You'll get a great nights sleep too. Didn't experience the issue with noise as some people have mentioned. Great service as well eith case storage after check out. Would 100% stay here again!!

Everyone was very polite, the rooms are small but that's most/many hotels in the city. Nice finishes - the decision to have hardwood floors is perfect because carpet is gross and seldom gets replaced (Ask Row NYC about that. Yuck.) - Bathroom was itty bitty but very clean, all decor was very modern. The location is perfect. There's even a little room for street parking if you have the patience to keep moving your car accordingly. The best feature? The bed! It was SO COMFORTABLE!!! I'm a mom.... I never get to sleep.... It was VERY difficult to want to get out of bed. Temp in the room is easily controlled which is great - I've definitely had issues with that in older hotels. Price was very good - a steal and I got my incidentals fee back very quickly. Though, I will note that there really was no water and snacks so even if I did want them they weren't there but it's not a big deal. There's a CVS or Walgreens or Duanne Reed on every other corner anyway.

The gallivant is in a great spot,literslly in the doorstep to everythin in Times square.Rooms and bathroom were small but modern.Really hot through the night so we just opened the window a little to let some air in.The only negative i really have is that when we enquired about keeping room on for the day of check out to freshen up et before transfer was picking us up,a mousy coloured hair lady given us $45 to which we said we would let them know the morning after,when we went down a male said no its $75 and then i thought i.d try an trip them up and asked a completly different person to the first two...to be told $65 by her.So to me theyre all just making a price up which suits them which isnt very professional or consistent at all.Also the male and last lady who had blonde hair was very rude and unhelpful.

We stayed at the Gallivant and couldn't believe how close we were to EVERYTHING you could literally trip, rollover twice and you're in Times Square. The hotel itself is excellent, not flashy but warm. the staff were very helpful with reccomendations for food etc. The room was small ish but warm (it was very cold in New York the time we were there) the bed was very comfortable and the shower excellent. We will definitely stay here again.

The family room was perfect for 2 adults and 4 teenagers. We would definitely stay again! The location was great for the price. All the lights of Times Square are just around the corner. I will be recommending this hotel to friends and family who are looking for an affordable room in NYC.

Very pleased with everything about the hotel. WiFi was excellent, staff we’re very friendly and helpful, we weren’t told when we arrived about the city tax so that was a shock but once we were told it was ok. Excellent location just off Times Square. All the sights were a short walk or cab ride away.

The gallivant hotel was clean and tidy good value for the room rate if a tad small great location but the dreaded tourist tax put the bill up by 28 bucks a night plus tax , The hotel held £77 from my credit card and then £55 tax on top of that without informing me of either transaction after phoning them the accounts dept thought it was no big deal but a week later it’s still pending and held back on my account on top of that New York is very expensive for tourists and locals alike

The gallivant is a lovely hotel just a 2 min walk round corner from Times square,sight seeing places,theatres and very good pubs. It's friendly the staff very helpful and the hotel clean any problems were sorted right away.

I read some bad reviews about this hotel, when I walked in the lobby kind of shaking too, but the lobby design beautiful, my check in real fast , the blonde hair pretty lady in front desk was very kind , I got into my room right away, that was a standard room only 168 sq. ft , bathroom very tightly Squishy, but the bed comfortable, and shower head big enough with hot water, I liked the Japanese restaurant in front of the hotel more , plus 10% discounts as hotel quest , good deal, will come back for lunch or dinner

I stayed here in March with a friend. The hotel was in a great location, just around the corner from Times Square. A great theatre next door, which we went into and watched ‘A Bronx Tale’ on our first time in New York, it was a great show! The hotel room was small but extremely cleans and tidy - exactly what you need when visiting New York. I was expecting to be in the room much so this boutique style hotel was perfect! I would definitely stay here again. PS the elevator also had some great quotes on the walls. The photo attached is my favourite!

I booked this hotel in for a family trip to celebrate my cousin’s 30th. I was so concerned after reading the reviews but shouldn’t have worried.The staff were really friendly, the lifts were small (max 7 ppl) but big enough and worked well our entire stay, our heating was great and we could self-regulate it (although my cousin had issues with her room), the room was small but not ridiculously so and plenty big enough for 2, comfy beds, good TV, good (free) WiFi, had a coffee maker in the room, the hairdryer was powerful, cleaning was good and sheets and towels were changed every day.The location was perfect, minutes from times square, theatres, subways, 25-30 min walk to Central Park, a little convenience store just up the road. We were on the 8th floor and didn’t hear a sound during the night. It didn’t have outstanding views and I guess for some it would be considered too small/basic, but for the rate we got and the overall experience, we couldn’t have asked for more - we came for the city, not the hotel. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

need new tv smart. my son was no happy because he trying to wacht netflixneed a microwavelocation is perfect.cleaning good,service was good, no complein,was only single tv, in double room, the roms are small, any way, very small

Staff was friendly. Room was clean. Got a great rate. Just steps away from Times Square. Highly recommend The Gallivant. I would definitely stay there again. My only gripe is the shower pressure was low, this could have been just my room, and shower pressure is subjective.

Helpful staff : no one hassled you for tips etc , clean comfortable bed and great house keepers wildlings to help got a room upgrade as initial room the window had broke , very close to Times Square easy to get to all landmarks

The location of the hotel is excellent, you can get to Times Square within 2 minutes of walking. The lobby looks modern and clean however I cannot say the same for the rooms. When we first arrived, our room was "ready" however when we got there the room was dirty and the bedding was not made. The reception did resolve this by relocating us to a different room, the receptionist did not apologise for this and told my partner that they recently been having issues with house keeping staff and describing them as argumentative or lazy. This should be dealt with internally. We got to our room eventually and our impressions was average. It looked dated, the TV was OK. The shower facilities was below average as finding the correct temperature for the shower proven to be a task. I also noticed that there was also slight damage on the bathroom floor. Lastly, Our heater/air condition was possibly defective as we would adjust the settings but nothing would change. Basic hotel, good location but not very likely to stay again.

We arrived early on a Thursday morning and was welcomed by suny and Trisha who went out of there way to get us our room quickly.on entering our family room we found a large spaceous room 2 queen beds and bunk beds a large shower/toilet area.housekeeping is amazing ruby our house maid did a marvelous job nothing was an issue.adriana and back shift Cassandra on reception we also amazing great tips and advice.big rab the manager keeps guest and staff happy.this is a great location and easy accesable very clean super friendly cannot fault this hotel my kids had s fantastic time.thank you all very much.

Not the 4 star hotel experience I am used to. Reception area looks modern however the rooms are in need of a makeover, very basic and a bit shabby. Told we were being given an upgrade however that consisted of a change from a room with a double bed to a room with 2 single beds, not really what I call an upgrade. The room we were given hadn’t been cleaned since the last guests checked out, beds sheets hadn’t been changed, dirty towels on the bathroom floor etc. We had to be moved to another room. The TV did not have signal, all channels were fuzzy and unwatchable at the end of the day when we wanted to relax. There was a constant noise from units out the back of the hotel and the beds were creaky when you moved. The location of the hotel is fantastic, in close proximity of Times Square. There is a fire station at the end of the street so sirens were sounding on a regular basis, I brought ear plugs which did the trick and drowned out the noise. The beds were made and fresh towels provided daily which was a positive. Overall a very basic hotel; definitely not 4 star quality. Not sure if I would stay here again in the future.

The hotel was in an excellent loacation less than 5 mins walk from Times Square. Lobby was nice and clean. Reception were helpful. Rooms were small but absolutely fine. I had emailed 3 times go get twin beds but my room had a double... I asked reception to change it and they did. “At no extra cost”. The rooms were clean and the maid came daily. My sheets weren’t changed in 3 days but I didn’t expect them to be. Shower was really powerful and nice and hot. The rooms facing the street were soooo noisey. This didn’t bother me and I can’t speak for any other rooms - but if you’re a light sleeper it will be your waking nightmare... literally because you won’t get any sleep. WIFI - none existent. It just does not work. I’m on 02 in the U.K. and I couldn’t get 4g either. This signal is soo bad in this hotel. Other than the WiFi it’s really good value for money and you couldn’t ask for a better location. Steer clear if: you are 6ft+, a light sleeper, can’t keep off your internet.

The hotel is really lovely and the staff were all really welcoming. They gave us a room upgrade on checking in so we ended up with a room with a double bed, bathroom and then a seperate section with a set of bunks (which we used for our luggage). The rooms are not overly spacious, but they don't feel too cramped either (except for the bathroom). You are REALLY close to Times Square (which is great if you are seeing an evening show) and various subway stops so it was incredibly easy to get around. It is also a nice walk to Central Park and the many shops around there. It is directly next to a fire station though, so it was hard to sleep the first few nights as we were often woken by sirens (couldn't believe how many would go off in 1 night!). However, we did get used to it. Personally, if we came back to NY we would stay in another part of town, such as Soho or Brooklyn, due to the sirens and the fact that being so close to Times Square got old quite quickly (it's hectic!). However, it is a convenient location to see different parts of New York and the hotel itself is nice.

We stayed one night at the Gallivant. The staff were helpful. It was conveniently located to Hell's Kitchen and Times Square. We had booked for a premium room for our family however it was not available on our arrival. The hotel offered us 2 standard rooms instead. Very small rooms but comfortable and clean.

Got there early evening checked in fine. Staff friendly. Went to our room was clean and ok although bit small and dark. At 2.15am in the morning the heating started making a noise so we was moved quickly which was brilliant although 2nd room was very noisy but it’s time square so what you expect. There no hotel bar but hurleys next door is fab with lovely food. On the whole the gallivant is ok to stay for a few nights all though bit of a shocker when we had the room tax bill $114 for the 4 nights. A higher up room would of been better I think. But we had wonderful time in New York so all was good

The lobby has a fresh modern look. Lovely fish tank behind the reception area. Lots of comfortable seats. Check in was easy . Friendly staff .The lifts are very small and can be slow at busy times . They hold seven people. Our room was very small . Perfect if you are only staying a short time and don’t have large luggage cases. If you have a lot of things there is just nowhere to put anything. Maybe there is bigger rooms in the hotel or a suite you could request. The room was generally clean. Some areas could do with a deeper clean on closure inspection. We had nice fresh wallpaper on our wall so I think the rooms are getting a makeover. The bed was comfortable and the TV had some decent channels. There was a iron and coffee machine also. The aircon unit could be noisy at times. Check out was busy but moved quickly. Baggage Porter was friendly and efficient. The location of the hotel is excellent. Outside noise was minimal. Noise from other rooms could be quite loud. A very nice hotel. I would stay here again.

Stayed here in JanuaryRooms alright size was told had been upgraded room but clearly hadn’t the bath room was so small the shower was frezzing. Found a dirty sock from the person before. The floor was never cleaned.Front desk staff just rude and stuck up. House keepers where terrible. In complete honesty reading the reviews etc I was like it’s not as bad as people making it out to be but it really is. Then the tax paid over £1000 for myself then for that to be added on which was meant to be paid on departure but took from card straight away when mentioned it without being told about it!! The only good thing about the place was the Chinese next door. Will I be back never!! And I see it’s only the good ones that get replies and moved up to hide your bad ones.Don’t book here just because of the location you can stay in the Hilton for less and it’s so much better...

I booked this hotel knowing it was basic given the good value for money. Upon check in we were greeted by a man who said oh I’m not sure why you have been booked into these rooms we can do much better than this. I don’t know why he bothered the 3 rooms we were given were on the 4th floor- views of an emergency exit and it’s rubbish and a pair of used ladies knickers the smell from the extractor fan from the neighbouring restaurant was so disgusting we could not open the window, the rooms were generally shabby the promotional photos were way off an accurate picture. Hallways had old shabby carpets with rips. However I didn’t complain as I said great value for money. To add insult to injury on check out I was handed a bill for $596.72 for city tax state tax and an urban fee although one of the rooms was a different charge to the other two as that was booked before the higher charge was introduced - I booked all 3 rooms together nearly a year ago!! Advice to travellers -may appear a bargain look for a better maintained hotel that does not rip you off on check out!!!

Currently staying here pre cruise and have to say I’m very disappointed. Was really looking forward to our first visit to NY and the accommodation has put a bit of a damper on things. First the positives, the location is great, very central and easy to get to all the major attractions from. Plenty of restaurants nearby. And that’s as far as positives go. We are in room 1011. The room is small but fine for 2 people, bathroom is tiny but serves a purpose. The cleanliness is very poor. The floor was not clean when we arrived and still isn’t. Toiletries were not replenished after first day. The walls are paper thin, which isn’t great when you have screaming kids in the next room. There is a heater in the room which is noisy and doesn’t always work, wire has to be jiggled a bit.No hot water yesterday from the shower. Warm water this morning only. Overall I wouldn’t stay here again, certainly wouldn’t recommend and was suprised that Royal Caribbean have this rated as a 4 star hotel which is definitely isn’t!

We stayed at the Gallivant for 2 weeks in December and found it to be an affordable and pleasant hotel. Staff were friendly, rooms were clean and tidy, room service staff were lovely. The restaraunt downstairs was excellent and their food was top notch. The only issue we had was one of the two elevators were out for most of the time we were there, making it almost impossible in peak times to get in one going either up or down. Front counter staff discounted a days resort fee(there were 5 in our party). A little more of a discount would have been nice for the inconvenience of having to walk up and down 11 floors.Other than that we would happily stay there again.

I've stayed here twice. The rooms are typical NY small and no view but the location is the priority. Times Square is literally a block away. There is a parking garage right across the street which is very convenient.

Beautiful hotel. Very central too time square. Rooms are lovely. standard but what else do u want when your not spending much time in them. The shower room does get a little wet bit people are moaning on here just put a towel down on the floor it's not hard. Wi-Fi was excellent and all staff members were so professional and lovely. Can be a little noisy on the lower floors at night night u are staying in time square so take that into consideration..

Stay at the hotel is usually cheap. But those prices dont come without strings. The hotel is the worst experience. When you rather take steps to the 8th floor than To wait untill the elevator arrives.

We booked 2 rooms we have 3 kids , i booked rooms to be next to each other because kids are 2 ,7 and 10. When we got there lady was so dumb she didnt know how to look up my reservation . They gave us rooms so far from each other i had to get up every hour or so to go and check on my kids. The doors will not lock you have to check few times make sure its looking, Saturday morning people were fighting in our hallways and yelling screaming no one came to check what was going on , i asked front desk later what was going on they said they had no idea . This place is just bad and dirty looka nothing like their pictures on webpage. Will never stay here again.

TheGallivant is ideally located if you’re coming for Broadway performances or just choose to be in a central location to all the NYC events &attractions. Nice, contemporary lobby next door to a wonderful sushi & Vietnames restaurant. Rooms are small (typical for the neighborhood) but well appointed and an excellent value. It’s proximity to Times Square makes it a little noisy, but if you’re a sound sleeper, probwon’t be an issue. The staff is friendly and helpful, eager to make your stay memorable—-thanks for a great time

We searched for and found Gallivant. Perfect location. Room clean and nice. Love the ability to store luggage before and after arrival. It delivered was was promised. Easy walk to Times Square and Gershwin and subway to 911 memorial.

Arrived on the 12th December 2018 around 8pm. Check in was quick. Man on the desk had a bit of a chat wished me a merry christmas so i explained that it was my birthday first. He asked when so i told him to find out the other guy who was with him on reception was the day after mine. Asked for a credit card for the hold charge and that was it, all checked in. No other charges were taken due to me booking a package with british airways. My room was on the 13th floor. I had booked a single room as it was just myself and i was only sleeping and showering there. Room was small. Had to sit with my legs on the bed to open the wardrobe each day. It was clean untill i found a few ants crawling around one morning before i went out. Simply poured boiling water on the source and i didnt see any after that Room had a heater that was noisy but had to have it in cool all the time as the room was so hot. Im usually always cold so dont usually find that a problem but the heat was too much for me. Room also had its own balcony. Not much of a view but it was ok for me. The door was slightly stiff and didnt close properly like there was a slight gap in the frame almost like it had been sprained at the hinges. Didnt find it an issue though as i was on the 13th floor. It was very noisy due to the location but for me that added to my experience and once id turned the lights out and blinds were down i was sound asleep from being busy all day anyway. Maids came each day with towels etc but no toiletries. I always take my own just in case but none were replaced when used. Location is fab. 5 mins walk from all the the glitz and glamour of times square. Easy to find the hotel from 50th street station when traveling from the airport by subway. Upon checkout i left my case and rucksack with the bell man for 2 dollars per bag. He asks what time you'll be back to collect and then threads and chains them around the sofas in reception and secures with a padlock. Asked if i could print my boarding pass but the printer wouldnt print. After a few mins playing around and using a different programme to open the document i finally managed to print it out. Although the lady on reception said if i emailed it to her she would print it for me if it didnt work the second time around. Couldn't have asked for more really for my first time in new york. Id stay here again as i had such a positive experience overall. Im one of those people who isnt picky about places unless it really deserves to be brought up. Just go and enjoy yourself. If your going to pick the room apart then simply stay in one of the high market chained hotels if it makes you sleep easier.

The bed sheets were dirty! When asked for another set they were just as dirty. The location is great but there are other places to stay there where it might be cleaner. Upon checking out I called the front desk for my complimentary tote bag I was promised and I was given a little attitude but did receive the bag. I wouldn't stay here again.

Brilliant location just off Times Square, very helpful and late check out 12pm. Only negative was the lifts (elevators) there were 3 and slow which meant a lot of waiting unnecessary waiting around. Go to the end off the lobby to get guides, maps etc. We didn’t find them till the last day.

We checked in with our three kids at 5pm. Check In was at 3:00. We were told our original room was still occupied and were given a smoke-filled dirty room instead. This room was unbearable, so we requested another room, which was not available. The staff were apologetic, but not helpful in resolving our problem. Although the hotel is non-smoking, somehow they failed to check the room and clean it before we checked in. We wonder if they even cleaned it or changed the sheets. They said they would charge the previous residents for smoking — however, this was no help to us. Luckily we were able to secure a decent hotel room at the Hilton down the street, or we would have been stranded in the city with our children. DO NOT take a chance with this place. Believe the mixed the reviews. We would rate it a zero if we could. Beyond the beautiful lobby, it was disgusting.

After reading all the bad reviews about this hotel I was quite worried about staying here.......but what can I say!! The check in was quick and easy. The staff were attentive and friendly. Yes the rooms are small but when visiting new York does anyone really go there for the size of a room? An absolutely fantastic location right next to times square. We ate breakfast every morning at the hotel which was a great start to our day. Am American style buffet filled us both right up. Rooms were cleaned every day with fresh bedding and towels changed every day. A nice late check out at 12 midday and also you could store your luggage safely for a small fee of $2 per case. Again.....I can't express how friendly the staff were. Always a good morning and a smile when we came down.......Even down to them ordering our taxi back to the airport which arrived ahead of time and waited for us until we were ready.Would 100% stay here again

Great location 100 metres from Times Square, warm and clean. Tiny rooms lovely bathroom in standard rooms. However I had no hot water for 5 days in 2 rooms despite numerous call outs to maintenance people-even had the General manager in my room who waived the nightly charges $30 ish because of it. Helpful Reception staffHowever the worst thing was I left 2 tops in the wardrobe-both brand new (my fault for leaving) informed hotel within 12 hours of leaving. But housekeeping didn’t record any items found BE WARNED (was very happy to pay to have them returned) make sure everything is packed away ! No chance Of getting it back. Some is telling fibs about what was left in roomAlso took 4 days for email reply

It was a nice experience living in the time square such a great location only they have an issue with cleaning the details !! The balcony in the 10th floor is so good to have I really like it while it’s cold weather

This hotel took a $200 in case of damages deposit and even though we checked out and are now back in the UK, we haven’t had it back. We weren’t notified about this prior to travel.They also charge $32 per day for use of the ‘free wifi’, the gym and the business centre. You have no choice in this, even if you don’t use it. Wall paper was peeling off the wall, the towels were too small to be useful and apparently there is a bar...?! We didn’t find this and had to entertain our American friends in our room, all sat on the bed. Bathroom shower screen was filthy and only a coffee machine provided in the room so if you don’t like coffee, take your PG Tips with you! (It will have to be black as there’s no fridge for your milk)In short, the holiday of a lifetime was ruined by a crap hotel. Would not recommend and would not return.

We didn't stay here. We chose to find another hotel so this review is on checking in, finding our room and checking out only.We experienced a passive aggressive clerk at check-in, a sub standard room with no hanging space whatsoever and only 1 out of 3 available lifts actually working.

Location is GREAT! Located one Block from times Square is very comfy. No noise! Hotel is BIT OLD! It usted to be betterService and cleaning needs to improveRooms too small Beds are oldI repeat LOCATION IS GREAT

Room was everything i expected, clean, modern and warm. Location was amazing, staff were polite, professional and friendly and the wifi was good. There was a bit of noise but your in a busy city but my sleep wasnt disturbed by it and i sleep lightly! Will deffo be coming back to The Gallivant. Soon hopefully!!

Perfect hotel for doing the touristy thing. The location relative to Times Square and all the centrally located attractions is ideal.The bed was very comfortable (I believe it had a memory foam mattress), so we all slept very well. The room was not large, but we didn't spend much time in it so it didn't really matter, however it was surprisingly quiet considering we were only on the 3rd floor and we overlooked the road. The only slight negative to the room was that the hot water took a long time to come through, but once through it provided a very good shower.We did not have breakfast at the hotel as that appeared to be very expensive. We found some much more reasonably priced places near the Rockefeller Centre where the locals often grab breakfast.Overall we would recommend the hotel.

Nice comfortable hotel fits perfectly for doing all the tourist things. It's central location is ideal for buses, subways and you are able to walk to most places. Right in the heart of times square but off the main street so it is quiet.

The lobby is quite swanky and nice to sit while you're waiting or relaxing. Our room was very good and cleaned on a daily basis. There's not many lifts and there can be a long wait. Overall, no negatives. I'd stay there again - it was a decent price for a decent quality in a prime location.

Only Asian males work at the hotel on the technical side, they are disrespectful towards women. The phone on my room had no digits missing all numbers, we had to use a pen to dial. TV would not work we called the front desk 6 times before they sent the same disrespectful guy to not help, just argue. The shower in our room would make a loud sound and seems like the whole wall would fall. Just unacceptable

This was our first visit to New York and we couldn’t have wished for a better location. Leading up to our visit we were slightly concerned about some of the reviews but when we arrived it was clear we had nothing to worry about.The staff were so helpful & friendly throughout our visit, our room was ready for us hours earlier than we were expecting. The room was clean, the bed comfy, sheets & towels changed daily.Although comments say rooms are small, ours was more than adequate, after all its New York, you’re not visiting to stay all day in your room!Location is fantastic, it made our holiday. You literally step out into the heart of everything, we walked 65 miles in 5 days exploring everywhere on foot & the very comfortable bed was most welcome at the end of each day!Thank you Gallivant for making our very first stay in New York a wonderful, memorable visit. We hope to come back again, perhaps next time in summer & would absolutely book with you again.

Just returned from 3 nights. The hotel was spotless, staff friendly and location perfect!Our room was the ideal size and came with all the facilities we needed for a short break.I don’t understand the negative reviews would 100% recommend to others and would definitely go back myself.

Do not believe the negative reviews on here. Before we arrived we were a little nervous after reading some of the reviews on here. Upon arrival we were greeted with very friendly staff. We were handed our keys to our room and told where to head to. We did have a slight problem (and when I say slight I mean very slight) problem with our first room. The air conditioning didn't work and there was no safe. We quickly rang reception to notify them and without any other questions we were quickly moved to another room where it did have working air con and a safe. Absolutely first class service! Maid service every day with fresh bedding and towels. The location is flawless and the staff are superb! when we checked out a taxi was sorted out for us for our trip later on that evening! We cannot fault the hotel and its staff and we will definitely be heading here again!
location is great and staff are helpful. Everything was clean. Maid service daily. Also loved the fact that it’s a 12:00 check out so no mad rushing on last morningWould definitely stay here again...

Excellent stay, Location could not be better and brilliant.Staff very good and very helpful. Rooms could do with a coat of paint like the hallway but overall very good and would certainly stay there again.

Lots of thing to improve on this property! The location is the best, near Times sq and all the subways! I do loved that! Rooms are to small and beds old! I have a terrible back pain from them! Cleaning service is not good. Most of the staff members are great!

Very good hotel clean and comfortable rooms.small bath room wonderful staff .central location as walking distance to time square and theatres. Restaurants both sides are good lovely bakery arcoss the road.had pancakes and waffles around the corner.would come back to this hotel as they were very helpful.first time to new york.

Best location in NYC, just close to Times Square and good restaurants. Cleaning is very poor and not compatible to the hotel location and type. Incredible large quantity of dust under the bed. They shoud clean that! Bed was not confortable, but ok... Average gym available.

I have stayed at the Gallivant a handful of times, and each stay is perfect. Great location, very comfy beds and rooms, but most of all, amazing staff. Everyone working there is so nice, and seems to enjoy their job. I look forward to my next visit.

Stayed here for five nights..good location and clean rooms.Bathroom is small. heating on at all times and very warm..understand it is winter but guests should be able to control heating.in room! Had air con on but very noisy at night... one lift for a few days which was a problem..resolved on the last day! Be mindful you must pay a security fee on a credit/debit card before check in..we had brought cash and nearly couldnt check it even though room was paid in full..right beside times square and broad way! Next door to an Irish bar and close to everything.

Before leaving for New York we reviewed previous reviews of the Gallivant and were a bit apprehensive due to the nature of those reviews. We arrived in good time but were not greeted by the staff and hauled our own luggage in ( i know this sounds lazy, however, having been to New York before it is customary at most hotels for the Bellman to attend you upon arrival). The receptionist was pleasant enough, however, she only booked us into 1 room (two couples)! Upon realising this, we had to go back down to reception to sort it out(not what you want to be doing after travelling for 18 hours). The guy on reception wasn't very helpful and even tried to argue we had only booked one room - even though our paper work showed differently. Eventually we got it sorted out, however, the reception staff were very short on giving information and didn't explain the debit card bond situation very well. All in all, not a very professional start.The room was clean and tidy - nothing flash, but for a budget hotel not bad with all the amenities and coffee making facilities and a secure safe. The only draw back was that for the entire 5 nights we were there the bed sheets were never changed!The staff were not very approachable and appeared to not want to be there and the only time i saw a smile was when we were checking out.Overall, it wasn't a bad stay, but I've had a lot better from a similar hotel only a block away.

The room was small but comfortable. Wifi, hot water, wake-up calls were all fast and reliable. Excellent location - only 2 short blocks from the subway and tons of great restaurants in the immediate vicinity.

You would think as stylish and beautifully appointed as the lobby is, the rooms would reflect that. Bait and switch. Our room was cramped, the bathroom was apparently built for a dollhouse. There was trash on the floor when we checked in and after housekeeping had come through twice the trash was still there in the exact same place. The tv had a hole in the front of it and kept turning itself off. The A/C unit cover and vent cover was hanging off scraping the floor. I know most places don't look like the pictures, but this was a serious let down. Especially for the price.

We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and were very comfortable. Our first room was noisy with the air conditioning but first thing next morning we were moved to a room at the front of the hotel which was better. Staff went out of their way to be helpful in every way. Rooms were not large but more than adequate.

I stopped here to bring my mum for her 60th , very helpful staff from minute we got out of the taxi , please be aware there is a $25 a day charge and this cane into force March 2018 so if you booked before then make sure your agent etc has paid it :) .The staff helped me sort everything out as I was so stressed and when we went up to our room I was gutted as the cold air was stuck on and was tired :( but the receptionist was amazing sent up the repair man and moved me into another room and it was perfect :) a bit tired like others have mentioned but I was very happy with it very comfy bed spotless linen, plenty of towels which were changed daily and bedding which I’m sure was changed 3 times :) . The cleaner was very thorough and you can’t fault them .Personally I enjoyed my stay and would return and this is really down to the staff who made my stay enjoyable !! Thanks guys keep up the good work of improving as some of us do appreciate it xx

Firstly the positives - The check in was quick and smooth with no issues. All Gallivant staff have been helpful and polite. The rooms are clean with clean towels changed daily with shampoo, conditioner and soap provided. Beds are comfortable with soft fluffy pillows. Breakfast is available in the hotel which we have enjoyed. The location of this hotel cannot be faulted. The negatives- Our standard room is very small. Bathroom is tiny. Room temperature at night has been the main issue. At times it has been too hot at night making it almost impossible to sleep. The window in our room does not open and air con has been a bit hit and miss. If you are planning to spend a lot of time in your hotel room then this may not be the hotel for you. If you want a clean, friendly and perfectly located hotel from which you can explore all that NYC has to offer then I would recommend this hotel. We were very worried having read some of the reviews just before we came and thankfully have not encountered any issues.

on first appearances the gallivant was impressive despite the scaffolding outside, a clean lobby/reception and friendly staff.the lifts/elevators are dated but do the job, our room was on the 9th floor, it was large clean with fresh bed linen, good size tv, and a great coffee maker, bathroom was larger than expected but did need updating great powerful walk-in shower, but put towels on the floor as they do get wet outside the shower cubicle.walk out of the hotel turn right and within a 5 minute walk you are in the heart of times square, there are 2 restaurants either side of the hotel and hurleys irish bar 2 doors down (highly recommended for food and beer) would i stay at the gallivant again? yes

We arrived on Thursday 3rd January,it’s in an ideal place close to lots of amenities and yes we had one time of waiting a little longer for the lift but what do people expect in a busy hotel. We had an issue when we first arrived but the manageress quickly sorted it for us and we were very grateful. Our first room was very compact but they moved us to a slightly bigger one,but when you are in New York all you do is sleep in the room !!!!!! Our room was 1120 we loved hearing all the noises our bed was spotless and we had clean towels each day x

We stayed to celebrate the end of year at the heart of NYC. The hotel is a stone throw away from the party at Times Square which is great for us at least. The stay was pleasant and Inwas impressed at the cleanliness of the hotel. Cleaning services would even call you to make sure they know if you want your room cleaned or not. Overall it was a great stay and will mot hesitate to book again.

This hotel is ideal for the city break being right on Times Square. As stated the rooms are small, I hoped to avoid this by upgrading to a queen room. However upon arrival found this to be just a small with only a double bed, so would advise not to bother!

Stayed for 7 nights early December 2018. The hotel is in a fab location - although can be noisy at night if your room is on the street side as ours was. Our room was a standard queen and the size overall was good! The room was cleaned everyday & clean towels supplied. We had no issues other than one of the lifts not working for 5 days of our stay. If you have booked this hotel - please don't be put off by any bad reviews. Some people will complain over anything.

worst hotel in New York. I go to New YorkI was charged for fees I did not know. an absurdity! Second time I go in the hotel the room is lousy, loud and cramped, as well as dirty. 10 times a year and I will never go to this hotel again.

I really enjoyed with my stay and it is very comfortable room as well as it is nice designed. Quick response for every request. Nice reception desk workers. All amazing amenities just steps away to hotel

Jose is wonderful. He made my stay fun. Met everyone with a smile. Excellent service. Close to everything. Rooms need updates but if your not going to be there too much you won't notice. Good value for price.

We stayed for New Years and really enjoyed our stay. Close to many great places to eat at and great shopping. One of the better values for this time of the year, but still a little pricey. I would recommend!

First, I want to add that we have been looking forward to this trip for a year. Our family from Germany flew in to share the holidays with us here. When we arrived and came through the front doors, the lobby was very updated and beautiful. That excitement quickly turned to horror as we entered our room. The most upsetting part is that I am not the only one who complains about these issues; yet the hotel does nothing about the following issues: we had a broken dresser. If we open one drawer, they all opened and then would come off track. We tried to fix them. Did not work. After a closer look-- all furniture looked like rejects from Salvation Army. The photos attached show very worn furniture, however, my photos do not capture how bad the furniture truly was. My husband was going crazy after seeing many exposed wires hanging out throughout the room and no wall outlet plates. Whenever one of us would shower, the water would flood the bathroom. (They did fix this). Also, when one of us showered, there would suddenly be dozens of bugs flying around us and climbing on the walls. The housekeeping staff said it is normal. The bugs come up from the drain. Throughout our room, there was peeling paint, wall holes, wall knicks, broken blinds, and some of our windows did not open correctly. Also, there was missing floor in some areas and in others, the flooring was overlapping one another. We had broken and/or missing baseboards as well. Ok. Ignoring all of the esthetics, it just got worse. We could not even relax to watch TV. The TV does not swivel--it faces the broken desk. To watch the TV, you must sit in the "one" old, uncomfortable, breaking desk chair. If more than one person wanted to watch TV, we had to take turns sitting in the "one" old, uncomfortable, breaking desk chair. Mind you, we had a Family Room for 5 people. To have to share a chair with 5 people is plain ignorance on the hotel's part. We paid for a large room with 3 beds; yet we could not watch TV at the end of the night and we are paying about $600 a night. This is one of the stupidest decisions I have ever made in my life with regard to wasting money. Because our stay was during the holidays, we were held hostage. There was no where for us to go. It was extremely maddening. We had children. There was no way for us to avoid our room and stay out all night. Also, after 6 hours of walking around every day, we wanted to relax and watch TV as well. How the hell to do this when the TV faces the east wall and our beds are on the north and south walls? Remember, the TV does not swivel. The thought that went into this "boutique" hotel were extremely trivial and uneducated. I recommend staying at a chain hotel so that there are standards that must be met or the staff is held accountable.

Stayed at the Gallivant in between Christmas and New Year’s so location was very busy! Lovely welcoming hotel and staff nice modern decor, room very clean and comfortable and attractive, bed and linen very comfortable, shower great although sometimes did take good 5 mins to warm up once we realised this was ok. Lovely soft clean towels, didn’t use coffee machine would have been nice to have had provision of tea bags as we don’t drink coffee. Great provision of travel adapter we actually went out and bought one before we realised!
