I’m just home from a great stay at the Gallivant. Location is perfect, just a short walk away from the subway and shops. Room was quite small but weren’t planning on spending much time there anyway! Beds extremely comfortable and the room was very clean. Coffee maker was a lovely touch. The heating system in the room could be noisy at times but we just kept it on for short periods and turned it off at night, room stayed pleasantly warm. It was very effective too, we got soaked our first night with the snow so put a few things on the radiator and they were dry in minutes! Staff were brilliant, maids even made sure to ask us if there was anything extra we needed for the room and gave us some more coffee. Only small things I would say would be it would be great to have a mini fridge in the room, would just take it to the next level. The room could be a little noisy at times but we had a street view room and we booked a hotel on Times Square- can’t exactly be surprised! It didn’t stop us sleeping at all and didn’t really bother us! Overall I would definitely recommend and would love to stay here again.

Perfect location, very friendly staff, for NY great rooms. Have been there for business, but the hotel also works perfect if you want to spend time in NY for leisure. The rooms are for NY big and clean.

Although the location was convenient, the hotel is very basic. Room was disappointing and unwelcoming. Beds were very comfortable however. Tea and coffee machine poor quality. Paper cups! Standard far below expectation sadly.

It is a good hotel, we got a quit but very small room, too small for 2 big dutch girls and 2 big suitcases. There was no space to put the suitcases in the room, so they lay on the ground direct next to the bed. Also the bathroom was very small, only 1 person could be in there. The bed was too small for 2 friends, it was 130 a 140 cm. Location of the hotel where great!

We have just returned from a 5 day 1st time trip to New York. We couldn't fault any of the service we received from the staff at The Gallivant especially Suni who was always so happy and welcoming. We were upgraded room upon arrival which was a great treat as it was a trip I had planned for my partner over a year ago for her birthday surprise. The room (728) was spacious enough for us both and very comfortable, which is needed after a days walking around the city. Great location on times square, away from the hussle and bustle but close enough to feel the atmosphere. All in all a great stay, and one we hope to make again soon. Highly recommended and will be our choice for our next visit.Thank You AllStephen & Sarah

I wanted a single bed in a room close to the Walter Kerr Theatre. The room was great for me as I was so near Time Square as well. I could walk to many sites as it was central to most of New York City's great places like Strawberry Fields in Central Park and St. Patrick's Cathedral.

Very plesentley suprised . Nice hotel, very helpful front desk, manager comes to the front desk to ensure your stay went well.This hotel is in such a great location, just a short walk to the theatres, shops, tour bus’s, restaurants.We loved the Deli directly opposite for breakfast.

I was only looking for a place to sleep for one night. Great location, short walk to most everything in the Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park. Plenty of good restaurants and Dunkin Donuts nearby. The room was small, very clean, and comfortable. Staff was very helpful. No blanket or bed spread on bed … I didn't care. Room temperature controls worked good. Two very small elevators with delays at busy times, but since I was on the 3rd floor, the stairs were easy. Was able to have luggage stored for a $2 per bag fee ... well worth it. Cheaper than by at least $100 per night over nearby hotels. Yes, there was a $32 fee on top of the room price that I bought at a discounted rate from cancelon. I recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Stayed for three nights in Nov. The hotel room was spacious and comfortable with everything we needed for a short NYC break. Room wasn’t spotless and air con was noisy but the hotel location made up for any shortcomings. Location was the perfect base for getting out and seeing the city. So close to Broadway / Times Square makes it ideal for theatre trips but close to subway station too. However being midtown means walking uptown or downtown fairly easy. Great base to explore from.

Nice hotel, very good area, service was a bit delayed, but elevators are absolutely terrible. I waited over 20 minutes for an empty elevator. They are so tiny and slow. I arrived late to my meeting which was just a 10-minute-walk away. Expected better.

I brought a group of 26 people and overall it was a good stay. There were a few complaints of things like, no hot water, could not adjust temperature. Staff took care of most things. I was happy with my room; the beds were comfortable and everything worked. Rooms were small, but expected in New York. Wonderful location! A block off Times Square and easy walking to Theaters. There were two restaurants on each side of the hotel that served a full breakfast with a nice variety of items. The only problem was that, with a group, they had trouble keeping up with the coffee supply and replenishing the food items. I would recommend this hotel to travelers who are mainly interested in location and value and who do not expect luxury.

I booked a simple room, and unexpectedly need to make a 4-hour conference call. My room had no desk or chair. When I asked for a quiet space somewhere to make the call, the friendly desk clerk simply upgraded me to a better room with the needed equipment - at no charge! Then she gave me two bottles of water for the call.

“Oh you booked with Expedia” The rest of the attitude from the desk staff when I checked in followed in line with a type of “you’re a lesser being in my eyes” attitude. If it wasn’t the lack of hospitality and professionalism that started out this not so great experience let me add the rest here so you all will be aware. Paint missing on the walls, temperature control system looked and sounded like Sanford & Son sold it to them (It was a 70’s unit that was barely able to keep the room cool and it was November), the carpet rug looked as though it hadn’t ever been washed in a decade and it was fairly new, waves inbthe flooring, windows nailed shut, and the greatest fail can in two areas, instructions when I booked over a month prior to the visit included being away from the elevator (nope, out the elevator across the narrow hall) and there is a club or something just outside the only single pane window that blasted hard core hip hop dance with intense bass way past 1am on a Friday night. I can deal with most NY attitude when I’m on the street, but not when I’m paying for a service or product, I can deal with cramped small rooms in Manhattan but then keep them clean and tidy, I can deal with some noises off of Times Square and in the city but when I call to ask about it, and it’s not adressed, not one once but twice when I called and you try to tell me Bruce Springsteen’s musical just let out and the volume should come down but doesn’t after 3 hours and you say it’s hip hop dance music to only get a response that Bruce has become “progrsssive” is s a sheer tell tale sign the hotel is a joke. I called, I wrote, I even addressed all of these at check out and NO ONE said or did anything. Lastly, DO NOT waste your money on the shuttle service to the airport. They are late and slow and take every possible route to avoid tolls and was only $5 less than a LYFT! (Lesson learned!)I can’t see myself staying there again. There are too many other options that treat their guests with honor and professionalism. Lastly, the beds are ok. Nothing spectacular or comfortable to brag about, the blankets are cheap and have barely any loft or weight. I gave them 2 stars because of location and price.

For a place that is conveniently located this has to be one of the best places to stay at. I personally liked it because, I walked the whole time I was in Manhattan, and having the subway nearby and tons of shops. It just makes sense. Having somewhere convenient to crash at. The rooms were confortable albeit small, or mine was. Besides it's not like you're going to spend your whole day stuck in your room. At least I hope not. So that wasn't an issue for me, all in all I highly recommend this place

DON'T GO... This hotel is really dirty and doesn't care about your health, I've been sick because of the AC, you can't imagine what you breath... When I checked inside the AC, I was really shocked on how it was dirty, it could kill an asthmatic. And I'm not even talking about the noise of the AC. I find blood on the wall and other non-identifiable substitutes... They don't give you shower gel because as the housekeeper told me : "you can use shampoo, it's the same"... You will hear any kind of noise : slamming doors, house keepers, streets, police, fireman, nightclub, AC, heat... but never the sound of your sleep, and that's too bad for an hotel ! Of course, when I complained to the manager, I was wrong on everything.

Upon arrival we found a hotel room with dirty floors and dirty bed sheets. The window in the room would not close and spent the first night freezing cold and not being able to sleep. After querying the window with the hotel staff who were rude and blunt, they advised they would get someone to look at the window. We returned to find it shut but this did little to stop the noise of the extractor fans outside the window and the room was still cold as the air-con was out of order. Every day we would return to something being missed by room service, the floor was not cleaned at all, once the beds weren't made, or there were no towels, no tissues, no cups, we ended up doing our own room service by taking stuff from the trolleys that seemed to be permanently on the landing. By far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Especially when on the last night I pulled back the covers to get into bed only to find a live bug - which I have searched and believe it was a bed bug! See the photos.

Booked for my 30th birthday,though the hotel looked amazing online but the room was tiny and there was hardly any room to store clothes so we lived out our suitcases for the 3 days,the room on the last night got very hot in the middle of the night and the window was stuck so wouldn’t open properly,the lift only takes 7 people at a time and it took 15mins for it to eventually get to us empty enough to even use it to check out with our suitcases,we couldn’t take our suitcase down the stairs or we would have this was a shame because it was a huge negative,for the amount of rooms more lifts are needed and with a bigger capacity.

Reasonable hotel in a great central location. Rooms are small but clean, comfortable and well-equipped. We experienced a problem with our air con and were immediately upgraded to a bigger room at no extra cost. I wanted to give full marks but the only thing that lets it down is the restaurant part where breakfast is served - it lets the hotel down - it’s dingy and dimly lit and frankly a bit depressing. Breakfast is a continental affair with option to upgrade to fry-up (don’t bother) the coffee is lukewarm as is the hot water used to make tea. Very unappetising and not at all what you’d expect of New York. Do yourself a favour and go to one of the many good diners a few minutes walk away.

My Wife & I thought that the room was average. Not really much else I can say about this hotel apart from the great location. If this hotel didn't have the great location, we wouldn't want to stay there. On arrival, we were informed by the man at check-in that we were half an hour too early & that our room wasn't ready (we arrived at 2:30 & check-in isn't until 3:00), so he told us to take a seat till 3:00. All this without any eye-contact & nothing like a welcoming attitude, we felt like we were being a bit of a pest to him. A smile would have made the world of difference! (after all it doesn't cost anything). In fact checking out was very similar. I honestly feel that this hotel would be so much better with a reception staff that didn't give the impression that they wanted to be anywhere else but standing in front of you! No return visit for us, plenty of other hotels around that we will give our money to & who will give us at least a small sort of idea that we're welcome. Surely the Management here realize that a welcoming reception staff is crucial to first impressions of the hotel. I'm not in the hotel business but even I know that!

My husband and I stayed here for 9 nights for a full size bed. The staff was courteous and very helpful. Our room was clean apon arrival and cleaned every day. The atmosphere within the lobby was always a little busy but had enough space to accommodate it. The only downside we found was the elevators being small and allowing only 7 people at a time.. many times you had to wait awhile to get one that wasnt full.. but really there isnt anything they could do to improve that. The area felt very safe at all hours and it's in a great location for shows, Times Square, transportation and restaurants. The room itself was beautiful.. the bed was comfy and the shower was really clean with hot water.

Although the rooms are very small - bathroom even smaller - it was in a great part of town - so close to Times square and very central. This hotel is in need of some maintence -a blocked shower, which we we ask to be fixed several times however this was not addressed during our stay.

Stayed in a twin room with my daughter. Not much room for suitcases and shopping as room was small but very clean, not noisy considering great location, half a block from Times Square. Great value for money. Lifts were small and slow so we tended to take the stairs when we didn't have luggage. Didn't eat in the hotel as there were lots of places nearby that we tried.

I just don't know why. I had the best sleeping time in months!!! The beds were just perfect, the weather, the pillows, the throws. The room was very comfy and it has a cool ny balcony. The hotel is very well located, so everything is near.

This hotel is in the most perfect location, but that has to be the only positive about it. We had a room on the 14th Floor. It could sometimes take us 20 minutes to wait for a lift to get downstairs. Also, being that high up, you would expect the sounds of the street to be drowned out, but that is not the case. The room we had was small, but all we done was sleep and shower there, so not massively fussed about that. The only massive problem that we had was that 2 large amounts of money have been taken from my fiance's debit card. These transactions have not been approved by us. My fiance never put his pin number in or signed anything for these charges.So how they've got the details, we do not know. This was a trip for my fiance's 40th birthday. I contacted the hotel before we arrived to see if anything special can be done for him (in the UK you wouldn't have to ask, they'd just do it), and nothing was done. Very disappointed with that.Just a little gesture to say Happy Birthday would have been appreciated. If we ever go back to New York, we wont be staying here again.

This hotel is prime location. It is sooo close to Times Square and lots of restaurants and theatres. Staff were friendly and really wanted to help. We had a small issue with our AC unit in the first room assigned to us and they immediately moved us to another room. I would stay at this hotel again. It was a great experience.

Situated just round the corner from Times Square this hotel could not have a better central New York location. If all you want is convenience and can get an affordable price it might suit. But be warned this is a pretty basic doss house ! Our room was narrow with room for the bed (OK), some tatty furniture and little else. It had a window but a view of a brick wall. The bathroom was OK though. The WiFi reception varied from marginal to non existent. The safe, perched almost out of reach, didn’t work. The lifts at busy times were unreliable. There are no public rooms. I stayed in more luxurious youth hostels fifty years ago!

The staff were all very friendly. It was nice being within walking distance to just about everything the hubby and I wanted to do. Only complaint was the size of the room and bathroom as they both looked bigger on website.

Great location, good service, rooms are a bit small and pricey, but overall a good experience. The water dispenser was not working on the 10th and 15th floor, but the vending machines were working. I would recommend this hotel and come back here in the future.

Perfect location, rooms ok. Look better on pictures. Beds and toilets cleaning ok, windows and rest of room dirty. On departure day pay 3dollars per bag.... :( perfect location! Times square at 3min. Price /ocation ok

Staff were really helpful. Room really clean and great location. As we are so central knew it may be slightly noisy. My room was at the front and although I could hear sirens slept ok in a really comfortable bed.

Location of the hotel is great but that is probably the only reason for using it, the location means there is a lot of noise at night andwindows are ot designed for a quiet night .The lobby is very small and often gets overcrowded. breakfast is served basically at the next door hinese restaurant and is not value for money

3 stars. Half the price of other similarily located hotels, but wholly unremarkable rooms. Helpful staff. Beds were small, only views of the roof. Lots of guest / housekeeping staff noise near the elevators.

This hotel is great! The rooms are so cute and look newly renovated. The value is incredible. The service was fast and easy. I was able to get into my room 6 hour early!!! Overall. I will definitely be staying here again!

The lobby and general vibe of the hotel is comfortable. Location of hotel is centrally located with easy access to Times Square, H/K, etc... Hotel room had window with view of lower roof and all the trash on it (that's all). The room itself could have been a little bigger with better accommodations. But overall, it was an okay stay and visit.

Staff was great and rooms were very reasonable. I will return when visiting New York on business or pleasure. Thanks to The Gallivant Times Square for your wonderful staff and accommodations our father daughter trip was a great success!

Hotel location is brilliant. Staff attitude appalling and not very helpful. I would not stay here again. For the price I paid I expected a better sized room. My room was very compact which I shared with my mother. Quite disappointed to be honest.

The hotel is in a good location. We had a deluxe room, small and compact. There was a window which was that dirty you could not see out of it, so a dark room. The AC was very noisy so moved us to a premium room . Bigger rooms and could see out of the windows. There was a terrible smell coming from the shower so we fixed it by putting a plastic bag over the drainage hole. Very very dusty floor, dont think it had been swept. On out last night we had a visitor. Say hello to Mr Roach, reception did come up and removed him and reassured me there would not be any more Glad it was the last might he decided to show himself.

Great location, good decent size room which was very clean and well maintained ( we stayed in a Queen Deluxe Double). Very helpful staff when asked for advice, directions, help with underground routes and booking taxi returns to the airport.

My friend and I had a great experience at the Gallivant. We got the double room at the 13th floor, which is the only one with a balcony, and high enough so that the city noise doesn't keep you awake at night.The room itself was small but very efficient, and the balcony was a very special treat - I may have had a worse perception of the room had it not been there.The location is amazing, right by Times Square and a short walk from everything that's good about tourist life in NYC: broadway, some pubs, Central Park, the upper west side and even the Rockefeller Center.It's not a cheap stay, but I felt it was definitely worth the price!

Not clean room. When we arrived, the room was dirty and full dusty. not friendly staff, doesnt really want to help and assist. When we arrived at the hotel, our room didnt have a safe in it so we had to move a room, but the safe was locked and we had to wait for 1 hour for someone to come and open it for us. They are charging 2$ for bagage (first time that I experienced that in NY, and that was my 4th visit this year alone). The internet connection is super slow at the rooms, nometimes not functioning at all. Its a very noisy location, the front rooms are facing the 48th street and there is a fire station near by so.... the back rooms are facings the air-con condensores... we actually prefered the front room coz it was impossible to sleep next to the condensores (in terms of noise).The rooms are relatively small, the bathroom is tiny and there is no desk at the room

Stayed in the Gallivant for four nights. The hotel is in a good location very short walk to theatres subway and restaurants. Rooms are very compact and noisy (from aircon and traffic). Bathroom is tiny barely room to stand up. Rooms are in desperate need of being upgraded, they are poorly fitted out with old damaged furniture. The safe in the fitted cupboard is at a ridiculous height that only someone above six foot tall could reach. I had to move the bedside table to stand on to put my belongings in the safe, wish I hadn't as the dust and dirt underneath was disgusting. Under the bed was as disgusting, do the cleaners actually clean in this place. There was no chest of drawers to store clothes and only 5 coat hangers between 2 people. Bed was comfy enough and sheets were clean although stained in places. Staff seemed pleasant enough and concierge was very helpful. wifi only seemed to work in hotel lobby which made it very busy and difficult to get to lifts. Lifts are very small which makes them extremely busy in the mornings when heading out for the day. We didn't use the luggage storage as it was not secure, they were chained together in the hotel lobby in full view of other guests. Feel the resort fee was a complete rip off as it is for providing for extra facilities, but with no wifi in rooms and charges for storing luggage I have to wonder what the extra facilities are that are being charged for.

I couldn’t fault location of hotel-it is located just off Time Square near M&M world. The room was compact but had everything you needed although there was a strong damp smell which I reported on our arrival. I didn’t think the staff were overly friendly. The aircon unit was old and noisy. You could open window so the aircon has to be used to cool room down and mask smell. The bed was comfortable and linen was changed each day. It would have been nice to have shower gel supplied as I had to buy some. I personally wouldn’t return to this hotel due to the lack of follow up regarding my complaint. I also advised that this trip was to celebrate both mine and my daughters birthday. I received an email to say they had noted this but we received nothing on way of this. The hotel lobby is beautiful and concierge was good as they held our bags once we had checked out. It would appear that this hotel is used by a lot of school parties as there were a number of separate parties there during our stay. To sum up this is a small functional hotel with comfortable beds perfectly located but lacks the personal touch. It’s ideal for a ‘base’ nothing more. ....................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................

Tiny rooms just about big enough to swing a cat, disinterested staff. We had a carrier bag of souvenir gifts in our room which were removed, when reported to reception they did not seem that bothered. Spoke to the manager who said she would look again but never re-appeared. Also told that we would be given a bottle of water each per day, started at 500ml then reduced to 250ml after 2 days.Additional charge for suitcase storage which is usually complimentary - only $2 per case but would expect it to be included as part of the service.

Cool receptionist and unacceptable room of the first night. Incredibly small, noisy, smelly and needing maintenance technitian. Well the room of second night. Appreciated the internal organisation for shuttle to airport

I highly recommend staying here. The service is good and the rooms are clean. We have always had a great experience and have always been treated with respect and courtesy. I can't say enough about this hotel. It's a great place to stay when in New York

Of all the hotels we have stayed in on this 28 day trip, this was the most disappointing. The internet took 12 hours to redirect us to log in, the first room we were offered was small, pokie and the heater smelled like there was something being barbequed on it. It also looked like some one had tried to break into the room with a crow bar, the room number was 527. I complained and we were switched to a different room 627, which the room was about 8ft wide with 18" of a gap on the left and on the right there was about 9" because of the heating unit. The bed is too small, for a hotel that charges $250 per night, I wouldn't expect my feet to be hanging off the bottom of the bed, in fact the bed was just an every day, run of the mill, double bed. The head in the shower was too low, when i used it, I had to remove the head to wash my hair. The bath was an old tin bath, with a enamel chip at the back, which someone tried to recoat but to no avail. The noise was horrendous from the hallway, there has been no effort to reduce the noise from the doors slamming, try sound proofing on the door frames, maybe. The fact that the health and safety of the hotel has to be in question when the cleaning trolleys were left in the hallway and with half filled rubbish bags. To top it all off, when we checked out it was absurd that we were charged $8 for storage fees for 4 cases, for them to be stored insecurely in the lobby........ In conclusion, I don't think your hotel was worth the money I paid for it and certainly not recommended the gallivant to any friends or family travelling to New York

Very good location and that's all.... The rooms are not clean ( at least our ) We had a premium suite which it looks more as standard room in 3 stars hotel .The furnitures were old,the windows very dirty .You have to pay for wifi (28 $ per day)...The location is good ,but you can have others hotels in the same area ....

is a hotel in a very good area in the center. surely a little bit of fireworks from lower classics to the new sound. clean room with iron and hairdryer. now for personal cleaners very good. but others can all get to the reception and are generally just too bad or indifferent either good or good. so bad I have never seen in a hotel. asking something .. you were crying out! the blond man with glasses at the reception of a lot of evil.

Room : too small, dusty (look under the bed after each room service, it's getting worst) and too noisy because of the AC. You CANNOT stop the noise even if you stop the AC. Bring earbuds.Shower : quite good.Receptionist : by day, terrible, busy and not friendly at all. I received my bill under my door step. No more. Check-out time ? 1 sec, they only care of your money. BEST LOCATION EVER, terrible service. I wish some people had a better experience, very sad because the hotel has a lot of assets to be one of the best in town. Price was to high compared to the user experience and these drawbacks.I will never come back and never spread the word to a friend of mine if I care of its.

We arrived yesterday for a stay of 8 days. Booked a premium suite for my family 4 of us. The room is very small impossible to open our 4 suite cases. The bath room is tiny and filthy no place for our personnel belongings. The room is very noisy it was impossible to sleep. Lamp is broken, windows and furniture are dated dirty. The air conditioning is old and so loud that we had to turn it off. We often travel to NYC but this hotel is the worst we stayed in. It is on Times Square but it is far from being enough. I will try and discuss with the manager to see if I can cancel my stay. The four of us are désapointed.

Great location to everything -Times Square, theaters, Rockerfeller Center. Very nice and helpful staff. Bathrooms small but room updated with comfortable bed. Quiet for sleeping. Would stay again. Great time.

This was my third time staying here. Great for Business or families. The staff is always professional, friendly and accommodating. In a great location and walking distance to restaurants, shopping, broadway and more.

This hotel was in the middle of New York’s theatre land. Staff were very pleasant and facilities were very clean. It is surrounded by a fantastic choice of a variety of eating establishments of every variety you could ask.

The rooms need shower curtains in the shower . The elevators were slow and small . The carpets in the hallway were dirty they need to be changed . I recieved 1 bath soap the whole time I was there . Overpriced

The Gallivant is in a great location, right near Times Square and near all the theatres. I was expecting a kind of funky hotel based on the website photos but unfortunately the rooms were very disappointing. Cramped, old and tired and in need of repairs. The reception staff couldn’t have been less welcoming. I was asked by a staff member how I was enjoying my stay at the hotel and when I mentioned that I was a bit disappointed with the room the response I got was “well you should do your research before making a booking.” I found the housekeeping staff to be exceptional, they were very kind and caring to us.Overall I would not chose to stay here again.

Overall I am really satisfied with my stay in the Gallivant Hotel. Only 1 day I had an issue with dirty sheets. Very helpful staff. Easy check in and check out process. I would stay again there. I recommend it.

The room was small, most of the days we had to claim for towels and amenities. The receptionist were not friendly nor kind at all. The concierge would not help us with moving with the big suitcases though watching us in a hurry and trying to move fast. Well located but hotel offers no services at all apart from having a place to sleep.Very expensive for the quality offered. Not recommended.

We had a really good experience in the Gallivant Hotel in Times Square. The hotel has an excellent location, really close to Times Square. The room was clean and we had new towels every day.Staff was really nice and helpful.

Very clean, with first-rate bed-linens & towels, & a very convenient location. After that-- just not good enough. Sparsely furnished room (no dresser, no shelves, no hooks, 1 chair -- not even a luggage rack to even park your bag on), non-existent common space (only a very busy, industrial-feeling lobby), no bar, no coffee, no radio, no fridge ... Just NOT worth $300-plus dollars a night.

Great rooms perfect location and very nice staff....i would go back to this hotel as it was not far from the Hustle bustle of Times Square. Good location for theatre as well. Rooms were spacious and had tea and coffe making facilities which were great. Nice large wet room and very comfortable beds. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We used the concierge service to book the shuttle bus back to the Airport which was great.

Great location! Nice staff! Lovely room!! Enjoyed the lemon water in the lobby! TV did not work the first night. Called the front desk and they came up immediately and fixed it! They were so nice! Plus it was a short walk to everywhere we wanted to go!

A relatively small but nice hotel. Staffs are quite good especially bell boy was very friendly. Room was clean and beds are comfortable but there was no fridge. One thing I ought to say is unstable wifi.

Nice hotel, very small and stuffy room. Great location, just near times square. Dont eat at the next door restaurant, it is not worth for breakfast. Across the street there is an awesome bakery, with blueberry muffin;)

Excellent hotel, great location, friendly and helpful staff, really nice room, great service. Quick to reply via e-mail or facebook. The only thing that is not excellent are the elevators, sometimes you have to wait longer than usual, but it's a minor thing, really. Already stayed twice at the Gallivant and I'm sure to be back. :D

1-to save my bag for 4 hours was charged us $ 2.00 per bag!2-Go to room 1522 and run your hand under the furniture. I do not think it's ever been cleaned.3-piece information to the receptionists, especially those at night.4-Compare the photos of the site with the actual.

I didn't get what I expected for the price paid. The AC is terrible(run from the rooms at the 3rd and 2sd floor). The cleaning is change towels and pull the dirt to under the bed. The hotel don't have minibar. They charge Urban fee (that is a scam in NYC and Vegas to charge more).

Fantastic location, room was clean but very small. Wi-fi is free but slow. Television wasn’t working and the air conditioning is very noisy. Good value for a quick stop in New York. Not recommended for more than one day.

We reported and showed to the duty manager the still alive bed bugs we found in one of our beds.. (we wrapped it in a paper napkin.) We got as a gesture a.... smaller room!n When we checked out at 12.00 the porters demanded 8 USD for the storage of our suitcases till our departure at 4 PM. No receipt has been given.

Be prepared to pay resort fee's on top of your original inflated costs for a very small room that doesn't even have a clock radio. The only bonus they give is a bottle of water each day. Staff are pleasant and the on site concierge is a nice touch.

Potential is there but a long way to goShower Drain not draining away and exhaust fan wouldn’t turn off, reported first day and they had the maintenance man fixNo housekeeping on the first day although the sign was out to make up room from 8.45-4.30 I rang the front desk and they didn’t want to know about it.On arrival the room Bin had the previous guests rubbish and the toilet seat was up with urine in the bowlWiFi was only available in the foyer, so the foyer was always full of people making it hard to get to lifts, Due to Windows covered over with an artificial frosting and no access to WiFi in room you had to dress and go out to assess weather and return to room to re dress/get umbrella for the day.If you can put up with the downfall of poor service then it’s a great location.

The Gallivant is located one block over from Times Square, next to an Irish bar, a 5 minute walk away from Hell's Kitchen and a variety of cafes and restaurants - you couldn't ask for a better location. The room was somewhat small but nevertheless extremely clean and tidy. The staff were friendly and welcoming - exactly what you need when exploring New York.

I travel internationally several times a year. This is by far the worst hotel (sic) I have ever stayed in! Fleas; urine smell; towels were hand size and worn; safe did not work. When we complained several times, nil was done. Even the housekeeping staff said nothing gets done. And then to make things worse, the manager Rob Nap, undertook to resolve, but refuses to contact & communicate with Hotels.com.... our booking site. And it gets worse.... Hotels.com refunded me part of my booking (thank you hotels.com).... But the good thing was we were not charged for the bed bugs that shared the room.

Our hotel was perfectly located within blocks of Time Square and Broadway. That's where the benefits end. We showed up a couple of hours early(around 1pm) and had to wait until 3pm to get our room. Which we totally understand and check our bags with the bellhop. The bellhop and front desk person had a heated exchange of words in front of a very crowded lobby. When we returned 2 hours later for our bags and room we had to go in and identify our bags because no one tagged them properly.The elevators hold 7 people and are extremely slow. When we got to our room the bathroom was tiny with a fan that doesn't work but dropped condensation on you while on the toilet. The shower didnt have a door or a curtain so water ended up everywhere. The AC unit barely worked and the sheets were damp because of the humidity. We found mildew and black mold in the room. All in all I would find any other place to stay next time.

What this hotel has going for it is the proximity to Times Square, but otherwise it is not somewhere I would choose to stay. Interior is dark and in need of an upgrade. The room we had was tiny. No room to put our suitcases down. The tv didn't work, the safe didn't work, there was no full-length mirror, light came through side of the blinds at night from the flashing neon sign opposite lighting up the whole of our room, and there were ants in the room. We were on the 15th floor so not sure how ants got there but they did. It was a base whilst we explored NY but I was disappointed with the standard.

very nice hotel in the center of mid town , near times square, near theaters broadway new york. The service , the cleanliness and the room is in the up level! You are in the center near 7 and 6 ave. , near central park N.Y., and only 5min walk to the Top of the Rock.

We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Clean room, big bathroom. Internet was patchy and slow at times. Lifts are annoyingly slow - not enough lifts for the hotel. And the cleaning staff uses it too, so that makes it difficult in the morning. Check out luggage was charged 2 dollars per luggage to be stored, that was a little cheeky and annoying, why can't they store it for no charge? first time i have ever had to pay to store my luggage.

Rooms were small, our room had no safe, only bath towels and no other towels. Second room offered but this time air conditioning controls were not working. Windows will not shut properly so you could smell cooking from restaurants next door. Disappointed,

Fantastic location to Times Square, Broadway, subway, etc. However, we had numerous issues with service. Our 1st room had no air conditioning and it took 4 calls and promises to send someone up before they decided to change our room. Our 2nd room had no luggage racks and given its diminutive size and sparse furnishings, no place to set anything, let alone suitcases. It took 2 days for us to get our luggage racks. On our 2nd day our dirty towels, visibly soiled, were placed back in the bathroom, folded up like they were fresh and a dirty washcloth left on the floor of the shower was hung back up. We had to call multiple times to get the towels we needed as they were having some issue with their towel service - still NO excuse for rehanging dirty towels. The beds were SO hard and noisy that it was hard to get up in the night without awakening my friend. Overall it was clean.

The room was very small and not as clean as expected. Floor had debris and dirt in areas. The central air conditioner did not work and the window air conditioner was not easy to operate. The staff was friendly and willing to help with questions and reservations. Lobby was modern and welcoming and the location to local attractions was good.

We were visiting from the uk, Stayed here for my first time in NYC, great check in, and Rooms are decent size for NYC, its in an excellent location i think 1 or 2 block to Times Square & a few blocks over from hells kitchen which is great, staff are friendly its clean and affordable also abit quirky, and there's hurleys saloon right next door which is pretty cool also.

Friendly staff room was a bit noisy from work being carried outside in street. Great location for the stay easy to find way back and forth to hotel. Rooms cleaned each day, TV reception was rather poor but wasnt a big deal.

Where to start.. very slow front desk service, missed towels (as in only 1 towel left for 2 of us, literally 1 towel, no bath mats, face cloths) not helpful front staff ( I had to wait 5-6 minutes to get more towels as mentioned above) elevators are slow, the location is good however the noise level is out of this world (unless you’re fine with sirens all night long) and they have nothing but thin blinds on the windows. Nothing thicker to try and cover up the sound or anything! Some staff are rude and don’t like to be disturbedof and the worst of it we prepaid but they’ve charged me on my credit card GRR! That’s only what I can think of right now, however, I’m sure there’s a lot more negatives! Won’t be staying here or recommending this to anyone.. EVER!

Still 3 stars as I am conscious that the hotels in this area are generally expensive and that I haven’t stayed in others to compare, but the main things from this holiday are:Rooms - first room we were in, was beyond tiny, it was like a box room, there was me and my husband plus a baby in a cot, once the cot was up we were stuck in the bed as we couldn’t physically get past it, bathroom so small only one person could fit etc - again this I know is probably accurate for the area unless you spend lots as space is a premium, but still I was pretty disappointed.So no sleep on the first night, too close quarters and baby didn’t cope well with being pretty much on top of us, so we upgraded the room from the second night on, I believe it was an extra 500 dollars to go up a room to a family room, LOADS better, separate area to put the cot and a normal sized bathroom! Service - can’t comment other than dealing with our room change, was a bit of an ordeal and up until our arrival back at the hotel the second evening we weren’t even sure we had been moved, but we were so I’ll leave it there. Area - spot on, right in the thick of it, loved the area and close walking to transport links.

I was surprised by the excellent attention from the personel. Our room had a couple of problems and they fixed everything right away. All the staff amazing! The location is perfect and close to all NYC principal atractions

My husband and myself stayed at The Gallivant Hotel for 3 nights and I must say that we were very disappointed with the room 1301 as it was so small that the bed was just slightly larger than a single bed and the shower was even smaller that you couldn’t even turn around. When using the toilet you had to sit sideways. The ac in the room was so old and antiquated as well as being very noisy that we didn’t want to turn it on. We requested another room and was given another which was bigger but still the shower room was quite small and compact and the ac was very old and noisy. The lighting in the room needs to be updated as this is very poor and rooms are quite dark. The only good thing about the hotel was the location and the staff were very helpful but as previous reviewers state it is right near a fire station and can become very noisy.

The hotel was supposed to be very good according to pictures and price. The only advantage was its location. But expensive , small rooms , awful view , bad service, they forgot to leave us coffee for many days in a row . Windows super dirty. We asked to change our room because we couldn't even place our suitcases and they did. But even if it was less small it was a rip-off as the deal price in booking then didn't include services like wifi etc which was a shame. Wifi connection next to the door or in the bathroom . When I asked the receptionist about the pics on the internet???? He said yes they are DECEIVING!!!!There are other hotels in Times square that offer breakfast with a lower price. So check in depth before making a reservation. They even chargeU$ 2 to keep a piece of luggage. Awful service never again. NOISY there is a firemen station just round the corner imposible to sleep!!!

The one and only good thing I will say about this hotel is the location, which is perfect, the rest of it.. forget it.. rude,disrespectful and unhelpful staff, extremely tiny rooms, air con is non existent and had to request a fan as heat was unbearable.. would definitely not stay here again, bad!!.

Hotel was fantastic and right across from Springsteen on Broadway. Room was clean, staff was friendly, and the location was convenient to everything we needed and wanted to do. We loved it and would definitely stay there again.

I usually don’t write a review if i had nothing good to say but this time is different.I had stay here for 2 nights and i knew it since i step inside the hotel that i had made a bad choice to booked it.Carpets on the floor was really dirty, carpets in the elevator was dirty and carpets on the floors were dirty.My room was so small that i couldn’t unpack my luggage and so dirty, dust was everywhere and the worst part is i found human hair in the shower.I had to make a complaint about it in order to give me a better and bigger room.Location is ok but seriously ain’t worth the money.Make yourself a favor and check for something else instead.

I had the worst experience in this hotel! I experienced unpoliteness and really discrimination to myself and my husband!The room hasn’t been cleaned for 2 days and when I complained they told me the cleaning manager decided not to because there was a small carryon on the bed! This is absurd!!! Next day we find our sheets are all torn apart and ruined next day same ruined sheets and finally under the ac we find 2 condoms used!!!!We have been treated like trash I am still feeling shaken by the experience!My vacation was ruined by the attitude of the people and I felt discriminated for not being local and not understanding “their way of doing stuff!!!” I mean I am Italian and I know how a 4 star hotel in the center of New York City should be treating a guest! I found people were extremely rude to me and I am considering legal action because I feel all of this has been done on purpose because it was horrible staying there! I had my vacation ruined and I couldn’t move to another hotel because they didn’t even accept to check me out earlier and give me back my money! I felt hopeless and I don’t know if there is any association that can protect my rights against this awful experience!!

First the good - perfect location for Times Square & theatres. Reception clean & modern looking. The lady that cleaned our room was lovely, chatty & helpful. The room was a good size with a double bed, desk & chair, chest of drawers and coffee making facilities and the room/bathroom were both clean. Wireless reception was excellent. Next the bad - Reception has continual dance music playing so loud you can barely hear yourself think. Reception staff were rude and on arrival we were barley spoken to. Local room tax was deducted on arrival from the card used for any room expenses and in our case, not the card on which the booking was secured, this was not explained at reception on arrival and when we asked if we could change the card charged we were told no, very unhelpful. As I said room had coffee making facilities but no tea available from reception and at $5 for a box of teabags at the local deli so had to make do with decaf coffee and not everyone likes coffee. Bathroom was so small that the floor got soaked everyone you had a shower. Not sure if it was value for money as it was booked as part of a package. Not sure I would stay again. Reception staff really need to be trained to be more polite to guests as the ones we dealt with were unhelpful & it was as if we were just an inconvenience to them.

The room was tiny as was the bathroom, but this is Time Square.Could have done with a chair and a small desk.The room overlooked the street and was therefore really noisy day and night (why do New York drivers use their horns so much?).The city that never sleeps!!On the positive side the staff were friendly and efficient and the location was really terrific.Wish that we had raised our concerns on arrival instead of at the end of our stay as we were offered an upgrade but we were leaving the next morning so couldn't accept.One note of caution to potential visitors: don't assume that a taxi driver waiting in the hotel lobby is kosher. We went with the guy waiting there and he ripped us off. $30 for the short trip to the Port Authority bus station.Having said that this was the only occasion we felt we had been cheated in New York, a city well deserving of all the accolades.

Arrived at hotel, looked lovely, reception, looks good, that's where it stopped, got first room, bed so small, ask to change, and no hot hot water for a shower, 2nd room bedding was dirty, we asked for it to be changed and was offered another room, room was ok, but bathroom so small, couldn't close door without squeezing passed the toilet, door had to be forced to close as it hit sink, nasty view, pile of something covered with blue tarpaulin, aircon was noisy, sounded like we were next to the runway at jfk

A fantastic location, and very helpful staff. Turn right out of the hotel and at the end of the road you are in Times Square. We were in a disabled access room as I use a wheelchair. Some of the furniture had seen better days, but you don't go to New York to sit in your room! The lifts had very small doors, which wasn't a problem for ordinary users, but whenever security was around they let me use the service lift. The chambermaids were fabulous, and very helpful. When we couldn't get my wheelchair charger to work they sent the maintenance supervisor to help sort out the problem, which was easily solved. When we checked out they called for an adapted taxi, and it charged a better price than one off the street. All in all we were very pleased with our stay.

For over 300dollars per night I expected much better. Small room, bathroom little more tha 6x4 yet still got shower, sink and toilet in. Bed only had bedside cabinet on one side, couldn’t fit one on other side as bathroom door in way. Coffee making facilities BUT no tea making. Took over 5 minutes for hot water to come through and was next door to a fire station.

I’ll start with the good because it will take less time. You cannot fault the location. It’s right in the heart of Times Square and close to Central Park, Rockefeller Centre and the Empire State Building. The free wifi worked very well. When we arrived early, the lady that checked us in could see we were very tired and keen to get into our room, so she upgraded us which was very kind. The room was ok, basic. Good shower and nice shower amenities. The bad...My partner and I both work at the Four Seasons, and so we know what great service is and we expect it wherever we go. Even if the hotel is not 5 star, the service should ALWAYS be 5 star. The bathroom did not have a fan and the window could not be opened, so it got extremely steamy and soaked all the towels in the bathroom every time we showered. We had to shower with the bathroom door wide open. The housekeeping fiasco was ridiculous. When we stay in hotels we always choose to put the do not disturb sign on the door until we go out, at which point we call the front desk to ask for housekeeping service. We did this on the first day, and the front desk said yes it would be done. When we got back to our hotel room that evening, the room had not been serviced. I called the front desk and they apologized. The next day the exact same thing happened, I couldn’t believe it. The front desk gentleman said he would put me through to the manager. It went straight to voicemail, so I called back and the front desk guy suggested that tomorrow I should come down and tell the desk when we want service rather than calling (what on earth is the difference?!). A couple of days later, we left our room for the day at around 12.30pm and went by the desk to ask for service. The front desk guy gave us a rude look and said ‘we’ll try’. I asked what the problem was and he said housekeeping only runs until 12pm. I have stayed in tonnes of hotels and have NEVER experienced one where housekeeping finishes at 12pm. What a joke! But also, why on earth did nobody tell us that the first two times we called to complain our room hadn’t been serviced?! Later in our trip (we stayed for 7 days) our room was serviced twice without us asking AFTER 12pm, which was great, but does housekeeping finish at 12pm or not? Was the front desk agent just lying to us? The housekeeping lady (Asian lady with short brown hair) was quite frankly a nightmare. Our do not disturb sign was on one morning, I was stood in front of the mirror doing my hair, when suddenly I hear shouting through our door - ‘do you want service today? Do you want towels?’ I thought she couldn’t possibly be talking to us because why would a staff member shout through the door to a guest, especially if that guest had a do not disturb sign on the door? But the shouting carried on, so I opened the door and there she was. I looked at the do not disturb sign, looked back and her and said please can you come back later. She was completely oblivious.Another couple of times, we had the deadlock on (as we always do for safety) and she knocked once then opened the door STRAIGHT away (seriously, have these people received no training? What if we were undressed?) then shouted through the locked door asking if we wanted service. We were still asleep!!!The phone operator was terrible. Couldn’t answer basic questions and had to put us through to the front desk every time, even when we just requested towels. The operator seriously can’t request towels for us, they have to put us through to the front desk? She also answered the phone each time with ‘operator’. No name, no ‘good morning, how can I help’, nothing. Then she’d put us straight through to the desk without saying anything. Just terrible. This is really basic stuff that the staff clearly haven’t been trained on, or just can’t be bothered to make the effort. We called to ask for two bottles of water and were told we’d have to go to the desk for this, they would not deliver them. Really? The front desk staff were so unbelievably rude. We had seen a sign on the concierge desk saying we could purchase show tickets there, so we went down one evening around 7pm to find nobody at the concierge desk, so we went to the front desk. A gentleman there (didn’t get his name but he was a back guy with a bald head) asked what we wanted and we asked if concierge were around. His reply - ‘no. Why, what do you want?’ I said we were looking for tickets. He said ‘what tickets?’ I said show tickets. He looked at me like a was a complete idiot and said ‘why don’t you just get them at the box office?’ I could not believe it. I have NEVER been spoken to like that by a member of staff in a hotel. The staff at this hotel need some serious training on how to speak to and treat their guests. The only staff member I ever saw with a smile on their face was the lady who checked us in. We were not made to feel welcome whatsoever, and not only do they not go above and beyond to help you, they don’t even do the bare minimum. I’ve seen the manager’s replies to some of these reviews saying that this is not their standard and they always value their guests and have a high standard etc. But we were there for 7 days and saw absolutely no evidence of these high standards, so exactly what does the manager think his staff do to make the guests feel valued and welcomed? Shocking.

The outside and lobby are beautiful. The room itself was uninviting. The lighting was cold and dark. The room smelled strong of mildew. We were not impressed. My daughter locked herself in the closet accidently. Had we not been there to let her out, it would have been a big problem.

Stayed for four nights with my wife on our honeymoon, we arrived late following on from a train journey from Niagara Falls. The front desk staff were friendly and check in was a breeze. Our room on the 2nd floor faced the road, with all the associated noise that comes with visiting New York. And it was noisy!!!!The room itself was small ( you expect this for NY) but comfortable and suited our needs the bathroom was also pretty small but didn’t hamper us. It was clean and the housekeeping stay always friendly. All in all a comfortable stay in a great location next to Times Square, however if you want quiet stay this hotel is not for you.

You can't fault the location, take a right from the lobby and your in Times Square in 2 mins. It's the facilities that let it down.The lifts in the lobby, there are four of them, need replacing. During our stay upon arrival 2 out of four were operational which got really bad on departure when only one out of four worked and half the hotel wanted to check out!!Another small irritation was the 'resort fee' of $50 per room for our two night stay. Now nyc is amazing but in no way, shape or form is the gallivanting hotel a 'resort'.So, pay your money take your choice location is fabulous be prepared for less than 4* facilities!!

On 42nd street. Right on Broadway, near the M&M shop. Couldn’t get a better location.Room and bathroom small but clean, didn’t spend much time in the room as out exploring.All staff very helpful.I travelled with my 12 year old son and had a double room booked, not sure if it was my mistake or theirs, on arrival with out asking they got us a twin room.Can highly recommend

I was quite worried after the terrible comments I've read on tripadvisor just before my arrival (dirty, very small, wifi not working, no housekeeping, long queue for the elevator etc.). But, I was pleasantly surprised at the end. We stayed at a standard room and asked for a higher floor. It was quite clean; however, it is obvious that it needs some maintenance/renovation (there was iron burn stain on the chair, stains on the window shades, marble on top of the drawer was broken etc.). After spending that much money, one does not expect this type of flaws. The room itself was tiny but spacious enough to handle two suitcases. Be prepared for a very small bathroom though. The biggest negative side is that air conditioning is very very noisy. If you can't sleep with some noise, you should think twice! The location is great, though. It is easy to access everywhere. And, we had no problems with wifi. Overall, it was an okay experience.

Great hotel close to everything. Front desk are always very polite and friendly. Room is good, but next time I´ll book one with queen sizebed (double bed is narrow for 2 tall people). Bottle water for free (included in the hotel tax amenities). I recommend to stay there.

We knew the hotel had a moderate price for Times Square (about 200 USD before taxes). The location, the rooms, the cleanliness, and the staff were all great. But the wifi didn't work at all for any of our group or devices. In 2018, it's like running water: It's absolutely standard. The doors don't block sound and slam hard automatically, so expect to be woken up as your neighbors come and go.

Very central location, which is its major selling point. Room was supposed free upgrade, but it was still restricted. At least there was a side part to store cases. Safe provided. Breakfast in the attached Chinese restaurant was quite basic. Better value and quality close by in Times Square. All staff I dealt with were excellent.

We picked this hotel purely for the location. The hotel is off the main strip (about a 10 second walk!) so it isn’t too noisy and disruptive at night. Our room was a premium room so very spacious with a nice bathroom. Also, a fridge was included which was very useful.Housekeeping and staff were very friendly. I also used the gym which was fine, if a bit small (only 1 treadmill, bike and cross trainer). It wouldn’t be possible for more than a few people to use at any time. The only few bad points; loud outside in the morning (I think either deliveries or bin trucks?) but not the hotels fault. The breakfast was poor quality and a bit expensive for what it was. If you want an American breakfast, better to walk a few minutes to Juniors. Even though the room was decent, it was a bit tatty with broken furniture and some broken lights. However, the great location and lovely staff outway the few bad points and i’d happily stay again!

Just back from a 5 night stay at this hotel and had a fab time.We had a twin room which was perfectly adequate, plenty room for suitcases etc. Drawers and hanging space in wardrobe with iron and ironing board (handy but never used).Yes the bathroom is quite small but a quick shower etc and you're out!Aircon was a bit noisy to be fair but New York is noisy 24/7, earplugs might help.Staff were all very pleasant and the location is ideal, just off Times Square. I'm surprised at all the bad reviews as we loved our stay here and wouldn't think twice about staying here again.

We stayed at the Gallivant for 5 nights Aug/Sept, and ended up upgrading to a premium room (505) on arrival as my adult daughter and I didn’t want to share a bed. The room was fairly basic but clean and tidy, despite being a premium room I had to ask for a fridge to store my medication as there wasn’t one in the room when we arrived and it took a couple of requests to get the second bunk closed so my daughter wouldn’t bang her head if she woke in the night and wasn’t paying attention. That being said the beds were comfortable and We had no problems falling asleep. The TV kept losing the signal but as we were only really using the room as somewhere to shower and sleep it wasn’t a big deal, so I didn’t bother to report it.The only real bugbear for me was the elevators which seemed to take forever to get to the ground floor and only accommodated 7 people at a time, if you got to the lobby when others were waiting for the elevator you could find yourself waiting a while.In terms of the location you couldn’t ask for better, a minutes walk to the centre of Times Square and all that entails. A lovely central location which allowed us to access everything we had time to see and I would probably return purely for the convenience of knowing in advance how close the hotel is to Times Square.The staff we spoke to during our stay were polite, friendly and helpful, a real credit to the business.

I have stayed here a few times, and live this place! Great staff, nice clean rooms, and location. Again! Great staff! Look forward to my next visit! You are in Times Square, but just away from all the hustle and bustle to have best of both worlds! Great staff!

I booked and paid for 3 nights but was able to stay only 2 nights (my flight was cancelled). When I checked out, I asked to talked to the manager, Ben, and he kindly refunded me the night I didn't stay. So awesome!!! Thank you so much!!

Currently have 1 more night here (stayed for 4) yes the rooms are a little small but ideal for 2. We are in room 1003 and cannot fault it for the location, cleanliness and comfort. We have a small balcony at the back of the hotel and ideal for me as a smoker.Staff second to none, yes early hours there is rubbish outside waiting to be collected...hotel's fault? No. If you want a base, that is clean safe and central this is the place.

Nice, comfortable accommodations in a fantastic area of the city. Great area for restaurants and shows. It’s nothing fancy but for the price conscious this hotel is a good choice. Clean and convenient!

We stayed at this hotel for a week at the end of May. I was very nervous of staying reading previous reviews but I have to say we had a good stay. The hotel is tired and could do with a bit of TLC but for the money we paid and the fact we literally only slept there as were out exploring NYC all day, we were satisfied. Staff were attentive and friendly, the rooms were very clean and had everything we needed. The location is fantastic as you are right in the middle of it all. The noise was bearable for us as I think we were at the back, NYC is a noisy city there is no way to escape it. Considering there is a firehouse at the end of the street we only heard them a handful of times. If like us you just want somewhere to sleep and don't want to pay a fortune for a hotel, I would recommend this hotel. if you are going to spend considerable time in your room, I would not.

Got to this hotel to be shown to a room on the 15th floor. The air conditioning did not work the TV was not even straight in the room. And to top it all off the bedding was covered in stains. For the money I paid I expected more. Won’t be going back to this hotel anytime soon

Good location, but piles of garbage in the main entrance of the hotel, there were flies/bugs/termites all over the room, mainly in the bathroom, so they gave me a much bigger room, so I thought it was as a courtesy for the flies inconvenient, but then they charged me the difference and now I'm trying to get the Assistant General Manager Ben Elie to get the refund and he has not responded to any of my emails and phones calls. This is serious and I have to escalate this.

Booked this hotel via British Airways as a long weekend break, chosen for its location Close to Times Square and the bargain price I got the whole deal for. Arrived at 1pm which is two hours early for check in but the staff still gave us our room key which was perfect after a long day and flight from London. I must say at this point there was a mix up with my hotel reservation that was not the fault of the hotels but was sorted by the staff with ease. We had room 1121 on 11th floor looking out the front of the hotel. Small room but had everything you need including coffee maker(free bottled water at reception) room did smell damp at first but putting air conditioning on sorted it. For the time you stay in your room it’s perfect ! Rooms cleaned by maids perfectly. Would come back without question.

This hotel was a total disaster. I'm not sure how it earns a four star rating. Apart from the location the hotel has little to offer. After checking into two rooms, we found that the one room had not been properly cleaned (stuff in the bin), the bed was ruffled and the TV remote lying on the bed - so it appeared that someone had just used the room and had to leave in a hurry (maybe a staff member). We complained about this and were moved to another room. Thereafter we discovered that there was a hole on one side of the mattress in the second room. When we complained about this we were told that there were no more rooms available. As it was very late - after 10pm - we stayed the night and checked out the next day.

Picked hotel for its location to Times Square. Visited during heat wave for one night and air conditioner in room was so noisy it was like having a jet engine in the room. So noisy it prevented us from getting any sleep.

We stayed in the family room at this hotel for 5 nights. Great location, room was big enough for the 5 of us and had a huge bathroom. Great location, fairly quiet considering where the hotel is situated. Would recommend and would stay again.

#Great location, walking distance to Times Square, Friendly Staff, Clean Bedding & Amenities unfortunately though a very damp room which you could smell on entering! The damp was obvious to see on the bedroom ceiling & bathroom ceiling & the Air Conditioning Unit was noisy & dirty. Shame as it was a great holiday!

First of all yes the rooms are small and air conditioning is outdated and noisy, however it does cool the room well. The lifts are small and slow but hey what’s the rush??We was on floor 14 and the view was the back of another building but I did not come all the way to New York to look out of a window! The major criticisms is we were here Thursday to Monday and on Saturday and Sunday we put the sign on door asking for room to be cleaned and this was just ignored.

We enjoyed a fabulous 10 night stay at The Gallivant in August 2018. The hotel is less than a minute’s walk from all the action of Times Square & many of the main NYC attractions.The hotel is clean & welcoming & all the staff were friendly & attentive.

Room was small and nothing like the pictures they show. The view (from 2nd floor) was of a roof right outside the window covered in blue tarpaulin. Staff very noisy in the mornings, with loud talking. No ink in the printer in the 'business centre'. They didn't ask if i enjoyed my stay when i checked out.

This hotel has an excellent location bang in the centre of New York.The staff are very friendly and it feels safe and homely. It is a two minute walk from Times Square and is very close to a wide range of fabulous restaurants. It also contains a gym and a conference room.For family’s the room is large with a bunk bed and two double beds. The bathroom is clean and tidy as it is in other rooms. The only criticism is that the hotel is next to a fire station leading to some noises here and there but it is very easy to get to sleep. The lifts are slightly slow but altogether the hotel is one I highly recommend for a family or a visit of however many there are.

The staff at the Gallivant (shout out to SUNY) were tremendous. I was traveling with my niece on her first trip away from home and they could not have been more accommodating. We stayed in a double bed room which was huge and very cool style. We were treated like both royalty and family all at once! Location perfect for Broadway!

I've been lodged in this horrible hotel for 5 night in which none of them I have been able to sleep because of the incredible NOISE of the air conditioning machines at the back part of the building my room was facing and the one I had in my own room.It's been a disgusting nightmare to be there because of the small, old, deformed BED. Not to talk about the SIZE of the room & bathroom. As an example, the bathroom was so small that to get into the shower you had to twist and the shower glass was so small that water flooded it every time you had a shower. The ROOM was as small as the bathroom, you know, to open our two suitcases we had to redecorate the room moving the chair and the side table !!! my room was in the back part of the hotel...of course, with no views....and it was on the fifth floor... Lucky me!!!! because the hotel has three ELEVATORS.... one of which has been broken since May or so (according to another guest who was there and complained through this web too) and the second elevator has been used to carry the towels up and down so none of the guests have been able to use it .. so I've used the STAIRS every time I went to my room. Our last day after 15 minutes waiting with our luggage to check out at 12:00, we begged the cleaner to let us put our luggage in the elevator which was used to carry the towels and we had to use the stairs to get down to the lobby. READ THE SECOND PART!!

The hotel is very clean and nice. The location wins all the disadvantages that they have. The hotel itself is very old but they try to keep it nice. Before booking I read a lot of reviews that people had problems with elevators but when we stayed the elevators were pretty fast and we never had to wait long. The rooms and bathroom are very very small as expected but still yet the place is good to stay just to sleep after long New York walks. The only issue we had with the hotel when we asked for fresh towels 4 times and still nobody brought us. We called in the morning again twice and finally we got our towels, also I think Front desk could be more friendlier and provide better service.

I visited NYC for a quick meeting and needed a reasonably-priced hotel, just for the night. I saw the term “crash pad” in one of the descriptions of this place, so I looked it up and saw that it referred to a quick place to get a good night’s sleep in a swanky area. This place was fantastic! A small bedroom and bathroom, but, it was just me and just enough. It was beautifully-decorated, I loved the wood floors, fancy wall paper (pictured) and upgraded bathroom features with marble tiles (all the way up the walls) and updated vanity and shower. I can’t wait to come back with my husband. There was a safe, ironing board and iron, a desk, a dresser, wall-mounted flat screen, cool features and a comfortable bed. That’s all I needed! - Jonesie

The rooms are very small and so does the beds, the furniture have seen better days, we also have issues with the toilet door. Thera are many rooms facing inside the building that will not have a lot of natural light. The elevator in the morning is mission impossible!

This hotel was a joke, the room I was allocated was the size of a caravan, you had to reverse in to the toilet to be able to shut the door, air conditioning is old and noisy and the lifts are a joke, only one working which accommodates max 7 people so this leaves you standing in unairconditioned corridors waiting for sometime 20 minutes! Definitely would not return to this establishment!

Fantastic location and very friendly staff. Couldn't have picked a better spot for the few days we were there. Room was small, but clean. Pack your patience for dealing with the slow elevators!! Anyway, it was great!

We stayed here from 22nd - 26th August, a family of 4 including 2 teenagers. We had a premium room which meant we had 1 king size bed and bunk beds. The room was clean and our bed was very comfortable. The hotel though is old and tired and needs new showers and a new lift. The lift kept breaking down purely because it’s so old. I cannot fault the staff, they were friendly and helpful. I would stay here for convenience to Times Square for a night or two. It is more a 3 star than a 4 star hotel. There is a good pub next door called Hurleys, good food and atmosphere. Top Tip: don’t rely on the restaurants in and around Times Square- they are way more expensive than restaurants and bars a few blocks away, such as the Hells Kitchen district or China town where you will find really good food and it is inexpensive.

Good family base but it is a tired hotel. You are paying a premium for its location and my advise is dont stay in Times Square area as it’s unlikely to be where you want to be if you are exploring NYC. The hotel lifts are very slow and the staircase steep and narrow. Facilities are limited too.

Nefarious, that nobody comes to this hotel, persobal reception incredibly impolite, hotel manager arrogant, the 3 elevators, one broken and another used to raise and lower towels, ie a lift paea the entire hotel in the middle of August.Outraged is little, over at the time of putting a claim the head of reception, who speaks Spanish, I face and I drift to the manager who only knows English so he does not understand and this guy comes screaming at the clients that we were asking for a explixacion of what happened and see when it was going to solve.In the end they give us an email to put a claim, but I think it will not help.Bad service, bad rooms (small and noisy), .........

Friendly staff, decent place in Manhatten, small room but comfy, A/C somewhat noisy, very slow rattling elevator, close to Times Square and subway, everything is expensive in NY and so even this hotel is not actually cheap

This hotel is perfectly located in the middle of Broadway area. The hotel was quiet and the rooms were clean and had everything you might need. The staff was courteous, personable and professional. Would definitely visit again!

The room is small but was clean. Our only issue is that the bathroom is tiny so you are forced into the main room to get ready but is dimly lit. There isn't a door or curtain on the shower so water sprays everywhere! If you are a heavy set person.. you will find it a tough place to get ready in the morning.

We were very disappointed in this hotel. The rooms were extra small - and the photos were quite misleading. Some of the staff was courteous and helpful, but the front desk in the evening left a lot to be desired. A lot of things did not work in the room - internet, phone, light in bathroom. My husband left a pair of shoes. The manager found them and set them aside at the front desk, but did not make sure that the staff on duty knew where they were. A very stressful 15 minutes was spent before they were located, and the front desk person was quite rude.

Location is great.. close to all the tourist spots. However had the worst nights sleep. Air con could not be controlled so room was freezing, called down to reception who were no help. Furthermore it was the loudest AC unit ever.. it my frustration in the middle of the night having been so tired from the flight I searched around for a button to switch it off and the unit and it the areas around it.. I even pulled out an old keycard covered in dust and hair. Wouldn’t stay here again.

We stayed at the Gallivant for 3 nights with our 3 children aged 14,12,9. The family room Was plenty big enough for the 5 of us and was very clean. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The location is great - you are a minutes walk fro m&m world.

So................ I contacted Ben the Hotel Manager who often comments on here, with some questions.......no answer, I sent another email prior to checking in............no answer. I have sent a third email questioning an additional charge to my credit card, even though Booking.com states clearly that all taxes are included (including city tax) and still no answer, I also emailed the hotel directly.................guess what...no answer!!!This is a great shame, as apart from agreeing with comments regarding room size being on the small size, the hotel was okay. Great location, clean rooms , and most staff were friendly(not all) . However, even though i asked at check out if there were any other charges and was told no, they rob my credit card, this is unacceptable, regardless of the amount, which could have been much higher, you have no control of what they decide to steal from you.I rarely give poor reviews, but this has left me with a bitter taste. I have also contacted Booking.com as they are also misleading customers regarding fees.I would never recommend this hotel due to this now. Be aware, they are happy to take your money without prior knowledge, and totally ignore any form of communication.

Front desk staff are rather abrupt and the rooms are small, but this is New York after all. The concierge and bell hops are friendly and helpful, which makes the contrast with reception operatives stand out. Rooms small and, as with many US hotels, the aircon is about 50 years old and makes a hell of a noise, but it's clean, comfortable and makes a great base for exploring. I like the reverse side of the do not disturb tags, which get straight to the point by saying "I'm in New York, why would I be in my room?"

Hotel looks very little like promo pics on web..ripped seats in reception, no bar facilities ,smallest hotel room we have ever stayed in, and the two male reception staff were rude and dismissive. However, housekeeping staff were great, as room was always kept clean with fresh towels. Very disappointing hotel !

I accidentally booked another hotel for the wrong dates, so I went with this hotel last minute.. Great location. Great price.
