Only stayed 1 night but walked to/from 2 Broadway shows, Times Square, restaurants, etc. I've stayed in several NYC hotels so wasn't surprised at the small room size despite it being a premier room. Couldn't check in because computers were down, but went to lunch next door instead which was wonderful. When entering the room, there was a fake eyelash on the floor and the kids were mortified. I just kicked it out the door. Bedding is white and shows everything but I still felt confident it was clean. Toilet was running which didn't bother me, but did the kids so even though it was 11 PM it got fixed by a pleasant guy. If you were a person who stayed in their room 24/7, I would say this is not the place for you. But, we were there less than 10 hours which includes sleep and it was fine. Just need a place to nod off in the city that never sleeps! Parked across the street at a public place and got a hotel rate which I was about $45 for 24 hours.

I stayed here for 2 nights with my 11 year old son. The location is GREAT. Yes the room was small, but this is NYC, so no surprises there. The check in was fast, the room was quiet and the A/C worked well in the 95 degree weather. Not fancy, but we weren't lacking in anything and I travel about 10x/year, so I think the really negative reviews of this place are harsh. Only 2 elevators, but since we were on the 5th floor we took the stairs a lot. For the price and location, I would definitely stay here again.

Although the room was on the small side, it was enough space for two people. It was very clean, had a nice TV, and a comfortable bed. The location was great because it was so close to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. There were only two issues that could have made the stay better. First, there was no mini fridge, which made bringing dinner leftovers back to the room difficult. Second, the shower only had half of a glass door that didn’t cover the whole shower (I have been seeing these in a lot of hotels lately) so the bathroom flooded every time one of us took a shower.

Just got back from staying at the Gallivant for 5 nights. I went with my girlfriend and we were both very impressed with the hotel. Firstly the location is superb. It literally took about 3 minutes from our bed to walk to Times Square! Our room was fairly small but perfectly adequate for 2 people. The cleaners did a great job and supplied clean towels every day as well as making the bed and cleaning the rest of the room. There was a big wall mounted tv, a nice desk with chair, wardrobe and in the bathroom a really nice shower with different settings like 'massage'. Something we're not used to in the UK! All the staff were very pleasant to deal with and every bit of the hotel we saw was clean and had a quality feel to it. My only criticism would be our particular room didn't have a very good view but in a hotel with so many rooms they obviously can't guarantee a decent view with all of them! We love New York and will definitely be returning soon. When we do the Gallivant will definitely be a hotel we consider staying in again.

We had to change rooms 3 times, the first one has mould on the wall, the 2nd stunk of marijuana & the 3rd wasn’t too bad but holes in the bed sheets!! This wasn’t what I’d expect for $200!!’ Location is prefect for Times Square. The receptionist was very helpful in the whole situation but sadly I wouldn’t recommend this hotel to anyone.

Good location . Literally in Times Square . 10 minute walk to Central Park . Close to open top tour bus stop. So location wise this is exactly what you want . Room was ok size . On 5 th floor . Bathroom small but functional . Room was quite dirty - used tea bag on floor , hairs and dust on floor and mouldy fruit and dust behind air con unit . Bedding was clean but pillows were stained underneath pillow cases . Bed was comfy. Bathroom and towels were clean. Safety deposit box in wardrobe . Coffee machine in room . Ice and iced water on some floors which we used a lot . You can leave luggage safely for $2 per item .Overall it was ok for what we wanted - bed and a shower but it’s not luxury and needs a bit of a clean. Having said that I would try it again for the price and location .

Professional staff and well organized. The rooms are clean and the a/c worked great which is always a challenge in these older buildings. The location is amazing, only a few steps away from Time Square. If you want value for your money, this is the place.

Overall great stay for 4 days in the end of July. Would have been awesome to have a mini fridge in the room. The room has everything else needed though. Didn’t hear any overally excessive noise from Times Square.

Recommend by BA - would think twice about BA recommendations again. Rooms are very small. We had two large cases that the room simply couldn’t accommodate. The bathrooms are even smaller and the two rooms that we had between us had doors that wouldn’t close. The air conditioning was old and in need of replacing and was very noisy during the night but essential to maintain a decent temperature. The doors to the rooms allowed huge amounts of noise pollution from noisy guests allowing doors to slam at stupid hours of the night. The location is great and we only really needed the rooms to sleep in but we were discouraged to spend time in the rooms because of the size and the noisy air con!Wouldn’t stay here again.

The hotel location is perfect & our double room was great. Yes a little small but if you’re anything like us you’re out all day enjoying the sights so literally only need it to sleep.Room was modern & very clean, maids made the bed & fresh towels every day. We had a light dripping water over the shower our first day, reported it & it was fixed by the end of the same day. My partner arranged surprise flowers & champagne as it was my birthday & the hotel had them ready in my room for check in.Only 4 stars due to lack of communication over room tax - in check in got told they hold a ‘deposit’ on my card & it goes back on at end of the stay. Then check my bank a few days later to see it is actually the room tax gone out. Double check with reception again to be told it is still a deposit & not the tax so me & my friend purposely keep cash for the end of the stay to pay it. Low & behold at checkout the money taken out of my bank WAS the room tax & didnt have to save the cash after all!

Friendly staff, great location, will definitely go back! More than friendly and accommodating,right in the middle of everything, can not wait to revisit, will definitely book at the Gallivant again :)

I was charged extra $28.50 / room / night (we booked two rooms for 5 days, unfortunately) at checkout, a fee that was not included in the advertised price. This practice should be illegal. We were not paying attention to this fee (should we?), but it doesn’t make it less of a scam. $230 less on my credit card will be a “nice” memory of our trip to New York and this hotel.

Positives: The location is really good for exploring Midtown by foot, with lots of shops and restaurants nearby. This is especially true if you have tickets for a show. We went to two different productions and were at the theatres in around 5 mins. In the room, the shower was good and the bed was comfy. The hotel also lets you print things like tickets and boarding passes for free, which was good.Negatives: The room was pretty pokey; the sort of room where the doors always won't open fully. It was very hot in the room and the air conditioning was very loud and too strong. The main issue we had with the hotel was the hidden charges. Booking.com gave us an estimated cost after all the odd taxes American hotels charge but the amount we were charged was in excess of £50 more than that. We could have stomached this if they then didn't charge us another £30+ after we checked out for an unknown reason. We searched their website to find possible reasons for this but couldn't find anything. When I contacted them twice for an explanation, there was no reply. It left an unfortunate sour taste in the mouth after an amazing trip to New York.Conclusion: The hotel is ok but you could get better and cheaper. We thought a Times Square location was important but New York is so easy to walk, cycle or subway around that we would recommend staying elsewhere.

We honestly had a wonderful experience at The Gallivant mid July. As I've glanced at some reviews, I can understand some of the frustration. However our stay was really great! OK, small rooms with only a shower but this was more than adequate for our two night stop over in the Big Apple. The room was modern and clean. I planned our trip carefully, and confirmed and rechecked details, especially as I'd requested that the original booking (through the airline) for a double room was re-booked for twin beds (having to share with a teenager). We were in Times Square and near all of the sites we wanted to visit as well as the Metro. We had a Fantastic time and using The Gallivant as our base was excellent.

We arrived at 6pm on 22nd July 2018 and had a 2 and a 1/2 hour wait to check into our 2 rooms. We had no access to water, we were left to guard our own luggage. We were promised check-in within an hour. The cause was they only had one accessible room left, yet our rooms had been booked in March. Also they had given the previous guest a late checkout for medical issues? Late checkout until when? According to the Hotel check in is 3pm. We arrived at 6pm with our unwell disabled adult son who had to lie on the hotel couch in the foyer and go to sleep while waiting 2 and a 1/2 hours for his room. Was he not a guest too?We had to ask for water of which we were given 2 bottles to share between 3 people over the 2 and a 1/2 hour period.We finally asked to speak to the Manager who guaranteed our rooms within 10 minutes. This turned into 42 minutes.There are no guarantees in this hotel. No promises are kept.We finally got into our rooms at 8.30pm to find thst the accessible room with roll in shower was not a true roll in shower. It did not allow my son to turn his wheelchair and shut the door to be able to have privacy when going to the toilet.If he had a shower his wheelchair got wet. There was no shower stool/chair and there was a huge stone, pointed basin where if my son fell he would have seriously injured himself.The lip into th he bathroom at the doorway was inaccessible for him to access in his wheelchair. The hotel engineer came up with a piece of raw timber to put at the entrance of the bathroom to help my son access it for the 5 nights we unfortunately had to stay here.The bathroom in the other room was built for a tiny house. You sit on the toilet and your knees basically touch the wall in front of you.The staff do not care. The manager does not care. The lift could only just fit our sons wheelchair in It, the doorway is so narrow and the inside of the lifts not much bigger. The hotel hallways are so narrow my son had difficulty manoeuvring his wheelchair into his room.Give this hotel a miss. It is noisy and old and the rooms are in need of maintenance. And they are so tiny. It's only positive is its position to Times Square.

Stayed at The Gallivant for three nights. Party of four in two double rooms. First night we had one single room I guess but they sorted that out next day. Rooms small but clean and well equipped, nice shower! Friendly staff everywhere ready to help you with all your needs (thanks Suny!). Location excellent for exploring NY.

Stayed for our 10 year anniversary and it was amazing! Convenient to Times Square and all the other attractions. Staff was super especially Suny at the front desk. Will always stay here when we come back.

Tidy rooms with good decor that is urban chic and modern. Good coffee maker in room. Compact rooms as you would expect for central location. Brilliant base for a stay in NY. Only negative was that floors could have been cleaned better. Tissue just under bed (easily seen)was there when we arrived and still there when we left and hairball in shower on arrival which we put in bin. Bedding and everything else spotlessly clean. Hotel staff really friendly and helpful and recommend airport shuttle booked in lobby. Would definitely stay there again.

We arrived to find our booking for a room with twin beds had been ignored. The male receptionist said that our travel agent was to blame. We had to share a double bed in a dreadful 3rd floor room overlooking a dark central courtyard with a tarp covering something beneath. The aircon was ancient and we had to get someone to turn it on manually because the wall control was broken. When we did get a room with twin beds, after sharing a double for two nights, the windows were so dirty we couldn't see the view (if there was one) and the bathroom extractor fan was broken (leaving the place hot, damp and humid (to match the July weather). We informed reception that the extractor fan was out of order. We waited patiently for it to be repaired. Only when I asked about it at reception again three days later, was I informed that it could not be fixed. Our third room, promised to be an upgrade, was even worse! Even less space and a bathroom which flooded every time someone had a shower. Do not book this hotel. We changed hotels at the earliest opportunity.

First night horrible...stranger get into the room the 1st night at 1200 am. I was with my parents, sister and my daughter in a family vacation. Imagine our worry, if somebody came again to my room. This night the manager was not available in the hotel. The only was he did was change the room keys and don't offer us any amenities or another free night or don't charge this night. We was there worry , if somebody came again or took our things. Our safety was ruin and our vacation too. Ufff...Shame on you...

The lobby is modern and inviting ! Service was amazing and location is perfect ! I will recommend this hotel to everyone I know ! A big Thank You to Ben, he’s running a great hotel ! Looking forward to my next stay !

The pictures are very deceiving. I’d rather had staid in the lobby which looked better than the rest of the hotel. We walked in the room which was the size of a closet. I couldn’t even get in the bathroom and close the door. I’m 5’6” and 126lbs mind you. My fiancé went straight down to talk to someone and they immediately gave us another room which was slightly bigger but no better. Then when I went to take a shower there were bugs everywhere. There was also no water in the hotel. When we asked where we could get water, my fiancé was sent on a hunt through the hotel. He came back 30 minuets later with soda. Apparently there’s a drought. Both rooms were dirty. It’s upsetting to pay almost $500 for two nights of complete disappointment. I’d post pictures if it was big enough for me to actually get one! The Novotel was less and much better. I think I’ll stay there again instead.

We stayed at the gallivant for 6 nights at the end of may/early June. It is an idealLocation, in walking distance of so many amazing bars and restaurants, really close to the subway. There are a few reviews about the rooms being small and they are fairly small, but there’s definitely enough room for 2! Rooms were clean, maids were friendly and reception were also very friendly. Definitely worth a stay.

I never write reviews, but this place was horrible! The staff was very rude, screamed at us when we questioned the bill which was much higher than what we were told over the phone and taxes being charged at a higher rate than the hotel across the street. The rooms were horrible, bed was very uncomfortable, I'm 6'0" and I was hanging off the bed. I heard everything outside the hotel room and next door. For the bathroom, how the hell does this place not get shut down, a pipe for the shower coming out of the what without anything covering the hole, and water leaking in.

A good room to stay no longer days, clean, close to Broadway and Times Square, close to subway and easy to walk to some markets, restaurants. The service is very good, they help whatever you need.....

We took a trip with friends who booked this hotel. To be courteous to our friends was the only reason we did not leave after we looked at the elevator! The elevator fits 4 people comfortably and maybe a suitcase??? The halls have the appearance of a cruise ship, except the cruise ship halls are wider. After leaving my tiny room, I returned to have a visitor on the floor (Mr. Cockroach) waiting as I opened my door to walk in. He was quite healthy so I know I had been assigned his room. The hotel location is good. I did not eat anything provided by this hotel for obvious reasons. Do not be fooled by the website or sale prices. It is budget for a reason. Never again for me; Friends or not.

Stayed June 22nd- July 1, arrived at hotel early room not ready said we will explore few hrs but can you text us when available, no text 3pm we rock up still nothing, ok we wait, cant connect wifi asked Jose if he could assist still no good, asked for assistance again Jose's response was he hasn't got time to waste in a lazy ignorant arrogant manner, mind you I haven't checked in or paid for accommodation, along comes a lady named Yanneck (sorry if not spelt correctly), a person that knows how to treat customers in a friendly & professional manner that upgraded us & followed up several times if things were ok, room clean comfortable, staff friendly (Jose a waste of space at front desk, brutal but honest opinion), location in the heart of it, I would stay there again... Have a great day people

Things I have learned recently ... if there is no size of the room on their website or link (if you book through affiliated sites) DON'T BOOK IT! My daughter and I were in a double room. So small that we couldn't open our luggage at the same time. I requested a move which was done immediately and we were moved into an equally teeny-tiny twin room. We had a plumbing issue and were again moved to a third room. A little larger and we could open both suitcases which is a great bonus!Honestly I don't know whether this is a standard for NYC hotels. It's an older style building so it might be. The hotel itself is in a great spot for Times Square, tours and restaurants and just getting back to the room for a second I'm in NYC so what am I doing in the room anyway?The staff are very helpful and polite. The rooms were spotless and the cleaning staff were super friendly and efficient.

It seems that most of NY doesn’t heat or cool their halls or elevators. This as true at the Gallivant, but who hangs out in the halls? The room was small, but effective use of space made it comfortable. Helping, was the responsive air conditioning. The smallish bathroom was beautiful and charming. Staff was excellent.

The Gallivant Times Square was in a great location to visit NYC. Right in the heart of all the action down town. Literally a 3 min walk to Times Square. Service was great, room was small but clean. Great value compared to most in the area.

There is absolutely no early check-in even if you want to pay which is the worst if you are traveling from the opposite side of the country. The room was a small closet. No room to do anything but get off the bed to take 3 steps to this restroom which was the size of a toilet room. Body mirror is behind the entrance door which gives you literally 12inch/1foot of space distance to see yourself. No counter space!l and the worst thin sharp toilet paper ever!!!

Very good location.Elevator slow and always busy.Beds small (twin bed room).External noise heard loudly in the room (14th floor!)Cleaning services missed my room on one occasion completely, when I complained to the front desn I was told this is normal as cleaning services work around the clock (not so !)

I stayed at the hotel from Thursday to Sunday. Check in was effortless and housekeeping was good. The single room was spacious and clean. My only issue was the shower which when turned on wet the bathroom floor. The big selling point is that the hotel is centrally located to Broadway theaters and Times Square, I was able to walk to my destinations the whole time here.

Overall good experience at this hotel. Located right in time square. Super convenient to mid-town and trains. We had 3 kids so loved the bunk beds in our room as it was spacious and comfortable for us. Room was super clean and overall very happy with the condition. I would stay there again.

Folks if you are looking for a hotel in Times Square try The Gallivant. First Trisha was there to check us in. She was really friendly made great suggestions of things we could do for fun and shows on Broadway to see. We were greeted every morning with a smile from Trisha inquiring if we needed anything she made us feel like family. The Gallivant was just steps from Times Square and Broadway shows. The beds had us inquiring about what mattress they used we slept wonderful. The Gallivant is close to restaurants and even fast food, street vendors are there also. Again we give praise to Trisha ‘s excellent customer service.

Stayed for for one week early December. Location was amazing! So close to Times Square, good location for Rockafeller centre, Central Park, Shopping etc. Rooms were lovely and clean. The room we had was a good size. Even thought right beside the lift couldn’t hear much noise. Excellent location and value. Highly recommend it.

My husband and I stayed for one night on a Saturday and were completely satisfied. The lobby is modern, and the staff is welcoming. Our room was fresh and clean with a double bed. The amenities and décor were modern, and the linens, and towels were fresh and new. There were two windows overlooking the street which made the room seem bigger than it was. For international travelers, there is an adapter in the room. I just bought one to travel outside the U.S., and I thought that was nice of them to provide considering Times Square is a magnet for people from all over the world. Like every other older, but remodeled hotel in Manhattan, the elevators are slow and small. It's the same everywhere. One tip provided by the hotel that I learned too late is that the Icon Port Park garage located at 235 West 48th has the best rates. The location so close to Times Square was perfect! I will definitely stay there again!

I read the reviews before I arrived which bothered me a little I am here at The Gallivant at the moment and the people who have given a bad review must be in a different hotel to me as I’ve only move things to say about our week here it our last night tonight stayed for 7 yes it’s a bit noisy BUT your in New York !! Rooms are lovely cleaned everyday beds made and changed toiletries fresh everyday the little coffee machine in the room is ideal WiFi all good !! Nice tv in the room plenty of channels !! Bathroom is small but it’s fine for what you do in it !! There is a hair dryer and a safe in the room overall a great hotel and we will recommend it to people !! And we will return thank you to ALL the staff for a lovely stay !!

Lovely clean rooms. Excellent comfortable bedding! Convenient location. We had 5 adults traveling together so we needed a large family room. This hotel was a great find. We were not dissapointed. The floor space was roomy enough to handle all of our luggage also.

Terrible service, terrible room. Room only has hot water, no cold or warm water, purely hot. No blow dryer no body wash. Staff was unfriendly. Never recommend this hotel. It’s the worst hotel experience in my life.

was there for a week hotel if fine and clean good central location to time square we has a few problems we got stuck in the lift it was a bit off experience but there were on the ball got every one out in 15 min no problem .There was a lady in the reception was not very present or welcoming.Which what the charge you they over charge us pre room for room tax and other things and when we left they took £50 out off my card for what i never got a reply as yet how we found out thay over charge for the room was when i ask about the £50 taken out the seen it and refund that 7 days later ,i have sent 11 email about this and never got a reply i sent a email to the manager also and no reply also on the plus side we had a good week there in new york .

Top location in Times square, near Irish pub and some nice restaurants. Ideal for a short city trip, with Central park, pubs, restaurants nearby, and the High line not far away. Quiet room despite the activity outside, but a bit expensive. No particular extra value in the room. Bathroom and shower a bit narrow.

It is very well located and the staff very friendly and professional. Good internet and the gym is good enough to distress. Rooms are quite small at least for a family of four and the amenities are not at all state of the art but livable.

Disappointed, mattresses too soft. Water was brown when first turned on. The upper bunk on the bunk bed was broken. Luckily we didn't need it. The ice/water machine on our floor was not working and it was 95 degrees when we visited.

Love the uniqueness of the hotel, the location in Broadway. However the room was small.. and also the bathroom is tiny. The Japanese Chinese Restaurant was great.. great food and friendly servers. Love the place

I wouldn’t ever recommend anyone to stay stay at this hotel.We paid everything upfront however the receptionist demanded extra 28.65 per night.When questioned as to why, he replied “pay or leave”Could not believe it. When refused to pay, he called the security.Worse experience ever.Beside that, the room was very small, stinky, no minibar for cold drinks and extremely loud.I would not ever stay again for whatever reason

I was at the gallivant for my daughters 21st birthday treat. Room was Very small , drawers didn’t open because of air conditioning unit. No hanging space had to live out of suitcase (first time ever). Air conditioning unit was very noisy and only worked on full. So had to switch it off at night and if got very hot. On arrival we were told we had be moved to a better room( had booked a queen room) 2 single beds. two of the lifts were directly outside the room door and one at the side very noisy at times. It was very clean and staff were helpful. Iv stayed in New York before rooms are small but this was extreme and a bit dated. Foyer looked as if it had been refurbished. Great location but wouldn’t book this hotel again.

There's nothing particularly wrong about this hotel. But nothing very positive either, and given the competition available + the pricing they charge, it's hard to see myself using this again. Rooms are VERY spartan in terms of their accomodations. Small, mediocre bed, old tech. Only thing in its favor is its location which is really good for tourists.
every thing was perfect, the hotel is well located just close to times square , and the staff friendly. the comfort is fine. we recommend this hotel and We will come there again.our stay was perfect,

I have never been this disappointed and regretful in my whole life. 0 value for money, sleepless nights, ants in rooms, no air conditioning, small rooms... the only thing good about this place is the proximity to most touristic sites in Manhattan. I would never recommend it to anyone.

My wife and I had the honour to stay at the Gallivant for 4 nights! The Gallivant is centrally located near Times Square (about 4 minutes by leisurely stroll), and right across the Walter Kerr Theatre where Bruce Springsteen on Broadway is playing. We found the hotel clean, quiet and comfortable. The staff are very friendly, with everyone always smiling. A BIG shoutout to Antonio on the front desk for his music trivia and recommendation on Ray’s Pizza. Antonio certainly helped make this trip a bit more memorable. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to NYC!

Its location is just perfect. Right next to Times Square. Otherwise everything is average. The receptionist Antonio was helpful, room was small, price is high for what it offers. Photos in the internet do not really correspond to the rooms. In our room there was no cold water -unbelievable but true...nevertheless they changed our room immediately.

This hotel is centrally located to a lot of NYC highlights.....the theaters, Time Square, restaurants, and Central Park, to name a few. No fee in keeping our bags prior to our stay, but $2/bag for keeping it after we checked out. This hotel was so convenient to everything we wanted to do. We were allowed one additional hour for late check out.

Second time I’ve stayed at The Gallivant. Here’s the major pro - the interiors are clean and the rates (for a not-divey NY hotel) are affordable. If you like the bustle of Times Square like I do, it’s also a great location. There were some little things, though. The bathroom is so tiny. Makes it hard to get ready in there and don’t even think about shaving your legs. The guy who checked me in was a turd - he made a massively sexist joke to me and I was deeply offended. And my room was humid in the mornings. I don’t know why. It would be lovely and cold (how I like it) in the afternoons and evenings, but humid when I woke up. And something to keep in mind if this would bother you - there is an NYFD house around the corner, so I heard some sirens.

I can’t completely fault this hotel as the room was clean, small and basic but perfect for what you need and the location is brilliant. HOWEVER, we opted to prepay our city taxes to prevent any unexpected spends whilst enjoying or time in NYC.Unfortunately I was gutted to discover a further payment was taken from my bank 2 days AFTER checking out of the hotel. And to make matters worse, the phones conveintly weren’t working and the email response is abysmal, my emails are now being IGNORED as I have proof of pre paying my taxes. Feel so upset that my trip in NYC had to be tainted by the unhelpful rude and greedy staff in charge of customer service! Would of never written a bad review about this hotel but unfortunately customer service is just as important as a ‘clean room’ and I’m disgusted. WOULD NOT stay here again neither reccomend!!

The hotel asks for $50 for bottled water and WiFi. Where in the world do they charge $50 for these things. Most people don’t even need WiFi and even if you don’t drink the water, use the WiFi or the fitness center (which is included in every hotel I’ve ever stayed at in the world), they still charge you! Unbelievably bad idea. And I’ve seen other people post that they didn’t get the ‘unused’ money refunded. The resort fee is actually $25 dollars, but the hotel takes $50 and forgets to give back the rest. So dishonest!

This was our first visit to the hotel since its rebrand as The Gallivant. Rooms are well decorated and very clean, and we paid a good rate for the room. The location is ideal for tourists as you can easily walk to Times Square in just seconds, and Broadway shows are within a block or so. This is our go to hotel when we are in New York.

Horrible customer service. Reserved family room and when checked in wasn’t available. Gave us 2 separate rooms and were VERY small. Asked for extra pillows and were told no housekeeping at night so can’t bring them up. Sent husband down and waited 45 min to be told we can have only 1. Just a rude experience all around.

Clean, Close and Efficient for those who will be out in the City. Rooms are cozy and clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is easy for Times Square and transportation to everything else.

The phone didn't work, and never was fix. I can tolerated that, but the fact that one of the two beds were that damage that I did feel every iron in my back and the manager only said " sorry in have no more beds to replace it ", this can't be tolerated. No service, no excuses, no credit. Just pay and leave. Be aware, is incredible. Is not wifi, was a complete nigthmare suffering.

The shower head spilled water everywhere since there was no curtain or door. The AC was not working well for one afternoon, the day it reached 100 F degrees. The location was very good. Service was satisfactory.

Me and my friends stayed at this hotel between 13th - 17th June and found that it was in a great location, right next to Times Square and next to various restaurants and Broadway theaters. Staff were also very friendly with rooms cleaned on a daily basis. Would highly recommend for anyone taking their first trip to New York!

Dirty bed sheets . WIFI not working properly . Unfriendly and arrogant receptionists. Overpriced crappy breakfast at the asian resto next door which gives discount to customers paying cash(Fishy). Rooms were very noisy, you can hear all the noise coming from the hallway .Hidden charges. All your worst nightmares.

We stayed in room 403 it has been renovated and as this is our fourth visit to NYC we thought the room was a good size. All refurbished, ice cold aircon, WiFi good. Check in and out easy with friendly staff. Towels were changed every day, beds very comfortable.So many moan and complain about this hotel, yes it can be nosey but this is New York! Yes the lifts can be a little slow, try using the stairs!! For the price we think this is great place. Two minute walk to Times Square, two minutes to either uptown or downtown. Theatres, bars, restaurant all very close.Would recommend this to any of our friends. Thanks for a great stay!!

Great location in NYC for a quick stay near Times Square, Hells Kitchen, Central Park, Columbus Circle. Hotel rooms are clean, we got a family room with decent extra space. Room furniture looked outdated and very basic. Biggest issue at The Gallivant: terrible WiFi, do not expect this service to work for you. We do not have unlimited data service and not having a reliable WiFi is a big no-no. Staff was friendly and the check-in/check-out was really fast.

In general the hotel is very small and of low quality for the price, the only thing that justifies the value is the location, friendly and Spanish speaking staff, corridors with dirty clothes and dark smelly little warm

was excellent every thing. only the computers and printers are slow also the lady in the consierge was in an angry mood, the location is excellent , the rooms are very good, the rooms are clean, very good

Located just off Times Square. Decent price. Front staff not the friendliest. Elevators and hallways dont have air and are extremely hot. Rooms small but decent. Many restaurants within walking distance.

We were very happy with our stay at the Gallivant. We were in the city to see Springsteen on Broadway and the hotel is almost directly across the street from the theater. Parking is convenient, not too pricey, and there’s even a tiny pastry and coffee shop on the block not to mention Hurley’s. Rooms were small, but that’s to be expected in NYC. Hotel was clean, check in and check out was quick. We’ll stay there again on our next visit!

My husband and I enjoyed our stay here when we came to NYC for our first anniversary. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Everything is pretty modern and clean. I used the workout center to run on the treadmill, and it also houses an elliptical, bike, some yoga mats, and dumbbells. The location of he hotel was exceptional! It is close to Times Square and various restaurants, bars, and theaters. We were lucky enough to see A Bronx Tale at Longacre Theater two doors down. On our way over we stopped at Hurley’s next door for appetizers. We were only disappointed that there was not a mini fridge in the room to store and chill our bottled water, snacks, and left overs during our 3-night stay. But we had a small cooler we brought just in case. Parking was easy in the garage right across the street. It was valet, and you just need to be sure you pick it up on time to not get charged an additional day (they communicate this well). We really liked Iron Bar for both dinner and drinks, and it was only a few blocks away—very easy walk—even in heels! Make sure to check our Juniors for cheesecake, also not too far of a walk!

Great location, room was small but I only booked a standard so can’t expect anymore. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Room was clean and clean towels everyday, coffee was great too. Although in the heart of the action, never heard a thing at night, really comfortable bed!

The Gallivant was a great place for the family to stay during our visit to NYC! It is centrally locates, and very close to Times Square, the theater district and subway stations. It was clean, with very friendly staff. Having taken the red-eye in from the west coast, we arrived early, and they made every effort to get us in our room as quickly as possible. All this for a very reasonable price. Some things you should know: the lighting in the bathroom was not great, if you’re going to be applying makeup. There is no shower door and no exhaust fan, so things end up getting quite wet in the bathroom. Also, don’t buy into the breakfast “deal” with the adjacent restaurant. It is super expensive for mediocre good. A much better breakfast can be had at nearby delis.

the location was great. we spent 10 days in a family room, very large and well equipped. with a very large bathroom. Some amenities were defective like one curtain and the shower head. the whole stay was great.

after paid full amount in online, they charged me more after arriving there. nothing is working inside the room. worst management. room was not even 1% good as showing in the pictures. I would never recommend anyone and never stay again. rude front desk. irresponsible management. costly breakfast. overall worst experience. only one positive just 2 streets away from times square.

Main saving grace for this hotel is the great location close to Times Square. The furniture needs replacing and the general decor of the rooms updated. Quite noisy at night, mainly caused by the AC and the inconsiderate guests who cannot be bothered to shut their room door quietly.

The Hotel Decor is beautiful. Staff helpful and courteous. Excellent location in times square. Rooms clean and stocked wth a coffee maker and packets of coffee. The rooms are small. The only have two elevators for guests.Two restaurants attached to the hotel.

Nice hotel great location right ontop of Time Square clean and tidy just be aware that when you check out and you go to get your deposit back you do have to pay the urban tax city tax and state tax which works out around $28 dollars a day so please be aware and from what i understand a lot of hotels charge it and some charge even more . So check up before you book any of the hotels.

Our first time in America let alone New York! The Gallivant was perfect for us! We left there today to go to Miami. The staff were lovely, helpful and polite. The room was small and cute and had everything we could need!Perfect location! We would definatly stay here again and would definatly recommend to others! Thank You The Gallivant!

We arrived at the hotel to a very unwelcoming receptionist who wasn’t even able to manage a smile during check in. After arriving in the room dirty make up marks were spotted on the bedding straight away to which we returned to reception to the same receptionist who offered no apology and just passed a different room key to us to try! The new room appeared clean although extremely noisy air con which went on to effect sleep! During the stay we found several flies in the bathroom especially first thing in the morning. The room was not cleaned properly whilst there with the same crumbs on the side for entire stay. We also had no water etc left at any point.The plus side to the hotel is the beds were very comfy and location better than could of imagined! There was also a lovely member of staff who was possibly a porter who helped us lots when we asked for any advice and was very friendly. We were barely at the hotel due to doing so much however would not of wanted to be there more days than we were and would not plan a return. Cleanliness and hospitality of staff need looking at closely to ensure guests have the stay they deserve whilst in New York.

I had horrible customers service the whole time I was there. I had to ask for things over and over and still never received it. it was like they didn't care what I needed because they were busy that weekend

All good, location excellent, place excellent, the only thing to mention is the elevators, there is two elevators for all the hotel, and is not to good, but the general time is good, only in rush hours was dificult

My daughter and I stayed here for 5nights in February, I had read reviews and was a bit worried as they were average....But to our delight our fears were unfounded, I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the beds and bathrooms in this hotel, they were kept very clean every day.We had a hitch with the tv, the cable guy didn’t fix for 3 days, I just like it on in the background and for the news.The gym was a bit grubby needed a good clean and it’s very tiny, 3 people bit of a squeeze.The staff were helpful getting us a limo back to JFK Airport as it was raining and we didn’t want to lug our cases down the subway.We didn’t have breakfast so can’t comment, but bought yoghurt and granola from shop down the road.Coffee making facilities were ok although I drink tea it heated the water well enough.

AC was broken in our room and we were told there was nothing they could do and no discount was applied. One of our guests had to get another room for himself because he could not sleep, he too was not discounted on that room.the room was not swept and trash was not taken out upon us checking in

the hotel is most spacious for NYC, very clean and modern decor. The hotel could not be in a better location for tourists, 1 block from time square, and right around the corner for the hop on hop off bus departures!

Couldn't ask for a better location. We were lucky and were upgraded to a very large "family" room. It was very roomy and comfortable. Nothing special other than the size of the room. It was average, but served its purpose. Prior to coming, I read reviews with concerns about the elevators and wait times. While the elevators are small, we didn't encounter any longer than normal wait times. Every staff member we talked to was friendly and helpful.

Arrived at this hotel on 21st at night and after paying already for this hotel, the receptionist still asked for my credit card. I asked what it was for as payment already made and he said that they hold a $50 deposit which is refunded after checking out taking 3-4 days on the card.He didn’t really welcome us just gave the key and told us to get lift up. The room was a disaster, no view at all, really stuffy and air con is so loud plus the room was so small, absolutely nothing like the fake pics they post online. On the 2nd day the room key didn’t work so we had to carry all the bags down again to get a replacement…so annoying.Concierge was more interested in other things and was not very helpful at all. The housekeeping staff do shout every morning to each other down the corridors and also one morning 4 of them were arguing outside my room so I had a look what the commotion was and then they all went in to the next room and closed door but I could still here the arguing. They make so much noise it’s really difficult to sleep. 5 days after leaving this hotel, they decided to take $86 dollars from my credit card for an Urban fee. (The receptionist failed to mention this when asked on the 1st day – how convenient). I disputed this and received a refund from this stealing hotel with hidden charges – Beware!!!Even booking a late check out online, they kept asking me if I was checking out when we went for breakfast….Do not book this hotel – its nothing like what they make out to be and pictures are very deceiving.

I understand that the hotel business is tough, but our stay at the Gallivant May 29 – June 3 was exceedingly disappointing. I would not recommend it to others considering booking a room there.Not everything was a disaster. Above everything, if one is visiting NYC for Broadway, it’s a brilliant location. Every theater is within walking distance. Other positives: the towels were great (new?) -- refreshed daily and fluffy. The hotel offers a 10% discount at the two adjoining restaurants – our meals there were good. The in-room coffee packets were replenished every day too – that was appreciated.Unfortunately, the disappointments were significant. First was the “resort” fee of $28+ a day for…something (wi-fi? Exercise room? Lobby computers?). IMHO, the Gallivant is anything but a “resort”. The extra $28/night was a means to increase the money paid while keeping a competitive price displayed on-line. (Sort of like the airlines charging for a seat assignment, checked bags or a ‘fuel surcharge’…) That resort fee added 11% to the daily room rate.The room was a postage stamp. Even by NYC standards it was tiny. I’m 6”1’ and I banged my head on the bathroom door handle when getting up from the john (sorry if that’s TMI…) The distance between the bed and the window wall was 18 inches. I measured. The floor is a faux wood laminate – no rug or carpet. No table/work station. One chair like you’d see in a banquet hall – and stained fabric on it to boot.While the towels might be new, the bedding/mattress was not. It was marshmallow squishy. The sheets were under-sized and wouldn’t tuck-in. One awoke almost swaddled in the sheets in the morning. Boo.A little thing, but the in-room clock would not reset. I looked for five minutes to find the change-time button, and failed. That might be on me. My solution was to unplug the rascal and use my phone for my alarm. The elevators were scary. Slow, and it went up when you wanted down, and down when you wanted up. We were on the second floor so we used the stairs except when we had luggage. The fire department was even called one evening to rescue guests who were stuck in one of the elevators for 30 minutes. Yay stairs.I don’t know if it was on purpose or just lackadaisical staff, but there was a linen cart left in the hallway at the same spot our entire stay. Maybe it was so guests could get additional towels if needed, or an extra soap. I thought it odd that it never moved. Dangerous maybe if there had been a fire (or… if the elevators stopped working?...)The icing on the cake is that when we checked-out on the 3rd, “the computers were down” and our final invoice couldn’t be printed or displayed for review. The front desk said to leave my email and the final bill/receipt would be sent to me. Today is the 5th, and two days after our departure, that final invoice hasn’t yet arrived. I don’t know…maybe the computers are still down.Our stay at the Gallivant was disappointing and we will not be returning…ever. There are too many other $250 - $300 night hotel options in NYC near Broadway to go through that experience again. I wish the owners and managers of the Gallivant good luck – based on our recent stay, they are going to need it.

This is an utter dog hole! From cameo on reception who checked us in, to the room in itself! The handle fell off the shower, the bed is a little larger than a single and the room is filthy! Booking.com are a disgrace for even listing this as a place to stay. Me and the missus are laughing as we have been had over big time. The rooms are nothing like in the photos. Don’t stay here it’s that bad!

Booked 2 rooms for 2 couples. Staff at check in were rude and not at all interested in us as guests, more like we were an inconvenience in their day! Every time we approached staff at the desk or concierge they either ignored you or were very short with us. Nobody seemed happy in their jobs at all. Housekeeping would be shouting down the hallways to each other or other staff from early morning. Rooms noisy, smelly and small. 6 nights, no change of linen. Towels paper thin. Even for the money this hotel is not worth it. Bonus was the location, being close to all theatres , a great pub next door and good restaurants nearby.

1. We suffered with severe itching every time we got in to bed. Despite leaving generous tips daily our bedsheets and towels were not changed throughout our five day stay. One day the bed was left unmade but the $4 dollars was taken. 2. I found a black slimy insect slithering on my towel on the first day. 3. No shower gel provided, luckily we had our own. This is the first time in all my years of travel that a hotel has not provided this. 4. No milk for the coffee or water provided despite hot weather in NY. Again, we have never experienced this in any hotel before. 5. The concierge refused to make a call to the shuttle company confirming our pick up time. We were directed to use the phone in our room. I tried it and it wasn’t working! I had to use my UK mobile phone which cost a packet. 6. The air conditioning was SO loud we didn’t get any sleep all week. It was horrendous as we were so tired every morning and this impacted our ability to enjoy the sights. 7. The Chinese people running the limited breakfast buffet agreed and wrote a price for us for the week which I paid on the first morning. On the last day we were told, despite showing my receipt, we owed more money. Every morning they looked at us and started speaking another language, then they would peer at each thing we ate making us feel guilty if we went up and got something else to eat/ drink. Further, the bread was stale snd it was upsetting they did this. 8. Extension sockets with wires next to bed as the hotel is so outdated, there are no sockets for laptop or phone etc next to bed. 9. Television had about 10 limited channels, unclear picture and wonky on the wall. 20. Narrow hallways with cleaning trollies that are left there 24/7 and have to be negotiated to get to the lifts which take so long to arrive. When they do, they are always packed! 22. Nowhere to put your toiletries in the bathroom. So small you can’t swing a cat in there. I spoke with British Airways as we came here for a rest/ recharge as a family member has cancer. We feel worse/ more tired than before we came from lack of sleep from the noise. Staying here caused us more stress. We explained this is definitely not a 4 star but more a 1 star hotel. The decor is outdated and any attempt at updating the lobby is tacky. Our room was something I’d expect in a third world country. BA said it would investigate and downgrade the rating or remove from its website as necessary. Location is good, about five minutes from Times Square but that’s about it.

Came to this hotel in November it’s by for the worst place I’ve ever stayed in! Rude reception staff, cleaners asked for a tip for cleaning our room on our last day! the hotel was so cold our heating didn’t work in our room when we asked at reception about this they gave us lots of excuse one even was that it was against the law to use heating at that time of the year they offered us some extra blankets which we never got only good thing about this hotel is the location! Maybe try giving your staff some customer training!

Came here for just short of a week away to celebrate a special birthday. When we arrived the computer system was down late at night, so we were unable to check in until the following afternoon (next day), so we were put in a temporary room over night but had no cold water which they were aware of this and therefore couldn’t shower, which is one of the main things you want to do after a long time travelling! With this there was no compensation but only a verbal apology eventually when my mother actually broke down into tears as we were not treated the way we should have been when paying a lot of money for it! The photos of the rooms are very misleading on website as rooms are not light and airy, but actually dark and dingy with tiny bathrooms, and antiquated air con unit! We will never stay here again nor recommend it!

Location is good just a 5 min walk from Times Square.Hotel is very dated and run down. Room was tiny, no space at all to move around and strangely no mirror ! Walls damaged and grubby, wardrobe isn't big enough for a coat hanger to hang straight. Bathroom too small to use with the door closed.The rooms really need a refurb and some clean blonds at the window would be nice rather than the awful stained grubby ones.No interest from staff when we complained about the roomLifts are a joke and you can expect to wait up to 10 minutes for one at busy timesThe only plus is the bed was small but very comfortableHowever, the old dated air con unit was so noisy that it could not be used if trying to sleep so when its 34 degrees outside its a little less comfortableIf you want to spend one night close to Times Square its bearable but not for longerNo view at all from the window, just another wall

We booked this hotel for its location primarily - excellently positioned just minutes away from Times Square and a short walk to Central Park. The pictures on the hotel website make it look better than it is - in fact it is quite tired and in need of upgrading. The windows in particular are so filthy you can barely see out! On arrival, we expected the normal over effusive American welcome, but no - the staff were quite abrupt and less than helpful. We had to walk out into Times Square as our room wasn't ready despite a very long and tiresome journey and woud have been grateful for somewhere just to rest temporarily. We also had to request that our luggage was safely stored as they seemed prepared to leave it unattended in the foyer. Be prepared for a restless night - although we were on the tenth floor, the street noise seeemed to funnel all the way up. The only thing to recommend the hotel is its position - there must be better dals out there. Oh, and we also had to wait ages for the lifts which seem inadequate for the number of rooms!

Nothing bad to say about the hotel itself. Best location, clean room and bathroom, good tv chanels selection and internet.The only thing i would mention is the noise during the night from the garbage tracks ... we were on the 4th floor.

Location superb, Rooms have everything you will need, free ice available aswel.Free WiFi, rooms cleaned every day if you want it.Couldn’t fault it for the price we paid was sceptical after reading mixed reviews; but do not hesitate!Would love too rebook but struggling to find an operator who is selling this hotel (Coop Travel, TUI, Virgin etc.)One thing to bare in mind with flight times you can’t check in till 15:00.

I have just returned from a 4 night stay with my mother and other 2 sisters, and had a great time! We had the family room which was really spacious and very clean (the maids also attended daily with fresh towels and coffee top ups!).Was nervous about our stay due to dome reviews however the Gallivant did not dissapoint, staff were extremely helpful and pleasant during our stay!Amazing location, right in the heart of Times Square and so close to Subway, tour bus stops and lots of bars and restaurants

My friend and i had 4 nights here. We checked in with a cold welcome.. no..'welcome to tge gallivant' or 'enjoy your stay'. Just sign here and i need your credit card. By the way.. we paid £120 dollars room tax for 4 nights so put that aside. The lifts were far to small for such a big hotel. They were slow to get to ground so we would often walk up to the 7th floor and very hard to get into from there as they always passed by full so it was a 7 floor walk to the lobby.The room we had was a good size.. i did here people complaining that the rooms were tiny so maybe ph ahead to ask for a large room? We had a room facing the road so it was noisy at times, there is a fire house just 100 yards up on the corner so we heard a few sirens as it passed by.. must have been really loud on lower floors! To finish on a good note the bed was really comfy so after a long day seeing the sights and a couple of drinks on the eve that was very welcome. Definitely wouldnt call it a 4* as TUI did but it was 4 nights so we got on with it.

Room was small but fit our needs. VERY clean. Balcony was an unexpected extra. All the staff was super friendly and helpful. Hotel allows check in of bags before and after your stay which made it very easy to deal with the 3pm and 12pm check in and checkout times.

I have just returned from a 3 night stay at The Gallivant and I was pleasantly surprised. I had been given the trip to NYC as a 40th birthday present back in January from my boyfriend and have been reading the mixed reviews on here since then. I was nervous if im honest as the reviews were so mixed but upon arrival there was absolutely nothing to worry about. The hotel is clean, the staff were friendly and the location is just amazing. It took us about 20 seconds to walk to the famous Times Square steps. The room wasn’t enormous but it was perfect just for the 2 of us and the shower was lovely and hot! I would defiantly recommend the hotel and we would definitely stay there again!

Hotel is in an amazing location close to the main tourist spots. The lobby is very modern on arrival, reception staff were very straight to point not as welcoming as could have been. Room size was fine and clean, did not find the room it’s set small as others found-although the bathroom was tight. Although could hear the city due to central location it did not effect our sleep. This was a perfect base for anyone who wants to explore New York. Shame about charge to store bags on departure been to Budget hotels who don’t even charge for this service.

The location can not be beat. The staff are great. The room was quiet, despite being in the heart of the action. Very clean and welcoming. I will definitely stay here again. Hardwood floors and the bed was really comfortable.

- elevators often unavailable - windows on a wall and stairs - safetybox out of order - no sweeping of the room and the bathroom (cotton buds under the furniture) - faulty and dangerous electrical equipment (plugs do not hold and repair to adesive tape) - sighs of the person when chech out to whom the luggage has been entrusted ... - TV : some channels only (weak signal)- Invoice INCOMPLETE (1 page on 3) and NO ANSWER to my request to receive it by mail- Only positive points: location of the hotel; comfort of the bed

The location of the hotel was fine and this was the only thing that was. Before our arrival we upgraded our room to a Deluxe Double Queen room but on arrival we were very disappointed. We live the biggest part of our time in a holiday home and the living accommodation and bathroom is bigger than what our room was. The hotel in general isn't as clean as it could be and is looking very run down. The staff in the hotel especially the reception staff were anything but helpful in actual fact they came across quite rude at times. They didn't seem as though they wanted to help us at all. I enquired straight away about the upgrade we had paid for and was told quite abruptly that the room we were given was the room we booked, I beg to differ as on returning I have looked the website for the hotel and our room was nothing like the one we thought we had booked. The only person who seemed to want to help was a gentleman at the concierge desk when he obtained a taxi for us. While waiting for our taxi my husband noticed the sofa we were sitting on was absolutely filthy there were food remains in the button decorations.

The rate they quote on their website inaccurate. I booked a $220 room and was charged $284. The room had a full size bed not a queen as advertised. Ugliest room I have seen in NYC. Cheaply furnished and uncomfortable. I will not stay there again. Much better hotels available in NYC at the same price and in similar location.

Stayed at the gallivant which is just off Times Square. Ideal location if you want to be centrally located. Even thought this hotel is just off Times Square I was not facing the main road so was never disturbed with traffic and generally outside noise. Pleasantly met by the reception staff. Check in was quick and effortless. There is two lifts that appeared slow so we're always waiting for a lift to arrive. I opted for the larger room which I'm pleased I had as I had the chance to see the smaller room and think I would of been dissatisfied when staying for several nights. My room had an ensuite shower room. The bedding and laundry were clean and appeared good quality. Tbh I didn't spend much time in the hotel but then again why would you when you've got New York on your doorstep. I never had any concerns whilst in the hotel but if I did I'm sure the helpful staff in the hotel would have no hesitation in solving my problem.

Stayed here last week for 4 nights and found it to be a great location. The room was a queen on the 15th floor at the front, it was spacious and clean. The bed and pillows were so comfortable. I haven't slept so good in a hotel bed for a long time. I found the staff helpful with any questions I had and would definitely recommend this hotel.

When we arrived they upgraded us from a double bed to queen. It wasn’t check in time so we dropped our bags and went for a short walk to Times Square. When we came back they upgraded us to a king. That room had a loud air conditioner, no fridge but no WiFi so they offered to move us (913). They moved us to 1413 which was bigger, had a fridge and was my better. We stayed for 9 nights. It was always clean and we loved it. Great location. Perfect for everything. It was recommended by a friend for the cloud beds and they lived up to her recommendation. Do it!!! The food in dings was delish but check groupon for cashback

We are staying here at the moment. First got very small room with extreme noise from outside (ac?). We could change day after (needed to bring everything down) but when we came back, they put us on the same floor! Even the man who had to tell us was a bit ashamed! Now we are at the front and its better but not good. The interior is outdated and the water isnt really warm in the morning. First we got towles with black marks on it, now they are ok. Rooms are clean, windows arent. Location us a plus and the people are friendly, but hoe they treated us with the rooms does not make us come back. I had better in NYC!

The staff here were friendly and helpful, with one exception. I complained that I was cold in my room and that the heating would not turn on but was told the heating would not go back on unless the temperature dropped to a certain level, it was February and it snowed, so I was wet and cold!!!!The location is great, so close to the theatres and times square, all within a very short walking distance. This suited me really well.The room was compact but we had a reasonably good city view. Usually we have looked out on to other building when staying in New York, so this was a real bonus. The bathroom was very small but adequate. No chairs in the room, there was one wooden stool/round table. had to lay on the bed to watch the tv, but the remote wouldn't work from one of the beds. We spent our spare time in bed, keeping warm but my bed had broken springs, so was very lumpy. On investigating the lumpy bed, the mattress was stained and the cover dirty-good job I only did this on the last night. urghh!!!t Beds were not made up every day but we got clean towels daily, trash was taken; and they replenished drinks.We did not eat in the attached restaurant for breakfast, as it seemed pricey at $20. We got cheaper, good breakfasts elsewhere.The reception area looked nice enough, with lots of seating but as mainly busy so not a place to sit and relax. The whole hotel is looking a little tired but ok enough.I wouldn't stay here again as I ;like somewhere to rest up in comfort as I find New York very tiring on the old legs and back. However, if you want somewhere good for theatres and Times Square and don't spend much time in your room, this would be ideal: if they change the bed mattress and bedding$2 per item of luggage is charged if you have a late flight home and don't want to trail your bags/cases around with you. Sixth visit to New York and this is the first time I have charge for this.

My boyfriend and I stayed here last week for 5 nights. The hotel is in an excellent location, just off Times Square. The hotel itself is quite modern, the foyer has quite a boutique feel. I read other reviews saying it felt tired and run down but we thought it was fine. The reception staff were fine upon arriving but not overly welcoming or friendly. Bad points: Our room was tiny. The windows were dirty and we could barely see out of them. The air conditioning unit was incredibly noisy so couldn’t be left on overnight which meant it got very hot as it was too noisy to leave the window open. We had a water machine on our floor but on the first night it was out of order and beeping, which we could hear from our room. We called to reception to report it and they said they would send bottled water up and also someone to look at the machine. An hour later, nothing. I called down again and was told by a rather rude member of staff that they were short of staff so would not be sending bottled water but someone would come look at the machine. Another hour passed and still nothing! It never got fixed while we were there. We were on the top floor so used the lifts but there is only three and they are small and slow. One broke down while we were there. One morning it took us about 10 minutes to get down because it took a long time to arrive then was going down, and then going back up to higher levels before it reached the bottom. We eventually got off on a different floor and took the stairs.The lady on reception when we checked out was quite curt, did not ask how our stay was etc, just took our room keys and confirmed we were checked out. Good points: The hotel is very clean. Our room was really clean (except the windows!). The room was well equipped with a hairdryer, iron/ironing board and an adaptor for U.K./European plugs. The cleaning staff were lovely, so friendly and cheerful. As we didn’t spend much time in our hotel it did not affect our trip too much, but there’s definitely things that could be improved!

I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend last week to celebrate my 21st birthday. Whilst there are a few positive points on this hotel there are a number of issues which would be easily resolved which let this place down. First we arrived around 9.30pm after hours of delays with our flight and were met by a miserable, extremely rude member of staff at the reception. She didn’t explain anything to us and just threw our room key down, stating the room number and shoving a piece of paper to us. Didn’t provide any information about the hotel or our stay. We got to our room on the 10th floor and I have to say considering it’s in the centre of Times Square the room was not that small, it was a reasonable size for 2 people for a 5 night stay. There were a number of amenities including a coffee machine, an iron and ironing board and an ice bucket for the ice machines located on a number of floors. In the bathroom there was also soaps and a hairdryer. The biggest downside to the room was the air conditioning unit which is essentially a whole in the wall with a unit too small for the whole placed inside leaving a gap under allowing a lot of noise and smells to come in from outside. The worst part was the noise that the unit made even when switched off, it made it almost impossible to sleep. This hotel is also situated just a few doors down from a fire station meaning you can hear the sirens all borough the day and night and with the windows so thin and the gap under the air conditioning unit it can be very loud. We had a massive issue with the water temperature in our room after the first day. The way in the shower, sink and even toilet was boiling hot. We had the maintenance guy come up who was very nice but all he did was leave the water running for around 10 minutes and flush the toilet and few times and then said it was fine. This meant whenever we wanted any cold water we were having to leave be water on for around 10 minutes and continuously flush the toilet, we would then get some cold water for around 5/10 minutes and it would go back to boiling hot. This left us almost burnt a number of times in the shower and when trying to wash our hands etc. I had read a lot of reviews mentioning the lifts and until our last day we didn’t have a problem. On the last day I believe one of the lifts was out of service therefore it took a long time to manage to get into the lift and walking up 10 flights of stairs numerous times wasn’t the best situation.On a whole I do wish I had chosen somewhere else to celebrate my 21st, I feel that in many other hotels something special would have been done on the day of my birthday and the hotel was informed by my boyfriend previous to arriving asking if there was anything that could be done that he could pay for, however we was ignored and nothing was done to acknowledge the special occasion. The lack of sleep due to noise became a real issue during the stay and whilst I appreciate you are in the middle of one of the busiest cities in the world and it will be noisy there are steps that could be taken to reduce the noise such as getting rid of those ridiculous A.C units and having better windows fitted. There are certain members of staff that could also do with some customer service training. In saying this there were some members of staff who were very pleasant such as the cleaners that we seen and the lady on the concierge desk who arrange a private car to take us back to the airport pretty last minute which cost us $65 and was all round very helpful and pleasant. I don’t think I would choose to stay here again due to the lack of sleep and some of the staff. However it is in a great location and within walking distance of so much. If you don’t mind a few rude people and are not a light sleeper then this hotel would suit you just fine.

Nice, clean hotel. Great location. Rooms are small but it’s New York. You’re only there to sleep! We really enjoyed our stay and would stay here again. Staff were helpful and always pleasant. Thank you.

Stayed for a week with my boyfriend as my 21st birthday present. Incredibly rude staff. Only good thing about this hotel is the location! Tiny rooms, no air con, no in room services such as bottled water, mini fridge etc. Constantly found black marks on the towels and bedding, shower was far too small and water went everywhere when you had a shower. Unhelpful and unprofessional staff. Asked for a receipt for the tax I paid and was shouted down by the woman at reception who wouldn’t even listen to what I was asking for she just shouted me down and completely ignored me. I have a hunch it was to do with our age as while we sat in the lobby waiting for the taxi we witnessed multiple people check out and they were polite and helpful with all older customers but were increcibly rude to us. Left the hotel crying in the taxi on the way airport at how the disgustingly rude and unprofessional staff had made me feel throughout the stay- ruined my 21st birthday present. Will not be visiting again, will not be recommending and do not want any contact from the hotel as there is nothing you can say or do to rectify this- unless you intend on giving me some of my money back I do not want any further contact. Very very unprofessional.

This hotel is very well located closed to Time Square and this is its main strengh because the room are not large, more or less cleaned and quite noisy during the night. The price is expensive regarding the overall services proposed.

Stayed here back in February (only just had time to review!). First of all the hotel is in a perfect location to explore the city, right on the door step of Times Square and close to major subway lines. The staff we encountered were all friendly and helpful. We found the rooms clean, contradict to some other reviews. The negatives; We were put into a room with a generator directly outside. After asking to be moved, we found that the entire side of the hotel had that issue. We were told we could move top the top floor and the other side but there wasn't any tv signal above the 7th floor?! We had no choice but to accept because the sound proofing was terrible as it was. We also didn't have air con on the top floor, unlike the rest of the floors. Luckily we only used this room as a base for our time in the city and mostly only slept there.Overall, good. But the hotel has great potential if modernised and if the sound proofing is improved.

We had a family room, which had a very weird layout and just one bathroom to share (not a separate toilet), making you wait for everyone continuously. The air-conditioning was way too loud, making it near impossible to sleep at night. The most redeeming quality was the fact that we shopped online and had it delivered it to the hotel, which they were completely fine with.The room in itself was fine, with everything in walking distance (we didn't even use the metro a couple of days).

The hotel is in an amazing location two minutes from Times Square, and around 10 minutes to walk to Central Park. The room itself was quite small, couldn’t open the blinds to let natural light in as we faced two walls, but the room is what you pay for basic and clean. Staff where friendly and helpful, and we got breakfast each morning in the restaurant joined to the hotel. Food was nice, as much as you want and tax included in the price. Ideal hotel for a first visit to New York

After reading previous reviews i was quite worried and the biggest problem is getting in touch as i tried a few times but once i did it was really good reply wise,i booked a twin twin room(room 528) and it was spot on size wise and really quiet for me and my friend,housekeeping were great everyday n front desk were helpful too,i will defo come back and stay as location wise u would struggle to get much better....nice n clean hotel and worth the money

Stayed In this hotel for 10 days around Xmas time with family members. Overall, the experience was good. From the beginning, all the staff (réceptionists, housekeepers, restaurant staff) was very nice and helping. There was a leak in one of the bedrooms, and the staff sorted this in a very efficient manner (forgot his name but the guy was awesome). The location is great. Just a few steps from Times Square. The rooms are ok, too much heating but you can use the air-conditionning to cool down. I would have recommended this place if it wasn't for a very nasty and standoffish woman called "Adeline". A blond woman who seems to think she is so cool she has the right to give you the cold shoulder when asked a simple question. Very standoffish, gives big smiles to pretty male clients and a cold face to others. Pretty shocking and unacceptable attitude to receive when you spent over 5000 dollars.

I had to stay overnight in NYC and chose the Gallivant because of its midtown location and price. I was impressed with how nice the hotel was, both the lobby and the room. The staff was also very friendly. I must have gotten a good deal on the room, because it was on par with much pricier hotels in the area.

Clean and comfortable room with excellent room service. Helpful reception staff, with an excellent restaurant for breakfast before setting out to enjoy the sights.Great location, reasonably quiet given the close proximity of Times Square and Broadway.

Location - excellent if you want to be around times square, easy to get to all the main attractions.Overall, the room including the bathroom could be cleaned more thoroughly. Our first room had a broken bathroom door lock, the mirror light flashed constantly, the cupboard door handle fell off the first time we opened it, the air con worked for the first couple of hours on cold but woke us up blasting hot air in the night which wasn't very pleasant and it took quite a lot of persuading to open the windows. Also had an interesting bug come out the ceiling in the bathroom which was the last straw. Second room was better except the shower mixer tap which fell off the wall on our last day and as we checked we had all our belongings, we noticed lots of towels and rubbish under the bed which looked like they'd been there for a while. Receptionist did get our room changed within 10 minutes which was appreciated. We were under the assumption all taxes were included in the initial price but on arrival were asked for a credit card (we thought for ID) but since have realised another £87.91 has been taken for an unknown reason. Would be better if they let you know why they need your credit card. Hotel lobby toilets need cleaning, one of the doors didn't close to lock it.

Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband, friendly reception and hotel staff. Stayed in 212, 2nd floor, up one flight of stairs, lifts get busy. Clean, well equipped queen room with shower room, toiletries and towels provided and restocked daily, beds changed also. Lovely cleaning ladies, very friendly, ideal central location, in the heart of Times Square, they can also arrange a shuttle to the airport. Only one problem was no cold water in the bathroom, literally burnt myself in the shower, receptionist immediately offered to change rooms, very helpful. Would stay here again.

Room was clean, and tidy, a lot smaller than presented in the pictures but was suitable for a couple, no air conditioning meant the room got very hot, also the windows in the room had not been cleaned on the outside meaning they were so dirty you couldn’t see out!!! The shower was good and stayed hot but due to the shower scene being too small water went everywhere when you took a shower and the floor stayed wet!!! Services in the room were pretty poor, no Air-Con, no fridge, no drinking water, coffee only, no Milk! The location was perfect! Staff at the hotel were very rude, when asked if we could have a receipt for the tax payment we were profusely told that it wasn’t possible, the receptionist continued to refuse to print a receipt even continually talking over and taking louder when my girlfriend requested it! Cleaner believed that 8AM was the right time to clean our room every morning so everyday at 8AM there would be a knock at the door! Very Dissapointed with the service by the staff!!! Unless something was to change would not stay here again!!

This hotel is in SUCH a good location!! It's a few minutes walk from Times Square as well as being close to Broadway and a subway station. We found that even though we were so close to Times Square, we slept surprisingly well and weren't disturbed by the noise at all. The bed was big and comfy, the room/bathroom were nice and clean, and the amenities were good e.g. coffee machine, safe, shampoo, shower gel, moisturiser etc. There was also free Wi-Fi. One thing was that the room and bathroom were very small but considering we only really slept in there it wasn't a big deal. I don't think this hotel deserves its bad reviews and I would definitely recommend staying here!

A friend and I stayed here for 5 nights on a city break to NY. It was easy to find and close to a few major subway stops. The location is perfect! A 30 second walk from central Times Square! And 10-20 minutes walk from many major sights - rockerfellla centre, Empire State Building, 5th Ave and Grand Central. Lots of amenities close by like shops for food or quick snacks. Loads of bars, cafes and restaurants nearby too - next door and the next streets. So it was perfect for this side of things!
