The hotel itself is pretty standard but fine, it has all you need in the rooms - towels, shower gels etc. Great tv channels! It was clean, the beds are comfy and warm. We had a deluxe bed and it was pretty massive for the both of us so we had so much space! The staff seem helpful and it has some quirky features around the reception! Sleeping isn’t amazing when there’s loud music from Times Square or neighbouring bars but you can get over that and it only really affected us on one evening. The rooms aren’t massive but you don’t spend that much time in there so it doesn’t really matter. I’d stay again :)

Close to Times sq. Lovely room king size bed, really comfortable, coffee machine. Even an exercise bike in room. Close to theatres and lots of restaurants. Bathroom with shower, just a little niggle, the shower when running splashed over onto bathroom floor, which meant the floor stayed wet for sometime. Also being from the UK my daughter didn't like coffee so maybe adding teabags to the complimentary drinks might help. Lovely hotel, friendly and helpful staff. Would stay here again.

Just back from a 4 night stay at the Gallivant booking through BA. the location of this hotel is key, literally steps from Times Square and the many theatres. Its well connected to the subway too making the trip from JfK a breeze. We were a little surprised at the negative reviews as the rooms were a decent size by city standards. They were clean and the coffee machine is a nice touch. There's a fitness room in the basement which is handy. We were also able to leave bags on our last day for a small fee. My only recommendation for improvement is that the heating / cooling units and pipes can get a little noisy but not enough to disturb sleep too much. I'd certainly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in MidTown.

Have just spent five days in this hotel as part of a package with BA. The hotel is perfectly located with theatres opposite and a few doors down as well as in the surrounding streets. Walk down the road and you are on Broadway, turn right and you are minutes from Times Square. The hotel itself is pleasant enough, although the rooms are small and dark and the shower room incredibly small. Nevertheless we were warm and comfortable and the room was clean. Sadly our safe was out of action, and despite the efforts of the maintenance team, could not be repaired. Fortunately we were able to use the one in our children's room. They were given a free upgrade to a larger room with twin beds. The staff were polite and helpful, keen to sort out problems if possible. There is a Chinese restaurant leading off from the lobby where you can get breakfast at about $19 for a full cooked option or less for the continental version. We found local coffee shops that were cheaper and a corner shop where you could buy pastries for $2. Our experience was very positive in this hotel and I am a little surprised at the negative reviews on here. I would stay here again, and found it good value. You could not get such a good hotel in London for this price.

Room: Family Room with 1x Double Bed and 1x oversized single Bunks. It was a Premium Room. In short, this is a very tired hotel which is in need of maintenance and decoration. Save for the lobby, the hotel is not kept well. We raised two serious maintenance issues and both were fixed promptly (so top marks there) but they were the kind of faults that shouldn't have occurred at all, and had the cleaning been half way thorough, would have been obvious to the housekeeping staff too. All staff were very friendly bar two Reception team members who seemed hassled so difficult to know if they were just having an off day. The hotel is very noisy front and rear, even for NYC Times Square; soundproofing is way below other hotels in the area. Bed was very comfy so if this is simply put your head down for few hours, and you can sleep through most external noise, this is a decent choice of hotel. Location is good too as easy to access most key tourist hotspots on Manhattan from here. The Chinese restaurant attached do an okay breakfast and if you will commit to more than a day at a time they will do you a deal on the buffet rate of ~ 25% discount. The family room design gave my 9 and 10 YO some private space which is nice, but I am out of positives at this stage. We wouldn't go back to The Gallivant, but we have stayed in worse. Its value for money for Times Square, but for a few dollars more, you can do much better e.g. The Manhattan Hotel.

After reading all the reviews on trip advisor after booking this hotel, I must admit I was a little anxious! But as many have said on here, you only stop here for sleeping! Overall I was quite impressed.. After travelling for over 8 hours we arrived to a pleasant lobby area, we checked in and had to pay $100 for city tax ($25 per night) which needed to be on a card.. thankfully I used monzo! So we had a room on the 5th floor and despite having a lovely(!) view of a wall from the window the room was pleasant and clean- there’s 4 lifts, which yes are small but at one point there was 8 of us in a lift.. but what do you except in the middle of NY? Upon arrival the gentleman at reception gave us a piece of paper detailing the city tax, check in and out times, WiFi code and how to use the room telephone (if needed)The heater.. so this made a lot of noise but once I got to grips with using it it was fine and I had managed to opt for the “heater” function which didn’t utilise the fan so reduced the noise aspect.There was a door in between our room and next doors which is maybe used for families who have children to provide a double bed and 2 singles (we had the 2 single beds) it was lockable which couldn’t be accessed from the other room but at times was a little off putting due to noise and hearing talking from the other room. There was a safe in the room but we didn’t use this - just use your case with a lock instead! The bed was super comfy, two pillows and just the right tog for duvet for both myself and sister.. tv worked perfectly fine, shower; was a power one, nice and hot! The one morning we woke up late but the housekeeping service knocked the door offering to change the towels, which were clean, no marks and this was changed daily. Had toiletries: shampoo, conditioner, soap and hand lotion readily available within the bathroom, with a hotel hair dryer hanging on the bathroom door in a bagThere’s an option for $2 per bag to keep in the hotel on your last day so you can finish off exploring before catching the plane. We opted for the airport shuttle, again ordered on the day of departure, this was $65 for 2 people and 2 suitcases and pick up time for us was 4.25pm, it was early but took just over an hour to get to JFK (due to rush hour) but if you’re tired I’d recommend this! We caught the airtrain to Jamaica then E subway to world trade centre to get to the hotel upon arrival which took around 1.5 hours so about the same (again during rush hour) Overall, if you’re wanting a cheap, good location hotel and not fussed about fancy add-ons this is the one for you.. you only use a hotel to sleep in and refresh before exploring NY which is exactly what we did.. the location is perfect for accessing everything in New York with the subway being on 50st and 49st just off Broadway..

A hotel with a privileged location near several restaurants, theaters and the most iconic places to visit in NYC. The rooms are very spacious and clean and the employees very attentive. The speed of the wi fi is excellent. A single observation or suggestion, the heating equipment is noisy. 100% recommendable.

Stayed at the Gallivant for Easter with my husband for 4 nights. It is a place to sleep close to Time Square if you are unlucky to get a room like ours, the hearing will wake yo up and you might not actually sleep at all. I am a relatively heavy sleeper and this kept me awake every night even after I bought ear plugs. We complained to front of house, two staff basically said.... it's an old building and they are noisy, this is New York. They offered me ear plugs and if we wanted to move rooms but said a lot of the rooms have the same issue and they couldn't tell us which ones did or not. They were pretty rude also. We were also charged some random scam/tax that other people have mentioned on reviews. Nothing being mentioned at reception about them charging as we had paid in full. In Europe that is called Fraud. Over priced and standards so low that I'm amazed they get the business. I am a regular in 3 star hotels so don't mind a standard experience but this is just bad business practice. Am surprised/suspicious at some of the reviews on the hotel.

Firstly, we were put in a room on the 10th floor. I had booked a 'deluxe queen' room and this was certainly not a deluxe or a queen bed! The room was filthy and the radiator was stuck on full with the thermostat broken off... We queried the room and were told that this was definitely a deluxe queen. We stayed in this room for 2 nights, trying to regulate the heat with the noisy air conditioning unit, but on the second night I woke at 3am and turned the air con on and it said the room was 92 degrees! I went down and complained at the desk, the staff don't seem to care at all, not even an apology... the man that I spoke to said that there was only one other deluxe queen left and moved is to that room. That one was even worse, it was absolutely filthy! I went down to ask to be moved again and was told I would have to pay extra which I was not having. We were eventually moved again after a lot of negotiation and the room for the remaining two nights was acceptable, although not very clean again. To sum up, the hotel is in a great location but the rooms are awful and staff need training! I wouldn't go back

My wife and I stayed here in November 17. The room we were given was a little small, and the hotel was a bit noisy. It was really cold outside when we were there and the heater in our room didn't work, when we told reception they gave us another blanket and assured us it would be fixed. It never was! The next night had to ask again and had the same response also had to get another blanket as housekeeping had taken the first one. Thankfully we were only here for three nights. The safe in our room was broken too, which reception didn't seem worried about at all, so had to cart all our valuable around with us. All in all a great location but poor hotel.

Stayed here for two nights staff were pleasant we arrived to our room it was a bit on small side but manageable only problem was the room would get incredibly warm at night but this was sorted by the cooler in the room overall I enjoyed my stay and would stay here again

Wouldn’t recommend this hotel at all, if I could give it a minus two I would. Location is in the middle of everything that’s the only thing that makes it attractive. What was bad. Rooms are too small and it’s way overpriced I’d rather spend the extra 100-300 dollars for a different hotel, air conditioning had a horrible smell coming from it, staff were not helpful from the second we walked in the building, girl behind the desk had a horrible smug look on her face and wasn’t approachable (charged extra fees when checking in and they just said it was taxes, no other explanation), cleaners shouting at each other in the hallway at 8am. It’s located right beside a fire station so unless you like the sound of sirens at 4am don’t book here because the noise of them is horrendous!!Lifts are tiny and they stop on every single floor!! Could be better walking if you didn’t have big bags with you.All in all I wouldn’t recommend anyone to stay here bad experience that you don’t need when it’s your first time in New York!!

I was dreading my stay here because of all the bad reviews but from my experience I honestly don’t know what all the fuss was about!A cheap and cheerful hotel that’s been recently refurbished. The room was bigger than I expected after reading previous customer feedback. Ours had a great TV (which worked fine!) and coffee machine in-room, Wi-Fi, a nice modern bathroom with hot shower and everything was clean. The maid service came in every day and replaced towels, made the bed and emptied the bins.What really sells this place is the location. You’re literally a street away from Times Square and I think that’s worth every penny. Let’s be honest, you’re not really going to NYC to spend the whole time in your hotel room - if you are then perhaps look for an alternative place to stay. The Gallivant is a great location to set up base camp for the week or however long you’re staying.Of course it could have been better in places but I would recommend to anyone travelling to New York on a budget.

They say they have free wifi, but they will charge you for wifi, use of the gym and free water (that you never recieve). The hotel doesn't mention this, we found out when they charged our credit card. So the hotel has a good location. How ever the hotel is outdated. Our shower was broken, resulting in water all over the floor. The bed was broken. The elevators rarely worked and when they did they took forever.I really wouldn't recommend this hotel.

The room was large for one of the lowest price hotels in nyc . We had 2 small doubles and then pull out bunk beds a large bathroom tv and coffee making facilities . I was impressed that we had 2 windows in our bedroom that looked out into the streets. Another bonus as lots of nyc hotels look out onto walls. The place was very clean . The hotel is literally in Times Square. The only downside if your a light sleeper is it’s at side of a fire station which comes and goes through the night. Take your earplugs the hotel is worth it great price and size.

This hotel has small rooms, the only good thing about the room was the comfort of the bed. No hot water twice, no heating had to call the engineer up, and he had to use a pen to fix it. Will never recommend this hotel or stay there again. Friends in one room found a cockroach, the toilet was to close to the wall.When we booked in the girl on the reception was rude,also we booked three rooms and only two were available when we checked in, we had to wait for over a hour for the other room all the other staff were pleasent.

The rooms are very small.The smallest we have ever stayed in in NYC. We probably wouldn't mind if the room was clean.All the light switches were filthy. The floor had crumbs and hair like it wasn't swept after the last guest checked out . The white sheets were actually gray.The windows are so dirty that even if you have a good view you wouldn't be able to see it. Now lets talk bathroom. If you wouldn't mind taking a shower in an airplane bathroom, then go for it because it is that small. And again white towels that are so gray. We were wondering why we had extra towels and found out the bathroom floor floods from the shower. The shower is so narrow the water goes right onto the bathroom floor. One night was enough for us so we checked out a day early and was not even asked at the front desk if everything was ok. I guess they are not surprised. We were prepaid so we were not offered a refund at all.

The location is the best if you are coming to town for a show or just to do really touristy type things. Nothing stood out except for the roach I saw in my room just before we checked. Also its 2 doors down from A Bronx Tale Musical Theater. Just imagine coming out of the hotel every night to a traffic jam and large crowds. Definitely prepares you for the crowd you will encounter throughout the city. Overall I was ok with it. If the price is right I may stay here again but not my first choice.

Six of us stayed at this hotel during November 2017. We loved the hotel. Our room was perfect for our needs enough space for us all. November was very cold it was great to come back to a very warm room. We were on the 10th floor looking out on to the street and amazing view of the sun rising in the mornings. The room had tea/coffee making machine 2 double beds and a set of bunk beds. The bathroom was huge more of a wet room perfectly designed. The staff were all very courteous and helpful when needed. Our wee housekeeper was lovely and our room was always spic and span. The location of this hotel could not have been any better, just off Broadway and perfect for all the activity New York has to offer. We were right across the street from Springsteen on Broadway and we even managed to get a photo of the Boss as he greeted the crowds outside waiting on his arrival. I could not fault The Gallivant Hotel it's perfect and when I return to New York I'll not stay anywhere else.

the rooms are very small, so is the bathroom.the noise from the air-conditioning system was loud enough.beds not very comfortable,the positives sides are the helpful staff and the great location.at that price, you could find some better choices

We had two rooms on the 8th floor. Very small. Could hear noise from the street ALL night. The thing that really pissed me off was the extra charge of $25.00 per room after the fact that they said was for an urban fee whatever the hell that is.

I stayed here 22/3 for 3 nights with my 20year old daughter. It was perfect for our needs. We used the recommended shuttle bus from JFK and they were efficient and n time. Check in at the hotel was quick and friendly. We had room 1005 which is a double room. It was quite spacious for NYC hotel and we had a small balcony overlooking city blocks. The bathroom is very modern and clean with good quality toiletries. And plenty of towels. The room was very hot and although there is air conditioning it is very noisy and had to be turned off at night. The lifts were fairly quick each time. The main good point of the hotel is location. Less than 5 min walk to times Square. About a 15 minute walk to macys or empire state building. About the same in opposite direction to central park. There are two theatres almost next door, Bruce Springsteen is in one and we just happened to see him leaving the theatre one night. The bronx tale is in the other theatre and its a brilliant show.The hotel has free good WiFi and the extra taxes are only $15 per room per night.I'd highly recommend the gallivant all round

The room sizes are average but this is Times Square we are talking about! You won't get a reasonably priced room so I'd pick this one as you are in the middle of everything and the service at the hotel is good and friendly.

Friendly staff, fantastic location couldn’t recommend enough 5 stars. We stayed for 5 nights the rooms are adequate clean and comfy beds. Lots of people advised against staying in time square due to it being ‘too busy’ but that is nonsense Stay in Time Square and Stay at the Gallivant

I took my daughter to NYC for her 21st birthday and at first, having read some of the negative reviews, I was somewhat reticent to book this hotel. However, I’m glad I went with my gut instinct and booked it anyway. It was a fantastic location. The staff upgraded our room as it was a special occasion and were so lovely when we checked in. The rooms are basic but they’re clean and the rooms are serviced every day. No complaints whatsoever. Would definitely stay again. I’m not sure why people moan though. Room sizes are never going to be huge - it’s NYC and the only thing you do in your room is sleep, shower, change and then you go and explore the wonderful sites.

Perfect in every sense of the word! Excellent location where the action is - walking distance to Times Square, shopping, food! Our family of 5 stayed in NYC from Dec 18-27. Booked this from Dec 18-20 and regret moving to another hotel for the rest of our stay. Excellent family room for 5 people, excellent service, 24 hours front desk. Will definitely choose this hotel again!

This hotel could not be in a perfect location for anything/anywhere in Manhattan. Steps to Times Square and theaters, several metro stops and easy walk to Hudson River piers. Rooms were nicely appointed, albeit a bit small, but hey, your in NYC, all the apts/rooms are small. Breakfast is coordinated with the Asian restaurant next door....it's "meh". Be sure you understand what you are paying for....the restaurant staff will be on your A*% in a second for additional fees if you mistake an "American Breakfast" item for a "Continental Breakfast" item...kind of off putting.I don't know if I will ever get used to the aggressive/unfriendly nature of the folks who work in NYC and this hotel is no exception. Their were some lovely folks at the front desk and some not-so-lovely folks. You won't know which one you are getting until you ask for help or need information. Best of luck to you here.Elevators...not so reliable. Take a room closest to the ground floor in case you need to take the stairs.Housekeeping, pot luck. We stayed here for 5 days and not once were the sheets changed on the bed (I know because I made a small stain on the edge of the sheet...still there when we checked out). There was also a dried coffee (I think) spill on the floor that was still there when we checked out...mopping the entire floor clearly not a priority either. The bathroom, on the other hand, was meticulously cleaned....very nice to see.Overall, if location is your priority...this one is a winner. The other features are probably comparable to other area hotels.

We have visited the hotel in march. The location is great, easy to reach all the famous restaurants and places, Time Square is just 5 min. walk.The room was quite clean, has everything you need.Lobby was also very attractive however missing the bar, which is on the pictures.And let's see the other side.Elevators got wrong every day.When we arrived the receptionist just ask for my passport and credit card details with a really boring face.House keeping staff were yelling on the corridor from 8-9am, and you can see all the laundry and trash bags doesn't matter what time of the day.When we needed some help from the concierge he just basically sent as away. So all in all, the staff really need some improvments from hospitality.I don't think so we will return.

My third trip to NYC and this hotel has been my least favorite (the Stewart Hotel was the best). The location was good for us because we did things uptown, downtown and midtown. Check in was uneventful; room wasn’t ready early which was ok, but the front desk lady wasn’t very friendly and when we placed our bags with the bell hop, we were charged $2/bag in cash. Which I assume covers his “tip”. I always tip bell hops but this requires you to do so. Weird. As other reviews have stated, our room was small too, the bathroom was very tiny and the view was through a dirty window, but we can handle all this. It’s the elevators that irritated us. There are only two guest elevators with a max capacity of 7 people and one was out of order. So the wait time for a ride down 8 floors was very long. We took the stairs but a lady in high heals isn’t very happy to start the day like this. Breakfast is served buffet style in the adjoining lobby restaurant Ding. Lots of stuff to note here. The quality is low budget buffet quality, but the price is $19.99/person? However, the lady who poured coffee approached us to propose a deal for our breakfast. If we agree to come back again, she would charge us $16/person. Had to pay her in cash as well. Again weird. Finally, check out was uneventful and we had an evening flight out so we put our bags back with the bellhop and again paid him $2/bag. We booked the hotel shuttle with the concierge, and were charged $60, again in “cash” so back to the ATM. We were told pick up was 3:25 pm. We’re waiting in the lobby by 3:20 when we were abruptly scolded and rushed out to the shuttle by the same concierge and when I boarded the packed shuttle was again scolded by all the passengers that had been waiting for us. Not a nice way to end a stay. I really understand hotels and resort fees because they include perks and amenities and while on vacation I appreciate those nice touches but I didn’t get any nice little perks here. It seemed like everyone was out for their own little scam.

Stayed at the gallivant in march this year.The hotel is in a great location .But the rooms are tiny and the view out of the bedroom window was of a shabby rooftop and alleyway. Staff not very helpful won't be going back.

Super helpful and friendly! Because of Jose Corporan, I will return again in the future because of the superb customer service that was extended during my stay! Service like his is rare and I appreciated the ease and attentiveness he provided.

Very good location very close to time square. Hotel was clean rooms where a bit small but really how long do u spead in your room it was cleaned everyday clean bed clothes and towels. Hotel was warm we needed it because it was so cold outside. The only downside I have was we were on the 2nd floor with no view which was disappointing also was very now is at night with traffic and there was also a fire station at the end of the street which didn't help. We never ate or drank at the hotel so can't comment on that. Overall we were happy enough

Stayed here for 5 nights in March and we couldn't fault it. We were late so they checked in on our behalf, the staff ( especially the bell man) couldn't do enough for us. The rooms are not that small despite what other reviewers have said and you're hardly ever in the hotel anyway. You have free WiFi and it's so close to time square. Would definitely stay again :)

Situated close to Times Square on 48th street and Broadway this is handy for all attractions. Subway Terminals and All the top on how off busses within 2 blocks.The rooms are basic but warm and clean.Plenty of places to eat nearby.

Have read some unfair reviews of this hotel. Obviously, the location could not be better. The hotel is seconds from Times Square and right in the middle of the Broadway theatres. The room we had was “compact” ie small, but there appears to have been recent renovation and the decor is smart contemporary (Malmaison style). The rooms are very well serviced and have a coffee machine, plus supplies, which is very handy. Particularly nice toiletries too. We also found the staff to be friendly, pleasant and helpful.

4.5 circlesI booked this hotel through a third party site. I was nervous about what to expect given some of the reviews here. Don't believe everything you read! I booked a shoebox with twin beds which was fine for one night. This hotel is in the Times Square area, off the beaten path a bit. It's about a 15 minute walk from Grand Central. The lobby was beautiful and fancy. We were checked in right away and were told we would be "upgraded" to a room with three beds for free. Yes the elevators are small and European style. Maximum capacity is 7 people! We only had a few small bags as we were only staying overnight.The 9th floor is very nice. We had a corner "premium" room with one set of bunk beds and a queen bed. The bunk beds are built into the wall and can be folded up when not needed. We had a bit of a tough time folding up the top bunk by ourselves but it stayed put halfway up! The room is very very nice. The wall was decorated with a nice map of the area and the bunk bed half was separated from the queen bed area by a half wall (the bunk beds are against this wall). Both sides of the room featured a window with city view, 2 windows on the queen size side, individual climate control and each side has a TV. The beds are made in white linens with multiple pillows of varying softness and a plump duvet. The beds are very comfortable. The windows have double shades and you do have to look closely to find the pull chain on the left of the window to draw the night shade down. Otherwise you get lights from the street below. Once the shade is closed, the room is dark. Climate control worked great. We put the air conditioner on when we arrived and then shut it off at night. My sister put the heat on in the morning when she woke up. I thought the heat was too much. The room also featured a small closet with safe and plenty of space to hang our coats and a coffee maker and coffee.The bathroom was kind of hard to find. It was hidden in the corner of the room across from the Queen bed. The bathroom was quite nice. My sister loved the shower. It's a small bathroom but fit "fluffy" women just fine. My only quibbles are that the wifi didn't seem to work and since we both had phones with data plans, we didn't call the tech support number and ask. Also, the elevator floor was dirty with food wrappings and such in the evening when I went to get ice. We had a very nice stay. There are a couple of theaters in the area. Wicked was about 2 blocks down and Once on This Island is next to Wicked. My sister took pictures but hasn't sent them to me. If she does, I'll add them later.

I like many of you was worried... don't be. We had a great holiday. It's was just myself and my young daughter exploring the city and this was a fab base. All the staff couldn't be more helpful! The computers are there to print off tickets and boarding passes they take great care of your luggage on the last day for next to nothing and it's clean. It's so central to everything and there is a little sweet shop a couple of doors away for snacks in the room. Bathroom is tiny but shower was amazing. Bed comfy and although quite small everything you needed was there. Heating is their only problem it was boiling!! New York was mild in weather while I was there .. I wasn't able to turn it off but I played with the dial and could stop it blowing BUT the windows opened in our room so it didn't bother us and we just listened to the city and cooled down that way. We forgot some items and they were found and logged with lost property etc. When I called them they started to arrange them to be posted but luckily a friend collected them in the end. We had one night of banging doors and hallway shenanigans and the staff there couldn't have been more apologetic and helpful about it. I would stay here again! Top tips ... juniors for brunch Tony's for dinner and Ellen's stardust diner instead of a broadway show!!

We arrived late in the evening, check in was quick and easy. We got to our room (202) and was disappointed to find it was tiny and very very dark! To get into the shower, you had to stand over the toilet breathe in as much as possible and try to close the door, only then could you get into the shower. When you did, it flooded the entire room as the glass pane didn't cover much of the splash at all. In order to get into the bed I had to go from the bottom and climb up as the aircon/heating unit was immediately at the side of me. Because of the lack of room there was a clear lack of cleaning as the floor was covered in layers and layers of dust! We tried getting into the safe which was locked, called reception and was told only the manager has the codes to unlock them and he/she wouldn't be in until 9am the next morning so we had to carry around our passports/money etc with us around the city. As I say, the room was extremely dark, for some reason the lights are situated right in the corners of the ceiling and not in the middle and so the walls were slightly lit up, but nothing else. It was such a depressing room! We couldn't even open the blinds as we were overlooked by other rooms and you don't want your neighbours to see you with no clothes on and I don't like to look at brick walls and tarpaulin. We went to reception the next morning and asked to switch rooms, the only one they had was 227 on the same floor, it had the same view but thankfully I didn't have to close the door to use the toilet or shower and I could walk around to the other side of the bed! The shower still flooded the bathroom every-time leaving you with constant wet towels but it was somewhere to sleep. This hotel is classed as 'luxury' and I must say there is nothing luxury about it, you even have to pay to hold your bags in the storage room once you check out, EVEN AFTER PAYING ALL THAT MONEY FOR A ROOM!The hotel was in a great location I think that's the main highlight.

After reading previous reviews I was really worried about my stay here but my experience was nothing like what I was expecting. I emailed in advance to ask about extra payments and security deposits, I received a quick response with all the information I required so I could budget accordingly and avoid any costly surprises.The room was plenty big enough for me. There was plenty if space for my luggage and the bathroom was mire than adequate. Staff were always friendly and helpful and the room was cleaned and towels replenished daily. The heating/air conditioning unit was a little loud so I turned it off but it wasn't the deafening noise that I've seen reported on here.The location is perfect for the tourist, Times Square and Broadway on the doorstep and any train I needed within a 5 minute walk. Yes it's noisy outside but if you won want noise don't stay in Times Square, one if the busiest places in earth.Will definately be returning to New York and will definitely be staying here when I do.

The hotel was clean, no bad smell, sufficient for our needs - just sleeping. It is in a need of an update, no view from our room window - looking at another block. Our room was small but ok just for my daughter and myself. However, great location, ok for a short break!

Hotel was clean, but the rooms are so much smaller than what they look inThe photos. I had a deluxe queen room and I had to ask at the reception if they put me in the right room because the bed looked like a double! The windows to look outside were dirty. Just overall not really what I expected, doesn’t look like the photos.

Perfect location for a trip to NYC! The hotel is right off Times Square, but is close to everything, we walked pretty much everywhere! The rooms are a lovely size aswell and the bathroom! The only thing was we found somebody else’s sock under the bed after being there for 5 days but this wouldn’t put me off staying here again, it was cheap and in a great location.

You cant get better for location for this hotel. It is however very basic. Our first room was on the 9th floor. It was tiny.....and I mean tiny, smallest hotel room I have ever seen. It looked worn and a bit tatty,broken light switch, plug socket etc. However we were just sleeping there so just shrugged it off. Woke up at 5am due to time difference....tv didnt work we spoke to reception who said TVs did not work on the 9th floor or above. They offered to move us rooms so we did.Second floor, kingsize room.....much better, still basic but back to normal hotel room size, bathroom bigger than a cupboard.My advice if you book, go for the bigger room.The staff at this hotel are lovely and cant do enough for you. No complaints there.The laundry trolley was left outside our room for the entire stay...not a good look as it was about 6ft tall and 3 ft wide...just little things like that let the hotel down. We enjoyed our stay, would we stay again....prob not just because we prefer a bit more standard style hotel room but if you are looking for a base, great location, clean rooms there is nothing wrong with this hotel.

Stayed in a family room with three teenage children. Bathroom surprisingly large, bedroom fit two double beds, one single bunk, all luggage and still room left over. Staff were helpful at all times. 2min walk to times square.restaurant is next door for breakfast,but there are so many other choices around it doesn't matter. Happy to go back at any time, was great value for money.

I recently stayed here for a Bachelorette Party and we had a great time! Five of us stayed in the family room, number 714 and the room was exactly as pictured online. I found the gallivant through my travel agent shoreluvtravel.com and we booked it through bookings.com. It was super easy and the price was amazing for a room in Times Square! The description was accurate and I was very happy with the hotels interior throughout and more importantly the size of the room. This room is perfect for groups of friends or families. There was a good amount of space and a huge bathroom with double sinks and mirrors. It was fine for 5 girls to get ready! The beds and pillows were comfortable. The only downside was that this room did not have a good view at all and we were thinking it may have been over dumpsters because when we opened the window it smelled really bad! We were on the 7th floor so not too sure but once the windows were closed the smell was gone! The room was very hot when we arrived but we just waited for the AC to turn on instead! Not a huge deal! We didn’t mind not having a view because we were going out anyway! Overall, I would recommended this hotel to anyone traveling to Times Square who wants to be near all the action. Everything was so close! The staff was very friendly and checking in and out was super easy!

We stayed here for Valentine’s Day 2018.Absolutely lovely hotel! The location is ideal! Super central and ideal for nipping back to freshen up/have a quick rest!We were checked in really quickly 13/02/18!Room is small but has everything you need for a short stay! Didn’t spend much time in the room anyhow as too busy out exploring the city. Bed is super comfortable. There was a extension lead already in the room with 3 extra plugs as well 4 usb sockets for charging phones etc. No issues with TV worked fine.Shower was great, really powerful and had various settings! Complimentary toiletries too.Seen a few bad reviews on the air conditioning noise or not working we didn’t have this issue it worked perfectly well for us! Room had WiFi and coffee machine. We ended up getting the bus from port authority back to the airport (Newark). Think was about $16 dollars each which is really cheap in comparison to a taxi! Only about a 10 minutes walk away from the hotel too!We really had no issues with this hotel, it was lovely and we really did have a fabulous stay! Have no complaints at all! Would definitely stay again and recommend to friends and family!

From check in and an upgrade to check out this hotel delivers excellent service and value for money. Clean,quiet and tidy room with fresh linen and towels every day. Bed very comfortable and coffee machine worked with coffee etc renewed each morning. Location could not be bettered with Times square minutes away and many places to eat and shop. Theatres close enough to walk to and all tour buses within easy walk to join. Check in procedure for our flight home was done very efficiently by Antonio, desk receptionist which was an enormous help. Overall I will return and can recommend to any one reading this review.Thanks Gallivant hotel.

This hotel is bang on Times Square so first of all expect noise! I was with a large group therefore didn’t have a choice over the hotel. I have visited New York before and my honest review would be this is not the location I would choose...expect to here sirens, tooting, fire engines all throughout the night. This hotel also seems a heavy favourite with school trips - so that may be something you don’t fancy being roomed next to!On the surface the rooms are extremely comfortable. The bed, pillows and linen are great quality! The shower was great but you do have to let it run for 10 minutes until it turns hot. Once you’ve spent your first night you do start to notice the upkeep isn’t to a high standard, there were lots of marks, cracks, scuffs on the paintwork and didn’t feel overly fresh or clean.There is no plug socket near the bed, which was annoying. Having to charge your phone overnight at the complete opposite end of the room on the desk. The air con/heating is a huge boxed vent in the room, which is extremely noisy when on however it is a better alternative to opening the windows and the noise kind of drowned out the traffic noise.There was no fridge in my room, therefore the milk provided was powdered, not an ideal way to start the morning. Facilities in the room are good - iron, hairdryer, safe etc.The room is made up everyday - although I did return early to find a maid sat at my desk using my iPhone charger to top up her battery. There are only two lifts in use at the hotel and only allow 7 people at a time. They’re extremely slow, it also doesn’t help this hotel is oversubscribed by schools, so you are often waiting for a whole school to have gone up and down in 7s before you can get in yourself. I did often take the stairs to the 14 floor don’t recommend after a full day of walking! All staff were extremely friendly!

The hotel is in a great location, 30 seconds from Times Square.. No food option within the hotel from what we saw, but you don’t really need it with everything that’s outside.TV didn’t work whilst we stayed for 6 days.Friendly and helpful staff.

Upon arrival of the hotel, we were happy with what we had booked, looked clean and tidy - how a hotel should look. Reception staff very friendly and found them easy to talk to, once we arrived to our room which was located on the 12th floor our first thoughts were the rooms are a lot smaller than they look online, but it suited our needs who go to NYC and spends all their time in the hotel, room was very clean and we always came back from our days out to a clean room, the cleaning staff are brilliant, the downside to the rooms are they don’t come with a fridge which I find a nice thing to have as my wife and I always bring back water to the hotel room so would be nice to keep it cool, maybe this is something the hotel could invest in, however I can’t knock the hotel room itself, we found our main problem was the use of the lifts, they either seem to come straight pass the level you are on and you are left waiting for a while or they don’t come at all, both lifts had broken down on 25/2/18 so we had to use the stairs and as people were coming up and down the stairs which are so narrow it made it even worse, after our day out the lifts seemed to be back to their working order, I just think this is something they need to keep an eye on, also another problem was with the amount of children running riot in the hotel messing around with the elevators and running off after they had called for them, don’t get me wrong I was a child once and use to the find the funny side but when you are standing with crowds of people waiting to get to the higher levels stairs aren’t really a good option, I think the amount of children were there together on a school trip, all in all we enjoyed our stay and would use the Gallivant again.

If you are about to press the book button on a third party site like hotels.com or etc, compare the wording of what you are booking to Gallivant’s actual site. They do not have a Queen double standard. You will either get one I single full size bed or 2 twin size bed. We know because 2 grown men got thrown into a full-size bed for a night until another room opened up the following day. The cons,1. Rooms are small, not as small as a European or Japan style hotel room, but not much bigger.2. The walls are thin! You can hear everything.3. Only half a shower door exist, so water will splash everywhere. 4. The heater/AC is either noisy or does not work correctly. Our first room, once we turned on the heater, we could not get the off button to work. When it turned on, it literally would scare us. Our second room, we had to use the AC because the room was oddly hot! The heater was either running or something was warming our entire room through the day.5. Sheets are not changed, ask to get the sheets changed or you will find some hidden stains. 6. There is no bar, just 2 sit down restaurants that are connected.7. The fitness center is smaller than the rooms, with not much space for anything. 1 treadmill, 1 bench and weights, 1 elliptical, vending machine and a water fountain. No tvs by the way. 8. The TV are either old or not setup correctly because the images were cut off on top and button and no way to adjust.There are some pros1. The fitness and business center is 24 hours.2. Time Square is less than 5 minute walk.3. The train stations for all points are only a few blocks, including the ones connecting to JFK airport.4. The staffs are friendly enough.5. The decor was not to outdated. If you are on a tight budget or just need a 1 to 2 day stay, is a heavy sleeper, and opted for the least expensive room, this is an ok choice.

My wife was over in new York for 5 days with her friend they checked in and were shown to their room they had booked a twin queen and got a basic double room and got told it was an upgrade I don't think so . They payed for 2 beds not one total rip off they were told they would change them back on Sunday the day they left

First, let me start by saying we are seasoned NYC travelers and have stayed in every location, in every borough, and paid numerous rates. We paid an unheard of price ($117) for being so close to Times Square. For those that are claiming a small bathroom, we have seen smaller and in much worse shape and the room size is not uncommon, but we do love the renovations they've made on the old "TRYP" hotel. There are much worse places to stay for twice the price. Although the elevators are small we didnt find the short wait or the size much of a problem. The lobby is small but modern and clean. We didn't eat at the restaurant buy why would you when you've got numerous great choices within easy walking distance. We will be back!!

Great stay great location room nice and clean done daily. Staff friendly would stay again! Well worth the price has ice machines in hall which was good. Breakfast next door looked nice but we didn't stay

The room is SMALL, the free bottled water came in handy after a long day of walking through NYC and the elevators were fine during a busy holiday season. Next time I want to stay somewhere bigger but I know I will have to pay a lot more. Gallivant was clean and safe and I am happy overall I choose this location.Come to find out on the last day I did not have the room I booked but what can I do now? I guess it is kind of my fault for not catching it when I checked in.

Staying in Manhattan, especially Times Square is a 50:50 risk unless you are will to pay big money, you have to take the medium and lower priced hotels with a pinch of salt and make the most of them, you are there for the city visit not the inside of the hotel room. Very happy with hotel location, reception, check in etc, got a twin room as requested, high up, so it was quiet. Don’t be in a rush the lifts are slow. Upon arrival in the room, couple of things, space is limited, but if you have been to NY before you will know that. I always check under the bed and to my disgust found a 10 day old box of left over chicken wing remains from Hooters. Lovely. Secondly my bed sheets and pillow were covered in long black hair strands from the last lady who stayed in the bed. I had to question if they sheets were even changed? I slept on my jacket as a pillow for duration of my stay. Didn’t even bother asking reception as I don’t expect it would be dealt with.I’m not putting the hotel down as a whole, but cleaning needs to do some extra checks to prepare each bedroom. Overall my stay experience here was ok and not as bad as a lot of the comments make out. I just ask the management team to put a bit more focus on cleanliness and care to stop all these negative comments coming in. They reply to a lot of people saying they will look into it, but it’s obvious that doesn’t really happen. It’s a shame because this hotel has a lot to offer guests going to visit the Big Apple !!One last thing- if booking through any of the hotel discount sites, just be aware the online price does not include all the taxes and city taxes and tourist taxes and Times Square taxes that the hotel add on per night to your bill!!! It adds up.

So after many hours of planning our first visit to NYC we decided to stay at the Gallivant Times Square. There is plenty of mixed reviews here on TA, but for the price we paid for 5 nights we really couldn’t turn it down. First of all I would just like to say what a great hotel it turned out to be. Check in was really quick and that’s what’s needed when you arrive at 1:30am. They do ask for a credit card on arrival to keep on file. Next the room... I see people saying the rooms are small but your in NYC you get what you pay for BUT our room was pretty spacious for a double. Large double bed very comfortable, only downside to the room was the bathroom and I agree with other people’s reviews they are small. The location of the hotel is perfect. Basically a minute walk and your on Times Square. (Amazing). Plenty of places around the hotel for food and drinks. Only problem we found is that there is a fire station just around the corner and there is plenty of sirens coming from them at all times of the night. But who needs sleep it is NYC after all. (Lol). But seriously it really is a great hotel. Rooms are great, staff extremely friendly and helpful, location is perfect. A big thank you to the staff at the Gallivant hotel for making our first visit to NYC a great one. Keep up the great work.

Stayed here for 3 nights in January , check-in fast but then got asked for a Credit card for a breakage deposit , not everyone carries a Credit card but still had to pay it which we were not told about , got to our room and couldn’t believe how small it was, to get to the shower we had to go between the toilet and sink to shut the door , bed was tiny and i had to share a double with my cousin , good job we didn’t mind but did not get offered a twin bearing in mind they could see we was two females, our heating system kept leaking water which we reported and got told it was fixed but it still kept leaking, had to phone down one night because the shower was freezing all we got told is it would be sorted but never saw anyone come to fix it and everyday we had to to reboot our key cards cause both didnt work, the good side is its in a central location and is not a 2 minutes walk to Times Square , Wouldn’t really stay here again as there are better hotels around the area , bit of a disappointment really

Avoid room 900. Noisy lift right beside it. Bed too small for two people. Got small double while having requested twin room. Great location but that’s all. Air con noisy too so had to leave it off. Bed was very comfy but not suitable for two. Good shower. Great area in Times Square but plenty other hotels for same price with more space.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel and room at first glance looks lovely! After spending a few hours at the hotel we were able to pick out flaws in the room. The shower would spray all over the floor in the bathroom. There was a weird mould growing at the bottom of the shower glass. Our TV was not working, when we phoned down to reception, they said that all TV's weren't working. We had only just checked in so it would have been nice to have been told then. The first morning we used the coffee provided. When we left to go out for the day, I left a note asking if we could have some more coffee and sugar. The cleaner had been to give us fresh towels but the coffee had not been topped up, the bin had not been replaced either. So we then had to go down to reception to ask for more. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay a lot! The hotel is very central to time square which was great! Bad points aside, I would stay in this hotel again as these are points that can be changed! Thanks for a great stay!

I wanted to write a review on the hotel because whilst we had some initial issues with the room itself we spoke to the manager about the heating and tv not working. The manager was very accommodating and kindly upgraded us to a king room. The rest of the stay we had no issues at all. We enjoyed the rest of our stay here at gallivant. The staff were welcoming and friendly. Our room was cleaned everyday. Excellent location to all the main attractions in NY. What I would say is look further afield for your smaller restaurants away from time square for good deals and great food. We would definitely come back to visit. Loved it!!!

Great central location by Times Square. Friendly staff. Room was an ok size, bathroom really small. Bathroom squeezed in a toilet,small shower and tiny sink just enough room to open and close the door. Overall good base to stay as not in the room much. Didn't eat at the hotel as too many places to try!

Found the hotel to be a very good budget hotel. The trip was for my boyfriends 40th and I would like to thank all the staff for looking after us so well, from making the room clean and tidy each day. On arrival we were upgraded to one of the penthouse suits, Very quiet inside. The noise level outside was pure New York and loved it.The hotel is perfectly situated, so close to Times Square. This was my first time in New York (my boyfriends second) and we will be back

nice hotel great staff very helpfull great location just of times square we got a free upgrade on arrival after our first room allocated was flooded did not eat at the hotel to expensive much cheaper diners locally

Fantastic hotel! Stayed for three nights at the end of our honeymoon. Really friendly staff and clean rooms. Thought the rooms were a good size compared to others we have stayed in in NYC, for a similar price. Comfy bed and excellent shower. Modern bathroom and great facilities provided. A bit noisy - but you’re in the middle of the city! It’s to be expected and it’s really not that bad. The location is amazing! The concierge was so helpful and worth chatting to. Thanks for an amazing stay! We’ve already recommended you to friends.

Great hotel in excellent location. Particular thanks to the concierge staff Antonio (Pepe le pue ) and Suny for their friendly disposition and helpfulness. Clean room, delicious in room coffee. Only drawback was the noise outside..but the sirens etc added to the NYC vibe.

Great Hotel, Friendly staff, Nice room, shower and bathroom, comfortable bed, clean and sheets changed daily. Towels also. Super shower, TV, charging points. Room safe. Great location, 2 mins from Times Square hustle and bustle. Would stay again. would recommend.

We arrived to the hotel quite late about 12am after the long flight - staff very friendly and polite and gave us a bottle of water each as we were exhausted. Was a bit nervous as the reviews on here aren’t great, but they aren’t wrong. This hotel is great if you are on a budget and you only get what you pay for, rooms quite small. The worst bit was there was no safe in our room (the most important bit!) so we’re moved to a better slightly larger room with a safe. Also in this room the shower was cold and wouldn’t go hot but an engineer came out to fix it. On the plus side the bed is very comfy and the pillows are a good size. The shower very powerful and not pathetic. Very central location, obviously you can hear traffic but you can anywhere in NYC. great for travellers on a budget and only around the corner from Times Square. Within waking distance of 5th ave, trump tower, Empire State etc. There is also a hair dryer in case any women are wondering and the WiFi is good and strong for FaceTime/ Skype calls.

Myself and my daughter stayed for 5 nights in January..after reading some bad reviews we where a bit worried what to expect...on arrival the lady at reception was very welcoming and gave us our room 1408 ...yes the room wasn't huge but we didn't travel to New York to stay in the hotel room all day/ night...very clean, towels changed everyday, room cleaned everyday not got a bad word to say about any of our stay there...spot on location for everything and 5 minutes from the hop on hop off buses we used for our city pass...also we had tickets for wicked at the Gershwin theatre which was only 2 streets away..perfect...would we stay at the gallivant on our next New York trip? YES!! That goes without saying!! Thank you guys for making our stay so amazing!;

Stayed here 3 nights with my wife.. We regularly visit NYC, this place is a good location geographicly, Cloe to Times Square.Our room was tiny,with the smallest double bed I've ever seen, just enough room to walk round between the walls At the foot end of the bed was a 3 drawer unit, with a tray on top housing a coffee machine . That was all the furniture except a flat screen television in the side wall. The shower/ wc was small but clean in an adjoining little room.The room service trolley was left in the corridor all day after rooms were serviced. I assume they have converted the store cupboard where it would normally reside into another guest room.... In fact I suspect the one we were in.Hotel was OK, a bit like a youth hostel really... Dark grey corridors, elevators were like riding a yo-yo. You get in on 2 ,press 1 and go up to 10 back to 6 then up again... All over the place ....Place is clean though but don't bring a cat cos you won't be able to swing it

We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of January. The room was everything we needed. Central location, perfect for getting up and getting out the door to explore. The room was clean, towels replaced every day. Reception helpful and modern looking (loved the New York wall paper feature wall on our room). Big thing for me is a long hot shower and checked that box as well. I read review where people complained about the noise from the street. It's New York. There is noise. It is not the hotels fault people been there horn NON STOP. Heaven only knows what the NY drivers think it will solve. But if you want to avoid street noise, go to the country side or the desert. Not Manhattan.

Beautiful hotel lovely service we stayed here for 3nights before heading back to England it was a brilliant location within walking distance to central park we went to see Chicago loved it will definitely return to New York xx

I was in NYC for 8 nights with my boyfriend in Jan. It was our first time so we of course wanted something Central, after that as long as the bed was comfy we knew we'd be happy. Well The Gallivant certainly didn't disappoint! 2 minutes walk from the middle of Times Square, rooms are cosy in terms of size, all en suite, extremely comfortable bed, modern decor which made what is a bit of a dated hotel feel very stylish and unique. We honestly didn't spend much time in the room except for sleeping and getting ready in the mornings, after that we usually didn't return til the night. For tourists it's the perfect option. There's no restaurant in the hotel but I believe the Chinese next door does breakfast at a reduced rate. However with so many various options within a 10 minute walk we decided against trying the Chinese so I can't vouch for it. Staff are polite and friendly. Concierge was lovely and set us up on the shuttle bus to JFK for our return journey, $55 though so not much cheaper than a taxi but certainly more comfortable and easier to manage with luggage. There's PC & printing facilities in the hotel free of charge which was much appreciated by us as we had tickets to a few shows and games that we couldn't print until the day before. Bed was made every day and towels renewed, just remember to leave the Do Not Disturb sign up until leaving or else you will likely have knocks on the door at 7am. Hotel lobby is gorgeous. Ice dispenser and water machine on our floor (4th), not sure if these are on every floor. Overall, this hotel suited us perfectly and we hold it in very high regard, especially considering we got a very competitive price. Thank you to The Gallivant!

After reading a lot of the YELP reviews on this establishment, I was very close to cancelling my reservation. However, I decided to give it a chance. Afterwall, I came to NYC with the intention of exploring the city and really only needed a room to relax and sleep at night. For that purpose, this place nailed it. Room was pretty small, but all I needed for a night. Location is prime, service was good, and room was clean!

I arrived on the 26/01/18 with my daughter and was absolutely taken aback by the kindness of the staff at the reception as they could see that I was not very well as i had a really bad cold virus, the staff asked if there was anything they could to help me to make it easier for me , I said if I can get a good nights sleep it might help thank you any way . After 2 nights I couldn't take the air con as it was not working and my coughing was getting worse so myself and daughter asked at reception about the air con and the lady at reception was so very helpful that she gave us the room next to the one we had which the air con was working and the rest of my stay was really good. There is no words that I can express my appreciation how helpful , pleasant,friendly your staff are. I cannot fault your hotel and staff at all, I would recommend your hotel to everyone. I hope that I will get another opportunity to stay at your hotel in the near future. Thank you.

I was a bit wary about visiting here after seeing the reviews, though had no issues with the hotel directly . Arrived at 12ish room was ready which was nice , room was tiny but clean enough a few cosmetic issues dogedy paint work and bits that needed attention. Rooms get really warm so rarely used the heating , house keeping good . Could hear the rooms along the corridor and guests kindly slamming and shouting outside the door though not the issues of the hotel . Location was good , though walking through Times Square daily was tiring constant people selling and asking you to take cds, and if you said no thank you being claimed to be racist amongst over things left a sour taste in the mouth but I would except the cops to sort this , we would avoid the area if possible which is a shame that’s my only gribe . Bit disappointed to email the hotel three weeks prior to the visit with a request not to get a reply and also no bar at the hotel ! Irish bar next door good though I’m yet to find any reasonable priced food or beer! Anyway good price in a central location

I visited solo for a weekend getaway. Room 1529 was my room. It was spacious, modern, clean, and had an exercise bike and yoga mat. It also had a refrigerator, safe, and iron. The room temperature can be controlled using the wall control. The hotel was kept clean despite it being very busy with guests especially in the lobby area. I did not have any issues except the noise coming from the next door housekeeping closet. It was tolerable but definitely noticeable and unnecessary noise. The location of the hotel is perfect for Times Square.

Couldn’t fault anything in this hotel! Took a yellow cab from JFK (cost $58 plus tip) and reception were very friendly upon arrival. We were in room 1325... we had a balcony!!! Room was lovely, very spacious and bathroom also a decent size. Room had air con, but was easy enough to just open balcony door! WiFi also great throughout hotel. We needed to print out our theatre tickets so went to reception to ask if they could help, to which they pointed to some computers and a printer in the reception area which you could use for free!! Upon leaving our flight wasn’t until 9:30pm, we left our bags with concierge for $2 per bag, and also organised transfers at the desk for $55 back to JFK. Hotel was basically in Times Square, couldn’t have got a better location for the price we paid, and would happily stay there again if we go back to New York.

Great location, unbeatable, the hotel is perfectly adequate in almost every way. Staff were very helpful. As others mentioned though our sleep was disturbed by the heating system, it really was like someone hammering the pipes....atrocious. We were moved to a less noisy room. Regardless I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

After having booked this hotel twice for a return trip a week later, I wish I didn't. My first experience was a shock. The staff were lovely but the size of our room was a shoe-box. shower was lovely but so tiny. Comfortable bed. Second visit was the same size of room - tiny! This time we looked onto a generator which was rather unsightly. (Not quite the romantic holiday stay I thought.) The location was great however, for us first time travellers. Bit of a disappointment after booking quite an expensive hotel in August for such a small room, much better stay in the Manhattan which had a huge room.

We visited in January 2018 and I was a little apprehensive due to some of the reviews on here. However, with our flight being delayed 24 hours they happily moved our booking back a day. The rooms, whilst small hence the 4 star rating, were well equipped, clean and the bathroom was lovely. The location is central to most of the cities attractions and a great place to stay amongst the mania of New York, just don’t expect a view. However, you’ll spend most of your time out and about so it really wasn’t an issue. My only gripe was that there was a small gap from the bottom of the door to the floor meaning you could here movement in the hallway very clearly and being located by the lift we could hear everything.

I admit, some of the reviews made me nervous - but after actually going there (1/25-1/28) I have to wonder if these other folks expected suites at the Ritz? NYC hotel rooms are small - in any hotel. When we walked in we were greeted warmly by reception. They told us our room was ready even though it wasn't even 9 in the morning! We went right up - elevator was waiting at the lobby level. We had a family room - 1414 to be exact and it was perfect. Was the elevator slow? Not really - it could take a while in high traffic times, but that's any hotel. It wasn't very big either - but again - it's NYC - that's pretty typical. Back to the room. There was a closet that was perfect for our clothes and to keep the shopping bags. A little alcove across from the door perfect for our suitcases. A huge bathroom. No, there wasn't a shower curtain - but common sense would tell you to point the shower head towards the far corner and the water doesn't go out into the bathroom. Add the shower mat across the entrance and we never had a problem with water on the floor. Great water temp and pressure even on the 14th floor!The beds were 2 single bunk beds and two double beds as advertised on the web site. huge? no, but they were exactly what was advertised. Very comfortable as were the linens and pillows. Everything was spotless and well kept. Housekeeping came in each day and did a great job! No complaints there. We never ate at the restaurant off the lobby - we went to the Times Square Diner just around the block - We are very picky about food and this is the best diner I've ever been to. It's a very busy place, but even with a wait out the door you don't have to wait long. Food comes quickly, is amazingly good and the service is amazing - such nice people! They are great talking to kids too! If we go back to NYC I will absolutely eat there! As for the hotel overall - the place was amazing - especially for the price and location. So close to everything - restaurants, shops, shows, subways! Best location ever!!!

The good Location The badPokey roomAnyone can enter hotel as there is no security Evidence of forced entry damage on doorsTv didn’t workAircon system didn’t workThank goodness we were here for one night only

If you’re here to be a top tourist. This place is bang on the money location wise. Right next to Times Square and In the heart of the theatre district. It’s perfect, loads of subways around too so if you need to move about it’s super handy. The room is admittedly small but that was expected, and with myself being 6ft my feet did hang off the bed. We also had a leak through our ceiling in the bathroom, these things do happen but at the end of the day, it’s just a place to rest before your next super busy day. All the staff were delightful and overall we had a very enjoyable stay. Fully recommend.

I don’t usually write any reviews but felt an accurate one should. As most people have said the location is second to none. Absolutely amazing location 1/2 minute walk and you’re right in time square. The decor of the hotel is also very nice, room, bathroom and bedroom. Yes the bedroom is small but it has a chair, small wardrobe and chest of draws so it has everything you except. The bathroom is very nice. On the small side. However the shower is a really good size. We spoke to a few quests who said they had issue with the water being to hot but ours was fine. The most common theme was the air con within all guests. At home I can generally sleep through noise but it sounded like there was someone in the room banging continuously all night on a metal pipe. We got to the point where we turned it off and unplugged It and it still continued. It worked and was very good just extremely noisy.For us that was the only real negative. We never had cleaners in our room, we thought it was strange for a hotel as we did see them around but they never came in monday- Friday was our stay. Wasn’t a problem but as I said unusual. For the price it is great, location is everything and it is a very well decorated and pleasant hotel with lovely staff.

I cannot begin to say how great this hotel is for the price and location. The air con made a little noise but worked. The rooms were on the small side but we're comfortable. If people don't like this hotel it's a shame because I will return as it was perfect for the week I stayed. Well done guys I recommend. Reception team were great. Thank you

Hotel is situated just off times square on the road of the MM store.Rather noisey outside if you want to have sleep.Breakfast is nothing special to types continental and American breakfast. Very plain. Some staff nice and friendly.Rooms are ok beds is very soft and showers are nice and powerful.Good to stay to get your head down for few hours.

we arrived 28th de for 3 days. needs updating, no coffee making in room, had to go across the road . wifi didn't work, rooms VERY small, I know nyc hotels have small rooms, but this was redicules, time we got 2 suitcases and ourselves into room, we could hardly move also bathroom very small, just as well Im only 5foot 1.

Superbly placed for the hustle and bustle of Times Square , all the bus tours start nearby on 47th street .Restaurants galore plus your mainstream shops nearby.Hotel good value for money , bathroom not massive but does it need to be any bigger ? Recommended

Spent a week here for a friend's 40th Birthday this was a great location in the centre of Times Square. Only problem was the rooms were too hot and a standard double bed was tiny. My husband is just under 6ft and his feet would hang off the end of the bed. Other than that the hotel was clean, rooms were cleaned every day and the nothing was too much for the staff. Great time spent in NYC.

Beautiful clean nice size room in the heart of Manhattan. The only complaint The room was very very warm, The bed was comfortable but the pillows were spongy.Close to great plays and restaurants. Would return again.

The room was too hot despite turning the heating off and the fan on. It was a choice of not being able to sleep because of the heat or because of the external noise as we had to open the window. There was a constant smell of burning which was unpleasant and worrying.

This hotel was great. In a fantastic location, just off Times Square, amongst everything that's going on but away from it all once inside. Presented lovely, clean and everything provided. Made to feel very welcome. I definately recommend this hotel.

Gallivant hotel 48th street and 8th Ave New YorkWe were travelling in a group of 4 and we were looking for position and economy. We paid over $3000 for 7 nights for a family room that included 2 double beds and 2 pull down bunk beds.The position was perfect for us as we planned on seeing a few Broadway Shows which were an easy walk from the hotel. We were on the 13th floor which had a view over 8 th Ave. The room was larger than expected with a small fridge. We used the 2 bunks for our suitcases which was perfect. The bathroom was large and modern, and all amenities were provided. The subway was only one block down and we used the hop on and hop off bus for a few of our tours. This bus stop was on 8th ave just around the corner and we were also in the heart of Times Square. Check in and check out was efficient, our room was made up each day with fresh towels.On the negative side we were situated above the NY Fire dept and had noise all the time, but for us it added to the NY adventure. We were a little crowded at times sharing one bathroom, however we hardly spent any time in the room other than to sleep. Overall a reasonably priced (for NY) clean hotel, in a great position.

So, we booked this hotel twice in the span of 2 weeks. Unfortunately, we didn't know what we were up against. I won't get into hotel details, feel free to read the other reviews; you'll notice if they really bother or not by the way they haven't actually replied to any replies yet.Robbed.Our stay was during the 'Bomb Cyclone' that hit earlier this year. We had a package that was due to be delivered on the 5th of January. Clearly, due to flight delays, we were unable to wait at the hotel to actually receive the package, so we informed the reception several times that they needed to decline the package. We also suggested that we would cover any additional costs in order to have it collected and shipped to the right address. Convinced by 'Aziz' the staff we were in contact during the whole process that he would ensure that he would 'decline the package and return to sender'; alas nothing has happened. So, 20 days later, and after several emails inquiring about the state of this package, they have confirmed finally that they have 'returned to sender'. Unfortunately USPS confirms that they have actually dropped the package at the reception. Stinks.Feel free to pop into this hotel if your idea of New York is to have a great stinking vacation. The rooms are depressingly old, smell funky and the attitude of the staff are to be blamed.Unprofessional.There's nothing that I could compare in all my travels that would redeem this hotel from any right doings. I've seen hotels in the distant seas of Vietnam, Bangkok and even Bali that have better service and professionalism. Sure, they are situated pretty close to Times Square, but that's not all that New York has to offer!

Small room, but perfectly comfortable for solo traveler making quick theatre-going trip to NYC. Had not anticipated the city noise until 2 a.m. in an upper story room, but I was there the night before New Year's eve and outdoor rehearsals were taking place in Times Square. Doorless shower, which is always a bit annoying for containing water. On the other hand, not a big deal when I'm not sharing the room.

Read a few bad reviews on here before i went to this hotel in January for 4 Nights. Hotel is perfectly located in the Theatre District, only a few minute walk to the always busy Times Square. Reception and Foyer are are very posh and clean. Reception staff were very friendly and give us a late checkout for free. There is 3 lifts and a stair case. But its a long way up if your on a high floor! There is nothing wrong with the rooms, apart from the Bathroom was really small. But manageable. Shower was good, and there was plenty of towels. Heating system worked fine either to heat the room or to cool the room. Overall it was defo worth the money so don't be put off reading bad reviews. See for yourself! Ate out so never tried the attached restaurants.

The location of this hotel is great! 3 minutes walk to the main part of Times Square, surrounded by the theatres of broadway. The subways are very close and easy to use.We stayed here at the beginning of January 2018 following the bad weather which saw some services close in NYC (refuse collection meant rubbish was piled up in every street)The hotel is a quaint little place, small rooms that do get overly hot. We turned our heater off completely however it must have an override on the main system as through the night the noise and heat were not what we bargained for. We had earplugs so the noise was quickly solved, the heat however saw us dampen towels to cool down. 2 main lifts and a service lift which can be used. The staff were polite enough. The hotel service ladies were lovely and very friendly each morning. We would use this location on our next visit to NYC, we’d pick spring or autumn next time though :)

I know you don’t come to New York to stay in the hotel room simply because you are out all hours of the day seeing the city however of the times spent within this hotel, I was really not happy with the level of service provided. First of, upon arriving from the UK, after a long days travelling and tired etc the receptionist checked us in and asked to swipe a card for damage within the hotel room. We had literally taken every penny out of our cards for the trip prior to visiting therefore we did not have $125 to cover the 5 days we were staying and had to inform the receptionist of this. She was not happy and instantly told us we were to ensure of not to touch/break anything within the room; that was fine... until we got to the room - items were already broken!! Including the aircon! (I can imagine this to be hell in summer as the room was absolutely roasting even in winter at all hours of the day). Everything is tatted and needs an entire revamp, towels with stains on them, bed sheets stained, lights not working etc. On top of all this, the maids who visited the room daily have both been really short and rude, cutting me off when trying to explain certain situations (in which I shouldn’t even need to explain myself!!) not acceptable. The very last complaint I have with the hotel is that I cut my finger badly and required a plaster, called downstairs to reception to enquire about providing me with a plaster - pretty universal first aid item - and was told they didn’t have any?? Nonsense! As said in the title, the O N L Y positive of this hotel is the location, everything else was mediocre or below average. Will never return.

Arrived for our stay 26th December booked 2 rooms. One room not ready for over an hour..it should have been available at 3pm. Got in at gone 4pm. Duty manager apologised but said it was down to when the cleaners have finished. Not what I was expecting told me the hotel was not even a 2 star hotel.. when trip advisor rates it at 3.5. Again not expecting that comment. Unprofessional offered a slight discount for one night. Poor service..location and quick turnover is relied upon more than satisfying customers who have paid a lot of money to stay there. That said location is perfect..bar next door very convenient . Would recommend ...just don't expect to get access to your room when expected.

The decrepit aircon / heater unit was housing other guests random socks cocooned in balls of grey filthy dust that had been there literally for years! When I spoke to the maid, she removed the sock only! Whole room has never been cleaned properly & when you strip the bedding, it was covered in a reddish / orange splatter around the edges. Great location, poor standards .....

Stayed in November 2017 to celebrate our 30th birthdays. The location is great. Right in the theatre district and close by to the city tours bus stop.
