The good points: - friendly staff (on the whole) - Well priced for the location compared to others close by and we were out early until late so really just a place to sleep. -Cleanliness in room and public areas was to a good standard and room serviced daily. - no issues with lift that others pointed out so I think it must have been fixed when we visited although you can wait a while for a lift as 2 lifts serve 14+ floors. Points of note.- our heating didn’t work on the 1st night and we had to call down to reception several times and had to physically go down twice to chase for a fix for it. (This actually warmed me up having to do this!) Eventually the heating was fixed but staff in front desk didn’t really apologise for it taking so long to be fixed (around 1 hour but after a long flight and travel from the UK we just wanted to sleep!) - as mentioned earlier the lifts were working during our stay but be prepared to wait for a while as they are small and have to serve 14+ floors. - we were on the back of the hotel and could hear a number of generators but look this is central New York and noise is a given! All in all, I would stay here again for a couple of reasons, the price, location and cleanliness. Did exactly what we needed for our New York birthday stay!

My partner booked this for my Christmas present . The hotel its self is lovely and clean. We had a little problem with our booking but this was quickly fixed by the lovely gentleman behind reception.He then took a credit card in-print but never stated that he would take the authorization off the card for each night.Upon check out my partner noticed that on his banking " The Gallivant " has taken more money out off his account. When we asked about this the lady on reception said that's standard procedure for an authorization and that it will be credited back onto the account. I asked if I could have a written letter stating what they have told me , and the receptionist put me on the phone ( pretty unprofessional) to the manager . The manager stated again that is would go back onto the account ....again all I asked for for was a letter stating what he said. He then said he would get one for me. As I waited for this for about 10 mins the reception said she would leave the letter at reception for me for when I get back for my transfers at 4pm.Once I got back I asked for the letter - and they refused to give me it because I booked via an agent and not direct to them.Now if I didn't work in the hotel industry I would have believed that was the case - but I know that was a lot of rubbish and poor management on their part. You took the autherization - you deal with it.Over all management is shocking - but the hotel is nice and clean ( met the housekeeper - she was lovely and a credit to the hotel).

We stayed at The Gallivant for 7 nights in November/December 17 & found it to be an excellent base for exploring Manhattan. This was our first trip to New York to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary & this hotel was ideal for us. We arrived late in the evening after a long day & checked in quickly with the friendly & welcoming reception staff. Our room on the 3rd floor was a decent size for a couple & had all we needed, a comfortable bed & a decent bathroom with efficient shower & was very clean. We were at the rear of the hotel so we looked out of the windows onto a back street but this had the benefit of not being noisy at night. The room was serviced daily with clean bedding & towels every day & the coffee supplies topped up also. We did not have a great deal of contact with the reception staff but when we did we found them to be very friendly & helpful. We will visit New York again & will book The Gallivant next time as we found it to be all we needed with a sizeable clean room & central location.

Hotel staff are very rude. Not helpful at all. Drafts coming in from window. Heating/air conditioning has a mind of its own... rooms are tiny! Got moved room after first 10 minutes. Air vent hanging off ceiling! Flys in the shower flying around. Disgusting!! Air con/heating makes noises during the night.

We stayed here for 4 nights during the snow in January 2018. The site we booked through called it a "boutique" hotel. I would translate that as little small.However we were not in New York to enjoy the hotel, more so the sights and experiences which this hotel puts you right in the middle of. Just a block from Broadway and the surrounding restaurants and a short subway ride to downtown Manhattan.I would consider using it again as a base to visit New York as long as it was at a discounted price. The hotel restaurant also offers excellent Chinese cuisine if you need something quick before a show.

This hotel is in an excellent location in relation to Times Square. Our room actually came with two twin beds, but they were comfortable. And, having travelled with my 16 y/o daughter, it worked out well. Elevators, doors, baths and rooms are small. They've done a wonderful job maximizing space. I wouldn't recommend the restaurant breakfast. And, if you do eat there, they only accept cash.

I had a dreadful and disappointing experience. Booked for 4 nights but stayed for one. The room was very noisy with all the air conditioning units outside the window and the temperature was locked on 84 degrees. Horrendous after a long evening trip across the Atlantic. Fortunately we were refunded the three nights we didn't stay.

We stayed here for four nights 29/12/17 till 2/1/18 lovely clean hotel comfy and cosy bed to sleep in clean towels everyday hot water for shower warm heating what more could you want after a long day and night out in new york where there is so much too see and do there and as the hotel is in time sq area makes it a brill place too stay ❤

Executive summary:It was a decent hotel, good customer service, great price, phenomenal location. It was my first time in NYC, went for 2 nights, 3 days with a friend for New Year’s Eve. The hotel location was unreal.. any other hotel nearby was going for about 4x the cost. You’re right in Times Square, 5 minute walk to 5th ave and Rockefeller, 10 to Central Park, subway and great food all around. Customer service, concierge all good experiences and fast. Given how crazy their weekend must have been, dealing with sold out guests and security /police for the Ball Drop id say the service was great. Hotel felt safe. For the price, I expected worse! It’s certainly not your 5x glam hotel, but you really get the New York experience and location for cheap. Things to be aware of if you are picky on your hotel. It’s an older building that they’ve done appearance touch ups (new wall paper, New lamented floors). It’s an older elevator but they have stairs if you’re skiddish. It’s radiator heat unit by the window. Small bathrooms and there were some sort of fruit fly like bugs that seemed to reappear in the shower every morning (never saw any bugs in the room, only tiny flies that stayed in the shower). The pipes are older and you can hear them throughout the night, however so too are sirens because you’re downtown NYC so really can’t complain about pipes! The rooms show their age, but again this is downtown NYC. Overall I was very happy to stay here for 2 nights.

This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my life (not being dramatic) and I am a avid traveler. I don't even know where to begin!! I checked in and was shocked at how SMALL the room was even for NYC. I came back to my room at 2am to take a shower and the shower was clogged and started to over flow also sheets were dirty and smelled, so we went to the front desk and the front desk agent accused us of clogging the shower and when we told him we hadn't showered yet he asked why we hadn't showered earlier which was irrelevant and none of his business anyways. He gave us a different room that had a furnace attached to the wall instead of a blowing unit and when we turned it on it made a loud water noise and smelled horrible and the layout of the room made no sense! The next room had no hot water and the heater blew out cold air. The final room he gave us (by this time it was about 4am) was a street view where we heard a flag whipping loudly and dump trucks taking garbage all night long! He was SO RUDE and the maintenance man and the cleaning crew were RUDE and said we were just being picky! The entire hotel was DISGUSTING and a mess! The vending machines took our money and we were not accommodated for ANYTHING THE ENTIRE STAY! When I asked to speak with a manager I was told he was not available to speak with me so we would just have to deal with it. This hotel was located near time square and across from a parking garage that was the ONLY good thing about it! This hotel should be shut down so nobody ever has the experience I had there for New years eve celebration. This hotel RUINED my whole experience!

I stayed at the Gallivant for one night after the Christmas holiday. We arrived at 1:30 understanding that our room would most likely not be available so we took the opportunity to stretch our legs and grab lunch after a long drive. I requested a room on the highest floor possible, and the manager was able to accommodate putting us in a family suite on the 10th floor. We were checked in and in the room by 3:15. The room was spacious and clean, and surprisingly quiet. The only noises I heard were a few sirens around 1am, but I'm a fairly light sleeper and no one else had an issue. The beds were a bit smaller than I expected, but they were comfortable and clean. The bunk beds worked well for 13 and 19 year old girls. The only thing I did not like was the bathroom in our suite. I do not know if it is designed for handicap guests, but there is no separation of the shower and the remainder of the bathroom. The drains prevented any flooding or serious inconvenience, but it was not at all enjoyable for any of us. The shower head and water pressure/temperature were all acceptable. I'm OK with the no shower door/curtain concept in hotels, but this did not have any enclosure to ensure the bathroom would not be completely soaked and could prove to be dangerous. I've attached pictures. The TV was old and outdated and was at an angle where not everyone could get a good view of the screen. This did not matter to us as we did not watch the TV but if you plan on watching TV at all in this room set up, you will be disappointed.The doorman/valet, and everyone at the front desk was extremely helpful and pleasant. It is not by any means a luxury hotel but a solid 3 stars and relatively budget friendly depending on when you make your reservations. My only complaints are the bathroom set up and the teeny tiny slow elevators.As far as location- it couldn't get much better. A few blocks to Rockefeller Center, the Theater District, and Times Square. Late night pizza place close by and convenient to anything you may need during your stay.

We stayed here in December as a couple! The rooms are very small but it's all we needed. Bed was quite small also but again by the time we came home we were just glad to sleep as it was such a busy holiday. Hotel was clean and staff were helpful enough. Location is perfect just around the corner from time square and if you are going here check if Bruce Springsteen is still on broadway as it is just right opposite this hotel and he does a meet and greet before and after the show!

The Gallivant hotel was much more than we had expected and we were pleasantly surprised! From check-in to the cleanliness of the rooms we felt that all staff were very hospitable and welcoming, making our stay an enjoyable one.The location couldn't be better as everything was on our doorstep and fantastic value for money. I would definitely recommend as they are not advertising this as a luxury hotel and serves the purpose as you are barely in the room!Slightly disappointing that you have to pay to hold your luggage in the hotel when you have a late departure. But everything else was great.

Day 1- check in about 7pm, sheets on bed dirty - great! Housekeeper arrived extremely annoyed that we didn't find the dirty sheets acceptable. Day 2- up early to see the sights. Shower breaks. We wait over an hour for it to be fixed. Great! Day 3 - Arrive back in the evening to a blocked toilet ... Great. Day 4 - while packing to leave we find someone else's dirty socks in the corner. Great! So all in all. The location is great for the city centre sights. The hotel however is not 4 star. More like a 3 at best. Staff are certainly not 4 star. In fact I would say the most friendly, personable person we came across was the engineer who came to fix the shower. I'd agree with other reviews, spend a little more and stay somewhere better!

We visited The Gallivant on our honeymoon but we didn’t have a choice because we went to NYC with an agency. Before I choose a hotel to stay I always check it’s TripAdvisor score and when I checked the Gallivant’s I knew what to expect and unfortunately I wasn’t wrong. Definitely not a luxury hotel despite what you see on their site’s photos. So the main facts that disappointed us were:1) the bed was comfortable but small-definitely not a king/queen size, it barely fitted me and my husband.2) the room seemed to lack maintenance on the air conditioning units (broken)3) we could not regulate the room temperature and during the first nights of our stay when it was hot in the city (15 degrees Celsius) we had difficulty sleeping because it was too hot.4) the hotel has three elevators from which one is for the hotel employees and another one most of the times didn’t work. And with 15 floors and I don’t know how many rooms you can imagine what happened at the lobby during rush hours. And the hotel staff didn’t allow us to use the staff elevator even when they saw 15 people waiting for a single elevator!The pros of the hotel are:1) the extremely convenient location.2) the clean sheets and bathroom.

A stone's throw away from times square your close enough to the action but with enough quiet to sleep.Small rooms but your in new york, who spends a lot of time in the Room? Our room had a balcony with a view of times square at the end of the block as well as most of the appartments opposite (they need to learn to close their blinds). Elevators are a pain with normally at least one of 3 out of service for a hotel with 16 floors. When two went out of service it look nearly 20 mins to get from the 13th floor to the ground floor. Staff are ok, though the first thing I got met with was credit card for security deposit. Rooms were tidy and mostly clean, the maids need a mop that reaches the corners of the Room.

The size of the room is fine, not spacious but you only sleep there. The bed is not really comfortable but fine after walking all day. Location is great, only 2 minutes walking distance to Times Square. The hotel employees are very nice.The only negative thing I have to say is about the $5 charge to leave your luggage there on check out day but still have time to enjoy NYC.

Spend a few more dollars and stay at a better hotel. Front desk staff was extremely un-welcoming when I arrived, and as soon as I stepped off the elevator, I knew I had made a huge mistake. The hallway was full of dirty linen, there was a horrible smell and I had to step over garbage to get to my room. I didn't mind that it was so small, but it was so dusty I had to clean everything ( even the bathroom sink) myself and when I picked up the phone to call the front desk ( there was no blanket on my bed) There were dead bugs all over it. There were also ants everywhere. The bathroom, all over the dresser and on the night tables. I called the front desk but nothing was done about it. She just said "I'll let housekeeping know". When I went to bed after doing some sightseeing, I noticed a horrible smell on the sheets, but I was so tired I didnt bother calling the front desk again and just took them off. The bed was very uncomfortable and the mattress was sunk in the middle. I also had to ask a housekeeper for some washcloths as there were none in my room and she was very nice and gave me a couple. The balcony was probably the best part of my room. Too bad it was too cold to spend any time out there. It was my first trip to New York and I had a great time and met a lot of really nice people while I was there, so I will visit again, but will definitely not stay at there again. Don't let the pictures fool you. The nicest part of the hotel is the lobby. They also say on their website that bottled water is provided in each room ( it wasn't ) Not such a big deal, but I also had to practically beg for a tea bag. I should say that the woman who checked me out was lovely and friendly. Where was she hiding during my stay?

My son and I just spent 6 days at The Gallivant. After reading the reviews I was apprehensive but I wanted a boutique type hotel that was close to Times Square as I didn’t want a cookie cutter hotel like the Marriott. When we arrived we were greeted by Tricia, we arrived at 9:30am and told us we could check in right away and gave us a couple of rooms to choose from. The rooms are not large but they were fine. She then upgraded us to a premium room which was very big with a double bed and bunk beds and a wall between us. The hotel is so close to everything we never needed to take a taxi or Lyft. The housekeeping staff were very sweet and accommodating and kept our room clean daily. The hotel staff were very nice. There is a wonderful Chinese restaurant adjoined to the hotel and if you want to see Bruce Springsteen in Broadway then he’s across the street. The elevators are small but again this is a boutique hotel so if your looking for something affordable, close to EVERYTHING and more personable then The Gallivant is perfect and our trip to NY was amazing. Don’t listen to the reviews, take them with a grain of salt and decide for yourself. I already booked my next trip here in February. Thank you Gallivant for making our trip memorable.

We stayed in a family room which was plenty big enough for the 5 of us. Room was clean, well maintained and not too noisy. Now you are in the centre of New York so it’s noisy but nothing more than expected. All staff we encountered were friendly & polite. It’s location is perfect, easily accessible to so much. Now it’s not plush & doesn’t offer any bells & whistles but for a place to lay your head after a mamouth day of walking it ticked all our boxes. We were expecting the worst after reading reviews but our experience was a good one.

Visited hotel early December. I read numerous reviews beforehand and decided to give it a try. I booked it for a great price....I found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. The room was small...to be expected...but clean and comfortable. I would stay there again....great location to Times Square area!

I reserved a tiny (very tiny) single room. I had no idea just how small it was! You literally have just enough room to fit yourself and a couple of suitcases in it lol. But considering you’ll spend most of your time exploring NYC, the size shouldn’t matter. I walked everywhere since it was minutes from Broadway and Times Square. I was happy that it was clean, (some of the negative reviews about cleanliness was misleading- my room was pretty clean). It wasn’t noisy either. I slept like a baby both nights I was there. The bed was comfy (although I’m slightly OCD so I bring my own sheets ad towels) but it looked neat and freshly made. My only complaints were that there was no microwave or fridge available on the entire premises. I asked. But if I see a review that states they are available upon request, then I would be very disappointed in them. I wasted a lot of leftover food because of that. Aside from that, I had another issue. I was supposed to receive a gift item upon check in but it took me 2 days and 3 staff members to finally get it. I booked my room 2 months in advance but next time I’ll shop around. For over $250 a night, I could’ve gone to a chain hotel with better perks.

We arrived at The Gallivant prepared for the worse after what we had read online. Having paid in full 11 months beforehand (including all taxes), we were committed to making the best of it or the other option was we would lose our full payment. Well we didn’t need to worry. We arrived to a warm and friendly welcome from the lady with the fabulous hair. Reception was very clean and modern looking and the lady in front desk couldn’t of been anymore helpful. We arrived at our room (610) to find we had got the actual room we had wanted and booked (unlike what others had said), only it was better than it looked in the photos online. The room is a corner room with 4 windows. As you walk in there are. Ink beds that pull out from the wall and a dressing table and TV. There is a wall divide and the other side of the wall is a huge queen size bed with bedside tables, chest of draws, Another TV and a chair. The view isn’t much, just the brick walls of the surrounding buildings but it was warm, clean and inviting. The bathroom had a huge shower with endless boiling hot water too. There is a wardrobe and two full length mirrors, coffee maker, safe and hairdryer. The Hotel has a Chinese next door that you can get to via a door by the end of the front desk. My hubby and children went the breakfast on our last morning and were both very happy and very full. It is a Buffett style and offers all the English breakfast options, plus tea, coffee, juices and pastry’s too. The reason for dropping a star is that although I was leaving a tip of $5 per day, only the beds were made, the towels changed and the bin emptied. The floor wasn’t swept for the whole of our visit. There is a very helpful lady who sits to the left of the Hotel doors. She knows everything about getting around NYC and will even draw your route into a map. I didn’t catch her babe but she was so helpful. We brought way too much at jersey gardens and asked if we could get a bigger taxi to fit the four of us in with all our bags. She arranged a fabulous suburban to take us to a JFK for only $99. So much better than a yellow cab and my hubby and kids had plenty of room that they actually fell asleep (sorry to the driver for hubby snoring). All in all we as a family of two adults, a 17 year old and a 12 year old, had a great stay at this hotel. I would say to others, don’t read too much into the reviews and make your own mind up. We enjoyed our stay and have recommended The Gallivant to our family and friends. If we come back for a third visit, we would definitely stay here again without a doubt.

We stayed here for a 3 nights on a vacation to NYC. The best thing about the hotel is its central location just off Times Square. Our room was small and hot but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. I would stay here again based on the location alone. We walked to Central Park and even walked back from the 9/11 Memorial which is probably 4-5 miles south. The subway and bus are close. The staff are pleasant. We were at the side or back of the hotel without a view but it was very quiet.

It's ok. But the rooms are tiny and I killed two little harmless but unpleasant bugs nevertheless. Rooms don't seem very clean to me as you'll see balls of dust on the floor. Towels seems clean enough. It was ok because of the location. But otherwise, I think I could have stayed elsewhere.

We stayed here for an anniversary weekend in city, and this place was selected by Priceline for 3.5 stars. I was worried when I saw a lot of bad reviews, so we went in with low expectations. I'm not picky and usually never write reviews, but this place was unacceptable and almost ruined our weekend. We got to our room, which was small as expected.. Room 223 on the second floor. We quickly noticed a mound in the ceiling where the plaster was falling in, probably from a leak, and was just painted over. I found another reviewer mention that this room had a leak from this spot. There was also peeling and bubbling paint all around the wall, radiator, and window.. must have been from moisture coming through the wall and window. Right when we got in we heard a loud banging noise, like a hammer on metal.. I thought that someone was either working outside the window, or the room next door was being worked on. The room was also extremely hot.. I tried thermostat and it didn't work, so we just figured we would open the windows when needed. We went out for the night and came back. While getting ready for bed around 11 we heard the banging noise again. Seemed to be in the wall right behind our bed. It would progressively get louder for about 5 minutes, stop for about 10 minutes, and then start up again. We tried to sleep but couldn't with how loud it was. We were also right behind the hotel's street sign, so spotlights where shining right onto our room and through the blinds. Since it was so hot we would crack the windows, but then the street noise and sirens were too loud since we were just a floor off the street. I called the lobby and they said they were sold out for the evening so we couldn't switch rooms, but would switch us the next day. They didn't seem surprised. Needless to say it was a miserable night. The next day they apologized and said that it is a boiler heater, so it makes that banging noise when heating up. They then moved us to a room on the 11th floor, which had it's own heater/cooler with a knob to adjust. Luckily this room was bearable, and they did give us $100 off for what happened, even though I wanted the whole night refunded. Unfortunately our whole first day in the city was pretty miserable since we hadn't slept the whole night. I saw a reviewer on yelp the next day (Maricela) write a review for the same room, so it is obvious that they are just cycling people through these rooms without addressing issues. A lot of the bad reviews seem to be with the heating/cooling (noise or lack of heat/air or thermostat) and maintenance in the rooms. If this place upgrades it hvac and repairs minor things around the rooms it would be a good hotel. The location was the only thing going for it. Writing this review so others know what they could be getting into!

Room located on front of Hotel very nosy with Bin men. Heating system very loud with pipes knocking against wall - this started from 3 am onward. When complained did not offer to relocate us. Room very basic and not up to a great cleaning standard. On one occasion maid had left door a jar while we was out. When using shower the smell from the drainage system was disgusting. Certain Reception staff very helpful Location : excellent location

Hotel has an excellent location. When you get on the tiny elevator you'll get a good idea of what the rooms are like. If you stay in a lot of hotels as we do you'll probably not be happy when you arrive in your room. The tv's are in strange locations, the heating/cooling controls do not work properly or at least in our room. There was not counter in the bathroom for your toiletries except on the back of the toilet on the tank. No door to the shower and the floor gets quite wet in front of the toilet. The bed was the size of a double bed at best, and the mattress was so old and used that it had a hole in the area where your butt goes or in this case 10,000 butts. Definitely needed a new mattress. Its very tight and uncomfortable in the room. One desk chair with a filthy seat, and dirty corners in the bathroom. Just read the other reviews. The hotel is definitely aware of these issues and complaints as they hear the same info for guest after guest. Just read the reviews. I get a kick out of their response that they are sorry about your experience and they want to make it better for their guests, but they never offer to comp you the room because they know most of the time you'll never return. Do yourself a favor and choose another hotel unless you have now choice. Priceline name your own price beware.

I stayed at this hotel in 2016 and it was really good, so i decided to re-visit in December 2017. The contrast was day and night.The hotel seems to be stuck in a time freeze, nothing has been improved. The aircons are noisy and ineffective and have evidence of mold on them (yuck).The only reason for a reasonable score was this place is saved by the staff, who are sublime. They are helpful, knowledgeable and courteous. If the staff leaves this place will sooner or later be a dump.

We stayed here in November 2017 for 3 nights before boarding the Queen Mary 2 to sail back to the UK. As the hotel came as part of the package we had no choice on where we were staying. It is a great location and we had high hopes.The hotel is stylishly decorated and looks quite smart but the bedrooms are smaller than many prison cells. This may be a common feature in New York but it came as a shock to us. The ensuite shower room was so small that one had to straddle the toilet in order to close the door behind you. What really impacted on our holiday was that our part of the hotel did not have any central heating for a couple days. I understand that stuff can break down and it probably wasn't anyone's fault but the staff's lack of communication or empathy on this matter was extraordinary. No apology. No attempt at booking us somewhere else. No offer of assistance. The bed was pushed right up against the aircon/radiator and without heat it was simply an open vent to allow gale force artic winds to blow through. It was cold enough to see our breath in the room. We asked for a portable electric heater but they had none left. They eventually sent up a couple extra duvet blankets which were very thin but did just enough to prevent hypothermia. Needless to say we both came down with stinking colds which was not a great start to our holiday.It may be that without the heating problems the hotel would have been bearable despite the small rooms but after our experience I can't recommend this hotel to anyone.

The location is GREAT, but that’s it. Expedia indicated they pick you up from the airport, which is technically true, but it’s $120 from JFK! Insane! You can take a cab for $50. The staff wasn’t super friendly. We were also told we could get late check out when we called before booking because we had tickets to a show that morning, but when we arrived, it was a different story. The night we checked in, the man told us we needed to check with a manager during business hours. We asked the next morning and then they said we had to ask the day we were leaving. The day we were leaving, we called at 7:30 and the woman said the manager would be in at 8. Then at 8, they said the manager would be in at 8:30. We had to leave for the show at 8, so we just checked out and paid the bellman to keep our bags while we were at the show. No one was helpful. The bathroom had NO counter. At all. It was pathetic. It was very difficult to get ready to go each morning because it has no place to set things. There is also no shower curtain or door in the shower, so the bathroom floods each time you bathe. We called and asked about that and were told that was the design. The shower also drained slowly, so you stood in a 2 inch puddle the whole time. The water was also either burning hot or ice cold. You had to really work to find a happy medium. The room had a TINY closet and no walking space. We had to squeeze next to the tiny dresser to get to the other side of the bed. The doors to the rooms are thin and flimsy and you can hear every sound in the halls. The halls are super narrow and not very clean. Do your self a favor and stay somewhere else. The location was the only positive for us.

We checked in on 30 November 2017. Antonio on the front desk was efficient and friendly as a group of six women we stayed in room 1114 on the eleventh floor. There were 2 double beds and a set of bunk beds, all of which were clean and comfortable.The room was equipped with a coffee maker and supplies a in-room safe (free of charge) and an iron and board. The only downside was very small hanging space available and only 1 chest of draws. There was a hair dryer and the bathroom was a wet room with plenty of towels provided and shower gel, shampoo and conditioner should you have forgotten your own. The lifts were always busy so on more than one occasion some of us decided to walk down the stairs. For some reason never seemed to have a problem getting a lift to go up to the room. A couple of times had to have the keys re-coded. The rooms were warm so we were glad the air conditioning worked, the room looked over the road but apart from when emergency vehicles went past not to noisy. The hotel is right in the heart of Times Square very easy to find your way around.If you come out of the hotel and turn right and walk another 2 blocks you will come to Rockefeller Plaza and the huge Christmas Tree. Right behind there is Saks department store absolutely beautiful window displays and amazing light show at night.An Irish bar Harley's is right next door which I can recommend the food and atmosphere was brilliant.

For such a large price the rooms are pretty small. I had two double beds and these were very small when trying to sleep a family of four. I'm 6ft 2" and my feet stuck out of the end of the beds. The a/c fitted in the room barely worked and even with 3 degree weather we needed to run it to counter the heating in the building. The a/c was so loud and noisy it almost blocked out the continous sirens from the fire brigade that are based at the end of the hotel.

This hotel is in a fantastic location to Times Square, however this is my only positive note. The staff are extremely rude and unhelpful, with no hospitality skills, one evening I was waiting on the lift (which is extremely slow by the way) for at least 6mins, once the lift arrived one of the concierge staff stepped ahead of me and filled the lift with suitcases meaning I then had to wait even longer on another lift to come!!!!Rooms are quite unclean and noisy although the bed is comfortable. On checking into the hotel I witnessed a very unhappy customer complaining to one of the male receptionists who laughed in her face at her complaint, it was extremely unprofessional and not a great sight to see for my first impressions of this hotel.Another issue is the lady who is meant to be helpful in regards to things to do in the city along with sorting airport transfers... Will this was quite a laugh as she has the worst customer service standards I have ever saw, she really didn't want to help anyone and is very cold and abrupt!! Don't waste your money on this place!!

Location is amazing! We arrived dec3 close to midnight and the gentleman working was very accommodating and good customer service.But be aware that it's loud. The room we had faced the street and it was loud and even perhaps the pipes were making a lot of noise into the night. I didn't fall asleep for a couple hours of trying and I can sleep anywhere! Also we were given room 424 at first but the door didn't close tightly so it was easily picked open with a credit card or key card. It wasn't reinforced like the other ones by the room. So we asked to change rooms. BE AWARE AT ANY HOTEL IF THE DOOR DOESNT SHUT PROPERLY. Or else it's easy for someone to pick it open while you are out and steal your stuff.We got 223 after and it was a bit bigger. The decor is nice. The bed is comfy but looks lumpy and worn out. The problem with this room is that it had a huge lump in the ceiling and it leaked water! Dripped throughout the night. A small and slow drip but nonetheless a drip. Was worried if it I guess average is being generous. It should be between average and poor. It's not the worse hotel I've ever been to but definitely not the poshest either. It's fine for one night and for the location. We asked a gentleman in the elevator how his room was cause he came from the opposite side and he is reply...."I Didn't Know What I Was Getting Myself Into!" Lol! Too funny.

My husband, myself and two daughters were given two rooms on the 6th floor. When we walked in, the rooms were so incredibly hot. We turned it to A/C in both of the rooms and then left for dinner. We came back to the rooms late that night and the rooms were so hot, you couldn't even stand to be inside. Maintenence was called and his solution? He opened the windows. In Times Square. On a Saturday night. He said that these rooms have had this same problem for quite some time now and if he "turned off the heat in our two rooms, it would affect the whole hotel". It was a miserable, sleepless night. Even with the window open, it was too hot to sleep. Imagine the noises that you hear in NYC on a Saturday night in Times Square trying to sleep with an open window. I complained the next morning, again. I was told that someone would be calling me or emailing me. Nothing. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS MOTEL.

I booked a room for my daughter and I through our family Expedia account . The account is in my husbands name so the room was booked in his name , I prepaid the room with my credit card . When we arrived we were told by Antonio that we could not have the room because it was in my husbands name and he was not here.I explained I booked the hotel through our Expedia account and paid for it with my credit card . He refused to let us have the room . He insisted I call my husband and make him call Expedia and add me to the reservation - while my daughter was speaking with my husband I offered Antonio to speak with my husband to clarify the situation - he refused . My husband was able to call Expedia while working and get this straightened out . Totally unnecessary . Antonio was rude and made no attempt to help us . The only reason I chose this hotel was because I am attending Springsteen on Broadway and wanted a hotel close to the theatre - otherwise would have chosen another hotel . Besides the ignorant staff our room was no larger than a closet with a tiny double bed . Stay elsewhere !

Stayed in a twin room which was very small but adequate. The furniture had clearly been hit by many suitcases! The central location was excellent so that outweighed the small room. We were in NY to see the city, not a hotel. The bathroom was tiny with no shelving space for toiletries. We arrived on the coldest night of November and the room was freezing. We asked for extra blankets which did not materialise, but when we enquired for a second time, a heater was placed in our room when we were out for dinner. Reception staff were very friendly.

Stayed In this hotel for 10 days around Xmas time with family members. Overall, the experience was good. From the beginning, all the staff (réceptionists, housekeepers, restaurant staff) was very nice and helping. There was a leak in one of the bedrooms, and the staff sorted this in a very efficient manner (forgot his name but the guy was awesome). The location is great. Just a few steps from Times Square. The rooms are ok, too much heating but you can use the air-conditionning to cool down. I would have recommended this place if it wasn't for a very nasty and standoffish woman called "Adeline". A blond woman who seems to think she is so cool she has the right to give you the cold shoulder when asked a simple question. Very standoffish, gives big smiles to pretty male clients and a cold face to others. Pretty shocking and unacceptable attitude to receive when you spent over 5000 dollars.

Superb location, just 2 minutes walk into the heart of times square. Clean room (although quite small) but adequate. Friendly staff. Decent Chinese restaurant literally next door at reasonable prices and an Irish bar next door to that!Would stay there again.

The hotel in my opinion was great, stayed from the 14th 18th Nov and found it to be a good stay. Easy to get to from JFK with a great location and facilities. After reading a lot of negative reviews I had very low expectations and was a bit nervous when turning up from the UK. Check in was easy and our room on the 6th floor (room 618) was just what we needed. We got the king room and it was very spacious, after reading that most rooms were tiny I was pleasantly surprised. Our room looked out onto the street and those negative reviews sparked some anxiety thinking that we wouldn't get any sleep with it being so noisy, boy was I wrong. Probably one of the comfiest beds I've slept in in a hotel and the size of the king bed made for a good night's sleep next to my girlfriend who sleeping next to normally resembles what I can only describe as a 6 hour WWE wrestling match. It was noisy with traffic and theaters finishing shows up until about 11 o'clock but then after that everything seemed to stop and I didn't wake up once during the night from any noise.The room was clean and got cleaned every day by housekeeping, they even folded my jeans I'd left on the floor and put them on the bed. Bathroom was ok and again nice and clean. Getting down to the reception was slow at times as with only 2 lifts they can be busy in the morning but with only being on the 6th floor we often opted for the stairs which wasn't to much of a stretch.Free high speed WiFi was a great inclusion and allowed me to catch up with things back home. All major subways being less than 5 min walk was great as we got it pretty much everywhere and downtown to world trade center was the furthest away at a 20ish min ride.There is only one negative to the stay, which unfortunately was/is quiet a big one. Upon check in a credit card is stored for a security deposit and for the $60 city tax fee. We were told on check in that nothing is taken and it is only recorded until check out. 5 days later at check out we were told about the $60 fee (plus small change in tax) and made our way to the airport for our flight home. Once there my GF went to check our online banking to find that the hotel had taken £71 in charges - which equates to roughly $100. The transaction took place on our first day, shortly after check in. After an email for an explanation we received a receipt showing charges for $60, when we sent back a screen shot of the £71 taken they said they would sort it out and give us a refund for the overcharge. This is currently being sorted and I hope we get that money back, if not we have already contacted our CC company who were more than helpful in freezing and flagging the transaction.Booked through Expedia at under £500 the hotel offered everything we needed, a great location and a clean comfy bed. Marred only by this transaction issue which could have gone unnoticed if not for my GF we had a great trip to NYC. Would give it a 4-5 star review if not for this $100 charge that someone has made. With that currently being resolved I'll go middle of the road and give it a 3

Hotel was chosen through a travel agent when my friend and I booked our holiday. Was there from 6/11/17 for five nights. Upon arrival we thought the atmosphere was welcoming and the person who attended to us (anthonio) was really nice and had jokes with us. When we got to our rooms we didn’t like it coz it was two of us and we had ordered a double bed but it was really small looked like a bed and half. We went back to the reception and asked if we could change our room and the Anthonio and Temi (manager) actually upgraded us to premium. That room was much better and bigger. Only thing is one of the heater wasn’t working and that’s not ideal at this time of year. The second heater was working but was on the other side of the room. One out of the three lift was not working and they are quite small but that’s about it. Room service was good.

My partner and I booked online to stay here and have been over charged and extra £125 to our credit card and this doesn’t include the city/room tax we have to pay on departing. We have tried to get in contact with the hotel via email and telephone to no answer or responses...It completely ruined our trip before it even began and it was supposed to be a well earned rest and recuperation as my partner serves in the British Army. Whilst looking at this months reviews and our constant battle for the last month for our own money to be returned we have now canceled our stay at this hotel and are in the process of trying to get our money back through booking.com. (Wish me all the best of luck)I’m well traveled and have never ever experienced poor front of house management and personnel like it, it is absolutely appalling so be warned don’t book to stay here !!!!! Avoid like the plague

Currently at the Gallivant. The temperature upon entering the room was sweltering. Tried putting the thermostat on “cool” and the temperature at 65. Reported problem to front desk. They sent an engineer up who reported that the unit wasn’t functioning correctly. We were told we were to get a new room; however we were leaving for a Show and were assured it would be taken care of on our return. There was a different staff member at the desk on our return who knew nothing of our situation and said there was no other room available. We now have the windows open but are still uncomfortable. BAD FORM GALLIVANT HOTEL! Never coming back.

Good location a couple of minutes walk from Times Square with friendly staff. However, our first room (a 'double double') was so small it would have made a better housekeeping cupboard (which seemed to be needed as the trolleys were always left in the lift corridor). The bed was a very small double. We asked to change to something bigger and Tricia was very helpful, noting the existing was a small corner room with small window but had nothing available that day. She promised another room the next day and next morning we were told we could move to another room on the same floor which was much better with a view over the front rather than a scruffy rear lightwell although still not large. At least the bed was normal size and my feet did not hang off the end. The heat pump AC/heating did not seem to work but we were not bothered at the time we we were there.There were a few small faults (lights and the bathroom fan not working) but left them to see if housekeeping would pick them up as pretty obvious and get maintenance to fix them 'proactively'. Unfortunately they did not - suggest training housekeeping staff to look for obvious faults and report them. Radio alarm provided in both rooms did not work but we had our own so did not bother about it.The bathrooms are very small with a walk-in shower which was fine except that the screen was short to allow you to enter and the spray flooded the floor.We checked out mid morning to spend a last day with friends. When we returned to collect the luggage late in the afternoon my wife realised she had not packed an expensive pair of shoes and asked them to check the room but this proved difficult so they took her contact details. When we got home I also emailed and confirmed they were not in the packing and please advise if/when found but we have never received any contact, even an acknowledgement of the email.

Good value for money the hotel is a two minutes walk from time square the rooms are small but this is expected of new York the staff all friendly to a point not the same hospitality as other us cities we have visited. The hop on hop off bus is great to see new York you will need two days to get it all in.there is a restaurant called BBQ just off time square great portions found new York to be expensive bring plenty of dollars. Great pub next door to hotel staff all great barmen on top of their game really enjoyed the big Apple.

This is not the poshest hotel you will have ever stayed in, nor is it the cheapest. The bed was comfortable, bathroom tiny, coffee machine good and room fairly clean. But you are here for the location, bang in the middle of the theatre district. Staff pleasant and helpful.

Located close to Times Square it is convenient. On reception we had a warm greeting from a lovely lady called Suny. We were in room 1125 for a week. The room was clean and serviced daily. it was well decorated. with coffee facilities. The room is located in the front of the hotel making it noisy at night having a fire station on the corner of the block. The bathroom is small but clean. There is an extraction fan in the bathroom which is noisy operating on a delay timer and PIR which was annoying during the night I managed to disable the PIR by covering it and removing the tape after our stay. The Heating failed during our visit when we complained, an electric fan heater was with us within 15 minutes which was adequate to heat the room, after the heating returned the air conditioning was extremely noisy so we opted to turn the air con off and use the little fan. The safe would not lockmaintenance appeared in less than 10 mins.As my title said what you pay is what you get.I would stay there again for its value for money and location.

This was the smallest room I've ever been in the tv was on the wall in the side of bed because it was so small. The ac sounded like a jet engine the I was standing in hall with door open to take one of the pictures and standing in bathroom for the other. I stayed in a single room.

The rooms don’t look like the pictures and I have never stayed in a hotel with such poor housekeeping. A headboard with dirt like this is totally unacceptable. There are similar pictures on previous posts which indicate the lack of care and attention to detail in this hotel. I would not recommend this hotel and if you have already booked check the room first before you accept it. Can’t wait to leave today.

We got upgraded by the friendly man on the front counter which we appreciated, but after one night in the room we asked to be moved. There were two women working the front desk that day and they were blunt and rude, as we had interrupted their conversation and they seemed annoyed by this. We were put in a family room which had two bedrooms, but to make enough room in there for more beds, they had made the master bed absolutely TINY!! It was big enough for only one person, not two. We then got moved to a room with a bigger bed, but it was so noisy. Yes, it is right in Times Square so it's to be expected... but it was so loud. We had quite a few sleepless nights in there. We found if we left the AC on, it created enough white noise that the outside noise wasn't so bad.

Don't take my review lightly; this was genuinely the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. I don't even know where to start. Firstly don't think the rooms will look anything like the pictures! When we arrived we were so shocked at how small it was barely could fit a double bed which i'm pretty sure was a very small double. The bathroom had loads of flies flying everywhere! Tried to get on with it cause I couldn't be bothered to complain cause we found the staff very rude! The final straw was when I found snot smeared on the walls. So we spoke to the manger and he said we'd have to wait until tomorrow for an upgrade. I was excited for the upgrade but somehow it was worse! Stunk of damp and was still very small and felt so dirty. We never slept under the sheets or walked around with our shoes off. The walls were very thin so we could hear everything the couple next door were saying. So overpriced and the staff just don't care. They clearly don't care about the guests experience and they'll always get customers cause of the false advertising and the fact its location will always bring tourists in. I've seen the hotels response to bad reviews and they clearly don't listen to them. Fix the issues! Don't give empty apologies. Such a waste of money. I could go on all day about how bad this hotel was. PLEASE don't waste your money here!

Rooms to the front of the hotel are noisy due to traffic also air conditioning is ancient and that too is noisy. Extension lead was held together with tape. Only one working lift which held seven people (also used by the cleaners) it took ages to be freed up and often resulted in us having to walk down the back stairs from the sixth floor. The rooms were dark. We stayed five nights and the sheets were not changed in that time.

We expected a tiny New York hotel room. This hotel room was spacious, quiet, and comfortable. Staff was extremely friendly and room was clean. Perfectly located at a reasonable price for Times Square. Highly recommend.

great family room, with 2 double beds and bunkbeds plenty of space quite basic but had fridge and kettle stuff , quite loud at night as its over a fire station so sirens going thru night , but so close actually in times sq def go back reasonably priced toon

Stayed for the NYC marathon and the hotel was crowded with some issues in the mornings to get the elevators. I’ve got the Premium Suite and it’s ok. It’s well located at just a couple of blocks from Time Square. Nice hotel and the asian food restaurant is very good.

We stayed four nights at this prime location hotel. Although the location is a plus, the noise is definitely not pleasant. Our room was next to a storage closet and we heard lots of noise all hours of the night. The room size is tiny but all the other reviews already stated that so it was not a surprise. The most surprising thing of all for me was the fact that the shower had no door! the water splashes all over the bathroom wall and wets everything! Not ok!

Due to an emergency, I spent a night here. I had never heard of this hotel though I must have walked by it a thousand times, with the NYFD building on the corner as a navigational landmark..Good location, steps from 8th Ave on 48th Street. The minute I walked into the lobby I was struck immediately with a definite European flavor. Front desk clerk's accent confirmed that, with a quick and efficient check-in. Elevators were a bit slow, but with a busy lobby, it was an opportunity to take in the surroundings. There is a bar and grill with an entrance from the hotel lobby and the street. Modern room with accented lighting as opposed to central-type lighting from one or two locations. The bed was comfortable, though a bit firm. Bathroom was small, clean, with good water pressure. Glass enclosed shower stall, no bath tub. A 42 inch flat panel TV, with desk and chair. Wi-fi available. The flooring was linoleum, which I found a bit different, but was clean and spotless. Also very unique wallpaper, as a kind of map with directions to most of the city's main attractions. Staff was courteous and professional, with helpful bell service. Abundant restaurants and sandwich shops nearby with most of the city's subway lines less than a 5 minute walk away and minutes to Times Square However, situated on a one way west to east bound traffic street in the theater district, traffic gets to be really heavy making blaring car horns common. Still, not a bad property and would not hesitate to return.

Nice location. : You are on times square Small rooms : you just have to spend a night or 2 Small washrooms : something I didn't like much Honest staff : I left my wallet in the locker I had to call the hotel and they recovered it for me and got my money . The lady at the hotel gave more money than I remembered was in my wallet. She could have just given the money that I was telling her over there phone to my colleague who went to collect it. However she handed over the wallet intact to my colleague.So NY being NY am glad I stayed here

I spent 5 nights at The Gallivant hotel in time square. I had made the booking through a popular third party website having reviewed its facilities and the surrounding area - It was exactly what we were looking for, for the right price. Upon arrival, the hotel lobby and check in process was as expected. I had booked a twin double room with no board. My friend and I received our room key and went up to the 2nd floor where we were booked to stayed. Having stepped out of the elevator i then realised our room was right opposite - Initially this worried me as i feared it would be noisy. We went into the room; it was dark and bit rough around the edges (corners of furniture scuffed and chipped). The room was not of any that were pictured on the website i had used to book the stay. Unfortunately being on the 2nd floor and New York city being built up, we got very little daylight, making the room dingy. Still, the bed was very comfy and the bathroom was clean and had all we needed. Upon checking around the room further, we did find that there was also plenty of dirt and dust around the edges, behind the bedside table, on the room telephone etc. We aren't ones to complain but the straw that broke the camels back was when we retired to bed early the first night due to jet lag, and found ourselves repeatedly disturbed by passers by outside the room using the elevator. Ordinarily, i would have put this down to bad luck having our roomed picked out for us by whoever organised the booking, however we could hear multiple conversations as if our bedroom door was wide open and the persons were standing right next to us. The sound proofing seemed non existent. All the above led to my friend going down to the hotel front desk early morning to request a room change as we couldn't possibly manage 4 further nights of interrupted sleep. The member of staff we spoke to couldn't have seemed to care less and said we should return at 10 am and maybe if someone is checking out we could talk about a room swap. We did return and explained the situation to another front desk member of staff who informed us that the only twin double rooms available were in the same position of the building up all 16 floors, however if we were willing to share a bed that she could sort a room change out for us. Now this is not what we booked for, but balancing bunking up with your best mate against hearing the gallivant's 2nd floor gossip for the next fews days, we opted to bunk up. The member of staff asked us to drop our bags off downstairs, and that by 3pm we'd have a new room. We were somewhat doubtful but did as she said and went out for the day.Having returned, we did indeed get issued a new room. The front desk lady had very kindly upgraded us. We were now on the 15th floor, in a family room which had light, was clean, and as pictured on the third party website id used for booking. We had much more space being a larger room and i have to say, the room change really enhanced our overall trip. Had we stayed in the dingy, dark, dirty room for 5 days we'd have had a sour taste left in our mouths. Despite the initial staff we came into contact with who clearly didn't give a hoot about the state of the crappy room we originally had and how poor our first night had been, this lady turned it all around. She was apologetic, helpful and sympathetic. Overall, i would stay at this hotel again; the location was perfect for everything we wanted to do (surrounded by theatres, bars, shops, times square, and subway links), however i would not ever book a twin double room here, and would consider upgrading to the family room despite not needing to sleep 4 as the extra space was great!

As you'd expect with a hotel this close to Times Square space is a premium. Our room was fairly small and the cleaners were hit and miss, some days our beds were made, others they weren't. The air conditioning in the room was extremely loud and clunky causing a few interruptions in the night.Only one lift worked which meant excessive queues for lifts and when they finally arrived they were full with no space, we resorted to using the stairs most of the time which wasn't great being on a high floor. The hotel itself could do with a lick of paint and investing in some window cleaners.Having said that, staff were friendly, not overly helpful, but friendly. Worth staying if you're not planning on spending much time in the hotel and going to be out all day.

The hotel is a perfect location to easily get to the theatre. The accommodations are the size of a dorm room with good sheets. The best part are the staff and the manager who go out of their way to help the guests. I appreciate everything the Manager Rob did to help my son and I.

First, on the positives The Gallivant is in a good position & clean. The cleaning staff are very good, friendly & helpful.On the negative side, the reception staff were only just ok, they checked us in but that was it... polite but not very helpful.I think that if some of the lovely ladies that cleaned the rooms were on reception it would be much better! Rather a claustrophobic hotel, lifts that worked intermittently, small rather chaotic lobby and very little facility to sit comfortably if waiting for transport etc.

Gallivant Times SquareStayed 3 nights in Oct /17. Prepaid through Expedia and paid $252 CAN/night but then had to pay the $15 US /night Resort fee at the hotel. The first night we arrived we got a room on the 2nd floor which was very small with little space on each side of the bed so much so that the closet door couldn’t fully open. We requested a room switch but they were only able to accommodate us the next morn. We then got a room on the 8’th floor for the next 2 nights which was bigger and nicer that we were satisfied with. Very good location. We used the Super Shuttle to get back and forth from the LaGuardia airport for $71 CAN total. I would stay here again.

Giving a 2 out of 5 starts in rating because despite being near the Times Square, the hotel has a terrible administration service. Everything went wrong: charged me in my credit card a huge amount of money even though I had already paid everything, forgot to bring new towels and toilet paper for 3 consecutive days, nobody could get anything done except for the manager who was never around to do that. And after all the trouble I had, had the nerve to charge me for some "urban fee" I had no idea what was and did not use at all. Worst hotel.

Great location on Times Square and close to the theatre district, check in was simple quick and helpful, trendy busy hotel with lots of the buzz of New York. Our room had rather high set beds which were clean and comfy. Lots of late night hotel noise from within the hotel but this could have been that our room was situated by the lift. The room was painted grey and had water leak stains on the ceiling. It was very dull and lacked light so we spent as much time as possible out of our room. I was travelling with a young relative who told me the darkness made her feel depressed. Plenty of towels and the room was clean with coffee facilities. The shower was nice and hot and some toiletries were supplied. The safe was so high up on a shelf that it was impossible to use so we had two carry our valuables with us during our stay. Most of the staff were friendly apart from one member of concierge who found it all an effort to help with directions. A nice easy early morning check out with a very polite male receptionist. This hotel served its purpose for the few days that we needed. We didn't have a view of the city but it was nice to have been able to have a lower room. Great strong wifi facilities.

The hotel is dated, the location is excellent, internet is included. Abundant restaurants and laundry facilities and of course Times Square and Theatres are all close by. 3 elevators but only one available to public. One had been broken for at least two weeks, one was used mainly by staff for deliveries and cleaners and only other elevator could not take more than 7 people. Check out was a nightmare getting people and suitcases down 16 flights of stairs with one elevator! Check out is midday so earlier than most NY hotels we stayed at, which were normally 3pm. If you got there early or had to store your bags after checking out the charge is $2 a bag. Wouldn’t stay there again, would rather walk a bit further and stay in something more luxurious with lots of elevators!

The hotel is renovated with a new name...Well the front office staff where very helpful to receive and store a shipment before my arrival.I booked a room for two purposely (Double occupancy), however it's a single occupancy, I was given a very uncomfortable tiny standard room! (It was even difficult to take photos of the room because it's small). The bed could take only one person, very tight to move around the room, the toilet is like a flight toilet - very small, also the door should be changed or heavily fixed because it does not close and broken, it make high noises when opened or closed.Not a lot of amenities. Not bad bed and pillow quality. Towels are good and clean.Cleaning level is good.I highly recommend you not to use the services of the concierge, 1st of all he is the rudest that I have ever met during my travels, 2nd lacks a lot of accurate information - especially regarding prices, he gives you a price then he calls to book then it's higher, last but not least the prices he gives are 15 - 30% higher than the prices outside!The hotel location is great, in Times Square which makes it a walking distance from the shows and the active touristic action of Manhattan. An advise if you like the location and rate for this hotel to make sure not to book a standard room, any higher category, especially if it is double occupancy, so you could have a comfortable stay.All in all the hotel would take a 6.5 of 10 in my opinion. If you stay in a comfortable room, you would have a 7.5 experience.

This hotel has a fantastic location close to Times Square but just far enough away from the chaos! Very fun and funky lobby complete with neon lights and tropical fish tank!The rooms were perfect for our girls weekend needs - one queen bed and twin bunk beds...although we only used the bottom bunk and shared the queen (none of us were brave enough for the top bunk after a few wobbly pops)! Cons - hallways were insanely hot, and the elevators kept breaking down...which is not ideal when your rooms are on the 14th and 15th floor! Rooms are not huge, but really you aren't in NYC to stay in your room. Three grown women shared for two nights just fine! The lobby bathroom was not very clean when I was there and if I remember correctly 3 out of 4 (or two out of 3) stalls didn't work.Very reasonable price for what you get. I'd recommend it without hesitation, but might suggest requesting a room on a lower floor as it sounds like the elevator issues aren't uncommon!

I think a review of this hotel can be summed up by saying "that you get what you pay for".It is adequate. Our room on level 14 was tiny, as was the bathroom but it was adequate. The bed was comfortable, bathroom clean and the hot water was plentiful.The location is excellent as it is convenient to everything which is basically what you want in New York. It was a bit noisy but that is the way New York is and with ear plugs at night it was fine.There are heaps of places to eat all around.The lifts are tiny and slow so allow yourself plenty of time to get in and out. The foyer is also small but was usually busy.Overall it was fine and good enough value in an extremely expensive city.We returned a couple of weeks later for another 2 days and got a slightly larger room on a lower floor with a desk as well as a slightly larger bed (I think).

Just one block away from Times Square makes the gallivant an ideal location but in the five days we stayed one lift was permanently broken with a second frequently not working. This left only one lift working which on two occasions broke down as well. We paid for children to have the penthouse suite and after a night out returned to find no lifts working so they had to walk up 16 floors. We were on the 10th floor so if you suffer from health problems ask for a lower floor as the lifts are very unreliable.

Lobby nice room dirty and in desperate need of an update, also very small this was expected but 2 suitcases mean no walking space. Air con noisy with no off switch. Location seems to be the only thing going for this hotel.

Typical New York hotel ,small rooms poorly lit corridors .Excellent location with a quality diner within easy reach in the mornings . You end up spending a lot of time waiting for a lift .Staff were efficient and as friendly as any New Yorker .

location is brilliant,,, right on Broadway,,,got what we paid for,,,central to everything,,lifts very small and very slow,,, coffee in room was fab,,very clean and 6 of us stayed in one room with plenty of space,,,

Before I begin I have emailed the hotel twice to address the issues during our stay, no reply.Arrival, room was not ready as we were getting a complementary "upgrade". No big deal a bit of a wait but nothing we were unhappy with.We were given family room 414 (remember this number you will not want to stay in this room). First thing was the room door, it was loose and looked as if it had been kicked in, when the door was closed you could see out of the room between the door and the frame and hear everything.The view was of a pigeon crap covered air con and heating plant facing a brick wall and other apartments.Bed time, we settled down for the night. About 3am we were woken by a clattering and juddering which sounded like a spanner had been thrown into an engine. The air con unit in the room had seized and was looking like it was ready to explode (see the pictures). Turned it off at the wall, kept awake by the air con plant outside the window.Next morning youngest son was in the shower, the shower faucet fell off and hit my son on the foot making him cry and bruising his foot.I went to reception and complained I was offered a change of room but as we were unpacked and there for one more night I declined, we agreed the room would be repaired once we went out for day. I made it very clear we would be out all day and would be leaving at 1030am.On return to the hotel late afternoon the room had not been made up and none of the issues fixed, I complained only to be told because the do not disturb sign was on the door they did not enter. I pointed out I had told the staff we were out all day, I was made to feel this was my fault.Returned to the room toilet was now not flushing and a whole bank of lights in the room went out and would not work.After another sleepless night I went down to reception and complained I was taken aside by a manager Ben Elie and after recanting the whole sorry saga he stated my bill would be taken care of.On return to the UK my bill was "discounted" by a lousy $75 a night, not my understanding of being taken care of clearly. I guess as Im no longer in the country we are not important.Bottom line people do not stay here it is a dump, the hallways are dark and seedy, ice machines work intermittently and the lifts take forever to arrive.Lesson learned I guess but at least I can offer my experience as a warning to others.One last attempt to get this resolved by writing to Interstate Hotels CEO Michael J. Deitemeyer.

The rooms were small, not very clean, uncomfortable and were in need of refurbishment, fittings hanging from walls ie air con unit, shower accessories, flaking paintwork. Corridors were dark gloomy and had an odour, clean/dirty laundry in the corridors for most of the day. On first use of the shower my wife shared it with a swarm of flies. We had 2 rooms and both were poor. Only plus was the location and Hurleys bar next door !!!I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Location brilliant lobby very smart the rest much to been desired. Dropped our suitcases off we out for the day came back collected cases went to our room about 22.00 a eak coming through the bathroom ceiling and lights, rang down maintenance came up looked around followed by a cleaner that was it drip drip. Told the maid in the morning as we left, lovely day in New York walk miles returned to the room 21.00 water dripping faster nothing had been done rang down AGAIN gave us a bucket with towels in.... left early mention to desk staff only to be told should have spoken to management ....sorry reported when happened should have been sorted very very poor

Booked a one night stay on the same day as we arrived. Location very central, few minutes walk from Times Square. Hotel quite modern, but we only seen the lobby and room we stayed in. The reception staff on arrival weren't the friendliest, slightly abrupt so not the nicest welcome. The room we got was a Premium Room which consisted bunk beds, then a double bed at the other side of a short connecting hall. Room was nice, bathroom clean and bed comfortable. All that we needed for a one night stay.

My daughter and I stayed one night at The Gallivant. I would highly recommend this hotel. The location is fabulous. The room was great. Small but very nicely decorated. In room coffee was great because I needed caffeine to keep me going after so muck walking. Check in and check out was easy. Don't let the bad reviews scare you. It was great.

The Gallivant Hotel is a decent hotel. The room and bathroom was clean but in need of an upgrade - signs of use are showing.The staff are friendly and helpful. All my online purchases were delivered to my room at no charge. My only issue was the shuttle service to the airport that I had booked but did not arrive. The hotel is very close to the centre of Tines Square and a 5 minute walk to the Metro.The two restuarants next door are not part of the hotel and were not enticing to eat at. That means to eat you need to venture out.

After reading some of the horror reviews I must admit I was dreading staying at this hotel but as we'd mistakenly booked non refundable we were a bit stuck. however, please do not believe everything you read on here. The room was surprisingly spacious for NYC, really light and airy bedroom with a really good sized bathroom with shower. Very quick check in. Rooms were cleaned daily and we're kept immaculate by the housekeeping staff with fresh towels. Location is great for Broadway, couldn't be more in the heart of Times Square. Only disappointments were that we asked for a twin room as I was staying with my mum, we both emailed the hotel management on 4 occasions and still got a double bed, we asked if we could change at the hotel however they said come back tomorrow and they would sort it- we couldn't be bothered with that so just got unpacked n stuck with the room- not really a big deal. whilst we were there one elevator broke and nobody cane to fix it, this was on our check out day so we had no choice but to wait as we couldn't manage the cases down the stairs, had to wait 20 mins for the lift to get to us with space, but again still not a major problem. Yes the hotel is next to the fore department but honestly i never heard it, mum saod she heard ot once and that was it. We really enjoyed our stay and were pleasantly surprised!

We arrived at hotel as a family of 6. We were checked in right away by very friendly reception staff. They told us of some sights, supermarket, breakfast places and mentioned we had a fridge to stock up for drinks for the kids. She was very very friendly and helpful. There are computers in the reception area free to use. One day we couldn't get our tickets to print, the guy on reception came to help and ended up letting us use his computer at desk to do this. Nothing seemed too much trouble.We had a family room (Room 614) which had two double beds and a bunk bed. The room was very spacious. Had lovely large bathroom, wardrobe, desk, drawers, coffee maker, fridge, tv, safe, iron and ironing board, toiletries. Room was great for a family. our youngest kids didn't like sleeping on top bunk as was quite high, we just lifted matress down to floor at night, still left us plenty of room to get to bathroom etc. Never had much of a view, but I don't think many hotels do.Our rooms were cleaned every day and fresh towels left every day. Our rooms were immaculate every day we came back.The location itself is less than a 5 minute walk to Times Square and a 10 minute walk to shopping in 5th avenue. There was a subway station a few minutes walk away. It is still quiet enough at night to sleep. We never heard any noise from other rooms either.I would definitely stay here again, great room, great location and friendly staff. The price we paid was a considerable bit less that other rooms this size. My only small complaint is getting charged on last day to leave luggage. You had to pay a small fee for each bag. Never had to do this before!

We recently travelled here for a 9 day visit, primarily to meet with family living in NYC, but also to do some sight seeing and the usual 'touristy' stuff as well.Having read some of the previous reviews we didn't really know what to expect. We had booked via another site at a discounted 'no refund' rate and were left with ideas that we were going to some sort of horrible hotel that wouldn't match any of our needs.We couldn't have been more wrong. The Gallivant Hotel was fantastic at every stage during our stay.We were checked in by Suny who was such a lovely lady (despite continually thinking our Scots accent was Irish, ha ha). She booked us in very quickly, explained all we needed to know and let us go on about our way. every time we passed reception, all the staff were very friendly and helpful when we needed any info or advice. We were also upgraded on arrival which was a lovely and unexpected surprise.Our room was more than adequate for our needs. Nice and spacious, it came with a fridge, a cupboard to hang clothes, and iron/ironing board, a safe, and the bathroom was great too with a walk in shower as well as plenty of towels and toiletries too for use.Our rooms were cleaned every day and fresh towels etc left if you required them. The housekeepers were brilliant at what they did. Our rooms were immaculate every day we came back after a hard day's sightseeing.I think your view on the rooms etc depends on what you're actually expecting. It's NYC and why people spend as much time in their rooms is beyond me. It's basically a place to get changed and sleep... there's so much to do in the City that we were hardly ever in there.The location itself is less than a 5 minute walk to Times Square, and is also situated right in the heart of Broadway with one of the Theatres right across the road - it was the Bruce Springsteen show that was about to start it's run and one day we seen the Boss himself going in for rehearsals.Instead of going down Broadway you're only a 10 minute walk to all the shopping on 5th and 6th Ave and again only a few minutes walk to a subway station that will get you on one of the many lines running through the city. A $32 weekly ticket was worth it weight in gold and saved us an absolute fortune as we were all over the city every day.If I was going back to NYC again I would definitely think about staying here again as we had a great time.Thanks to all the staff who made our stay so friendly, welcoming, and worth while!

This Hotel is in the perfect Location, right on Times Square, next to hersheys and M&M world! Room was small but adequate. Had safe, A/C, iron and iron board. Wifi was very good. We never had breakfast as we wanted to eat out and try all the different places. We used the concierge to book us a day trip to Woodbury outlets and were very happy with the prices and service we received. They managed to book it cheaper that any of the prices I was finding online! There was no view from our room, it just looked out onto a roof, but honestly, this didn't bother us at all. We were out all day everyday! We will definitely use this Hotel again on our next trip as it really is in the perfect location and would definitely recommend

The room was small as you would expect for NYC. I've stayed in a few US hotels and this is motel standard. Old and with a modern splash on it... but still old.
