The lifts are dated from before the building was built I think, we waited at least 25 minutes on one occasion as the only two lifts that service the building went past our floor numerous times without stopping. On the 12th floor after a day exploring NYC you don't want to walk up 12 flights, with shopping etc. It happened. Elevators were out. The location is great though, just off Times Square on West 48/8th and is surrounded by life 24/7, having said that it's quiet and you don't hear the crowds. Everything is "ok" but for the price you pay you expect a tad more. If you want somewhere to rest your head at night in the heart of NYC, don't want luxury then this is "ok". Did I mention it's expensive!

I booked this room through Groupon. They upgraded us to a larger room, just because which was nice to have the extra room. We stayed there one night while touring Manhattan. We were barely in the room cause we were out and about so much, but it was clean and quiet. And the best part was that it was very much right in time square.

Stayed at this hotel for five nights what a let down.upon arrival were given 2nd floor room when my wife and I arrived at room noticed door was badly damaged it looked as if it had been kicked in we were allocated another room but again another problem no safe allocated another room the bathroom if that is what you would call it was smaller than my dogs kennel having been to ny on numerous occasions this was the smallest room we have ever stayed in and probably the most expensive the only thing good about this location is the location and to add insult to injury received my visa bill today and saw a 75$ charge on ringing the Gallivant I was told by someone who could hardly speak English that it was a resort fee now I always thought that the majority of hotels that charge resort fees had something to offer for it. to all the many many tourists that visit New York avoid the Gallivant like the plague.

We recently stayed at this hotel and apart from its great location being only a 5 minute walk from Broadway & Times Square it was very disappointing. Central Park is also a 15 minute walk away.The hotel is very clean and the service lived up to expectations but that is it. Our double room was a reasonable size but the bathroom was tiny with it not being more than a metre wide. It was case that you did not have much room to sit on the toilet!!The wardrobe was tiny with very few hangers and the bedside lights could not be switched on or off if you were laying in bed. They had obviously been replaced as the original switches were still there but whoever installed them certainly did not think about those staying in the room.Also the windows were not double glazed and so the traffic noise could be heard. The hotel is just around the corner from a fire station and although American fire engines are extremely loud there were thankfully only a few call outs.

I lived across the street from the Times Square location for 24 years, and then retired to upstate NY, however I still needed to be in NYC a couple times a month. A friend was able to get a better rate than TripAdvisor (however they have great rates, as a user/writer since 2010), and I just have to say that 65 million strange visitors from another planet to NYC have been challenging for a local.The hotel has had at least 3 owners in my tenure, and I remember when my mom stay at the Best Western then. It was dumpy and small. Gallivant has really turned around my impression! The lobby is bustling, bright, with a lot of drapes to cover up the old look and make it new. The staff is friendly by NYC standards, and our room is bigger than our 600 sq. ft. apt was right across the street on 48th! We have a family room, with 2 Murphy beds, two doubles, and a bathroom that I have never seen so large in all my worldwide travels! Device users: Gallivant has so many wall outlets for devices and an international charging station on the desk. No alarm clock, but who needs that anymore? Gallivant has a mandatory $15 “Urban fee” to all guests. For the fast Wi-Fi and wall outlets, I’ll pay that.Wi-fi was very fast and easy to set up my 2 laptops, 1 iPad, and two phones. NOTE: AT&T has never resolved the poor signal in Times Square. 1 bar if you are lucky to get any bars at all. Some negatives:The elevators are small, and international traveler’s and tours use this hotel frequently. It will take you more time to check-in and check-out, so be forewarned. There were lines of tourist luggage filling the lobby. Trash bins in the hallway make it difficult to maneuver luggage to the elevators.This is an international hotel, so be prepared for delays. I stood alone with three agents at the check-in desk, and was ignored by all three for well over 4 minutes as they bantered back and forth multi-tasking, including chatting w/ an employee showing pix on a phone. Check-in is at 3pm, and there is a fee for holding your bag, which is typical. Please, please, please, tip your bag service person. He is your friend. One dollar per bag, and if it is heavy, even more. New Yorker’s tip for good service. Sometime you just have to throw money at good service.Huge tip: take ANY elevator that opens, even if you are going down. Go up and enjoy the ride down, especially if you have a large suitcase! My shameless endorsement restaurant tips for the mid-town area:An’Nam (Vietnamese/Chinese) 1 door from Gallivant. (Ask for Peggy or James)Pongsri (Thai)La Masseria (Italian)Virgil’s (BBQ)Hurley’s (Irish Pub)Natsumi (Sushi)Carmines (Italian, and good for large groups)My all-time favorite pizza is John’s Pizza of Times Square. They deliver to the Gallivant, and if you visit in person, it is located in a circa 1929 church.The Gallivant has been a positive experience for me, a die-hard New Yorker of 24 years, with very little patience. Once you are past the noise/horns/sirens and the NYFD fire station below The Gallivant, that lost 12 firefighter’s on 11-9-2001, there is a nice park dedicated to those who saved lives just across the street on 48th Street with a lovely memorial fountain.-David Allen

We stayed there for 4 nights and were disappointed. The room rates were quite expensive compared to the room quality and the service we suffered.Next time we will choose another hotel and book over normal platforms which offer protection in case we are not satisfied.Alternatively we will choose Airbnb.We booked over the app “hotel tonight”, which was close to fraud, because if you want to change the hotel due to planned cancellation they do not refund you any money! You are forced to stay in the hotel you have booked even if you are not satisfied.Additionally to say is,that the pictures in the above mentioned app were COMPLETELY different from the room we got. So the Gallivant finally ripped us off and gave us the smallest room they have. Asking for a room change was really tough because our complaints were ignored - only an upgrade was “offered”, but honestly we did not want to pay any cent more and decided to treat the room only as a place to sleep. That’s how we arranged us the 4 nights.The room was simply too small. Maximum 2x3 square meters. The TV was old and the picture was kind of cutted (you could not see the full picture, no settings possible). The bed was ok,but for American proportions just okay for two persons. The room was clean. But some dust on places like tv, aircon etc.The cleaning staff smashed the door in the morning as if there is no tomorrow:) the doors are a little bit strange, like metal doors on a ship. Our view was uninteresting - we looked in the inner courtyard which was really dirty and dark. But there rolling shutters you can arrange with:)The only “good” thing about the Gallivant was: rooms were quite clean. But I think this should be natural in a hotel. The location close to the Times Square is really practicable.My recommendation if you still want to book it:Do not book over the hoteltonight-App and ensure that eventual complaints allow you to get your money back in case the Gallivant employees try to make a fool of you.Even better: ask which room type you will receive and ensure to see it beforehand.I saw other rooms during the cleaning staff opened some doors during cleaning. They looked brighter and more comfortable than ours.

3 nights spent on our golden wedding anniversary this is a dirty filthy hotel, cheap and nasty , you have been warned broke my heart.black shower head, bathroom door rotting , damp and musty smell . Looked out onto 3 brick walls and a pile of rubble window height covered in plastic. Changed rooms 3 times but could not unpack my clothes covered the case with bath towel . Chair stained , bathroom door nearly touching sink, not enough room to dry your self in bathroom , and I am not obese, Had to switch air con off at night very noisy,

We went here for my husbands 40th! The hotel is in a fantastic location, we had a quiet room no view but that didn't matter as we were not there for a view. Small room but expected for New York. We were pleased with the hotel and amenities and would recommend this hotel.

This hotel is good enough for a couple days' stay if you're traveling through the city, and it's just that. The staff are friendly especially the housekeeping crew. You get free baggage storage if you have a reserved room - which came in handy for us since we arrived early morning. The location is great, with just two blocks to times square, about 15 minutes walk to Central Park, and just in general walkable to most other places in Midtown. The 8th Ave, Broadway, and 7th Ave subway lines are also within 2-3 blocks if you're going anywhere slightly farther.The good things pretty much stop there though. The rooms are tiny, small enough that a "standard room" actually comes with a full-sized bed instead of queen, so if there are two of you sharing that bed, be prepared to cuddle. The AC is extremely loud, and it doesn't help that it's right by the bed - so we pretty much had to leave it on all day to keep the room cool just so we can have it off when we sleep. The elevators are also tiny (I'm talking full with 5 people with no luggage), and the fact that large tour groups from Europe tend to live here doesn't help with that. All in all, it's not the most impressive hotel we've been to - but if the price is right and you're willing to get less than a 5-star experience, this place will do.

We stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms as like a lot of New York are small. Bathroom door kept sticking. It didn't bother me but it must have drove the rooms above and below crazy in the middle of the night. Lifts are slow so expect a wait when its busy. They have an ATM inside the hotel but it is set to only dispense $200 at a time and charges you a transaction fee. You can get more out in one hit at a bank. Reasonably clean and tidy rooms cleaned every day. It is an absolutely ideal spot for Time's Square and on that basis alone I would stay there again.

Stayed for a few nights on a business trip - ideal venue for exploring the Times Square /Theatre area as only a block away . Found the staff to be very helpful and friendly , room was basic but more than adequate for me - general noise was what you'd expect in such a central area but one downside is being very close to the fire station so sirens tend to go off at all times . Good bars and restaurants nearby

been to New York 11 times , this was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, the bedding was dirty, drawer falling off , shower took 10 minutes to come through hot, windows were filthy looking out, if you could, onto walls with air conditioning , paper cups , just coffee no tea bags, moved rooms but no better , dead flies in the drawers and came home with bites on legs, no duvet cover just a sheet on the top of the duvet, location was good but this was all this hotel had going for it. never again

Very rude staff, next to a fire station which meant being woken up at 2am / 3am / 4am etc. The air con was very noisy it's like being next to a truck so very hard to get a night's sleep. Also I was charged for things after I left which I wasn't happy about and they still haven't refund me

The location was brilliant. 1 minute to Times Square and short walk to subway for a number of routes across / around Manhattan. The room was bigger than 'the night hotel' we stayed in last time which was on 47th street so that was a bonus.We needed to check in the day before we left and the hotel had computers and printers free to use in the lobby which was an added bonus along with scales to weigh your luggage before leaving to go the airport.The aircon was a bit hit and miss but was ok. No view but only used the room for sleep. Really good location.

The Gallivant is right in the Broadway Theatre District, just a block from Times Square. We found it to be a brilliant location at a reasonable rate. The rooms where compact yet comfortable. We enjoyed a walk to Central Park for a bike ride and were also close to the train station, Hop-on-Hop off city circuits and Hells Kitchen restaurant district. One caution is that the Gallivant is relatively close to the NY Fire Station. We enjoyed our interactions with the firemen as we walked past and hold them in enormous regard but if you are sentive to noise, you couldbe disturbed but the night call outs. Apart from that, we highly recommend the Gallivant for reasonably priced accommodation in the heart of NY.

Spent the last three days at the Gallivant. (Formerly Tryp by Wyndham.) Check in was efficent, front desk staff very friendly and the lobby is small, but quaint. there are laptops in the lobby that you can use free of charge. It was conveniently linked to a printer, perfect for printing out coupons, attraction and theatre tickets etc... The room was clean and modern though Small, as to be expected in New York City. one complaint is the teeny tiny bathroom! It was recently remodelled and is nice, but your knees touch the wall when on the toilet! There is no where to put anything. It didn't matter to us on such a short stay, but if one had to drag their toiletries, make up, hair products etc... back and forth from the bathroom to the suitcase or desk everytime it could get annoying. Closet is also too small to fit a midsize suitcase. Bed linens were nice and clean and beds and pillows comfortable. We couldn't have asked for a better location! Literally one block from Times Square. The Rockafeller Center, radio city music hall, Carlos bakery, ripleys, Madame Tussaud's, Ellen's Stardust diner, Central Park, etc... all within 5-10 minutes walk. Lots of restaurants, comedy clubs, shopping, street vendors and food carts in the area. Three small things that could have improved our stay: 1- the mirror on the inside of the closet door should be moved to the outside, it's so dark behind the door and also too crammed to make use of it. It would have been handy to use while my partner was in the bathroom. 2- half wall glass shower with no door needs a curtain!!!! The floor and toilet got absolutely saturated even with the bath mat down! It's going to ruin the nice floors....3- they charged 2.00 a bag to store our luggage after checkout. This measly amount was not a big deal, but they could have hid that service fee in the daily room rate and offer it as a "complimentary" service like other hotels. It would seem less tacky for a nice hotel.

I stayed here for 3 nights as I was in NYC for business. It is in a great location to restaurant row and time square. My room was a great size and I had a small balcony. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. I drink a lot of water and they sent me an ample supply.

My son and I went to. NYC for 3 days. We had a great trip except for the New York passes and the big bus tours. They are overpriced as well as misleading. If you're there for as short of a time as we were, I'd recommend looking at visiting places differently than the two ways mentioned. The big bus is a bit unorganized and the people working in their main stores were rude and not very helpful. They just want your money then they want you to go away. I've done big buses (same company) in Chicago and DC and they were way easier to work with as well as much friendlier and helpful. We stayed at the Gallivant in Times Square and although it was small, it was pleasant, clean and centrally located. I'd stay there again and not spend a bunch of money on a room to simply sleep in.

Read a lot of these reviews...I actually had a good time. Good location...clean..and as it says on the tin.I wasn't expecting anything but the room size was bigger than I'd had at other lower priced NYC Hotels.Location tickHousekeeping tickAs expected tick

This is my first trip here and it's been pretty good so far. The room is small with a king bed in it but that's ok cause we only need it for sleeping. The bathroom is odd with no door on the shower so the floor gets really wet as does the toilet but other than that it's a pretty good place to stay for my first time. I've heard horror stories of other places and consider myself pretty lucky to be Staying here. It's really close to Times Square which is what you want for all the action.

Stayed here for three nights, and moved rooms three times due to various problems. It was recommended by my travel agent, however I contacted them mid-stay to see if I could change hotels. As it was a prepaid stay I couldn't. I checked in on the first night into room number 1. It seemed kind of okay. However, after using the bathroom, the toilet wouldn't stop running. I called the front desk to let them know and they offered to give me another room (this was at about 1am).I then moved to the next room. It was tiny, cramped and stuffy, you had to step to the side of the toilet to even close the door. On top of this, the air conditioning barely worked, and was extremely noisy. I decided to deal with it and try and sleep. I'm not that tall, but I barely even fit in the bed. I didn't get much sleep that night. The next day I asked the front desk for someone to take a look at the air conditioning. The engineers came up to have a look, they took the filter out and it was absolutely disgusting and clogged. They cleaned it out and then taped up some gaps where air was escaping, however this still didn't fix the problem. I was offered another room transfer, and upon gathering my things I noticed trash under the bed. I was told to expect a phone call when the new room would be ready, but after waiting a while I went to call the front desk and found the phone didn't work. On arriving in my third room I found relief. The room was much bigger than the second room, the bed seemed larger, and the air conditioning worked. The only real problem with this room was that it wasn't 100% clean, and wasn't maintained too well, with the bathroom fan hanging out of the ceiling.Overall, this place is poorly run, dirty, and not well maintained at all. The value for money is poor, especially when you compare it to nearby hotels. You could say the location is great, but there are cheaper or near-price hotels close by.There shouldn't have been this many problems, and it clearly shows a much larger problem with the hotel management. I've recommended to my travel agent to remove it from their listings, and strongly urge anyone considering staying here to try a different hotel in the area.

The price was right. The location was just a few blocks from Times Square. The place was clean, and the employees were GREAT. I have stayed in the hotels in the same area and they were a lot more expensive and their rooms were smaller.

I just spent 5 days here. The staff were great. They were helpful and obliging. The amenities are wonderful although some of the rooms are tiny. However the whole experience was spoiled by the air conditioner. It was noisy and sleep disrupting. The unit faced the bed and blew directly onto the bed. The staff moved me to a bigger room on the 2nd day and the problem was only slightly improved. Wi-Fi is also a little iffy at times. If these things won't bother you then it's a great place to stay at a great location in the heart of the theatre district.

The hotel is just around the corner of everything but the rooms, the elevator, and everything else it's not what we think we were buying, looks dirty. The room is very small, we thought that we were paying for some for star hotel, booking on Priceline and was the worst one on all hour journey.For us was a deception on our trip.

We stayed 5 nights at the hotel in September 2017. We had a wonderful stay and everything was as expected. Nice and clean room with plenty of space. You can hear the traffic, but not in a disturbing way.The location is great, just a few hundred meters from Times Sqaure and with a metrostation nearby.I can definitely recommend this hotel.

Stayed here last week. It's a great location, easy to find, close to subway station on 50th street. Loads places to eat drink very close. Right middle Broadway theatre land too. Nice staff. Nice foyer. Very comfortable bed. Room small. Bathroom tiny, I could barely sit on the toilet without my knees banging against the wall. If you're over six foot tall, bad news. Needs redecorating. About three doors down fri mid Manhattan fire station, which is great if you need fire putting out, but not good for sleeping with window open. Room amenities basic.Overall it's okay.

I really don't understand why this hotel has had such bad reviews?! Yes the rooms are smaller than your normal hotel but what do you expect being smack bam in Times Square?! The location is amazing, you couldn't possibly get any better. The rooms are very well decorated, lovely, clean and modern. Lobby area very modern and staff were very helpful. Air con very good, could be a little noisy to some people but didn't bother us at all. Would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone going to New York and would only come back to this hotel if I visited again.

I stayed at the Gallivant from 7 _ 14 September 2017. The hotel is right in the middle of Times Square. In between Broadway and Seventh Avenue. It has a restaurant and offers breakfast for $20. I didn't use the restaurant as there are so many places near by to eat. One very nice place is Ellen's Stardust Diner which is on east 51st street and Broadway. Good food lots of choice, reasonable prices and very clean. It has an A rating. Good atmosphere as the staff are all aspiring Broadway stars who sing in between serving. Back to the hotel staff are friendly and helpful. The hotels decor looks tired and would benefit from being painted. My room 1127 was a reasonable size, it was clean and there was a mattress cover on the bed. It had an iron, ironing board,hairdryer and coffee machine. Room was cleaned everyday. Bathroom was ok the only problem was there was no shelf to put toiletries on. there was a cupboard under the sink where you could put stuff. Room very noisy when the Windows were open, this issue is due to the location of the hotel and the fire station at the end of the block. I recommend you take ear plugs if you are bothered by noise. Overall this hotel is ideally situated to lots of places. Times Square,Broadway, the pick up.point for the bus tours, the subway and only 14 blocks to Macys. Although it was a bit expensive £1,800.00 for 7 nights you are paying for the location. I would recommend the Gallivant as a good place to stay.

Stayed for 5 nights at the Gallivant Hotel - 4 of us shared one room with 2 Queen Beds, on 12th Floor which had plenty of space, beds were very clean and comfy and the pillows were amazing. Our room was situated at the lift, however we never heard any noise, we actually commented to each other how quiet it was. Check in and Check out was easy. We were there to see the sights and make the most of our time in New York, so for us the hotel was just somewhere to wash and put our heads down. The room was cleaned every day and fresh towels supplied, couldn't have asked for better and perfectly situated in the City. Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel or returning to it if I am lucky enough to go back to this amazing city.

Stays in both July and August at this location. Had one little slip up with housekeeping not servicing the room in time on the July stay, and wouldn't you know it- they remembered me for the August stay and took phenomenal care of me. Five star service from FIVE STAR caliber people, especially Robert the front desk manager. There's 'service industry' people out there who do it just for a paycheck, and then there's the types that do it because they LIKE doing it, they LIKE earning their location great reviews, and they LIKE leaving people satisfied. Will speak highly of this location to everyone I come across, one of my better stays in NYC in my entire life.

Fantastic location just around the corner from Times Square. Room was adequate and staff were friendly. The only mark lost was for a broken lift which lasted for 70% of our stay causing delays getting to and from room.Would definitely recommend for a well priced hotel in a brilliant location

We have just returned from a 4 night stay and had an amazing time . We stayed in a family room which was brilliant .There was so much space and the large bathroom was great . Our stay in New York was made all the better for booking with this hotel so Thankyou very much . I would one hundred percent recommend this hotel .

Our stay at the Gallivant was very pleasant.We went to New York for a mother-daughter trip and booked this hotel for its location-which is perfect! It's only a couple blocks from Times Square which was convenient for us.We had originally booked a basic queen room through travel zoo but were pleasantly surprised when we were given a king room when we arrived. The room was small but very modern and clean which was enough for us. Initially we had some issues with our shower as the water wasn't draining fast enough and took very long to get warm enough to shower but we were willing to overlook this. However our toilet then gave us problems as it wasnt flushing and was backing up every flush. We called the front desk and they were very quick about sending someone up to fix the toilet. A maintenance guy came with a plunger and said he fixed the problem. The next day it still wasnt flushing so we went down to the front desk and spoke with Antonio. Antonio worked immediately to fix our problem all while being very friendly and funny. All we asked for was a fixed toilet or to be moved to a new room if it could not be fixed. Antonio immediately said he would get us a new room! Not only did we get a new room but we were upgraded to the premium room. This room had 2 bunk beds, a much bigger bathroom and shower, and a whole separate bedroom with a large king bed and a view of the street! Our previous room had a view of a brick wall so we were very happy about this upgrade! We had to go down and thank Antonio a million times for his exceptional customer service.He had even let us immediately go back to our old room when we realized we forgot an ipad in the safe. The rest of our stay was amazing. Our room always smelt like fresh laundry and the maids did an exceptional job at leaving us enough towels,soaps,shampoo, etc. We were always very satisfied. Make sure to talk to Antonio about any of your concerns because he will do his absolute best to accommodate you. We will be back to this hotel just for him!

Over charged and poor accommodation . Our room on second floor had intermittent hot water, broken blind and toilet seat which we reported when checked in and didn't get repaired. Requested early morning call which we didn't get due to room phone not working. Noisy room due to poor windows. Lift very slow. Fairly clean but not great and needs a paint. Initially reception staff helpful but when got to next destination to find they had taken money off credit card even thou fully paid, tried to call and cut off 3 times rude and not interested, still to be refunded back. Very disappointed

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at The Gallivant Times Square. I traveled from Queens to Times Square while on vacation in New York. Even though I was early, staff allowed me to leave my bags at the hotel and had water when arriving. I loved the location of the hotel. It was in the middle of Times Square but on a quiet street so it felt like you were getting away from the bustle and noise each night. I also thought the room was nice. I stayed there by myself and it was the perfect size. I thought that the bed was really comfortable! I slept in without meaning to. Noise was non existent and air conditioning worked. The bathroom was small but didn't detract from the room or my stay. Elevators are small in the hotel but there are two and it doesn't take long for a second to come. I also appreciated the concierge service and staff held the shuttle for me when I was a few minutes late. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family travelling to New York.

Pretty disappointed with this hotel, pictures make the rooms look big and they are tiny, we had to keep our suitcases stood up the whole trip as there was no where to put them. The air-conditioning when on was extremely loud. The bathroom was awful, cold showers and bad water pressure, not to mention the fact it was all of 2 ft wide and 5ft long! To top it off, we unfortunately left a watch in the room when we checked out, i called THREE times and apparently the watch has never been found....we are gutted. On the upside it was in a perfect location.

We recently stayed at the Gallivant Times Square and were really pleased. First of all... about us. We are in our mid-forties and travel a few times a year. We enjoy the finer things, but also aren't precious about everything. Think of it as champagne and hot dogs. And most importantly, we're really breezy and don't understand walking into anything immediately looking for things to complain about. We've been to New York several times and like to stay in midtown. This time we decided to try a new hotel. (Booked through Expedia.)I read some of the reviews and was a little nervous, but had no reason to be. Check-in was smooth. Really smooth. We were given exactly the type of room requested and Antonio on the front desk was charming and funny. The room was exactly as we imagined, and while the view was nothing spectacular, we weren't there to gaze out the window. The bed was comfortable and the amenities were fine. (Working room-safe, coffee maker, more than enough towels.) The air conditioner was a little intense and it took us a while to get it to a setting that worked for us.As for the general size complaints that seem to be mentioned a lot... Yes, the elevator was small, and the bathroom was comically small. (Really, if you were feeling feverish, you could sit on the toilet and rest your head on the tile wall opposite you.) But the water pressure was fantastic and the room was always clean. I also understand the complaints about storage if you are traveling for more than a few days, but our two small suitcases fit well inside the closet. For us, nothing beats the location. We walked almost everywhere, but also had access to most of the major subway lines within a few short blocks. We were steps away from Times Square, and also from some great little local brew-pubs and restaurants. There was a great grocery store around the corner for when we just felt like grabbing some pastries and drinks and heading back to the room after seeing a show or just at the end of a long day, and great breakfast spots nearby. I would absolutely book this hotel again when we go back to New York.

Conquer Times Square and explore the rest of the Big Apple while ensconced in a restful refuge. This hotel is close to the action but still covered in relatively unhurried area of 48th Street. With the surplus of attractions nearby plus all other sights to see in this expansive city, any tired traveler will appreciate the hotel`s offerings. The deluxe room has a queen-sized bed and, a partition away, the bunk-bed, making it good enough for 3 or 4 people. Two flat TVs are provided together with a personal ref in addition to a writing desk, chairs, bureau and cabinet plus iron & board. Bathroom is compactly serviceable. The family room is a size larger to take in an additional double bed. Firm mattresses and smooth bed linens induce dreamland and help recharge after a busy exploration of NYC. Fast wifi comes with the accommodations. For any concern, the personnel responds accordingly. The willingness to book this again or to recommend this to friends will speak of its worth. Thumbs up for this accommodation!

We came to NYC for a weekend getaway and found this hotel clean, affordable and in a great location. But the best part was the staff!! Specifically, Jose went above and beyond to ensure we were satisfied with our room and experience. He also provided terrific guidance on the best way to get to sites we wanted to see. We can find clean and affordable hotels, but it's customer service like this that brings us back as return customers.

We had a great time in New York. The Gallivant provided us with a central location, just steps away from Times Square and in the heart of the theatre district. The room was spacious and clean with freshly laundered towels and sheets. A coffee machine with coffee was provided. The staff were courteous and helpful and we were able to leave our cases in storage for the last day for a minimal sum. There is a lot of noise from outside but we used earplugs at night. This would probably be the same in any of the central hotels...Thank you for making our stay comfortable. We will be recommending the Hotel Gallivant!

Great location on "Times Square" Other than a tiny elevator, tiny and narrow hallways, super tiny room, restroom smaller than a port a potty seriously, oh and power strip as outlets, hollow doors! Ok for the price of $109.00 through "Hotels Tonight" it would have been ok for just a place to sleep. But let's put a cherry on top of all that with no late security!!!! What that means is anybody can enter the hotel and go up to the elevators onto the rooms unlike other hotels I've stayed requires room key to enter elevator/lobby access.

We arrived to the Gallivant around 1pm, we were told that a room would be available within 30-45minutes, so my wife and I decided to stretch our legs and go for a short walk along Broadway.The hotel itself, is very well located and is only a few minutes walk from Broadway and Times Square as well as the Subway and main attractions.Upon our arrival at the hotel just over 30 minutes later, we were told by a different receptionist that the room would be available at 3pm, however, he had just checked someone in before us.At 3pm, we were checked in and headed off to our room, on arrival to our deluxe room, we were surprised on how small the room was, as was described as a deluxe room. The bathroom was small and in order to use the toilet efficiently, you had to sit side wards on. The shower itself was fine (advise you to put a towel down covering the floor area in front of shower).The room itself, could do with a complete lick of paint, it is very noticeable that small parts had been painted due to scuff marks etc as these stood out in the light. The air-con was very loud during the night, but it was warm, so needs must.

We just got here and we already love Jose from the front desk! Our room wasn't ready but he saw how tired we were with so many bags and quickly made magic happen! Thank youuuu!- The two Dominicans and Cubanita

We spent 9 nights at The Gallivant and really enjoyed it The hotel is very central to Times Square. The room we had was on the 12th floor and was very spacious with one of the largest beds I have seen The room was cleaned everyday by the excellent house keepers The front staff where all very pleasant and helpful The air conditioning was great to have as it was very hot when we where there I would certainly recommend this hotel and would return Also great free wifi

Pros- Excellent location, the end of the road is Times Square! Could not be any better - Modern and clean and tidy rooms - Lift Access - Quiet (on 15th Floor) compared to how close you are the all the action - Breakfast available to purchase- Look after suitcases if flight is later than check out (a couple of dollars each)- Free wi-fi was excellent- Excellent maid service - left a couple of dollars tip for each day - Comfy bed (even if small - see below) Negatives- Air con didnt work properly throughout the whole of our stay (which in the heat of the summer was almost unbearable). We told reception on day 2 and they said they would send someone to have a look. Didnt make a difference. We heard a guest who had clearly taken over our room number also complain as we were waiting in the foyer for our flight so there was definately something wrong. - Only 2 lifts that hold appox 4 people each (for a 15 floor hotel this seemed minimal)- Service from front desk was very black and white. Did what they needed to but didnt go the extra mile. - Small bed - my 6ft 2 husbands feet hung off the end- Place Do Not Disturb sign on the door every day - the one day we didnt, the maid knocked on the door at 8.30am. When it was on the door, they cleaned room when we removed it on leaving for the day.

We checked in to this hotel to discover that the booking company had made a mistake and instead of a twin it was a double. The hotel was booked out but assured us they would try to rectify the dilemma the next morning. True to their word next morning I went to the front desk and the very nice lady made the change and apologised for the inconvenience. I assured her it was not her fault but the booking company. she said to go about our day and housekeeping would look after the move. when we returned in the evening everything was moved to a spacious twin bedded room with a balcony. I could not fault a thing at the Gallivant. the place was spotless and well kept. the staff were super friendly and the concierge service was next to none. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, thank you so much for making this stay in New York with my son so memorable..

We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in early Aug 2017.While the website, and hotel lobby, are reasonably impressive they hide the fact the rooms are pretty basic and very noisy. We had a room on the 4th floor facing on to the hotel generators, the noise from which was loud and constant. This made sleeping very difficult, as did the nightly patrols of the fire engines (stationed immediately adjacent the hotel). The room was also quite shabby and run down with chunks taken out of the furniture.In general, we found staff on both the front desk and travel desk to be largely rude and unhelpful. When asked if there was a quieter room, we were told that this is not a quiet hotel. On the positive side, the cleaning staff were particularly attentive and the location, within a short walk to Times Square, is good - however I wouldn't stay here again, and cannot recommend it.

This Hotel was in the heart of Times Square. My sister and I went for a 1 night stay. As we are born and raised New Yorkers we had a great time acting as tourists. The Hotel is small.. the rooms are tiny yet very comfy and clean. The bathroom was well equipped as was the shower ( which was probably the best shower I've ever encountered on a vacation). It was spotless clean and very nicely updated. However as we were out walking my sister called the Hotel to ask for a late checkout and was hung up on. Soo we walked back and asked in person for a 12:00pm check out and was told that only a supervisor can ok it ( as it was 1:00 am in the morning there were no supervisor there so the answer was no). We come to realize after our 11:00 am ck out that the ck out time is 12:00pm!!!! All in all the Hotel staff (who brought us our blankets) was very nice and quick to address our needs. We didn't use the restaurant or gym but it was a really nice little getaway.

A party of four of us stayed here for five nights. The hotel itself is well-situated, right by the shops, theatres and restaurants of Times Square. Excellent location. Our room and adjoining bathroom were both a nice size, well-furnished and for the most part we enjoyed our stay there. We had a few issues with the walk-in shower spurting water all over the floor. Could do with a bath mat. Other than that the room had pretty much everything you would expect: comfortable bed, safe, hairdryer, air con, TV, tea/coffee machine (though on the two occasions we requested tea bags wires were crossed and we were bizarrely sent more coffee). A fridge would have been useful but for five nights you can do without. If you have lots of luggage be aware that the lifts are very small: not many people can fit in them so it can be a long wait. On one occasion we gave up and walked up several flights of stairs instead. Our very first and last impressions of the hotel- which are ultimately the ones that stay with you- weren’t great. After we checked in we found that an additional fifteen dollars had been taken out of one of our party’s bank account for wifi. We pointed out to management that when we booked it had said that wifi was free. Whilst they did then remove the fee, we couldn’t help but feel irritated that it had happened in the first place. Classic case of a hotel advertising its facilities as free and then charging upon arrival. We later checked out of the hotel at the end of our stay only to find that both our flight- and the alternative transport we subsequently arranged to another state- had both been cancelled. As it was now 3am in a large city we didn’t know that well and given our relatively young age (22) we felt we had no option but to return to the hotel. We were quite disappointed when we explained the circumstances that the staff didn’t show more empathy. It was as though they could sense our desperation and the price reflected this. Obviously a hotel is a business and not a charity but we felt that given we had stayed there a while and had checked out literally that morning that the staff could have been more helpful and offered us a slightly better price than we were quoted. In summary, a nice hotel in a very good location. Wouldn’t stay again due to disappointing treatment by staff at end of holiday. Check upon arrival that there are no extra charges you didn’t agree with when booking (i.e. wifi).

Wanted to stay somewhere for value for money for a family of 4 in the centre of times square.Hotel - 15 floors high including PenthouseWelcome = Disappointing - very lack lustre and miserable, not quiet what you want when you have just arrived and very excited because your in NYC !!!2 x Lifts = Small, one lift just fitted family of 4 plus luggage - so quiet cosyAte out so never tried their breakfastGym in basement with conference room = basicRooms = Basic to Good - Great value for the money we paid, remember it's a "base only".Don't expect it to be immaculate in detail - For instance had to call Maintenance to fix a lock and a wonky tap. No doubt you will find signs of wear and tear, cracks, and rips.However linen changed daily and immaculate, toiletries and tea/coffee supplied.Beds rather comfy, but NIGHTLIFE will continue into early hours, so some may have trouble getting of to sleep, but you ARE in times square so be warned. Air con in room, but check out how to use it. Safe supplied free of charge plus other things like hair dryer, TV, iron etc. Overall hotel felt a little compact in parts, our room was of standard size. It was in prime walking distance of Broadway, theatres, attractions and great value for what we paid.

the location is very good if you look to stay in time square, the room is very small not like in the pictures, shower and bathroom is tiny, the public area is not so clean and the staff in the reception are not nice at all, but and this is a big but, the hotel is very cheap if you look for location than it is worth the money

Spacious Deluxe King Room.Very friendly and sincere staff whom I've met on many previous trips to New York.While the hotel's name has changed over the past 17 years, many of the staff remain which makes for great conversation and assistance!I am planning my next rip for July / August 2019 and will definitely be staying at The Gallivant Times Square!!!

NÃO RECOMENDO DE FORMA ALGUMA.O staff não é nada amigável, principalmente os atendentes Sunny e Victor que são extremamente impacientes e grosseiros - PÉSSIMOS.Para uma estadia de 6 noites precisamos trocar de quarto 3 vezes.Relação dos problemas:2 pacotes encomendados à Amazon que constavam com entregues pelos correios foram extraviados, apesar da insistência o hotel não os localizou; elevadores extremamente velhos e lentos (não dão conta do movimento do hotel, por vezes esperamos mais de 10 minutos); os quartos não têm geladeira e o hotel dispõe de máquina de água e gelo em apenas 3 dos 15 andares, sendo que duas estão quebradas em pleno verão (apenas a do 10 andar funciona); quarto sem cofre (o anúncio nos garantia um quarto com cofre), depois, no quarto que tinha o cofre, este parou de funcionar; barulho infernal da rua (as janelas dos quartos não têm isolamento acústico, e têm um quartel dos bombeiros ao lado, que saem a todo instante com a sirene ligada); no terceiro quarto, a lâmpada de cabeceira da cama estava queimada, as gavetas da cômoda não paravam fechadas e o ralo do box do banheiro estava entupido.I DO NOT RECOMMEND IT AT ALL.The staff is not at all friendly, especially the attendants Sunny and Victor who are extremely impatient and rude - HURRY.For a 6 night stay we need to change rooms 3 times.Relationship of problems:2 packages ordered from Amazon that were delivered through the post were misplaced, despite the insistence the hotel did not locate them; extremely old and slow elevators (they do not account for the movement of the hotel, sometimes we waited more than 10 minutes); The rooms do not have a refrigerator and the hotel has a water and ice machine on only 3 of the 15 floors, two of which are broken in the heat of summer (only the 10th floor works); room without a safe (the announcement guaranteed us a room with a safe), then, in the room that had the safe, this one stopped working; the windows of the rooms are not soundproofed, so the rooms receive all the noise from the streets (they have a fire station next door, which leaves at all times with the siren on); In the third room, the bedside lamp was burned, the dresser drawers did not stop shut and the drawer of the bathroom box was clogged.

Comfortable if small rooms. Everything worked. Bit odd when we arrived to find a lady in our room sat watching tv with air con on full.Positives. In the heart of Times Square next to a pub. Reasonably priced. Walking distance from everywhere in Manhattan. Perfect base.Downsides? Noise. Cluttered lobby, very busy. You have to pay extra for bag storage after checkout. It did exactly what we wanted.

This was a room for 3 people. It was a really good size room for 3 people. 2 double beds and a bunk bed. Good size bathroom. Clean. Had a few issues with the air conditioning unit but this was sorted once we called reception. Would recommend for larger groups/families.

I took my family of 5 to this hotel and booked 2 King rooms through Priceline. I was shocked at how dirty this hotel was. Layers upon layers of dust build up on the plug outlets and cords. I have photos which I will upload. And we discovered tons of garbage strewn under the bed, empty cups, dust and paper swept under the bed by housekeeping. We complained and nothing was done until our 5th day there even after complaining to each housekeeper and front desk. We finally had to call the manager to deal with it. He send a housekeeper in and they cleaned under the bed but not the rest of the room! Unbelieveable. My daughter broke out in excema from the dust and my son had itchy eyes and sore throat the whole week. The female manager was very unprofessional and rude to us as though our complaint was uncalled for. The only manager with authority there is Ben. I wish we had booked a different hotel for all of the issues. Priceline said this was comparable to a Hyatt which is why I proceeded with the booking. I would rate this hotel a 1-2 star. THe only positive thing about it is the location. Housekeeping was very loud every morning knocking on our door waking us up before 9am

We were very pleased with our stay at The Gallivant. So close to Times Square and the theater district. We were in town to see "Hamilton" and we just 2 blocks away. Perfect! The room was very clean which is always a plus in my book. While the room was small, it was still nice. I mean, it's NYC- you won't be in the room much. Too much to see and do! I would stay here again.

The only good thing here was the location... and kind of, because it was very loud all night... the people at the front desk were rude, the only polite and helpfull worker was José from Dominican Republic, everyone else super rude and unhelpfull. The housekeeping service was bad aswell, they left pillows on the floor... everything was "half done" or done quickly... also, we left the sign to not disturb several times because we were tired... and at one point the housekeeping lady called us to our room to wake us up because she wanted to "clean" the room. If the sign is there then DONT DISTURB!Unsufficent elevators also... one was not working so the other one was always busy, wich delayed our outings. This is not a four star hotel... at most 2-3 stars.

Only my second time in NYC, I was told to expect the hotel rooms to be tiny. When I walked into my room, tiny isn't even a word to describe it. First problem I had was when checking in, the gent said I was booked for a single double bed. I was extremely confused, since the reservation I had in my hands said a double queen. He went on to explain that a double queen means you are either getting 1 double bed or 1 queen bed. Interesting play on words there. I explained to him that is going to make my stay extremely uncomfortable, but he said there is nothing he can do since the hotel is sold out. Asked me to come back down the next day and they might be able to switch my room. After receiving my key and going up to the room, I walk in and definitely got the 1 double bed. The bathroom was so small I couldn't shut the door while sitting down, I was too tall and it would clip my knees. The next day walked down to see if they could do anything about getting me into another room with another bed. A different gent said they have a twin full available. Not learning my lesson the first time, I agreed to switch rooms. Well the room was even smaller then the first with 1 twin bed. Fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me. Went back down and asked for my original room back and they were happy to accommodate my request. When booking, really make sure you read what you are booking. Also I would suggest talking to someone rather then doing it online, to really really make sure you are not getting played.

Last minute trip to NYC, quick booking. I'm used to studio mircro accomodations in big cities and Europe. Housekeeping was knocking on doors on our floor (2nd floor) constantly. Expedia notes an airport shuttle, and so does their website. No such thing. With all the additional fees tacked on, you might as well stay at a competitors offer because it may be just as much or more for a nightly stay. Super easy and central location to get around but not impressed with it's boutique appeal.

Recent seven days in New York, fantastic vibrant city, just love it. Not so much the disgusting, dirty hotel that we landed in. After arriving up stairs to our room, I knew it was the pits immediately the moment I saw it . Spent the first night in a small hot room, the air conditioner did not work. Had no refrigerator, and there was what looked like blood on the wall. Disgusted went straight down to reception early next morning , and was given another room. Oh the first room only had a double bed. Was told that the next room would be much better. After packing up all our belongings, we went up two more levels. And I must say this room too was so disgustingly small and dirty, but at least had a air conditioner. By this time we were so tired of moving , we stayed. We did have a great location, ten minute walk to fifth avenue and twenty minute walk to Central Park. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone coming to New York. In fact, I don't really know how it can still be open for business.

Great location and smooth check in. But hard to know where to start on negatives! As it was NYC I wasn't expecting palatial but our room was very small, two small double beds, yet we booked for 2 adults and 3 children which they accepted. We ended up with one of us having to sleep on floor each night on pillows. Room was painted grey which accentuated smallness. Asked to change room they just said no, not even sorry but no. Some of sheets were stained. AC noisy and didn't work well. TV didn't work two nights running, maintenance had to fix. Window looked out onto a tarpaulin with loads of rubbish around it. Shower didn't have curtain so bathroom would flood. Frequently smelled weed over the four days we were there too. Reception staff disinterested. This was not cheap to stay either so Avoid this place if you can.

If you're looking for a central hotel right on Times Square, then this hotel is the one for you........if you don't mind damp, cramped rooms and mouldy showers. Myself and my fiancé stayed for 5 nights. On arrival we were allocated room 727 - aka "the coffin". Immediately upon entering the room we were hit with the smell of dampness. It didn't take us long to find the source - the wall above the air conditioning unit was damp, covered in peeling paint and had clearly seen better days. The room itself was very small and the bed was a very small double at best. Don't bother opening the blinds, all you will see is the alley behind. The bathroom also smelled of damp and the tile grout was covered in black mould. If you want a hot shower, best set the alarm for early doors as anything past 9.30am and a tepid shower is all you are going to get. Let's hope here's not a fire during your stay - there was a fire alarm test on our last day and the alarms in our room did not work! We could barely make out the main fire alarm in the hallway - it sounded more like a phone on vibrate than a fire alarm - so let's hope you are not a heavy sleeper! Oh, and don't waste your time looking for the roof top lounge as it doesn't exist.

Good location. Tiny room. Great view of the air conditioning unit. But they do have a book called Citiview in the room which I guess makes up for it. Make sure you don't get room 214 as the air conditioning unit outside makes a fearsome noise all night. Also don't choose this hotel if you like hot, warm or luke -warm showers as the water is always cold.

We had a great experience at this perfectly located hotel. Formerly a Best Western, this hotel had a complete renovation in 2015. The room size was adequate and more roomy than other hotels in the same price point that we've stayed in in NYC. The bed was comfortable with plenty of pillows. The air kept the room cool and was not noisy. The hotel itself is very quiet which is amazing as it's onky 1/2 block from Times Square. Lots of great restaurants close by and The Hop on Hop off bus stop/office is a block down. The Staff is multi lingual and exceptionally friendly and helpful. The cleaning staff goes above and beyond to accommodate. A full breakfast is available (for a fee) and delicious. WiFi is easy to connect and strong. Our new go-to hotel in NYC. A great value.

Stayed in The Gallivant Times Square with family for three days. The hotel's location is fantastic as it is right on the Times Square. It is so convenient to just walk to the most happening place in the world. The rooms are expensive a bit but considering the location, it's worth spending the extra buck. They don't provide even the breakfast, which is annoying but there are plenty of restaurants near by .Overall a pleasant stay.

The rooms are extremely small and very little room to move around in itis hard too keep w suitcases in the room and A/C males a lot of noise whilst you sleep. Fairly clean room but you get for what you pay for. Nice for a room if you won't be spending much time at the hotel.

Checked into a supposed "queen"Room. Absolutely no space for anything in room. Nowhere for cases or bathroom items. Not enough space in front of shower for bath mat. Almost needed to put one foot in toilet getting out of shower.Safe did not work. Clock/docking station did not work. Staff very condescending. "We apologise for that sir"No offer of remedy.Moved to a new room. A little better. A staff member comes into locked room while I'm changing. Didn't knock first.Definitely would not recommend. Plenty of cheaper better hotels in the area!

Located in a central location! Just around the corner you close to lots of New York City iconic location. What make this special for me was the attentive of the staff. I specifically want to give a special shout out to Jose Corporan a fellow veteran that made our stay at the The Gavillant a special one with all his attention. I would defenetely will tell my military friend that in their travel to NYC, they will find a friend at The Gavillant!!

We stayed at this hotel for two nights at the start of summer and what greets you first off is the heat from the non-air-conditioned lobby. They did have cold lemon water at the ready though, I just feel for the lobby staff. The room we stayed in was quaint but comfortable. The shower room is one person only due to its size, but, my showers were alright. This hotel has really good WiFi as well. It's walking distance from everything happening in Time Square and Broadway so the location is absolutely perfect. I also commend the bell hop Larry for taking care of our luggage as we had to leave it with the hotel overnight. Overall for its location, price, and staff, I think this hotel is worth staying in.

The Gallivant Hotel has an excellent location - just steps away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. The room had all the essentials - efficient air con, safe, comfy bed and powerful shower. It was small and a bit dusty in places and after the first nights sleep we returned to the room to find a plastic bag with a baby outfit in it placed on top of my suitcase which I imagine was found by the cleaner under the bed (but wasn't mine). The room was also very quiet from both outside and inside noise - despite being located opposite the lift. But overall the hotel was just kind of average - the room wasn't anything special - it felt basic. I would stay here again as it was just for sleeping but if you are wanting something special I would suggest staying somewhere else.

If you need a clean decent hotel in Times Square, stay here. It's not fancy, but the rooms are clean, and it's located in a perfect spot. Our room was small but had all the amenities needed as we were only there to sleep. If you need to spread out and want space make sure you get a bigger room. We had a queen bed, and a clean newly designed bathroom. They brought us extra shampoo/towels when asked, and you leave your hotel and you're a block away from everything. The wifi is "free" but included in the fee you pay upfront

Recently stayed at this hotel. The location was brilliant, 1 block fromTime Square and close to all the Shows on broadway. It's pretty tired and being in the central location, quite noisy; however it's the centre of New York, so what do you expect!Day 2 of our trip we arrived back from our day trip to find the AC leaking. Called the front desk. They were most helpful, said they'd contact the maintenance man. Still 2 hours later, no maintenance man. We offered to change rooms at 10pm at night but said they'd send more towels to mop it up! When my husband moped it up, he found a dirty sock and a lot of dust! Next day happened to meet the maintenance man in the lift with head of housekeeping. They said we'd need to move immediately and were most helpful and found a room on the same floor as our children. Next room was much quieter, however the ac in this room wasn't very efficient!On departure day we woke to no hot water!Spoke to front and the general manager. Was advised the Assistant Management would be in contact. 3 days later, not heard a word via email and not had discounted contributions for my troubles. Let alone the security payments been refunded to our cardThere's no fridge, safes are not in every room. When checking we had all our stuff, we found yet more dust under the bed! Overall stay disappointing!

I've become picky so therefore I may be a bit over the top when I say this was nothing special. I would recommend this hotel if you get it for a good price. The rooms were tidy and descent and best of all was the location. Typical NY the rooms were on the smaller side, but if you are going to pay top dollar you should rather look at something like the Citizen M or so. Again, it's not bad at all and was comfortable and tidy but nothing outstanding.

We always have a wonderful time at this hotel. Tricia at check in always has a friendly smile and provides outstanding service. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is located steps away from Times Square. Looking forward to going back.

Myself and my boyfriend spent a week at The Gallivant. It's right at the heart of the city just a short stroll around the corner to times square. The hotel is well presented outside and follows through with reception and the rooms. We checked in late afternoon and got a room on the 8th floor at the back of the hotel. The room was bigger than expected from having read previous reviews. We unpacked into the drawers and put the 4 suitcases in the small wardrobe. The ensuite however was small but did exactly as needed. The shower was lovely fantastic pressure we didn't have any problems with spilling out onto the floor. The bed and pillows were one of the comfiest. House keeping were fantastic especially Lilli, very thorough. There is a fire station at the end of the block you hear the alarm for about 2 minutes and then it's stopped, we slept pretty well after all you are in NYC. Our only negative was the lifts there are extremely small and slow only 4 people with bags could fit comfortably. One day our cards didn't work when we got back to our room so my boyfriend went down and the staff reprogrammed them but the lift took so long. We enjoyed our stay here, the hotel is so close to everything and it's so easy to walk from here. We loved walking to central park.

We arrived here after a 7 night cruise in Carribean. Reception area of the hotel checking in was quite nice but it needs better air conditioning. Went up in the very small lifts, corridors were so dark & dingy. Terrible smell of smoke or weed about the corridors. Good location for Times Square.Our room 1116 - blinds were all burnt, hairdryer didn't work, horrified to find that my son 16 & his friend 17 were to sleep in bunk beds! Chewing gum all stuck to the wall beside the bottom bunk. Decided to dump our cases and just head out, we are only here for 2 nights so it will have to do.Came back in at 12.30am got changed for bed, pulled the cover down, absolutely horrified to see that the sheets were dirty. Clothes on again and back down to Reception. The man on reception Aziz was very apologetic & helpful and said there was a family room available if we wanted to go and have a look at this we could move to room 1514. By this time it was 12.45 in the morning, this room was much better it had 2 double beds & bunk beds. I asked if we could leave all our cases (8 off) in the other room until the morning as we were absolutely shattered but he said this was not possible. So up to the first room to get the 2 boys back out bed and get all our stuff together to move. This room had a massive bathroom, but bathroom door didn't lock properly and the toilet seat was broken.I was horrified to find out that I had paid over £600 for this hotel for 2 nights, I would definitely not stay here again.

The hotel was booked on the advice from The Flight Centre and was a great choice for my wife and myself. Central to all facilities around Times square and Broadway and for ourselves within easy walking distance of all the major must see attractions ( so easy to walk in New York without feeling intimidated). Plenty of eateries in the area with a great choice of styles. A city pass is the best and cheapest way to see all the major sites.i.e. the Empire State and a choice of many more. The staff at the Gallivant were as most Americans are ,very polite a friendly

What a fantastic hotel! Great location and only 2 blocks away from Times Square. Easy walking distance from E 50 St Subway St. Only stayed at hotel to sleep - rest of the time out and about NY. Couldn't fault this hotel at all. Staff warm and welcoming on arrival. Only down side is didn't realise the hotel offer a shuttle service to major airports. But had already arranged transportation to JFK after asking about the shuttle. Needs to be pre-booked!

The Gallivant was a big reason why our family trip (with 3 children!) to NYC was fantastic. The staff was amazing and the location was perfect! Attentive and very helpful. Right in the Theater District and around the corner from Times Square. Walk to just about everything. Hotel itself was nice. Very clean. Perfect for those wanting to see the city on foot and subway.

My friend and I stayed here in February earlier this year. We were a little dubious because of the reviews and the fact that the hotel changed hands between us booking the stay and staying there. But it was the most perfect city hotel I have stayed in, great location (right in Times Square) for the New York tourist. Don’t listen to the bad reviews I am well travelled and have been to dozens of cities over the years, if want you want is a warm comfortable place to rest after a long day of sight seeing then this is the place for you. The rooms were clean, modern and of a good size. The only issue we had was that one night the shower ran cold for about 10 minutes before it heated up, but it was in the dead of winter in a busy hotel. Also, we left the TV remote on the bed before going out in the day and the maid kept getting it caught in the bed sheets so we would have no remote when we went back, after the third time of this happening we found it hilarious. I am heading to New York with my father next January and have booked to stay here again. I plan to come back in the following July to experience summer in New York so look forward to trying out the roof top bar. Oh and another thing, the WIFI is top notch. Always a winner.

My cousin and I stayed at the Gallivant Times square from 20.06.17-24.06.17. After already having travelled to LA, Vegas, San Fran and Washington we were looking forward to ending our holiday with a bang. Unfortunately we were greeted by the most unfriendly staff at reception, a stuffy hotel lobby, tiny lifts and hall ways and a small bedroom. Also to our surprise our room was never swept, apparently you need to leave a tip for the cleaners to get this done. Whilst the location is excellent, I think a major change in attitude is needed from the staff, especially the men on night duty at reception.

It was with some trepidation that we booked The Gallivant, having read a number of negative reviews from previous guests. However, our experience with this excellently located hotel at the junction of W 48th St and 8th Ave was really good. Our room was clean, functional and nicely decorated. I loved the wallpaper with all the major NYC attractions listed. The lights were bright, making the room look tidy and cheery. The bathroom was a little small, but it sported a Grohe showerhead. Everything worked well. We were on the 3rd floor, but the sound from the streets did not get to us. The hotel is within walking distance to everywhere in the centre of NYC - Times Square, 5th Avenue, TheatreLand. We even walked to the Grand Central Terminal (a leisurely 20 minute stroll to check out the statue of Cornelius Vanderbilt, and to have breakfast there). Upon checkout, we defied the traffic jams, and walked, lugging our luggage all the way to 34 St NY Penn Station to catch our Amtrak train.We had pre-empted nasty bill surprises by emailing the hotel in advance to check on the final total bill to pay, inclusive of all taxes, fees and additionals. Hence, there were no hiccups there. The only grouse is that the lifts are exceedingly small, so do make time waiting for them. Other than that, The Gallivant was a good base from which to gallivant in NYC.

The Gallivant is perfectly situated in Manhattan, right on Times Square itself. The room was clean, comfortable, relatively quiet, and reasonably spacious.I didn't dine, nor avail of the fitness facilities, so no remark in those respects. Overall, it adequately, if not spectacularly, served purpose.

The hotel is in the center of the city, one block away from Times Square. It is also very near several metro stations. We stayed a week in the hotel and our rooms were very comfortable, clean and of nice size considering a city like New York. We stayed on the third floor and it cancelled noise completely.

I stayed here for three nights because of business. When I got to my room it smelled bad, like someone had smoked some skunky pot. This smell lasted all three days and was in the hallways as well. A month after my stay I check my credit card statement and find that there was a charge for $48. I called in and was told this was for a resort fee. At no point when I checked in nor when I checked out was I notified of this. When I called in to the hotel to ask what was going on with this the woman on the phone could not have been less helpful. She didn't care one bit. I do not recommend staying here at all.

Location is excellent if you are headed to the Big Apple and want to spend time in Times Square. The staff could not be kinder...Seriously - they rocked. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. This is my 2nd time staying at this hotel for a conference, and once I know the dates for next year, I will be booking it again. There is a gym, which is small, but has all you need to get your work out in for the day.

Clean enough with a certain style and in a great location. But old and in need of renovation. Plus bad soundproofing on windows and doors means you'll be woken at 6am sharp. Some staff are nice in a New York kinda way, but most are useless and verging on rude. Only stay here if it's super cheap.

This is a great little place to stay in New York, close to Times Square and easy access to other areas. The downside; the lift access is narrow and the walls are painted a dark olive drab colour which gives it an oppressive feeling in the rooms and corridors. The plus side; the staff are great, very friendly, the rooms are compact but clean and have everything you want and the hotel is nice and quiet. There are no dining options on site but you can get breakfast in the Chinese restaurant next door, it's overpriced but handy. We enjoyed our stay here and we would go back.

Would have been a 5*. When we arrived at the hotel we where surprised by how nice it was. After reading some reviews about the hotel rooms being small it certainly wasn't that. We really enjoyed our 4 nights staying here. The issue we had was when we where going home on 23/06. The concierge on the evening shift told us he was to busy to bother with us to book us a taxi to the airport after the concierge in the morning was great and told us it was his duty to do so. I was disgusted by this and really left a sour taste after a great stay. It would put me off returning to the hotel as booking a taxi is the least you would expect. Good hotel but think it may be applicable to teach some of the staff some manners.

We stayed with elderly parents: not the right place! The front lobby has no AC: crowded and hot. One of our rooms had no hot water for over 10 hours. The rooms were nice, and the front lobby staff was superb: helpful, accommodating and friendly. Couldn't ask for nicer people. We did get the rooms very early, which was lovely. On the last day one of the elevators was broken, so we waited for 25 minutes and finally gave up. We walked four flights of stairs with suitcases: not an easy task. In conclusion, if the hotel has better conditions it would be a perfect place. Great location.

First trip to NYC and not disappointed with our stay in The Gallivant. Rooms were modern, bright, clean and quiet offering a comfortable night's sleep after all the day's sightseeing. Staff were friendly and maid service exceptional. Definitely be going back for another visit.

in heart of Times Square, but rooms were still very quiet. Great deal for the quality and location of the hotel. the bed was very comfortable and pillows were great. I will be going back there, what a great find

We had a great time. So close and nice and clean. Nice dark room at night. Shower in with toilet which is weird but whatever. Go to moonstruck for a great breaky. Dont head to hells kirchen at night. stay in times sqaure and youll be fine. Definitly go to hells kitchen in the day though. New york ... so great. Parking is RIGHT across the street. Avoid elevators at peak times. But thats anywhere. I highly reccomend this hotel.

I stayed here before when it was The Tryp by Wyndham. It was OK and with a great location, so we stayed here again. For the location, the hotel was reasonably priced, but I guess you get what you pay for. Upon checkin, our room was not ready which was fine, we got there very early. We were told we could check our luggage and all was great. When we came back to the hotel, our room was ready, the agent was as nice as she could be and the luggage was brought to our room in a very timely manner....GREAT!It went downhill from here. The elevator was tiny with no air conditioning. Not a fan, but not really the hotel's fault. The beds, however need replacing. All you could feel and hear were the springs. Overall, the room was moderately clean with a funky smell. In the morning, my sister found a bug in her bed. It was an ant. Then, while I was packing, I noticed a swarm of ants all over the floor. They were around the balcony door and on the floor. I had my suitcase on the floor and was scared I was going to bring them home with me. I complained to the front desk agent as we were leaving and he was pretty disinterested and never even apologized. Since our train wasn't going to leave until later in the day, we asked to check our luggage. This time, they charged us $6 for two carry-on bags and two totes. My sister said we were checking out today and were guests at the hotel. Nope...you are to pay. I have never had that happen before. The bellhop asked if we needed a cab, which we said we did. He walked out with us, got distracted and disappeared. Where did he go? Weird.Would I stay again? Probably not unless I couldn't find lodging elsewhere. The Gallivant has a great location, it is too bad they can't provide the customer service to go along with it.

Ideal location, just a stones throw away from Times Square! After reading some of the reviews I was sceptical about staying here, those people should have booked into a 5 star if that's what they were expecting! This is an average hotel. Its clean and people are friendly theres nothing that made it above and beyond and thats fine because not what we were expecting. The only thing we had an issue with was the extractor fan in our bathroom was hanging down and not working so bathroom got very steamy and made everything soaked. Not a massive issue to us so didn't raise it with any of the team. Rooms are a little small but that's city living. The rooms were cleaned daily with fresh towels. If you complain then your spending far too much time in your room. We had a pleasant stay and would stay again if we were returning to NY.

I was skeptical about my stay, after reading some bad reviews, I'm happy to say there was no need to worry. Absolutely fabulous stay, rooms were not huge but who who spends time in there room in New York. Rooms were cleaned daily, air con was left on for us so after a hot day we returned to a nice cool room. Staff were also really friendly greeted you with a smile and were happy to help in anyway. Only problem was the restaurant, 21dollars per person for poor food but overall really good hotel location was perfect as well.

Stayed at the Gallivant 4 nights 20th May to 24th May and what a great location for our stay located just off Times Square just turn right out of hotel walk a few 100 yards and your in Times Square. Room had everything you needed no view but it's a base clean and tidy and you get all the views you need as you step out the hotel. Great reception area always wishing us a good morning and on checking out we had a plane to catch at JFK not only did they arrange a Taxi for us which only cost $65 a nice black sedan extended our check-out time so we had a few more hours in this wonderful city. Once again thank you for making our stay great. Always had a good Wi-Fi connection in room and around the hotel

After reading fairly good reviews on trip advisor my partner and i were excited to stay here. We were going to stay cheap in a hostel though decided on the gallivant as the location was great and wanted to be comfortable. Upon arrival we had been on a plane for 19 hours and wished for a hot shower. We informed the front desk that the showers were just warm and that the sink was flooding. They seemed quite uninterested and said someone would check later. This was not looked at until the following day with the shower being fixed and the sink not. Following this the toilet lever continued to fall off and the air conditioning/heating vent leaked water onto the floor. Upon checkout 3 days later i queried the final price on my bill. I believed that an extra $300 (the price that i paid for my deposit) had been taken off my credit card. The receptionist made me feel quite distressed saying that it had nothing to do with them and should call my bank. This would be an international call and midnight back home. As a student on a big holiday we have saved for some time and that 300 is distressing. The receptionist finally paid attention as the line grew and i appologized to those waiting (something you would expect them to do. He clearly just wanted to get rid of me saying it was for security and was simply on hold and would be returned. 3 days later this is not back in my account.The location of this hotel is great, though service is not

The rooms are small and the elevators are slow but it was still a comfortable hotel. It has a good lobby and staff were excellent, but it's prime benefit is that the location is superb being just off Times Square, a few minutes walk to the Rockefeller Centre, Central Park is a couple of blocks up the road, and there is a subway station close by. There's a great street market each Saturday on 9th street, about 5 minutes walk away and plenty of restaurants nearby. It represented good value for money, so I was happy.

Very well located small hotel just off Times Square. Clean room and towels changed daily. Coffee making facilities but can't make tea.
