Breakfast available at adjacent Chinese restaurant just off the Lobby but very expensive for mediocre food. Better off at Starbucks just around the corner. Friendly staff and exceptionally helpful bell boy (man!). Would use again.

Couldn't have asked for better! We were here for 8 days and suited us very well. Perfect location, room was small but who needs a big room in New York!? - You should be out exploring. The hotel had everything we needed, free city guides, free printer to print boarding passes/tickets and it was so central to everything. 30 seconds walk away from times square! Clean rooms and helpful staff. Would recommend to anyone!

This hotel is pretty great and you'll get good value for your money here. It's very close to the subway, Times Square and 5th ave. Nice staff, the rooms are okey, but a little noisy. I would love to have another stay here. We didn't try the breakfast because of the location. (Too many great spots out on the streets nearby)

The hotel isn't fancy but the room has everything you need. The staff are fine. The cleaning staff are friendly. The location of this hotel in relation to Times Square and Central Park is great! My bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The shower was the only thing that bothered me and it's because the water wouldn't go down the drain fast enough. Anyone who complains about the rooms must be spending more time in it than enjoying their vacation.

inexpensive little hotel in the heart of the theater district. the best I can say is that it is clean and relatively quiet. No luxury here, but then again you aren't really expecting it or paying for it. Shower drain clogged, barely enough room to maneuver in the room. Staff wasn't friendly but not hostile either. Basically a clean room to sleep and leave for a full day in Manhattan.

The location is excellent! The room is okay and a good decoration, the building is cool. This hotel is a good cost benefit. I think that the employees could be more nice... But they fulfill their function.

Booked through a Groupon deal in USD - overall was a cheaper rate in CDN than if I booked directly or through a travel site online.Hotel is central to Times Square. Check-in fast and easy. Stayed on the 10th floor in a deluxe room with queen bed. Had a balcony also-but lots of cigarette butts all over the ground :(Decor was modern and funky. Room size small but expected for a NY boutique hotel. Felt a little dark as the walls painted with a darker color. You can tell they tried to modernize an old building with the finishes but you can see still some wear and tear in the rooms, not a big deal though. A/C was an old window unit! so noisy when on, but turned it on low and managed to get used to it when sleeping at night. Bathroom very small but sufficient for both my daughter and myself. Nice toiletries. Step in shower needs to get curtain liner or something as it gets soaked and water leaked out over the bathroom floor.Rooms could be cleaned a little better, dust bunnies around. Bed low but comfortable.

The hotel was amazing. We stayed on the 16th floor which i believe was a penthouse suite, but initially i booked a family room. Was surprised to get an upgrade without even asking! We were a family of five which included two teenagers and a 4 year old. We had plenty of space and got a good deal on the room from the hotel website. We had two balconies that overlooked the city. It also had outdoor furniture as well with cushions. The location to times square was amazing as well. We will definitely be back.

Great locationSmall room but spotless and very modern! I would recommend it and would return myself.Staff weren't the friendliest and our room wasn't ready on arrival but these are my only negatives. A

I wasn't sure what to expect when we booked this, but it ended up being quite nice. We needed a big space but didn't want to go the AirB&B route. Enter this hotel, with "family rooms," kind of one room divided into two. But it was a good size (we had three adults and three children and it didn't feel overly cramped). It also had hardwood floors, which I love! The room had an interesting layout: you walk in to a little area with a closet, mini fridge, and mirror. To the right was a desk (lots of places to plug in gadgets) and two bunk beds and a TV hanging on the wall. As you kept walking through, you came to the other "room" with a queen bed, dresser, and TV on the wall. Each area had its on thermostat. The bathroom was nice. The shower is open (no door, no curtain) with just a half wall coming out from one side, so the bathroom gets soaked every time you take a shower. And it got hot in there! But lucky the window opened, and we could let the steam out. The rooms were absolutely perfect for what we needed and there was even space for a roll away cot, which was very comfortable. The hotel didn't seem to be loud, but then we were tucked into a corner, so you may hear doors and things if you aren't. There is a fire station nearby, which we heard several times but nothing major. The hotel isn't big. Not many bells and whistles, which was fine with us! We just need a comfortable and clean place to sleep when in NYC, which we got! The older lady working the desk was extremely pleasant and friendly! The elevator is super small and a tad slow, so just be aware of that. The location can't be beat, though! It's just a couple blocks off the top end of Times Square (near the Hershey store). We like to walk the city, and it was just a great location to be in. If you're taking a larger family to NYC, this is a great space and worth looking into. We also didn't think the price of the hotel was bad either.

Rooms are small, but clean . Location is big plus point Avoid restaurant, staff at restaurant is very rude. Breakfast is also very ordinary, better walk toward Time Square where many better options available

We stayed here 3 nights. I've read lots of these reviews, and have to say, our stay was great. Staff were friendly and helpful, room was clean, and yes they're very small rooms, but it's mid town New York, who wants to be in a hotel room? I've stayed in many hotels in many countries, and these are the pluses I look for that were included at the Gallivant. Security- Doormen and cameras, as well as in room safes. Most important.Helpful staff - when your in a different country and need directions and advice, helpful desk staff and concierge are gold.Hygiene - the room was clean and refreshed daily. Soaps and condiments were available in the corridor to be used by guests as they wished. Toilet and shower cleaned with the room refresh. Thank you.Small room, who cares? Best location, for Times Square, Broadway Shows, Restaurants and Clubs. I'd stay there again.

Location: Even though it is mere minutes away from Times Square, it was very quiet. Area felt safe. Lots of fun bars, restaurants, shopping, touristy things to do. The nearest metro was only a couple of blocks away. Room 310: faces another bldg. Clean. Small as expected. Bathroom was nice and had shampoo, hairdryer, basic needs. The room itself is a bit dark and doesn't feel as homey as most other hotels. Costs: pricey but comparable to nearby hotels really. Atmosphere: fun modern decore. Front desk staff were polite enough. Didn't try the gym or the attached restaurants. Nothing in particular for me to complain about. Check in and check out was hassle-free for me. In summary, a good stay. I would return if I could not find something cheaper for similar amenities.

I stayed here two times this year. Once with a large group and then with my mom. It is right in the heart of times square which was fun. the staff was incredibly helpful. we had an issue with our room and they changed the room immediately. Not all rooms are the same I guess. We didn't have the hotel breakfast, there's an incredible variety of food in NY. We enjoyed our stay here and would think of returning for the next time.

Firstly, the reason I've given this review an average is because the location is key. 1 minute walk into the heart of times square and for this key location the price was good. That's all the positives I can really think of!We arrived at 2130 to be told our room wasn't ready.... which is absolutely silly at that time and after such a long flight we wanted to get in our room! After standing our ground the hotel agreed to give us separate rooms.The rooms are small but when in NYC, you only need a roof over your head.... the beds were extremely comfortable and perfect for a good night's sleep after the business of new york. On arrival they took a deposit out of my bank account and said it will be returned within 3 working days of our departure. That was almost a month ago and still haven't received it back! I contacted the hotel and no reply so had no choice but to go through my bank as a fraudulent transaction.

The Gallivant is a modest hotel close to many of New York's iconic sites, the subway and other forms of transport. It is near the theatre precinct and Times Square. Being so close means that it is noisy so ask for a room higher than the second floor. The rooms are on the small side but the service is good and fabulous restaurants and shops are at your finger tips.

Arriving late at the Gallivant ( 2am UK time ) we checked in and went to our room. Very disappointed that we had been allocated a double room instead of the twin that was booked long before. Hiked back to reception with our luggage and finally got twin room.we spent our first day exploring and did Central Park, had a good time and returned to hotel around 4pm. As we arrived at our room we were met by the head housekeeper who told us that as we were checking out the room was not serviced. We explained that we arrived yesterday and were staying for one week and definitely not checking out. She advised us to see the Manager which we did - he was apologetic and said let reception know as soon as we left for our evening out and the room would be serviced, which it was. We thought the room and especially the bathroom too small. Premier Inns in UK are of a higher standard. We thought there may have been some goodwill gesture or even a price reduction for our experiences. Nothing! This is quite an expensive hotel but not one we would consider in the future.

first off taxi from lagardia airport $52 arrived hotel 7 15pm big fancy reception whitch made it look lovely checkin was good now the down side got very tiny lift to 12 floor entered room whitch was about the size of a good cupboard when we sat our suitcases on the floor there was barely standing room left i have never seen a hotel room so small windows could not be opened and were absolutely filthy on the outside went to take a shower was so small with one glass pane on the side the water just went out on the floor and after two minutes had to be turned off as the small shower tray overflowed the restaurant was too expensive s we ate outside the hotel there are plenty of little cafes whitch are quite reasonable. the only one good point about this hotel was the wifi whitch was free and very fast

From 25th of April until the 1st of May I was a guest of The Gallivant.The location was essential to me and this hotel is absolutely superb in that category! Very close Times Square (1 minute walking maybe). Other positive notes: Good reception, friendly staff and a good looking hotel.But I also have two negative notes. No umbrella in the room (it rain in NYC in that period). And the cleaning of the room wasn't perfect. Everyday they cleaned our room but we still saw dust on the floor. Despite the negatives our experience was very good.

This hotel was totally amazing! Everything about it was perfect,the staff,the rooms, the views, restraunts either side, definitely recommend the Chinese!! the location couldn't have been any better .. it was a few minutes walk from time square ... if you are considering this hotel, then don't be in any doubt .. BOOK IT!!! ... the night before we was due to leave our flight was cancelled due to bad weather .. at the time they had no more rooms, but the staff were brilliant and told us not too worry they would sort us, a great relief ... thank you for a wonderful stay :-)

Will never recommend this hotel for personal or business trips, as personnel and management have no interest to their clients. It's obvious that they don't have loyal clients, only people passing by and never return back!

Stayed here for three nights whilst attending an event at Madison Square Garden.Location is literally around the corner from Times Square.And a do-able walking distance to Central Park also.Not in walking distance (unless you love walking) to Ground Zero. Hotel seems to get same reviews regarding the staff. With the exception of one guy on the front desk the night we checked in ( didn't get his name) everyone else we encountered was expressionless & cold.No warmth from the staff at all. They literally answer you monosyllabically & certainly don't offer a smile.Rooms are teeny tiny. We left our bathroom door open permanently (when not in use) to give the illusion of the room being larger than it was.Bathroom is a wet room effect with the water from shower falling straight onto the floor. But drainage was ok however I wouldn't imagine a long shower would be advisable or you might end up with a flooded floor. Rooms are modern, relatively clean but could do with more attention from the cleaning staff.Also the lighting in our room was very poor. We had two windows facing a wall & basically it felt like it was permanently night time in our room.Bed & pillows are comfortable except our bed had a giant bottom sized hole on one side. Given the unapproachable manner of the staff we didn't bother complaining.We literally stuffed a bath towel into it & made do.Had the staff been more accommodating I would have said that, yes I would return to this hotel, however I would not recommend The Gallivant because of the staff. Go elsewhere folks.

So Tiny rooms, AC wasn't cooling and when I went down to the front desk they asked to come back tomorrow to complain to the management as they could not do anything, the only solutions was to open the window in this noisy city as a stupid suggestion from the front desk. Tried to sleep but couldn't make it for more than 3 hours and imagine after a long travel that what you get from a careless hotel with no maintenance support in a high season, what type of customer service is that. And finally the engineer left without knowing what the HECK is going on with their AC repair.End Of NYC comedy show Shame

Our first room was too small and the decor was too dark, we had to move as I felt claustrophobic, second room a lot better but decor definitely needs brightening up,it would make the rooms feel more spacious, facilities not great, but location excellent. Need a better restaurant and the price for breakfast are a bit high. On the whole we had a good stay.

Comfortable room, clean and would highly recommend. We forgot iPad and realized it once back home. Located it through Findmyphone and made it ring many times but evening staff was not very helpful, neither was breakfast room manager but hotel manager Yannek took the time and looked for it and found it. She messaged me and was amazing! So grateful because it had lots of pics. Thanks again! I will certainly book this hotel next time in NYC.

From the curb the bellmen met me and grab my bags to take them upstairs which is always great to checkin and be bag free especially if you pack like me! Walking into the hotel, it's beautiful and meeting SUNY at the front desk which is her name and look and smile! The sweetest lady with such a great personality. She checked me right in and upgraded the room because I'm not going to mention the room I was going to stay in at first. That's why I have mixed feelings because the rooms can be better. The walls are thin and over all it's just pretty dark. Can't really complain for the location and price tho. So with this you pick your poison.

I had issues with insects. tiny flies flying around in shower.. I had an ok room because they upgraded me to a suite..they dealt with the flies in shower by leaving a can of raid.THE location was excellent and I was right next door to one of the plays I got tickets for. PERHAPS the standards in New York are lower than any other city in the states..Not sure How miserable it would have been if they did not upgrade me. The bathroom very small as well. In all fairness, I only paid 1/2 the price of all the other hotels in NY. The time I went was also low season.

Just back from New York, stayed here for three nights. The location is perfect you are in Times Square and only a few minutes walk to main attractions.The RoomThe room was absolutely tiny but fit for purpose. Due to the sheer size of the room a lighter colour on the walls would have been better and would have given the impression of being larger in size. The grey walls were very dull and a lot of the paint work was scratched and off in places. Furthermore, the air conditioning while very good was extremely loud and hard to sleep beside. The bathroom was decent enough however there is little room to store makeup etc and it is the only place that has decent light. There is only one other mirror in the room and that is in the wardrobe door but there is no light in that area so you can barely see yourself and there is not enough room to stand back. There was room for a big mirror on the wall beside the door so it is a pity they did not have one there. Before we left we lifted the bed up as a few of my personal belongings slipped under there and it was covered in dust so it is obviously not dusted often. There was a large Panasonic television in the room which you could move and adjust this was great and lovely to be able to come back after a long day and chill in the bed watching movies etc.The LiftThe lift is tiny and once again really dark inside. A lighter colour, better air con and maybe more mirrors would help. I was nervous in this lift as it was tiny and it would be hell if you were to get stuck. Furthermore, the lifts took ages to come down. You could be in the corridor waiting for ten minutes before the lift would come down to you. Not enough lifts for the amount of floors and people using them. We were on the 14th floor so using the stairs wasn't really an option.StaffOn arrival the staff were not very nice. I cannot remember the lady we were dealing with but she gave us barely any eye contact and very little information. We had to ask her where the lifts were as they weren't obvious and she replied rudely and then just turned to talk to her colleagues. (they were so small they look like doors with the Gallivant sign on it). The staff were not informative at all or helpful when asking for directions etc. They didn't seem to want to help at all. However, there was one lady an older lady who was lovely and gave us some kind advice when we were going to buy a new suitcase (my boyfriends case had burst) and she let us check out two hours late as well due to the fact we had to go buy a new case etc. This was very kind. If only all the staff had been like this lady our stay would have been more pleasant.WifiThe WiFi service was average. At times it stopped working and would come up error. Wasn't strong enough to load videos from Facebook etc.Smoke AlarmThe smoke alarm outside our room on the 14th floor was all wires and had obviously been taken out. There were more alarms on the floor but was a bit unsettling to see this as smoke alarms are so important especially when your 14 floors up.I would stay here again however it would be nice if some adjustments were made especially to the lifts. They are only small things but would make such a difference to the place. Furthermore, it costs the staff nothing to be pleasant so it would be nice if some of there attitudes changed.

The hotel serves a purpose for the price. The location is great - very near to Time Square and Hells Kitchen which we loved. We seem to have gotten 'lucky' with our room size as the room itself was absolutely fine in size, although the bathroom was very small so it's one in one out. We did have a problem with our first room where the blind was broken, but they quickly moved us to a different room when they couldn't fix or replace it so they handled that well. There has been some modification to the room - new bathroom suite, new wallpaper, new flooring which is great but they just need to do a little bit more to get it up to scratch really. The furniture is obviously being re-used from when it was run by a previous company, and the bathroom door had a big chunk taken out of it at the bottom so really needed replacing. And although the bathroom suite had been modified the water pressure was pretty terrible so no chance of a quick shower and although they provide complimentary shampoo and conditioner, there is no shower gel. Some of the other things are a bit annoying but can't really be helped especially as it's an old building. So lifts are slow and small. Yes it can be noisy but it's NY and the hotel can't do much about that, and we found it didn't really affect us much (although we were on the 13th floor so nice and high up). The addition of air conditioning units adds to the noise but again this is very typical of NY. Our second room had a much smaller, quieter and more efficient ac unit than the first which we were greatful for.But the bed was comfy - we had a great sleep and in NY that's the most important thing as you spend little time in the room.

Just come back from New York was there to celebrate my 50th, what an amazing place to visit, the hotel was wonderful, very central , couldn't of booked a nicer place to stay, and not too expensive either. Staff friendly check in easy,I could take all week writing about this place, but I don't have the time, if you want to know more just contact me

Hotel room is very small, but awesome as far as location.When I read earlier reviews before leaving I was apprehensive, but it turned out fine.Beds are comfortable and clean.We found the staff to be very helpful.Really no complaints.

Nice hotel a few steps away from Broadway. Small but cosy rooms. Just what you need for a good night sleep.Bathroom was tiny but good shower. Only a hairdryer would ne nice aswell as a few extra cloth hangers.

We stayed at The Gallivant for 7 days last week during our magical trip to New York City. We paid a little less on Booking.com with the exception of paying before we got there and having no option of cancellation so all together the hotel cost us around £1,100 with tax which is extremely reasonable for New York.On arrival, we were told that we had been ungraded to a bigger room if this was true I was pleased because the room we stayed it was still rather small(Queen Room)! Which wouldn't have been an issue if we were only staying a few days, however this was our own fault so I would reccomended a larger room when staying for a week for extra comfort. We arriving in our room, the air conditioning was leaking leaving a sizeable puddle, sadly the man at reception forgot to tell us the number to call for reception and we had to go back down to ask for a new room. The man gave us a new key for a new room which didn't work! So another trip down to reception was required to sort that out, not ideal after 15 hours of travelling. The room was comfortable, we did have a few issues with hot water and the air con was very noisy. Apart from that, we were very impressed with housekeeping who had our room clean by 11am most mornings and who were very friendly. As for the location, I cannot think of a more perfect place to stay. A 2 minute walk down the road brings you into the wonderful Times Square which was so perfect. As long as you don't mind a little background noise throughout the night from the city, this is a perfectly placed hotel.

This hotel is located just 3 minutes walk from the heart of times square. And maybe 10 minutes walk from the ports authority bus station. Rooms are relatively small so you need to be careful while booking on line as they have many options for different prices. I made that mistake while booking through booking.com, cos website doesn't restrict you though you mention number of guests. However the staff concern (in the night shift on 03.04.17) was so helpful and provided us with a bigger room. Rooms were clean and i experienced the same throughout my stay (4 nights)

I visited NYC last year for a couple of days. Having mentioned to the hotel we would be arriving early I was shocked when (despite a delay to the flight meaning we arrived 2 hours after the actual "check-in" time) we arrived we were kept waiting for over 3 hours whilst the room was prepared and cleaned and then re-cleaned before we eventually moved into a still damp and dirty room. Having stayed in September I was then even more shocked to be charge for the room over a month later and conveniently just after the exchange rate had collapsed adding a further 10-15% to an already very expensive room. I have been emailing a couple of time a month since and am yet to have a response from Mr Elie (the Assistant GM) or any of his colleagues. This was one of the worst experiences I have ever had in a hotel and the follow up service is atrocious. Do not stay here!

Great hotel. Recently refurbished with the modern look. Room are small but very clean and tastefully decorated. Linens all fresh white and bed very comfortable. Compact but perfect shower room. Very reasonable price for the location. Would recommend.

We stayed there for four days and in room 501 which was extremely small. First, I would like to let everyone know a deposit is required and although they say you will get it back, they take the majority of it and put it towards a "resort fee". So beware. I realize everything is small in NY but this room was extreme. We had to take turns with our luggage because there was no way we could unpack at the same time. We couldn't even open the closet door all the way because of the bed being so close. Although is was close to 40 degrees outside it was really hot in the room. I asked them to come and fix it and noone ever showed. I tried calling and got nothing. The elevators are also small and took forever so we had to take the stairs many times. Upon checking both in and out I had notified them that I wanted to pay cash for my "resort fee" and just have the full deposit go back on the card instead. They ended up charging me saying their system was down and they had to charge me regardless and paying cash was not an option. Needless to say, we will not be back. On a good note, it was close to Times Square and clean but still not worth it in my opinion.

We spent a hole week in this faboulus located hotel, in 4 different singel rooms. When we first arrived, we where given four rooms at the same floor. One of them was not ready after the last visitor, and appeared as a dirty mess. We got another room imideatly, but this one had water all over the floor because of a leek some where. The third room was wery nice thoug, with a balcony. After gettting through this starting-problems, we had no more trouble with the rooms. It was a lack of heated water though, and the dockingstation/clockradio was outdated in all four rooms. There was a need of upgrade of some of the dors and windows, that someone had tried to cover with som dashes of paint. Not very good looking. The stearwais was small and hard to use for someone not in good shape, so I was a bit afraid for the scenario in case of fire. The restaurants with direct acsess from the lobby, was not any good options for us from Norway. Our taste didn't match the menu. This is all the bad things we can think of, couse everything else was absolute fabiolus!!!! The rooms had coffe maskines, and the mades filled up our rooms with, more coffe and cups every day, among lots and lots of clean towels, and the nicest soap/bodylotion/shampoo ever. They also made the bed perfecktly, and was nice and smiling all the time. That goes for almoust all the employees. It is wery pleasent to stay in a hotel where a smiling face meets you every time you leave your room, and a smile and a helpful answer always wayting for your question - what ever you need to ask about. The location is insanely good, and you can reach almost everything within a few blocks. The beds are wonderfull, and make the rest at night perfect. That is as long as your nabers do not make noise in the hall, cause then you could hear everything. The noise from room to room where not a problem though. If you do not mind if your room is very pretty, but need a god place to sleep in the middle of all the action in the city - this is the place! The lack of heated water, and the poor stearways is why it just det a average rating. The fact that you need to walk some blocks to get breakfast, drags it even lower. I want to enjoy my breakfast in piece and quiet before I meet the crowded streets outside! The coffe maskine in the roome helps though :)

This hotel has recently been renovated so it's clean and very modern in decor. The staff is welcoming and helpful. A block down from Times Square in the midst of the theater district makes it a great place to stop. The Thai restaurant off the lobby is a welcoming food or drink stop though located where it is, the hotel is surrounded by numerous eateries. Shopping price on the web or calling direct will secure you a nice room.

The hotel is grand, rooms are small but they're clean and modern enough (very hot) the bathrooms are decent and the shower was good, only problem I had with the place is they overcharged us! They told us they had only charged us what was agreed through hotels.com but we had to contact our credit card company to find out they had taken extra €300, when we contacted accounts the lady (Olga) had little or no sympathy or even apologised once. Pity because I would have recommended the hotel other than the money issue. Judging by few other comments here I'm not the only one overcharged!

Fair enough, it's a low price for the location, but the reason if painfully clear when staying here and there are better value choices.Firstly - the noise. Yes, if you choose to stay in the Times Square there will always be an element of this, but the building is very poorly looked after and none of the windows seal. This let's in lots of noise that just shouldn't be the case, almost like there is no barrier to the outside. and if you stand no chance of sleeping in a hotel what's the point?Secondly - the rooms. They feel tired and grubby, and the ceiling and walls have marks where condensation has run down them. Just a bit gross really. Lots of the lightbulbs weren't working.The service from staff is brisk and generally not very friendly, which I found unusual compared to stays elsewhere in NYC.Lastly- the resort fee thing is just stupid. It's clearly an added charge to just squeeze extra cash from guests, and it's very confusing and absolutely caused complaints from others while I was in reception.All in all, you're better off looking elsewhere.

When you go to New York all you need really is a cosy bed and a place to shower. When we needed a rest there were plenty of TV channels to choose from. Only complaint I would have regarding the hotel was the heating was always on. I opened the window slightly so the room stayed a nice temperature but it didn't help with the noise from outside. Other than this the staff were very pleasant and the hotel is a 3 minute walk from times Square. Considering we were hardly in the room this was perfect for us. If we were to come back we would use this hotel again. It gave us what we needed.

I wouldn't stay here again, they took the money out weeks before our stay with no warning as they said it would be on arrival. I know there is many tax charges to stay in NYC but it was ridiculous, paying nearly double the price we were initially told we were paying. They also took more charges out when we arrived home and when I tried to get ring up and ask they kept rudely transferring me to different lines and didn't want to know. Other than this it was actually a good hotel in a great location.

The staff, particularly Suny and Adelina, are friendly and accommodating. It is wonderful to be greeted so warmly after a long day of travel. The rooms are spacious, by NYC standards, and well equipped. The location is PRIME - just a few steps from the heart of Times Square. The Gallivant will always be my first choice for accommodations in the city.

Overall not as bad as I was expecting after reading some of the reviews on here. Yes there were some niggly problems like poor internet connections, noisy air con units and poor sound proofing (especially the windows) and also a leaky coffee machine but it didn't affect us too much as most days we were too tired to worry about those things. The room was quite spacious and cleaned to a high standard every day!! The front desk staff were also helpful and I didn't experience any rudeness. We did however need to change our room as the first one was at the back of the hotel and directly outside of the window were noisy generators. Even after an 8 hour flight I couldn't sleep. This was not a problem for the staff they moved us later that day. This may not be an option if you visit later in the year due to the hotel being more busier so I would think it may be prudent to invest in better sound proofing windows. The location was fantastic right in the heart of Times Square.

My niece had booked this hotel for my sister (her mother) and me to stay in on a surprise break for her 60th birthday. We found the rooms adequate for our needs and the hotels location was great. We managed to walk everywhere we wanted to go, apart from using the tour bus. The concierge (lovely lady) booked us a show to see and also arranged our transport back to JFK.The snow storm never stopped us getting about just delayed our departure for 20 hours.this hotel is so central, its is so close to Times Square, Central Park is a short walk away and beautiful in the snow..hopefully we can return again and would book the same hotel.

Due to blizzard conditions on March 14 2017, reservations were made to stay at the Gallivant Times Square located on 48th Street, and Broadway.Upon entering the room I was immediately struck by the small size of the room, the dark brown paint, and wallpaper which made the room feel even smaller.The frigid room temperature was also very noticeable so I contacted housekeeping services and an engineer was sent up to turn on the radiator, and to adjust the thermostat. After the heating issue was "fixed" the room turned into a sauna. No matter what temperature the thermostat was set to, it would shift to 79 degrees. The laminate flooring was warped, and there were consistent puddles of water on the floor. Water was also found leaking from the radiator. In addition, why mention free wi-fi only to charge the client on the final bill? Doesn't free imply no charge?All-in-all the room was adequate for the purposes of shelter from the blizzard, and the location was in excellent proximity to work. On a regular basis, I would not recommend this hotel for a stay while in NYC, unless all you need is a bed, and a place to freshen up. I now truly grasp ratings of Trip Advisor south of 3.9. On a positive note, the Staff is pleasant, and attention to guest needs were immediately attended to. The hotel location is central to many sights, and attractions in midtown Manhattan

I honestly wouldn't even give it 1 star. There was a lot wrong with this hotel experience and it was the worst I've ever had. Every good reviewer here that I have seen booked one of the more spacious rooms that are highly expensive such as the penthouse which is $715 dollars a night. I shouldn't have to pay for so much money for a decent room. We received a standard king bed room with a rollaway bed since we were a group of 4. The staff also recommended this room for us. Service initially seemed amazing. We got to the room and it was extremely small. The photos we saw of the room differed SIGNIFICANTLY from the picture. From the bedding on the sheets to the actual sizes of the beds itself. They most likely took most of their pictures from just their penthouse suites or family rooms and posted on the hotel to look good. We literally could barely fit our luggage in the room without having to trip over them (each of us had 1 standard suitcase and a small book bag). We couldn't control the heating. Your options were either extra toasty or crispy burnt bacon. We had to open and close the window almost every two hours throughout the night to get optimal temperatures. In the middle of the night we heard clanging noises from inside of the walls, which kept us up for an hour. I notified the front desk that we would be leaving after that night and check out. Everything was fine and we got to a much spacious hotel that was definitely worth our buck (Hotel Pennsylvania). However, when I got back home I see that I was charged over 400 dollars because they charged me for the two more nights we obviously didn't stay for! I've called countless times and no one could properly answer me besides the fact that their system says that I stayed the whole 3 nights I planned to stay. They would constantly redirect me to accounting and I will ALWAYS get sent to voicemail. I called every hour or two to see when accounting would come in and 5-6 hours later, THEY STILL AREN'T THERE. At this point, I can no longer get a hold of anyone at all! And it wasn't because the line was busy, but there was no one there at all to even answer the front desk! This is extremely unacceptable no matter how you look at the situation. If you are getting a standard room, IT IS NOT WORTH YOUR MONEY!! For 658 dollars and some change, I expected much more from the hotel than this and the person reading this review can find a better room for equal or much cheaper that is actually worth it. NEVER COMING BACK!

The front desk staff and all there were amazing. My only complaint was the shower not closing all the way. It left a lot of water at times. We checked in on Monday after a long bus to find Suny, one of the sweetest and most professional front desk reps I've seen and meet. She was everything amazing about NYC in a body. She checked us in swiftly and we were on our way. This Tuesday NYC was hit with major snow and ice. After our show was canceled we really didn't know what to do. No museum were open, NYC was rather quiet. My daughters boots decided to go,leaving us with not many options for dinner. The hotel has a Korean restaurant on one side and a Chinese restaurant on the other. We went with the pho/ Korean restaurant. It was tasty and affordable. The reason we did? Another Galvant staff member. He told us about both restaurants in detail. Kind, friendly African American male. Sadly I missed his name but he was amazing. The rooms are small but for myself and a 8 year old it wasn't bad at all. Tv worked, shower was clean and hot and the bed was comfortable. Because of the impact of the storm we were notified that housekeeping wouldn't be able to service us but for one night, who cares lol. There were towels and toiletries left out for guest on each floor and staff were around to help. I would totally stay here again. It's in a great location. Turn left and you have diners and the train, turn right and you are in the middle of Times Square! As we left, my daughter wanted a souvenir from the hotel. I was hoping to buy her the pin that many staff wore. Sadly they weren't for sale but Suny to the rescue! She gave my daughter hers. Gabriella was ecstatic after having part of the trip be a disappointment because of the show being cancelled. I can't tank the staff enough for keeping everything going so smoothly through that crazy storm!

I called few times all the phone numbers looking for assistance. It was extremely hard to find someone to even pick up the phone, not to mention that they were not able to help/answer any of my questions but kept saying that I have call back. When called I was not even greeted after I did. I asked the lady (Johany) of the best number to call but she kept saying to call tomorrow. Finally she understood my question since I was just asking for the best number to call and then she said:"Call the same number". She was not polite at all. I asked about her name and she said Johany. I asked the second name and she hung up on me.

Hotel is located literally a minute away from Times Square, although you don't really hear anything, staff where helpful and the room was spacious and reasonably clean, although spent little time there other than to sleep as its New York!!!!!!!!

We expected the room to be teeny-tiny, but it was fine and spotlessly clean. Our room had 2 full beds and a bunk bed (for my 18 and 19 yr old sons). Not much privacy, but definitely not too small. There was a desk, dresser drawer, large screen TV (which could only be viewed from the bunks and 1 of the full beds). We didn't need to ask the front desk for anything, so can't complain about service. Everyone was friendly from check-in to check-out. My sons said the bunk beds were not very comfortable (they were probably built for smaller folks), but our full beds were fine. The whole experience was a pleasant one. I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 only because it's not an up-scale, posh hotel, but is quite nice and comfortable. I don't understand how anyone could give a negative review unless they were comparing to a super up-scale hotel. The location is GREAT! 48th near 7th and Broadway. We were on the 13th of 16 floors. Noise at night was minimal. Only a siren or 2 here and there - which were disruptive - but, afterall it IS Time Square! We were on the 13th of 16 floors. Otherwise, not a sound. Large bathroom with an open shower, which is kind of odd and gets the floors wet.

I'll start by saying it's a shame for the 1 star because I was prepared to give a detailed review and I even took some pics to share but after returning home and trying to contact them with regard to an item left behind and receiving nothing back, forget it.I'm not prepared to review a hotel when they don't have the decency to respond a simple yes or no to a question for an item of sentimental value left behind. I have emailed, telephoned (no answer), Twittered & Facebooked them but nothing!Shocking to me that they can't even be bothered to reply?!So, for crap customer service, you get 1. And that's only because I can't give a zero.

Great hotel very Central lovely rooms nice pub next door walking trip enjoyed lots of shops was very cold outside and lots of layers if you're going at this time of the year lots of theatres around the area

You can't go wrong at this hotel. We were one block from Times Square for less than $125 a night are you kidding me! Hotel was clean, front staff were great, room was big enough for a full size bed, desk and two end tables and no view. Did I mention the price, this is the best hotel for your money in Times Square. There is a great Italian cafe across the street with awesome coffee and pastries. Less than a block away is Times Square diner which has an amazing affordable breakfast.

Amazing location, we got a bargain for what we paid for the room. The hotel and and room were very clean. The room was very compact, smaller than we expected, as was the bathroom. However the air con worked great, the bed was comfortable, there were plenty of plug sockets, and the shower was great. Actually great value for money.

Not a bad place to stay in Times Square. Really convenient location. Friendly staff. But, here is where it gets negative - This place is on 48th St, which seems to be heavily traveled throughout the day and evening and there is a firehouse at the corner of 8th and 48th, so you have to deal with the noise from there too. Our room (a King size) was really nice and the bed was comfortable with clean sheets, but our room lacked a desk (which there was enough space for). Also; They need to step up on their maintenance, because our sink would not properly drain and our dresser fell apart while we were staying there. We told the frond desk about it and were assured that they would have it addressed, but it was never done. Like i said before, this is a nice hotel, but, given our experience staying here for one week, I would consider staying somewhere else.

Ignore any rubbish reviews, just about to check out and have to say hotel has been absolutely ideal for our stay. Been in 10th floor with balcony to sit out on. Very clean room- bed comfy - iron and board also safe in room. Yards from Times Square- within walking distance of 98% of sights. Really cannot fault this hotel. Staff friendly and very helpful. Thank you vision cruise for choosing this hotel, we were apprehensive but all fears alleviated. Would recommend to anyone

After reading some of the reviews on here I was extremely apprehensive about our booking and considered changing to another hotel. So pleased we never! The location was perfect, the bed was like sleeping on feathers and the staff were extremely helpful. We had some of the issues previously mentioned, ran out of coffee, reception replaced these and cups; Room was small with no view but it was the standard Room (312) & it meant no noise from the street; the air con packed in on night 3 of 4 - they upgraded us to one that worked and bigger for the inconvenience (1027).. they couldn't have done more! To add to this they arranged a black car to the airport for us, only $8 more than a taxi, which was the perfect way to travel. Stayed in NYC 4 times but this is the only one that I would return to... thank you

Lobby is very nice..loved the decor. Parking is directly across the street. No valet needed. Hotel will stamp your ticket for a better price. Tried to check in early but no go. Asked for higher floor room which hotel accommodated. Checked bags with concierge so we could walk around. They were very polite and helpful. Hotel is really in a superb location. Reception desk was polite. Room is small but comfortable. This is NYC after all. Everything clean. Queen room is more than enough for two people. No fridge in room which would have been a plus. Vending machines sold out of water..although with this location you can get anything you need from a million places. Would definitely stay here again. Can't beat price for this value.

If all or part of your visit is to go to the theater, this is an ideal choice. Within a block of the TKTS day of show ticket booths on Times Square, what could be better? Look for off season deals to get best value. It's a fairly noisy location, especially since a fire station is just down the block in the opposite direction, but not much different than other hotel sites. The single/double rooms are small but adequate, clean, and comfortable. A friendly singing maid brightened the day each morning. The only negatives: the small number, small size. and slow speed of the elevators; the lack of counter space in the bathroom -- both first-world problems.

I booked this hotel through their page, I thought it was going to be a nice spacious room with a double bed. Well, the room I got looked nothing like the ones they show in their pictures and on top of that we got two twin beds. Only one of the beds had a comforter. I called the front desk and asked if they could provide me with another one and they said that they had no more comforters left, so I ended up sleeping with two blankets and it was pretty cold. The beds were pretty comfortable. The room and the bathroom were clean. Overall, cleaning staff was very polite and diligent, treated people very kindly. Location is excellent. It is pretty noisy but its in the middle of Times Square. If you want peace and quiet stay away from TS.I would like to point out that some of the staff members at the front desk, including the manager, don't really give a hoot about costumer service. The only person at the front desk that knows anything about costumer service is Antonio. Kudos to you Antonio.

So we stayed here for three nights in Feb 17 and over Presidents Day weekend. Despite the American holiday, the hotel didn't seem too busy.First impressions, lobby seemed clean and modern. Checked in around 9pm and the guy at reception didn't smile, or greet us in a particularly friendly manner. Doesn't make or break things but when you've just flown 7 hours and are tired, every little helps...I'd asked for a high storey room after reading some reviews...ended up on floor 4 so that didn't happen either.Onto the room, like most manhattan rooms, it was small, with an incredibly tiny bathroom however it was tidy enough and seemed modern. Enough for somewhere to rest your head and have a wash. The bed was also very comfy.Being so close to time square, a certain level of noise was expected, however being on a lower floor and near the bar meant there was a lot of loud music in the evening which I wasn't too pleased about. Overall, for the price I paid, I was satisfied but I probably wouldn't stay there again and would stay a bit further away from time square next time.

When you go to NYC you know rooms are small. But as small as to barely fit standing on the side of the bed? And the front desk staff do have an attitude. Again, is what you have to expect when traveling to the city, but more so.

This hotel is perfect location - right round the corner from Times Square and 10 minute walk to central park. The hotel is lovely and clean, very modern. The staff were friendly, pleasant and always willing to help. There is an ATM in the lobby which was useful. The room had everything you need but I did think it was a bit small - not much floor space for suitcase, shopping bags etc. The shower is so powerful and hot - best shower ever! The bed is extremely comfortable but you can hear a lot of noise outside. We had the heating pipes constantly bang every night - so when I was asleep I slept great - but was constantly woken up. Would I stay hear again? Location - yes. Quality of sleep - no.

Price at this time of the year is friendly on the pocket plus it is in a prime location and tourist sites are mostly within walking distance. Queen deluxe Room is decent enough for 2 people considering NYC standards. No microwave oven in the rooms and fridge are upon request. Restaurants are all over anyway.They have given us complimentary early checkin and it was such a great help after the 14 hour flight.

Picked this hotel purely for its location and ease to everything, I'm not one to pick a hotel on its facilities when going on a city break like NY you pick for its location and this was spot on, room was small but again what do you expect for a NY hotel? Facilities in room were ok there was free coffee and free safe use which was nice, shower was OK but room had no bath, bed was on the small side there was no way it was a queen bed which we had paid for. If your a light sleeper then I'd advise strongly against this hotel, it wasn't even about the noise outside as again you can't help this, it was the paper thin walls I could hear the next room screw up a piece of paper this is how thin the walls were so just factor this in as it appears to be most rooms and can be extremely annoying and kept me up for the first 2 nights! If you want breakfast same yourself for 2mins down the road don't pay $20US in the restaurant attached as it's so not worth it. Overall an average hotel for its facilities I would choose somewhere else to stay purely on the fact of the room and the noise coming through the walls.

We were pleasantly surprised when we stayed here in November, we had a very comfortable and clean room. Four of us stayed in a room that faced the river. Like most places near Times Square, there was a little noise, nothing that kept any of us awake. I loved the view, down to the river and all the buildings in between. We were on a girls long weekend, and the Gallivant was perfect for us. Pleanty of room, extremely comfortable beds and clean. We had a great wet room with a big shower. We were concerned when we read previous reviews, we had no problems at all. The staff we spoke to were charming and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

I had a terrible experience in Hotel Pensylvania NY, however we transfered into a premium room in the Gallivant, loved the room, very modern and nice. Had usb ports for chargers which was very helpful, very spacious. Lovely view from room, bed very comfortable. Only thing that could be better is shower pressure, water came out very faintly.

The hotel is in a great location and the rooms are updated, clean and very spacious. The area can tend to be a bit noisy at night with the hustle and bustle of the city since you are right in Times Square, but for the price, you can't beat the location. I would recommend this hotel.

Negatives:We came straight from the airport at night and didn’t have cash to tip the man who took our bags (which we apologized strongly) – he went from being the kindest person to not even looking at us for the rest of the week or being rude. Then we were woken up in the middle of the night; several times during our stay. You can literally hear EVERYTHING people say and do in theirs rooms…. And when the doors shut they are so loud it will definitely wake you up – every time… This was probably the worst thing of the entire stay.When we asked questions the people at the reception made us feel like we were annoying. Not very welcoming. We asked for a late check out; the best they could do was ONE hour later.. So we had to stay in the lobby for about 7 hours with a manager starring at us to make sure we didn’t lay down. We had to pay for them to keep our bags in a room which I find ridiculous – it’s a locked room in the hotel, ive never had any other hotel charge me for this service. And to top it off, when we come home they’ve charges our card with 115 dollars in “urban fees” which i first though must be a mistake. They did not inform us with this information upon arrival which I think they most definitely should have done. The hotel interior in the lobby looks very cheap as well (my personal opinion..). Positives:The vietnamese restaurant next door. And the cleaning staff do a good job. The location is good, but DO not eat around this area; first day we paid over 80 dollars for a breakfast for 2 people…. All in all, the hotel is ok, with some major flaws. Not worth the prize. We definitely not be booking The Gallivant on our next trip to NY.

The lobby is the nicest part! The room was tiny and the bathroom stunk of fresh cigarette smoke each time the fan was turned on, which is each time the light is switched on. The receptionist/manager "Unique" (that is her name) told me she would send someone up to spray air freshener. This never happened but I wouldn't have expected it to work. I inhaled second hand smoke for 4 days. Shower broke on second last day and had to shower in a different room two days in a row after 90 minutes of a plumber attempting to unblock the overflowing drain and pleading with reception to give me access to a different shower. Asked for an extra blanket on three nights to no avail as the room was Baltic. Froze for 4 nights and had no shower for two. Single paned glass on a busy NYC street means very loud and cold room. Window froze one night so had to breathe in cigarette smoke for the night and no fresh air. Reception were not interested. Asked reception for cups to make coffee in an attempt to heat up one particularly cold night and was told to wait in my room and the cups never arrived - surprise surprise. Had to go out in -5C weather and get coffee instead. They don't care about their customers at all. The elevator and surrounding areas smelled like weed too! When making a complaint re the above, I was told the general manager Ben would call me on Monday morning and I didn't get a call. Again, surprise surprise! Good location as it's right at Times Square and theatre district, but I would rather the comfort of a decent hotel.

Travel on buisiness 2 nights.On first impression entering the hotel was neat. It really has an interesting main lobby area. Although small it was quite fancy and great change from the typical Marriotts and Hiltons normally stay in when traveling.Checkin was fast and easy, and staff were friendly. I do not understand the deposit you need to place when checking in. I payed by credit card so shouldn't have had to pay a deposit. But oh well, money was returned on checkout.Elevator was really neat. It is very tiny and classic old which adds to the character of the hotel.The room was really nice in appearance and well furnished however there was just enough room to squeze around the bed on all 3 sides. Had to put luggage on bed everytime I needed to put something out. The washroom was even smaller, have to sqeeze to the side if you need to close the door. The size of the room was amusing but did not bother me and actually felt really cozy. This is NYC and realestate is expensive. BTW I have stayed at a couple of other hotels and while rooms were bigger they are all small in the older buildings.Did not see any bugs or bed bugs and I always do look the room over when traveling regardless of where I go.Did not notice any noise at night and was facing front of hotel 5th floor corner room, most lower rooms in all hotels are typically noisey in NYC.I would stay here again as price was great and location better.It is a 2-3 minute walk to the heart of times square and lots of restaurants and bars if you so desire.It is in the center of the city so if you like to venture on foot as I do in the evenings just walk in any direction and be amazed.Did take a walk to Central Park however it was night and dark so did not go in and do not suggest doing so. Great during the day if you have time.December is a greeat time to visit as everything is decorated around the city with Christmas lights.

What can I say about front desk agent SUNY? First of all, I have never in my life been treated so poorly by someone who is your first point of contact at a hotel. I do not understand how she is still employed, especially at the front desk. She should be collecting the garbage instead in my opinion. To top management - do yourselves a favour and find her replacement ASAP. There are so many people unemployed that would contribute to the hotel in a positive way - Suny is so patronising and full of bad attitude. Monkeys could do a better job. The hotel location was good. The bed was comfortable, however the room did not look anything like the photos (as mentioned by other reviewers, room was small and lighting was horrible). And, be aware of additional charges that they do not tell you before you book. There is a $15.00 mandatory urban fee (excluding tax) which is a scam to me. It apparently covers the use of the business centre, fitness centre and WI-FI. If you look on the website, it says wi-fi is complimentary...so i don't understand why it is additional. I did mention this to the assistant manager however she made up some lame excuse that it says clearly on the website. Wi-fi was slow anyway. Also, if you leave your bags after checkout you have to pay $2.00 a bag. I don't know if this is the norm in NY, but i have never been charged to leave a bag for a few hours.

Location of the hotel was close to bus stops, restaurants, attractions and shops. The entrance to the hotel was great, clean and reception staff friendly. However, when we arrived at the room it was very tiny and did not resemble the photos online and shown by the travel agent. The double bed with small, there was only one bedside table on one side and the other side was about one foot from the wall, couldn't walk up beside it to get into bed had to crawl up from the bottom. The wardrobe was tiny and made even smaller by having an ironing board in there and the only place to put the suitcases. There was a chest of drawers to put clothes but the top was taken up with tea and coffee facilities so there was nowhere to put toiletries or makeup. One stool so had to sit on the bed. The bathroom again was tiny and the shower was open so the water came out onto the floor. The shower was not hot on the first morning but after contacting reception this was sorted quickly. Lighting in the room was very poor, it was spot lights down the side of the window so when I was sat in/on the bed I couldn't read the maps or guides. We were so tired from the journey and as we were only staying for 3 nights we didn't complain to reception.

I couldn't believe how great this hotel was. You know when you book a hotel in New York City's theater district for $110.00 per night including taxes you get a little scared about what you are going to receive! The Gallivant is the old President Hotel which has gone through an entire makeover! Clean, roomy(for New York), excellent beds and good view in our king size bed hotel room! The location could not be better, between Times Square and 8th Ave it right was steps away Longaser theater and across the street another theater its just the best location for theater mixed with price you couldn't stay in a better place!

Great location, between 8th Ave and Broadway, just north of Times Sq. Easy access to subway lines, walk to many tourist sites. The negative about the location is that at the 8th Ave corner there is a fire station, a busy fire station, sirens. While the room was well sound insulated from the hallway and adjoining rooms, there was little insulation from street noise. Staff were VERY friendly, allowed an early check-in, fixed the broken heat quickly. Room was small but who spends a lot of time in the room while visiting NYC? Bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was tiny, not much room for toiletries and the shower was one of those open showers, no curtain, no door, expect a flood. Wife, 2 friends and I had a very good stay and would happily stay here again.

Where to begin? First impressions of the hotel were great, the location, could actually not be much better. We found that being so close to Times Square gave some excellent options when it came to food, shopping or sightseeing. The lobby/reception is impeccable when it comes to cleanliness, appearance and mood. It comes across as a really classy place. Check-in was swift and we got an upgrade to a room with a bigger bed, all for free. 2 items worth mentioning here, there was a $125 charge made to my credit card for 'security deposit' (would have been nice if this had been mentioned to us at check in, not three days into our stay when we queried it), second item to mention here is the $250 charge if you smoke in your room (I will pick this up in a moment).The room was tiny, I've seen bigger toilet cubicles. The lighting was horrific, spot lighting didn't line up with anything in the room, and opening the blinds did nothing as we were on the third floor at the back, so we looked directly into a tiny courtyard. This did have a plus point, it was extremely quiet. Another small point on this room, the heater didn't work, so it was really quite cold.Now, the smoking charge. On our third day in the room, we noticed a rather strong smell of smoke in the bathroom, it seemed to be coming from the extraction vent. Upon complaining to the front desk, we got ourselves another room to move to, this was on the 5th floor facing the street. Excellent we thought. Lighting was much better, room was bigger. But why have the $250 charge in place if you aren't actively going to stop people smoking in the hotel. The exact words of the guy on the front desk were "it's not you, we know that, don't worry". Not to mention that quite frequently when moving from our room to the lift the was a really strong smell of cannabis, that was most unpleasant. A bit of a let down to be honest, but at the time, we thought we had got the better end of the deal...Wrong! The second room may well have been bigger and better lit, but there was a rather large gap better the top of the window frame and the wall it is supposed to attach to. This made any noise from outside, become inside. It also made the room as cold as outside, which in January, is seriously cold, overnight, we were looking at -4c / 24.8f with the worlds thinnest duvet/comforter.Overall the hotel was poor but the fact you are in New York City (so you aren't really in the room much) and the location for outweighs the misgivings of the hotel. For the price, it would have expected a little more but then again, I did book based on the misleading photos.

We checked in on 29th January, and were greeted by a very rude dark haired man (never caught his name due to lack of name badges) at reception. We were not told any information on check out, wifi, breakfast they offered etc. All the dark hair man cared about was getting a credit card details from us which we weren't told we would need from our travel agent. Lucky we had a debit card available at hand as none of us even own credit cards. After he snatched the card from my hand and swiped it he told us that $125 would be charged to the card. We were then given the room keys and told it's room 605 and shooed off. No customer service whatsoever. We had to go down the night before check out to ask for the check out time where an African American girl working on reception gave us a weird look and told us 12pm. She never even thought to ask why we weren't told, she was again very rude.Check out was even worse, this time we were greeted by a blonde hair women (again no name badge) who was very rude and just asked us our room number and never offered if we wanted our bags stored away. While we waited for our shuttle to come pick us up we noticed that every other guest that checked out after us was asked if they wanted to store their luggage.The housekeeping staff were the nicest, most friendliest staff in the whole building! They would greet you and have a small chat with you, and made you feel far more welcome to the hotel. However, the rooms weren't as spotless as you'd expect. On the 3rd day my sister found a cum covered sock underneath her bed. It was very unpleasant.Another complaint was the noise coming from the air con/heaters they would make a racket noise every 30mins-1hour. It's was sort of a loud bang, very annoying. we were at the back of the hotel and every night and day you could hear the noise of fans turning from the building next to the hotel. I suggest you bring ear plugs if your a light sleeper. Another point to mention, was that as soon as it hit 5pm there was this displeasing smell of deep fried food that somehow got into the room, but there was no windows open and we never even ate in the room. Only stay here is you are looking for a place to rest your head.

I've just got back from NYC this morning! Hotel is in a GREAT location (at the top of Times Square) and wifi is really good. The rooms don't look anything like what they look like on the pictures though, the lighting is absolutely terrible. We had to move lights to allow us to get ready because it was that dark! The double bed is not what you'd expect in America more like a 3/4!The bathroom got soaked every time we showered and the condensation was ridiculous. We ended up putting extra towels on the floor every time we showered! As we weren't in the hotel much we didn't mind but if you like a nice big room don't book here!We didn't have any issues with noise as most people have complained about?! But we're on the 3rd floor at the back of the hotel. It seemed a problem to ask the receptionists anything! We queried a card payment on our 3rd day and were told it was a resort fee (£79.61) this transaction is still pending but we were told there was nothing when we checked out. Suny is particularly rude and didn't listen to what we were asking just ended up raising her voice above ours. If you're just after somewhere to sleep after a long day exploring then perfect but if you expect a lot I wouldn't book here!!!

We booked a economy room which was about £100 a night. The room was tiny and dirty. We asked to be moved and was upgraded to a queen. A tiny bit bigger but still dirty. I found ants and a Cockroach in the bathroom in February! twice and complained. We moved again to a king room which is better. No mini bar or water in the rooms. If you're on lower floor the noise is crazy and you will will get no sleep. They also take out payments out of your account before you even arrive, not in one payment but in a few so I get a credit card fee each time. All in all I would not come again ever! and would Not recommend it. Oh and if you're on the larger size the bathroom is a tight squeeze! (I'm serious!!) good location and that's it.

I stayed at this hotel for four nights end of January and I couldn't have been more happy about my choice. I had read some negative reviews about this place before arriving and I feared that I would have a bad experience. But I was positively surprized when I arrived. The check in service was really quick and friendly. I got a room on the fifth floor facing the back yard the first night. I wasn't to happy about the view and asked about if I could get a room on a higher floor the next day. This was no problem and the next day I got a room on the 15th floor with windows facing the street. I really loved this room. A bit smaller than the first one but so much cozier. During my stay I was only in contact with the staff for recommendations of where to go etc and I really don't have anything to complain about except maybe that they could have real glasses in the room instead of paper cups and i was also surprized that there was no mini fridge in the room. But those are small things and it doesn't really do anything to my impression of the hotel. I would be happy to book this hotel next time I visit NYC.

We stayed in a "family room" - very nice room with two double beds and a pull down bunk bed. All three kids loved it! Plenty of space for all five of us. The bathroom was very modern and had an open shower, which the kids also thought was amazing. The reception staff in the lobby was super helpful, and there is a cute Irish Pub right next door. Our only complaint was the loud sirens/horns/firetrucks at night, but I guess that is what you get when staying right in the heart of Times Square.

We're a group of students and faculty from Philippines. We drove to New York City from Washington D.C. last December 13, 2016. We arrived at around 2pm and we couldn't check in yet. The lobby was full of luggages and people waiting to check in. We decided to have lunch first at Dallas BBQ, a few steps away from the hotel. The best thing about the hotel is its location. If you walk out the hotel and turn to your right, you'll see the Hershey's World and that famous Times Square Tower. Our room was fine. Comfortable beds and clean bathroom. The view from our room was a nay though and the heater was making noise. In case of others, their rooms were smaller than ours ( idk why but we all got the same type of room) and they had no mini fridge! (Our room has)Overall, this is a good hotel. I would like to visit and stay again here someday.

Rubbish hotel, rubbish room, noisy from generators outside the room. But great location, Location is only reason it got 1 star otherwise I wouldn't even write the review consider the 1 star a positive.

Please book a stay at this place. location is amazing and the customer service is outstanding. Tricia is the best concierge I have ever met and I work for a hotel!! I was really treated well by the entire staff and the soaps and lotions are great too!

First time staying in this hotel after reading reviews I knew it wouldn't be the Waldorf but we were generally disappointed with the room itself.Check in was simple and easy, the lobby is trendy and welcoming.We then got stuck in the lift for around 20 minutes which wasn't the best start to our stay! However I cannot fault the Security Guard who was there in a flash trying to fix the problem for us.The room was tiny and the bed was the smallest double bed I've ever seen! It would've fit 2 small hobbits!Our room was on the 14th floor and it was absolutely boiling hot all the time even with the air conditioning on full blast (very old system - not temperature controlled). The lights and plasma tv give off so much heat as well, try to turn them off before you leave the room!We didn't get any water in our room and when I went down to ask reception if we could have some I was told we didn't pay the "urban resort fee", which included bottles of waster, turned out we did but when this was discovered on the last day there was never any water left when we asked. I know it's just water but if I've paid for it as part of these extortionate "resort fees", I'd at least expect some left in my room or available on request at reception. We didn't eat in the hotel however breakfast is available and there's a Chinese next door. We didn't use the gym or other facilities either so can't comment on them.We paid $2 per bag to store them for a few hours which I think was a bit tacky but just another way to make some cash. There's a hotel airport shuttle which was $55 per couple and ran every 30 mins. We weren't aware of this or told of this until we saw the sign leaving the hotel. We got an uber from/to JFK and it cost around $60-65 each way.The location is great, so close to Times Square! And going by some of the other reviews of it being noisy....off course it's noisy, it's a hotel next to one of the busiest tourist attractions on the planet in the city that never sleeps, pack some ear plugs or stay Uptown!The reception staff weren't particularly nice, every query/question/small request I had they weren't able to help. Never asked how our stay was when checking out, no one to speak to about the issues above.Overall you get what you pay for, be sure to check the resort fees and what you actually get with it.As a base for NYC it serves its purpose but I don't think we'd stay here again.

Great location but we were miss informed about two things .called the hotel to make the reservation and was told breakfast was included. Not so ! We were offered water !second we told a state of the art exercise facility.wrong a 2x2 room with three pieces of equipment..would the minute we got there we had to have the air conditioner serviced. Will shop around a little more later

Generally the hotel was amazing, nice size room and cleaned everyday as well as the brill location - 2 doors down from a bronx tale. However putting up a towel instead of a pane of glass for a window would have been more effective at times especially in the morning when the bin lorries came however this was expected! We both found the male staff to be more efficient and friendly as opposed to the female staff who just seemed annoyed that they were at work however on the whole the hotel was pretty good and on the way back to the airport the hotel sorted us out a limo with a company they work alongside. Dont really see what all the awful reviews are about, people expecting far too much from such a decent priced hotel. Couldnt fault the maintenance as our toilet was blocked and it was fixed within minutes. Couple of heads up though - there will be millions of bus tour and comedy ticket salesmen in times square which get really annoying, try and catch a new york islanders hockey match in brooklyn as its a nice change of scene and there will be plenty of people who seem friendly enough in times square - such as people giving u mixtapes or dressed in costumes- but really just want some money (they can spot a tourist a mile off!) Also pay a visit to the playwright tavern on 49th street!!Lovely hotel would definitely stay again thanks very much!

1st trip to NYC, location perfect for ease however the noise from outside all through the night was really horrendous, windows single glazed and draughty. Room nice but staff lacked any customer service skills or general politeness. We weren't even asked upon check out if we were satisfied with our stay, had we had a nice time, nothing. No hellos upon entering/leaving. We couldn't believe how friendly everyone in NYC was, including the locals who were only to happy to help with directions etc... if we ever got stuck, which only high lighted the unfriendly staff at the hotel. On our first night we asked at the main desk if there was a hdmi point on the tv, his response was "I don't know, find maintenance and ask them". Only thing going for hotel is location however now knowing how easy the underground was would definitely recommend staying out of the noise which is relentless, not to mention the time square extra added tax

Compact hotel in the heart of Times Square next to the Aladdin theatre. Easy to find. Easy to navigate from. Great wifi. Rooms clean and funky. Compact but not a surprise as space is money in central New York.Took the JFK shuttle from Grand Central for $18 to go back to the airport upon recommendation from checkin staff. Went through hotels.com and got a secret deal for 80gbp per night for a double room which i was chuffed with.

Good location for tourists but I'm not one. Room was small and clean BUT the bed mattress was totally broken down on both sides (yes, I tried to use first one then the other side of the bed, total failure) Bathroom incredibly small and room lighting insufficient. Won't stay here again.

Rooms are smaller than you see on photos .the staff are very helpful and the rooms are very clean it's only a 2 minute walk to the corner of the street which is Times Square had a great time in New York hotel was a great base right in the hart of the city so much it see and do we ran out of time will have to go back

My partner and mum and dad stayed at this hotel for my mums 50th, we had the penthouse. It was fantastic, clean, great views but the layout was not so good. The toilet was in one of the bedrooms so we only had the 1 to share and no privacy. We notified the staff the night we arrived, Azim had told us to speak to the manager in the morning, we went down in the morning to ask for the manager if we could change to 2 king bedrooms, the lady who helped us as the manager was not around at the time was brilliant, she couldn't do enough for us. Thank you Suny!!! The two bedrooms were spacious, clean and the maid was always on the floor asking if we needed anything. I will definitely recommend this hotel. Ideal location. Thank you for a lovely stay :) Sofia and family xx

I booked the Queen deluxe room on TravelZoo for $109 before tax which is a great price given the area and quality. After reading other reviews I didn't have a positive impression but I was very impressed when I walked in. The "premiere" room we were assigned was spacious with ample room to move around. The bathroom was modern and beautiful. There are reviews about the shower flooding the floor but that didn't happen to us. There is a half glass wall that blocks water going on the floor unless you purposefully spray the shower head towards the half that is not enclosed. Using the floor towel that is provided also helped and the shower does have a threshold that is several inches tall. The lobby is very welcoming and the staff was friendly and approachable.Two negative points that relate to personal preference are (1) our bed was very firm which made it difficult to rest and (2) the elevators were so compact that it made me anxious.
