They are not for plus size folks due to the narrow entrance. Points of interest for visitors: it's just a few steps away from M&M World and Hershey World! All the fun of the theater district and the non-stop shopping and action in Times Square. Check out the Thai restaurant next door, Pongsri, you won't be disappointed.

I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The location is amazing, only a two-minute walk to Times Square but far enough away so you get a decent night's sleep. The staff were extremely nice. The internet connection was very good. The TV worked well.If there were any gripes, the size of the bathroom was incredibly small. The toilet is stuck in the corner, wedged against the sink. It was the first time I had to do a number two with my legs crossed!

Stayed here for 2 nights. One problem was the tv's weren't working but after telling front desk they promptly fixed the issue. Other problem was there were no vending machines. Other than that everything was good.

We booked a family room, two double beds and large bunk beds, for four nights and enjoyed a very good stay at The Gallivant. Our room was spacious, clean with an excellent bathroom. All modern and well decorated. My only negative about the room was the dim lighting. The hotel staff were all helpful and really nice. Used the printer in reception to print out my boarding passes.The location of this hotel,was the best, literally just off Times Square and walking distance to Central Park, The Highline, Rockefeller building etc.

I stayed here with my two daughter in late December. We stayed 3 nights. Our room was never cleaned, trash not taken, no clean towels. I stopped the housekeeper in the hall who said she would get it later but it was never taken care of. Also, my daughter left her iPad on the bed at checkout. And we know it was there and when I called it was never turned in. Also, while going into our room for the first time at check in we left a pillow outside in the hallway for 2 seconds while taking in the luggage. Went back to the hallway 2 seconds later and it was gone. I asked housekeeping and no one could ever look in lost and found for me. Also, mysterious $249 charge on my bank account from the hotel in addition to my booking charge. Was an act of congress to finally speak to the manager after 2 days of asking front desk staff. No one could ever answer why it was charged. Return of funds took 2 weeks.

After reading a few not so great reviews prior to our trip (after booking) I was a little apprehensive about our stay. It was great. Reception staff were efficient. Lobby area was clean and quirky. Our room was reasonably basic but clean, modern, cosy and well appointed. The shower was great! Broadway and Times Square are literally a stones through away. The side street the hotel is located on is fairly busy but not too noisy come night time. Sirens can be loud from the main roads but to be expected in a city. Window opened which was great for getting some air in. Couldn't really fault our stay. Couldn't comment on breakfast facilities as we chose not to have breakfast but enjoyed morning coffee in our room.

I had a wonderful experience at this property. We were warmly welcomed by Antonio de la Cruz from the very beginning and we could not have asked for a better room or surroundings. The room looked newly remodeled and the bathroom was wonderful. Our room was very quiet and we had a restful night's rest each night. The bed was very comfortable and we were so centrally located that we walked EVERYWHERE. We were able to get great dining suggestions and must see recommendations from Antonio and enjoyed every last bit of the city we could during our brief stay. Thank you to the team at the Gallivant we will be back.

the situation is really good, near Times square, but the service is really poor. The key didn't work when we arrived, the groom sent us to the reception and asked us a tip... Really strange, i thought it was his job

Location location location. Can't get better. Staff very helpful and friendly. Rooms have awkward distribution and need better lighting (decor is nice & modern) but the rooms poorly lit. Only 2 elevators. Not impressed by the restaurant at the base of the hotel. Several restaurants, bars nearby.

Stayed In this hotel for 10 days around Xmas time with family members. Overall, the experience was good. From the beginning, all the staff (réceptionists, housekeepers, restaurant staff) was very nice and helping. There was a leak in one of the bedrooms, and the staff sorted this in a very efficient manner (forgot his name but the guy was awesome). The location is great. Just a few steps from Times Square. The rooms are ok, too much heating but you can use the air-conditionning to cool down. I would have recommended this place if it wasn't for a very nasty and standoffish woman called "Adeline". A blond woman who seems to think she is so cool she has the right to give you the cold shoulder when asked a simple question. Very standoffish, gives big smiles to pretty male clients and a cold face to others. Pretty shocking and unacceptable attitude to receive when you spent over 5000 dollars.

If you're looking for an affordable, decent place to stay in Times Square then The Gallivant will likely make you very happy. Make no mistake, this facility is scaled on the small side. The lobby's small, the elevators are small, the rooms are small, the bathrooms are small, etc, etc. So, if you're looking for some palatial experience, this is not your hotel. However, if you want a clean comfortable bed for a very reasonable price just a few steps from the action, then you can't go too wrong here. We had two rooms on different floors over a weekend during the busy Christmas season; one for us parents and the another for our young adult daughters. Both rooms were modestly furnished and maintained very well. The bathrooms were generously supplied and had ample hot water. The floors were not carpeted but obviously kept really clean during our stay. This was particularly nice for those of us with allergies.We found all of the staff to be courteous and helpful. The front desk was staffed with professionals who worked very quickly to get us in and out and the cleaning people did a great job during our stay. We had to check out earlier than our train and the Bell kept our luggage and bags secure while we enjoyed our last few hours unencumbered. This is decent hotel, competently run and for Manhattan, well worth the money. Save a bunch here and get better seats or some decent cheesecake to take home instead. Also, be sure to visit the Chinese restaurant next door. Pretty awesome food for the money.

I would never stay here. The Gallivant canceled my room the day before New Years Eve. When I called to see if I can check in early, the receptionist Mike was very rude. He had no sympathy and was not accommodating. Although it was there fault, they did try to help us find another room (a sister location)...when my booking agent called them. I did end up finding another room on my way to New York City but it was just a horrible experience when you're traveling 3 hours away and your room was canceled and you weren't notified. I wouldn't recommend this hotel based off of the experience that I had and how horrible the customer service was when trying to find a resolution to THEIR mistake.

Great location, nice modern hotel and satisfactory room. Lower level room was too noisy and near to generator. Moved to 14th floor with no problems however a charge was made to credit card after departure and no explanation why. There were no charges at the time of departure. Have emailed hotel 3 times but no response. Very frustrating and not so great after care service.

Location is great but the pictures on the web does not reflect the real life. Heating/ventilation system not working well, very small rooms, no hotel bar and average to poor service. Not really value for money.

I checked in was assigned room with a view of maintenance equipment and the noise to go along with it. The maid service knocked on the door at 830am wanting to know when I'm leaving despite not having the do not disturb sign out. Than I came back to find they didn't make up the room. They charged me 2 dollars to check a bag. I decided not to tip the bellman as that is about the avg tip anyways. Just a unhappy experience.

I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel near Times Square. As a frequent traveler, I tend to steer clear of unfamiliar hotels. However, with the lavish pricing of most hotels in the vicinity, particularly during the holidays, I decided to try the Gallivant. It was at least $100 less per night than nearby hotels. I was very happy with my decision. The hotel was clean, well-maintained, and modern. The lobby was contemporary and the staff was professional. Like most NYC hotels, rooms and amenities are compact, but our "suite" was quite spacious by those standards. We stayed on the 5th floor and had a street view; nothing too impressive, but better than the view of the alleyway, dumpsters, and heating units I've experienced at other hotels. We had one full bed- quite comfortable, and a bunk bed down the "hall" in the suite, which worked well for our family. The sleeping areas each had a TV. The room offered a small mini refrigerator and in-room coffee. The only criticism I would offer is the lack of parking. A convenient lot was directly across the street, which offered a discount to guests. Unfortunately, that lot was full, so we were forced to pay $70/night to park with no compensation/discount. Also, like all of NYC, the food offerings at the hotel were quite expensive, with continental breakfast running about $15. Overall, I really enjoyed my experience at the Gallivant and will likely book again when visiting Times Square.

I took my 10 year old grandson to NYC for the weekend the week before Christmas. We stayed at another hotel on Friday night, and then moved to the Gallivant on Saturday night. That is a long story; it was only supposed to be one night! The Gallivant was not as “swanky” as the first hotel, but it amazes me how the people can make up for anything. The hotel was nice, but the kicker came when we were checking in and my grandson met the front desk person, Cassandra. They chatted a while and I remember her reaching her hand over the desk to shake his hand and introduce herself. The next morning, we walked by the desk, and Cassandra said “Good morning, Will”. That’s his name, she remembered and it made his day! As recently as today I heard him say he liked the Gallivant better! Again amazing. The only negative I could find was the help at the buffet. I wanted to charge to my room all I heard was it will cost too much, tried cc, she said no. The woman really wanted cash for some reason. But I do hope that Cassandra’s superiors see this and provide her the accolades she deserves. I will be coming next month with yet another grandson and we will stay at The Gallivant and only hope that Cassandra is there!

While the location was great and the rooms were nice (for NYC) it was disappointing to learn there was no hot water in the building. Needless to say, staff didn't inform us, nor was anything offered by staff. For the amount of money the room costed, it was a waste.

Had 4 nights. Rooms very small but ok if you only need somewhere to sleep. Location was perfect. Very easy to walk to time square and to Central Park. Shower took forever to heat up. Customer service was very disappointing. Not friendly at all.

The Gallivant is typical Manhattan, attractive lobby but tiny basic rooms. Plus points obviously right in the heart of time square and not quite as expensive as some of the other ones. Still pricey though, but that's Manhattan. Customer service was good with friendly staff. But negative, rooms are just tiny old and a little bit dirty. Our white headboard was black with grime, so we ended up sleeping the other way around. Some noise from corridors. But really, this is typical of Manhattan, all rooms are expensive and tiny. We now prefer to stay a few metro stops out at long island city where you'll find cheaper prices and bigger rooms.

My boyfriend booked 7 nights at The Gallivant as part of a surprise 30th birthday vacation and I couldn't have chosen better myself. We drove to the front of the hotel to drop-off our bags and driving through Times Square isn't as terrifying as you might think, check-in was friendly and hassle free.Our room was clean and comfortable. My partner paid for a deluxe room and as far as we could tell we were in a standard room but we didn't say anything as our room was one of few that came with a balcony and we concluded that we would rather have the balcony than the extra space as it was lovely to sit out on with a root beer. The room was a little on the small side but I understand that this is common throughout New York City.Location is really what sell's this hotel, it's safe and in the middle of it all. If we peered over out balcony we could see Times Square, walking through Times Square and getting a bagel and coffee every morning gave us a real New York City experience. Generally we were able to use the subway and walk to most places we wanted to visit. If you don't fancy that, yellow cabs are the way to get around and you can get them in abundance, just be warned that although we're from England and we'd only been in New York a few days we knew our way around better than some of the cab drivers so do be sure to get a map and keep track of where you are =).Thankyou to The Gallivant for a fantastic and memorable stay in NYC!

The location is super great; within walking distance of anything you want to do or see around Times Square. The room was small, but it doesn't matter. If you're a tourist, like I am, you won't be spending much time there anyway. One thing I did find really weird was the shower. Floor to ceiling glass on HALF the entrance to it which meant that a LOT of water freely splashed out on to the bathroom floor. Very dumb design.

Three women needed a room with three separate beds at a reasonable rate and we found it at the Gallivant, formerly known at the Tryp Times Square. We got a family room with two double beds and a bunk bed. The room was large, the bedding was nice, the beds were comfortable (even the bunk bed), and the bathroom was large and modern. The bathroom had a large walk-in shower. The location is FANTASTIC if you are visiting the theater district, Times Square, and Rockefeller Center to see the Christmas lights like we were. There is an office right around the corner on 8th to buy tour bus tickets, and the buses leave nearby too. The hotel has a concierge. One thing we didn't like is that they charge $2 to hold your bags for you. All in all, a great place to stay.

Our Family stayed here Thanksgiving week. Check in was very smooth. Our room was the family room shown in photos. Located on the 14th floor. Yes, it was noisy at night...you're in NYC. Beds were comfy, bathroom was perfect size for 6. Our only maintenance call was for the heat, which was taken care of in a matter of minutes. Our Family found nothing wrong with this hotel or the customer service received. Any charge, like holding bags, were written out for all to see when reserving a room. I too, was nervous about staying here after reading some of the reviews but after staying there, I just believe some need to find negativity with all things in their lives. We enjoyed our stay and will stay again.

You can tell they attempted to renovate this hotel, but did it very cheap, room was shabby. I was not welcomed or even said hello to at check in, very rude. They had the nerve to charge to hold our bags prior to check in, we were spending a good amount on a room, I think they should do that as a courtesy, like most hotels do.  When we got to our room, the TV didn't work and the shower was making a horrific loud noise like the pipes were gonna explode when the water was on. Although they did come to fix it very quickly they seem annoyed by it, like we had nerve to complain. Walls very thin, heard everything. It was a great location as far as being close to all the sites, but maybe because we were there on the same night that santacon was going on, we had noise outside the hotel all night long. We wont be back

All I can say is do not stay at this hotel. Staff rude. Reception toilet disgusting. Have to pay to store bags following check out. Rooms small and paper thin walls (kept awake all night by next door) tiny bathroom. Staff at reception unhelpful and seem inconvenienced when you ask them anything like where is the guy who gets the cases as I've been standing waiting for half hour!! No hot water first night. And all this for nearly $400 a night! Oh yeah and my wife had bites on her leg that looked like bed bug bites! Stayed at three different hotels in New York during this stay and this was the worse. If you are thinking of booking just don't bother!

Stayed here for four nights, ideally located around the corner from times square, just a 1 minute walk. Rooms are smaller then in the pictures but when in New York you don't be in your room much, was clean an has everything you need. Concierge next to useless, needs to learn how to deal with people in a better manner.

We booked the Gallivant in error, on a flight/hotel deal, whilst it was still called the Tryp, and confusing it with the other Times Square Tryp Hotel. Having read the reviews, we were gutted and expected the worst. However, on arrival we were more than pleasantly surprised.  Our family room was plenty big enough for our group of four adult women friends (and their suitcases, and later, Macy's bags!). With two double beds and a set of bunk beds, there was a (very comfortable) bed for everyone. The room was clean and well serviced each day. We were on the 14th floor, so well away from street and traffic noise and we could even glimpse the Hudson from our window. The bathroom was nice and big, no problem with the shower and fresh towels each day. Staff on the front desk were welcoming and friendly although we did wonder whether the concierge had yet to attend the same customer service training...? The lift must have had an MOT, as there were no delays on that front either. As other reviewers have pointed out, it's a fantastic locations, steps away from the shows and excitement of Times Square and centrally placed for trips up and downtown.I would not hesitate to book a family room here again.

The room is small. We had 2 twin(not double)beds and there was just enough room. Rooms with a full size bed seemed smaller. The bathroom was insanely small. The shower has a half glass door so the floor gets soaked when you shower. Did find if you roll up a towel and place it on the ledge going into the shower it helps. We were with a group and it a lot of people's luggage went to the wrong room or sat in the lobby unattended and unlocked all day. The room was clean. The lighting in the room was odd. Only 1 light switch so all the lights were on or off. No lights over the bed so may be a problem if you like to read in bed. A note there are 2 shades on the window and if you pull both of them down the room is very dark. The hallways remind me of going to a interior cabin on a cruise ship. Small and narrow.

This is a well-situated hotel if you want to be in Hell's Kitchen or the Broadway district. The rooms are relatively comfortable, although the mattresses are of average comfort. The room is average sized for New York, and the bathroom is serviceable. The hotel feels pretty well-kept up and I liked the boutique design. The service is erratic. Maid service was good, check-in was inefficient and authoritarian more than welcoming. This is not a warm fuzzy place, but a perfectly functional hotel for our overnight needs.

The room was far too small even for one person.More a 3 stars rather than 4 if we consider american standards.No minibar available (a grochery shop is around the corner in case).Breakfast bouffet limitedThe location is just perfect. Time square is around the corner as well as Rockerfeller Center and the Empire State building is just walking distance.Live show teathers are next door. Very busy in the afternoon and late in the evening.Also walking distance from Central park.Irish pub next door.

Room good size though bathroom was clean it was a little on the small side with no shelf to put your wash bag. Unfortunately we had several equipment failures - toilet blockage, safe broke, no coffee. All these were fixed promptly by the helpful and polite staff. Also had to have the door card keys reactivated more than once.

The Gallivant is close to times square we booked it through travel planners as part of our holiday. The welcome was first rate our bags taken into the lobby check in was excellent nice friendly staff. Our room on the 13 th floor was large indeed had two tvs and and two beds. A balcony over looking the city too. Comfy beds clean warm not noisy.Minutes walk from times square the hotel staff were first rate helpful friendly. Shower bath excellent totally recoomend the hotel to anyone wishing a good quality hotel within walking distance of tourist sites and hop on hop off buses etc. will definately use it again on out next visit

The Gallivant Hotel is a very nice hotel for the money. We paid $139 per night which is a bargain in Times Square. Decor is very nice and appealing. However there were a couple of hiccups. The bathroom is tiny, and when we turned on the shower the handle fell to the floor. We had to attach it back to the wall and carefully turn to get water. Once the water was flowing, there is no shower door, and water was splashing all over the bathroom floor and created a river that was headed to the hallway. I had to use the towels to sop up the water and wring out. The last mention is the window had a translucent roll up screen, but no room darkening curtains so it was fairly light in the room throughout the night. And when dawn broke we could not sleep any longer. During the night the fire trucks came by with sirens and horns blaring which added to the experience. Turns out the fire station is around the corner. It was loud, but hey it's NYC so we deal with it.Still a deal at the price, but perhaps adding room darkening, sound insulating blinds and a little maintenance and this hotel can be the best deal on Broadway. I would definitely stay again.

We stayed last week in preparation for a trip to Ireland. Hotel was clean and well run. It's an older building with smaller rooms, but considering rates it was good value. Everything worked and the staff were very helpful. We will definitely stay there again.

The Gallivant is one of many hotels in NYC that was renovated into "boutique" status by primping up a solid 1920s building without really upgrading it properly. The lobby looks chic but the fundamentals are lacking. They stupidly installed "European style" showers that lack a curtain and therefore leak onto the floor. They tack on a $15/night "urban fee," which is the worst "nickel and dime" move. The room decor is cold and uninviting. There is no doorman. The desk service was not very friendly. Management needs to rethink the product they're providing. It's not an optimal use for that building in that great location.

Firstly the location of the hotel is fantastic, on 48th Street (3 streets away from Times Square), one Bellman was helpful and sorted us a taxi back to the airport on departure, however, other staff were not overly friendly, hot water was not working on the first day, when I asked I was told it was being fixed- no apology.Hotel was lovely on arrival, posh lobby which gorgeous aquarium behind the desk,The room on the other hand.....Asked for a quiet room and I got room 210 which must be the worst, to be fair it was quiet but everything else wrong with it.It was small but the size was not the issue, it was pitch black, we had one window which faced a brick wall and one fake window which obviously did not let any light in!The bathroom was the only source of light, the cupboard was extremely dark, which is were the safe was located- made it hard to see anything I was doing.The bathroom was small but I could deal with that, the shower however, overflowed onto the floor if you were in it for more than 5 minutes, the water was also cold on the first day.The bed was comfy but smaller than your average double.Floor was covered in dirt and dust, overall very disappointing stay.

Small rooms no view looking at brick walls Terrible customer service no bar even though they showed it on their website. The amount of money paid per night was not even worth staying their may as well stayed in a youth hostel. Would not recommend at all and we have advised our travel agent to no longer use as the night before check out we had a backpack stolen from our room from the cleaners.Room safes were not fixed to anything so if room was broken into or cleaned the safe could easily be picked up and carried out of put in a bag and wheeled out to be undetected. We escalated this thru our agent where hotel are denying anything and we are still awaiting management to put something in writing to us as a formal apology.

The Gallivant is located between 7th and 8th on 48th Street. Convenient to Times Square, Fox News, NBC Studios and Rockefeller Center.The hotel was clean, but the bedding was about 2 star worthy. I booked the room through Priceline.com and the otel charges you an additional feed of 15 dollars a day above the quoted rate. The elevator was tiny and slow. My room faced 47th and not scenic. Faced a rooftop. They may have had rooms with a view, I didn't experience that.

Modern hotel very central to Times Square. Was given a room with some air conditioning unit outside. Requested a room change next morning and was given a new room without any fuss. The hotel could probably do something about noise abatement with the rooms overlooking the street as it can be noisy at night. Overall a nice hotel with very good room service and pleasant staff.

We got hell of a deal from Travelzoo for this hotel in the middle of holiday season - labor day weekend. We paid $160 per night ( after everything - taxes , fees etc). The hotel is located on 48th between 8th ave and 7th ave ( Broadway). The location is PERFECT and the hotel is in the middle of the Times Square.Walking distance to Times square and Broadway for shows. The room is very small - we were 2 people and we cannot move in the room freely. When you use the toilet bowl your legs will hit the wall ( granted I am 6'2"). If you are not claustrophobic you should be good.The service and cleanliness are at a good level. Our maid never restocked our shampoo so I had to ask for more shampoo from front desk.As I mentioned in my title if the price is right this is great hotel. At the end of the day you are not staying inside the room all day - we used it for sleeping only.Be ready for some city noise - which is normal for any large inner cities. I would book there again if I have same price :)

HAving to work in NY for 3 days,I decided to try a new hotel and my choice was The Gallivant in Times square,rate about $200,00 per night plus the hated "resort fee",supposed to be for a wi-fi(decent),free access to the gym(just a large room with some weights and a couple of very old machines) and free access to the "business centre"(a table in the hall next to the reception with two pcs on internet)First impression was very good:not a too big hall,but with a beautiful acquarius behind the reception desk as well as a great position,just 120 seconds away from Times sq.But all the rest...my godness!!!I slept in the smallest room I've ever seen in NY and in the smallest bed I've ever laid my bottom on!!!!Definitively smaller than a regular queen size!!My room was on the second floor and I could hear even people speaking in the subway,since the wall were not too thick and there is no insonorization at all.The ninth floor was not too much better(even if some little improvemen was made...)Twice parcels sent to me were not found for some while,although being searched for and regularly handed in hours before by the courier,waiting uselessly only to be replied"Please be patient"(???)And at the end on monday evening I went for a shower,but found only cold water.Called the reception only to hear a voice carelessly saying that there was no hot water becouse of some works on the hotel piping;and when I said angrily that they should have adivised their guest that this was going to happen they just said sorry once again and closed the phone!!!!No....I will not go back there!!

i stayed three nights in this hotel. The room was nice but kinda dark and the grey walls didnt help. Its a minor issue and I 've enjoyed my stay there nonetheless. The Thai resturant next door makes the best seafood ramen noodles soup in town, so make sure you stop by

This hotel is truly in the heart of it all, 48th street and 7th Avenue....perfection. I love that it is on a fairly quiet street so we could actually sleep at night. The elevators are teeny but you make friends that way! There was a domestic incident in the room next to our one night, we ended up calling the front desk 3 times but they came immediately every time. (Obviously not the hotel's fault but they addressed it quickly).We got great suggestions and directions from the front desk. We were able to print our show tickets at the printer downstairs. The rooms were small but clean, we had great towels, great linens, and a nice place to stay. We got a smoking deal on Groupon, we couldn't have been happier.

I don't take to writing such a bad review but this one is a must...WILL keep it short..yes this is in a great location unless you are at the front of the hotel which is very loud, but there are so many more hotels with great locations..I found the staff especially the 2 males on front desk very rude and non apologetic ,Heater was broken in our room so how you could bake a cake, they then turned whole system off and never returned to fix...Internet was hit and miss.Shower leaked very badlydraws were all brokencoffee stains on floorfood all over the telephone No welcome when entering, when i did complain they didn't want to solve the problem.Breakfast......STAY CLEAR WAS REVOULTING...bed was strange no real cover just sheets on top of a quilt...??why? so unhygienic.Next to a very loud pub and entertainment place. Very loud location STAFF NEED TO LEARN MANERS AND CUSTOMER SERVICE SKILLS.AVOID AT ALL COSTS....(CAN PROVIDE PHOTOS OF ALL SAID)needs a down grade on its star rating as very misleading.

It has good location to access traveling spots around Times Square. However it looked quite close to an old inn with some facilities to required to be renovated. The room was quite small as most of other NYC hotels were. Some folks in my group should go over to the Paramount hotel to check in near the Gallivant because rooms were over booked when we tried to check in at the night time.

This hotel is in a great location, just a few minutes walk from Times Square. Great for the theatres etc. The rooms are a little on the small size but when in NY you shouldn't really be in your room, only to wash/change & sleep so the size of the room wasn't problem for us.

So despite our first encounter of the non-responsive front desk, this hotel is a very nice place to stay. Beautiful Lobby and good size New York hotel rooms. Great location very large bathrooms (despite what I read from other visitors )..... maybe each room is different ?? We Will stay here again.

I booked a 2 night stay at The Gallivant for myself & 2 girlfriends for a weekend getaway in NYC. Upon arrival, I checked in with the receptionist behind the desk. He was informative & professional, but definitely not welcoming. We then went up to the 'premium room’ so we could drop off our bags & start our vacation. Imagine our disappointment combined with disgust as we walked around the room & found strands of long, black hair on the floor by the mirror, not 1, but 2 pieces of chewed up gum (1 on the floor by the bunk bed & 1 on the radiator), a take-out container in the fridge filled with smelly food from the prior occupant and a business card, a receipt from Banana Republic & an adhesive label from a garment all found under the bunk bed. This was all discovered within less than 5 minutes of us opening the door. I am sure we would have found other 'gifts' if we continued. We immediately called the front desk & were told that someone would come up to our room. After waiting 10 minutes, we decided we could wait no longer as this was supposed to be our vacation & time was being wasted waiting unnecessarily. We brought down the food, business card & receipt to the front desk. As I approached the same gentleman who checked us in he said, "You brought me some food?!" I explained what we found & showed him pictures of the gum & hair. He apologized & upgraded us to the 'family room'. (This was the room I originally wanted to book but when I called, was told it was unavailable.) He also gave us vouchers for free breakfast (which was absolutely delicious). The family room was nicely appointed with 2 bunk beds & 2 queen beds. As there were only 3 of us, we wanted to push up the top bunk against the wall so the person on the bottom would not bump her head. We soon realized this could only be done with a special key, so we called the front desk. A nice man from housekeeping came & tried to force the bunk into place. He could not & said he would let maintenance know to come up with the key to lock the bed into the wall......we are still waiting for maintenance to come....Upon checkout, we had to pay a $15.00 'urban fee' per night. This fee is for access to the business center (this was a girls weekend trip, not business, so we never used said business center), Wi-Fi (according to The Gallivant website, it clearly states "free Wi-Fi, high-speed internet) , access to fitness center (never used it) & 2 complimentary bottles of water upon arrival (didn't even get 1 bottle). I should have disputed the charge but I didn't, as at that point I just wanted to leave the hotel.Needless to say, we will not be coming back. I have never encountered such blatant filth in a hotel room. Also, the corridors were made even more narrow by the fact that the 2 maids cleaning carts were always parked by the elevators. A first we thought it was because they were still making up the rooms, but the carts never moved from the hallway the entire time we were there. It made the area by the hallway look like a janitors closet...cramped & untidy.

This hotel was booked for us as part of a cruise package so I have no idea how much it cost, we stayed twice one week apart.The check in procedure on both occasions was brisk, garbled, gabbled and verging on rude.As mentioned by others the "gentleman" that booked me in seemed to be working from a script, which terminated with you being passed a contract to sign followed by instructions quickly pointed out with an incoherent explanation.The lifts were the starting point to the squashed journey to the tiny, cold dismal bedroom which was only worsened by negotiating the depressing corridors.Who ever came up with the awful dark colour scheme in the upper floors should be made to spend a month looking at them.The first bedroom we had was small with a shower/WC which was so tiny even the waste bin would not fit anywhere.The one chair in the room actually looked like someone had used it instead of the toilet.The second room was slightly bigger, and had an enormous air conditioning unit which sounded like a truck! We actually needed heat being November, however all it did was throw out noisy cold air.As for the breakfast, don't fall for the con like we did. Breakfast is taken in the Chinese restaurant next door accessed through the hotel. The lady owner (we supposed) told us they didn't take credit cards and advised not to charge the bill to our room as they charge $20 and she would do it less for cash. when I paid I was charged 2 x $20 just the same.I suppose you could say we should have complained but after lugging cases around after flights etc we decided to put up with it, and maybe this is normal for this part of the city.The only plus points were the location which was excellent, and the free wifi.The website in our view bears little resemblance to the reality

arrived here early afternoon and were checked in immediately. room was 220 looking onto the street at the front of the hotel. room was spacious, clean, with flat screen tv,coffee making facility,safe. the bed was super comfy and the bathroom was spotlessly clean with clean towels supplied every day. having read previous reviews ,we were a bit worried about noise and cleanliness. no problem at all . had a slight problem with bedside lamp,which was fixed immediately. hotel will look after your luggage for $2 per item. they will also arrange a shuttle bus to the airport. would we return here? definately. loved our stay. thank you gallivant

So brutal had to stand up off toilet to close door i bragged to my boyfriend about american duvets comforters this was the cheapest of quilts 4 ft bed very short ..shower very poor spoiled our visit spoiled my whole visit even went to cinema 1 nite so i wouldnt have to go back it cost me €1249 for 4 nites i so regret it

12th floor room, comfortable,clean and quiet,close to Times Square and to the Hells Kitchen area. Small elevators however everything well managed - excellent team. We arrived to NYC and were not able to get room until around 4pm - recommend booking a room a day in advance if travelling from West Coast to East coast. I recommend this hotel.

Travelled to NYC with a friend to experience the NYC marathon, and stayed in a standard room on the 12th floor. The room was a good size, with 2 very comfortable single beds with lovely white bedding. The bathroom was small, but extremely well designed. There was a small fridge in the room, a desk, coffeemaker, and 2 chairs. There was plenty of room for the 2 of us and our luggage. We got there early , and our luggage was kept safe for us until we could go back and check in. The nights were extremely loud, and it was difficult to sleep, but this is in no way the hotel's fault. (it's NYC, and it is loud outside; bring ear plugs). The staff were wonderful with any requests and always friendly when we passed by the front desk. The hotel was easy walking distance from Penn station, and a quick walk to Central Park, and REALLY close to Times Square and many restaurants. I would definitely stay here again!!

The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to Times Square and a huge Starbucks. However, the rooms are EXTREMELY small and narrow. The size of the rooms were not listed at all. The two main elevators, hallways and rooms are not ADA compliant. Also, when I booked my room in September 2016, it was being advertised as a website Wyndham property. Once I got there to check-in and asked about proving my member number is when I was told that Wyndham have not been associated with this property since July 2016.The bed is comfortable but the pillows are awful. The noise level is very loud. The hotel is located near a bar that does not close until 2:00am. Therefore, trying to sleep was a challenge even with my room being on the 7th floor. Overall the room was very clean but if I was staying for more than one night. I would have left and stayed someplace else. Size of the rooms, hallway and elevator, along with the noise level are the reasons for my low rating.

Myself and my partner have just got back from a short break at this hotel. Really it is all about the location. The room was an okay size bathroom small but what else can you expect when you are a stone's throw away from Time Square. The air con worked perfectly and was actually so loud that we couldn't hear the road noise! We stayed for three nights and were happy with our visit.

It is a great location, right next to times square and a massive starbucks. However every staff member I spoke to was very rude and made it out like I ruined their day by asking to sign in early (I came all the way from sydney, australia. We just wanted to sleep) and even though they were non smoking rooms, the hallways constantly smelt of Marijuana and maids were yelling at all volumes from 6-9am every morning. Within our stay we made 3 international calls (two to our travel agent and one to my bank) and were charged for 6. Once again I got a horrible attitude from staff for questioning why I was billed almost $200usd for international calls! It says they have room service but it's just from the restaurants next to them, so essentially nothing fantastic to choose from, especially if you don't like chinese or vietnamese food. The floors in our room were dusty and probably haven't been vacuumed in months. Teeny tiny rooms with an even smaller bathroom (when sitting on the toilet my knees touched the wall). We stayed here for 9 nights but I was over it after the first two! I will not stay here again nor would I recommend it to anyone

Was recently in New York and spent 3 nights at the Gallivant. I booked on a Travelzoo deal. The location couldn't be better, just a half block off Times Square. A small but very nice lobby area, iced water at the front desk, a sitting area with tables and chairs where you can eat any takeout food you bring back, tv on a news channel. The room was actually a good size for New York, but the bathroom very small and shower set up not the best, water sprays over the floor. I was on the third floor on the front street and noise wasn't a problem. Maintenance seems to be a bit of an issue, quite often people at the front desk complaining about something or another. The blackout blind in my room wouldn't go up, I reported it on my first day there but it was never fixed. I didn't spend a lot of time in my room and there was no view to speak if so it wasn't really an issue to me. All in all a good hotel and I definitely would stay there again.

We loved the location of this hotel. The room is small and the bathroom even smaller BUT you are in New York so, this is just a space to collapse into, not lounge in all day.Added bonus is the cafe across the road with great coffee. Loved that we could walk back from all our shows and close to restaurants and bus pick ups.

The location of this hotel is perfect for the traveling tourist! The staff--from the front desk to the concierge---were friendly and very helpful. The room size was adequate and the rooms were clean.I would definitely recommend this hotel.

If you visit New York to laze around in an hotel then possibly the Gallivant is not for you. It is really central, has friendly and helpful staff and the rooms are comfortably fitted out. They are not spacious but they have adequate hanging space and drawers for clothes, the beds are exceptionally comfortable. A corner of the room has been made into a shower room/loo area/ wash basin which is well equipped but not somewhere for dancing. The rooms are cleaned daily. There is temperature controlled heating which is very effective. We had our window open every night and there was a little traffic noise and we were at the front of the hotel, if you are a light sleeper then you may well be woken.There is a small fitness centre in the hotel and two good restaurants, one on each side of the lobby, reached direct from the lobby. Breakfast is a available.

The location of this cozy hotel is wonderful , the beds are very comfortable and the service was very good. The one draw back, noise. Ask for a room that is not street side . The rooms are small but when you're in NY , who cares , there is so much to do the room is just a place to sleep

Really well situated just 1 minute from Times Square. Not 5 star by any stretch, but then not 5 star prices either. However, where thus scores really well is having 3 beds in room - 1 double and 2 large pull down bunk beds. Difficult to find in the city.Only real downside was waiting for the lifts - only 2 small lifts for a 15 storey hotel- but that is nitpicking a bit!Overall a good stay.

We have stayed at the Gallivant for 1 week at Manhattan, the best location for tourists, rooms are clean and comfortable and the most important is the staff which was very kind and helpful. I especially want to mention Robert, the assistance manager which helped us at a specific problem with our room reservation, even though we made the mistake he helped to fix the problem with no extra charge. The 2 things which need to be improved1. Elevators are small and not enough for that kind of a hotel2. Wifi very slow and need to re-sign in every time

Really nice hotel, service was ok. Cozy rooms and comfy pillows, but the bad is too short and too small for two. If u looking for a hotel to take a shower and to be close to everything thats the one 4 u.No shuttle service to airport.

Incredible service,quiet, near to everywhere comfortable pillows,small room but cozy.the elevators are good.The coffee was excellentGreat deal and lucky to choose this hotelNear to eat,in general is amazing

The hotels location is perfect. Times Square is just around the corner. Rooms are clean.Now to the not so pleasant facts: room is basically in a size of a shoe box. Bathroom door won't even open all the way.Housekeeping cleaned our room although do not disturb sign. Reception staff are so rude. I just noticed lots of reviews mentioned that. They really give the most rude answers and no smiles at all. Our check in process was basically asking our passport and credit card and then give us key and a sheet. No explanations no welcome. Nothing. No one helped us with our luggages.Also, when booking the hotel, they didn't mentioned on booking.com that they charge 2$ for each luggage they keep and the same for each package delivered to them. When asked them about it the reception lady hardly answered me that it's like that and there's nothing to do.

This hotel is right in the heart of the Theater District but it's not a good hotel. Certainly the entrance is nice, actually looks trendy. I actually thought the low reviews on TripAdvisor might be wrong. But once I saw by guestroom my spirits plummeted. The room was tiny and made even smaller by an oddly-placed exercise bike in the room. Really?!?! The mattress must have sunk 3 or 4 inches when I sat on it and there was a stain on the white bedsheet. My room was facing 48th Street and it was NOISY. Loud traffic passes through at all hours and I'm so thankful I had earplugs in my pack so I could actually rest (air conditioning was also quite old and noisy). At least the shower was good and other than the bed stain the room was otherwise clean. The WiFi worked okay in my room, though not in the breakfast restaurant. There wasn't even a desk in the room -- the strange exercise bike was placed where a desk should have been. You're only paying for location, location, location. I couldn't wait to check out of here.

5 women stayed in one of the Family Rooms. We were happy to share beds and it was completely fine. Perfect location as close to subway and also walking distance to where we wanted to go. Rooms were clean and comfortable. NYC is a noisy city and we happened to be close to a fire station so sirens were going all day and night, but we didn't seem to notice (we wore ear plugs).

Our room was small but okay, bathrooms very small. But our major issue was the NOISE!! The windows are very thin so you hear all the noise from the street. Very annoying and frustrating especially at odd hours. Cars, garbage trucks, people, it was really bad. Also the ACs are noisy and outdated.The hotel needs to fix these issues because it's a great location...

We were very excited finding an available hotel in the heart of Manhattan NYC, beside Times Square and the Theatre District. The room was good, well decorated, Double bed for the family, room only has coffee maker, safe locker, and hair dryer, fresh bed linens... no other amenities. The wifi signal was good even on the 14th floor. However, here's "the caveat" one out of the two elevators was out-of-service for a whole 24 hour the mattresses in the room were third grade, mediocre, motel quality mattress. So now you can figure the rest of this story on comfort Robert Napolitano, the good Front Office Manager had to upgrade us, made us pack and relocated us to a different room. We would return to stay again, but I would check on my two caveats before unpacking in the assigned room

Not the best hotel we have stayed in and really wouldn’t return, but it done the job for us for the 8 nights, that is once they moved us to a different room the next morning after check in. The first one was what I would describe as a Shoe Box!!! Next one two Shoe boxes but so so much better. Showers small and the screens do not keep the water from splashing all over the floor, Air Conditioning was like having a truck with it’s engine running in the room, so hard to sleep. Elevators were the slowest I have seen in my entire life, could have ran a half marathon before one arrived. Noise from the street, yes there was, but that is New York you need to live with that and the sirens. Definitely overpriced hotel for what you get. Housekeeping were so lovely, that would be the best feature and the Doorman, total gentleman. The Wi-Fi was hopelessly slow, we ended up hot spotting from the phone to the iPad we found that was quicker. Location was great for the Subways and other places close by to walk to overall we didn’t let the Hotel affect the Holiday as it was the City we were there to visit and loved everything about it.

Stayed for 6 days (mid Sept)- great location- very noisy though but to be expected. Room was smallish but adequate.Blinds are ineffective at keeping light out- though woken early anyway but the traffic horns & don't think about walking around undressed- we were being watched from an adjacent building. Needs some attention to detail- grout in shower needs a good scrub- electric cable on coffee maker too short to reach socket so had to be moved every time, ice machine off the corridor has room temperature water only (not sure if this was a fault- no one seemed sure)- though handy little fridge in the room. Ate one evening at the attached restaurant- wouldn't rate it really- staff not sure about menu items & someone brought the bins through the area while we were eating. Maid service every day (Zumka was lovely- even the small complimentary soaps were changed if they'd been used). Beds were comfortable & clean- brand new mattress (I check this in every hotel I'm afraid) Check in/ out simple & hassle free- Reception area is gorgeous. Overall would stay here again if was a good price.

This hotel is a joke for what I paid (even through Groupon). I have stayed in many hotels and hotels in NYC and this must have been my worst experience. The only good thing I can say about the hotel it was clean for the most part. I will explain...the room itself was clean, however, the bathroom shower only had a half glass stall and no curtain. So the water from the shower (no matter how careful you are) got all over the floor and the bathroom door...which inevitably has mold / mildew on the bottom of the door.Now, the room itself - the windows in our room looked at a brick wall. The bathroom was so small you had to be careful and stand in one place and spin. You could sit on the toilet, wash your hands and have foot in the shower!!! The smallest bathroom I have ever been in!To back up just a little....when I got to the hotel to check in - they could not find my reservation! I had to be in limbo for over 2 hours until Groupon and the hotel could work out the details. I was charged $2 per suitcase / luggage to have the bellhops store my luggage since my room was not ready, etc. When we checked out we were charged another $2 per luggage fee to store the luggage (did not want to drag it around the city with us on our last day)! This left such a good impression of the hotel with us...NOT!!!They have three elevators, however, only one worked and this was used by the guests and hotel staff!! I had to wait over 15 minutes for an elevator or use the stairs...I opt to use the stairs on numerous occasions. The only good thing I can say about the hotel - they were conveniently located! I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. There are far better hotels for less or equivalent money.

I paid a lot of money for thid hotel and the room was the size of a broom cupboard, only just fit in a small double bed. They made me prepay the accommodation some 4 months prior then cliser to the date the room rate was a quarter of the price . It was clean and in a good location. We had a fire alarm go off at midnight and there was no direction from the hotel people were just standing in the stairwell and not moving. Also the porter scammed us. He called us a car i asked about price and he said standard price and pretended not to understand me. When the car came i asked same question he responded stamdard price which i though was $60 us as per taxi rate but when i got to airport wanted $75 usd. Not impressed. Learning for me don't want others to get scammed.

Awful staff! Awful services! Tiny dark rooms not very clean! Noise from the street! Not working blinds! not a hair dryer! and awful smell! this hotel is not worth it 2 stars!Not my first time in New York City... and this hotel was absolutely not worth the money and not worth 4 stars either!! Location was ok .. about 15 min walk to Central Park and couple of minutes to Times Square! Anywhere ... I love NYC... so my trip went ok anyway... just next time when I am here I will choose different place!!

Ok it's small and its hard to move around with double bed opposed to queens but it is doable ! Room done daily , fresh towels daily and a coffee machine in your room . Front desk is reasonably pleasant and happy to help out! The doors slam and rock your room and the wall can feel thin at times. But it's in an excellent location and your out for hours and chances not back until midnight! The lifts were fine and no slower to many other hotels ! 3 stars as its small !

Great little location as it's just behind Times Square. I'd say it is a 4* however don't expect amazing customer service, Americans really think they're good at this but ask them to do anything out of the box and they are shocking.Beware, you have to give a credit card so they can put a deposit for your room which I thought was very 'hostel-esque', you also have to sign a waiver that means you get charged $250 if you smoke in their rooms.No views other than a brick wall but very nice rooms and good staff - we left our safe open by accident one day and nothing got touched.

Stayed here for three nights in mid-September. Things I loved about this spot: perfectly located to get to Broadway, Times Square, subways, and a zillion bars and restaurants. Things I liked about the room: clean, well-appointed, comfortable pillows, extra towels, good a/c. Things I didn't love so much: jack hammering outside the window at 4am (seriously, who needs to bust up concrete at 4am on a Saturday?!), listening to the people in the next room do it all night long and then shout obscenities at one another and slam doors the whole next day (we could hear everything and it was unpleasant), no hot water on Sunday night (frickin' BURRRR), and a teeny tiny bed (to fit a little room). All-in, though, it was a good stay and, on balance, I'd go back.

Cant beat the location. Staff was friendly. Nice Decor. We had a king room on the 9th floor Reasonably spacious. Nice Asian food restaurants attached to the hotels - with Happy Hour every day of the week

This was my first visit to NYC and I chose the hotel from the reviews on TripAdvisor. The hotel was very easy to find and in an excellent location for on/off the subway, Times Square (literally a block away) and for walking around NYC. The hotel is nicely furnished and we had a queen bed room. The only drawback was the bathroom size, if you are over 200#s it is impossible to use such a small bathroom!!! We were on the second floor so walking up to our room was really easy, we didn't have to wait on the slow elevators. On our first night, we couldn't get the air con to work, but when I told them about it at the front desk, it was fixed promptly the next morning and worked really well. The front desk staff was very nice and housekeeping was excellent. Our room was cleaned and linens restocked each day. I would recommend staying here if you want a true and safe NYC experience.

I paid USD 385 incl taxes on hotwire for a night and as additional 15 at the hotel. Except for the location just off Times Square, there was nothing good at this hotel.The room was tiny and bathroom too, the intercom didn't work and there was no drinking water in the room. I had to go to the reception to ask and then wait a long time for it to be delivered when it should have been there. When I asked for some more the next morning, I was refused. At midnight, the fire alarm went off and all guests were made to wait in the lobby till the fire department sorted it out. There was no reassurance from the hotel staff. I found their attitude very uncaring. I would not stay again.

The crew member are not friendly the only one who was friendly was the bellman . The room is too small and the bathroom is for kids because they are very very very small. I payed $300 box for a good hotel and I received a Ok hotel nothing bad but I won't spend this money for this hotel ! I've been here in Hilton garden inn in the same area and payed something like that but I received a amazing hotel .. I wish I can't changed and stayed in Hilton ... so if you are very skinny you can stay here because the wifi is terrible ,the room is small,the elevator are small , the bathroom see the pictures and you will see the " small world " Im very upset and I have more 2 longs day here ! My room is 1422 !

The location was great 48th St between 7th and 8th ave, a short walk to Times Square and subway stops and shops and food. The rooms are small though, and if you get a room on the lower floors you may stay awake all night from street noise.

This Hotel is old and like the reviews say, the elevators are small and slow. The room we had was average, really bad mirror lighting in the bathroom with no room to out anything, so we out the coffee stand near the fridge in the bathroom to put our toothbrushes and amenities. The bathroom is small.There was no water upon arrival, our blind wouldn't go all the way down so had to use a towel on the button to cover the gap. Various parts of the room was dirty, dust piled in the corners, electrical and light switch covers were dirty.The bed and pillows were comfortable and clean. The doors to the room is metal, so when it closes, it slams shut. My key card didn't work on 3 occasions and had to have it reswiped, which was inconvenient because I had to catch that slow elevator. When in the hall or near the elevator, you can hear people talking, singing in the shower etc, so noise proof is out the door cause with the TV off, you can hear other people talking coming from the hall in their rooms.Our 3rd night the smoke alarm went off around midnight for 20 minutes. I called operator and front desk and the phones were dead. Then we could hear through an intercoms for everyone to stay in there rooms, there is no fire but alarm problems.Overall, the location is good, but I would probably stay at the Crown Plaza across the street, or Intercontinental couple blocks away. It's also hard to see if you're in car, signage is poor. Good luck, I won't stay here again!

The hotel is 3 star quality. We had a deluxe queen room, furniture and linens are 3.5 star in cleanliness and quality. Room is fairly sized. Front desk is not at all friendly or helpful (except Cassandra).

I was in New York in September and stayed at this hotel the room to start with smelt of smoke and wasn’t very clean the bed had stains on so was the best start but we got over that until the next day I saw a mouse run across the room, then I saw mouse droppings on the table next to the coffee machine, very hygienic I thought. I went down to reception to let them know and they moved us to a different room and that was the end of that apparently, not even the manager wanted to speak to us and apologise. I have emailed the hotel twice and had no reply so overall I don’t have fantastic feedback. Obviously not very enthusiastic to retain customers

I was quite shocked at how small the room was, even by New York standards. Granted, I got a very good deal using a 3rd party booking site, but my room was TINY with an even TINIER bathroom. The lighting was terrible - the window let in no natural light and the overhead lights were quite dim. The AC was very loud, so I kept turning it off, then the room would get warm, then I would turn it on until I couldn't handle the noise any longer.For positives, it is a block from Broadway and there is all of Times Square practically right outside the door.

I booked a pre-paid reservation through my company. When I showed up, the guy behind the desk handed me an envelope and said "You're actually booked at the Night Hotel a few blocks away." He explained that they do that when they overbook. They didn't call, e-mail, etc. When I told him this was crazy, he told me to take it up with the manager, who was not on duty. "We're both victims here," he said. Because he was overbooked and short-staffed. It was late at night; I had no option but to hoof it to the Night Hotel, where the manager explained that this was happening more and more. It seems like the Gallivant takes extra reservations and then farms them out to hotels that aren't booked. "Be glad they didn't put you in Queens," the hotel manager said. There was nothing *wrong* with the Night Hotel. But the whole arrangement was sketchy.

Stayed here for 4 nights for my Birthday and had a great time. There were a few negatives but these did not impact my stay:- Elevators are very slow and very small and we were on the 10th floor!- The (Queen) rooms are very small and the bathrooms are tiny! It was myself and my husband in the room and with luggage it was cramped but we didn't spend that much time in the room so made it work- The room was really hot and the AC was loud and didn't really help- Had to pay for luggage to be stored with concierge (we had to check out by midday and our flight wasn't until 8pm). I travel with my job so have stayed in numerous hotels and have never paid to store luggage with the concierge- I am still waiting for my security deposit to be refunded however have only recently got home and realise the delay could be due to my bank (I will keep checking)As I said above the negatives didn't really affect our stay. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. The location is perfect, so you really experience the real New York! I had a great stay and would definitely stay again.

We got a groupon and stayed here 4 nights for girls trip. The location was perfect. It is on the back side of Times Square so it was quiet but close to the madness. Centered between uptown and down town. Courteous staff, clean property , great restaurants next door, coffee shop directly across the street and a local market on the corner. It is on 48th so just 2 blocks from the subway. We took the transit authority bus from Liberty airport and walked 2 blocks. Going out we took NJ TRANSIT from Penn Station. Easy breezy. Comfy beds, coffee maker and Windows that open.One word of warning. The hotel is small scale. Not made for big people. Narrow halls, small bathrooms.I really enjoyed my stay here and will definitely use it as my base camp next time I go to New York.

This hotel was chosen by the Travel agent as this was our first trip to New York. For us as first time tourists it worked out really well.The hotel is clean and comfortable and although the room was a bit dark the bed was supremely comfortable. They thoughtfully provide you with the wi-fi details as soon as you arrive and our rooms are equipped with plugs & usb ports to easily charge phones, laptops, cameras. The bathroom doubled as a wet room - good shower and lovely & clean.We had a room facing a wall - as have previous guests, the up side being the peace and quiet ensuring a good nights sleep. The lack of view didn't worry us as by bedtime we were exhausted.We didn't eat in the hotel - there are many restaurants for any meal very close by.All the staff we met were very polite and helpful, especially the concierge who helped us chase our missing taxi.Thank you all for a lovely stay.

We got a good deal for £700 for 6 nights and the location is perfect if you like the absolute packed nature of times sq.Otherwise it was not worth staying, loud unclean, cramped and the room sizes are overly small. Didn't want to come back at the end of a day!!! The worst thing was the quality and cleanliness of the hotel. It needs a refurb and needs some lighting! We complained about house keeping everyday and they cleaned the room properly once. Look for another place is my advice.

We arrived to be told our booking had been cancelled and the hotel was full. A few phonecalls back and forth to England and we got booked in. As we were told the hotel was full I was puzzled- it seems common hotel practice that a few overbookings is worth the risk as they hope some bookings won't turn up. A nice central hotel although the white beds valance was heavily stained yellow. Incredibly central, times square and Broadway on the doorstep but the hotel is amazingly quiet.

Over price,the location is perfect just in the time square,And there r some restaurants and bars near the hotel but the hotel itself is just ok, house keeping never cleaned the room in a proper way and whenever the tissues are finished the never replace it, the reception stuff r friendly yet it's over priced for the small rooms and bad house keeping service.

Recently refurbished so a very modern feel. Loved the decor in my room, with really funky NYC wallpaper. As with all New York hotel rooms (unless you're very rich and famous!), it's a bit on the small side but perfectly adequate for a single traveller. The shower works and the water is hot! It's very close to the 7th Avenue fire station so there is often a fire engine or two tearing up 48th Street with their sirens blaring, but then, you don't go to New York for peace and quiet!

It was really unpleasant, we have got the room next to the generator and it was noisy It was really unpleasant to Stay, other than that there is only two elevators for nearly 13 floors and it's slow aswell My room smells really bad when we were entering,Wi-Fi is very slow

We arrived yesterday and have been pleasantly surprised -,people have said about staff being rude- they seemed OK with us , not rude , not overfriendlyThe lifts- yes they are not huge , we are on 8th floor and it wasn't that slowRoom- I think we have been very lucky- we have got a premium room - plenty of space , very clean , bed super comfy. After reading all the negative reviews we were worried bout staying here but we could stay againHad a drink and food at Hurleys next door- very goodLocation - perfect- Times Square is literally 2 mins awayWould definitely stay here again!!!!!

We checked in at around 10pm and was given a room on the 3rd floor. We had read reviews about being on a much higher floor but did not ask. The reviews about the size of the room were not exaggerated. It is small. It has a bed, 2 side tables (that has a top and a bottom, no draws) and a dresser where the TV is. The closet is also on the small size as well, so we kept most of our clothes in the suitcase. There was no view (only pipes). There is a safe and iron -board w/iron in the closet. There is no space for shoes so I just put the shoes by the wall. The bathroom is small as well. The area around the sink cannot hold a lot of stuff, so I had to put most of my toiletries below. I could not wash my face with the door close as my hand kept hitting the door handle. The shower had no curtain and there is glass on only the left side blocking the toilet. I thought I was missing something and kept looking to close the glass door but yes, the glass only covered half of the shower, so if the showerhead is set up high, water will splash onto the floor. The water pressure was great.With all of these things, I had a wonderful time. As I told my husband, who comes to NY to stay in their rooms. The bed was comfortable, we slept like babes and my husband is a light sleeper. Because we were on the 3rd floor, we did not have to wait for the elevator unless we want to, as we took the stairs. The lobby was not very busy at times so my hubby and I sometimes just sat and chat. There was one big issue and that was with towels. Somehow they ran out of towels. Apparently, someone does the laundry and did not arrive on time so we had no bath towels for an entire night, which I beat myself about as if I had had the room clean, chances are I might have had towels. Instead we had to use the face towels. But we got bath towels the next morning.We had breakfast there, but the booth seating there is very uncomfortable. I thought breakfast was expensive but it is comparable to places around NY, although I hated paying so much for orange juice when she was simply pouring it out of a Tropicana container, but you can go back for as much as you want.By the way, parking is very expensive so if you have family in NY, park your car there. The self-parking is across the road but it is $45 per day. Also, there is a small spot directly in front of the hotel to unload. The hotel is very close to a lot of things so you don't really need a car.They have a concierge so we got tickets from her to go sightseeing on one of the buses. We stayed there for 4 nights.

It’s a nice enough NYC hotel & it is very near Times Square. We got a dirt cheap price off Hotwire & overall we were thrilled with the low cost. N.B. This is a typical NY hotel, meaning the rooms are small. Space is at a premium. It does have some bad points: 1. Security. Yeah, there is a guy in the lobby but he didn’t appear too effective. The elevators don’t require a key card to activate. That means anybody can just get in & go upstairs. The hotel really needs to upgrade the elevators. 2. The walls are thin. We could hear everything. On the 8th floor we could even hear some of the noise from Times Square. 3. The bathroom especially the shower is tiny. If you are a “fluffy” person do not stay in this hotel. Seriously, we’ve had larger bathrooms on cruise ships 4. There are dings in the walls5. The room needed a chair. Didn’t have to be a big one but someplace to sit other than the bed would have been nice It does have good points: 1. Location is very convenient, a block off Times Square in the heart of the Theater District. You’re also 2 blocks away from a subway to go up or downtown2. The place is clean. I loved that they have wood lament floors rather than skanky hotel carpet. 3. The décor, especially the bathrooms, are very modern (but tiny) 4. The bed & the pillows were extremely comfortable 5. Even on a hot muggy day, the AC made the room quite cool but the system was kind of loud.

After reading previous reviews, I was a bit concerned about our booking but we found none of the issues raised. The hotel is in a great location and is a sleek NYC venue. Our room was fine, no mustiness, and bed and pillows comfortable. It would have been nice if the hotel provided bottles of water. There is also free internet access. We were able to leave our bag there even after check-out as we did our NY activities for an absolutely minimal charge ($2). All personnel we dealt with were very accommodating. My husband said he did find it noisy - but we were in NYC. Glad I didn't listen.

Arrived on the 3rd Sept after 3 complaints it took till the manager came in on the Wednesday to have our cushions for our outdoor space. He did however refund $50 for the nights without the cushions for our inconvenience . One member of staff on the desk was quite rude , the rooms were badly lit and although it had two bedrooms one had no storage and you had to walk through it to get to the very small shared bathroom .the room was clean but a little tired

I travel all the time for work on a weekly basis and when I checked into this hotel I immediately checked out and stayed at the crowne plaza across the street. They can not advertise themselves as a 4 star hotel when I have stayed at motel 6's that are run better then this hotel. From checking in where the front desk associate did not even say hello or how was my trip to the maintenance staff that left their equipment in the hall in front of my room blocking my entrance and did not bother to move it when asked!

This hotel served its purpose for our trip. The location is ideally located in the middle of Times Square but that ultimately means some of the rooms can be very noisy. We unfortunately were allocated a noisy room overlooking what appeared to be a rooftop bar ... But maybe this is to be expected when staying so centrally. We had breakfast on one of the mornings and it was ok, plenty of choice etc... Although the hot breakfast was on the slightly cold side.The lady who served us that morning was very pleasant, the man on reception during checkin wasn't the most friendly we have ever met but, again, it was a generally smooth check-in process. The rooms are small but we actually really liked ours, especially the great shower (one of the best!). The most negative part of this review would be that I left behind personal belongings in the room and I have since emailed the hotel and have not received a reply which has been very disappointing.

I do not understand the negative reviews on this hotel!! It is amazing ! We stayed 7 nights from 26 Aug to 2nd sept an from the minute we walked through the the doors everything was fantastic from checking in to checking out ! The rooms were perfect the most comfortable bed ever in a hotel an I was soo tempted to steal a pillow lol ! The bathroom was a tad small but it serves it's purpose ! We were in room 1527 an had great sleep every night as it was so quiet seriously sooo quiet ! I was really dreading what we were letting ourselves in for after reading the negative reviews but I'm glad to say I worried for nothing ! Real gem of a hotel just steps from times sq ! Would stay again in a heartbeat! In fact I wouldn stay anywhere else !! So people go for it you will not be disappointed!!

We were at the hotel from Aug 30th to Sept 02. This Hotel is extremely close to times square yet quiet in the room. You can walk to almost anywhere from this hotel. Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre and Central park which being the furthest one away but it's do able. The room is small but that is expected in any big city. The bed was comfortable. The bedding was clean. the towels were clean. The only issue we had with the room was they forgot shower curtain in our room but we just asked the front desk and voila it's there! Lobby was nice and chic. I can't comment on amenities as we didn't use any. Wifi was working well had no issue.We arrived early so they store our luggages for us till the check in time so we can go out and about till then. But after you check out they charged $2 per bag to store if you have a later flight to catch and still want to out and about in the city.There are no water or fridge in the room we found this grocery store called the food emporium. It's located just around the corner on 49th and 8th. You can get water there cheaper than the convenience store beside the hotel or some munchie if you like. They also have breakfast there. You can grab a container and fill it up. They charged by weight being $8.99/ Lbs. Not great but cheaper than the hotel.I have no complain about this hotel. I would stay here again and I would recommend my family and friends to stay there.

I really enjoyed my visit to the Gallivant, check in was friendly and efficient. The room was extremely small but comfortable, and the bathroom was probably the smallest I've ever seen in a hotel. It didn't matter too much about the size because the room was nice and was serviced every single day. My stay lasted 6 nights and I didn't have one complaint about the noise, the lifts, or the staff. It was a real pleasure! The location could not have been better; right in the heart of Times Square.

My sister and I booked a hotel (and I use this term EXTREMELY loosely) named Gallivant, for September 2 - September 6th. This trip was to celebrate my birthday and based on previous experiences with reviews found here, I believed we would have a favorable experience at this property, but this wasn't the case at ALL. When using the app we looked to your ratings for guidance, with respects to the quality and level of service we would receive. For this booking I must say that the description of the property wasn't correct at all. This property should receive a -5 star rating at best. Not only was the room not what we expected based on description, but we had our personal items stolen, the bedding was filthy, the room was much smaller than we were told, the staff was rude, the amenities listed weren't available, the wifi didn't work, and on more than one occasion our room keys didn't work - and we had to wait anywhere from 15 to 30 minuets for the front desk person to return so our keys could be changed. The stay we experienced was less of one staying at a hotel, and more of one during a hostage situation, because we were unable to cancel the reservation and find other accommodations.The times I have used your app I have been very satisfied, but this wasn't one of them. This experience has been lack luster & cause for me to question if I can take your ratings seriously. While I know there are things that are out of your control - accurately describing the property isn't one of them. We would have been better off staying at a motel 6 rather than being here.

Nice hotel. Modern room and lobby. Free wifi. Everything was good except for the musty smell in the room. You get used to it and don't smell it the longer you are in there. We had a window but I didn't check if we could open it. Good location.

The location is right in Times Square, which is good if you want to be right in the middle of things but not so good if you're looking for a spacious or quiet room. The lobby is nice and check-in efficient. Our room was very small, with a noisy air conditioner right next to the bed. It had recently been updated, so (with the exception of the a/c) it was pretty modern. There was a pretty strong smell of urine and/or garbage upon entering the room. Fine for one night, but I wouldn't want to stay here for longer than that.

First the good news. The hotel has an amazing location. Walking or metro distance to many great things. It is also a very clean hotel and the mattress was wonderful!Now the not so good. The room is the size of a shoebox. I travel a fair amount and it makes European rooms look spacious. The front desk staff could use several good lessons in customer service. Seriously I was sorry to disrupt them from their disinterested stance. Not at all helpful. I would not stay here again

I wasn't expecting much. We were seeking economy over luxury as we were only in NY for 3 nights and planned on cramming in as much tourist attractions as we could.
