Yes the rooms are small but adequate. The front desk and bell man were helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean, the shower was hot and good pressure, the beds comfy and the TV's were bigger and more modern than lots of resorts I've stayed in. The only downfall to the room was that yes you can hear everything in the streets and the doors all slam.The location is perfect! Steps to time square, walking distance to the Rockefeller, Central Park and the Empire State Building and Macy's. We were able to walk to the Theatre district (in heels) comfortably and thoroughly enjoyed Kinky Boots I might add.Free WIFI too!!!

We stayed in NYC for 3 nights after visiting family in North Carolina. We needed a family room for 5 that was close to the main attractions of NYC, we couldn't have picked any better! For just over £200 a night, this hotel - located on 48th St- was just around the corner from Times Square but didn't have any noise associated with the area! We arrived late at night, check in was seamless, we dumped the bags and went straight out. The kids were in awe of the place and the hustle and bustle. The room is well equipped with coffee maker, fridge, safe, iPod docking station and flat screen TV. The bathroom was HUGE!! the shower was superb, the only draw back was no shower gel (although soap, shampoo, conditioner and body lotion are provided). We had 2 double beds, and a set of bunk beds. All were comfortable and provided a good nights sleep. The AC was a welcome addition to the 31C heat but it was a little noisy when trying to sleep. There's a fire station located just behind the hotel, to be honest it never bothered us and we only heard it once during our stay. I know other reviewers have complained about the mouse from here. Check out again was seamless, and you can store your bags for $2 per item until you leave for the airport. Check out is great at 12pm do you can get sorted without rushing about at the last minute. In all a great stay, not a 5* stay but great for the price and location.

I stayed 6 nights at the hotel...The only good thing i found is the location!Its near Times Square, Brodway and metro station..Above that everything else was a disaster...The room is so small like a cage in a prison...The pillows had that awful smell that you couldnt even sleep..I found also something like honey in the floor and looks like they havent even cleaned it from the last resident...The shower had a problem and made some noises and i didnt found a shampoo or shower jel and i had to call and bring me.. Stay away!!!!

Excellent hotel for a fantastic price (we scored 3 nights at $149 on two different occasions) in the heart of the theatre district; if you're in NYC to see shows and want to walk between theatres and bars, it's a perfect place to stay. Rooms are modern and updated and we really didn't notice how small they were-- you're in NYC, who cares?! Beds are comfy but light sleepers may be awoken easily by the omnipresent sounds of sirens on the streets below (you'll hear that pretty much anywhere in Manhattan at any time of night though). This is our go-to hotel!

Over from Belfast 5 star service .very helpful .fantastic location .ticks all the boxes.will be back next year .everything in one spot free WiFi all over hotel .free lemon water ice cold 24.7 can't recommend this hotel enough .can't wait to return

Stayed at this hotel for 7 days whist on holiday with my Fiancée and it was fantastic. We were a tad skeptical as we had read mixed reviews on trip advisor prior to going. The location for the price was amazing. The size of the room for two adults was perfect. The only grumble we had with the room was the floor getting wet when taking a shower as there is no door, but a towel on the floor sorted that right out. The maids/cleaning staff were helpful and on hand everyday to change the bed, give clean towels and clean the room in general. The reception staff were also very welcoming and helpful when we had a problem with our Air con that was fixed within 15 minutes of asking. Would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to anyone.

The location is the best you can find, around Times Square...But that is the reason for the Price (almost USD300per night).Not services in the hotel, small lobby and ridiculously small rooms, with a toilet only possible for kids.

Can't thank this hotel enough. So very helpful. Perfect location within walking distance to absolutely everything. So clean and tidy. Very good air con and staff so very friendly. Would not stay anywhere else and has everything you need. Thank you galliviant.

Great place to stay near everthing in theatre district. We were celebrating girls trip and a b' day. We read all the reviews and picked a room in the back. Good choice. Rooms are contemporary and comfortable. We walked most places and Rockefeller center for concert series on Today show. Only complaint for us was doors to rooms slammed upon every entry of a guest in middle of night. Staff was very accomodating. Definitely recommend to stay here. Starbucks was near!

Upon arrival, I was stunned by the beautiful decor of the Hotel. The lobby looks amazingly beautiful it seems like it was recently renovated. Check in was fast and easy. But the elevators are very slow. We walked into our room and realized they made a mistake with our reservation. We requested double beds and got room with one double bed that smelled like smoke. I called the lobby and told them they made a mistake. Went back down to the lobby and requested for double beds and the receptionist said no sorry we are out, then I said what about a king bed? She then said don't have any of those either. But I never saw her actually checking the system. Then I asked for a room that at least it didn't smell like smoke. We got another room but these rooms are made for only one occupant. The space is so small luckily we were only going to be there one day so we had our small carry-on bags if we were there for a longer period of time we would feel claustrophobic . The room was clean and had some renovations as well. But still very small. The bed is not made for two people as soon as you sit down the bed sinks in and I'm not talking like a tempurpedic bed would but more like a deflated air mattress. These small compact rooms should be used for a solo traveler. One of the best things this Hotel had was the location only steps away from Broadway.

Tiny room and bathroom even by NY hotel standards but nicely appointed, comfortable and quiet. Really not bad for a three star. However the big issue is the elevator. It took me 20 minutes to come down from the 5th floor to check out. I couldn't walk with my luggage. The elevators are tiny, extremely slow and not enough for the amount of rooms.

Gave the hotel four stars because the service was prompt and associates friendly. The room is compact with one king and two bunk beds and a small bathroom. Good enough for a short stay. There was a problem with the bathroom sink and after reporting it, a technician came withing 5 minutes and problem resolved. Also one of the bunk beds did not have a blanket and again someone came with one promptly. There was only one small issue, went for breakfast about 10:15 and everything was put away. So it says breakfast served till 10:30 but I guess that means be there before10:00.

We were in NY to see @Hamilton on Broadway. This hotel is within walking distance to just about everything. Great Location! But I give this hotel 5 stars for the level of hospitality and service shown to us by the bell desk for how they handled our luggage and for hailing a taxi when needed. I especially want to recognize Mr. @Oswin Smith for outstanding level of professionalism and effort when helping us to retrieve some personal items. Nothing like friendly people to make you feel right at home when you are away. I recommend the Gallivant Hotel and look forward to our next visit to NY because of our experience here.

Stayed at the hotel for 7 nights in a standard queen room. Check in and check out were very brisk and I was a little surprised to have to pay $125 deposit (by credit card) to cover any possible charges that may occur during our stay (hopefully this will be refunded)The room itself was very small but functional (could be a problem if you plan to do lots of shopping). It was regularly cleaned by their wonderful cleaning staff and provided an excellent proximity to Times Square. The air con however, was quite old and noisy - sounded like an airplane in flight and leaked three times during our stay once all over my handbag - would have turned this off it hadn't been so hot. This hotel has great potential given its location but needs to give some attention to finishing touches to make it more of a luxury stay.

Overall disappointing. As a regular traveller to New York I usually stick to the same hotels but was lured by the price of the Gallivant. What I thought was a good deal combined with the location led me to cancel my other hotel and book this one. Unfortunately however my booking was cancelled by the hotel less than 24 hours before my arrival. I received no warning emails and the first I knew was when I logged in to get the address and saw it was cancelled. Due to already being on route to NY I was panicked and rebooked despite it costing me €127 more than my original booking. Upon arrival I was given room 300. Unfortunately the safety deposit box wasn't working so the maintenance guys busted it open (I am pretty sure there must be a reset button instead of the forceful method that was used!) After destroying the safe they moved me to room 908 which seemed ok at first at least it had a working safe. However, after a great first day I returned to my hotel room to find that the bulbs in two of the lamps are blown including the one beside the bed in addition to this two of the ceiling lights also needed bulbs which made it pretty difficult to see anything in one section of the room. Just when I thought it couldn't get worse I stepped into the shower the next morning to find the ceiling covered in small flying ant type creatures! Needless to say I spent as little time as possible in the hotel. The hotel has so much potential and the location is excellent but for the same price I could get a nearby hotel with working lights and no bugs. Sad to say I won't be rushing back and won't be recommending to friends.

StAyed for 5 days. In a really good location for Times Square , Bus station etc. The front of house is pretty funky, once in the corridors upstairs , the decor attempts to be modern , but just makes the place dark.The in room AC is old and noisy. NYC is noisy outside too, unfortunately this translates 24/7 into the room.Room felt small, we spent the later 5 days in the Intercontinental which was more than twice the size.All felt a bit drab and dated. It is a convenient location that said. Good delis just round the corner , with a Fire House are one end of the street and M&M store at other , leading into Times Square.

Found this hotel when my husband and I had to stay last minute in NYC. It was a great convenient location close to Times Square. The hotel can barely be noticed from the street but it is modern and updated inside. The only issue is that the rooms and hallways are very tiny and there is a very annoying "urban fee" off 15 dollars that gets tacked onto your bill during your stay. The front desk clerk says it was for the "fitness center" however we never used it so I have no idea what it was like so I can't comment on it. The urban fees are a turn off - and should just be included in the base price.

Booking a hotel in new York can be costly, I managed to find this place at a great deal and literally in Times Square. The hotel lobby is great, service is mediocre (we had to carry our own bags and the reception looks like they are doing you a favour) the rooms are nothing fantastic (including an on going generator noise day and night), it is small but enough for 2 people, bed is not bad and no view from the window. But our main aim was to be outside enjoying NYC, I would say this is an average hotel but have seen much better 4* hotels in the city - the location is the best attraction for this place.

After just getting home from a long week-end stay at this hotel I felt it deserved an excellent review. This hotel is a little bit hard to find and the signage that is shown in the photos is not in place. A quick visit to Google maps and you will not have an issue in finding this hotel.From the moment we checked in we had great customer service. We arrived early in the morning and we met with bell services where they took our bags and we worked with them to valet our car for the three days we were staying. It was worth the extra $10 a day to not have the worries or issues with parking the car. We were receipted for the car and off we went to explore.We arrived back around 2PM and we were surprised to find out that both of our rooms were ready. We have a double room and a premium room that had a King size bed and bunk beds around a half wall. The room was comfortable and the beds were some of the best we have slept on at any hotel. Be advised the rooms are small but for the purposes of your trip they are perfect. We had excellent maid service as our rooms were cleaned and ready everyday before noon. We have often tipped the maid service and we did so on this trip. When we came back to the room on the second day, we were given a "thank you" on the pad where I left the note with the tip. I have never had a maid thank us for the tip. Nice touch!The elevators are small but fit the size of the property. We had issues only once in getting on but it was in the heat of the day and most were either coming or going. Staying on the fourth floor, it was a simple walk to the lobby.Since this is a "boutique" hotel, there isn't complimentary breakfast but options next store (which attached to the hotel) offer both continental breakfast as well as a buffet option. While we didn't take advantage of either, the pricing and offerings looked great.What I really loved about this hotel was the proximity to both Times Square as well as Broadway. Thanks to The Gallivant and their staff for a wonderful vacation. If you are looking in this area, please consider this property. We are already planning a trip back to NYC and we will be staying here again.P.S. Absolutely loved the wallpaper in the rooms. A great shoutout to the area.

We were upgraded to a fitness room which was nice and spacious. The hotel is in a fantastic location for Times Square, but tucked away so you can have a quiet escape. Staff very helpful, especially a lady called Cristina..Rooms modern and trendy, but I do have a message for the hotel - when you are designing a 'trendy' hotel, it's still vital to remember everything must be functional and practical. Draws would be more useful than an empty box next to the bed, and the bathroom may look cool but if the shower floods everywhere and there's no bench space - it's annoying.But we enjoyed our stay and will stay again.

I guess The Gallivant used to be a Tryp Hotel by Wyndham, but isn't any more. There was still some paperwork distributed that had the old name/logo. Not a big deal, just an observation. The standard room we had was small and the bathroom was tiny, but that's pretty common by NY standards. The rooms looked to have been recently renovated with recessed lighting, faux wood floors, flat screen TVs, and tasteful wall coverings. Bed was comfortable, bedding was nice, and room was very clean. Great location at a good price. Nice that they have free access to internet in the lobby as we had to print out boarding passes for return flight. Rooms were quiet facing front where we were. Street noise wasn't bad at all.Curious that the hotel doesn't have a sign on it, maybe that's in the works. Without a sign, we kept walking by it especially returning at night, so we used the Vietnamese restaurant next door as a landmark. Also, the showers have panels with no door, so the bathroom floor floods anytime you bathe (and we tried very hard not to). We dried off and then used the towels on the floor. And yes, you will end up waiting for one of the two small elevators. Fine if you aren't in a hurry.Staff was friendly and attentive. Upon arrival, the air conditioning unit didn't work properly, so we called reception. Mario quickly came up and fixed it while we went out to dinner. Then it was plenty cold, which was good because it was in the middle of a heat wave.Overall, I'd stay here again.

Stayed ten days here. Very nice rooms. Staff helpful. Maid on the tenth floor was very pleasant and helpful. Lifts could be faster.Breakfast should be cheaper. $20 each is a bit much Less then a two minute walk to times square. Great place to Base yourselfWould go back

Stayed in room 427 which was designed for wheelchair access and a fitted lower shower. I enquired if we could move rooms as the shower was not suitable but was told that all showers are like this. (Shower was fitted at waist height and had to be held in hand) I also had to ring to ask for shower gel as they left us one tiny bottle between two people. The view from the room was walls and vents. They also charged $2 per bag to keep it after you check out (before you fly home) and staff had bad atitude. I rarely leave reviews but my experience was a bad one. I had been looking forward to this trip for ages.

The location is perfect . We really just used it as a place to sleep and nothing more. The elevators were pretty small and had no ventilation which made my daughter quite nervous about riding on them. The room we got was apparently next to a supply closet and there was a good amount of noise.

We really loved this location ! 2 minute walk to Times Square, and restaurants around everywhere !!!! We walked everywhere, the great Broadway shows were just a step away, the big name shops also within walking distance. We arrived very early on a very busy Saturday morning after travelling more than 35 hours, and were met with smiles from all the staff despite it being mayhem in the foyer. When we asked if we could have our room early the staff member on the front desk nicely replied that we would have to wait until at least 3pm (the actual checkin time ) as there were many others also waiting for their room. That lovely staff member was the exceptionally helpful and kind Cassandra. We went out for an hour or so but soon found that we were extremely tired and really needed to sleep. We returned to the hotel to find a very apologetic Cassandra advising us that the wait would be a little longer and that she was very sorry. We said to her that we were fine and that we would just wait in the foyer as we were too tired to go anywhere. There were 6 of us and we had booked the family suite so we could all fit, Cassandra came back to us within 5 minutes with an option of two rooms for the price that we had paid for our single room at no extra cost and advised us that our room would be ready for us within 5 minutes. True to her word we were off to our room quick smart with Cassandra telling us to have a good rest and then hit the shops. Over the next few days she also helped us with information on where to go and what o do and at all times with a helpful smile. All the staff were very helpful at the hotel (including the lovely cleaning ladies) however Cassandra made our whole trip the New York so much easier and a great deal less stressful. Thank you Cassandra....and thank you Gallivant staff for employing such a wonderful staff member. We shall recommend this hotel to all of our friends visiting NY. Good luck Cassandra in all that you do.Kind regardsThe Howard and Muttumani families

We booked a room for 7 days, great location. Rooms are to small, if you are planning to do some shopping it will cause a nightmare there. Elevators are quite slow and sometimes crowded. Only one block from Times Square, Olive Garden, M&M world. Two blocks from Broadway. Nice for what you are paying for.

The location and the hotel itself was very nice. However what lacks is the hotel room and the bathroom in particular is a little on the small side. Time square is only walking distance away and Central Park is not too far away as well. Despite it being NY it's surprisingly not too loud.

Very small, but cozy room. No carpets in room, and tiny bathroom was well and newly renovated.Beware if your room is situated towards the back of the hotel. The windows are not insulated, so the fire department below will be heard at all hours of the night.The service was not the best, nor the friendliest. A simple smile or welcome from the reception desk would have done wonders, but this service was non-existent. And, the hotel name is nowhere written on the building... find this place using the address. The picture above is surely Photoshop)The location was excellent though! Close to Times Square (not even a 2-minute walk), subway stations are numerous, museum close by.

We arrived very late after a very stressful trip to be told that they didn't have our rooms that we had booked originally (2 Queens) and they would have to put us in two standard rooms and move us the following day. The standard rooms were so small we could barely fit ourselves in- we opened the door to the closet and it hit the bed, we had to back into the bathroom to use the toilet. Luckily this was only for one night. The next day the hotel offered to move us, they gave us no warning and a porter arrived at the door demanding our bags, we were in the middle of getting ready and had just showered so I asked him to come back in half an hour. He wasn't happy about this. The new rooms were slightly bigger and very comfortable. We had a nice view as well. We didn't spend too much time in the room after that as we were out sightseeing every day, but I did have to pick some items off the floor and as I did I noticed a lot of dirt gathered around the edges of the room and in the corners- it needed a good clean. On our last day the hotel knocked a small amount of money off of the first night due to the change in room. We also ordered a shared shuttle via the hotel which due to unforeseen circumstances was over half an hour late. The concierge immediately ordered us a different personal shuttle at no extra charge.We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, instead choosing to go out and eat. Overall this is a good budget hotel for the city. The location is great, less than 5 mins to Times Square and in the other direction towards Hells Kitchen. I highly recommend walking left from the hotel to a few blocks down- this takes you to Hells Kitchen where there are some great bars and restaurants.

Rooms, lobby, etc are nicely made over. 3 of us stayed for business, good Hotwire deal. Amazing location near Times Square and restaurants. Rooms are very small and we all had single beds. Good if on a budget but know what to expect. Also, fine Thai restaurant but not a good breakfast or coffee spot.

We stayed here while in New York for part of our honeymoon. The hotel was in a great location meaning we were able to walk to many of the things we wanted to see. The room was small with no view but it was fine for our 3 nights stay. The bed was amazing- so comfy, no problem with noise at all and the staff seemed nice. Basic, clean, fab location sums this place up. Didn't spend much time in the room as we wanted to see as much of New York as possible. No complaints here.

Stayed here for three nights at the end of July. Overall the stay was good - the bed was very comfy and it was fairly quiet considering its in the centre of NYC. Location is fantastic just around the corner from Times Square and theatres we managed to get everywhere from this hotel.The were a couple of things which put a downer on the stay - in the bathroom there was lots of tiny fly's flying about - I'm guessing they came up through the drain. Secondly when we were there only two lifts were working and they were very slow so getting to and from the room took some time.

We stayed for 5 nights it was booked under Wyndham but it was sold to a new company. Bed was horrible and lumpy you could see where it was sagging. The bathroom was small no space you can literally stretch out your arms and touch each wall. The shower was a half glass so of course the water sprays out onto the floor. The hotel staff was probably the worst I have seen very inattentive at checkin and during the entire stay. It was almost like they didn't know they worked at a hotel the gossip between each other was at times interesting. I doubt they have a manager on staff. The hallways are dark and usually packed with dirty laundry and trash. The elevators were horrible very small and slow. To make it worse they use the guest elevator to take the dirty laundry and trash down. We went for breakfast at the restaurant which is really a Chinese restaurant . Don't waste your time there the food was god awful and cold. There is another Asian restaurant also connected which is a good place for dinner or lunch. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location . I personally would never stay there again.

Great location, close to subway, theaters, able to walk to many locations. Rooms were small but didn't spend much time in them. One of our rooms had ac that wasn't working but they took care of it right away and gave us another room. Very friendly staff.w

small rooms, very, very small bathroom, the air condition is noisy to a point that it is hard to sleep, poor room service. the price is much too high, in my opinion to what is expected from a hotel that claims to be first class when we reserved the rooms.

We stayed here with a special from TravelZoo. We are not frequent travelers to NYC so we had absolutely NO idea what to expect. The hotel made of long weekend so worth it! We went shopping, saw the Rockettes and had a wonderful dinner in times square. We also had our 7 year old daughter with us. She was able to do all the walking to and from without any issues. And the price was right! I absolutely recommend you staying here!

Very small boutique hotel. We stayed here for 3 nights. Great location for Broadway shows, Times Square etc. the rooms were clean and a decent size, especially for a family of four-there were bunk beds for the kids. The front desk staff was not very friendly and seemed annoyed any time I asked a question or interacted with them.

The Premium Suite was terrific for a family. It was roomy for New York, with a bunk bed area nicely separated from the queen bed/parent area. For a room in this great location, we were impressed. Front desk was friendly. Housekeeping was high quality and reliable. Room temperature was nice and cool during hot summer days.Drawbacks we felt: elevator was very slow, and we experienced some maintenance issues (room air conditioning, television). We were surprised by $2/bag fee to hold luggage upon checkout - not sure we've ever seen that before.

Tryp is a recently renovated Best western hotel. The rooms are nice and spare and the bath small with a very narrow shower and small sink. The lighting in the room and bath were dim and made it difficult to put on make-up.The halls are also very narrow.The hotel staff was very nice and the maid that cleaned our room was very, very nice.When I couldn't find my cell phone she called it from our room for me. She didn't think it would put a charge on our bill but we were charged $10. That is a ridiculous amount. I don't blame her. She also left me extra tissues because I had a terrible sneezing fit.It was a great location for Times square and a reasonable price.It was a little noisy on the second floor facing 48th st.

I stayed in this hotel for one night, while my sister and her partner stayed for a full week. When I returned to the hotel on their check out day I asked the concierge if someone could help us hail a cab as we needed to get to JFK airport. The concierge then tried to convince us to purchase tickets for the hotel shuttle bus, which for the three of us would have been $72 before tax and tip. When I declined his suggestion and told him that we would prefer to take a cab as it would be a) quicker - the shuttle came once every hour and would then stop at every terminal, and b) cheaper - NYC yellow taxi cabs have a fixed rate of $52.50 which including the toll charge and tip would have been $70 at the most to and from JFK to Manhattan. I was then spun a story and this is what made me angry about how the taxi fares are increased when it's raining (no they are not) and that the bellman does not hail cabs during rain....Before any of this had happened I would of happily recommended people staying here, however the blatant lies we were told about the taxi cabs and then the refusal to help us after my sister had just paid for a full weeks stay, I would not suggest this hotel to anyone. I lived in NYC for two years and this is the first time any hotel has tried to lie to me or refused to hail a cab due to rain. Shockingly poor service, there are many other great hotels I would suggest people spend their money on.

I had a business meeting in Manhattan before departing for a European Vacation and needed a room for two nights for my wife and I. The Gallivant was formerly the TRYP Time Square Central but recently changed hands. It was still the TRYP when we made the reservation. We have stayed at the TRYP by Wyndham Times Square South near Penn Station on previous trips to the city, and it’s a great hotel. First off, The Gallivant location can’t be beat. You’re in the heart of the Theater District and it’s a quick two block walk to two different subway line stations. We arrived at Newark Airport, took the NJ Transit train to New York Penn Station, the subway two stops to 50th Street, and then walked back to 48th street to our hotel. As others have stated, because it recently changed names, there’s no signage but it’s still very easy to find. When we departed, we flew out of JFK so we just walked back to the blue subway line on 50th and took the subway all of the way to the JFK AirTrain station in Queens. If you utilize the 50th Street Station, there’s no elevator, so you have to carry your luggage down three flights of stairs. However, you can walk six blocks south to the Port Authority Bus Station on 42nd where there’s a lift, and take the same subway line to JFK.The hotel rooms are small as are most hotel rooms in the Big Apple but very modern with ample storage. The Free Wi-Fi is fast and the large flat Panel TV offers many channels. Being in the middle of Time Square there are hundreds of restaurants and lots of shopping in every direction.The only minor negative is the staff which are less than friendly and not at all accommodating. We had minimal interaction with them so it didn’t bother us.I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again at a rate under $200.

Stayed from the 2nd to the 6th of June in the Tryp New York... Oh hang on, The Gallivant Times Square.... and loved every minute. Fantastic location, Times Square is literally a stones throw away! What more do you want?Room was a bit small and we struggled to store all of our shopping in the cupboards/wardrobe provided. (So I was made to sleep in the cupboard whilst my girlfriend shared the bed with her clothes!!)A bit noisy in the nights, so if you're a light sleeper take ear plugs! Standard procedure.10/10 for the wallpaper in the rooms too.All in all a fantastic base for a fantastic City! Look forward to coming again!Jorge.

The place was very nice and centrally located. The rooms were clean but super small, a New York City trademark. We would stay there again as it was close to the places that we wanted to see. We enjoyed walking to 9th and 10th avenues as we hadn't gotten to that area very much before.

Day 1- Requested a fridge. Front desk replied "We don't have any." Wrong answer.(The response should've been "Although they're all taken, as guests check out I'll see if one becomes available and contact you in the am.")*- Alerted front desk about the 1. Foul sewage odor in bathroom 2. Mildew stained shower walls3. Mold on shower curtain. 3. Flies coming from drain They were apologetic but would not be able to address until the next day and offered to comp breakfast which I passed on.(Placed the shower curtain in the hallway to alleviate the room stench)- Hotel authorized a hold on my cc OVER the standard $25 deposit I thought was authorized.(Uncovered this after reviewing my cc bills)Day 2- Replaced putter fabric shower curtain but no plastic interior curtain- Staff said they would clean bathroom and address fliesDay 3- Asked for fridge again and finally got one- Alerted the front desk of excess charges that I didn't authorize . They said it was a "system issue."- I asked Felix "guest services" agent, to kindly resolve the issue by Utilizing that UNauthorized amount already taken from my acct. towards :a. $25 nightly deposit feeb. rate for tonight c. OR allow me to use cash for the $25 deposit........due to the HOTEL's "system error" absorbing my available balance Felix's replied: "It wasn't us it was the system. But we already released the unauthorized amount. You have to call your bank and ask them to put it back on your cc." Felix continued with "We already released it so if it's on hold it's your bank not us."First of all....- If the "system" is to blame, is it not the Gallivant Hotel whose responsibility it is to implement a "system" that works.- Notwithstanding all "systems" have a margin for error; but when it causes financial burden to the hotel guest the natural reaction would be resolution oriented. Not with Felix. His reaction was not only defensive but also shifting responsibility.Second...- Telling me to call my bank and impress a sense of urgency for an expedite their process because the hotel's "system" made a mistake is inappropriate and unprofessional Felix failed to realize that there wouldn't be any sense of urgency to put on my bank if the mistake had not been made to begin with.Third...- He immediately refused any of the alternatives I listed; nor did he offer any apologies, compromise, resolution or compensation for the lack of :hospitalitytransparency in unauthorized/excess chargesfinancial restitutionFourth...- When I asked who HIS manager was he identified himself as the "Hotel Manager." I knew he wasn't the manager based on how he handled "guest services." It was extremely transparent how green he was based on the inability to: listen, communicate effectively, diffuse conflict-situations, and problem solve.I had to ask him again "Who do you report to?"Then he gave the name of his mgr. To no surprise I find out Felix is the assist.I was forgiving about the moldy bathroom because at least that MOD made an attempt to compensate for the inconvenience; despite my amicable decline.I also understand that this is the Hospitality BUSINESS therefore they have policies for payment.However, it's the manager's job to train the staff to recognize opportunities to resolve issues before they escalate. My exchange with Felix was like gasoline to a flame. (The flame being drain flies in the shower). Had Felix apologized for the financial inconvenience, listened to the list of filthy accommodations I patiently endured, acknowledged how much I've already compromised on lower hotel standards and offered resolution this would be one less negative review.

We stayed here for 7 nights. Nice central location and hotel room was clean and the staff friendly. The noise from Times Square wasn't an issue for us - we were located on the 10th floor. The room was small but most places in New York are small, however this didn't bother us as we were out and about most of the day and only really in the room to sleep. Would definitely visit the hotel again and am pleased with our stay. Free wifi in the room was a plus.

Stayed for 8 nights from July 14th. Didn't know the name of the hotel had changed as when we booked it the hotel was called calledyp. On arrival we were told the was a 90 minute wait for the room, however after about 20 minutes which was just enough time to pop across the street for a cold drink we were given a room.8th floor, compact (expected for NYC). Very clean, good storage space with hangers and space for suitcases, iron and ironing board. Large flat screen TV, tea and coffee facilities, fantastic air-conditioning which was efficient and quiet. Nice powerful shower. A bed and pillows that I wanted to take home, solo comfortable, better than my own bed at home.Nice unobtrusive domestic staff, very polite and efficient.Didn't use the breakfast facilities as this is NYC and there is choice everywhere, so unable to comment.Room was 809 at the back of the hotel and very quiet. Location is a dream, two minutes walk from Times Square so central for everything and a great base for a New York holiday. Concierge excellent, hailed down a taxi when we left and loaded our bags which were very heavy in the back of the taxi.Can't wait to go back and would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat.

This was my first trip to New York and the location of the Gallivant is just ideal. Close to subways, and to Times Square itself it's bang in the middle of everything going on. For New York the rooms are a decent size and clean! The hotel staff are also super helpful! Definitely recommend.

We had two rooms here which were quite nice. Our bathroom door was old and warped wouldn't close and the shower leaked. These rooms are quite small as is the bathroom. Great location just a short walk to Times Square and everything else you could need.

If you are looking a clean, affordable hotel in the theater district, look no further. Located on 48th between 7th and 8th, you are literally minutes from many Broadway shows. Great staff, helped with room selection (choose a quiet one on the back side of the hotel) and directions to local eateries.Rooms are small, but a comfortable bed is all I asked for from this hotel and they delivered.Find a prepaid method to get to this hotel as this is a very congested area and a taxi with the meter running might require a new mortgage loan to pay the driver.I would stay here again and strong recommend this hotel.

After reading some of the reviews we were a bit hesitant but we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived after a long international flight from Australia. The room was not as small as we were expecting, the bed was comfy and there was a lovely little balcony to sit out on. The location was fantastic just a 5 minute walk to Times Square! The only thing that was annoying was the air conditioner was very noisy, other than that we had a lovely stay.

Myself and a friend stayed here last week, we had just spent over a month backpacking around Europe and then flew from London which is an 8.5 hour flight, we were both sick and exhausted and so excited to get to our hotel and go to bed. We had booked this place as a treat to ourselves however I have stayed in campsites across Europe which had better staff and cleaner rooms upon check in. I checked in with Victor who was initially lovely to deal with and quickly checked us in to our room on the second floor. Upon getting into our room we were horrified. The last persons rubbish, dirty towels and dirty sheets were on the floor and table. (Photos attached) I immediately went back down and explained what was wrong and was told that they would get someone up there to clean as soon as they could. I told them that after being on a long flight and sick that I was not willing to wait around for our room to be cleaned I wanted to be moved. When I booked this room I let the hotel know that we would be arriving between 9-10pm so when we arrived at 10pm and our room was dirty I was not willing to then wait even longer to get into it. Victor agreed to find us a new room but the way we were spoken to after this was like we were an inconvenience. Our second room now on the 11th floor was lovely and clean, the only problem we had with it was the loud aircon which we had expected after reading previous travellers reviews. A couple of days later we returned from a day out and our loud aircon wasn't only loud now it was leaking, my clothes and a few gifts I had bought were wet, I went and spoke to reception again and the gentlemen I got (whom didn't have a name badge on) was absolutely lovely! He really saved our experience at this hotel. He moved us into a new room and got my wet clothes dry cleaned. He was friendly and genuine the whole time I dealt with him and he is a real asset to your business. When we checked out on the 16th I asked to speak to a manager about our ordeal on the first night. I explained what had happened and that I was not happy to pay for the first night as by the time they got me into a clean room I would be paying for the room for an hour. The gentlemen I spoke to, Felix, told me he could half the night and that's it. When I told him this wasn't good enough he said I can't do anything else, there is no one else here who can help you and I don't know why your room was dirty as a manager was on when you checked in. If Felix is in fact telling the truth that all he could do is wave $80 then that is a ridiculous way to run your business, if he does not have the power to wave a nights accommodation you should have someone in the building who can do so as I know for a fact other rooms had problems too (A family was complaining about a broken drain and fridge while I was checking out). As a manager of a business at home I know that the customer is always right and if someone comes in with a complaint I need to fix it fully and on this occasion my complaint was not dealt with correctly. If I handled a complaint the way that mine was handled I would be ripped into my boss. Overall I was not happy with my experience at The Gallivant Times Square however our beds were extremely comfortable and the rooms were a good size. This hotel is also in a perfect location. I hope anyone staying here in the future doesn't run into any problems with their rooms as then it would in fact be a good place to stay in NYC.

The location of this hotel is fantastic with a short distance to Times Square and Central Park. Had a family room with 6 beds that was very convenient. We did not try the breakfast as there are so may restaurants in the neigbourhood. Next to a fireman's station so it should be safe.

Had a one night stay recently for an overnight business trip, room was quiet, sizeable, clean, and with a comfortable bed a good nights sleep was easy achievable. Upon arrival there was no friendly welcome at all, let alone a pointer to where I might find in house hotel facilities. Never the less I checked in, grabbed a power nap and then set about going to work. On my return my key card wouldn't work and the receptionist first of all couldn't find my room booking and refused to issue me another key before then saying I was in the wrong room despite the key card cover being endorsed by their staff with that room number and my name! No apology for their mistake was forthcoming, and with that I decided this wouldn't be a hotel I would frequent again. True boutique hotels in NYC simply won't last treating repeat customers like this.

I was very confused as to who was affiliated with this hotel as it was previously a Tryp Hotel. The answer to this question was that it does not have one. So, unfortunately, they do not exactly have corporate standards to upheld themselves to on a daily basis. My one word to describe my experience is not even a word - it's "Meh." I was not generally horrified by the experience. I was not exceedingly impressed with my experience, either. I usually have an opinion one way or the other. But, for this BUSINESS visit, I do not. A business hotel it is not. The biggest plus I can give this hotel is that the wifi was FREE and generally a great signal. So, this was helpful workwise for me. The room was very small, but it was clean and furnished fine, albeit a bit confined. The bathroom was miniature. I will be honest, I picked this using the price factor as normally I would not go near Times Square. But, this seemed like a very busy weekend with rooms very scarce all over the city. That being said, NEVER expect a hotel next to Times Square to be quiet. Because of the age and location (clearly no double pane windows here), I battled with the street noise during sleep. My time away from NYC has clearly gotten me spoiled to want peace and quiet vs city traffic honking during sleep. Silly me. What outdid this noise? A family of 5 children who were clearly sharing a room on my floor. They mistook the hallway as their playground at 12:30AM. Since the doors were not soundproof either, I promptly screamed at them (as they were sans parents) and complained to the front desk (whose comment was "we know who you're talking about"). I have no clue if it even had amenities. The front desk staff were average in help and friendliness. The halls and the lobby were clean and suffice. My last comments will be positive. The cleaning staff and concierge were friendly and great at their jobs. The bed was relatively comfortable. I may not love the location, but it is great for tourists who want to be in the thick of things or be the first ones in line for the TKTS booth. It was close to my office, so I could walk. Score.

I was a little afraid to stay at a hotel that I had never heard of before and especially reading the reviews. When we got there, the front desk guy was so nice and it looked like a nice hotel. When we got to our room, it smelled a little moldy and the sheets were a little damp but it was 1:30 in the morning so I didn't really care. Well, my allergies started acting up after 3 hours being in there. I couldn't sleep so I went into the bathroom and I was so freaked out. There were bugs flying around in the shower and if you looked up, there were dead bugs on the ceiling. I took a video and also a picture of the shower. Went downstairs and showed the guy that had checked us in and he was shocked as well. The bell hop guy came over and saw the video as well. They couldn't get us a room right away so the bell hop guy came back up to our room to see the bugs and I guess to see first hand. Well when we got in there, he saw the bugs and went back downstairs to share the news. The front desk guy called us right away and found a room for us to move into. This was now 5:30AM; I had not had any sleep really after driving 5 hours and not sleeping all day prior. We went from the second floor to the ninth floor. The room was a whole lot better and my allergies were so much better after an hour of not being in the other room. We tried talking to the general manager but he was unavailable and I have not heard from him at all. I left all of my information and I talked to 3 different employees that work there and they all seemed like this was the first time they were hearing about this situation. I saw the front desk guy write everything down. This is a little absurd! It's not in a bad location but I would recommend staying somewhere else unless you get a room above the 2nd level.

My girlfriend and I stayed here this past January for a weekend. Our room looked really cool with dark wood floors and a super modern look. Be warned, however, that the rooms (our room anyway) was pretty small. Nothing extravagant, just a bed, a desk, and a small bathroom with a TV mounted on the wall. The size was perfect for us because we weren't in there very often, but some people might like a larger room. One great thing about this hotel is the location. It's about two blocks off of the main Time's Square area which is less than a couple minutes walk. It was awesome being able to walk out of our hotel and be right in the middle of Time's Square. That was probably my favorite part of staying at this hotel.The only complaint I have about this place is that the shower doesn't really have a door on it. In our room, it was just one pane of class that didn't go all the way to the wall, so when I took a shower, a bunch of water got out onto the bathroom floor. I understand that they are trying to make the shower look modern (and are succeeding), but something more practical would have been nice.Overall, for the value, quality/look of the rooms and the location, I was impressed with this place and I would stay here again for sure.

My friends and were bound and determined we'd somehow get burned our trip to NYC - namely, booking a hotel sight unseen. We were pleasantly surprised. The room was small, but not uncomfortable and decently clean. The staff were friendly and prompt when we called for extra towels and the beds were really comfortable. Or maybe I was really tired. My only major complaint was the lighting in the bathroom. Awful. We essentially applied our makeup in total darkness.

The hotel is right in Times Square so we were happy. If you can't sleep with busy traffic/loud noises going on all night then this hotel isn't for you. The rooms were a lot smaller than we originally thought, especially considering how much we paid for a room. The shower is tiny, the room was average, but again staying right in Times Square near all the attractions made up for it. While some staff were friendly and keen to help, others were quite rude and dismissive. While the lobby was beautiful, the elevators are broken and slow so don't try to get out in a hurry. It was a decent place to stay, but it could have been better.

While some might like the location of the hotel, one black from Times Square, I found it crowded, noisy and very difficult. The hallways are dark and narrow, and our room was smaller than any room I've been in since I was a child. When one was in the bathroom, it was difficult to move. It was about 9 square feet. Problems began as soon as we arrived. We were told that we were on the 10th floor, but when we tried our key, it did not work. We were, in fact, assigned to a room on the 8th floor. My husband opened the door to the closet, and the knob came off in his hand. There was no toilet paper in the bathroom. No wash cloths were provided on the second day of our stay. When I awoke on the first morning, the bathroom door was locked and required opening by a a hotel mechanic. The air conditioner was noisy, created a lot of condensation and made the room barely tolerable with the thermostat set at 66 degrees. Our room was clean, however, and the bed was reasonably comfortable.

We stay at this hotel when ever we are in NYC. Tricia always gives outstanding customer service. She made out trip very special. She should train others on providing great customer service. Tricia is a 10plus . The Gallivant is in walking distance to Times Square and all the Broadway shows. We love staying here the beds are very comfortable. The Miles

I stayed here with work for 5 nights last week. I arrived early evening room was ready, a bit small but adequate with a queen size bed, modern ensuite, desk and chair and large TV. Ensuite is small but fine. Room was clean and bed very comfy. Being on the second floor it was noisy but expected. Christina on reception was very polite and extended my check out as she knew I had a late flight back to Australia. Would stay here again.

The room was OK, a reasonable size and well appointed. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location was good in terms of access to transport, eateries, theatres and attractions. The breakfast area linked to the restaurant next door offers a reasonably priced breakfast which was very good and provided plenty of sustenance to keep you going through the day.

Visited NY with my dad for a week and this hotel was exactly what we wanted: very clean, comfortable, reasonably priced and centrally located. The beds were so comfortable and our room was tucked away from any noise (second floor at the back). Not much fuss is made in the lobby in terms of the staff as they didn't speak much and there isn't much going on, but for us this was perfect as the hotel was simply a place to rest our heads. Perhaps the shower could have a little more power as it was a treacle, but other than that it was great. The housekeepers are also very friendly. Expensive but less expensive than most others in the city, especially considering we booked <1 week before!Be sure to check out the Italian restaurant directly across the road, amazing! Will be back for sure

I have nothing to complain about. Everything and everyone was perfect: Helpful Staff, amazing location, modern hotel, beautiful lobby, not very crowded, lots of nice bars and rooftops around. Times square is just around the corner. Room was smaller than I expected but it didn't ruin my impression about the hotel.

When I arrived I was to say the least very disappointed when i saw my room. you couldn't swing a cat in it.Went down to reception, expressed my shock at this tiny room. The receptionist was very polite, explained that there was nothing he could do as the hotel was full. I should go to reception in the morning. I only unpacked what I needed that nigtht, anyway there was nowhere to unpack. I very politely asked if I could see the Manager, the receptionist on duty, asked if she could help. I told her my problem, The receptionist immediately changed my room.which was small but comfortable.The location of the hotel is great, right in the middle of Time Square. the reception area is very pleasant.The A C was noisy, but didn't stop me from sleeping.

Most miserable staff ever, especially Victor Fitness. Checked into our room, opened the door and genuinely thought it was a practical joke. Tiny shoebox room - literally never stayed in a hotel quite so small before. People often say hotel rooms are small but this is seriously something else...absolutely midget I kid you not. If the staff were friendly it may have made up for the horrendously loud AC, the tiny room, the lack of lighting and plug sockets, the disgusting cold and bland decor and the elevator that takes 7 years to arrive at the lobby. Literally the only thing this place has going for it is the location, round the corner from Times Square. We wish we had stayed at a similarly priced hotel on the next block rather than changing our booking to stay here.You live and learn, hey, ya live and ya learn. Peace out folks.

I stayed there for Saturday night the past weekend with my bff. We were looking for something in Manhattan that was under $300 with good ratings. This hotel fit the bill. It is in a great location. Pretty close to Port Authority and the bustle of Times Square. Close to restaurants and subway stations. But far enough from Times Square that it is not crazy, chaotic, and loud 24/7. I must note that it is pretty hard to find the hotel since there is not a sign above the door. The hotel sign is several stories up, planked by other signs and can only be seen clearly at night when it is lit up. We got there at 2pm and I was very disappointed that we were not able to check in early. But we were able to securely stash our bags with the bellhop and go get something to eat in the meantime (note: check in is 3pm). Staff was very friendly. The lobby is very nicely decorated and has plenty of seating for guests waiting around the lobby. The room was the typical NYC size--enough space to turn around in place and breath but not enough to dance or pace around the room. The bathroom was comically small. It was the size of a kitchen pantry. Not a problem if you are staying one night. But if you plan to stay longer, it can be a bit annoying. The bed was comfy. The room had ample plugs. However, I was a bit annoyed that the lamp and table light on my side of the bed did not work. I didnt realize this problem until it was time for bed. I feel that I paid a lot of money for not a fully functioning room. Check out was easy. Note: I also hate hotels that give you less than 24 hours in a room--3pm check in and 12pm check out.

Me and my father stayed to The Gallivant for four nights while visiting New York. All I can really say is this place is very, very basic. As I celebrated my 21st birthday we were upgraded to a 'Premier room', a good start or so I thought. A double bed and a bunk bed was what we were greeted with. Now, I have just come of age but the last time I slept in a bunk bed, I was 10. Hooray. We both agreed that the beds were uncomfortable, and having minor back problems I struggle to sleep on hard beds, so uncomfortable night sleeps all round. That being said, that wasn't the only problem with the sleep quality. Every night I struggled to fall asleep and stay asleep due to the horrific sounds of a tired, loud air conditioning unit. As far as I'm concerned I may as well have had someone power drilling in the same room and I wouldn't have been able to tell the difference! If this is the standard of a premier room I dread to think what any other room is like.The service in the hotel was passable, the cleaners did a good job at keeping our room to a good standard, however given the fact this establishment is in New York I was pretty amazed that 90% of the staff had forgotten how to smile! In summary I feel the hotel could do a lot better, and there are much better places to stay in New York City, avoid.

The hotel has recently changed to the gallivant hotel. It is perfectly locate one block away from times square and only a short 15min walk to central park all in all perfectly situated, one negative is the size of the room that we where in room 1002 it was tiny even for new york standards. But we still enjoyed our 5 nights in newyork.

The Gallivant is a fantastic location if you want to be in the thick of it. The hotel decor is lovely, the rooms are fairly small, but what I expected for centre of New York. There was enough room for us and we were only there 2 nights. It was clean and the staff were friendly.

The hotel was the TRYP when we stayed last month but assuming it hasn't changed too much and by the pictures it hasn't was a good hotel to use in New York. Location is great with Times Sq and Broadway at the door and a lot of other sites withing a walk.Hotel itself was good the room a queen was big enough (thought they did give us a upgrade the bed was only a double so passed) so stay with the Queen.Not a lot of outside noise later at night and we were their on the weekend so not an issue, only minor niggle is the lifts are small and a bit slow so can take a while to get downstairs sometimes but would stay here if we come back to New York,

My friend and I stayed here for 7 nights in June 2016. I am puzzled to content of previous reviews regarding staff, I myself can be critical, but I found the staff to be extremely helpful, friendly and professional. Our room itself was small, but adequate and freshly decorated. Plenty towel, toiletries and coffee provided daily. The best thing for my friend and I was the comfy beds and pillows. What a sleep!! Most comfortable beds ever, wish I could have taken it home with me. The location of this hotel simply could not be better. Seconds walk from M&M store. Close to Rockerfeller centre, St Patrick's cathedral, Penn station etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family, and if I returned to NYC would book the Gallivant.

Planned a last minute trip to see a Broadway show and good fortune landed us at this hotel. Very hard to find (small signage) but right across from the Ritz Plaza. Bright, clean, small but well designed rooms. We had a suite with a double bed in one room and pull down from the wall bunks in the other. Great rate for the area. One block walk to Broadway. Two blocks and you are at the top of Times Square. All personnel at the hotel were helpful and Midwestern like friendly. They have great quick breakfast options. Good food. Loved this place.

I booked a reservation for myself and a friend months before going to NYC when this hotel was still listed as the TRYP by Wyndham. I originally booked through a 3rd party website (easybooking), which I've never had trouble with before. Sometime before my actual stay, the hotel changed hands and became the Gallivant, which is where my troubles started. The day before I was arriving was a Thursday. A normal business day. I have a normal day job where I can't be at a computer and checking my email all the time. Apparently at 1:23 pm I was sent a message from a manager from the Gallivant telling me that they didn't have a credit card on file (despite me having put in my credit information through easybooking) and that they would cancel my reservation if I didn't call them by 3 pm. That's a 1.5 hr window...during a business day...when I'm at work...THE DAY BEFORE MY STAY when I made the reservation literally 2 months beforehand. I didn't check my email until after 3 pm and so had to call and yell on the phone until they reset my booking. Oh and best part? When I was giving my credit information on the phone, the man said "oh so the same card on the original reservation?". So they had my credit info the entire time. The incompetence and absolute lack of any professionalism only got worse from there. Our card stopped working for room less than 24 hrs after being there and they had to reset. Oh and even though they knew it was 2 guests staying in my room, they only provided one towel, When I asked for an extra, my room was called 10 min later and I was informed "we don't have any extra towels and won't be getting more until tomorrow". This place is absolute garbage in how they treat customers despite trying to appear as an upscale boutique hotel. DO NOT BOOK HERE. Horrible service and utter lack of care by workers.

I stayed one night in the standard room and it was really small. With 10 dollars more per day you can stay in a better hotel in the area.The location is really good, near subway and restaurants for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

The location of this hotel was fantastic for our trip. First, it was easy to locate after coming out of the Lincoln Tunnel. Second, we were going to a play at the Kerr Theater which is directly across the street from the hotel. Yes, the rooms are tight, but that does not bother me since we only slept in the room. The only reason I gave it an "average" rating instead of a "very good" rating was for two reasons. The shade they had on the window did not block out any light which was a problem. We were planning on waking up at 7:30-8 am anyway, but the light flooding our room at 5 am made our last couple of hours of rest extremely difficult and annoying. The hotel should invest in some blackout curtains. Second the bathroom was extremely tiny. Again, normally this would not bother me, but the shower did not have a door so the water spilled out into the bathroom. It was just a little too tight. All this being said, if you are not looking to spend time in your hotel this is a great choice. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable and that is always most important to me. In addition, the staff was polite and friendly which also important. Finally, next to the hotel is a restaurant/bar, Hurley's. This was a great spot. We only had drinks and an appetizer, but the food was good and the service was excellent! Have a drink on the deck!!

Absolutely filthy rooms, we even found fruit under our beds on day 2 and day 3??? Rooms are tiny and no double glazing means you hear every single noise and trust me NY is noisy. Staff are so unhelpful and to be honest seem completely uninterested too! Avoid at all costs

I had booked 8 months in advance and had requested a city view room on arrival but it was completely ignored. When we arrived instead of putting through the whole amount on my card it went through in several different transactions. I went up to my room to dump our luggage and had worked out that I still had $300 left to pay, when I went back down I was told it was over $1000 I had to pay and when I confronted them the clueless staff agreed to let me just pay the $300 without any questions. Really worrying how it went from $1000 to the correct amount $300. Half way through my holiday I had noticed that my bank account was emptied, my balance being nil, and noticed they had taken hundreds of dollars out of my account. Again, when we confronted the manager they admitted it was an accident and no explanation was given to why. It took 2 days to go back into my account so for they 2 days I had zero spending money. We spent our last day waiting 2 and a half hours on the manager because we got a bill through our door without warning and another couple of hundred dollars came out my account without my consent. We were well aware we have city tax etc to pay but when the manager eventually came down he had told us we had paid it all and had absolutely nothing to pay and the money would go back in my account. The managers attitude was disgusting, despite waiting 2 and a half hours we didn't even get an apology for waiting or for how much I had been overcharged from the very beginning. The money eventually cleared and that was fine but I was still waiting on my deposit back that I was promised would take a few days. Now we have been back for 2 weeks and $400 has been taken out of my bank account by this hotel. I have emailed the manager directly, repeatedly, to ask him to explain this and still no reply. I don't have an overdraft and because of all the money I had been overcharged for no reason I've now been charged on top of everything else for going into an overdraft which the manager said he would refund but I am still getting completely ignored. Can't stress enough how shocking we have been treated. Would never recommend this hotel to anyone and I am definitely taking this issue further.

Recently stayed for 4 nights here. The hotel was clean and well run. Room was on 7th Floor on front of building. Bit on smallish side but suited us as only used it to sleep. Great shower (a must on holiday) and very comfortable bed. USB charging station which made life easier without the need for adaptors. As with most NY hotels you can hear noise from sirens etc but wasn't really a problem. Friendly Staff. Times Square literally a few minutes walk and great bars and restaurants very close by and also good access to the Subway. One criticism would be need bigger towels in the bathroom but otherwise would stay here again.

Had credit card issues upon arrival, staff was very friendly while I was very stressed.Special thanks to Mrs. Cabrera who assisted very well and was very creative in resolving the issue. I was very grateful for her help.The hotel is on a perfect location, small room but very clean and you don't need more in NY!Airport shuttle service available in the hotel.

I stayed here for 8 nights in June. I must say the location is perfect and the hotel was very clean, but, and there are a lot of buts;I know I was not in my hotel room a lot, but the walls are so thin, you can hear EVERYTHING. One time I could hear people talking so loudly I thought they were standing outside my door!The lifts are tiny and very slow. My shower was literally the bathroom floor - no separation and not even a hook for the shower. The staff were not that hospitable or welcoming. Especially the man who I asked for advice about getting taxi back to airport. To charge 2 dollars per bag upon check-out after I have paid so much money is not acceptable. I normally am quite easily pleased, but I paid a lot of money to stay here and these faults are not acceptable considering.

My husband & I stayed her for four miserable nights. The room felt like a closet, it was so small. There was no sitting area in the room other than the bed. The bathroom was small with a shower that only has half a door so the water covered the bathroom floor overtime you had a shower. The room had very little lighting so was very dark. he housekeeping carts were in the hall way day & night which looked terrible. One day there were no face clothes left. When housekeeping was called they came to the room & said they ran out so could leave me one. Unacceptable! For two days the elevators weren't working,so only one very small elevator was servicing the entire hotel.I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. I will never return to this hotel!!!!!!!

The location of this hotel is amazing. Some of the staff have a real attitude problem, particularly those on the check in desk who were rude and unhelpful. Despite emails to the hotel, they have still not returned my 120dollar deposit and ignored my emails.

Walking distance to Times Square. Rooms are small, which is normal for NYC. Rooms have been updated. Staff is helpful. Window A/C is noisey and mattress is too soft. I booked under an advertised deal for about $200 per night including taxes. Area is safe.

Kindness, friendliness, cleaning and perfect position are the right components for a good hotel. The room was always cleaned, the staff very kind and the hotel perfect. If you want to have subway near and be next Times Square, the Gallivant is the perfect solution,

We stayed at this hotel four years ago when it was The Presidents Hotel by Best Western and absolutely loved it. We were so looking forward to returning here for a two night stay. Luckily we knew where it was as there is no signage on the building. There was a small sign in the lobby "The Gallivant" but nothing to indicate we were in the Tryp Hotel that we had booked online. One person was at the desk and even though it was 10 AM she gave us room right away. We had booked a King room. We were given a closet sized room with one double bed. This was unacceptable. Back at the desk, she found us a room with a king sized bed. Luckily I had a printout of my original booking. Odd that there were no other patrons around and we were given our room so early. Our new room was so dreary. (See my photos).Walls and ceiling were painted dark grey, one wall wallpapered with grey and white street map, floor was light grey stick-on plastic made to look like laminate flooring, the view out the window was a brick wall with a fire escape, furniture consisted of one round bistro sized table, the king sized bed, one small battered three drawer dresser, one end table (doesn't work for two people) and one kitchen type chair. The flat screen TV on the wall was good but the coffeemaker didn't work, the headboard on the bed was not wide enough so if you tried to sit in bed to watch TV or read, the pillows fell through the gap behind you. The bathroom was very small with absolutely no counter space (see my photo), the shower was a good size but the glass wall only came half way across so the floor got soaked when you showered. This place feels like a prison. Very depressing. The housekeeping cart and garbage trolley sat in the very dark hallway by the elevators from the time we arrived on Wednesday until we left on Friday. (See my photos- very dark). On the plus side, the bed was comfortable, hotel very quiet, staff was friendly, excellent location close to Times Square and Broadway theatres. We were able to leave our suitcases at $2 per bag in a secure room until our flight and the doorman got us a fixed rate luxury vehicle to the airport. We had stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn at 237 W54 Street our first three nights on points and loved it there. We were excited to once again stay at the hotel at 234 W48 Street for our last two nights. What a huge disappointment. We know where we'll stay next time and it won't be the Tryp/Gallivant.

I have been to NYC many times and I thought it would be nice to stay at the Gallivant Hotel by Time Square. Location was fantastic and rooms were very Clean, however the only fault in the rooms were the walls. It was too thin, I was being woken up every single morning at 6pm by loud chatting or singing. The staff were not approachable, welcoming nor very friendly. When asking for enquires, they seemed the least helpful. I have never experienced such bad hospitality.

This hotel was great. All the staff members were very professional and courteous especially Cassandra and Victor (desk staff) and Syeed (bellman). Rob N. (assistant front officer manager) was extremely nice and courteous. He answered all our questions and made us feel at home. We will definitely be back again and will also recommend this hotel to friends and family. Thank you to all the staff that made our weekend memorable.Andreia G.

Having booked this hotel with Flight Centre ,6 months before we left ,it was then called TRYP Times Square We found for the price we paid it was very ordinary no tea very small and expensive compared to others. Position is really good only around the corner from Times Square but once you get your bearings you could easily booked a better and much cheaper hotel

If all you are looking for is proximity to Broadway and the Theater District, then this is the place for you... There is no arguing, hands down this place has an ideal location and effort has been taken with the decor in the lobby.Aside from that the place is extra average. nothing to write home about. The rooms are quite small, however clean and updated. Walls are paper thin and not insulated against sound at all. The front desk staff was quite taken aback when I actually engaged them for assistance, and it appeared to me they were more taken aback when required to acknowledge my presence... quite unnecessarily pretentious... Interestingly enough, I sat (prior to being assisted and subsequent of having been assisted) and did not witness anyone else being given the semi-condescending attitude i received upon my arrival (I sensed a level of bias. an ordinary person would have been uncomfortable... however Im not your ordinary traveler) Don't get me wrong, they did their job... But I guess I expect more, in the way of service, than just doing ones job.The housekeepers and maintenance staff are quite nice and genuine. They are helpful and attentive.Attention to repair detail should be taken... Sheet rock is exposed in various corners and is pulling away from the wall. (not a basic maintenance issue... Management might have a project on their hands)The restaurants in and around the property are great... again, the hotels proximity to Broadway and the theaters allows for ease of access to all points of interest.In this case, I guess you pay for location. The verdict is out as to weather i would stay again.

My partner and I stayed at TRYP Times Square (now The Gallivant) in May 2016. The hotel is in a great location just off Times Square and near a few subway stations. The room was a great size and was kept clean and the bed was comfortable. We didn't have any issues with noise despite being so close to Times Square. There is a nice bar/restaurant next door and it is quite an easy walk to Central Park (10-15 mins). Rockefeller Centre is located on the same Street about 3 blocks away and is also an easy walk. Overall we loved our stay and would definitely recommend this hotel!

We stayed in the Tryp for 3 days had an excellent time lovely hotel nice staff. Only bad experience was the Ding restaurant we went in there for breakfast and were told we could charge to the room. Half way through breakfast one of the servers who had been walking up and down grumbling all the time we were there came and demanded we pay cash now... We've no problem paying cash but it ruined the experience and they lost a customer because of th way it was done.Not an especially good breakfast and certainly not worth the hassle. We ate out from then and had some really nice food and good atmosphere elsewhere.Hotel great but avoid Dings.

We absolutely loved our stay here as the staff were all very friendly and helpful. We even got an upgrade on the room which was most welcome. The bed and pillows were all super comfy and the room was perfect. Very impressed with the plug socket with European plug also. Great value and the location is just awesome for accessing Times Square and also public transport such as the red tour buses which were just down the road

I loved my time at this hotel. I had a corner room on the 15th floor. Room was the perfect size for one person. Plus the aircondioner worked well. The week I arrived the hotel went through a name change and still had no sign on the exterior. I was impressed with the power board in the room as it had an international socket and USB ports. The hotel is very close to Times Square and the theatre district. The only thing I wasn't keen on was the $2 storage fee per bag once you checked out.

We stayed for 3 nights and had a room with 2 beds. The room size was ok, not very much space in the wardrobe though. We slept very well and could not hear a sound from outside (8th Floor). Fast check-in procedure, Transfer to airport can be booked at the concierge (a little more expensive than super shuttle, but less expensive than a taxi).

SERVICE:So I walked in from another hotel that was 11 blocks away to save time and money in a cab, like all travelers do. It was Sunday, so the front desk wasn't swamped with people. I approached the front desk and was barely greeted by anyone at there, no welcome, nothing... The young lady at front desk told me that she could not find my reservation because I made it 35-40 mins. earlier, tells me she cant check me in until 3pm, and so she picks up the phone (Doesnt bother to tell me where to check my bags, I had to ask... normally they're courteous enough to direct you). So I go to check my bag and was told I had to pay $4... So I go to the ATM that charged me $3.50 fee to take out $10, I come back and begin to hand the bell man the $10 and he THEN asks me if I was checking in or out... I said checking in and he says 'Oh, you don't have to pay'.Really... REALLY?!I came back around 5pm because I figured a ton of people would try to check in at the same time. So, I go up to the front desk, the young lady forgot who I was (as far as the situation) she just looked at me like 'what do you need?' Answer: My room that I paid for...She handed me my keys, no further information about the hotel was given to me and I was seriously pissed. That was crap service. I know its a weekend, a long one at that, but really? ROOM:The room was nice, pretty small. Im literally sitting on a full sized bed in a room the size of my old bedroom at my mothers house but its okay. Very clean wonderfully decorated with the walls showing where great theaters and museums are. Hardwood floors, (They need to replace the very dated iHome radios, and the bathroom comes small but nice.You can hear everything in your room from the the hall and other people's rooms when you're out in the hall. I kept hearing this terrible noise that sounded like a vacuum cleaner was about to explode that I assume came from the door across the hall from my room. Sound is minimal form outside... the only thing you can honestly hear is sirens which you will rarely hear. LOCATION: It's literally down the street from all theaters and Times Square, for those who find themselves easily lost. Tons of great shopping and sightseeing. I would suggest that if you are trying to catch a cab &th or Broadway won't be too great traffic wise. You will be better off going to less congested areas such as 9th Ave. or the W.50s

Booked this hotel for my first visit to NYC because of its proximity to the known tourist zone, modern decor and inexpensive cost. I was prepared for small but the room and the bed was so itty bitty, i'm only 166cm tall and my feet were hanging off the end. There was no room to wheel out the chair and even sit at the desk. No refrigerator for supermarket bought cold drinks, breakfasts or snacks.
