The room was always too warm from central heating and the in window air-con unit rattled all night long but still didn't dampen the constant traffic, horns and fire engine sirens from outside. Our room had a great view of the flashing m&ms sign in times square but after a few sleepless nights and exploring the city I wished we had booked somewhere less touristy and more cosmopolitan.

No name on exterior because it turned over just last week. Seems to be an older hotel (very small rooms) that was flipped by Omni, but they did a nice job. All new finishes and fixtures, comfy bed, real thermostat for a/c, and lots of hangers.Checkin was smooth, friendly, and efficient. Right in the heart of the theater district and 2 blocks from subway. Size is sac rices, but the reward is location. Pricing is typical for NYC. I'd stay here again .

Stayed in NY for 3 days in early May 2016. TRYP is a very good Hotel in a great location - walking distance to Penn Station, Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, Times Square, the Theatre District, great little Restaurants nearby as well and a great Bar called Hurley's pretty much next door was an added bonus too - it's also close to Subway Train Stations too. Small rooms - but as far as I can gather it's pretty much par for the course for NY City hotels. Anyway the room was nicely furnished, warm - the weather was very cold and wet for most of our 3 days sadly, but we still had a great time. The bed was comfy and the best pillows I've ever used - am trying to source these pillows - that's how good they were! The room was clean - small bathroom - only room for one person at a time - but clean and good supply of hot water in the shower and great water pressure too. Quiet room too - we were on a high floor that overlooked 48th St and surprisingly it was quiet. All Of the Staff were very pleasant and helpful. Well priced too for USA. Would definitely stay here again.

Property is nice but there is no public areas in the hotel. The rooms are small but nicely decorated. The AC units don't work well! Bathrooms are very small. The property is in prime position next to Times Square.

Right in the middle of Times Square! Lovely small hotel with good service and perfect location if you are visiting NYC in the holidays! Close to many restaurants, theaters and subway stations. They change our rooms from a king bed to a double room since we were traveling with children at no extra charges. Would definitely come back!

TRYP is a great dinky hotel in a prime location that won't break the bank. You are round the corner from the chaos of Times Square. Despite the close proximity, the hotel is surprisingly quiet.The room itself is small, but has everything you need for your stay. The bed and pillows were super comfy. Overall you can't be disappointed with this hotel. The staff are friendly and efficient, lobby is trendy with plenty of seats, room is clean and it's a great central base.

We stayed at the Tryp for 6 nights back in October. It was our first time visiting New York so the location was perfect for us. We were pleasantly surprised when we checked into our room on the 10th floor and found it was a corner room with a patio. The room was bright, clean and spacious. The bathroom is small and shower design could be better (a flood of water on the floor is unavoidable), but this is a minor complaint. There is a fire station on the corner, so you will hear it quite often. This didn't bother us as we live on a busy street and are used to the noisy, but if you are easily bothered by noise you might want to bring ear plugs. The elevators are small and slow...another minor complaint I could look past because of the great price and location. Housekeeping staff was friendly and always made sure we had everything we needed. Biggest plus goes to their honest and helpful staff. My fiance had dropped his wallet in the hallway and did not realize it until the morning. In a panic, we searched everywhere and finally decided to let the front desk know in case someone turned it in. As soon as we stepped off the elevator, they recognized him and said they had been trying to get in touch with him all morning. A staff member had found it on the floor and turned it in with everything in tact. I made the reservation so they didn't have his contact info on file, but had tried to contact him via the number on a business card in his wallet. Thank you to the Tryp staff for making our first visit to New York a great one!

Booked this hotel according to the reviews that I had read and unfortunately was not what I was expecting. New York hotels are expensive enough as it is and for the price that we paid for our stay we were quite disappointed. We booked a deluxe room-the size of the room was good but cannot say the same for the cleanliness. We found crumbs on the couch-the floor was extremely dirty-bathroom was not clean so it left to wonder if the room had been serviced before we arrived. Needless to say we had to have the room cleaned again. Also as one reviewer commented-very noisy-construction was going on right beside the hotel. Granted it is close to Times Square

This is a very good hotel especially if you are planning on visiting the sites and most likely spending minimal time in the hotel. The lobby is welcoming and modern with friendly staff. The bathroom / shower is one of the best I've ever used (and I have a high standard when it comes to showers). The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. It was maintained well (leave the maids a tip, its only fair) and had the usual facilities. The location of the hotel is good, just minutes from Times Square and next door to the excellent Hurley's Bar. It could do with another lift as they were small and busy at times but I suppose this is what most NY hotels experience. Finally the room windows don't cancel out all the street noise but this is a budget to mid range hotel so you can't complain and it wasn't significantly noisy. I managed to sleep well despite being in the city that never sleeps. Great hotel, would stay again. (Note: they have just ended their association with Wyndham)

First location was great. That is about the only good thing I can say about this hotel.1. Paid $928.78 for a three night stay, about $309. a night and we over looked air conditions on many ugly roof tops. Also they advertise Mini bars, Keurig coffee makers and King or Queen beds in your room. Dream on we had a double bed and a tiny old coffee maker and no mini bar. Just so very disappointed!!2. My husband went down to the consigliere to get us tickets to a show, knowing we would pay a little extra by letting them get tickets for us, but we figured they knew what they were doing.He got tickets to Jersey Boys (which was a great show). We paid $296. for 2 tickets ( ticket prices had been marked thru with black marker on our tickets??). The little English girl,( blonde had accent) told him they were orchestra seats, well guess what they were up about 5 flights of steps in mezzanine no Orchestra seats. So do not get tickets through TRYP Hotel.3. FYI always use Yellow cab to and from airport. They are only about $35.00 plus tip, compared to black sedans or mini vans which run $50.00 plus tip.4. Had great dinner after show at Carnegie Deli, matzo ball soup was delicious and hot pastrami sandwich was mouth watering. Pigalle Restaurant had great Eggs Benedict and Bagles and lox.I will definitely come back to New York, love the intensity and the hustle and bustle, but will not stay in a Wyndham, nor will I recommend to any friends planning a trip to New York. Hope I have been some help to first time travelers to New York.Thank you for allowing me to voice my opinions.Gayle Broachgaylebroach@ aol.com

Stayed here for 5 nights in May, just before it changed to a new name and new owners. Yes, the room size was a standard New York shoebox, but it was clean and modern. Staff were friendly too. our room was on the 15th floor towards the back, still really noisy so definitely recommend ear plugs if you're a light sleeper. Close to Times Square and subways to get around and walks to Central Park and other locations also doable

Spent 4 nights here and have no complaints at all. The staff were friendly, the room was clean, lovely shower and comfy bed. It might not be huge rooms but visiting from the UK they seemed to be around the size of an average Travelodge. I didn't expect a large room with it being Manhattan. The bathroom is small but as I wasn't planning on throwing a party in there then it wasn't a problem. The walk in shower was great, does splash a bit but put down a towel and it's fine.The location was perfect, Times Square at the end of the street, bars, diners and restaurants, shops and Penn Station and Port Authority transport hub a short walk away.It is noisy, but being in the city that never sleeps I expected that, and took earplugs which worked a treat. We caught the Airtrain from inside JFK to Jamaica Station then the E train subway to Port Authority and a short walk to the hotel. It took about an hour and cost $7.50 or so. Easy and cheap.If I come back to NYC then I would definitely stay here again.

Location is great and rooms were okay could have been cleaner though. We were right next to the air conditioning unit so was a little noisy. The safe did not work and someone came straightaway to sort which was great. The shower handle was off the wall when we arrived but it did work once I attached it and was a good shower.We asked about a taxi on check out to be told the bell boys would call one however when we went back they advised we would have to get one ourself. Also it took over 20 mins to get our luggage.Overall was ok and would have been better if cleaner.

Great Hotel Breakfasts very good buffet style so plenty for everybody very clean, friendly staff except for Victor, one of the receptionist we arrived at the hotel booked in and in all of our 5 days in the big apple he was the rudest person he was abrupt, unwelcoming and rude we really thought oh boy hope it gets better and of course it did it was fab but Tryp management please send Victor on a customer care course because he definitely is the wrong person to be on reception shame he is the first impression of an otherwise great hotel ...... when you are the first port of call you can't have a bad day hence the overall rating had to be marked down

We stayed for 3 nights in May 2016. We had a comfortable king size bed. Our room was clean but small. The bathroom was clean but also small. Free wifi.Location is excellent - closed to all amenities, subway stations, Times Square and several theaters. The neighborhood is noisy. You can hear the sirens from police cars, fire dept trucks or ambulance going on all night. You can also hear the noise from big commercial vehicles.Breakfast is expensive. There was not enough room for the guests. Some are having their breakfast in the registration lobby.Service is very good. Staff is friendly and accommodating. We will stay there again.

I've stayed at this hotel twice while I was in town for a night. Both times I had a fantastic stay. The hotel was one block from the theater we saw Book of Mormon at. Very good location a block from Time Square and you couldn't beat the rate for a night in Manhattan! I will definitely stay there again on my next rip to the city! Only negative was we had trouble finding our car in the parking garage they valeted it in, not very good directions, it took us a while to find. I suggest giving better directions to guests next time someone needs to get to their car.

Lovely and clean. The room was perfect sized for 2 of us. We had everything we needed and the price was not bad. The location of the hotel is its best feature. Just a 20 min walk from Penn station. The staff could have been a little more friendly. I was expecting a big American welcome but got a sharp guy instead. We never got time to try the hotel food so I can't comment.Walking out of the hotel onto time square was my favourite.If you have never been to new York plan plan plan. I managed to see 10 main attractions in just 4 days. We were shattered lol.

hotel was right off times square, very handy for first time in NYC. alot of people complained about noise but i expected it to much busier at night as it is NYC & we had a front facing room with a balcony & it was not noisy at all. room was perfect size for two people. clean tidy, bathroom perfect. bed was extremely comfortable. Staff were very helpful if needed help or advice on anything. I would return.

My best friend and i stayed here during the week for a girls night. Absolutely LOVED this place. Clean room, comfy bed, lovely staff, and perfect location. The room wasn't very big, but they utilized what space they did have perfectly. Next time I'm in the city this is where I'll be staying. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

This hotel is right next to Times Square. It was extremely easy to get around from and see the sites. We felt safe and the room the 4 of us shared was huge with loads of space for our suitcases . Being 4 girls we needed the space. The room service cleaned up after us every day bless them. There was 1 huge bed and 2 large bunk beds all very comfortable ample wardrobe space too. We really enjoyed our time here. The hotel was very clean and the staff curtious . Even to us coming in late most nights and sleeping till late in the day. We didn't eat in the hotel as such, but there is an adjoining restaurant, Thai food we ate there twice in our 10 day stay, food was good . I d stay here again if visiting with friends. At first I wanted an apartment and didn't like the thought of not having enough privacy but the room was so large we didn't feel at all crowded highly recommend for friends. We are all in our late 30 s early 40s and we here for 10 nights . It was just the location and comfort that we needed for a stay in NYC . Location was perfect . I cannot think of anything bad to say. I think it's a 4 star hotel, we were just interested in good clean central space and this hotel was perfect. Btw take the free ferry ride to see the Statue of Liberty it gets so close that I don't think the tours are worth it. We enjoyed that immensely .

You couldn't find a better location. We came into Penn Station on the train, and it was a quick taxi ride to the hotel. We could also have walked it (close to a mile) but had our luggage, etc. Also very easy access to the subway. Just a couple blocks from Times Square.The hotel is really tiny - lobby, elevators, hallways, rooms, shower - but comfortable and with a friendly, helpful staff. It's worth it to buy the breakfast, and good to start the day off fed and ready to go. There's a nice Japanese restaurant right off the lobby; we stopped for a late night snack after the theater. I'd go back.

Just returned after 4 nights staying here and can't really complain at all. Yes the room was small but you're in NYC, you're not staying here to stay in your room all day!Room was clean, comfortable, bed a good size and bathroom was modern with a good shower. Staff were pleasant and helpful and the hotel was well presented. The only 2 downsides were the hotel bar wasn't open during our stay and the lifts are very small. We were on the 10th floor and sometimes the wait for a lift was a good 5-10 minutes. However, this did not bother us too much.Overall, this is a great hotel 2 minutes walk from Times Square and Hells Kitchen with everything you could want on your doorstep. Would definitely stay again.

To say that I am disappointed is an understatement. We booked a deluxe queen room at a cost of almost $300 for 1 night and there was nothing deluxe about the room nor was it even a queen size bed! I doubt the room was more than 150 sq ft total! When I questioned the front desk we were basically dismissed and pushed to the side. The front desk person would only repeat my system says it’s a queen. No one ever thought to come check the room (because computers at Tryp are 100% right all the time I guess) Our tv never worked properly and after it was “fixed” it turned on and off by itself. I actually had to unplug the TV! Our shower never got hot water…it would get to a luke warm but never actually hot and the shower leaked all over the bathroom! The A/C struggled all night long to keep the room cool so it was turning on and off every 15 minutes which made it almost impossible to sleep. The cleaning staff filled the elevators all day with cleaning supplies, dirty laundry, garbage and themselves instead of using the very large service elevator. One trip from the lobby to the 12h floor took almost 30 minutes between waiting for the elevator and stopping to either drop off or pick up staff and supplies at every single floor!! It made you think twice about making a trip downstairs because it took so long to get an elevator! But honestly the worst part of the entire stay was the noise! From hearing the garbage pickup at 3am 12 floors below us to the constant slamming doors all night long to walls so thin I could hear simple conversations in the hallway not only on my floor but the floor above and below as well as someone nearby having sex @ 3am! We got such little sleep in this hotel that I am now sick. I can honestly say I have had better experiences at Days Inn!!

I chose this hotel by accident. My intentions were to book the location on 35th St, which had a much higher rating at the time, so I was expecting the worst. With that said, I wasn't so disappointed with my stay at this location.Cons:The room was small, but I hear that's typical of NYC hotels. Aside from the closet, there was no additional storage space, which made the room feel even more cramped for two people. Nightstands with drawers would have been nice. Our remote was broken. We had to hold it together in a very specific way every time we wanted to use it.There's really no shower door, so water got all over the bathroom floor. The water pressure is actually really good, but you can't even enjoy it. Pros:The room was clean.The bed was comfortable and larger than I expected. The room was quiet. We stayed in 326. I heard doors slamming a couple of times, but that was it. There was no outside noise. Housekeeping staff was really nice. They actually called our room to ask if we wanted them to come in. We stayed on Pacific Time, so we slept late most mornings, and they were pretty nice about working around our schedule.The front desk and restaurant staff were nice.The LOCATION is so convenient. I was a little worried about getting around, but the hotel was close to transportation, and a lot of the things we needed were within walking distance, including Duane Reade, restaurants in Hell's Kitchen, Times Square, theaters, and the subway.Overall, the hotel has some flaws, but it worked pretty well for us, mainly because of the location. I would consider staying there again.

Don't listen to the moaners this hotel is great location 2 minutes from Times Square Cleaned every day and tea and coffee replaced every dayStaff friendlyRooms great as we were given a family room just for the 2 of usTry tonic bar the food is great cheaper too

Excellent location, just 3-4 minutes walk to Times Square, close to subway station, Hell Kitchen.... everything you could ask for your holiday. The room is a bit small and the air-conditioning made so much noise. But in general, super satisfied during my stay.

You can't fault the location for being near Times Square and the theatres etc. However we found the staff unhelpful at best. Check in was a nightmare in the small, narrow congested lobby. The room is a good size for New York but the bathroom is poorly designed. The glass shower screen isn't long enough so the bathroom gets soaked (although the water pressure is great). However the bright white image you get online and on the booking wasn't what we ended up with. The walls were brown the ceiling was grey and it was all a bit dark and dreary. WARNING - If you are a light sleeper stay somewhere else! With the fire station next door and the pub on the other side the noise is very loud! Couple that with the constant slamming of doors in the hotel by the house keeping in the morning. This is not the place for a peaceful stay!This hotel relies on it's location but there are other hotels with the same location that give you a nicer stay. It's not awful it's just not great.

The room was tiny, and the bathroom was also annoyingly tiny, but the room had a balcony, which was neat. The location of the hotel can't be beat. Breakfast was expensive at $16.50/person, providing all the same stuff that's often free at continental breakfasts at many hotels. The place was clean in general, but the room wasn't ready on time and wasn't attended to during our stay. The elevators are tiny. Our room had a wall air-conditioner that needed to be plugged in. Bed was a twin - my feet stuck off the bottom, but was comfy. However, again, the location was incredible.

Although we read a few poor reviews, we were EXTREMELY happy with our week-long stay at the TRYP, and will continue to stay here when we visit NYC! The staff was very helpful and was able to accommodate our requests. We stayed in a higher floor and LOVED the view! The location was close to several subway stations, which was great for sight-seeing. It is down the street from the Hershey's store in Times Square, so it's a close walk, but far enough from the noise of Times Square.We read several complaints about the noise and slow elevators. There is a fire station down the street, but good luck finding a spot in the city where you won't hear sirens. The noise did not keep us up at night, as some others had mentioned. We only had an issue with the elevator when we checked in, and that is only because there were at least eight parties checking in at the same time. Overall, great location and friendly staff! We'll definitely be returning :)

Our first time to New York, the Tryp Hotel is in a great position to get to all the things you want to see. The hotel rooms are quite small, but I think most rooms are in Manhattan. We only really just used it to get changed and sleep in as there is so much to see and do in New York. Good little hotel.

This was a small room. Basic but a great location. The gym was a good addition. We probably saw the hotel room only to sleep which was fine. We thought it was worth saving the money by staying here rather than paying for a more luxurious hotel. We're glad we did because it served a purpose. There is so much to do in New York both day and night. A very small bathroom but bed comfortable. Noisy air conditioning. Great location which was the reason we chose here.

This hotel is in the perfect location if you are planning to hang around Midtown. It's just off the beaten path enough that you don't feel swamped up by Times Square. The hotel is lovely looking and the staff very friendly and accommodating. I stayed for 3 nights while attending a workshop and was rarely in my room but to sleep and shower. My room was super tiny and was trying so hard to be cooler than it was. Weird things like flickering lights in the horribly lit tiny bathroom and the shower handle falling off made me chuckle at how the "high end" features like a motion sensor bathroom fan seemed unnecessary when some of the more everyday items were so needing an upgrade. If you aren't planning on spending a lot of time in your room (which why should you if you are in NYC!) then this hotel is perfect and decently priced. Even with the little off items I would still stay there again!

I'd like to give this location a better rating however on my 5 night stay 1 saw 2 cocaroaches. This hotel is centrally located near Times Square. Rooms are small but comfortable, bed is very comfortable! Slept great! Was given an "upgrade" which was no upgrade at all. There was a gym machine shoved in the corner of a regular sized room. The big bummer was when the first morning I saw a tiny roach in the bathroom. I quickly killed it and hoped there would be any more. All was good until the last morning I saw a much bigger roach on the bedroom floor. Hotel looked clean, housekeeping cleaned everyday.... unfortunate situation.

I got a good deal for my room here, I usuallwould not stay in Times Square and especially for how close it is I was very worried about the noise. The room was small but nice and so quiet I was impressed. The location is very convenient to subways etc and theatres.

The best thing about this hotel is the location - that was great! Staff were polite but not friendly, rooms and baths were small, which isn't all that unusual in Manhattan but these were ridiculously small. You can hardly turn around in the bathroom and with no shower doors, the floor was soaked after every shower no matter how you tried to aim the shower head. Not what I expected from a Wyndham property.

I will recommend this property. Location-location-location. Rooms are small & bathrooms are almost ridiculously small. I kept hitting my elbow when trying to comb my hair. I'm only 5'5" tall. Alarm clock had incorrect time on it & required a maintenance man to set it. Bureau drawer wouldn't stay shut & required a maintenance man to repair it. My room cards had to be reset 3 times during my 4 night stay & hall phone didn't work for me to call for help. That meant several elevator rides to the lobby to get rooms keycards replaced. Location is above a Fire House so lots of sirens at all hours....but it is Manhattan. Wyndham should spend a little money on repairs. All hotels in Manhattan are expensive this was no exception. I would stay here again.

This was my second time in this property. Ben Ellie, the director of Rooms and Tricia at the front desk specifically were a true spirit of a world class hospitality.I can't forget about the rest of the employees, they were very hospitable and kind too.The location is outstanding, few blocks away, you simply have the best choices of restaurants, shows and nightlife.I definitely recommend this hotel for new visitors or even for the big apple connoisseur.Thank you very much for this great experience.

Too small rooms, and a bit dirty as well. For this price I excepted more. Location are perfect, but a motel 6 looks has more space and looks cleaner. The bed for two people very small.So next time I try an other hotel.

Confortable room, nice bed and clean bathroom. Very well located. Two blocks away from broadway. One block away from the subway. Shops and restaurants around. One point minus on the attitude from some of the guys at the front desk. Breakfast is ok but expensive and simple. I would comeback to this hotel.

Booked this hotel because it was very affordable compared to a lot of others in Times Square. It is just a small boutique hotel but it is right in the middle of Times Square. Perfect location! Checked in and got a room straight away. Our first room we were given was really small but we then got moved as our mattress was on a slope. They straight away had us moved to a better room without any fuss & offered us free breakfast. Our 2nd room was a lot more spacious! Rooms are really nice and all you need while in NYC! I liked that the lobby had lemon water at all times for people to help themselves to.

A small, but perfectly formed and comfortable room in an extremely desirable location. The staff were great, as were the amenities and facilities and located '"smack bang" in the middle of New York's Theatre district. Due to the Tryp's location in one of the world's busiest cities, it could get noisy, but it's a small price to pay to be in the heart of it all.

The location is about all this hotel has going for it. When I travel to NYC, I expect to have a certain amount of exterior noise to deal with because it's NYC - garbage cans, honking, sirens, etc. What I was not prepared for at this location was being adjacent to a club/bar that was playing loud music until 2:30am. My room also suffered from cooking odors from that same place - breakfast and dinner. As for the interior of the hotel, I find it off-putting that housekeeping left a minimum of 2 bins in the hallway right next to the elevator, crowding the hallway and creating an eyesore. I saw on my side of the elevators three of these bins at one point. The bins are canvas linen bags on a metal frame that are about 2 ft x 2 ft. Some seemed to be used to collect used towels and linens during the housekeeping rounds, and another maybe trash. The perplexing part is why they had to keep at least 1 out all day - to collect guest trash? For such a small space, it's ridiculous. I also requested a late checkout from the night manager because I was kept awake with the music, and I never got a confirmation it was approved. Instead, I got an early morning wake up call I did not request. I will not be coming back to this hotel, despite their apologies and the concession they gave me on my bill.

Visited in April 2016. Family room with 2 queen size beds. Very nice and spacey room with comfortable beds coffee maker and small desk. Nice bathroom with everything you need. Possible to store bags before and after check in. Friendly staff.

Great location in the musical heart of New York City. All venues easy to access. Bell man was very good to arrange transportation in the city and to the airport. Great guy!Downside:We slept above the fire station and that was a bit too much noise. We had a family room, but not a lot of storage in the room and bathroom.

This is a quaint boutique hotel in the midst of Times Square. The location is superb. Hopefully our room was unique in the fact that the aroma of mildew was overwhelming. The bed was comfortable and clean but the bathroom needs a good scrub down. The staff was friendly and accommodating.

It's Times Square... All rooms are small! This was a lovely place, everything we needed for a short break! Coffee maker, hair dryer,safe, iron! Staff were helpful, location is central close to everything Clean and tidy! Excellent. Would recommend the big bus tour

Travelled as a group of lads to NYC for St Patricks Day.This hotel was in a perfect location in Times Square. We ended up in a family room, (2 double beds and a set of bunk beds), but there was plenty of space. The room was clean and modern. The staff were very polite (when they could understand us!) and extremely helpful too. There's a great pub next door - Hurleys. Obviously there was lots to do in the area, and it felt very safe almost all the time. (McDonalds in Times Sq at about 3am should be avoided though!)I'd recommend this hotel to a family or group without hesitation. My one gripe - the lifts were pretty slow, which is a pretty minor complaint to be fair

The whole hotel is an exotic place, great bar with music. every room has an unique decoration that make you fell in an other universe. Not so romantic, but at least funny and enjoyable. The room is realy smal, but you are next time square, so it worth.

You are paying for the location, 48th Street, Just off Times Sq. and smack in the middle of Broadway. The rooms are tiny, But how much time are you going to spend in the room anyway ?The bathroom even smaller; our shower curtain smelled moldy and the shower drain was problematic. The lobby gets congested when guests are departing and arriving, and there is a queue for the "tiny" elevator. That said, the location is fantastic. WifI was on point. I probably won't stay here again, but it wasn't a complete disaster.My average rating seems a bit low, but I can't say it was very good either. New York is loud where ever you go, but there is a fire station at the corner. So expect some noise

I have been to New York several times, and the room was a very good size for New York. The staff was very accommodating in getting us checked in early which was nice. If you need them to hold your bags, there is a charge of 2.00 per bag. We had to wait at least 10 minutes to get our bags back since the bellman was no where to be found. Other team members were not helpful in getting him. Another guest ended of finding him out front. Then the bellman tried to give me something that was not mine. The location is great.
The room was clean and the staff was great. We will go back. Location fit our area in which we planned to go to the theater.

Spent one night here with my wife for a night in Manhattan. I thought it was fantastic. The location could not be beat. Its a Manhattan boutique hotel in time square. The only con I have is that the elevator can get crowded.

This hotel is in a very good Times Sq location and if you care about the service you can stay there. One of the Front Desk person named Sunny has a extremely terrible attitude. I stopped by the front desk to kindly ask for a small request to see if they can find anything that I left behind when I stayed there last weekend, but Sunny gave me the worst attitude I ever experienced in the service industry with her extremely impatient and impolite discriminating high pitch tone. I understand it's in the morning and she seems to be multi tasking because I'm a hotel front desk manager myself. Perhaps she was in bad mood with little training, or perhaps she is the manager or the director of the hotel so she thinks she can treat guest like that. Seriously she shouldn't even be in the hospitality industry and no wonder this hotel ranked over 300 at trip advisor

This hotel is awful, especially the bathroom. The bathroom has a sink, toilet, and shower, all in a line from right to left. Fine. I go to NY frequently and am used to small rooms and small bathrooms. But this one was the worst. You can actually sit on the toilet, touch 3 of the walls, and come within about 6-8 inches of touching the 4th wall. Think about this. You can always touch the wall behind you, so that one isn't a negative. You can then reach with your left arm, over the sink, and touch the wall to the left. Yes, the sink and its pedestal is smaller than the length of your arm. You can then reach in front and put your hand square on the wall in front of you. You don't even need to stretch. You reach to the right, through the shower, and you are about 6-8 inches from the 4th wall.Next time you find yourself doing your business, stretch your hand out to the left, in front, and to the right and think of that (+ 6-8 inches on the right side) being the size of your bathroom while on vacation.The only wall you can't touch is on the right where the shower is. The shower is bad too. It's a walk in (fine, I prefer that), with a partial wall separating it from the rest of the bathroom. But the wall isn't even close to long enough to keep the entire bathroom floor being SOAKED. Every time you use the shower, seriously the entire floor gets soaked. There was one good thing about the bathroom. They had special defogging mirrors which worked quite nicely. There's a switch that you flip that will defog the mirror quickly. That was nice.The rest of the room wasn't any better. It had everything you need (bed, table, alarm clock, TV) but nothing you don't. No dresser or drawers, no fridge, no storage. There was a small power strip on the table so that you could charge without hunting for an outlet (that was nice).But otherwise the room looked like a 19 year old guy's apartment. Barren. It had pergo/laminate floors, which my husband hated. I didn't care about the floors but wanted to mention that too.Location was good, and lobby was fine. But seriously, there are a thousand better hotels to stay in.

Very small room but that was expected. Had everything I needed and the location was superb. The staff were great. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends. The Pub next door was great and the pastry/ coffee shop across the road was excellent.

Good pricing for NYC, room is very small but who stays in the room while in NYC.Double (single beds) comfortable room, bathroom very small, think tow times the size of a port-a-potty but functional. Shower only.

We stayed at the hotel for four nights. Quick check in and polite staff. we were located on the 11th floor. Room had everything we needed, large bed including plenty of towels, hair dryer and toiletries. They have a USB connected in the room to charge your phone, so no need to fuss with connectors. No problems during our stay, the only concern to other people might be the noise from outside, but your in central New York, so it isn't going to be quiet. The radiator / air conditioning unit is noisy, but is easily switched off at the wall. As a first timer to New York this was perfectly located to explore all the sights. Would I stay again, probably not as we found another area of Manhattan that we would like to explore, but we would definitely recommend it to family and friends

Location, location, location. The Tryp has it all! Just around the corner and you'll see all the lights of Times Square. Metro station within a few blocks and a diverse kind of eateries around you. I'm not a big fan of TGIF, Olive Garden and such, but if you do, go and enjoy it! Back to the hotel, I must say I was surprise because I read a lot of mixed reviews, but in my experience, it all worth it. As I said before, location is great but the staff at the Tryp deserves all hands down, especially Sunny, always smiling and helping my friends at any request in Spanish because they're not English fluently speakers. We had a minor issue with our staying at the very beginning because our room wasn't ready, we booked a familiar suite and because of the high demand there were no vacancy. Cassandra helped a lot with our room, she got us a room with an extra bed, free breakfast because of the inconvenience and our room ready for the day after. I really appreciated how front desk managed this minor issue. Speaking of flaws, I must say there were so few, mostly maintenance stuff such as the bath room door wasn't working to well, the a/c was a little bit noisey and the remote he to be changed batteries two times. Despite of all the minor flaws, I must recommend this hotel if you want to go to NY with your friends. We really enjoyed our stay at the Tryp.

I booked this TRYP by accident, thinking it was the newer hotel. Our room was perfect! The staff was friendly and accommodating. Although we arrived hours early, we were able to check in right away. Hotel location was great-one block from the heart of Time Square. Room was clean and comfortable. And the price was great for New York.

We stayed in TRYP for 6 nights in late march/early april to celebrate a special birthday. The location is amazing! At the end of the street is times square, a 20 minute walk from central park, and has 2 very close metro stations making the while city accessible!BUT...For paying a fair amount of $ per night, you don't get a lot. The rooms are small and worst of all dark. The bathroom was tiny, you couldn't open the door and be in it without being squashed! And the shower made the whole (tiny) room soaking wet! The lighting in the room was super harsh under the lights but the room was dim and dark (a nightmare for any woman trying to do makeup/hair!).Our room was also right next to the flagpoles on the front of the building. The flags were collapsed and we kept getting woken up by it hitting the window throughout the night! Also, just around the corner is a fire engine station!!!!! I know the city is known for its sirens and honking cars but be warned, they are very loud and go day and night! Don't bother adding breakfast to your package- we had a complimentary breakfast and I am so glad we didn't have to pay! It's in the smallest space, the smallest collection of food and super disorganised!Also, the hotel STANK of weed the whole time we were there!Overall, not the best hotel in the world in terms of value for money, a good night sleep or customer service, but can't fault the location.

My week long visit the last week in March was nice. Yes, the rooms were small, but comfortable. I loved the breakfasts and the cleanliness. I must commend the staff for their assistance. I found myself stuck when my ride didn't come for me and a bit out of sorts as I had not had any knowledge of NYC, however, the staff was knowledgeable,and a very kind gentleman ,tall, dark and handsome, assisted me with a cab and advice on how best to get out to Long Island, where some of my relatives were, I didn't get the man's name, but I am very grateful. The front desk staff was always kind to me and our crew from the Bahamas. Enjoyable hotel, quite nice.

The room was great, the location perfect & the staff very helpful! Right in the heart of Times Square. Only thing is I wish the shower had a door or curtain to prevent the water from getting on the floor. But will definitely spending another night there .

Just returned from a 5 night stay of which we spent in 3 different rooms- first room stank of fried oil (low floor and over a reprise any extractor), 2nd room located on floor 10 facing 48th street (so noisy it's impossible to sleep), final room on 15th floor and located at rear of hotel so fine although all rooms have the worst aircon ever- the rooms are so hot even though it was cold outside. The first 2 bathrooms were so small you couldn't get to the sink with the door open. I have been to NYC many times and never come across a bathroom this tiny! The location is great if you are looking to go to Times Square/theatre all the time, but in my opinion, once you've been there once there's no need to go ahead. As I had made the hotel aware that this was a special trip I would of expected some sort of apology/deduction in room rate on check out due to the 3 room changes, however the staff were unfriendly and uninterested. As people have mentioned- paying to store your bags seems a bit of a rip off even if it is only $2 per bag! (Note for all the Brits- don't feel you have to tip because the Americans say so- a tip is recognition of good service! I find it insulting that the general public are expected to tip to subsidise poor wages even if they have not received service worth tipping!) I certainly wouldn't recommend this hotel if you want to sleep at night or are looking for something nice for a special occasion!

We stayed in a queen room for 6 nights. When we arrived to check in the check in was very fast but the receptionist was far from welcoming. She didnt seem to care at all and I found her to be rude.The room itself was a decent size but the bathroom was tiny but functional. We had a room overlooking the main street and it was way too noisy at night as we were very close to Times square. We had to use earplugs to sleep every night.The lighting was terrible in the room even though there were lots of lights in the room!The window in the room was drafty and you could feel the cold!You have to pay $2 dollars per bag if you want to store your bags on check out. We have never been to a hotel where we had to pay for storing bags!The staff definitely need some training in customer services. One young lady at reception was lovely but she was the only one. The staff just didnt seem interested in guests. We did not feel at all welcome at the hotel and therefore we did not interact with the staff much.On the day of check out, a lady from housekeeping knocked on our door at 9.45am and asked what time we were leaving! I said I dont know checkout is at 12. This was ridiculous, we have never experienced this in a hotel before.Stay elsewhere, somewhere quieter. Once you have visited Times square you dont need to go back as it is tailored for tourists - expensive restaurants and pushy sales people trying to sell you bus tours, shows etc. You can easily get everywhere on the subway.

Can't even get a bootle of water here!! Went to vending machines on two floors! Front Desk say's I'm being unreasonable in wanting water!! TV doesn't work! What a dump!! I would never recommend this dump to anyone! .

My wife is in a wheelchair and we needed a hotel that would fully accommodate her needs. We contacted TRYP because it was close to Time Square, and advertised it had wheelchair accessible rooms. I even called to verify the accommodations. After checking in, we went to the elevator but found it was too small to fit a normal sized wheelchair. We were directed to the larger service elevator, but it did not open. I asked the desk and they had to get someone to activate the elevator, When we finally got to the room, we found that the room was very small. The toilet was next to the sink with no bars and with no room to get a wheelchair in between. The shower was a walk-in but very small as well. I went back down stairs to let the receptionist (Adelina) know that this was unacceptable. She found another so called accessible room, but when I went in it was even less accommodating then the first one. With my wife wondering what was going on, I went back down to the front desk and let the receptionist know that this was not acceptable. She then told me that they could put us into one of the suites. However, when I went up to look at the suite, it had no wheelchair accommodations. We ended up with nothing. Adelina said that she was sorry, but clearly this hotel is misrepresenting itself when it states they have wheelchair accessible rooms. The front desk was not very helpful in trying to make amends by helping us find another hotel in the area. Fortunately, we found another hotel that had what we needed, but this was totally unnecessary. I am writing this so no one else has to go through this experience.

For everyone who has complained about this hotel, get a life, maybe New York is not the place for you. Who books a hotel that is about 100 metres from the edge of Times Square and then complains about the noise?Firstly the reception staff, only dealt with them when booking in and out and both times were done politely and effortlessly. All staff were courteous when passing. Rooms were cleaned every day, the corridors and reception area were spotless, elevators were regular. Beds were comfortable, wi fi, safes, iron and board and tea/coffee maker in rooms. Good hot showers with good water pressure. Ice/water/vending machines on three floors.Our room was at the back of the hotel and although not annoying or intrusive there was a distant hum of traffic. My son had a room at the front and said it was also not too bad. He said the flags at the front of the hotel were a bit noisy but not off putting. After touring about the city all day there should be no problem sleeping anyway. A fire station is situated about 100 metres from the hotel and the NYFD like to blast their sirens and horns when coming out but that was never a problem.Overall l've now been to New York four times now and don't think l will go back again but if l did l would certainly stay at the TRYP Times Square again and would have no problem recommending it to anyone. This hotel is a gem situated centrally for everything. Subways two minutes walk either side.Feel free to ask me any questions.

As others have said, the rooms are small and the bathrooms are miniscule. However, assuming that you aren't going to NYC to stay in your room, they are perfectly fine. The location is outstanding - so close to the theaters! One night I went by myself and walked back to the hotel at 11 pm and felt very safe. It's also close walking distance to great restaurants and other attractions. The hotel itself has been updated and was very clean. We especially appreciated Robert (Astronomy) who checked us in, helped us with a room change, and then inquired how our visit was going when we saw him two days later. He is a real asset.

I have very mixed feelings about this hotel. On one hand it's amazing. The location is perfect, the room was a decent size for NYC and it was modern with a really good shower. The room was clean and the housekeeping team did a fast and thorough service each day.However, on the other hand, the reception staff were not particularly polite or welcoming and I couldn't believe we were charged $2 a bag to leave our luggage after we had checked out. The biggest problem though was the noise. We had a room on the second floor and barely got any sleep. The first night the occupants of the room opposite forgot their key and spent 30 mins arguing about it at 4:00am. They then put their radio on and spent 10 mins tuning it in. We had two nights where the hotel (or bar) behind played their music till 5:30am. The other big problem we had was smoke. We couldn't work out whether it was from outside or from a different room but on our last two nights the smell of cigarettes kept wafting into our room - again this continued past 5:00am.I think I would return as it was reasonably priced and the location couldn't have been better however I would want to be located a lot higher up than floor two.

Made last minute booking on H2N but front desk failed to find booking. Then agent pushed me aside for other guests. Then some other undefined emergency erupted. Not knowing if or when the Agent could accommodate me I looked into other alternatives. Having secured same I left. When I informed H2N they refused to refund me. Beware of H2N bookings.

Long story short, the room is super small, the front desk lady was rude, the bathrub was clogged so taking a shower was hell and the room smelled weird. Not worth it at all! If you have to spend any money, go elsewhere!

After a fiasco with air b n b, we used a website to get inexpensive same day rate. Initial rooms were very small. As there was availability they kindly upgraded and one if two rooms was a premium room and fabulous!! Quiet as on inside. One block away from Times Square and so well located. Also concierge was immensely helpful. We loved this pied a terre in nyc. Perfect if you want location and quiet (probable inside rooms).

Just a few moments’ walk from Times Square, this is a really nice hotel. The location won’t be for everyone but for us on our first trip to NY it made sense and worked out perfectly. We found 49th St. subway to be very useful. There are obviously loads of bars and restaurants within very easy reach.The rooms were well-appointed and modern, although there were more lights and things than there were plug sockets. An odd setup – just remove a light! The rooms are already pretty dark so a light you can’t plug in won’t help. The bathrooms are nice, if a little small, but very clean. Breakfast was vastly overpriced so we didn’t have that.The only drawback was the size of the bed, which was a not-large double. Oh, and having to pay to leave our luggage. I know you have to tip people for breathing in the US (well done everyone, by the way) but I didn’t appreciate that. Oh, and the helpful set of sockets by the bed (which took USBs and various international plugs) wasn’t so helpful as it didn’t work.

Nice hotel, steps from Times Square and theaters although very noicy area.., very small room with almost no wardrove, confortable bed, cleanliness should improve. Excellent japanese restaurant next door.

We stayed at tryp for 2 nights and weren't impressed. First of all it took 22minutes to check in due to a long line and slow staff. When we got the front of the line the gentleman was very rude and gave the impression he couldn't be bothered. We were first sent to the wrong room on floor 15 so had to go all the way up to 15 to come all the way back down to get the key to our proper room. No apology from the staff for the mistake. The room itself was good. Beds are comfy, shower is powerful and a decent size. There is a big flat screen TV with a good selection of channels.House keeping are very rude and don't know what "do not disturb" means. We had the do not disturb sign on the door, yet housekeeping tried to get in the room and when they couldn't they phoned the room twice to ask if we wanted housekeeping! When we told them no as per the reason for do not disturb sign, to get a very rude "that doesn't mean you don't want housekeeping" for a reply. Housekeeping are also very noisy in the morning. They shout to each other down the hallways. Keep your wallet to hand as they will try to take your dollars at any opportunity. We asked about a late out and they wanted to charge $100 for this! They also charge you $2/bag for luggage storage! I have never had to pay for such a service!!! The hotel offers an airport shuttle bus but be warned as they charge $30/person for this. If you are not travelling solo, you are cheaper getting a cab! There are also vending machines that are overpriced. Top tip: win the lottery before staying at this hotel.

So we booked direct through hotel website and we got a very good rate. We arrived around noontime and was surprised the room was ready. we stayed on the 13th floor.. This hotel is so close to times square.FYI IF you stay close to times square and you find a deal on a hotel . the rooms will be small.. we understand that. The only complaint I had is there was very limited space from the toilet to the shower but again, it was a standered room.We did not eat the breakfast that they offered, We did notice they have 2 prices 1 pre pay 1 not They do have a restaurant that is connected but we did not see use that either.I would definitely stay here again if i get a good price

We spent one night at TRYP over Valentine's Day weekend with our daughters - 4 and 7. Its location is perfect to see a show and walk around Time Square. The room itself was a good size for the city, and really great for small families, as it had a bunk bed in a separate alcove with its own TV. The girls loved having their own "room" while mom and dad loved that we could take a nap! Unfortunately, the room is super dark with sad smokey grey paint on the walls and the white headboard was dirty and dingy. Small complaints for a great overnight in the big city with my girls.

The TRYP is honestly fantastic. The price, location, decor in the hotel and the rooms including reasonable staff make this a perfect place to stay when visiting NYC.In terms of distance... i could throw a rock from my room to times square - easy walk down to the corner and bam your in the square baby!The foyer of the hotel is small compared to some but is gorgeous and very modern.The bell staff are excellent and reception not bad.The rooms are great and yes some people are complaining about size but you pay for what you get...simple logic.Overall i was highly impressed and look forward to a warm greeting later this year when i visit again.I approve TRYP as a top hotel for all visitors to this great city!

This hotel service standards during overnight hours is quite dismal at best. Initially I came to check in around 2AM and there was no one in the lobby who could check me in. Alphonso finally arrived after about 10 minutes to check me in. I am understanding that he has other responsibilities and some times has to leave the lobby and it's also 2am. Checking in was quite a short and simple process. I hated the wait for the elevator. I noticed they put one elevator out of service during these hours. The lobby was very dark and you can't really take in the gorgeous lobby because almost all the lights are off. Not dim but off. I got up to a really noisy room (304) due to the rooftop bar across the street. I immediately called the front desk asking to change rooms and I was able to. The room I moved to (315) was very quiet the shower was really nice but water gets everywhere because of their being no curtain or door to completely close in the shower. Anyhow right after changing rooms I realized I left my phone in the old room so I called the desk again to let them know the response was ok come to the desk and I'll give you a key so you can get it. The response I would have loved is I'll send security to get the phone and bring it to you so you don't have to come to the desk. I came to the front desk Alphonso gave me a key (that didn't work, I had to revisit the front desk) turns out I ended up going to 305 which was the wrong room. Since he didn't verify the room I moved from and the room was vacant and dirty. This all happened while security was escorting me he didn't even realize this wasn't my room and walked away. I had to go back to the desk yet again security the escorted me back upstairs while he called Alphonso many names to include an idiot. So very unprofessional and inappropriate. Finally I got my phone and went back to my room. Checking out was a much better process of which the young lady was very nice and helpful. PS be sure to check the duvet and sheets when I got to the new room there was a couple strands of hair on the bed but the sheets were clean. I do hope someone contacts me to at the very least hear my concerns. This was the second bad taste in my mouth at a Tryp Hotel. The first one was at Times Square south where the young lady at the front desk was quite rude because I was at the wrong Tryp. She plainly said to me did you read the address I don't understand why you came here without reading it. Who would've thought you would have more than one of the same named hotel with the difference of one word and 15 blocks. More than likely I won't be back but you never know.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Tryp! The room was small, but my husband and I thought it was cozy with nice, modern decor. The location is amazing- only Steps away from Times Square and Broadway shows, as well as some great eats on 8th avenue. The bed and pillows were very comfy, and the room was well serviced each day. One warning: the bathroom is extremely tiny-- almost like a cruise ship bathroom. It would be challenging for a very large person to shower in there. The hotel staff was fairly curt, though our interactions were few. I'm not sure I ever saw any of them smile! Still, we definitely plan to stay again!

Room was a decent size, considering the location, so close to Time Sq. Lifts are annoyingly slow. Decor in rooms a bit cheap/plastic-ey. Didn't find the room noisy, which was surprising. Didn't eat/drink in the hotel, so can't comment. Would stay here again.

What a huge disappointment!!When we got to the hotel, we were told that the room wasn't ready in a very cursory way. We left our bags but weren't given the warmest of welcomes. The shape of things to come!!!Then we (finally) got to the room. What a massive letdown. The best thing I can say is that if you want a really good reason to see as much of Manhattan as you can, stay here. The room is so awful, you'll be happy to stay out as long as you possibly can. We have stayed in some amazing US hotels - this was such a disappointment. Corridors and lifts are dated, dingy and narrow. The room was small, cramped and depressingly dim. The furniture has seen better days, the walls are grey (grey???? In a small room??) and the one window was really small as well. Not a good room for claustrophobes. No fridge, one small bottle of water (just the once - wow) and paper cups for the coffee - no milk, just non-dairy creamer. Yuck!!The bed was comfortable but very little else was positive - dim lighting and no real facilities to speak of. The wardrobe was so small, you had to hang clothes diagonally or you couldn't close the door and the bathroom was pathetically tiny - tired and poky with insufficient space to put your toiletries. In fact, there wasn't sufficient room for anything. A real contrast to everywhere else we have stayed.So, not a relaxing room to stay and the room is really noisy - choose between the noise outside or the din of the air-con. We went for the air-con. The location is great and we had clean towels every day but that's all. You know it's not great when the towels are the best feature of a place. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone and would not stay here again. One to avoid!!!

Good location- near Times Square But very very dark , dingy and tired rooms They're small so why paint them grey More like a prison cell Room was tiny and smelt of disinfectant Not great Bathroom was the smallest I've ever had Not enough wardrobe space , and clothes had to be put in sideways to fit Front desk staff not that friendly Lifts small slow and claustrophobic- and shared with the cleaners doing the rooms Bag service very slow - and grumpy Do yourself a favour - stay at Novotel Times Square - same money - big modern refitted rooms- and a better nyc experience

The TRYP by Wyndham on 48th street could not be in a more precise location! Far enough away from Times Square but one block away from all of the excitement! Very convenient to Broadway shows and Central Park! Room: The room is smaller than you may be used to, but all NYC hotel rooms are small! With that being said, the room was perfect for my wife and I. The bed and pillows are GREAT! I even want to buy these pillows when I get back home! Modern design, no problem with the shower. TV did not work when we first checked in, but Victor at the front desk had it fixed when we got back that night! AC worked great and it was not loud at all, you will sleep like a baby after a long day! Lobby: very elegant, modern design! Plenty of places to sit and relax while you wait on a cab or just want to take a break! Staff: everyone on the Tryp staff was great! Very helpful, especially the concierge as she helped us reschedule our shuttle trip back to the airport! And very knowledgable about the things to do! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and would return! Thank you Tryp for making our first tryp to NYC a huge success!

The location of this hotel is fantastic a very short stroll to Times Square proper. We booked a Deluxe Queen room, it was very very small but the bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. Given the small space and all of our bags filling the room it was well serviced each day. Checkin was quick and we actually were allowed to check in early which was appreciated because I wasn't feeling well. Concierge staff were helpful when it came to asking for information. be aware there are a few TRYPs so know which one you are booked into LoL. I would recommend

This hotel is not for couples and it's very dirty not a 4 or 5 star hotel. The service here sucks as well know one is help full. We where checked into a dirty room on the first night and on the second day asked for an upgrade and told the front desk we would pay for it but was unable to move room because front desk said hotel was sold out. I will not recommend this hotel or stay here again.

Stayed here with my family in Oct 15. We are a family of 4 and to find family rooms in New York was not easy and never reasonable when you finally looked at the prices. That said I stumbled across this hotel in the Expedia sale last year and took a punt. I say that because at the time of booking in early 15 the reviews for the hotel were not good...but on booking I took in the fact that it had recently been taken over by the Tryp hotel group who were investing a lot of money modernising the rooms and corridors. It was a gamble that paid off extremely well as the cost was half of that anywhere else and what we got was fantastic and exactly what we needed for 2 adults, 1x 16yr old and 1 X 13 year old. Our room was a family room on the top floor and is the one I think posted on their website with views out towards the fire station below and beyond. Two double beds and a foldaway bunk bed system meant we actually had a spare bed if needed. Storage was ok with a cupboard and room under the bunk bed and if you wanted in the corridor. The room was refurbished and always very clean. Tea/coffee refreshed every day as was bathroom toiletries. Hotel cleaners and staff all very helpful. Location is excellent if you want robe in the thick of it as it's just off Times Square. If I could get this hotel for same price or similar again I would not hesitate to book.

Nice hotel close to Times Square right off of 8th Avenue. Room was small but it's NYC so that's expected, but it was clean and up to date. Alphonso at the front desk was especially helpful and courteous, I would come back again.

We booked our stay through Expedia and got a great rate for a premium room (queen bed and two bunk beds) by pre-paying for the room. We experienced no problems whatsoever with the booking, and the hotel staff was friendly and attentive. The room was very clean and the perfect set up for my husband, son (age 21), daughter (age 12), and me. Finding a room for older children of different genders is often a challenge, so we were very pleased with the bunk bed option.All of the beds were comfortable. The only problem we had was that the elevators are very small and there are only two of them, plus a service elevator, so we just had to allow extra time coming and going from our room. Overall, we were very happy with our stay.

The location of the hotel is great located off Broadway and a few steps from time square. The room was tiny but it was clean and comfortable. We booked through hotels tonight and got a good deal. If you get claustrophobic it's not a good spot, but if you just need a bed for the night it's a good spot.

Great hotel.. clean. Easy and comfortable. However Wyndham reps pounce and offer visa cards and breakfasts if you go see their new hotel... no word of it being about purchasing timeshares. When you go you are pounced on in small cubicles and pressured for 3 hours to agree to a timeshare purchase... one then 2 then 3 people will tell you how wonderful your kids are and how you look so bright but once they get the message after you speak of talking to accountants...and they ask why you cant make your own decisions... they become quite rude... and offensive. My advice. .. take the gift and run... its a scheme and you will be in for a major debt.... i wont be staying in a wyndham again because of this... although hotel itself and people were fine... but the pressure when you are on holidays is not appreciated and being tricked into participating makes it close to criminal. Be careful if offered a free breakfast and visa card .. its a trick.

Great location. Close to theatres and good restaurants. Ready walking to the subway. . Dimly lit rooms. Need more lights! Comfortable beds. Friendly staff. They will hold luggage for you after checkout. Good deal for the money and location.

Me and my partner stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel has recently been refurbished so has a fresh and contemporary look. The room was cosy and modern with a comfy bed and I especially loved the bathroom/shower. Location is absolutely amazing. 20 steps or so away from the madness of Times Square. When we left, my partner had forgotten some of his souvenirs in the room and we had already left for Miami. I emailed the hotel and Channel Garcia was especially helpful in making sure these items were forwarded on to us to our hotel in Miami. We received these within 2 days and were truly amazed by this customer service so thank you again for this. All in all, a wonderful stay and we would definitely return.

Nice hotel, room size was very good for New York standard and clean.The location is very good, just a block away from Macys.The bar is nice but the food is not all that. Over priced for what the food was.Staff were ok, check in and out was quick, however, they do charge to keep your bags after check out.Would stay here again!

My mum & I visited NYC from 5-12th March. I've been once previously but this was my mum's first trip & because we were also going to be celebrating my 30th birthday I wanted to make it as special as possible! I booked the hotel through booking.com for a very reasonable price. It was a bit strange to have 1 nights fee deducted from my card a few weeks before my stay and the remaining amount on arrival at the hotel, I was also informed 14.75% tax is excluded & there would be a $3.50 city tax per night charge. In advance I emailed the hotel to ask whether we could possibly have a late check-out since our flight was not until 21.30, the hotel replied that I could check out at 15.00 but any later than that would incur a 1/2 day charge. On arrival at the hotel at 22.00 we were greeted by a friendly man at the desk, my mum asked whether there was anything he could go with regards to a complimentary upgrade as it was my birthday and he kindly obliged and upgraded us to a family suite on the 11th floor with single bunk beds, divided by a shower room and a queen sized bed. Unfortunately though we did not get any sleep that first night since my mums bed room faced out onto the Main Street which was very noisy with sirens and car horns all night long, my bed faced out onto the air conditioning generators which whirred noisily all night long. We expected noise being in the centre of Times Square but this noise was something else & could be heard even when wearing ear plugs!The following morning we enquired about a room change and were told to come back in the afternoon after checkout to see whether there were any rooms free. We did as instructed and were told we'd need to come back later on in the afternoon as there were no available rooms. We were in our room when the very kind lady at the desk called us at approximately 17:00 to ask whether we still wanted to change rooms, which we did - my mum went down to the desk to swap keys. We were moved to the 16th floor and a penthouse suite!!! How lucky!!! The room was beautiful with a huge double bathroom and patio overlooking Broadway! Sadly there was still very noisy air conditioning units whirring non-stop but we felt we could not complaint again since staff had already been so kind & were able to put up with it, sleeping with ear plugs for the remainder of our stay. The penthouse suite was clean and towels were replaced daily despite us leaving signs up saying we were willing to reuse them, tea and coffee were replaced daily but unfortunately we didn't get any more bottles of water after the first day & it took me until day 4 to realise there was an ice and water machine on lower levels. The beds were always nicely made everyday. The hotel generally was very quiet inside, we only really came across other guests in the lobby and waiting for lifts when going to and from our room. This was brilliant in comparison to the hotel our friends stayed in which was a hype of activity with people coming non-stop and full of kids in school trips! We were so grateful for that!The only downsides were that there were some aspects in the room that were a little run down and need replacing. The lamp switches were wobbly and a little dangerous, the electric blinds over the double patio windows did not work and the lights in the room were generally a little too dim. Apart from that though the beds and pillows were extremely comfortable, the walk-in shower was lovely and we had a really nice stay. Unfortunately on checkout they were unable to honour the late checkout of 3pm as I'd previously agreed since we were in one of the prime rooms (penthouse), the latest they could allow was 1pm. We were able to leave our luggage but this was charged at $2 per bag which is quite expensive compared to 50cent per bag at a neighbouring hotel. The concierge kindly arranged a shuttle for us to the airport which was a very smooth journey and easy, stress free way of getting there. Thank you TRYP for a pleasant stay in New York!!

This hotel is in a great location, with plenty of restaurants, subways, and bars nearby. The decor is modern and trendy, both in the lobby and in the rooms. Everything was very clean. Also, the check-in process was seamless and quick, which is always appreciated.The only negative is that if your room is on the street side, it can get very noisy. if possible, try to get a room as high up or as far away from the street as possible. I was very impressed with the hotel staff, as they let me switch rooms in the middle of the night in order to get a quieter room to sleep in (the city was breaking up concrete on 48th street, just outside of my room, with jackhammers at 1AM). They let me move without fully moving all of my things from the first room to the other, which was very nice of them and much appreciated.

Let me start this telling you that I am not one to usually complain but when I choose a hotel, I expect a few things. Let's start out with the positives; great location close to Times Square, the rooms are cute and functional, and the engineering staff and concierge were very nice. Now with the negatives;we drove down to New York. We were in a few hours early. We went to the front desk to check in but we were told to come back at 3. We knew that our room wouldn't be ready but the woman at the reception was exceptionally rude..I asked her where we should park the car and she told me she didn't know..I went over to the concierge who gave us directions to a lot nearby... She was a very nice lady....When we came back later afternoon, we were given a room. It was a premium room with queen and bunk beds.... We all liked the room however there was an issue....the closet door was blocked by the bunk beds. There was no where to hang our clothing nor was there access to a safe. we were okay to have the room without the closet, but the safe was an issue. I always lock up the passports and computers. I went down to reception and asked them to bring up a safe. I was told none were available.... Not sure why they couldn't take one from another room and bring it to ours is a big question. There were empty rooms. I was given the option of switching to some other rooms.... I really didn't want to but had no choice. I looked at a few and chose the same room a few floors down....we had to pack up all the things again and move them down. The room seemed okay however the bathroom has a motion sensored fan which goes on the moment someone walks in....it is not a quiet fan but it does go on and on and on.... Literally it is on for a full 8-10 minutes after the bathroom is not being used and it sounds like a plane is taking off.... My daughter decided to take a shower. The handle fell off the moment she tried to turn the water on. The heating system is very noisy....my husband tried to turn it off but could not.....this hotel is poorly managed....they should really try to make their guests happy but it seems like they don't care.... The guy at reception could see that I was frustrated.... Instead of perhaps doing something special to alleviate my frustration, he did nothing..no apology.... Zip, nada!!!!..offering us a complimentary breakfast or something would have been nice....I guess they are too busy a hotel to care about their guests comfort.

Great staff. Very friendly. Interesting lobby. Modern and cool looking. Our room was a suite which housed a room with bunk beds. Then the bathroom. And a separate room with the queen bed. Very clean. Very happy with the room. Only gripe is the wine served at the bar. It is awful. Get a beer or cocktail for sure.

This location in the Theater District is super. Victor Pulsar at the front desk went out of his way to be helpful to us on our Anniversary weekend in NYC. The two room suite was disappointingly small with one room taken up with a vertical bunk bed, but we requested and were granted a move to a non-suite room which was comfortable. We enjoyed our stay and will return.

Just got back from a four night stay at this wonderful little hotel in the best possible place in NYC! Superb hotel....lovely staff....perfect location. Excellent value for money. We loved every minute! From the moment we arrived.....seeing the tank of fish at the reception desk.....to the sign post to all the New York sights.......we absolutely loved it! Thank you Tryp for making our visit to your wonderful city amazing. We hope to return as soon as we can :) xxxxx

We have recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The location was amazing about 100 yards from Times Square. The rooms are not very big but you're not in them enough to worry about that. They were very clean, fresh towels daily new shampoo bottles and soaps which was handy. Wouldn't recommend the lower levels are there is some sort of air conditioning unit at the back of the hotel which is very noisy. But apart from that would go back.

This hotel is in a great midtown location, its clean and comfortable and rooms are a good size for that price range for NYC. The staff are all wonderful and certainly go the extra mile. For a small fee (maybe $13) there is a plentiful continental breakfast. The gym is small, but adequate.I would stay here again and recommend it for both business/leisure travel

Everything was great,The hotel is beautiful and well decorated.The staff are attentive and pleasant.I stayed on the 12th floor, there was noise of fire trucks as some people said but at a bearable level.perfect location, close to Times Square.Easy to follow all city subway.Breakfast at a cost benefit very good as are the restaurants outside not very cheap and have less food choices and amounts.I requested the shuttle service through the Concierge and it was spotless.It has clothes iron and ironing board, coffee maker to make coffee or warm water, safe and smart closet with hangers.It is certainly a place I will return to host me, being in the city.

The TRYP hotel has a great strategic location, it's walking distance from all the great stuff around Times Square, their breakfast delicious and the rooms are quite comfortable and spacious, being NY and all. But definitively what I liked the most about the hotel was the customer service, Victor Pulsar at the front office was very attentive, and attended to all our needs with a great attitude, pretty cool guy, if you get the chance let him be your point person, he will help you a lot!

Me and my boyfriend spend 5 nights in this hotel and it was great. We had a continental buffet breakfast for $10 (quite good price for New York) we got the King size room with a view for only $94 per night and the location, is perfect!! The crew was super kindly, specially Victor Pulsar on the front desk, he was super friendly, kind and educated. I will definitely stay in this hotel again. Good job guys!

We have recently returned from a stay in NYC , this hotel was very central and staff welcoming. On arrival we were greeted by Alfonso who made our welcome even nicer with our room allocation and friendliness. All staff very pleasant but he made it special . Many thanks .

We stayed at the Tryp hotel from 14th February for 4 nights. It was a fab location for Times Sq and for getting on the Metro. It was a very clean hotel with friendly staff. Rooms were clean albeit a bit small and the beds were not great for anyone over 5'10" but considering the closeness to Times Sq it was relatively quiet at night. I would definitely return to this hotel.

A nice hotel located in the middle of Times Square. Our room was on the 11th floor and the elevator wait was minimal considering the hotel seemed full. The room was nice with a comfy bed and nice shower. We were supposed to stay at the 35th street location but we were asked to come here instead. I really do prefer the 35th St. location since it is located closer to Megabus and the trains. Overall, a decent location with enough bars and eating places nearby on 8th ave.

This hotel is perfectly situated for Times Square & Broadway. Its with in easy walking distance of bus/sub stations and touristy things for the whole city. We had a lovely room which was cosy and warm. Arrival was welcoming and warm (on the coldest weekend ever). We didn't have breakfast but it was no problem as there was a little deli across the street and we purchase breakfast from there. Coffee in the rooms was lovely.
