The rooms were cleaned everyday and the shower was out of this world good especially after a long day pavement pounding around NYC. There is a small bar in the reception but we never used this we went to the bar next door (Hurley's) instead which was very nice, warm, cosy & friendly atmosphere.If I was to return to NYC I would definitely stay here again and I would recommend it to anyone who asked. The bed was the most comfy I have ever slept in a hotel!

My husband and I stayed at this hotel atleast three times before, however it was previously owned by the Best Western franchise, so this was our first visit under the new management. What was meant to be a nice getaway, turned into a stressful and unresolved stay. My husband usually leaves his phone in the hotel room as our sim don't usually work in the US, I on the other hand carry my phone to take pictures of course. One particular morning he left his phone on the bed as the battery has just died and we went out for the day. When we returned late in the afternoon, we notice immediately the phone missing. We left the room with the beds unmade and when we returned the bed was made so the only person who was in the room is the housekeeper. We immediately called the manager to let him know of the issue. He came up to our room to get the information. We emptied all the suitcases, pulled the sheets off the beds and even lifted the beds to see if it fell beneath while the housekeeper was making up the bed. It was no where in the room. We were absolutely certain that the housekeeper took the phone. The manager said his staff didn't steal and that he had asked if she saw it and of course she said she didn't see a phone. He claimed that he even contacted the laundry services as the housekeeper mentioned to him she changed the sheets. Mind you, we were only there for four nights and that was only our second night, I've stayed at a lot of hotels and they don't change your sheets after one two nights unless they were dirty, which they weren't. The next day we told the front desk that we didn't want anyone in our room while we weren't there. When we were exiting out room, the housekeeper, who I'm sure was the same as the day before, was a few rooms away at her caddy. When she saw us coming out of our room that morning, she vanished, as if not to see us. My husband made a police report to the NYPD who is investigating the matter. My stay came to an end and still no phone or reasonable answer from the management about reimbursement for the phone. It was a brand new Samsung s6+ edge. All we were told is that their insurance company will contact us. Three weeks has already past since my stay and no one has contacted us.It is ridiculous for management to protect staff of they are being untrustworthy, I am a customer, for what reason would I be making up a story about a phone being stolen whilst we're on vacation trying to enjoy ourselves.I will NEVER stay there again and I don't recommend anyone to. How can anyone feel safe leaving their personal belongings in a room where a staff has sticky hands and management seems to only care about protecting them.

Went for a quick weekend getaway to be a tourist in NYC. This hotel is no frills and practical. The bathroom was tiny per NYC standards. Quick walk to the Hershey store and many places to eat. Times square is right around the corner. Able to hop the train a block away. Paid breakfast wasn't worth it. Easy access to the theater where we went to see Wicked. I would return to this hotel alone or with one other person. Wouldn't stay here with my family or a large group of friends as we couldn't hang out in lobby or at bar without being cramped in.

I definitely enjoyed my stay at the Tryp. It started out with an early check in, I wasn't sure if they would be able to accommodate our request because we were in early and requested a room without a view based on other reviewers. Luckily, they were able to do both and the room was lovely. Some of the furniture was a bit scratched and dented but nothing serious. Our heater was blowing cold air when we arrived and we reported tot he front desk on our way to lunch and it was fixed when we returned to the room. Housekeeping was prompt everyday and all of the employees we encountered were friendly.As far as the reviewers who complained about the size of the room, they must not have ever been to NYC before. I have been in smaller rooms, although the bathroom was one of the smallest I've been in. I also don't like these half-shower partitions that seem to be all the rage in design, they're not practical and flood the bathroom. I also would have liked to have seen keycard entry required for the elevator. I never got the feeling that the hotel was unsafe, but the lobby is very busy and it's hard to tell who is a guest and who isn't.The location is phenomenal and easy to walk everywhere. I preferred to walk over tot he west side and get away from the crowds.

I want to start by saying that the hotel itself couldn't be in A better spot for tourists looking to see the sights and get in amongst it while visiting New York city. Genuinly cannot fault the location (infact it's great) and the hotel itself is in fairly good shape with clean and comfortable rooms, again cannot fault that either...The problem we found was in fact the hospitality (or lack of it). From the minute we arrived the service left me and my partner feeling a little deflated. The man on reception on our arrival was pretty rude from the get-go. He then said that our hotel had not been settled up by the company we booked with and that I would have to pay $200 dollars for him to be able to check me in. When I questioned this (As I had indeed paid for the hotel) he folded his arms and said 'well I cannot check you in then, sorry' He then went on to say I can call reservations in the morning and claim this back. I wasn't exactly thrilled with this but agreed as it would work out easier than having to go and find another hotel. During the whole check in experience he didn't show any qualities which I would expect from his job role. No welcome, No smile, No conversation, No interest. To be perfectly honest his customer service was terrible. Really very poor. He also asked me if I realised I had booked a double bed when he saw we were two girls. Yes thankyou, I did realise this. Throughout our stay we had a couple different pre-auths come off our card, which left us a little confused. I went down to reception on three occasions as the pre auths all came out on different days and were for really random amounts. I fully understand how pre-auths work as a hospitality manager myself, so that wasn't the issue, the issue was the lack of explanation and holding amounts which I hadn't authorised. Not acceptable actually.When I go to hotels part of the experience is the relationships you build with the staff, that just didn't happen here. Actually there was a lady sat on the desk by the glass lift (Blond hair and what sounded like a eastern European accent), she was helpful in dealing with our shuttle and had a good level of customer care, so thank you.All in all, if you want a well priced hotel in a good spot but are not bothered about the hospitality and customer service you receive, then it might be the hotel for you. If your like me and you like service with A smile, don't go here, find somewhere else! And yes this was the Wyndham on 48th street next to pongsri, not to be confused with the Wyndham on 45

Over Feb. break, we treated the kids to a stay in the city. Needed a last minute reservation and Hotel.com had a great price for this place. Being a Ny'er, I would not choose this loca however, for a family of 5 TRYP offered the best case scenario. Adorable little lobby with a nice little bar, modern and clean. I can see from other reviews how check-in can be maddening, but we lucked out and were helped right away (checked in at 5pm) and was therefore painless. Now on to the room...We entered the room, and as much as I was pleased with the layout/space- there was food all over the floor and garbage, and marker writing on the bathroom mirror. Bad sign yes, but the guy who checked us in - came right back in with the vacuum and started cleaning! That just confirms they are under-staffed. So Kudos def. go out to Jason for rectifying the situation however, extremely unpleasant first impression. The room "Samsung room-#107' had 2 flat screens, bunk bed, sofabed, king bed in the master area and a well stocked/modern bathroom. Design was all very IKEA like. There were 2 huge windows that faced 'WOOD' , ok by us- didn't need the NYC view however, this would be a bummer to any non-Ny'er I can imagine. For our needs (roomy place to sleep)- totally fit the bill. The kids had fun when in the room and location ended up working out well for us - close to the subways we needed, etc.. Only choose this hotel if your priority is space over quality/NY experience. BTW - it's right by Penn Station, so calling it 'Times Square South' is pretty comical. I mean, it IS south of Times Square... but if you wanted to be in the thick of Times Square- this is a good 7 blocks away.

My husband and I booked this hotel through Expedia for a last-minute trip because it was the lowest priced 4 star hotel in the Times Square area (around $250 CAD per night). The location was great, especially for our first trip to NYC. The room was OK. Small, but from research that is to be expected. We were on the third floor and our window opened onto a garbage-filled rooftop. The sheets weren't changed in the entire 7 days we were there. And we came back one day to find a q-tip on our floor, which did not arrive with us as we don't use q-tips. So that was gross. The bathroom would literally flood every time we showered.I wouldn't stay at this hotel again, and I would also recommend people look at accommodations outside of Times Square. It's nice to experience the hustle and bustle, but (in my opinion) with the extensive transit system it would be just as fun to stay in Gramercy Park or Greenwich Village if the price were right.

Great location, very nice hotel!! Esspecially the hostess Tricia Hikking was very nice to us!! She gave us good information and was very helpfull!! Just around the corner are good restaurants and broadway shows. We would come back here everytime, thank you for a great stay

This hotel is exactly what you would expect from a budget stay. Rooms are economically packed but the premium room was more spacious. Great location to Broadway shows, walking distance. I would stay again due to convenience and price. Beds are smaller than expected but once again it's ok for one night.

When we arrived we couldn't believe how great our location was. A 2 minute walk away from Times Square.The hotel was modern clean and our bedroom was a great size for the 2 of us.Had an amazing trip to NY and if we ever come back we'll definitely come back to this hotel.Highly recommended and have also recommend to all our friends and family.

This hotel was clean and the bed comfy but the aircon was noisey and the staff's attitudes inconsistent. The hotel lifts were super tiny - left me feeling somewhat claustrophobic.Very well positioned super close to Times Square for sight seeing.

I booked thru travelzoo. I booked the 35th st property and Wyndham decided to move me to the 48th st property. Not what I booked. I verified that I would be getting a 2 queen room as booked. I was assured by travelzoo in coordination with Wyndham manager Jae Gil that I would be. That was not true they had traded in my 2 queen for a single king. This is not acceptable, I do not know if the true responsibility for lying to me regarding the accommodations is travelzoos or Wyndhams. I do know that I booked a 2 queen room on 35th street and was switched to a king room on 48th street. This is bait and switch when viewed in the best light. The hotel itself is clean, well located but with showers of erratic temperature and flow and a shower curtain from a kmart blue light special. The location is great and if you are ok not knowing what kind of room you are staying in this is an acceptable property.

I booked this room on Hotel Tonight, which I've used before and was very happy with my stays. TRYP was a different story. I drove from out of town and pulled up for the valet. After several minutes of waiting, I went inside to see if there was something I was missing. Walked up to the counter and when I smiled and said hello, I was rudely addressed by the staff. I said I was checking in and inquired about the valet. They asked me what kind of car I drive, and after commenting (judgmentally) about the make and model of my car, they told me there would be an extra fee. I asked about self park, which they advertised having at a cheaper rate, and was given directions several blocks away to a parking garage and told that my car would still cost the most expensive amount, even if I had self-payed. Had I known that, I would've found a cheaper parking garage and not bothered with the valet. Onto the room. It was tiny and it was visibly quite dirty. There was barely room for my friend and me to navigate without bumping into something or each other. I had to move furniture to open the closet door, and had and find the exact right spot to put the ironing board to iron clothes and have access to an outlet. The TV didn't work, the complimentary WIFI was inaccessible, and any interaction with staff was met with rude dismissal. Disappointing stay.

My partner booked this as a surprise for my 30th birthday. The hotel is quite modern in its look and staff were quite friendly.Pros: This hotel is literally a 2 minute walk to the middle of Times Square and about ten minutes to the Rockafella Centre. It was clean and has a good check out time of 12 which was great as our flight was late. Rooms were made each day with fresh towels. On our last day, the skys opened and we were soaked through with the rain. We had already checked out and staff were nice enough to offer us towels and a place to change clothes before flying - even if it was only a rest room!Cons:Rooms are really small. So much so that when one of us was sat on the toilet we couldnt shut the door. We stayed in room 601. The air conditioning is loud. We were there during minus temperatures and so couldnt leave the air conditioning off. That said, we were that tired after roaming Manhattan we fell straight asleep. Even though the hotel offered a later check out, we had to pay $10 for them to keep our bags for the day. All in all, we would stay here again just for the closeness of the amenities but would probably ask for a bigger room!

Just returned from nyc yesterday and stayed in this hotel for 7 nights. I had read reviews and was slightly concerned. On checking in we found the staff were friendly and efficient.The rooms were on the small side but adequate as we were only sleeping in them.We had breakfast included and expected a continental breakfast but was surprised to find we had a full breakfast as part of the deal.The manager of the restaurant Micheal went out of his way every morning to meet and great us. He was so helpful and made sure that all our needs were met. If we ever go back to New York we will defiantly think about staying there again. Location fantastic. Staff friendly but Micheal you defiantly made our stay at this hotel... Also Michelle who made sure our coffee cup was constantly full..... Thank you x

Yes the room is small as is the bed not a queen but a full. But very clean and comfortable everything worked perfectly the staff was awesome and friendly definetly will be back very enjoyable and the price was awesome 100.00 bucks for a Friday night in the theatre district.

This hotel is located only yards from Times Square and near to the Rockefeller Centre/Radio City, Port Authority Bus Terminal, Madame Tussaud's, only two blocks from a subway a subway station and in the middle of theatre district.The hotel rooms are small and basic but totally adequate. The addition of a travel/USB plug socket was welcome.The hotel bar offers cocktails at much lower prices than nearby restaurants. Hotel staff are welcoming, helpful and knowledgable.I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Booked three nights in New York and the Tryp had great value to it and it locations was excellent for our needs. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were compact but everything you needed (no frig) , very clean and fresh linens. It is a great place to stay - coffee shops, diners and delis all around you. They do have a breakfast that you have to pay for but we did not eat there so I cannot comment on it. I would definitely stay here again.

Where to begin, 1) Cockroach in my room - offered a 50% discount on the rate for the night he appeared 2) In total the hotel made four charges to my visa debit card during my stay with a total charged amount of £1,030, cost of stay £440. So far $96 instead of £96 has been refunded and I have been having the worst customer experience of my life to get the remainder back since they are denying they charged my card. While one can get over the cockroach the lack of competent customer service and helpfulness to address the additional charges has been disgraceful.I have now reached out to Ben Elie who appears to responses to this thread due to a lack of assistance from the hotel.Will keep ye updated.

The rooms were a wee bit on the small side, but you couldn't beat the location. They were clean. No fridge. The staff were awesome and very helpful. Two restaurants immediately next door to either side of the hotel, which was great, because it was very cold this past weekend!

We stayed for seven whole days. On arrival we were told that we could not use the water til 5pm because they were having problems. Once in the hotel room it was very hot and noisy outside and the back of the property with the generator. Staff were rude from start to finish. The lady behind the check in counter was rude when we arrived. The door man asking to see our room key 5 days into the 7 day trip which was odd. No extra tea in the bedroom. People from England like tea!!! when speaking to the staff they assumed we got it from the restaurant when we explained he dismissed us and said he will get someone to bring some to our room which he did not. we only wanted a tea bag. We lobed the location, the rooms were too hot and staff need hospitality training!!!!

lovely hotel,friendly staff ,nice little bar. Ideal for sight seeing 100 metres to times square Beds a little on the small side, ask to look before you get your keys. Ideal for all broadway shows. 9/10

Stayed at the TRYP Times Square South last time and really enjoyed it so we thought we would try this TRYP. I Booked a Family Room and was quite disappointed upon arrival. I expected 2 queen beds, bunk beds, pullout couch and two TVs.We received the two beds and bunk beds, but absolutely no storage. The room sleeps 6, and it has a tiny closet, 3 drawers for storage and absolutely no hooks.The bathroom is a joke. It is an open shower with no door and the water travels farther than it should and takes 10 minutes to heat up. They ask you to reuse your towels, but there are no hooks to hang them and no shelving for toiletries, just wasted space. All in all a very poorly designed room. Saving grace is nice staff. Also, we were on the 9th floor and it was so noisy, we could hear all the traffic. If you have to stay here, would suggest you request higher floor.

Stayed at the Tryp Wyndham Times Square hotel (formerly the Best Western President Hotel) on Jan. 17. I saw that Wyndham has made some renovations to the rooms.My room was comfortable as far as the bed and heating itself, but there was some problems as well:* First of all, the lighting in the bathroom is VERY bad...I am speaking about the light that is above the mirror .... it is VERY DIM! (It should be a lot brighter)* Secondly, whoever decided to change the shower area [from the way Best Western had it] should have been shot. Instead of a shower curtain or a door that closes the shower area from the rest of the bathroom, this is a good section of the shower area that is open [in other words, there is a glass enclosure that runs from one wall HALFWAY to the opposite wall] So when you shower, all the water goes onto the floor around the toilet. I had to mop up water using 2 or 3 towels!!!* Thirdly, the heating unit makes a lot of noise...a CONSISTENT, LOUD TAPPING noise....I didn't get a WHOLE LOT of sleep because of it (only a few hours). It just about literally drove me nuts!!

A great location right off of Times Square. We stayed in the family room and it was really fantastic. There were two double beds and a set of bunk beds and it made for a much better girls weekend for us all to be able to be together in the same room. We had a few minor problems while we were there but the front desk was quick to fix them and help us out.

Any hotel in Times Square is convenient for seeing a show, but we happened to be going to the Longacre Theater, and this hotel is right next door. Everything worked out really well, and we got a good rate from a discount hotel site. The room was mostly clean, though not spotless (there was glitter on the carpet, so either it's too hard to get up, or the vacuuming was more on the spotty side), but the hallway rug by the elevators was really dirty. I'm giving the place 4 stars, because this hotel has something that most others do not -- a family suite with two double beds and two bunkbeds. This is such an uncommon set up that it's worth looking into if you have family or a bunch of folks with you on your trip. The television is not HD. The bathroom was nice and roomy (I may have been crazy, but I believe it had a sensor-controlled fan that detected when a person sits on the, um, throne. Creepy or cool, you decide.) No bathtub if you have little ones, but the shower is very spacious. There's a business center for airline check-ins downstairs next to the fitness center. It's NYC, so it was also nice to have desk and door staff that were friendly, helpful, and polite.

Last minute trip into the city was amazing for my birthday! I had a flight the next day and decided to stay at the TRYP on 48th. Upon arriving friday, we met Victor Pulsar at the front desk, he was so welcoming and we had a good convo. I accidentally booked a the wrong size room for myself and friends and he was so accommodating, that he upgraded us to a premium suite room! Own beds and a balcony view! Made my night so great, I will 100% come back!

tourist travelling to New York was the greatest in my lifei visited New York with my family during December holiday we arrived and stayed in nice hotel near time square the place was full of plenty tourism places to visit it was very exiting for me and my children i recommend to all my friends and family not to loose this special chance to visit new York it is a great place for you and your family tourist in the world the wife and children where very very happy for this special holiday

We booked in the hotel for after christmas touring our visitors coming from country. The lady in the front desk is so rude, I believe She is some kinda racist because we asian. I said that because when she was attending to the europeans before us, she was so nice and pleasant but when its our turn she doest even do eye contact when conversing with us, doens't listen to our needs only respond as "no" and "just wait" by the way we speak fluently in english. We booked for 2 king size bedroom for our group but they gave us 2 rooms with a king size bed which we doesn't want bec we want to stay together. Apprently they said they are fully booked but we booked our room since november. When we get to our room we were told to go down and pick up our room keys ourselves because no attendant can bring it up. Room is small though. Interior seems ok descent design. Bathroom is clean and very nice not too fancy. Bed seems comfortable. Room service was bad. Room doors keep on banging when you close it. Place is just really good for sleeping not staying. Bright side is it an ideal location if you want to be walking distance around time square.

Hotel rooms are ok types, I didn't find rooms as per the cost. View from most of the rooms are nothing and windows of front rooms visible...3 star for its location very close to heart of nyc times square

Our room was on the 5th floor facing the street right above the flagpoles. As some people mentioned before, the flags did make some noises during the day, but apparently they were taken away during the night these days now, so I wouldn't worry about that anymore. The location is, as you can see from the map, very good. It's very close to Times Square while being a little bit away from the crowd. It was close to the fire station though, so anyone who isn't familiar with the sound of the siren should be aware. The room itself was fine and quite spacious considering the location. I didn't notice any problem with the cleanliness or the conditions of the room. However, the hallway looked like it needed some upgrade or more lighting. The lobby looks clean and bright, which certainly helps. In term of service, our room was knocked not once but twice, to ask us what time we are checking out (both times were around 9-10am, which is way earlier than the check out time at noon). I mean, there should be a better way than that to check if we have checked out yet. The check-in and check-out process were quick and uneventful though.Overall, I still think that this is the best hotel I could get for the rate I paid. It's probably better than a lot of hotels out there, but I would not actively try to stay here in the future.

Great hotel in NYC for location. It's clean, bed was comfortable and there is a bar in the lobby. The room is small. It was perfect for our one night stay. I would recommend it for short stays or if you just need a place to sleep in between exploring NYC. My only complaint is that the shower took forever to warm up. I wound up taking a cold shower but my husband got to take a warm shower. However, we would stay here again.

We loved the room, it was very clean and cozy. Yes, it was on the smaller side but it had all that we needed so who cares? The staff at the front desk are extremely nice! Especially Suny, what a lovely woman! So helpful. Location is fantastic. Not a bad thing to say about this place. I have seen some negative comments about this place and I have come to the conclusion that some people make it their mission in life to find something wrong with everything; they just like to complain! It's a nice place! So go check it out.

Round the corner from Time Square and 2 minute walk to the underground going up and downtown. Rooms were clean and presented nice. Mid range hotel and a reasonable price. Would stay again in the future.

Room was larger than most apartments and ours even slept 6. Room overlooked fire station which was loud at all hours. Bunk bed - broken, lamp - broken. Only given 2 towels...for 6 adults. Tiny slooooow elevator. Breakfast was supposed to be included which it was but only for 1 person/room/night. What?!??? All staff were rude. Front desk clerk wouldn't let us check in early but people both before and after us could. Had to store luggage until room was ready but there was a fee to do so and a 20 minute wait. Housekeeper was LOUD as she sang while cleaning which woke us up then on top of that, she kept slamming doors. In addition, she didn't thoroughly refresh the room - no coffe, only 1 towel, no washcloths, etc. left doors propped open while she ran back and forth for supplies and talked loudly about foreigners needing to go back home. Breakfast buffet did offer quite a few choices which was nice but not worth the argument with the server on "guard". Stay at your own risk.

Although the location of this Hotel is very nice, it is very close Times Square. But our overall experience in the hotel was very bad. Firstly, the rooms are tiny... and on top of that we were given the "Fitness Room" which basically includes an Exercise Cycle in the room. As it is the rooms are small, the inclusion of the cycle makes them very congested.Secondly, we even happen to spot a mouse (Near the side table) in our room. Upon informing the Reception / Front Desk, there was no apology for a situation like this. Like they didnt care or rather customer service was never a matter of concern.We really dont expect this kind of service from Wyndham Hotels.When I informed the Front Desk / Reception about the mouse being seen, he has the audacity to tell the guest to come down with all the bags ad collect the new room key. REALLY WYNDHAM... please teach your staff some Guest Relations / Customer Management.. rather basics of Hospitality.Eventually I asked the Front Desk / Reception to send the Hotel Staff to take our bags along with the new room key. I inquired with the person who came to collect our bags that was it normal to see a mouse in a Hotel of such high standards.. and he replied that he wasnt surprised to hear about the mouse.They gave us a new room, Premium Room.. which was at least better than the earlier one.. Luckily no mouse was spotted there. I appreciate that I was given a better room that the Category I had booked, but spotting of the mouse along with inconsiderate staff attitude was totally not acceptable.

We stayed here for 4 nights for a bit of a romantic getaway. The hotel is definitely in a great location, but the rooms are quite claustrophobic and not entirely clean. TRYP is good if you are just looking for somewhere central to sleep. In the future I would prefer to stay somewhere more relaxing with bigger rooms and less people around, such as Greenwich or Soho. The staff weren't exactly friendly at the reception desk and we had a very unpleasant experience trying to order a car to get us to the airport. The concierge flat out refused to help us and we ended up using Uber instead.

I have to applaud Whydham's attempt at the hip boutique hotel. I'm not sure they can sustain the amazingly personal and kind service, but I have to tell you it was very impressive. Upon arrival, we were immediately offered drink coupons and upgrade. While the upgrade room was small, it was highly functional space for work, luggage and bathroom. The room was "Eat off the floor" clean and modern. My only suggestions for improvement are better quality toilet paper and a shower that does not get the entire bathroom wet. The location is well how can you beat it! Heart of Manhattan! Would recommend as long as price does not exceed $150 a night.

Great location. Hotel very quiet only noisey from the sirens outside.. hotel is very hotBreakfast was quite good as eating outside hotel is expensive. Over all great hotel. Very helpful at reception!! Thanks to the lovely lady at reception with the short blonde hair for her advise on the best ways to getting to the airport.!! Took the train back, very handy and cheap! 8 dollars compared to 65 in a taxi!!

Stayed here 1 night during a quick US open trip in September. Pros: Great location, walking distance between two subway stops and slightly removed from the 'madness' of time square on a quiet street in the heart of theatre district. Friendly staff and modern look. My room had an exercise bike and although small was nicely appointed.Cons: annoying uneven flooring b/w bathroom and main room so you stub your toe repeatedly. Also had a weird 'open' shower so even with curtain you end up spilling a puddle of water onto the floor. Heater/AC in the room was noisy and disruptive. Thin walls so quite noisy irrespective of time of day.Overall, it was fine for a short stay. Usual NYC small room size but clean. Would repeat.

Very friendly staff willing to help in any situation, rooms pretty small and a bit noisy (tiny walls and frequent traffic on a street side), clean bathroom, breakfast ok. Would recommend for a short touristic stay, Times Square just around the corner.

My husband and I spent one night at the Tryp. We had a great stay. Although very small our room was clean, well appointed and very comfortable. We will definitely be back. The staff was helpful and friendly. The bathroom is tiny but plenty of towels and everything you need. Can't beat the price!

I would like to thank Trish and the other girl receptionist for dealing with our issues smooth and efficient... only fault is the air con unit sounds like a plane in the room taking off hotel in a great position for everything just take good walking shoes and see the city will be back

Start with the location-right next to 2 theaters, steps away from many more-which is perfect for those looking to see a few plays while in the city. Then onto the hotel itself with literally every employee we ran into being friendly. The gentleman who checked us in, Victor Polsar, was very helpful getting us a room that met our needs. Then he really made our day by giving us vouchers for free drinks and breakfast when we mentioned we were celebrating a birthday. The room was clean and served our needs. The room had all marble walls in the bathroom and a desk with a marble top which we liked. They had a plug/strip on the desk with several usb ports which is quite convenient. The toiletries were high end from a line from Gilchrist and Soames. The breakfast was extensive. They had eggs, sausage, bacon, French toast, pancakes, etc. But they also had cereals, fruits, yogurt, lots of pastries and breads, and hot beverages. You could fill up for the day!One thing we noticed was that every employee we saw greeted us with a smile and was helpful. From Victor checking us in to the staff at breakfast everyone made us feel like they would do whatever they could to help. Even a housekeeper getting off the elevator made sure to wish everyone a good day. I have already urged some family to go here and we will definitely return! Great hotel!

I have been raving to all my friends about the accommodations for our group of five (3 granddaughters, daughter and me) at the Tryp. We booked the family room. The bathroom was huge as was the bedroom. 2 bunk beds and 2 queens, $250.00 in the middle of NYC...can't beat it. It was walking distance to the theater and an $8.00 cab ride to Penn Station. Staff was very accommodating and pleasant. We had a fabulous time seeing all the sights and Lion King! We'll be back!

We are a family of three traveling to NYC every year. As we like to try new hotels every time we thought this one was good to try. As we come to the hotel, check in was poorly, the man on the reception wasnt very inviting at all. Then we come to the room(a smaller size than the one we booked online) but still ok, we bump into everything cause of the uneven floors. This is not a normal thing for me to experience at an hotel, but yes we lived this this for about a week. Next problem, we did not have a remote control to the tv, so we asked the reception for one. But little did I know that I needed to ask about 5 times for getting the remote control. I am not being pessimist, I work in the hotel business myself. But yes, the positive side? Good sized bedrooms.

Great location for a central base for nearly all attraction.The room was not very spacious but adequate for what we wanted, a bedroom to sleep in!The bed was very comfortable.The bathroom was very small but nice and clean. The shower was very good, nice pressure but a full door would help with the splashing out on to the floor.The only real criticism of the room is the dark decor which is unsuited to a building surrounded by high buildings as ther is little natural light.The staff seemed a little disinterested and could be heard complaining to each about guests who asked questions or help.We used the airport shuttle booked through the hotel concierge which was €55 plus tip which was $5 cheaper than taxi ($60 +tip). On a Thursday afternoon it took us 1hour and 15mins to get to JFK with one other hotel pickup so factor that in when booking a time. For a reasonable rate this hotel ticks all the boxes for a comfortable stay in a central location.

For NYC I think the TRYP was fantastic. We stayed for 9 nights over the Xmas & New Years period. The price was at least 30% - 50% less than other hotels around times square & the facilities were great. Yes the rooms are small, but that's apart of the adventure of staying in NY city unless you have $1000 US dollars to blow on accommodation every night. The staff were fairly helpful & there's a gym downstairs.

For the price you pay, the location is amazing. You're in the heart of everything, I walked just about everywhere. The staff was helpful and friendly. The room was small, something I'm not used to, but it grew on me. The shower was modern, the bedding was alright. The only thing I wasn't pleased with was the lighting, it was so dim, but I figured there wasn't any changing that. A wonderful stay none the less.

We really like the location and the room! Everything was clean and the staff was nice. I got a great deal through Travel Zoo on the room rate, so that was a bonus! I read the reviews before I booked so I knew to expect some possible bate and switch tactics.When checking out I found they had charged me an additional $65 per night. I was told it was a mistake so they took some of it off and now I only owed $21.00 more per night for unit taxes and such. This went on for a while. next I only owed $7.00 more dollars. Anyway I just kept showing her my confirmation email which specifically included all taxes and refused to pay a penny more. Finally I paid what I was promised! Now to get my car. They quoted me $55.00 per night but to pick it up I had to pay $65 because its an SUV? Really? I didn't have that one in writing, but I will next time!

Unwelcoming start with front desk agent challenging my presence in the lobby ("Can I help you with something?") then having the gall to make some sort of comment regarding my being a "VIP" after it became apparent to him that I was attempting to check in. This would set the tone of the detached, vaguely disingenuous but not wholly unpleasant service I would encounter at Tryp Times Sq. Nobody was truly rude, nor did it seem like anyone really gave a crap about me either.Room was clean, with a fair amount of wear and tear to the newish appointments; same went for the mattress which was in need of an update. Stiff, striped pillowcases on pillows that seemed more suitable for a daybed or sofa. Oddly placed AC unit in room's (#1319) only window meant a bunker effect with no view and limited sunlight through the upper aperture only if one chose to raise curtain all the way. Acrylic faux wood floor with no carpeting. Decent (for me) lighting with dimmer and no desk. Dorm style cube fridge in room. Enigmatic older HVAC setup.Tiny bathroom was pristine and well laid out, size and lack of counter space considered. Decent enough towels, excellent mirror, half glassed-in "Euro" style shower with no door. Generic but decent Gilchrist & Soames soaps/amenities.At the end of the day, it reminded me of a cheap version of the Distrikt over on 40th St, or an upgraded version of Pod 51. For the very reasonable price I paid, I don't think there's anything really to complain about and in fact would say Tryp 48th St probably represents a good example of a "if you just need a cheap place to sleep and don't plan on spending a whole lot of time in your room" hotel in Times Sq/Theater District - provided the price is right.

Stayed in the Tryp twice this month because of College Unifieds in NYC. The first trip was a Travelzoo deal and we were upgraded from a standard queen room to a family suite. It was amazing amount of space in a newly renovated hotel. My daughter and I couldn't believe our good fortune. The staff were friendly, kind, and very helpful. The hotel clientele were nice too. We were in the heart of the theater district so excellent location for shows. The second time we stayed there later in the month, we asked them to match the same rate and they did. And then they upgraded us to another family suite and it was just as amazing. Most of all, the hotel and its staff rocked their jobs. There was a snow storm, a city-wide ban on traveling and many of them not only had to work double shifts, but couldn't get home to their loved ones. And they still provided service with a smile and good attitude. I would highly recommend this hotel. Comfy bed, clean, good service and great location.

when making the hotel reservation online I reserved a certain type of room with meals but when I called to confirm with the call center they couldn’t find my hotel reservation. The call center made one for me but that room type/meals wasn’t available. They also told me about a parking garage that was a few blocks away that was cheaper than using valet. I loved the pictures online so we really wanted to stay at this hotel. Once we arrived we asked the bellmen/valet guy where the parking garage was and how to get there. He gave us that info and we went over there. When we finally found the garage they said that hotel wasn’t set up anymore. I was trying to figure out why the call center told me one thing then the hotel said something else. So we find our way back to the hotel and inform the front desk on what happened with the garage then we attempt to check in. At check in, I inform the agent on what I reserved (I had screen shots) compared to what the call center booked for me and she got us checked in and we went to the room. The room was only one bed so we dragged our stuff back down to the front desk and the agent got a Supervisor on duty and he moved us to two twin beds with a balcony. The room was very nice. Upon check out we talked to Christina she was very understanding on our issues. She gave us money off of the room and asked if we would come back in the future. I lost her business card and would like to contact her for a future stay. Everyone we talked to at the property was very nice. I can't wait to come back.

You can't beat the location--smack in the middle of the theater district and near great restaurants on 8th and 9th Avenues. The rooms are small, but this is NYC. The bed was comfortable and the room relatively quiet on the 9th floor. The temperature control acted up occasionally, but nothing that made it uncomfortable in the room. Free Wifi. The lobby is very bright and the staff were very helpful.

I travelled on 29th December with a girl friend. We booked a twin room and on arrival we were given a family room. I let my friend have the large bed and I had the bunk beds,, which I had no problem with, the mattress and covers/pillow were lovely. The room also gave us two areas, which was as close to two rooms as you can get.We expected it to be noisy at night, but it was much better than I expected, and slept no problem. Check in was quick and easy.The location was amazing. We didn't do the ball drop as we couldn't stand for a long period of time but went to a club in the same road ( which was pretty poor & expensive,but, we made best of it) The Thai restaurant next door is a must, great food. On New years eve, the roads began to be blocked off from about 4, we returned from a day out at about 5 and found it difficult to get through the barriers, even though the hotel staff gave us passes. But, after trying several roads, we found one that let us through. The police will only let you into the block that your hotel is in. You cannot pass through closed roads to get to it. We did panic a bit but it all worked out fine.After midnight, we wandered the streets, enjoying watching the clean up mission and chatting to police officers.The hotel is two blocks from the ball drop itself, very close.We had no problem getting about, using the subway and seeing the sites. We went on a budget and found many places to eat that did not break the bank. We also bought pretzels or pastries for breakfast for cheapness. We were too the subway is difficult but it really wasn't.I loved New York. I would definitely recommend this hotel, location and service, everything we wanted. I would return if the deal was right. Oh, we paid about £795 for 3 nights over New Year, which was between 1000 & 1100 dollars.

Booked hotel for 3 nights to celebrate my granddaughter's 21st birthday. We were a group of 4 adults. I choose this property because they have family rooms. Very pleased with the size of the room. 2 sleeping areas were separated by the bathroom.The space gave us plenty of room to spread out. I loved the location on 48th ST. and 8th Ave. near many eateries, 2 blocks from Time Square and 3 blocks from subway.The down side was that the bathroom had no counter space or shelf to place items. With 4 people the bathroom we had to keep moving our articles out of the bathroom.

Great experience hotel was fabulous value room was clean we were on 9th floor in family suit. Staff were helpful breakfast was a bargain and fresh and delicious each day would recommend we got a great deal at 200 night for 5people

The location was great, but the hotel had a lot of drawbacks. The shower took forever to get hot. The room on the other hand was too hot and we had to run the air conditioning in the middle of January. The bed was also very soft.

From the min we pulled up the experience started and not once was or bad Rooms are small but your in NYC The bed & pillows "Great" Very clean the staff was "Great" will return Ideal location for the city right off Broadway and 42nd plenty to do and easy to get anywhere in the city

We booked this hotel months ago to celebrate my Daughters 21st Birthday in NYC, whilst you cannot fault the location you can fault just about everything else! on arrival the surly gentleman behind the reception chose to ignore me and my family, until I asked him if we could check in, which he did eventually, we were given our 3 room keys, on our way up to the rooms we noticed the very tired and grubby appearance of the lobby/stair areas, going into our rooms did not improve, they were grubby, the bathrooms in each room smelly, I phoned the aforementioned receptionist and said that we were not satisfied with the rooms, his reply was " well you can be upgraded for another $75 bucks per night per room, then put the phone down on me!! Consequently we looked at other rooms which were equally gross and promptly checked out!

The hotel is in a great location in time square central to everything bus station subway ticket office theatres shops all in walking distance we went on Boxing Day so New York shop window displays were amazing xmas shows are a must the Rocketeers are really something else didn't think it was my kind of thing but honestly amazing to watch.Rocks fella views are amazing & Radio Ciity Tour is a must the Nnew York ticket gets you into over 80 attractions saving a fortune it's well worth the money, the beds in the hotel are the comfiest I've slept in very helpful staff never ate there as wanted to be up & out and try different places to eat so can't comment on food would definetly stay there again

I can forgive a bartender with no knowledge of wine because this is a sleepy bar and she was very nice. I can forgive a really bad house pour because it was a good measure (even though it was so bad I couldn't finish it). I can forgive a poorly lit room because that seems to be a trend these days. I can forgive no hot water in the shower in the morning because I'm sure it was a glitch and they will fix it. BUT I cannot forgive them wanting to charge me $2 to leave my suitcase for a few hours after checkout. I checked out four hours early from the room - I could've left it in the room for free for god's sake... it's just miserly and stupid and poor business. Side note: I like the Tryp Hotel on 35th street. I know I've left a bag there for free, they are friendly, the food is good, much better experience. So odd.

Stayed here just before Christmas. Hotel was in fabulous location. Can't beat the proximity to everything. Also can't beat the $5 drinks at the bar. Hotel was very clear, staff friendly. Elevators a little dated and slow, but whatever. Hardwood in rooms is a plus - no gross hotel carpet situation. Only downfall is that it is a few buildings down from a firestation and its pretty darn loud. If you are a sound sleeper or bring earplugs good on ya!

I travel often and use Wydham brands. I was bit all over by bed bugs while at this hotel. I felt something crawling in my sleep but thought it was just me. I woke up the next day with red bumps all over my body. My room was extremely cold and the front desk staff was a bit rude.

When arriving to this hotel we had a very warm welcome, we got told breakfast would be cheaper for a family however when we went to book it the next day they refused and said it was the wrong information the staff member had told us.our room was tiny and we asked to move to a bigger size which was agreed. On the 4th night we came back to the hotel with 6 fire engines outside as there had been a fire in the kitchen, when we were allowed in it smelt very strong of smoke that same night at midnight the alarm went off again-worst thing is you can only hear it from the corridor and not your room. We asked about what had happened and they told us next door had a fire even thou it was on the news and online that the hotel did. The hotel is next to a fire department so not good if you are a light sleeper.The hotel staff here are not very helpful, they come across very rude when you ask for advise or have a question. I wouldn't recommend this hotel as I felt there was more bad then good.

Great location, just what we needed to explore New York. Smallish rooms with a great shower, perfect for a couple visiting for a few days. Hotel has a trendy bar with helpful staff. Overall this hotel is good value for money

Some people deserve to be mentioned. I met Ms.Suny today asking for update for my room key cuz I made 2nd extension at this hotel. She just gave me complementary breakfast but she saved my day. I wish her a successful life and special thnx to her. Evrything is wonderful and amazing.

If you want to be close to Times Square this is the place to be! Just half a block from Time Square. Walking distance to just about anything. First time in NYC and have heard rooms are very small. This room was very small but the hotel staff was very helpful and nice. Very comfortable bed.

TRYP is situated at the centre of everything. Located at just one block from Times Square, it is the best choice for anyone. Reasonable rates. Rooms are spacious, clean and perfect. Free wifi added to the fun. Surrounded by restaurants and food stalls you have pretty much everything you would look for.I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a stay in New York City!

I was traveling solo, so the room was fine in size. The place is loaded with trendy young people who helped this "boomer" remember his youth. The decor is modern, and the rooms are very technology friendly - things like four port USB chargers. This is an ideal place for a Broadway theatre weekend. Off season rates were quite affordable, and the staff very helpful and friendly.

Located one block from Times Square, this hotel offered everything I needed for my visit. Reservations were made and pre-paid through Travel Zoo at an exceptional price, so I had my doubts. But I was wrong. This hotel, with its modern, sleek lobby was exactly what I needed. The rooms were European sized small, but extremely clean and modern. Bathroom was also European Style/sized, but shower was excellent. Close to everything. I was absolutely impressed. Only reason I don't give this 5*s was because of the room size. But since all we needed was a central place to sleep, this room was perfect for my needs. Room did not face the street, so it was very quiet. Great staff made this place even warmer. Wifi was OK. Not great, but not bothered by repeated login either. I would 100% be happy to stay here again, should the need arise.

Pros: Central location, close to every attraction in the city, close to subways and restaurantsCons: Poor sleep quality, LOUD hotel - noise from outside, room temperature too high and uncontrollable, poor service (had to call 5 times for towels)Couldn't sleep a all

Less than a block from Time Square. Great location. Rooms are small but comfortable with modern conveniences and appointments. I booked through Travelzoo for Thanksgiving weekend. Awesome deal. I had to wait a bit to check-in so they even comped me breakfast which is excellent but not included with most packages.

A little disappointed in TRYP by Wyndham. Stayed in Wyndham resorts before and they were great. Understanding rooms may be smaller in NYC but this room with a king bed was tiny. 18" sink in bathroom, faucet was loose, smoke detector in lobby kept beeping. They have no vending machines even though they had signs for them. It was cold so when asked for a cab they suggested we just flag one down ourselves. No coffee in lobby except during their breakfast and charged $3 each. There was a fire station next door so sirens all night. Not the worst place for the price but I'd try something different next time. On a positive note, great central location.

we really enjoyed our stay at TRYP on 48th. Hotel is in great location, and all was very nice.. Special thanks to Trish at the front desk for her helpfulness and hospitality. I recommended this to family members and they have already enjoyed the TRYP

I stayed at the hotel twice this December, and over New Year, spending a total of 9 days. The first room was so small I couldn't get from one side to the other without tripping on something. The second room was slightly better. In both cases the bathrooms are so tiny , and the shower messes every where. The rooms were very dirty, there was so much dust under the bed, it was a like a dustball. My sheets when I arrived had stains and had not been replaced before arriving. The rooms air conditioner was allowing cold air to come from outside, due to gaps. Some staff are rude. The reception ladies were wonderful. The security guy upfront was also very helpful. The hotel has its faults but is well placed has wonderful restaurants nearby, but needs some attention. The adjoining rooms are very noisy and I could hear everything next door.

Our room was tiny and not worth the price. You get charged $75 for a resort fee because they offer free Wi-Fi and a fitness center. Who goes to New York City to exercise when you're out walking day and night? Employees were not helpful or friendly - when we did need the concierge, there wasn't one on duty.

I booked this hotel purely because it advertised rooms with a bath / showerwhen I booked online I requested a room with a bath when I checked into the hotel I was told there were no baths in the whole hotel I complained.I was told the baths had been removed in March and had the advertising been adjusted then I would not have booked this hotel.This is false advertising - when I booked the baths had been removed

Location is fantastic, right off Times Square. Family suite was roomy,clean and very modern. Hotel staff from front desk to maids friendly and helpful. Quiet given all the activities over at Times Square. Reasonably priced. Close to the subway. For New Years eve when the ball has finally dropped it's great to have a very short walk to hotel. Would definitely stay there again on our next trip. Would strongly suggest trying the eats at the Food Emporium (8th Ave and 49th) just around the corner from the hotel which was great for breakfast and lunch.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights early December. When we arrived they didnt have any suites available, which we had booked, but offered us 2 double rooms next door to each other and complimentary breakfast for myself, husband and 2 teenage daughters. This suited us as we now had 2 bathroom!!The hotel is not luxurious, but very comfortable with a modern feel. Staff were very helpful and the location is just perfect, literally 30 seconds away from Times Square, but still manages to be away from the chaos.Must just mention the beds, the most comfortable any of us had ever slept in.I would recommend this hotel, especially for vale for money.

Located just a short walk from Times Square, I must say that it was worth every penny! The rooms are on the small side but totaly functional, and the downside was mainly the noise either from the outside or from the ac. We stayed for three days, which was just about enough - close to Times Square also equals a looot of people!

I stayed here over Christmas with my friend, the hotel was nice, clean and hotel staff helpful. The only annoying thing is the elevators, one of them didn't work and the other 2 were sooooo slow! We would wait forever for the elevator to arrive, and when it did it was pretty full. One time, we were going down and the elevator stopped on every floor, the poor people on the lower floors had no chance of getting in. It was like a scene out of a comedy, a crammed elevator stopping at every floor. Otherwise, the rooms are nice and clean, clean bathroom and free wifi. Breakfast was around $17 and had a pretty good selection. Location was great, we were in walking distance to a lot of key tourist sites. Overall a hotel I would recommend

My mom found this deal on Groupon and we decided to stay at their location on 48th considering we would be doing a lot of sightseeing in midtown. The hotel is a bit tiny but met our needs. We were checked in quickly and went up to our rooms. The bathroom was newly redone and looked very nice. One thing we encountered after using it was that the water would get everywhere since the glass shield was not long enough to keep the water inside of the shower. It looks pretty but what a nightmare that must be to clean every morning for the maid staff. The king bed was very comfy. I loved the full-length mirror inside of the closet. We got this hotel for $99 the Friday night weekend before Christmas, which was unbelievable. I would definitely stay here again if the price was right. The only complaint is that we could hear people leaving their rooms as early as 6:30 in the morning and their doors slamming. And not just once, at least a dozen times. Just a side note, check out Patzeria Family Restaurant which is within walking distance. Great Italian and pizza family-owned business!

This was a last minute trip to New York for NYE. Really last minute as in it was booked December 26. Snagged a sale through Priceline they were having for $215/night. Are you kidding me? There has got to be a catch. Booked for 2 nights 12/31-1/2 so for 2 nights the total was $501. But I should also note that my room was covered through my credit card company so all I had to actually pay out of pocket was $3.80 for hotel fees. OK so NYE is finally here. We hit the road at about 7:30am from Baltimore and arrived in NY around 11. I was told by hotel staff that the parking garage that they validate for is Quik Parking on 50th street between 8th and 9th. It's actually attached to a theatre but the name of the theatre escapes me. The hotel fee at the garage is $45/day (exactly 24 hours) If you go beyond that 24th hour you will be charged another $45 for another daily rate.. With that being said, if you don't plan to move your car at exactly the 24th hour, it'll be cheaper to use the garage regular hourly rate. Ex. after checkout we decided to get breakfast which was around 11:00, by the time I went to get the car out of the garage which was 1 hour beyond my 48th hour I was being charged another $45 for the day. Total for parking with the hotel discount was $135, however the gentleman at the garage told me that he would charge me the garage rate which made the total $122.Anyway, back to the hotel. Thankfully upon arrival around 11:00 we were allowed to check in which was a smooth process and not made to wait until 3. Waited in line about 10 min and then off to my room 322 (facing the street). Because of other reviews I was a little skeptical about being in a room on a low floor and facing the street due to noise. But I'm a city girl and I felt like, what's the worse that can happen. Obviously there was noise but not enough to keep us from sleeping. Yes I heard sirens and horns in the distance but even being directly across the street from a roof top bar I didn't even hear any NYE/partying noise from that. The only noise we heard which really grated on my nerves was from the flag pole banging in the wind. The banging of poles in the middle of the night is very annoying. Again, not annoying enough to piss me off in NY on NYE. Cute little quaint but modern room. I loved the wallpaper which is actually a map of NY. The beds and pillows were not too soft and not too firm but a very in between comfortable and the linens were of good quality. The room was small like other reviews stated but how much time are you spending in the room anyway. It was 2 of us and it was just enough room. I also read complaining reviews of no outlets to plug in electronic devices. Not true. There was an iHome on the right side of the bed where you can plug your iPhone into that or plug another device into the USB outlet on the iHome . On the left side of the bed there's 2 USB outlets. You also have a small closet with hangers, iron and ironing board. Coffee maker was a plus for me as well. The only thing that I would actually have to complain about is the size of the bathroom. It was literally a matchbox. No sink space for anything except about 3 of those 3oz liquid bottles that you have to carry on airplanes. I'm only 5'2 and while sitting on the toilet (which sits really low) my knees were about 2 inches away from the wall. Not sure how anybody taller or heavier than me can use this toilet without being crunched against the wall or falling into the shower. If you are tall, heavy or have any kind of disability you may want to request a larger room. I believe my room was the cheapest/standard room. My other complaint would be the shower. The water pressure was high and the water gets very very hot but please install a shower curtain or door. Other reviews stated that their floor got soak and wet due to the lack of a shower curtain. I have to admit that we just put a towel on floor and honestly the towel was barely wet. Problem solved. For me it's still kind of awkward taking a shower with nothing there though.Check out was easy breezy, just gave them my name and checkout was done. We decided to eat breakfast after checkout so we just dropped our bags off with the bellman. NOTE: Theres a $2/item fee for bags to be held. Now this is what I have a problem with or maybe I'm just spoiled by this service being free minus tip in other tourist places such as Vegas or LA. Would I stay here again? Yes, April 2016

My son and I took an unexpected trip to NYC and needed a place to stay for one night in the middle of it all. TRYP is about a half block off Broadway/Times Square near the M&M's store. Awesome location, even more quiet than I thought. Found a great rate for a queen bed room. Upon arrival we were able to check in about an hour early. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our room #307 was perfect for us. Typical size for NYC. Clean and had everything we needed. (See pics below). Only downfall, no view, but we were only there 1 night so no big deal. Would recommend this hotel to everyone! We can't wait to stay there again!

Floors dirty in halls, rooms small -even for NYC standards.... Very small lobby, no where to hang out..Staff ok but not that friendly ... Bar doesn't open til 4p....very good location near Times Square in theatre district. Noisy as little to no sound proofing....good bar next door and a lot of good restaurants near-by....just ok...3 star atBest.... Best thing about hotel is location... Would not recommend and would not return.

We stayed over New Years and were really happy with our choice of hotel! Room was small but clean, modern and more than comfortable. Amazing location! Staff were very friendly and always helpful! Free wifi connection was always working. Only complaint was the room was a little hot in temperature and although we could it down with air con it was very noisy! I would definitely recommend this hotel as its great value for money!

When we showed up to check in, they had lost our reservation even though we had a confirmation number. It took them an hour to find it (calling various people) and they were rude to us the entire time! We paid over $300 dollars a night for a room that was barely the size of our bed and yet they acted like they were doing us a favor. Shocking, even for New York City. Go there only if you don't care how you are treated.

We really enjoyed our stay here from 12/10-12/13. A turn to the right nd you are a block away from Times Square. Our room was nice and modern, a typical size for NY hotels. The only complaint I had is not much lighting in the room and he bathroom is even worse. i prayed each day I was not going to walk out looking like a clown from putting makeup on in such dim light. Our room overlooked the Buffalo Wild Wings on the other side of the block. At no time was there any noise we could here outside. Checkin and out was easy enough. There is a bar in the lobby although we couldnt get one as we wanted when we checked-in, the lady had "stepped away" and no one else could grab us a beer. Dont know about rate, we stayed with our Wyndham points with which I say in my opinion Wyndham has the BEST rewards program out there. 15,000 points per night no matter where you go. We plan on staying here again next year!

I love this hotel. A block from Time Square. I walked to theaters at night and walked to hop on off bus during the day. Great staff. Room is small, but we'll appointed. I plan on staying here in return visits.

Property is nice and clean. Rooms very small. Valet was a nightmare, they brought wrong car at 1st, took about an hour total to get my car. Charge entire amount on credit card even though portion was already paid, tried to fix, but didn't happen.

Let me fully detail my experience here so I don't sound like a brat asking for more than can be provided. Summary:Bad roomBad ACBad customer serviceBad bathroom (not hygiene wise) Good spaceAverage priceWe arrived at the hotel earlier than the check-in time and were told that we could leave our bags and come back later so we did. We returned later at night and were checked into a room on the 12th floor that was right across the elevator. I thought this was going to be a noise issue, but it wasn’t. We walked into the room (double beds room) and I was surprised to find the rooms were pretty spacious. The bathroom is small and the toilet is very close to the shower but this wasn’t a problem; what might be a problem to other people is the fact that the water from the shower spills out because there’s only half of a glass screen. I guess the solution is to face the shower head towards the wall. **HOWEVER, although the rooms were spacious, it doesn’t make up for the fact that 1) the air conditioning was leaking, 2) there were shorts left on the floor of the bathroom, 3) the TV wasn’t working, and 4) Costumer service was terrible. We called downstairs and they said they’d send someone right away. Thirty-five minutes and a couple of phone calls later we finally got a repairman who said the air was frozen. He “defrosted” it and said we should turn it back on in thirty minutes. There’s no thermostat, by the way, just a knob on the air with handwritten instructions and, of course, the knob was way off. Either which way we waited thirty minutes, turned it back on, and prayed that it would work. The next day we went out into the city and came back at night. It was well beyond 12 am which is typical in New York City. We didn’t ask to have the room made because we didn’t want to risk it. The pillowcases didn’t smell very clean and we were fortunate enough, I feel, to have clean sheets the first time around; if it’s not broken, don’t fix it. However, it was three of us in the room and we did need some extra towels. Well, readers, the response we got was, “We don’t do that past 12.” I’m almost one hundred percent sure that other hotels will provide towels if you ask. Right then and there another hotel guest starts inquiring about whether they can get help for a lady that was feeling ill in the lobby and she was told, “Well…if she’s not a hotel guest…” and the guy shrugged. The audacity. Icing on the cake? THE AIR WAS STILL BROKEN. I left the next morning thinking about how I never want to stay there again. It was a matter of providing some service and being kind enough to care. I hope the hotel can read this and improve. Considering the price, which wasn’t terrible for this time of year, they could’ve given a bit more.

Decided to spend Christmas Eve/Day in NYC. What a great way to spend the holiday! the City isn't as crowded. You can actually see the decorated windows on 5th Ave without waiting in a line. We even got a Fast pass to sit on Santa's lap at Macy's. This hotel is very modern and clean. Small but really efficient rooms (you're in New York, why would you be in your room?) They have an awesome valet service for your car that is a bargain & a half. Front desk was wonderful & let us check in early. Which was a godsend since it allowed us to go out & about & come back to take a nap. Staff awesome & helpful.

Stayed with a group of friends for a girls night. Family room is awesome and the floor we stayed on was recently renovated with modern decor which was a nice touch. Rooms were a good size for Nyc. One room we rented had a balcony which was awesome and unexpected. Clean room and bathroom. Would definitely stay again.

I found the room to be excellent and the staff to be friendly and efficient.The location was perfect for me in the heart of the Times Square area.I was attending a theater performance which was in walking distance.

Great location for a short stay in NYC to see Broadway shows - walking distance to Theaters and Radio City Music Hall. Also many dining options within a short walk. Also great price for this area. I have a family of 5 and we got a family size room that sleeps 5/6 comfortably. However, not big enough to hang out in room - just sleeping and showering. We got a handicapped room which was ok, but seeing some of the online hotel pics - a standard family room looked better (single vanity vs dbl vanity, and glass enclosed shower vs wide open). A few complaints though; room was hot even with 2 A/C units, the iHome clock radio is way outdated, bathroom sink was very slow drain, and the upright lamp was broken. Staff was friendly and quick to bring more towels when needed.

Newly renovated, good location, nice design. Rooms were small, but sufficient.We had booked a KING size bed, but got a double when we registered. We were told that they had overbooked the King rooms. People ahead of us had the same issue. They took $10 off of our bill!!!

The hotel is a small and out of the way hotel close to the subway and major avenues. We were upgraded to a suite and it was amazing! It had a sitting room, and mini kitchen and double beds. The restaurant in the first floor was great, although I only tried it for breakfast. All in all, great hotel.

Fantastic location - you can't beat the location for the price. we paid $150 including taxes ....and although the rooms are small, you are in New York City and steps away from one of the most popular places in the world. the rooms are clean and up to date. Would highly recommend and would stay again if could get for this rate. Powerful shower but no door? Also, if you like Italian, eat across the street at la masseria - one of the best meals I've had - enjoy!

Overall not bad for a typical manhatten location but for the times square neighborhood leaves quite a bit to be desired. The great? The location! Literally a block from any direction, hells kitchen to the left, times square to the right, theater district across the block and a subway at pretty much every corner. The "OTHER" nice? THE SERVICE! NO COMPLAINTS AT ALL! Exceptionally friendly and helpful front desk staff, a concierge that knows the area inside and out and the rest of the staff eager to please! The property? The front check in area is very lovely, a bit understated for a manhatton hotel but lovely just the same. The lobby is used frequently by guests and with the wonderful bar in the lobby apparantly the locals as well. Always a warm feeling though. Thats the good of it. The bad of the property. While needs a second chance from me personally as the property was under a floor by floor renovation our floor was supposably done. Overall the hotel decor and the rooms were modernly furnished. Small overall and while thats typical of nyc they are on the tight side by comparison. Even the finished areas left me with a feeling that its all a bit unfinished. Our room was adequate however there was a light above the door that wasnt attached and the naked hanging wires both gave a feeling of concern for fire and safety and NEVER was repaired. I capitalize NEVER because I brought it to the attention of the front desk, we were there for several nights and unfortunately had a room with poor flushing abilities and had to call for maintenance on 4 seperate occassions to have it unstopped thus having the maintenance ppl who were super friendly walk under it in and out every time. Other then those two particulars the cleaning staff was great, the room was accomodating and we were comfortable. Everyday a look outside the front door, regardless of morning, afternoon or night left a view of the cleaning personells carts that had to be dodged while heading to the elevators. Add to that the view of the staircase outside the window that had the same gstring tied to the handrail for our entire stay left an "unmanhatton" feel like some other hotels do. The other downside for this property is the payforbreakfast. One would think at least a continental with the price especially with the waisted room in the back of the lobby and despite the hotel being connected to the eatery. The property seems to be trying so I honestly hope it keeps it up and would recommend it!

I recently stayed at the Tryp Hotel Times Square with my partner and my parents who were celebrating their anniversary. The Tryp Hotel was amazing and upgraded my parents room to a much bigger one which made such a difference to their stay. They loved every second.The check in was quick and effortless and our request to stay on a higher floor was happily granted with rooms next to each other on the 14th floor.The hotel itself is modern and really nicely decorated and is only a minutes walk away from Times Square. The standard rooms may not be ideal for the larger/taller person, but for us they were perfect and seems slightly larger than some other hotels we looked at in the city.We didn't try the buffet breakfast but it smelled amazing and the rates seemed perfectly priced when compared to local diners. After 9 nights at the hotel it really did make the stay comfortable for us all, with everything you need right on the doorstep. The bar next door Hurleys is also a great place to hangout after a day wandering the city.Next time were luckily enough to come back to NYC we will definitely be staying in the Tryp Hotel. Great price, extremely helpful staff and lovely rooms. The cleaning staff on the 14th floor were also really nice and helpful.Great holiday made even better by a great hotel.Thank you Tryp.

Let me start by saying, my booking was a Christmas present for my sister & aunt. The point of the trip was to spend time together. I had booked one room with two double beds. We checked in our bags at one, were told that room would not be ready till 3 (no problem!) We came back at around 5 to check in & were told that our room was no longer available with no explanation as to why. We were then given 2 seperate rooms & were told that they were next to each other (not ajoining) & the rest of the hotel was sold out. The front desk associate then had her manager come speak to us. At this point we were told that there was a pipe leakage 2 hours ago in our room & it was unavailable to us. No one had contacted us in this 2 hour period to let us know of the problem. We agian were told that the hotel was sold out. By this point we were exhausted & given the busy time of year unable to get a room anywhere else. With no other choice we took the two rooms. The rooms were not next to each other but down the hallway. The small double bed left half of my leg hanging off of it, not big enough for one person let alone 2 to share. The smoke detector was covered with a plastic bag & had wires unattached. One piece of our luggage was missing a wheel. We then receive a phone call that the manager can put us in 2 rooms with queen size beds that are next to each other, one room is unavailable for the time being. So at this point we have waited 3 hours for both rooms to be set up; wasting valuable time, creating stress, and preventing us from the family time we hoped for. We then go to take a shower to find that the shower does not close, water poured everywhere and made a huge mess. We used towels to clean it up. These towels & even the toilet paper was not replaced before our check out time at 5 the next day. Bed was not made, room not cleaned, etc. and if it couldn't get any better, our breakfast the next morning was served in the lobby where there was no where to sit except at the bar right in front of the door which was freezing from people coming in and out. When going to leave we asked the concierge for help getting a taxi (apparently 5 is change of shift and most people would not stop or told us no to grand central) & were told to do it ourselves. Safe to say we will not be returning & were very disappointed.

A girlfriend and I visited New York City for a girl's getaway from 12/17-12/19 and chose to stay at the TRYP in Times Square for location and a great price!The hotel lobby was welcoming and trendy and seemed to always be busy, but service was fast each time we needed it! We arrived around 3:30 pm on a Thursday and had a very fast check-in, as our room was available right away. We reserved a small room with two twin beds, which was just enough for us for two nights! The bathroom was quite small, but again, we were out and about most of the time and only needed the room to sleep at night and rest in between activities in the city.We did have one incident with the shower when we tried to use it for the first time, we were unable to get hot water. Fortunately, the front desk sent maintenance right away and the issue was fixed within 15 minutes! The shower in our room only had a half door, which caused a lot of water to get on the ground while showering, but we made this work for our stay.We were headed to Battery Park to catch the ferry to Liberty Island on Friday, so we asked the front desk for directions to the subway to Battery Park. The man seemed confident in his directions, but he unfortunately sent us the completely wrong way and we almost missed our ferry. Luckily, we were able to ask for help at the subway station and made it just in time.The housekeeping staff was friendly and kept our room neat for the two days we were there, and we also used the bell staff to have our bags checked while we spent our last day in the city before departing home.
