It was a little bit unfortunate that we had to pay $2 per bag to have our things stored for the day, but we understood as there was very limited space in the storage room and many guests needed the service!The TRYP on 48th was a great location in Times Square off of Broadway ave and we found it to be decently quiet in terms of other guests around us and very clean! We expected our room to be small, so that was not a surprise, and overall we enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to stay here again if we find ourselves in NYC!

Here's the list of everything that went wrong. First of all, the room was extremely noisy and the windows kept no noise out. I woke up many times every night, even though I had ear plugs in and I’m generally not sensitive to a bit of noise. If you book a room, you MUST demand a room that is not facing the street side. It was also very noisy inside - every night there were noisy hotel guests past midnight, probably because the hotel is so close to Times Square. The room itself failed to cover many of the basics: no bedside table on 1 side; no electricity outlets close to bed; no wall/curtain/door around shower so that the room was soaked after a quick shower of only a few minutes; no microwave and no fridge; heating/cooling system did not work leaving us sweaty all night (in early December!) and forcing us to open up the windows, making the noise issue even worse; no glasses for water but only plastic coffee cups, and no tea bags; old and scratched furniture (although personally I don’t care about that). The service was terrible as well. In the manual available in the rooms it says that stamps are available downstairs, but when you ask, they send you to a deli a block away. There was no room service (or at least I couldn’t find it). I had to go downstairs to ask a few questions about extending my staff, and staff was markedly less friendly compared to hotels down the street. Once, I came down around 9pm and had to wait 10 minutes before anyone showed up. When he did, he told me, “Please wait”, and left me standing for another 5 minutes, completely ignoring me. Finally, Wyndham refused to give me any hotel points because I was not part of their Non-Qualifying Market Segments, even though I don’t fall in any of these market segments when you consider them one by one. At NONE of the above points did anyone of the hotel do anything to make the experience better, even though there were plenty of opportunities. They don’t seem to care about your experience AT ALL. Easily the worst hotel experience I have ever had – and I have had a few.

Picked this hotel because of its great location. That is perfect. The rooms are small and the bathroom while small is bigger than ones in Europe. The problem with the bathroom was the design of the shower where water spilled onto floor every time. There were adequate towels to dry. In spite of that I would stay again as I found the Hotel perfect to use as base

As soon as we walked into a room it smelt of damp and chemicals... The room is tiny... That bathroom is the size of a under the stairs boiler cupboard ... The shower leaks on to the tiny bathroom floor, which makes it very difficult to get ready and just constantly smells like damp... Hotel gym is the size of our room with very outdated equipment...the docking station in the room is old and only got for one type of phone... Staff at the hotel aren't the friendliest nor the worst... Oh by the way if you have breakfast included... It's in the reception area....

My husband and I spend 1+ night every week in NYC. We use the Hotels Tonight app to find good, last-minute deals. Needless to say, we've stayed at A LOT of mid-tier hotels, with a wide quality range. The TRYP is one of the better hotels in this class. Conveniently located if you have business in Midtown or Times Square, the hotel offers a modern design with clean and comfortable beds, small, updated bathrooms with tile floors and glass shower doors. The floors are faux wood tile throughout the room, which I prefer over carpet. The lighting is reasonably good, with LED bulbs rather than those hideous CFL's they use in many places. The hallways and elevators are a bit worn and tired, but that's pretty standard for this level of hotel. Overall, this hotel gets my approval. We'll be staying here again.

Stayed 7 days at this hotel, location was fantastic, room was small, cosy, one of my issues were the cleaners barging their way into our room most morning, very bad attitude, i was also interogated by i guess a security person or could have been a manager., i went out to get something to eat, he stopped me at the elevator and asked what room i was in, i knew i was on the 9th floor, he asked me for my key, i said, my family had 3, i didnt have one, he kept on at me, i was shocked! who did he think i was, seriously, just come up with me! something happened in the foyer that took his attention away from me, and i took the lift up straight away, he was rude, no matter his job! last but not least, we asked reception what was the best way to travel to the airport, we were directed to the doorman who booked an uber driver for the next day at 11am, great! we were ready to go, the 4wd was packed with our luggage, we jumped in the car, next thing we hear was a man whom im sure was the general manager of the hotel, was screaming at our driver, it was so harsh! he kept on and on, he was harassing our driver in front of us and there were people walking on the street who could here this too! our driver said nothing, offered to shake this managers hand, the manager yelled again, did not shake his hand and we took off, it was was a very intimidating experience, and unprofessional! there is a way to speak to people and this is not how educated people speak, especially with customers waiting in the car and exposed to this crap, so experience at this hotel was not the best as far as staff is concerned, really felt for the driver, who went above and beyond helping us with all our luggage at the airport, i truly wish him well :)

Spent the night here in mid-December and the location is very good; Theater District, between Broadway & 8th on 48th St.We were able to check-in around 11AM, which was great and they have a noon check-out policy, so that allows for a relaxing exit.We had a queen - "Deluxe", which was small even for NYC standards, but newly updated with a comfortable bed. We were on the 13th floor which helped greatly with the city's street noise, however, on the corner of 48th and 8th there is a firehouse which had several call-outs while we were there.I'm not sure what the hotel's "rack rate" is, but the Travel Zoo deal got us the room for $150 with tax. Great price for the location during the holiday season. Really can't be beat.Staff was friendly. Hotel had been a Best Western and is so new, neither the police nor a doorman on 48th and Broadway had any idea where it was located.

The location was right in the middle of time square, so great location as far as first timers visiting New York. The room was small, which I didn't mind because I had read reviews on it prior to coming here, so it was to be expected. The bathroom shower didn't have a door, so their was water all over the floor when we got out. Also, we notified the staff that one of the main lights in the bathroom was out, they told us that they would fix it, no one came. Furthermore, what really dissatisfied me was that the ac/heat unit wasn't controlled by the guest, it was controlled "remotely by an engineer". Our room was really hot, so we were told to let the window up, which I was not comfortable with, because I wasn't sure what was under the tarp outside our window. I also called the front desk to understand some charges that was charged to our card, and was treated in the rudest way. The lady raised her voice, tried to speak over me, and was really very unhelpful, and unprofessional. I paid the charges, I just called to understand what I was being charged for but overall that staff was just very rude. When you travel this far for an experience, dealing with rude and unhelpful staff isn't something you should have to deal with. Also, our television wasn't working, the single ac unit was broken, floor was uneven, elevator doors slammed, room door squeaked extremely loudly, hotel staff was loud while we were in our rooms, and hotel staff was rude. I wish I would've took my money and spent it elsewhere.

Pro- good locationCons-we had a very small room which could barely fit our luggage 6 nights was very hard to manage in this room keep in mind we paid 2400 so hence why we are disappointed - the noise level is horrible we were facing the fire station and could not sleep at all the doors also slam at all hours they should really be a soft close doors - I think rooms near the station should be heavily discounted - the two ladies on reception had zero personality and were actually quite rude most days they really shouldn't be the face of the company - the air con is not good does not work well and is so loud come on for 2600 for 6 nights per guest surely you can afford some new air cons??- the lifts are so small and you have to wait 5-10 mins in morning for your turn. On checkout we were 15 minutes late because only two lifts were working and we had four bags so hence why we could not take the stairs from level 8. Choose a lower floor if possible so you don't have to wait or better still don't book the hotel if you haven't already- on our last day we got a bill slipped under our door for about $230 we spent zero dollars in this hotel as it was all a rip off (breakfast and laundry Etc) so we made sure not to give them any extra of our money. Yet we still get a big bill under our door. I go downstairs to tell her we are not paying this and what is it she says its tax that wasn't paid when we booked our hotel. I said you should not allow a booking to go through if you have not got full payment I said do not charge my credit card I'm not paying she said "will you pay by cash then" another example of the ladies attitude. I said sort it out we have already paid you enough and it was all booked through a travel agent so I know it was done correctly 10 mins later we get a call saying they made a mistake. What a waste of our energy and so sneaky trying to rip us off Be very careful of this as who knows maybe they are just trying to get extra cash from tourists We have stayed at 6 hotels in our 5 week trip and this was the most expensive and the worst Look around I'm sure you will find a better place to stay!

Hotel is in a great location right in Times Square. This has its advantages and disadvantages. After reading other reviews, I requested a room on an upper floor to avoid street noise. The hotel accommodated my request and assigned us a room on the 15th floor. It didn't help. We did not get a good night's sleep. The street noise was still audible even higher up, and the heating/cooling system was noisy and difficult to get to a comfortable temperature. We kept adjusting it and it was either too hot or too cold, and very noisy. Things I liked about the hotel: very convenient location close to everything in Midtown Manhattan; chic, modern lobby; accommodating front desk. Things I didn't like: room was very small; bathroom didn't have a countertop on which to place toiletries; lots of outside noise very audible; cooling/heating system loud; questionable housekeeping (when we first arrived, we entered the room and it had not been cleaned from the previous guest). We complained at the front desk and they apologized and said the room was marked clean in the system. Then after the room was cleaned as I was walking on the wood flooring in just socks, there was something sticky on the floor - yuck! I would give this hotel just an average rating.

Pros: right in time squarePrice was affordableCons:Very small bathroomNo door on shower - water got everywhere Found TWO live cockroaches .. one was on nightstand .. yuckWater didn't get very hotStaff was not very friendlyDisappointed overall in our anniversary nyc hotel stay

This is a good option if you are looking for some place to sleep near everything in manhattan, the rooms are small with a nice view of the street (mine was 14th floor). The bed is confortable but the sheets felt like old. The bathroom was clean. The rooms is big enough for 2 people to stay.

I booked this hotel mainly due to location and after reading some reviews I was worried, but I have to say that I had no problems or issues at all with the hotel.It's location could not be better! Literally 30sec from Times Square.The room (queen) was a lot bigger than I thought and it was all perfectly clean as was the bathroom.I found the staff to be really friendly and helpful as well!Would definitely stay here again if I came back to New York!

Hotel is way to small, half bathroom. Had to keep calling about no hot water. This hotel is way to loud. All the doors SLAMS all the time. The elevators are way way slow, you can walk to the airport quicker than these elevators move. They do have valet service for an extra $55 a night. They do serve breakfast, be careful make sure you read the card, if not the waitress will try to up charge you $20 even tho breakfast is only $16.00 . This hotel wasn't worth the money, yes they gave great deals but try another hotel. I sure when you travel and had long meetings or just need a get away you want some peace and quiet.. This ISNT the hotel for that. But if you are ok with slamming doors all night, people walking past your door and you think they are in your room, this is the hotel for your you.. I am asking for my money back, the WORST TRYP HOTEL... BE AWARE...

Tryp Hotel was great! The room was nice (maybe a little on the small side) and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was extensive and tastful. Location is great, it is centrally located (up- and downtown, west and east. Ideal for a citytrip!Price/quality ratio is super!

Positives:Location to central Times Square is excellent.Hotel is clean in appearance.Breakfast was good (although the same every day).Staff friendly enough and helpful, particularly Alicia on concierge.Negatives:Sent several emails prior to stay and none were replied to or even acknowledged. Hard to contact by telephone too.Upon arrival we checked in and our toilet broke which flooded the bathroom. we were very tired and wanted a quick freshen up a drink and to get out for some food as the airport kept us hanging around in mindless queues for 2hrs and then a 3hr airport shuttle transfer which you should avoid like the plague.The handyman never arrived to fix the toilet even though we were told he 'was on his way'. In the end we gave up after 30mins and 2 phone calls. when we returned from dinner it still hadn't been attended to! and they had no other rooms available to transfer us to.Day 2 - we transferred rooms to a slightly larger room (bathroom only really) only to find that by the time we had gone back to our original room to get our bags, we went back down to the new room and found someone else in it!!! unreal! the hotel did then find us another room but it was just an unnecessary drama.Day 3 - woke early and went to the toilet to find a cockroach scuttling about. excellent!Day 4 - woken by a scream from girlfriend at 4am as she found yet another 3 times as large cockroach in the bathroom.Obviously we complained about everything, daily and the staff were apologetic and helpful. They refunded us one nights stay after the first cockroach incident and credited us $50 to pay for our return shuttle as a 'sorry' for the 2nd cockroach. all not enough to be honest but we'd had a good trip, hotel dramas apart and just wanted to leave.Won't be staying here again

We came to stay as we were incredibly excited to see the Christmas lights and see New York City for the first time, as we are from a small village in England. To start with when we checked in the receptionists were rude and disinterested in us, after much trying on my husbands part to be friendly and chat he explained we were on our honeymoon. He got a very glossed over smile and given an upgrade. Clearly their idea of an upgrade is putting us on a higher floor.. We left our luggage with the bell boy who said they'd bring our luggage up, however he shoved it into a corner in the basement for us to collect ourselves. The lifts were incredibly tiny and smelled horrible. The carpet looked like it hadn't seen a vacuum in a long while. After struggling with our cases out of the lift we then had to awkwardly work our way past a bunch of housekeeping carts that had been left in the hall. Pushed through the door into our room and by god it was tiny. The room smelled like cigarette smoke which stayed the entire time we were there. The corners were dusty including under the bed. The bed was too small for two people and our room was facing the fire station which kept us awake most of the nights we were there. We wouldn't have minded had we been warned by reception. They also failed to tell us check out time on our last day so we ended up rushing to find they checked us out without us even being ready. The staff were quite aggressive to my husband who bumped into the bellboy in the elevator and was told to "watch it" we don't recommend this place at all and it definitely ruined our New York experience.

Every year I visit NYC at the holidays with my mom and we always stay at the same hotel. This year, we thought we'd try the new TRYP in Times Square and had a decent stay. The room was your typical NYC room - small, noisy AC unit, but clean and redone recently. The elevators are so tiny and take forever which was a pain. Also, the fitness area was not very clean and extremely tight, with only 1 treadmill and elliptical plus random weight machines. The two women that I dealt with at the front desk during check in were amazing though! The best part was the location and if you can get a good deal, I would say totally worth it!

The cable in our room did not work. It took 3 nights to find another room. In. the new room we found new mattresses without springs poking through, a clock, bible and cable. They offered us two closets with beautiful views of the alley and air conditioning unit. There was only one working ice machine in the entire hotel. We loved being in walking distance of all things wonderful in New York City, but feel that we should have had a better hotel experience.

Third time to New York and best hotel I've stayed in. Location is fantastic, 2 minutes round the corner and your in the centre of Times Square. Easily walkable to Central Park and Empire State. Room and bathroom was clean and modern, had everything we needed for our stay. Will definitely stay here for all future visits.

We stayed at this hotel for our anniversary and because it was right in the middle of New York we walked every where. The room was very nice and clean and the staff were very helpful. There are a lot od great restaurants right in that area so we had a wonderful time there.

we stayed here dec 4-6 for a girls weekend. we had a premium room. rm 610 is a 2 room hotel room. one room had a double bed with tv and a dresser. the other had 2 murphy bunk beds with a desk chair and small refrig. quite roomy by nyc standards. there were robes and slippers in the closet, and 2 small bottles of water were replaced each day. there was a non descript soap,shampoo and body lotion in the bath. i felt the bath was a decent size with a walk in shower, but as others have mentioned there is only a 1/2 see thru glass shower door; no privacy and a very wet bathroom floor. prior to arrival i had received a call from the hotel requesting i confirm my prepaid reservation. the hotel is a few minutes walk from times square and well located for metro transportation. we waited about 5 min on a late fri afternoon to check in without problems. on arrival to our room we noticed a large hairball in the corner but otherwise the room and bath were clean with fresh linens. we were in the back of the hotel so noise was minimal. the hallway did have linen carts always out. the carpet in front of the elevators was dirty but appeared to be related more to renovations that they have been doing. carpet in front of our room appeared to have been vacuumed and i did notice the housekeepers with a vac and cleaning supplies each morning. we were not disturbed by them in the morning, but we were out early each morning anyway. we did not pay for the daily breakfast. the lobby was nothing special although it did seem to be always bustling with activity. would i come back, sure. good location, comfortable beds and value for the money.

We stayed at the tryp when we went to NY city to see the radio city Christmas show. The location couldn't be better. One block away from Times Square in the heart of NY. Rooms however are really small and the bathroom is even worse. No shelves to store any of your personal need items. Hardly any room to sit on the toilet and the tiniest shower I've ever seen. To make things even worse, the hairdryer wasn't working. Be very patient for the elevators as well. They only hold a handful of people, so in the morning it took at least 5 minutes before we could get on. Recap: location 10, service 7, rooms 4.

We chose the Family Room because we were 4 adults traveling and figured everyone could have their own bed. I was expecting a " Tiny NYC" hotel room but our room was huge! Definitely enough space for everyone and all our things. The hotel itself has a funky fun feel to it and is in the perfect location. Walking to everywhere was very convenient! The bar next door (Hurley's) was great for late night drinks and appetizers! The only thing keeping it from an excellent review was the Staff. While they were not rude, they did seem bothered when trying to talk to them... That is except for our housekeeper who was very personable, singing and Dancing while she cleaned the rooms on our floor! Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends and family!

The room was good and the location was excellent. However, outside our room there was an enormous pump station which prettu much made it impossible to sleep. During our second night we managed to get some earplugs... If you book this hotel make sure you get a room that is not close to the pump station.

We have just returned from a weekend at the Tryp Times Square hotel, I'll start with the positives, the location is great and the staff are friendly enough plus the aircon in the room (which surprisingly was needed in December) is great. They had excellent access for plugs etc including a USB charger plug which I liked. It's not an amazing hotel and it's not a bad hotel. A lot of the things we weren't keen on could be easily fixed. For example the room layout seemed wrong in our room (1003) the bed seemed the wrong way and gave the impression the room was smaller than it was. No full length mirror (except inside a wardrobe in the corner of a small room) wasn't great. The bed was very soft but that's just our preference. There was a bug (not sure what it was) trying to get out of the overflow in the sink on the last day which wasn't great. The hotel also gave me 2 receipts for my stay which worried me about being charged twice, it seems I've only been charged once but will keep an eye on my statement. One wall was weirdly always hot. I couldn't quite work out why but it probably explained why we needed the aircon as it was very hot to touch. It looked like it had been heavily insulated through a window outside but it was hard to tell. The door seemed to rattle as well which was weird. Even when locked it rattled if people walked down the corridor. It was a reasonable hotel for the price given what it costs to stay around Times Square and maybe some of our complaints you wouldn't experience. All in all. Not bad.

This was a great place to stay. It was central to Broadway and Times Square. I could easily walk to places to eat and local transportation. My room was very clean and comfy. I stayed in a queen room and it was small, but that's what the hotel is - smaller rooms for my affordable prices. But I really liked it! Since I was traveling alone, I felt very safe in my room. As mentioned in other posts, due to the setup of the very small bathroom, shower water gets all over the bathroom floor. But to me, the location of the hotel, it's cleanliness, and the helpful staff made up for that. My room was very quiet. Since there is a fire station at the end of the block, you'll hear a lot of sirens but again, traveling alone, that helped me feel safer (knowing emergency personnel were so close. Will definitely stay here again!

Hotel was clean and all employees we encountered were pleasant and helpful. Small lobby still offered a bar and breakfast. Beer was cold but didn't eat here. Location was good but still somewhat noisy even on 14th floor at night, mostly due to firehouse at end of block. Nice restaurant next door. Two theaters on this block and short walk to much more! A great location and reasonable costs for NYC. We'd return to the Tryp!

My wife and I traveled to NYC for a few days to celebrate my birthday, see some sights, catch a play. The TRYP by Wyndham Times Square is a typical New York hotel. A smaller room BUT a very comfortable bed, I believe the hotel underwent a renovation when it changed to the TRYP brand. The location is outstanding, only a half-block to Times Square, The hotel was always clean, and well-staffed. Now the negatives- our room was seventh floor, street side which resulted in a lot of street noise, noted in other reviews here.The elevators (2) are small, to the point of being claustrophobic, also previously noted.The bathroom has a motion sensor controlled fan. Apparently, should you take a long shower, the sensor will not note your presence through the fogged stall glass, and shuts off, resulting in more fogginess. Interesting way to encourage water conservation, TRYP by Wyndham!Finally, the bathroom lighting is very deficient, consisting of one overhead light and two smal lights inset into the mirror. I found myself attempting to shave while standing in a shadow.This location is a usable hotel, typical NYC, small and overpriced, good tourism location. So long as you understand what you will and will not receive, go for it!

quick check in - room was really nice and comfortable- great location. would definitely book and use again. within walking distance to so many go to places and theatre district, great value for the city.

We wanted a hotel in the Times Square area and could not have made a better selection than TRYP Times Square. We saw two shows while we were there and the hotel was in a short walking distance from each theater we went to as wells as each restaurant we chose for dinner. Even the inclement weather (cold and rainy) turned out to be a non-issue because the location was so convenient. The hotel itself was fine as well, there was an adequate buffet breakfast available for an extra charge, and the rooms were a little small but otherwise okay.

On arrival, we found there was no availability in the room we booked, with no hesitation the lovely front desk assistant Kumar, put us in one of the fitness rooms on 15th floor, which is an amazing room. The room was a very good size, intact an humongous size for NY rooms, clean and the beds extremely comfortable. I chose this hotel due to price and location, and it's exceptional value for money, as you are in walking distance to all the main attractions in NY, as well as public transport.We were meant to check out at midday, with our flight departing later that evening, we requested late check out and this was granted with 'the hotels compliments,' which we couldn't be more grateful for. Thank you for making it such a pleasurable stay!

I really like this hotel because it's right in Times Square, is modern and clean and usually has reasonable prices. If you don't like being in the middle of the action, then this probably isn't for you. What I like best about Tryp's is the lack of carpet. Floors are wood (laminate I assume) and it just feels cleaner to me. Bed is comfortable. Surprisingly, it was very quiet. I slept well and felt comfortable in the hotel and the area. Coffee machine in the room and wi-fi are are a plus. The room was small, but that is to be expected in this area.

If you want to be close to the heart of New York, namely Times Square, this is the hotel for you.Turn right and thirty seconds later and there it is!The rooms- ours was a Premium- are spacious, plenty of hanging and cupboard space which was excellent for Black Friday. The bathroom was more than adequate and the beds were very comfortable!We ate breakfast 'on the hoof' every morning but the breakfast area was always busy.It is so close to the theatres that you could slip back to your room during the interval!

This was a very good hotel to stay in and I would definitely return. The location was superb, particularly for a woman travelling alone. Half a block from Times Square and around the corner from subway and bus stops. Staff were very efficient (although not that friendly. Maybe that's just a New York thing?) Rooms were clean and well-equipped. I has a street-facing window onto 48th street and although low-down in the building managed to have a good night's sleep.

Great location, very trendy inside, however this trip was a special treat as an engagement surprise and I had contacted the hotel some weeks in advance of the vacation to see if there would be a possibility of upgrading our room or if there was something else that the hotel could accommodate with our special stay. I received a couple of emails stating that there could be a possibility however this could be looked at on arrival to the hotel. Unfortunately on booking in we were given a very small room, the air conditioning unit was full of dust, along with cupboards in the room, the wall paper ripped and wooden doors edges need painting. albeit the bed exceptionally comfortable, room adequate for our needs. Staff appeared friendly and helpful and after stating about the issues with the dust on the air conditioning unit we were give a complimentary drink In the bar. We were extremely upset that the hotel couldn't do more to accommodate our request due to it being such a special visit to us, but I must say the location, bed and the vibe of the hotel very good. Also I was asked to email the concierge about tickets to the Statue of Liberty crown tours, but unfortunately the email I received was very unhelpful and offered me nowhere to go with trying to obtain tickets. On checked out on our last day the staff did not ask how our stay was or if there was anything else they could do, so we never raised these issues with the hotel at the time. We wanted to send you the hotel a message direct rather than going onto tripadvisor with our views on our stay however after constant emails i have received nothing. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay, however this was a very special time for us with the engagement but have been really let down with this. We did not feel special on arrival to the hotel and sadly after a long day travelling and the excitement of the engagement we felt disappointed at the room. also communication was very poor.

This past thanksgiving week, my mother and I had the pleasure of coming to Times Square for a holiday trip to NYC. Staying at the TRYP hotel off W. 48th was a find. We really loved the proximity to all of the attractions, the subway, the restaurants, and the bright lights of Broadway. We enjoyed the modern, sleek look of the hotel lobby and the rooms and were even a little fascinated by the ultra-modern half-shower.  Unfortunately, the first room we were given left a lot to be desired. The TV in our room was partially inoperable. Local channels on TV were filled with static, unclear, and froze repeatedly. The engineer was called in to check the TV twice (once the night we arrived and again on Thursday night). Both times he said there was nothing to be done and said he’d contact the Cable company. The issue was never resolved. In addition, the beds were thin and somewhat uncomfortable. We could feel the springs in the beds when we sat up or entered / exited the bed. After talking with the front desk, we were offered a new room with a working TV. The first rooms that we were offered were smaller and did not have the amenities that were part of the standard room package and that my mother needed for her comfort. I am thankful for front desk associate, Kumar. He was not only attentive to our needs, but he was professional and sought to find a solution for us. He worked to find us a room that was configured with the same layout and amenities that were in our previous room. He arranged for our luggage to be moved, provided us an extended checkout that fit our schedule better, and even offered us drink coupons at their in-house bar. The room we were moved to more than met our needs. The beds were better, thicker, and more comfortable. The television was operational in all the ways that were expected and should be standard. This room even had some other “standard” amenities as an alarm clock. To be quite honest, if the room we were moved to was the room where we started, I can honestly say that our experience would have been great from start to finish. All in all, we had a great experience during our trip to New York and a good stay at TRYP. We would stay here again and I would even recommend the hotel to friends and family. The location can’t be beat and the modern, international flair made for a great environment. Thanks again to Kumar for his attentiveness and professionalism. Next time, we’ll have to take advantage of the breakfast buffet they offer!

I have spend couple of day mid of August in NewYork, in several hotels.But this one was far the less expensive, but this was a very good surprise, for the level of comfort, and the place to be near of every thing and especially Times Square.Quiet room (FitnessRoom) and confortable.I recommend .

Stayed here for one night in early November. Was in the city to see a show on Broadway. Hotel was literally only a two minute walk from the theatre where the show was on, its located in heart of Broadway. We got a free room upgrade and complimentary breakfast which was massively appreciated. Room was great very clean and spacious! Bar is a little overpriced. Some great bars beside the hotel anyway. Breakfast was also very good. We were able to leave our bags at the hotel the day we checked out for a fee of $2 a bag whilst we went sight seeing..Al in all would definately recommend this hotel!

My sister and I went up for a girls weekend and found this hotel last minute. Check in was easy. We were able to check-in upon arrival at 12 noon, which was nice. We tried to upgrade to a room with two beds, but they were booked so we were stuck with one. When we got to the room we discovered it was VERY small (even for New York). We didn't plan on being in the room much so the size wasn't an issue. The bathroom was also tiny, but it was nice enough. The one thing it was missing was a towel rack. There wasn't really a place to hang a hand towel, so it felt like we were always moving stuff out of the way. There were plenty of towels and some okay soaps and lotions. Most importantly, the room and bathroom were clean. There were a few issues with the room that would make me not go back. The first and most annoying was the water temperature. On the first morning, we were up around 8:30 and neither of us got a hot shower. The second morning we were up at 6:00 and we did get hot showers, but on days when I'm not leaving early, I wouldn't be up that early and enjoy a hot shower. Second, the beds were comfortable, but they were sort of like memory foam, which I don't really like. Third, they don't fully replenish the room when they clean. We drank the coffee and it was not replenished for the next morning. We also had extra towels and those weren't replenished either. Last, there aren't any curtains. They only have pull down blinds. We were on a room that faced in so the building blocked most of the light, but if you had a street view, light might be an issue if you prefer a dark room. The hotel itself is nice, very trendy NYC. The elevators are small and take a long time. The gym is decent and you can print for free in the business center.

I would not even waste your time. I booked a double room, as in 2 double beds in one room. upon arrival, I Was give two rooms with one bed each. I was traveling with myself and two daughters for the holiday weekend. I asked the check in clerk about the rooms (are the connected? why two rooms? I have two kids with me, I asked for one room) They told me no, not connected, two rooms because they were overbooked, rooms were close together so it shouldn't be a problem (not close together at all) against my better judgement I went to room 300 and 301, the rooms were not close to each other and were small. barely fit the double bed in there. Our view was of a blue tarp covering trash. there were housekeeping carts in the middle of the hallway the entire stay. I went a few hours later, and asked for a room with two beds (I talked it over with my daughters and they were not comfortable being by themselves) They told me they did not have a double room. They were over booked. so they sent me all over the hotel to look at two rooms with one bed each in them to find what would satisfy me (at one point they gave me a key to a room that was occupied). I settled on two rooms that were a little closer together, reluctantly. I really had no choice considering it was the holiday weekend. I immediately started calling other area hotels. looking for something that i could move to. eventually the manager talked to me and told me they had some cancellations so I was able to get a different room with two beds. ended up being the 'penthouse' on the 16th floor. bigger room, great view. Crappy room. floors were uneven and the fake wood floors were coming up off of the floor, the beds were uncomfortable, the lighting was horrible, it smelled, water pressure was low. Walls were very thin, there were many times that my young daughter would ask me 'whats that noise? when the neighbors were 'noisy', all around bad stay. I will say that the staff was friendly and seemed to really care about the concerns, almost like they know the problems the hotel has. The manager was very accommodating once we finally spoke. Hotel is aweful, staff was great. I did not eat at the hotel. I basically left at 6 in the morning and did not return until after midnight each day. I could not wait to get checked out. I was there for three days and then moved to the hilton for 2 more.

Truly ,, the location cant be beat - only half a block or so from Times Square and within walking distance of theatre where we saw the Jersey Boys. The lobby has obviously been re-done, but the elevators (?) (I only remember one), are tiny, old, and dirty. Hallways are dated and not very clean. Rooms were clean, but miniscule and felt sort of like being in a dorm room.

We stayed for one night. We actually live in NY but were seeing a late night show and didn't feel like having to drive home/ deal with trains at 2am. The hotel is situated in the heart of Times Square. Perfect for catching shows! The room was small (had a deluxe queen) but I've stayed in smaller! Bed was cozy, room was clean, bathroom was perfectly fine. Service was friendly and quick. Our room was right in front of the elevator but we weren't bothered by any noise, In general it was a fine stay. Great deal for an awesome location.

My husband and I checked in on Friday and checked out on Sunday. I found this hotel on my company's travel site. Using corporate rate, it still was 291 dollars a night including tax. Queen room. Near Time Square, the reviews were good. So I booked it. After all, it was my husband's big birthday. So let me list the pros and cons of this hotel. Pros: near Time SquarePros: friendly front desk. You can check out up to 1pmPros: lots of outlets to charge any technology you have. The cons:The rooms redefined petite. I am 5'2 and I felt like Gulliver. When I stood up, the bed lamps were on the level of my chin. The room was Very dark. The TV was freezing up every half hour. The old fashioned air conditioner was right next to the bed, I was freezing every night. If i turned it off, the room became stuffy. The queen size bed: I'm not sure if it was European "queen" size, it wasn't US queen size bed. I'm short, so I was lucky. My husband, who is 5"11, not so much. The bed was short. The bathroom was tiny. If I stood right under the shower, I was fine if I didn't turn, and I'm not a large women. The glass covered half of the shower stall, so by he time I was done with the shower, the floor was full of water. There was no space to put anything like toiletry. The sink was tiny. I managed to put two toothbrushes and a travel size toothpaste, and a travel size hairspray on top of it. The towels felt like hey came from a dollar store. New York is ridiculously expensive. I thought by getting a corporate rate, I would get a good hotel. Don't get me wrong, the front desk and the bell boy desks were great. Very friendly and professional people. If you are traveling on business, and there is only one short person in the room, the hotel is fine. Otherwise, for leisure..... I don't think so.

First of all a little background to my trip, I flew into Newark airport and got the Newark express bus (approx $15) to New york port authority bus terminal. From here the hotel is about a 10 min walk, and i highly advise walking, as it gives you an idea for your bearings.The hotel is less than 30 seconds from time square. Whilst breakfast is incredibly basic, the rooms are fitted to a very high standard and are incredibly clean. I stayed on the second floor which was very noisy but im a heavy sleeper so did not bother me. The staff are very helpful and can even help you arrange excursions should you need to. You are in WALKING distance of everything, Times Square, rockefeller Centre, central park, Radio City, and you are ON broadway. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone, and when I return to New York I WILL stay here!!. Breakfast I did not take at the hotel, but there are loads of Deli's 5 mins away to get a bagel, or yoghurt, or coffee, in manhattan you are never more than a block from a Starbucks. Use this as your base to explore New York!!!

I recently took my daughter on her very first vacation to New York and I totally regret my decision to stay at this hotel. Being that I have been to New York several times, I always expect for accommodations to be a small but that wasn't the issue at all. Upon arriving I will admit that I was pleased, it is a hip, funky hotel probably more appropriate for my 17 year old daughter which is why I chose it. On the first night of 3 the toilet ended up being stopped up. No big deal until it stayed stopped up for the whole time that we were there. We were pretty much forced to go use the bathroom in the lobby all day and night. Good thing we were on the 2nd floor because it took forever to get the one elevator that was operating at the time. On day two, on our way out I mentioned to one of the housekeepers that the toilet was stopped up again and she told her male co-worker that even she didn't understand why they would keep putting people in 209 because the toilet stays stopped up! Also on the 2nd and third days that we were there, they totally neglected cleaning the room at all!!!!

Stayed at this hotel 18th -23rd November. Great location for theatre, shops etc. I had a head injury on arrival at 1300 and my room check in wasn't until 1500. Staff were very helpful and genuinely caring. Gave me ice for injury, water and arranged for me to check into my room within 10minutes. Room was premium suite, Four females(same family). Room was very nice and spacious, toilet and shower were reasonable sized. Coffee machine. Large T.V's.Fridge for own use.. Heating,Air Conditioning and beds were very comfortable.Never ate in hotel but bar prices for cocktails and champagne very reasonable.Only constructive criticism would be more storage space needed. Yes the fire station was close by but we were not in room much to hear it. Maybe three times at most. I would definitely return to this hotel on my next visit

We stayed there last week. We found the hotel had a great location for getting around, no need for taxis. The hotel was clean. On the first night our room was a bit small but spotless, when I went to the desk the next morning to a Lady called Tricia(I Think) and asked for a bigger room. Got chatting to her and a lady called Venci, they couldn't do anymore to make sure we were accomadated. If all hotels had staff like these two ladies then the world would be a better place. We would love to stay there again. I cannot understand some of the reviews about this hotel as we found it spotless with great staff.

We stayed in Tryp for a week and had no end of issues during our stay. The corridors are constantly full of laundry trolleys and the carpets full of stains, which doesn't create a good first impression. Our original room was tiny more suited for one person. You could hardly walk around the bed and you had to manoeuvre behind the bathroom door to get in. It was dark and we had 3 broken lights. Not helped by the view of a wall outside. We complained to reception and the staff were quite dismissive and hardly even looked up from the computer screen to acknowledge us. Eventually they sent someone to replace the lights which was great. Our first night we had no sleep due to the hotel being near a fire station (which obviously can't be helped) then when using the iron in the morning the iron leaked a load of hot water all over my clothes and ironing board. So down to reception we went; again. This time we asked to be moved and we were put on a higher floor. This room was bigger and much nicer. However on our third night in this room we dropped the TV remote control down the bed. When retrieving the battery that fell out we discovered a Big Mac box with black lettuce in it, an old dirty sock, sweet wrappers and an empty plastic bottle it knocked me sick to think we had been sleeping above rotten food and dirty laundry. We again went to reception to complain with the offending Big Mac box. We were given 2 complementary drinks at the bar and was told someone would clean under the bed. When we returned, the empty bottle and sock were gone but the wrappers and bottle lid were still there. Why it wasn't cleaned properly, I don't know. It wouldn't have taken much to brush out under the bed. At this point; we realised there was no point in complaining again and were sick of queuing up to speak to someone. We couldn't even claim our drinks because the bar was closed and the staff said we had to use it at the bar rather than exchange it for something else in return. Considering we'd already had to move rooms you'd think the hotel would want us to have a better experience but I guess they didn't care. I've stayed in a number of hotels in New York and this has been the worst experience in a hotel so far. Throughly disappointed at my whole stay at the hotel, but thankfully not all hotels in the area treat their guest in the same manner. On my return to New York in a few months I can categorically say I will not be staying at this hotel again.

Stayed here for 5 nights last week and the first thing to say is the location was amazing! Times square no more than a 3 minute walk and very nearby to cwntral park, rockefeller center and empire state etc. Greeted as we walked in to the hotel by friendly staff. The lobby of the hotel is small but very well laid out and looks very fresh and new! There are 3 lifts to go up to the rooms, all very quick but not a massive amount of space inside them. Room was quite small but more than appropriate for our visit. Comes with all the usual, a double bed (very comfy as well) TV, Phone and an alarm clock/ipod docking station. The safe was a decent size, could easily fit a laptop etc in it and its free, another added bonus was an iron and ironing board...Bathroom again is not a bad size. As others have said the bathroom floor gets wet when you take a shower because of the glass partition but jat put a towel down and its fine. The maids were very good and we had fresh towels each day and the room cleaned to quite a good standard.Didnt really use any of the other facilities but everything seemed ok.. used the bag storage on our last day which was $8 to store 4 bags after checking out so we could still go for a walk.We used JFK airport and used taxis to and from the aiport. Worked out as $65-70 including tips and tolls so wasnt really too bad and probably quicker than subway or airport transfer busses.

My husband and I just got back from a two night stay at TRYP. We "theatre binge" a few times a year and this hotel fulfilled our needs with its great location. Although our room was small, as was the bathroom, it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. From our experience, most hotels in NYC suffer from street noise. That's a given. It is helpful to bring those flexible ear plugs that you can buy at CVS. Another positive was the ease of checking in and the very nice staff including Michael servicing the breakfast buffet. We would definitely stay here again.

Wifi top notch, Staff is most likely the best I have seen in many years. Jose working the desk is really good at his work and Ingrid who manages the clean up on my floor a really great person also. They redid the hotel The rooms are clean. The charging station at the desk worked with my German plugs no problem. Bath room new. my biggest issue was the beds are really small. I am 200 pounds and my wife is 250 we had trouble and they moved us to a better room. But if you are not used to sharing a small bed please let them know. Location is great 800 meters from central park were I ran every morning. Close to everything. Its very close to a fire station and you get normal fire station noises. Single pain normal windows. The shades in the room took a little getting used to but were fully functional.

We loved the convienience-location wide to everything, the comfortable bed, Suny at the front desk who was so sweet to allow us to check in early and provided us with a free breakfast as we were celebrating our 25th Anniversary at the same hotel (Best Western Presidente then) where we spent our Honeymoon. Loved the apples, USA today newspaper and the lemon water that was near the check in desk. We had a wonderful time and Suny really made our stay there so special!Noise was not a factor for us and the small shower and bathroom are typical of all hotels in NYC. Wifi worked just fine and there was no additional charge for it.

Hotel is perfectly located at 48th bet 7th and 8th. Roomm was smal and I believe bed was a full size which I am not used of sleeping in. Updated lobby and rooms . Small lobby bar and small fitness room. Ice only on certain floors. No security in lobby anyone can enter and get upstairs. Overall I enjoyed my stay because of clenliness and location and price which I booked on Hotwire not knowing what I would get.price was right.

The hotel is nice upon entry, very modern and clean, but after the check in is when the disappointment came. The elevators are extremely small and could be problematic if you're claustrophobic and have more than 2 people and luggage. The rooms are small, the bathroom extremely small, full length mirror located inside the closet door. But the most annoying issue by far is the EXTREMELY slow draining bathroom sink that you have to wait 10 minutes to drain before you can run water again. Called the front desk to ask that someone come tend to it. Phone rang 12 times before someone answered, after waiting 15 minutes, no one showed so called and canceled as the wait was making us late for our appointment. Apparently we weren't the only ones with plumbing issues, because the next day the maintenance man walked past us as we were leaving out with a plunger in his hand on his way to another room on our floor. And apparently every night around midnight for the 3 nights we stayed, the handles on the same set of doors was being repaired and had blue painters tape wrapped around them each evening. Walls were thin and could hear the neighbor's alarm go off in the morning and continued to go off for at least 15 minutes. Was hot and humid in the room, the A/C was definitely not working as efficiently as it could have. Needless to say, we were not impressed at all with the hotel, but its location was convenient to access everywhere we wanted to go.

Small but comfortable room. Never got a good night sleep though. It is really noisy with street noise and sirens due to fire station in the street. On our 2nd night the air-conditioner started making a really loud buzzing noise. We told staff who said they would attend to it, but it was never fixed, and we had 3 more nights of noisy air-con. The shower design leaves the bathroom floor soaked with water which we had to mop up with towels every time. Despite the 'Do not disturb' up on the door, still had housekeeping try to come in on a few occasions.Great location though with only short walk to Time Square and theatres.

Enjoyed my week stay in this hotel at the end of October , including Halloween .Location Location Location is everything and this hotel is so central for everything , Times Square , Broadway and 15 minute walk to Central Park . Nice room and even had windows which opened . Room was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable , Great value fo rmoney and very friendlyand courteous staff . I would definitely go back .

We were in NYC for a sisters weekend and stayed at the Tryp on 48th St. Perfect location to walk to everthing and the subway stop is right around the corner, which we took to go to Ground Zero.Stayed in a premium room which had a queen bed in one room and a seperate room with two twin beds. not spacious room but adequate. It was all about location for us.Staff friendly and ready to answer all and any questions.Did not eat at hotel(they do offer breakfast, not sure about lunch)Used valet parking which was good. $55.00 dollars daily parking fee.Would definitaley stay here again.

Tryp is a centrally located hotel in the heart of Times Square. A clean hotel with a modern vibe. Comfortable beds and pleasant staff. Very small room with a even smaller bathroom. However, the accomodations for a one nighter did justice.

Downstairs the hotel had one long counter serving as a bar, then reception plus a smaller counter dealing with baggage and airport transfer and the like.It was clean and busy with big tv screens showing the news or local sports fixture.My room was on the 6th floor and although I requested a room with view I only got placed in a room overlooking other rooms around the centre.The room was clean but seemed very dark with the colour scheme and floor colour being shades of grey. The lighting was dark due to energy saving bulbs.No carpets here just vinyl covering which was fine.The bed was Comfortable and the ensuite was clean.good supply of coffee for the room provided free.I had a loose door handle and a very wobbly ironing board which was promptly sorted out when mentioned, much to the front desks credit.The guests down the hallway were in my opinion smoking something they shouldn't have been and the landing floor by the lifts always looked like a service area at the rear of a shopping mall.it was cluttered with laundry carts and room service trolleys on floors that were filthy.This let the whole experience down for me.The hotel was located near to the centre of Times Suare and was ideal for mooching around the busy area.It was reasonably priced for NYC.

We were in NYC for a cousins weekend getaway with 4 other couples and we all stayed at the TRYP. We had a very early flight into NYC so we didn't get much sleep the night before. After we arrived, we dropped off our luggage and went out for breakfast. We're back by noon and although check-in time isn't until three, we figured it couldn't hurt to ask if we could check in early. We explained to them that we'd had a very early flight and wanted to get some rest before the rest of our party arrived. They were very understanding and accommodating and we were given a room right away. We were trying to save money so we booked a regular room with a full size bed. The room itself was small as was the bathroom. We weren't planning on spending much time there plus you get what you pay for so that was a non-issue. The bed was comfortable, the shower had the right amount of water pressure and the coffee included with the coffeemaker was delicious. We would all definitely stay here again and are already looking forward to our next trip.

We stayed in a standard double room which was clean and tidy but a bit on the small side. As we were there for 4 nights it was manageable.The staff were quite friendly and had everything you need for your trip. The concierge helped us book shuttles and attractions which was useful.The hotel is right in the heart of times square and walking distance to many subway stations.I would definitly come back as it is good value in the heart of the city.

Visited with friends and was surprised. The hotel itself is small almost boutique like. The room was certainly big enough and fit for purpose. The breakfast was buffet style with plenty to choose from. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The hotel is situated a short walk from the bright lights of Times Square. The rooms are freshly decorated and very clean.

Being NYC we expected a small room with very little space. Upon opening the door we were very surprised with the amount of space we had and the modern/up to date look impressed us. After 4 weeks of travelling around the US this was by far the most comfortable bed we had slept in. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Fantastic location! Couldn't have asked for a better place to stay.

Just back from a great city break in NYC! Hotel was nice and was in a brilliant location, not even a minute walk from the hustle of Times Square on Broadway! Room was nice just a little bit run down in areas but you don't spend much time in your room so all you need is a comfy bed which we had! Had to be moved on the second night from our room on the first floor due to water pipes banging all night! So would highly recommend you get a higher floor room on arrival! Overall the hotel is nice and isn't over priced! Just remember the tax and city tax that is added on to USA hotels when your booking as that can add a little more to your end total! :):)

My experience may not be typical of all the rooms but I was allocated room 502 and it was awful! Booked for 6 nights - how they could expect someone to stay there for that long is ridiculous. The bed was the smallest 'double' ever and still took up the whole room. The toilet door brushes the toilet as you open it and to close it from the inside I had to either stand on or astride the toilet. Room was also dark as had no daylight to offer as window view was brick shaft. The corridors were constantly piled high with laundry and blocked with cleaning carts and the lifts took an age to arrive.Apparently the hotel was 'full' so no opportunity to switch room. It's a cheap and nasty hotel good for one night if you only plan on sleeping in it and not unpacking - good location though but not good enough to make up for the bad room. I even took an extra room elsewhere at a 'proper' hotel for two nights in the middle so that my trip wasn't totally ruined.

I was at this hotel last week end in New York for a business trip. It's 2 minutes away from Time Square right next to Hershey store. The rooms are small but new, clean and with wood floors. It's the cheapest hotel that I found in New York and it was worth it. I'm difficult with hotels and I was please with this one. I recommend to everyone.

After a slight hiccup at check-in, I was checked into a very nice room with a comfortable bed. The location was terrific and ideal if you are in town to see a show on Broadway. There are a lot of restaurants in the neighborhood to choose from. I want to mention a special thank you to Suny at the front desk who was exremely helpful and Miss Harris as well for rectifying what could have been an unpleasant stay. I will definitely stay here again.

I spent 2 nights with my fiancé at TRYP and we really enjoyed the location as it was steps away from time square, good food and transportation. The bathroom was small, but it's what I would expect for NYC and the affordable price we paid. The room was clean, the bed was comfy and the only complaint we had was the TV was pretty horrible. No channels available and you could not adjust the volume down from the Max setting. Besides that, we would stay here again.

This is a decent hotel near Times Square. The price was average, but I felt a tad high for what you actually got. The rooms are tiny and the bathrooms even smaller. Had a single room with queen bed that was sufficient for a couple. We did not spend much time here, it was just a place to lay our head at night. The room was very clean and the location was very good. Central to the 50th Street subway two blocks north and Times Square is only a couple of blocks away. We arrived earlier than check in and the bellman offered to hold our luggage while we explored the City which was a plus. We were on the 4th floor and did not hear any of the outside noise of the city. However, one night we heard some drunken hotel guests making noise going to their rooms, but that is not the hotel's fault. Just inconsiderate people.I did have an issue with the concierge. The hotel offered a "airport shuttle" which for two people with two bags was $65.00. As we had spent the same amount for a private cab from JFK to the hotel I figured, ok we will take the shuttle back to save having to get a cab to the hotel. However, the concierge failed to advise us that the shuttle stopped at literally five other hotels after ours to pick up people until the van was full. We spend a full 30 minutes picking up other passengers before we even started towards the airport. This made us rushed for our plane, even though the concierge assured us that taking the shuttle at the particular time we did would be fine. I would avoid the shuttle service and just take a taxi or uber next time as the price is basically the same and you are wasting time driving around picking up other fares.

The hotel is centrally located, clean and chic. Rooms are small, but eh, it's Manhattan, so who cares? The staff is nice and helpful.But the acoustics... Wow. Not only could we hear neighbors having sex (on both sides), but I heard them brushing their teeth, taking photos (you could hear the click of the camera through the walls) and every word, snore and noise. Made for a rough night of sleep and an early wake up. And, even if you request privacy so you won't be interrupted by housekeeping, you can hear them knock loudly on every door and repeat HOUSEKEEPING!! over and over until you'll rip yourself out of bed and go out for coffee just to make it stop.I don't know how they can fix it, but it's really bad.I don't know if other floors are better, but I was on the 5th.

When I arrived to the hotel I checked in and was greeted by a very nice employee. I got my keys to my room, went to room and opened the door and what do I see...a dirty room with other guests items in it! We had to wait for another room to be cleaned since there was nothing else open. Here are the other complaints, very small room especially to accommodate 4 guest, lighting was very limited, window unit for a/c that produced humid air, sheets that had balls on them, limited phone service (no matter the carrier), front desk called my room at 11:45 pm because my friend brought a glass of wine to the room that she paid for at the bar because they needed the glass, and the room has not had a sweeping or moping in a long time. I was told by the manager Ben that he would comp 1 night due to the first set of complaints which was $300/night, he comped $100! Feel free to see the pictures I have provided.

We only stayed one night this past weekend but loved it. I really enjoyed the staff and their great attitudes and help with any questions. This is a top notch hotel and we will stay there again. The rooms were comfy and very clan.. well designed.

We stayed at this hotel for 8 days. It is a friendly, clean hotel in a great location - not to be confused with the hotel of the same name in 35th street! The rooms are of a reasonable size for a city centre hotel and come well equipped with TV, hair drier, air con, coffee machine, iron and safe. there is plenty of hanging and drawer space and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel has free wi-fi which worked really well in our room (on the 9th floor) and in reception. The hotel was clean and the maids did a great job each day refreshing the room. It is just a few steps away from Times Square and the theatres on Broadway with the subway just 2 streets away on 50th. I found the staff helpful - so much so that one loaned her own umbrella to a guest as all the hotel umbrellas were being used. There are one or two things that could be improved, the air con was very noisy but we chose not to use, there is no fridge in the room but the space is limited so I understand why this might not be possible. Also, on arrival there was a small bottle of water in the room but once finished it was not replaced, during the whole 8 days we stayed we were not given any more! It would have been better if water had been replaced each day. Finally, the maid trolley with the clean towels, toilet rolls, soap etc. was just left in the corridor near the lift the whole time. Not ideal! However, overall I would recommend this hotel, location was ideal, rooms were clean and comfortable and staff were helpful.

We had a reservation at TRYP by Windham and at four PM of that night we received a call from the manager saying they could not ;accommodate us and suggesting a nearby hotel that we were aware was surrounded by a major 11 hour daily construction project. A second property they sent us to was OK but our room just over a major Broadway NYC intersection was noisy all night. TRYP declined or request for some retribution, not even a partial future coupon, no less an apology. This hotel should be avoided.

We stayed in hotel for a week and all staff were very polite also friendly, upon arriving check-in was fast and furious, lol, but it was done a professional manner, breakfast was excellent well worth every penny. Having had the hotel near Times Square we didn’t hear much noise at all, a little but no issue at all. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning to visit New York any time soon.

location of hotel was great, right in the heart of Times Square but apart from that not much else can be said. entering hotel the main reception was lovely but going up to room it was down hill from there. the hallways to the rooms were tiny and I met someone while trying to get to my room with luggage and had to go back as the space was too small to fit us both. room was really small and I bumped myself multiple times trying to walk around bed but it was clean but unfortunately my room looked on to what I can describe as boiler rooms of sort and the noise was constant and kept me awake most of the night. room was also too warm and because of noise from my window I couldn't open it to let air in. I have stayed in cheaper hotels in more the same location and had much better rooms. unfortunately I wouldn't stay in this hotel again.

Own the city is this hotels motto!!! Location, location, location!! I have just returned from a 5 day stay in New York City and this hotel was our base! The location is prefect right in the heart of the city, so close to all the action and the city that never sleeps! Despite all the negative reviews we gave it a try and we were very pleased, all the staff were very helpful and could not do enough for you! The beds were extremely comfortable after miles of walking each day! The rooms are clean and tidy! All in all we were pleased with our stay and I would recommend this hotel again and again! Thank you for a marvellous stay!!

Its a nice Hotel to the extent i'm reviewing it before I leave.Excellent location you walk around to theaters,shops, restaurants,cafes.Its less than a block from times square,close to the city tour stop.Professional staff. Comfortable beds & Clean.

My mother and I stayed here for a week in October. Beds were comfortable, shower was clean and hot. Half a block off of Times Square, so of course there will be noise. Room safe was quite large.Only wish that we had a mini fridge in our room, it was only available in the suites.

Stayed here with my wife and 3 young daughters. This hotel is half a block from the center of Time Square, so a central location for getting to other areas of Manhattan. I recommend upgrading to a Family Room, which a trademark TRYP room that has two beds plus a bunk bed. These rooms are new (from when TRYP took the property over) so the decor is updated and the rooms are spacious (very hard to find in NYC). The front lobby is small but has a bar and a modern decor. Parking is half a block away at a discounted rate. Kizzy, the Office Manager, was a great help in ensuring our stay exceeded expectations. All in all a great stay.

A friend booked a room with twin beds for a quick weekend trip up to NYC two weeks ago. The hotel was an easy walk from New York Penn Station. Check-in was super easy. The room itself was clean and comfortable. Check-out was easy as well. The ATM in the lobby was busted but hopefully they've fixed it by now. Sound wasn't an issue for me but our room was located on the back side of the hotel. The hotel is tiny but very conveniently located and provided very satisfactory service for my one night stay.

Let's be realistic when we're booking our hotel rooms in the Manhattan/New York City area. Space is small and realistically about 1/2 the size as most any other standard hotel room anywhere else. With that being said; this hotel was not only a steal in cost; but a simple & updated luxury in its very least. The lobby swank, the staff incredibly friendly, and the rooms, although small; a "place to sleep". The standard rooms are great for 1 to 2 people MAX. And remember, these beds are Full Size; so if you are 6'1 or taller; upgrade your room choice. Everything is updated & the location is dead central Times Square/Theatre District. My only reasoning for giving this 4 and not 5 stars is simply due to the softness and comfortability of the Bed/Pillows. Very soft! Not good for bad backs/necks. And, you absolutely do sink way down into the bed/pillows. So. With all of this knowledge now; please book this hotel & enjoy the area (not the room). You're in New York!

Excellent location near the High Line and bustling restaraunts. Fun bar and good food. Clean rooms which tend to be small but that is what you get in NYC. Safe area due to immediate proximity of police station.

We stayed a total of five nights at the Tryp on a vacation from the UK. The hotel has just undergone a refurbishment and it looks very good. The staff were great and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. If anyone from the hotel reads this review, can they let me know where you can buy one of these mattresses? We had looked at the reviews of the hotel and realised that it was in a busy part of Manhattan - right in the heart of the theatre district and round the corner from the small fire station on 8th Avenue. We requested and were given two rooms on a high floor. In the end we heard the fire engine briefly a couple of times and it did not disturb our sleep, and the traffic was barely audible from the 13th floor. Overall this was a great find -right in the middle of everything. Thanks to all the staff. We will be back.

Just returned from our first trip to New York and we thought we had booked the other Tryp Hotel which was a bit further away from Times Square and had gotten semi decent reviews and much to our annoyance on getting in to the TAxi when giving the address realised it was not the South Wyndham Hotel but rather this hotel that we had booked. Don't know how that happened as we never looked at this hotel at all. How and ever we decided to make the most of it. The air conditioning unit was so loud that there is no way that you could sleep with it on. I don't know how anyone who was there in Summer would have been able to put up with it. We slept with just a sheet over us and just didn't even put it on but even having it plugged in was very noisy. If you had a shower the heat in the room became unbearable. With a fire station right beside us it was really very noisy. The only positive thing I have to say about this hotel that it is smack bang in the middle of Times Square and perfect location!. We put up with it as we really only showered and slept in the place but were really disappointed with it. Staff didn't welcome us to the hotel on check in and just took the key from us when we left and that was it. Rather abysmal public relations if you ask me. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone as there are so many more to choose from and as I say we thought we were going to the other Tryp Hotel in the first place. Stay away from here if you are looking for a good night sleep. It aint gonna happen and staff are sour pussed and unhelpful. Enjoyed New York and all it had to offer but it was such a pity with the Hotel.

Great hotel with funky bar and reception. Reception staff were all very helpful and we were delighted with our room with balcony, as well as a late checkout. Ask for a room high up, as it can be noisy outside. Room is very clean and compact, but it has everything that you need. Lifts are very small so fill up quickly. Be prepared to wait. Everything is on your doorstep so very easy to get around. I would definitely stay here again,.

Good location only 5 minutes from Time Square and other sightseeing objects.Price is very acceptable for location and room.Staff is nice and friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and looks very good. Wi-fi is free and good. Only breakfast could be free for everyone.

When we got there we asked to pay 100dollars up front incase we used the restaurant.We went up in the lift to our room and when we went in it was like the size of a matchboxand it had not been cleaned or bedding changed.We went back down to complain and we were given another room which was'nt a lot bigger but we made do with it. It was quiet on a nighttime so were pleased with that.We only used the restaurant once and at the end of the week we were given our 100dollars back

Went there september 2015. We had a room on the 4th floor viewing the street below. The room was pretty clean and the bed was comfortable. Small bathroom but enough for our short trip.They have free wifi which was a huge bonus for us. A whole lot of TV stations to watch.Good location. Right in the middle of everything. We walked from time square to our hotel. It was kind of nice not having to spring for a taxi or metro every time we wanted to go somewhere. It was however quite noisy during the night. But I think it kinds comes with the location and its not really something the hotel can control. Be sure to bring some earpieces or something to block the noise during the night.

This hotel was located with excellent access to Times Sq and the theatres with many restaurants nearby.Like most NY hotels it was small and very crowded and we changed our room three times to avoid the noise of air-con units and tiny beds.The local fire station is just around the corner on 8th Avenue and is an excellent source for a wake up call anytime of night!However the staff were very helpful and sorted out any issues immediately.If you prefer to be in the thick of it this is the place for you.

The Tryp on W. 48th far exceeded my expectations, which were fairly low when I booked because the price was too good to be true for October in NYC. You can't beat the location in the heart of the theater district with abundant dining and shopping options within easy walking distance. An easy walk from the Port Authority if you take the bus from the airport; Penn Station is also walkable if you arrive via Long Island Railroad or Amtrak. Front desk staff were very nice and I appreciated having my folio under my door to expedite checkout. I stayed on the 8th floor facing 48th St. and had no street noise.My room in the "deluxe queen" category was perfect for a solo traveler -- on the small side but has everything you need, including iron/ironing board, luggage racks, coffee maker, hairdryer and safe. Bed and bath linens were very nice quality. Suggest you bring flop flops or slippers because the room has wood floors instead of carpeting (which I actually prefer for cleanliness). Only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is size of bathroom. It was fine for me alone, but would be quite tight for two occupants as there's room for only one person at the small sink. That said, it has Grohe fixtures and excellent hot water and water pressure. Shower is small and water splashes on the floor as the glass partition has an opening but no door. Toiletries are basic - soap, shampoo, conditioner. Bring your own lotion or pick it up at one of the drugstores in the neighborhood.Bottom line is that this is an excellent value in a top location. I highly recommend as long as you are okay with the small bathroom. I have stayed at many deluxe hotels but who needs to pay $500+ if you are in NYC on your own nickel instead of an expense account? The Tryp offers a great value proposition!

Was thrilled to stay here in September. Beautifully appointed rooms and lobby, pleasant and helpful staff, and most importantly, this phenomenal hotel is right in the middle of everything! Looking forward to many more visits.

Very nice rooms, very modern decorations and bathrooms. only $2 per bag of you want to check your bags and explore after hotel check out time. $55 Valet parking which is very reasonable for NY. We had 2 different rooms for 2 nights and there were some very minor things... Lights not working, switch broken on the wall. No big deal but something they should keep up with.

Had a great stay here for three nights in August. The location is unbeatable and the hotel was very clean and the room/bed were quite comfortable. No issues whatsoever, however bring ear plugs as we would for any hotel near times square. I would recommend.

I stayed in this hotel twice. 4 days in mid September and another 4 days in mid October. Yes the rooms and bathrooms are small but it IS New York. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff friendly and helpful. You can hear the noisy landscape of NYC ie construction, sirens and car horns but it certainly didn't stop me from sleep. Right in the theatre district and lots of good restaurants and bars on 8th Avenue. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Looking for an affordable hotel near the Times Square? TRYP Times Square is quite a place! This hotel is very close to the Times Square, and other tourists spots. Not advisable for families, though, as the rooms are quite small. The staffs are very hospitable and kind, though.
