My mother and I recently stayed at the TRYP on a long weekend in October. Our rate was around $200.00 a night which, when compared to other options in the area, was a good rate. The hotel is in a great location- it is convenient to multiple subway lines and right near Time Square and multiple theaters so it is a good base for exploring that area of the city and taking in shows. There are also a lot of restaurant options in the area, some which are reasonably priced by non NYC standards, and there is a duane read and a market right near the hotel.Our room was small, but clean. The bathroom is also small, but again clean and everything worked. There was an issue with our heater making noise, seeming always at 6:30 in the AM- maintenance did try to correct it but were unsuccessful. When we brought it up at checkout they reduced our rate and comped our breakfast, which was appreciated.The breakfast was the standard, continental fare- eggs, oatmeal, cereal, pancakes, sausage, bacon, toast, bagels, fruit and pastries. It was warm and tasty. The common areas in the hotel were all clean, and everything has been recently updated. The desk staff tried to be helpful- however they didn't have a lot of information about the closed E line which we needed to get back to the airport and didn't put much info into tracking down helpful information. We were able to leave our bags at the hotel after check out, prior to our afternoon flight which was convenient but there was of course a charge. It wasn't much, but when you pay a fair amount for the room having that courtesy extended would be a nice amenity. Overall I would stay there again if the price was similar.

The title says it all. Even foam earplugs could not quell the wail of fire sirens throughout the night. Worse was the fact that I requested a quiet room, away from road noise, and received assurance from the front desk that this was a quiet room. Too bad as the staff is friendly and the hotel is close to theaters.

Staff were very unhelpful, we were continually getting charged for things we had no idea about every time we asked what the charges were for, the reception they didn't know either all they said was that it's extra tax when we had already paid it, we tried to make sure everything was paid before we left so that nothing else would come out of our bank, a week later £500 had come out, I phoned the hotel to ask what these charges were and the unhelpful receptionist just put me on hold for 15 minutes, when she returned she just said it was tax so I tried to explain we had already paid it which was on a receipt and showed that we had paid up, I then told her what I paid in GBP and she said she couldn't work the exchange rate into dollars, so she tried to put me through to a manager which just went to voicemail. Cleaning staff were very rude, we came back mid day for a rest due to a lot of walking, and the cleaners would not let us in our room and they were being very rude,

We stayed here recently and was extremely pleased with the service and amenities of this hotel, not to mention the location. It was an excellent experience and will no doubt return. A special shout out to Channel Garcia, Assistant Executive Housekeeping Manager who went above and beyond. Thank you!

We stayed 3 nights. The location seemed safe and was quite convenient -- 2 blocks from Times Square and the subway. The front desk was welcoming and friendly. Our room was modern, clean and quiet. The bathroom lacked shelf space but otherwise adequate. Free business center and PC and well as a small gym. Our room's hallways (5th floor) was being renovated.

Stayed at the Wyndham in Oct 2015 for our first trip to New York. It's in a great location near Time Square. The hotel for the price was ok. They put us in a room that didn't have a shower door so it got the bathroom floor wet which was a pain but not worth the hassel of packing up and changing room.There was no restaurant but again with the selection around the hotel not a big issue.Overall not as expensive as some of the other hotels but also not as nice.

We had a fabulous 3 night stay in this trendy hotel just off of Times Square. The service was great and we were fortunate enough to get our room at noon when we arrived. We had the premium room with bunk beds which was perfect for our party of 3 - it gave us plenty of room, and even though we were three girls, it would be perfect for a family. Room was clean, shower was great - our room was at the end of the hall and it was not noisy. You cant beat the price for this hotel in this location!

Stayed here last week for 5 nights. Perfect location for our city break. Very comfortable bed, good shower but Was lacking a shelf in bathroom to place toiletries. That's a woman thing maybe.Nice bar area and friendly staff.We stayed in room 708 at the back so we did not have street noise, but this is NYC it does not sleep! We slept soundly in the very cosy bed despite the noisy a/c unit.I thought it was a let down that the cleaning/laundry trollies, 4 of them, were permanently left in the small corridor outside the lift and our room, a bit lazy and unsightly. Overall though, very happy with our stay.

We stayed at the TRYP for five nights. Good points - great location, good shower pressure. Bad points - small room, tiny bathroom, no fridge, very uncomfortable bed, no tea (just coffee), paper cups, dark room (even with lights on), paper thin walls, received our Guest Services Directory the day before we left, EXTREMELY noisy 24/7. Would not recommend.

Avoid this place. It has thin windows and is a short distance away from a fire station which results in loud sirens blazing all night. This is in addition to the rooftop nightclub across the road. Sadly the owner has not bothered to install thicker windows / double glazing.Rooms are small.Lift is very busy and slow, particularly in peak times.Service is fairly average.Although it is obviously very close to Times Square.

Stayed for five nights at this hotel. Room 708, 7th Floor at the back so nice and quiet! Room was very comfortable and clean with everything we needed, even though small. The staff were always very helpful and polite. Well located and within easy walking distance of Times Square and Broadway Theatres.Only a couple of minor things that were not good were that the laundry trollies were left in the corridor outside the lifts all of the time and the staff were eating at the counter at breakfast times. Would definitely recommend and stay there again.

My husband & I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights recently and couldn't have been more satisfied. We were on a budget and were worried about what we were going to get for the price. Not to worry...it was great! Location was FANTASTIC! Walk to Times Square in minutes! The hotel was nice..small, but nice. Our room was small but great. Comfy beds, linens and pillows. Very clean. Housekeeping was good. Hallways and elevators could use some sprucing up...very dark. Front desk was helpful. Would definitely recommend!

What a lovely hotel, we had a room on the 15 floor, didn't want to be put off by any negative reviews regarding the bathroom and I'm glad we didn't, the bathroom was spotless, the pillows were so lovely that we want to buy some from the manufacturer, a receptionist called 'Suny was lovely. 'Larry from concierge so helpful. Fantastic location.GREAT PLACE TO STAY :)

Great Hotel, Very clean, fresh towels every day!! Not noisy at all!! would highly recommend for any one to stay here as it is so central to everything!! Was ideal for us as it was our first time in New York!

Excellent location - minutes from Times Square. Room was OK, looked out to the front of the hotel, slight negative that it was quite dark, needed to have all the lights switched on while in the room. There was a lot of construction work being carried out down the road so got quite noisy at times, not the hotels fault but it might benefit from better glazing.Cleaning service was good, carried out every day. Desk staff, friendly, helpful and knowledgeable.WiFi a bit sporadic, but free and available all over the hotel so could accept the occassional drop out I thought the rates quite expensive, even though negotiated by my company which has ample buying power, but I guess it's a refection of its location

Our family of 5 have recently just stayed here and we could not fault one thing about the hotel. Perfect area of where the hotel is positioned, perfect room nice and spacious especially with there being 5 of us and absolutely tremendous service from the staff cleaners to the management. Would 100% stay here again ☺️

This ranks as one of the worst hotels I've stayed in. The room was absolutely tiny and the bed was small and uncomfortable, but worst of all things were dirty -- the hallways and lifts were grubby and after the first night I noticed I'd been bitten a lot by what I can only assume were bedbugs. The duvet didn't even have a cover, so I question the hygiene overall! The cleaning staff didn't really clean my room, leaving empty bottles and trash. 48th is very noisy, at is has a fire station on the corner and NYC driver's love of their horns mean the hotel's windows do very little to keep the street noise out. If the street is quiet, then the noisy housekeeping staff probably aren't.The only plus points were the friendly (if noisy...) staff -- despite other reviews, all my experiences were very positive and friendly -- and a fantastic location, being about 30 seconds to Times Square and well situated for any midtown/downtown excursions.That said though, I was very glad to check out and just hope all my bedbug bites stop itching soon...

My two adult sons and I stayed here for one night in Sept. We were meant to be at the Tryp Times Square South which is a brilliant hotel, but lastminute.com had failed to make our booking (although confirmed it to me.) We were relieved to have a place to stay after a long flight and hours of fruitless discussions with lastminute.com, but the Tryp Times Square was awful. Our rooms, a double and a twin, were dirty and very small. There was a thick layer of dust on the furnishings, and the tiny, poorly equipped bathroom was not clean. The room had an unpleasant musty smell, but even worse was the pervasive sewer-like stench in the corridors. The carpet in the corridors looked like it had not been cleaned for years. The rates for our room were very high. The staff were barely polite. It is puzzling that one Tryp hotel is so bad while the other, Times Square South, is excellent.

Stay here just for the location. Steps away from Times Square, and the restaurants, bars and nightlife of Midtown West. The hotel itself is average - small rooms, thin walls etc. However, for the price paid, its acceptable.

We were thrilled with the TRYP by Wyndham in Times Square. We asked for a family room, but didn't expect to go all the way up to the penthouse and then have a rooftop patio facing towards Times Square! It was right up there with the best parts of our trip. Everyone we encountered here was extremely nice and helpful. It is a beautiful hotel in a fun and edgy way. The beds were very comfortable. And having read here on tripadvisor, to turn the showerhead toward the wall, we had no problem with wet floors. The room was clean and fresh every evening when we returned. The decor was unique and charming, We loved the Thai restaurant next door and ate there twice - and Hurley's on the other side is a great place to relax in the evening and regroup for the next day. It is walking distance to theaters and of course, Times Square is at the end of the block. My husband asked me to include that the shuttle to the airport costs about $70, as a heads-up. :) Thank you so much for enhancing the wonderful trip we had to New York City!!

I stayed at this hotel last week and had a horrible experience. Hole in the wall of the room, furniture falling apart, and the AC didn't work. I could barely sleep 1 hour and was exhausted at my conference the next day. I called the front desk about the AC and was told they would send engineering, but no one ever showed. It was 78-80 degrees in my room all night with no fan -- just miserable. Stay somewhere else near Times Square. Only nice thing about it is the location.

*Please Note: This is a review for TRYP North (234 West 48th Street) NOT TRYP South*I loved this hotel, I really don't think I can give it a good enough review. Firstly the location is amazing, its on the off road next to the Hershey Store in Times Square but its not so loud that you can't sleep at night. Everything is on your doorstep.The hotel is beautiful and very new and swanky, although the rooms are small, they're cosy and clean and comfortable. I stayed on the third floor and the wallpaper was a map stating all the places in Manhattan that is famous and how far away they are too. The rooms were cleaned every day and the bathroom was spotless by the time we came back to the room.The staff were lovely and helpful. When I lost a very important ring, I told the member of staff at the front desk and he informed all the cleaning staff and they managed to find it for me. I'm very grateful.Honestly I have nothing bad to say about this hotel and I will definitely only be staying here from now on. Thanks for a great stay TRYP!

My girlfirend and I stayed here for a week in September and could not fault the location as it is a short distance from Times Square and the majority of most of the sightseeing hotspots for New York. The only downside to being so close is the noise, even on the 6th floor the noise would wake us up on occasions - a risk of choosing a hotel so close to the central hub of Manhatten. Despite the noise the room was tidy and kept clean on a regular basis. The staff were polite and helpful. Overall if you are looking for a hotel in the centre of the action this is the place for you. If you are looking for a peaceful nights sleep it's probably best to choose a hotel a few blocks away.

I stayed at the Tryp NY Times Square after staying multiple times at the Tryp Times Square south. I spent three nights at the hotel at about $400 a night and wasn't able to sleep any night -- the first night I was awakened at 3:45 am by loud shouting and banging sounds that lasted 1/2 hour -- it sounded as if people were being attacked room-by-room. The next morning the front desk knew nothing about this and said only that they get "angry boyfriends" from time-to-time. The next night I was awoken at the same time by slamming doors (but no shouting) and the third night very loud country music woke me up at 4:30 -- I called the front desk and they said they could hear it too, but since it was coming from outside, there was really nothing they could do. It continued for 2 1/2 hours -- after which I simply left the hotel (I couldn't fall back to sleep). My only request at check-in was for a quiet room. I couldn't put the fan on high to try to drown out the noise because it didn't work. The rooms were incredibly small, the breakfast buffet had cold food and poor service, the lobby ceiling was leaking so that you couldn't sit in the lobby, etc. And they over-charged me at more than $400 per night. One of the worst experiences in a hotel in 30 years.

We stayed in New York for 4 days, 3 nights. We chose this hotel based on location because it is just steps from Times Square and all the shops and many food spots. Arrival and check-in was very easy. Although when we first walked in, the pictures made the hotel appear larger than it really was.The room was TINY. For two of us, plus luggage we barely had space to move around. Everything felt very cramped and it made our stay difficult. On top of that the bathroom was even smaller! When you sit on the toilet your knees touch the wall, and I am only 5'3", so anyone taller would struggle for sure. The shower made no sense to me since it only had half a door. I'm not confident in even calling it a door, more just a half glass wall. So the water gets on the floor, there's no logic there.Being in the middle of Times Square, I expected the hotel to have sound proof windows to cater to its guests. But that was not the case. A couple nights were difficult to get a good nights sleep because of all the noise and activity going on outside. I heard people playing loud music, talking and yelling, and some traffic sounds throughout the night. The air conditioning unit in the room also made it impossible to sleep if you're a light sleeper because it was very noisy.Overall, the hotel was convenient for us to walk around and see the sights. But I would not stay here again because there were no other positive aspects of this hotel.

Our travel agent booked us into Tryp Times Square. First, the hotel lost our reservation, which we learned about in the NYC airport..... We had a frantic hour calling the hotel and our travel agent trying to get it worked out. Of course we had a valid reservation and Tryp finally agreed with the agent that we had a room. Our first room was extremely small, loud because it was on the second floor, had no air conditioning - it was swelteringly hot - and water all over the floor. Back in the lobby the front desk to,d us to just sit around until they decided to fix it... Once again we called the travel agent who got us into another room. No Kleenex, no plugs or docks, not even any glasses - we asked the front desk for glasses and never got any..... We finally got a third room which was clean, etc. However, even with ear plugs it was hard to sleep due to street noise. The shower is half open - glass only covering part of the shower - so the entire bathroom bathes with you. The bathroom is so small I ended up putting on my makeup sitting on the floor. We asked for the maid to set the alarm clock to the correct time. Instead she set the alarm to wake us up at 2 in the morning....The restaurant Tryp markets is closed for renovations....On the plus side: good location, decent enough breakfast, nice marble and tiles. We do not recommend this hotel.Btw the rack rate for the room is $1600.....

Stayed for five nights in September as part of a couple and with a friend. Check in was very straight forward, and the reception area very lovely and clean so good first impressions. The bedrooms were very small but clean. The bed was comfy with lovely pillows. One of the rooms smelt of smoke so we spoke to reception and they offered us free breakfast and the option to change rooms which was good service. Breakfast was delicious and would recommend, however would not recommend paying full price for it. We used the front desk travel service to book some theatre tickets and the lady working there was so helpful and it was a brilliant and easy way to sort out trips or book tickets etc. Location is great right next to times square so perfect if you want the hustle and bustle. However sleep quality is not good because you are so central and a fire station is right down the street so its very noisy. We were high up on the ninth floor and even then it was loud so if you are a light sleeper then perhaps consider other options. Overall was a pleasant stay and value for money compared to other hotels for a good location. Some rooms had inconsistencies like in one of our rooms there was a fridge and the other there wasn't; this was a bit annoying. The floor does get wet from the shower but its not a big deal, they give you loads of towels so just use one more to clean the floor!

Stayed at the Tryp from 9 Sept to 16 Sept 2015. Paid $400 per night. Found pubic hair and used floss on air conditioner and a clump of someone's hair on grill in shower recess. Missing door lock (latch). Told management and rectified.Then the clincher..........the night before we moved out, found a used condom down beside our bed between the bed and the chest of drawers. Told management immediately.Cleaners need a rocket! Well below expectations. Also overcharged us for a family breakfast. Always check your account before you leave. Disappointed. No linen left for bunk bed either.

This is an old hotel which has been given a bit of a face lift.Basic rooms with very small bathroom. Great location only a couple of blocks from times square. Staff are friendly and helpful. Good value for the location.

I stayed one night at the Tryp. It was not my first choice, but city hotels were quite booked, and this location offered the most reasonable price. The room was comfortable and large enough for a one-night stay, or if someone just wanted a place to sleep while they sightsee during the day. If you book, request an interior room. My room facing the street was very noisy. I left the AC fan on high, but it still did not drown out the sounds of sirens, garbage trucks, etc.

While the rooms were a bit small, they were large enough for the two of us. The staff stand out as friendly, helpful and knowledgable. I would definitely go back. Great location, all in all well worth booking!

Everyone was very nice at the hotel and I even got upgraded to the penthouse. The beds were very comfortable and the room was great, I only wish they had bathtubs. The localization is perfect, it is at the corner of Times Square and it is only a short walk to Central Park, the Empire State Building or a subway station to get you anywhere else. I was only a little bit annoyed that they actually charge you to store your bags, but overall, the hotel was excellent.

I stayed here for a 2 day class paid for by work. My work's travel site listed it as one of the hotels to use. I had never stayed at a TRYP hotel but was familiar with the Wyndham hotel chain--which I like.The good-- Location is great-- right in the heart of Times Square and near Restaurant Row. Close to great restaurants. Fairly good breakfast included in my stay.The bad--Small hotel--no high floors so although I was on the 5th floor, I could hear noise and traffic all night long. The hotel staff did not know how to handle my federal government request for tax free lodging. I presented all the appropriate paperwork and it took hours after check out to get it resolved--though they finally did. The bathroom was so very small--it was unmanageable. My husband and I had no sink space and the shower--though a reasonable size, only had 1/2 a door so water went all over the bathroom floor, despite attempts to move the shower head. The hallways were narrow and the area near the elevator was filled with housekeeping cleaning carts for our entire stay. If I had the opportunity to stay elsewhere, I would have. I was limited to the federal govt rate and so I was limited in choices. However, in the past, I've stayed other places with much better accommodations.

This was my first time staying at Tryp, so I really did not know what to expect. I was very impressed with the room decor (the hotel was undergoing renovations, but you could tell it's going to be very chic when finished), the location (could not have been better right in the middle of Times Square), and the friendly staff; especially Suny (pronounced "Sunny"). She was such a pleasure to encounter! She made us feel welcomed from the time we arrived at the hotel. She was a joy to speak with and very accommodating to our needs. I have been to NYC several times and Suny is by far one of the friendliest New Yorkers I've ever encountered!The only thing I did not like was the breakfast setup. This definitely needs some tweaking, but there are plenty of great restaurants nearby. So, this was not a huge deal for me.

Room is adequate by New York standards. Nicely decorated with a real closet, iron, in-room safe. Big LCD TV.There was an old office chair on my balcony which I thought was odd.Air conditioner is a windows unit that is extremely loud.The cleaning lady walked in on me despite my having a Do Not Disturb sign on my door. Don't know what that's about but use the deadbolt.This hotel follows the three rules of real estate. Location, location, location. Reasonably priced.

Other than the location, the hotel was extremely disappointing from the moment we arrived.When my husband and I got to the hotel, I requested for someone to help with our luggage. Help didn't come so we ended up lugging 4 huge luggages to the lobby. (New York was our last leg of a month-long honeymoon so we had a lot of stuff) After we checked in (reception staff were unfriendly), help finally came to take our bags up to the room. When we got to the room, I was shocked by the size of it. With our luggages, we barely had enough space to walk, the toilet door couldn't open completely and you had to maneuver around it to get inside but still I was determined not to let that ruin the trip. But the last straw was when I closed the toilet cover to flush and realized dried up pee on the toilet bowl. (It wasn't the husband's cause he hadn't used the toilet yet) I wanted to throw up. There were a lot of other problems I had with the hotel as well - the aircon is so noisy it kept me up all night, the room walls are so thin you can hear everything like when housekeeping opens and shuts the door a million times in the morning and when your drunk neighbor gets back at 4am and starts yelling and fumbling about, knocking over furniture. The only saving grace was the location. It's just a stone-throw away from Times Square, but that's really not enough for me to go back again.

I chose this hotel because of the location, a good point of this hotel. However some problems appeared along my stay. Wifi didn´t work. Some passengers had the same issue. the elevator is slow and just 2 are not enough since the service staff use them as well. It´s expensive if you consider what you receive. the room was clean and looks like new, well decorated. I forgot a flash memory at my room. i came back 2 hours later and the service was made, my flash memory "wasn´t found"

Superb location - welcoming and helpful staff - large, comfortable room and kind bedAdvice: try to be up high - it is NYC and the streets are crowded(noisy)All elevators worked just fine and never a long delay.Newspapers and cold water at the front desk much appreciated.Definitely would stay again - offers discount to returning customers!Housekeeping staff were friendly and very competent.

I picked this hotel because I was able to get one room for a family of four which was one double size bed and two bunk beds for the children. I could not easily find any other hotels with this arrangement. It was also conveniently located very close to Times Square (about 1/2 a block away). The room was small, clean and comfortable and it worked out fine for us. The elevators were a bit slow and full. The housekeeping supplies cart was always parked nearby the elevators in the public area (on our floor at least). There did not seem like there was much room on the floors to store this stuff away. But that didn't bother me. I was satisfied with this hotel.

the hotel was nice, the bed was to short for me. in the shower the water always went out of the bath because its built poorly. the rest was great. pretty room, great air conditioning. I recommend!! gtteat location!

We had a wonderful stay at the TRYP hotel in NYC last weekend! Clean modern and a fantastic location! We saw Wicked on Broadway and we walked with no problem. We were also very close to Times Square. The hotel staff were great and we got a free upgrade to a suite!

At first glance I thought this place was great but I was wrong . It takes a lot for me to complain but this is far worst place I have ever stayed .Staff at front desk were ok but not that friendly second of all once got off at our lower level floor the hallway carpet was the most disgusting and dirty I have ever seen in a hotel . It looked as though it hadn't been vacuumed in a week . Room size was ok; aircon so noisy I couldn't sleep, flag pole outside window would make a bang sound so loud during the entire night if windy. Also found I was very itchy in bed I suspect like others have mentioned on here bed bugs . Also one day got back to room at 4pm and room still hadn't been cleaned which is a bit of a joke. Great location but besides that sorry wouldn't stay here again.

Nice size family room. Comfortably sleeps five. Remodeled rooms are clean and modern. Great location. About a block or two away from the V on Broadway in Time Square. Great food locations within walking distance. Highly recommend this hotel.

My husband and I arrived to the hotel around 10:30 A.M. and we were super excited that we were able to check into our room then. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a deluxe queen for 5 nights... Small, but plenty of room for two people. It's times square in Manhattan, of course. Bed and pillows were comfy and there was even a desk to collect all of your shopping finds for the day. There is a fire house around the corner, so we could hear the sirens pretty clear. However, i was never woke up at night due to noise. The bathroom is super small, which again was expected, so no complaints here. The only odd part was that the shower was door-less, so water dripped ALL over the bathroom floor. Overall, this was a great stay for the price!

The 12th floor room was spacious, with good space on all sides of the king size bed and comfortable space for a chair and the desk. Great shower. The location was very good, close to Penn Station for our arrival on the Acela, and a short walk to Broadway. The lobby was small, but nicely designed and comfortable. This would have been a 5 rating but for a few small things. The hotel uses soap dispensers in the shower, but for two days neglected to fill the hair conditioner dispenser. Frustrating. And the air conditioner produced the right temperature, but was disconcertingly noisy. Not good for a sound sleep.

Stayed in trap Wyndham it was really good. It was really close toe Times Square and the theatre district. So convenient for everything really. We used theropod on and off tour bus with the stop just on the corner. While the rooms are small they have everything you require and they are clean. The corridors are a bit scruffy but adequate. The staff are very friendly and helpful. plenty of eating house close by. Not far from the Rockefeller centre which is a must to visit. Never heard any noise other than the air conditioning.

I am not much on hotels, but in NYC you have little choice. The location is excellent in the middle of Times Square. The staff were very friendly and let us check in early. The room was more than adequate, it is NY after all. I paid about $225 a night with a groupon over Labor Day weekend and I can't imagine I would have gotten a better deal anywhere else.

The rooms are small and tight, but clean and comfortable. After all, you won't be spending much time here! This is close to all the Theater District, and makes walking to and from Broadway performances simple. Ample places to eat nearby. Subway and bus lines close as well.

This is a lovely hotel right in the heart of Times Square, the lobby is so open, the decor is lovely and it is very comfortable, they have cold lemon water and chocolates at the reception, nice touch after a long day of sightseeing or shopping. Every member of staff we came in contact with was very nice and the room and shower room were very clean and well maintained through our five day trip. We got it at a reasonable price considering it was a last minute trip, the air conditioner worked and it was very hot while we were there so we were happy. That said as is expected in N.Y.C the room was small and it was also very noisy we could hear everything from the street below, we were on the 9th floor they really could use double glazing, we bought some ear plugs and just enjoyed the hotel .

My wife and I stayed here the weekend of September 12, 2015. For some reason (September 11 commemoration?) it was very difficult to find a hotel in NYC this weekend. We had a party to attend at John Sullivan's bar in Times Square, and wanted to stay nearby. Finally we found a Travelzoo deal at TRYP, which worked out well for us.First impressions of the hotel are that Wyndham is trying to demonstrate a chic, sleek look for this hotel. The lobby is almost surrealistic, with giant white columns reminiscent (to me, at least) of bedside lamps, offset with a mixture of tile and what looks like recovered wood. It's a nice look. There is a bar immediately at the entrance, which you have to walk past to get to the reception desk. From what I saw the bar was not a big deal, there were never many people at it, so the lobby was not very crowded.Our room itself was modern and clean, overlooking 48th Street. This room is not large. There was a queen-sized bed, a small desk, dresser, and bathroom with shower. It's Manhattan- we were not expecting a palace. We were pleased with hoq quiet the room was, even on a busy Saturday night. The one exception to this was the fact that there is a NYFD fire station around the corner, so there were fire trucks with sirens passing by during the night. But there was no noise from neighboring rooms, the hallway, or the elevator.We really only used our room as a place to sleep and change clothes, but for our purposes TRYP was great. And relative to the other hotels on the same weekend, our rate was very good. I would recommend this hotel for one or two people who are looking for a quiet and clean place to stay for a night or two in the Times Square area.

Hey guys,My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights during our honeymoon. The experience was above our expectations with faboulous customer service from our nightshift front desk Alphonso!Always went above and beyond our needs which make it a really comfortable stay.Bang for buck as prior to booking the hotel, we couldn't believe the prices rite in the prime of time square, restaurants, tour buses and with no more then 5-10min walking distance from all the Broadway shows.We highly suggest this place for any stay as there's no complaints from us. Cheers Jay & May

We booked into the Tryp hotel on a last minute business trip to NYC. The hotel was booked solid for during fashion week so we grabbed the last available rooms online. We both arrived late, me at 11pm my colleague at 2AM. We booked two prepaid rooms but my colleague was "walked" to New Jersey where he had to pay for his room rather than the hotel comp'ing it.The room itself was fine, and reasonable quiet.When I awoke I found my colleague had been "walked" and was trying to get back to town. I asked for the reimbursement for his room, which the person at the front desk arranged through the booking service online. And they were kind enough to comp both of the rooms, which is why they got 2 stars from me.However, when I returned to my home my arms and hands were covered in bedbug bites. I know this is an endemic problem at many, even upscale, NyC hotels. But nonetheless, it is very gross to have to experience it first hand. All hoteliers in NYC need to be vigilant about this, failure to keep these pests under control is not optional.

We stayed for one night at the hotel on the 2nd floor. We had a double room which was very nice and had great a/c . The beds were super comfy and the room was modern. Location is brilliant right around the corner from Times Square. Do be aware if you are coming from JFK and getting a taxi it will take a good hour and a half with traffic so if you can use the train . Only thing I didn't like about the hotel was they charged our credit card for the room without asking how we wanted to pay and slipped the bill under the door in the middle of the night. We would have preferred to pay cash but it was no big deal

Having read mixed reviews about the property, I decided to chance it after getting a great rate for labor day weekend. I have reserved and pre-paid for a suite but when I went to check it, I was informed they oversold the suites and would have to make do with another room type. The lady at the desk was very apologetic and compensated us for the inconvenience, which I was satisfied with. The hotel is finishing up a very nice renovation in which a really modern lobby was been designed and ultra modern room that were nicely updated. I was quite impressed with the value/ accommodations for the area until I went to remove my luggage from the closet in the room on my last day, placed it on the bed, and TWO LARGE ROACHES crawled off my suitcase into my bed. I immediately got the manager who came up in which I made her go through each of my bags in which we found multiple other large roaches (2 inches) and several smaller ones. She said she was quite embarrassed (very nice about handling the situation) and also compensated us for the disgusting experience, but the thought of roaches in my room having crawled over who knows what freaked me out. One of the ones I saw ran under my bed as well. This has the potential to be a nice property, and the staff was excellent even with all the issues I had, but I am most definitely not going to return after this experience... it was simply gross!

The front desk staff refused to do a pre check in. They charge $2 to hold your bags until your room is ready. The rooms are very small and the hallways are dirty. The elevator takes forever and also extremely small. It is a convenient location and is priced well. Would not recommend for a long stay.

Always stay in this area so was pleased to get a good rate at this hotel. Unfortunately that's the only plus point. Reception area bright and modern and had boutique feel. Rooms were usual New York size but clever use of furnishings made it seem roomy but that's where it ended. While we were checking in we overheard clerk tell a business guest that wi-fi had been down for 3 days!!! And was offering to find her a different hotel. We were not afforded same information. On getting to our room there was water cascading down the inside of window flooding floor. When we called front desk they sent a maintenance man who said it was likely room above's A/c and we'd have to wait til morning. The water proceeded to drip on to a towel like Chinese water torture ALL NIGHT !!! TV and bedside clock didn't work and bathroom is tiny and badly designed so that shower floods all over the floor. Next day after 3attempts we got clock and TV fixed but waited 2 hours for housekeeping to bring a bottle opener to room. Flooring in corridors is filthy and paint spattered so don't think we'll be rushing back to this hotel.

It is a very nice hotel in New York. I will recommend it to anybody. It was a nice ,clean and good establishment. The customer service is really friendly. The awesome thing is that our hotel was right next to Times Square. So it was only a short walk

Great hotel in the heart of the Theatre District, just a block from the TKTS booth and walking distance to almost all of the Broadway theatres and many off-Broadway ones as well. Subway stations a few steps away. We had a "Fitness Room" which had an exercise bicycle in a corner of the nicely-sized room. We used it to hang clothes on. It could use more outlets by the bed. The bed, while comfortable enough, was too soft for my taste. Room was kept spotlessly clean and it was very quiet at the back of the hotel. The accommodating and welcoming front desk folks were just the icing on the cake. We hope to stay there again.

They sold 3 of our hotel rooms even when we had informed them of late arrival and then acted as if it was no big deal. The hallways smelt like a sewer. So bad the fire department arrived.You need to be able to put up with terribly small rooms. Don't recommend this hotel when you have so many great options in the area.

My wife and I stayed for three nights at the TRYP Times Square in NY. The room, although small, was comfortable, clean, and quiet. The location was excellent. The staff was extremely professional, attentive, kind and warm, and gracious. Besides these adjectives a special mention concerning some of the employees: Saadat (humble), Karmela (funny and honest), Tricia, Adelina, and Suny (very patient with this older man-they even put up with my sense of humor, and Ben the manager (understanding, and appears to be very competent). Some difficulties about the room: no shower door so water does splash on the floor and the elevators are slow

Lobby looked pretty shabby. Signs asked for patience during lobby renovation. Our first tiny room strongly reeked of mildew so we called down to the front desk and asked to be moved. Was told they'd be right up with a new room key. After 30 mins of sitting around trying to not mess up the bed, tried to call front desk to follow up--no answer. Went back downstairs to find the front desk unattended. After a few minutes someone came out, I explained the situation, and they got me a new room key. Tiny room #2 had a different but equally unpleasant smell. If we had booked non-refundable rooms via Hotwire I would have just walked out of the place, but we were stuck. Bathrooms are super tiny and shower DUMPS water out onto the bathroom floor, so you end up walking around on sopping wet towels. Location is about the only thing going for this place.

Everything about our experience in New York City was heightened by being at TRYP. The staff were attentive and always there ready to take care of us and give us helpful hints about NYC. Our room was a good size and were extremely impressed with the amenities. The one problem with the room was that the shower was constantly leaking all over the bathroom floor whenever someone showered, that has everything to do with the design, but it was quite annoying. The location was incredible, right by Times Square and only a block from the subway. I would definitely recommend TRYP by Wyndham to anyone!

Stayed for 7 Nights last week and the standard was high for NYC, The room was always very clean and the staff were very very helpful! The only thing they need to look at is the attention to cleanliness in the Hallways that always looked dirty! They need to sort that, other than that a great place located so centrally!
In a perfect location, close to Time Square, I enjoyed warm welcome, friendly and smiley service. Rather small but clean rooms: very good value for money.

This is our first stay in New York and this place would have gotten a five star rating from me......however.....when we got to our room we found a mouse running around. Now I know that would bother a lot of people but he was cute and I am an animal lover, just not those kinds of animals. We immediately called the front desk and they moved us to a room right off of the elevators so we hear all of the noisy tenants. That being said the room is clean, the staff is friendly and they took care of us right away when we noticed the mouse. We named the mouse Louie and we asked them not to kill him. I would probably stay here again in the future although I will be checking for extra guests under the furniture next time before we settle in.

Thanks to Mariana, Ben, Suny and Larry, we were attended to like "royalty" with smiles and courtesy. Alicia needs to be friendlier and didn't have the information we needed and for a conscierge, that is not acceptable. However, ALL ELSE WAS WONDERFUL! The room was decorated beautifully, beds comfy. I would STRONGLY recommend a stay here while in the Big Apple. And the location??? PERFECT!!!!!

The TRYP Wyndham is superbly located on the 48th street. Surrounded by eateries and theatres and the Hershey showroom,its very easy to locate.We stayed at room 827 from Aug 26-30,2015 and enjoyed our stay.Times Square is just around the corner and you can walk over there anytime you want to.Broadway too is stone's throw away as are many famous eateries of Manhattan.The rooms are small but in New York one can understand that. However,having a refrigerator in the room would have made it more convenient.Linen was clean but the bathroom could certainly do with a shower cubicle.Gets all watery with no enclosure for shower.The breakfast was just an apology arranged near the reception as is the lobby itself,but then there are so many eateries closeby that you are spoilt for choice.The staff are very businesslike but polite especially the very interesting Kumar Futbol who is a very helpful staff.Wifi was really good and the concierge helpful.The elevator needs improvement but the business center is open for 24hours and guests can get their printouts for free.Overall, a decent place to stay though you should not expect the same standards as the other Wyndham hotels.I had left my adaptor back in the room by mistake,while hotels in Europe mail such forgotten items for free,the lady from the hotel agreed to do so provided I pay for the courier charge.Nonetheless, definitely a place worth checking out in Manhattan.

I am really pleased with my stay here at Labor Day weekend. We stayed there for two nights. Time Square is next block and most of the restaurants are block away. I stayed at a room which has BALCONY. Thai is Just Perfect. So, Overall, Nice place to stay for Couple and Family.

Some reno's supposedly completed poorest attempt I've ever seen. Elevators are too small and slow. Everything is dirty and smelly. Maintenance people rude and as far as I could see lazy. All kinds of things to do but their just standing around. Rooms are poorly laid out and small. Even though they upgraded us to a larger room it was poorly laid out. It did have a huge patio but no furniture to enjoy it.

My fiance and parents and I stayed here over this Labor Day weekend. Overall, it was a positive experience. The location is great - just a block off Broadway, so easy accessibility to Times Square, shopping, dining, transportation, etc. I felt like the rooms were very small, though - we got a room with a king and it was tight to maneuver around. I also felt like in trying to be trendy with the re-design, the hotel missed out on some functionality - the bathroom was also small without much space to put toiletries, and the shower only had a partial glass wall, which made it impossible to keep water from getting onto the main bathroom floor. I'd have rather had a more functional bathroom space than one trying to be contemporary.

Myself and a friend booked this hotel for 3 nights after a long search for somewhere relatively inexpensive but with a central location. We got a pretty good deal at just under £400 for 3 nights which is excellent for a city centre hotel in general, especially considering we stayed over Labor Day weekend!The location is excellent; around the corner from Times Square and Broadway, a few minutes away from Rockefeller Centre and Fifth Avenue and about 10/15 minutes away from Central Park. The hotel itself is currently undergoing renovation, the staff have even placed a sign in the lobby to apologise for the hotels appearance whilst the renovations are taking place but the hotel is still clean, modern and well designed, so I should imagine it'll be spectacular once finished.The rooms themselves aren't overly spacious but this didn't bother us. Our room was clean, quiet, comfortable and well equipped. Staff were OK, they were friendly enough and service was efficient from both reception staff and concierge but they didn't make much of an effort to welcome you or provide you with information. That being said, some people don't favour overly enthusiastic staff, so this might not be a bother to some.We were allowed to store bags on check out for a fee of $2 per bag which is reasonable whilst we explored the city before our flight. The only thing that let this hotel down was how they dealt with payment. I provided my card details on booking.com and was told I'd pay the hotel on arrival. My friend decided she would pay for the room on her card instead on check-in so they swiped her card. I then checked my bank balance the day after to discover they'd taken a deposit for the first night from my card for which I wasn't informed. This left a huge dent in my account and not a lot of money on my card which could have potentially ruined our time away in the US. When querying it with the reception staff, they couldn't give me a clear answer and just said "you must have paid a deposit on your card before you came". I told them I never and explained it didn't leave me with a lot of money. They then changed their track and said it was an authorisation which would be released on my card within 72 hours...all the time whilst the receptionist was explaining this to me he couldn't look me in the eye and was instead just staring at his computer screen. I wouldn't have minded so much if I was told they were going to authorise/take a deposit or if they could at least give me an explanation and an apology but nothing of this sort. This let the place down.We didn't try breakfast on any of the mornings nor did we use the bar so we can't comment on these aspects. Overall this is a good hotel in a great location at a very decent price. I would return but their payment policy (which the staff themselves can't even explain) has put me off a little.

We stayed in Tryp, NYC on Friday-Sunday (3days 2 nights). TRISH & JOSE from the front desk were very accommodating. We had some issues with our room (which we booked from priceline.com) and they very straight forward in helping us with our concern. Especially Trish, she offered us to check another room and see if we would like to be transfered. We didn't have a refrigerator in our room, and Trish made sure for us to have one. Even the other staffs were very helpful, directing us where restaurants were located in the area. They were very polite and kind. We will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family back in PA.

We were very happy with this hotel choice. My mom and I stayed here for three nights, from August 31st to September 4th. The hotel was clean, the staff were courteous, and most importantly it was close to everything. This hotel is less than 5 minutes away from Broadway theatres, Times Square, and many, many other attractions. It was very convenient. If you're flying into Newark Airport, I'd recommend taking the Newark Airport Express bus as a means of transportation to the hotel. Get off at the "Port Authority" stop, and you're a 5 minute walk from the Tryp Wyndham. We used this method to get to/from the hotel, and it cost us around $25.00 per person and about 30-40 minutes of time.

We visited this hotel in Jul 2014, the hotel was still named Best Western Plus President, Time Square. The location is perfect. We can visit Time Square and Broadway by walking distance. Lots of restaurant, bar and shop,too, so convenient.

I am writing this review since I have been reminded of our visit based on the TRYP promotional emails I have been getting. More than a year ago, my family and I booked a 4-day stay at the Best Western Plus President Hotel off on a side street of Times Square. With two young kids in tow, the location was perfect to get around without wasting time riding cabs, buses or the Subway.Check-in was swift. From the photos in TA, don't think much has changed in the hotel lobby. Still the neon coloured lights, probably the aquarium is still there and the bar at the far end. No frills. Parking a bit difficult to secure. The hotel room itself was small for a family of 4. A rickety sofa bed was converted as a bed for my eldest child.But... the location made it all worth it.During our visit, I didn't think it was worth it to have breakfast at the hotel. There were choices of diners anyway in the vicinity. There was a small neighbourhood park nearby.M&M store and Hershey's were a stone's throw away. Of Mice and Men was playing at an adjacent theatre.Aoki restaurant beside the hotel was great for good Japanese.Hope this review still helps. I don't mind trying this place again despite the new management.

This hotel is great, they have a lot of good things. The breakfast was awesome, the bar had excellent drinks. When we arrive the lady of the front desk gave us a suite that had 2 queen beds, 2 bathrooms, a kitchen and a sofa. This was a great experience for us.

Ignore the bad reviews, trust me. Our stay with Tryp was wonderful, even in a Twin room which had two single beds. Me and my friend thought the room was a reasonable size for the price we paid! Stayed 6 nights total for about $1100 incl tax! The woman at check-in was very polite, friendly and helpful. Incidentals only $25 per day, which is excellent for those travelling on a debit method rather than credit. Location was really amazing, right off times square! Bathroom comments about water going over the edge are more than dramatic, it is completely fine! I was very pleasantly surprised with my stay here. Further, comments about the hallways being 'out of date' really are ridiculous. The lobby is fantastic, and they are obviously still doing further renovations. However, all the rooms were spotless and the cleaners did a great job.I really recommend to anyone looking for NYC accommodation - stay here! PS any comments about noise I found strange, you can turn off the air conditioning on the wall switch (some people complained you couldnt adjust it?) and ask for a quieter room that is around the back and you won't hear a peep!

Stayed for 4 nights in September 2015. The room was small, but everything worked and was clean, with the exception of the bathroom door that kept jamming. I think it had been recently refurbished and was still a bit rough round the edges. For the price the location was great, although it is quite close to a fire station which can get a bit annoying. Staff were friendly enough as well. I was happy as we didn't pay too much but wouldn't say it was a 4 star hotel. Would consider going back if the price was right.

We stayed there on 18 July 2015. The reception was great and helpful, especially Aphozie The room was a bit small and the bathroom is ridiculous small, with no shelves to put the toiletries there. When we had the shower, the water came out as there was no shower curtains there. It was on the 5th floor. The lift was just enough to get our suitcases in. We left our luggage there for 5 days as we joined a bus coach tour in New York and came back on 23 and 24 July. This was handy for us as we did not want to take the cases with us. We were given Room 627 and the room was a bit larger and the bathroom had a curtain in the shower so this time no problem at all. The location was central to everything, we walked to Times Square and Broadway and St Patrick's Church. The location was spot on for everything. There were lots of eateries around. We took the metro to Chinatown. The hotel was very close to the cruise terminal as we had to embark the Sea Princess at Manhattan which is only 5 minutes by taxi. Will we go back here again? Yes. May be a room on the upper floor.

The location for the hotel is amazing!! If your looking for someway in the middle of the city, with most of the main torist attractions in walking distance. This is for you!The hotel rooms are very basic, nothing special. Just simple, to the point. But clean, and very comfertable beds! The staff in the hotel are fine, there not rude, but that they don't go out of there way too help. For example, i rang up 3 times saying the air-con wasn't working, but they did nothing. Thankfully after the first night i found, by myself, the controls too the air-con. When is actually on, works brillanlty! Nice cool rooms. Also the wall are pretty thin...being woken up most mornings by the sound of the hover. Plus the fire station is behind the hotel, therefor you will hear a lot of fire sirens. So not the quiets of hotel. I promise you, the location is amazing! I had a week in New York and i was so pleased with the hotel. Yes there were something thing that weren't amazing, the noise, or the staff. But that doesn't take away the location! Its what makes this hotel change form a "average" to a "very good"I would recommend.

Hotel recently went through revamp and is very modern. Upper landings still to be completed but the entrance and rooms are great. Only two blocks from Times Square with lots of resturants and shopping close by. SEE TIMES SQUARE AT NIGHT, FANTASTIC!!!

We had an excellant stay, the staff was great and very accommdantng. We were given a small room the first day and was promise a larger one with two beds for the next day.The hotel and rooms were very clean and updated. The location was near the Broadway theatre district,and the price of hotel was great.

Small rooms but that's ok. Clean room, nothing like the negative reviews on this page... Its a small NYC hotel and not a resort.Nice omfortable bed, good housekeeping service, great location, helpful and friendly staff. .

I ran across this hotel through Groupon and boy did I regret it!This hotel is so small, the beds are so uncomfortable, me and my boyfriend kept rolling off it because for some reason the middle of the mattress was a little bit higher,...caused some serious horrible back & neck pains! And the washroom in the room...wow, never see the tiniest washroom in my life, so tight was hard for me to even do my makeup in! Even the elevators in this hotel....were they ever small.... this property honestly is not meant to be a hotel, it just doesn't work. The location right at Times Square though is just perfect however try and find another hotel.

When we arrived we were given a room on the 7th floor.Opened the room door to find the bed had not been made up and the room was about the size of a matchbox.We went back down to reception to complain and they gave us a room on the 15th floor which was marginally bigger so we decided to make do.Apparently most of the hotels in New York have small rooms.Apart from that we were quite happy as we were central to Times Square and is a very busy place.

if you want a hotel for location, you could not do better. Beds wear clean, room small (expected in NYC). but floors were dirty, they look as if they never have been cleaned or vacuumed. staff was very nice, no complaints, elevators were small and you did have to wait to use them as they always seemed filled. Would stay here again for a short stay in NYC.

Stayed with a large group for a week in March. Checked into Best Western and the next morning it was the TRYP... The room was shabby, very dark and had mice. We were changed to a different room, which was a little bit better. Renovations going on the whole time we were there....Lifts were a joke, it could take 10 to 15 minutes to reach the lobby. Day staff were okay to deal with, night staff were very abrupt, our key card had to be changed every night, which we would discover after a 10 min trip on the lift and then have to go back to the lobby.....Location of the hotel is excellent, only around the corner from Times Square.....

Excellent hotel for the price. Great location. We especially loved meeting Suny, who works at the front desk. She was so helpful and had a lovely personality. We were sad to part with her at the end of our trip!

This hotel was kind of a disaster. During our stay, the hotel was replacing its wall papers. The work lasted around 10 days, and started as early as around 6 am. So it was impossible to sleep after, since it was too noisy. Our package included breakfast, if that's what they call it there at TRYP. There were barely a few items to eat. We were staying in room for 4 ppl. 2 ppl were settles in the bed, and the other 2 had to sleep on a bunk bead. Well, everyday, house keeping would pass, we asked them to make the bunk beds, which they never did, nor did they refill our shampoo and soap stack. The wi-fi almost worked.

We booked a king room and got a queen; we requested a high floor and got a low; the air conditioner in our room barely worked; our room was filthy including food and debris on the floor; they didn't refill our room coffee, soap or shampoo; the hotel hallways and elevators were dirty; and the staff was not very friendly.

We had a decent visit here at Tryp by Wyndham Times Square (not to be confused with Times Square South). The location is great - close to many Subway lines, restaurants, the Theater District and Times Square of course. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful as well - my family and I were really impressed by the quality of service, great job guys! The price we got was great for the location too. Overall, we were happy with our stay and would stay here again. Now for the stuff that needs work: when we first arrived, we were sent to a room that had supposedly been cleaned, but didn't appear clean and smelled as if someone had just smoked a cigarette moments ago. Annoying considering I had just signed a piece of paper saying I'd have to pay $250 if caught smoking in the room. I called down to the front desk and they were super apologetic, and had someone upstairs in 5 minutes with keys to a new, pristine room. They also sent my parents up to their room and it was still being cleaned - well after the designated check in time. While everything in the rooms was good - comfy beds, nice towels, fresh sheets, and working AC to keep us cool - the hallways were consistently dirty, with debris on the floor and service carts/bins in the tight common area. While the rooms were cleaned, the hallways were always neglected. Other things: the lobby bar was cash only or you had to charge drinks to the room, which we thought was odd. The weird half-glass shower door was not my favorite - I would imagine a bigger person would have water going all over the bathroom. You are next to a busy firehouse, which we were fine with as we also live in a city, but if you need complete silence in order to sleep, you may find it a bit noisy (but that's almost anywhere in Manhattan). And of course the rooms are on the small size - but again, you are in NYC, so that is to be expected, and who comes here to hang out in the room anyway, right? So if you are on the fence regarding booking, I would say go ahead, but manage your expectations.

We stayed for a week in New york feb/march 2015. A family of five in a family room, which was a really huge room with two queen beds, a bunk bed and a sofa bed. Excellent acommodation. It was cold outsida, but warm and cosy inside. Two TV-screens, a coffe machine, a refigerator, a very nice bath room.The only thing missing is a fair priced or included breakfast. A bit pricy for us so we had breakfast elsewhere.

Just got back from a fantastic stay at this hotel. We stayed in a huge family room. Bathroom was huge too. This was a great location in the thick of all the Times Square action, but also only a short walk to Rockefeller center. There are about 3 subways very near and others in walking distance too. Beds were really comfy and we slept like logs every night. I would recommend if you want to stay in the heart of Times Square. Oh and free wifi!! Some hotels I looked at were charging $16 per day per device so free fast wifi was great!!

Pros:Great location - about 2 blocks to Times Square, Theaters, Restaurants.Inexpensive if you find a Deal - For me, I used a Travelzoo Deal and the cost per night was less than $200 and that was with all taxes and fees included. Murphy's Tavern next door - great selection of draft beers, usually $4.00General cleanliness was acceptable.ConsRoom 305 - twin bed room has no view - just adjacent building and roof below.The bathroom is TINY. You must straddle the toilet just to close the door! (no joke!) The sink is tiny and no shelf or anyplace to put your toiletry items. The shower has not door or curtain. It has one glass panel and the an equal size opening to enter. If you don't turn the shower head towards the wall/corner and cuddle the wall to get under it, you can expect an excessive amount of water going out onto the floor. Better have extra towels! Even when trying to hug the shower wall to keep water in, the floor still gets quite wet. Room was quiet - no street noise. General Items:Only 2 small elevators. Air Conditioning worked fine.

This hotel is a joke, not really worth a penny! Extremely dirty in our floor, shower has a half glass that gives the water all the chance to reach the floor, room very small, people are not very kind, price is not really attractive and breakfast doesn't justify to stay here either... The only thing good is the location but just in case you are planning some Broadway shows!

The best part was the huge comfortable beds lovely bedding very clean The room wasn't what I expected it was a little scuffy with worn marked furniture and the plugs didn't look safe. The bathroom was clean excellent with regards safety rails and easy shower Coffee lovely and safe provided I wouldn't recommend having breakfast the food was perfect but a rediculas price a complete rip off Beware of ordering a shuttle bus from the desk without checking they did it correctly Mine didn't turn up. I didn't like the area found it quite rough and dirty

We stayed here for 4 nights on a family vacation with two children in August. The rooms with the bunk beds are ingenious, and the housekeeping is fantastic. The size of the rooms is larger than other NYC hotel rooms, and the amenities were great. Washroom was indeed on the smaller size, but not a big deal. AC worked great, which was important as the city was very warm during our visit. Not much sound came into the rooms - it's NYC so noise isn't escapable, but it wasn't loud at all. The hotel location can't be beat. Nothing to complain about. Would recommend to others, as well as stay there again.

Great location, fantastic price, very nice room. I booked the room through Orbitz less than a week before our trip (last minute decision The to detour to NYC for a night). The location is great, right in the thick of things in Times Square. Our room, which the sign on the door calls a "Family Room," is a very good size. There are two double beds and a bunk bed. The room is nicely decorated and most importantly, VERY CLEAN. Check-in went smoothly and we found ourselves on the top floor with a beautiful view looking towards the Hudson River. I really don't have any complaints about the hotel. We found the concierge friendly and helpful. We would certainly stay here again.

Our hotel experience here was fabulous. The staff were all amazing - friendly, helpful and accommodating. We stayed for 4 nights . Our view was great and rooms were very clean and quiet at night. 5 minute walk to Times Square. Couldn't have asked for a better place. Perfect location. Will definitely return.

If you're looking for a centrally located hotel in the thick of the hustle of Times Square then you'll probably like this place. I'm talking the actual thick of it - noise and all! You will not sleep much here, but that is OK for travelers who intend to make the most of the city that never sleeps. New York hotel prices are high so this one is fairly affordable in that respect. Service at the desk was good, but having said that, there were issues with the room - no hot water which meant I needed to call the desk each night (a maintenance guy would come into my room to tweak the taps - a little unsettling as a solo female traveler). Terrible Wifi connection even though it is listed as "free", I had to go without it for about 80% of my 4 night stay. The hotel have advised that they are in the middle of some renovations so you might be lucky if you go there once the work is complete!

We had stayed at the Tryp hotel in Lisbon and it was fantastic! This hotel was not of the same caliber. It was clean and newly renovated, but if was a former best western. There was no bed skirt on the bed so you saw the bed frame. If they would change this one feature it would have made a big difference. The bath was as small as it could possibly be, however the shower was new and clean. The plus was we had a balcony of all things in New York and we could see the river. I do not think all rooms have this feature. It also is in a great location if you are going to the theater. This would be a good place for a one or two night stay or for a business traveler.

Good location, stilish, not a lot of room space, all essenziale services. Great hotel choice in center midtown Manhattan. Price, although high, is good compared to Manhattan prices. A little noisy the area, there's a active Fire central nearby.

Love this location, right in the theater district, close to everything including the subway. Service is good, but honestly I have had cruise ship cabins way bigger than this! Dark halls and room ceilings make it seem even smaller and darker. Bathroom lighting is also poor, no counter space and the shower runs onto the floor.Would I stay here again, maybe, but would search this area for a nicer room.Fun street market on 8th on Saturday.

Stayed for 1 night whilst in nyc, great location but it needs tenovation/cleaning. The carpets in the elevator area and corridors on the room floors are really dirty with cleaners trolleys and trash scattered all night, otherwise tooms are clean, quiet and comfortable and relative to the price and location not bad, public areas need an update and scrub

The hotel was clean, great service, nice rooms. Yes, they are renovating, but that hasn't taken from our vacation at all.The bartender need some training, he wasn't familiar with the "signature drinks" that is advertised on the website. We had to suggest our drinks to mix.Overall a great place to stay. So close to everything.

Excellent Premier Suite. Bedroom, Bathroom & Living Room with large flat screen TVs on both Bedroom & Living Room walls, fridge and complementary breakfasts. Excellent gym facilities and computer center.

Fair warning, the standard rooms are very small. Basically a double bed and in a room with not much space. A small bathroom. But, surprisingly, the room grew on me. Fantastic location and internet. We were very lucky and got a balcony (on floor 13)GYM LOVERS BE WARNED, the fitness centre in my opinion does not meet the standard to be considered a gym, few weight lifting machines and most do not work.

A friend and I stayed for 2 nights, I loved it. It's in a GREAT location. It's right by Times Square and right by the subway so you don't have to walk far. The employees were very nice and helpful. I didn't like the breakfast, it definitely wasn't worth the $17 that I was charged. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to someone if you're a light sleeper because you can hear the cars outside beeping but I was fine with it.

The hotel is only one street to Times Square but the street is very quiet; the room are big and have a very beautiful and full equipped.The position is perfect because from there you can visit all the Midtown and the subway is just around the corner.It's full of good restaurant and bar for lunch and dinner; the only problem is the price so high (around 19$ each) for a small beackfast buffet

I stayed at this hotel for four nights from the 9th-12th aug 2015. From the pictures of the hotel i was skeptical about the hotel so I kept my expectations low. I was def relieved after getting there I would recommend this hotel to anyone the rooms are small but super comfy the staff is super friendly theyll help you out with anything you ask for the location is excellent right at times square!! I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to everyone!
I was immediately greeted by a friendly face at the check in counter and enjoyed my entire stay.

Nice hotel. Picked it because of the bunk beds, but we couldn't get the ladder to reach the top bunk to work. Noone in the hotel knew how to work it either. Hallways and elevator was tight and in in fair condition. Staff was cordial, but not super pleasant.

Hello my friends!Suny, Cass and managers ( ladies! )I had a wonderful time in NY and in your hotel because of you!Keep the good work, your beautiful smile and your friendship.I really appreciate everything!Wait for me...I will be back!Many hugs,Myriam

Really steps away from Times Square, the location is perfect. Rooms are small, but this is a standard in Manhattan. The washroom could be fixed better and my room had a strong constant noise coming from a refrigerator or conditioning fan somewhere out of the window. The price is fair, btw, considered the location.

If you are looking for just a convenient location to Times Square and don't care about quality customer service, then this hotel will do. We had booked a queen bedroom. At check-in, the hotel clerk told me that they overbooked their queen rooms. So he bumped us down to a full bedroom. All he could do for us was to "comp" their FREE breakfast. It supposedly was "about a 16 dollar breakfast per person". Lies! When I looked on their reviews I found out that no one pays for the breakfast. So just beware of the scam they pull with overbooking. And there is a reason the breakfast is free because it is absolutely horrible. Everything was ice cold, we actually walked out after sitting down. After all, it is NYC. So why settle for some nasty continental breakfast when you have a million other options to choose. As for the room itself, clean but small, as most hotel rooms are in the city. The halls were a complete disaster and dark. And our room was right off the elevator so we heard people all night long in the halls.

Room was ready when we arrived. We went to Tryp south first and walked the 10 + blocks here but that was our mistake. Make sure you got the right one because very similar names. The room was clean and cool upon our arrival. The temp was good but I would like cooler, but seemed air was working hard to keep up during heat spell. Bed was very comfortable and we slept like rocks. Never heard and sound from any other guests. We were on the 8 th floor facing the street so it was a cool view. Elevators are slow and small. Took the stairs down a few times but to hot to walk up to the 8 th floor. Rooms and bathrooms are small but good for sleeping and getting ready. Plenty of hot water. Shower looked very nice, but no matter what we did, we ended up with a lake on the floor. Not a big problem, but annoying and need to change out towels because of wiping up the floor. Did not deal much with staff, but when we did everyone was accommodating. When we went to wrong hotel, the happily helped us out calling ahead for us and also said lots of people make the mistake. Good value and would stay again.

We visited TRYP in early August 2015 and stayed for two nights. You cannot ask for a better location. The room was small, but nicely updated and clean. It was obvious that they were in the process of doing some renovations, which makes it understandable that the hallways were not quite up to par.

We travelled in NYC for work and chose this hotel mainly for its location, as we were exhibiting at the Javits center and it was great, as we could walk to there.During our stay a bad snowstorm out broke. Because of the weather we had to extend our stay, staying a week in total to this hotel. The room was very spacious (We had a 4 bed room and we were three) and allowed us to be comfortable during our stay and be able to work from there. The room was very quiet but the A/C was quite noisy. The staff was very friendly and we had a great time at the bar during the storm that held us inside. Even though many employees couldn't move to get to the hotel due to the weather everything seemed to be running smoothly, including housekeeping. It was overall very clean. It is an honest hotel without much extras (like room service) - I think this make sense, as the rates were great and we felt like we really received good value for money. I would definately stay again in the future.

Stayed here on my own on a weekend in New York. Right in the middle of the Theater District. Within walking distance of Times Square, Theaters (I visited Gershwin Theater), Empire State Building, Macy's, Circle Tour Line cruise boats, New York Public Library.The hotel itself was modern and comfortable. My room was excellent, clean, and even had its own balcony. I felt safe. My tv remote control was missing but the very helpful room attendant replaced it for me.Instructions for the coffee maker would have been useful, but I managed to Google them.Didn't sleep very well the first night, but hey, this is New York - the city that never sleeps! Slept better the second night, when I left the aircon on (drowned out the street noise).

Located a third of the block east of the corner of 8th and 48th, this property is an excellent place to stay if you're taking in a show and exploring Times Square. We had a twin room which was small but clean and comfortable. Unfortunately, the air conditioning was not working and that's not what you want to hear in mid-August. They did give us a fan, but the temp in the room hovered around 76 which was a little uncomfortable. The hotel has a bar, which had specials at $8 for cocktails which is a bargain in the Big Apple. They also have a restaurant but we didn't partake. The lobby is futuristic but appealing. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We did have a run-in in the lobby with a HUGE creepy-crawly bug upon returning from after-theater dinner. Yuk.

If you want to be near the theatre district and Times Square, this place is great. But the rooms are small (and we have a premium room), things are just not great (door locks, missing hooks on bathroom doors, no shampoo despite our asking, dark rooms....Worst of all is that the lobby staff, particularly in the evening, is completely unable to help with recommendations, directions, etc. They were practically rude in their non-responsiveness. The morning staff was better but also not great. Also in our "premium" room, we had a queen bed and another room with two bunks which would have been great, but the TV is placed in the bunk room in such a way that you can't even watch it. It is unwatchable from both bunks. So, unless you just want the TV for noise, the one in the bunk room is totally useless.

My room seemed like it had been completely renovated. It was clean. Bed was comfortable. Excellent location close to theaters and Times Square. If you come with your family I recommend Premier room. The bunk bed and queen combination with a wall in the middle was excellent.

Ok. When we first got there, our room was so awful I called my travel agent and said, "get me out of here!" Then I spoke with the General Manager who put his assistant Christina on the case. I must say that she twisted herself into a pretzel to try to make things right and so we stayed the week. The first room was smaller than a ship's cabin with a bathroom to match. In addition, half of the headboard was ripped off of the wall. The phone didn't work properly, there was no safe in the room as was promised in the description. In the hallway, there was a commercial shelving unit where the housekeeping staff was storing the linens along with bins for soiled linens. All of this remained there for the duration of our stay. The second room was marginally better since there was a safe (although half of the buttons wouldn't work), the headboard and accompanying light was in tact, and the room and bathroom were slightly bigger. At least you could walk around the furniture. Oh, yes, and the elevators could accommodate as many as 5 whole adults. If we all inhaled. They gave us a complimentary breakfast, which was very thoughtful of them. However, if we had paid $19.95 for it as was listed, we would have been sorely disappointed. All in all, loved the staff, hated the building. Also, loved the location. Just won't stay in a Tryp or a Wyndham ever again.
