Got a great deal on travel zoo and loved the location. Very close to broadway shows and Times Square. But hotel needed some attention. Hallways hadn't been vacuumed in quite a while. I think they were going to replace the carpet but that's no excuse for the mess. Room was laid out well for us with a dividing wall between the queen sized bed and bunk beds for my kids. Air conditioner was very loud and didn't work so well and room lighting was poor. I'd stay there again with a good deal but don't go in with high expectations.

I recently stayed here with 3 friends in one of the double rooms (one bunk bed and one queen bed). The room wasn't too small, just the right size for the 4 of us. Aside from the fact that they never made the bed on the top bunk after the first day, housekeeping was great. The shower doesn't have a door, just a glass that covers half of it and the floor gets a little bit wet, but it wasn't a big deal either. The property's location can't get any better. Extremely convenient, and saved us a lot of money on transportation.

Loved the location and our room was great!! Clpse to times square and great spots to eat. Tons of space in our room and perfect for travelling with family. Two seperate tvs. We had the queen suite. The only thing i didnt care for was the metal murphy bunk bed ladders. Hard on the feet, especially if your someone who gets up in the night to use the bathroom. Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay. Staff was alright, couldnt complain. Would definitely stay there again.

This was a wonderful hotel and close to theater, etc. the room was bigger than I expected and modern. Noise at night was minimal maybe because we faced the side street. Showers do leak on the floor so be careful. Elevators are small and slow.

A perfect location for exploring New York. Light and nice lobby but nice and service minded staff.The elevator and hallways were dark and narrow, but the rooms were ok. Clean and everything worked as it should. the hotel is being renovated so it will surely be even better.Quite responsive with much noise from the street, but it gets you expect when you live in central New York.Will gladly return

We found this hotel on travelzoo.Good price and location.Arrival was made pleasant by the check in staff. Lobby is small and very busy. No restaurant in the hotel.Elevators were creaky and let us out onto a dirty carpet. A tired smell. The room was small with a depressing decor. The toilet seat was loose. There were water stains on the walls. We asked for and were given a slightly better room.The staff were very accommodating and let us out of our further reservation. They admitted our comments and early check out happens all the time.

I stayed at the Tryp for a quick one-night stay in NYC - I picked it because of the brilliant location (literally a stone's throw from Times Square) and the great price I found online. I'd heard stories about the recent renovation works causing disruption but there was no evidence of that at all. My room was pretty tiny, with one of the smallest bathrooms I've ever seen, but was lovely and clean and modern given the recent upgrade works. There's a bit of exterior noise but this is New York and it didn't stop me from getting a good night's sleep. Free wifi was excellent. Lobby staff were generally friendly, although the bellhop was a little grumpy (be aware there is a $2 charge per bag for storing luggage). If you're looking for a central New York room and aren't going to spend too much time in it this is perfect - just be aware that the small room sizes might be an irritation for some. I'd definitely recommend though.

We visited this hotel mid upgrade however this did not effect us in any way. My husband and I travelled to New York with our 12 year old daughter and 1 year old son and this hotel met our needs in every way. The room was newly refurbished and was a great size for our family with very modern decor. I was pleasantly surprised at the size as all reviews of hotels in New York which I read seemed to say that the rooms were on the small side. It was well equipped with comfy beds, 2 large wall mounted LCD televisions, small but modern shower room with lots of fluffy towels and plenty of toiletries, easily controlled aircon/heating, complimentary tea and coffee facilities and bottled water. The only complaint I had was that it was missing a fridge (we did request one but did not receive anything).The location of the hotel is fantastic and is literally on Times Square but you would not know this when in the hotel as it was very peaceful.The staff are pleasant and helpful and always took the time to say hello. If I return to New York I would definitely return to this hotel as my stay here was excellent and I would highly recommend it to others.

The hotel is near theaters and restaurants. We arrived early so we didn't expect our rooms to be ready and we were able to check our luggage with the bellman. Staff was courteous and pleasant. One room with a queen size bed was quite small but adequate. The bathroom was exceptionally small and with only a glass half shower door, the floor got very wet. The second room had two double beds and a sofa (not sure if it was a sofa bed) and was roomier than the other. The air conditioning seemed to be working but its location next to the sofa prevented it from sufficiently cooling the room. This room also had a very small bathroom. I would stay there again because it was clean and very convenient.

We stayed here for one night at the start of our stay in NYC. We arrived late, but staff were welcoming. Hotel is in a fantastic location for most things. We could see Times Square from the edge of our window. The room was fairly small, with a small double bed to match, but was clean and everything we needed for the night. Not sure I'd want to spend longer there though With the great location, comes the noise that you would expect from New York. The windows were thin, and we could hear all of the street noise full boom. But that's part of the NYC experience feel. The location and cleanliness of the room makes it a great hotel for visitors to NYC. I would stay there again.

This hotel was recently renovated and is quite nice. I read reviews that had concerns about room size, water on bathroom floor from shower, etc. so I was a little worried. In the end I thought this hotel was perfect. The room (and elevator) was quite small but I expected this in the city. I considered the bathroom a "micro" bath, but again, it was perfect for what I needed and expected. It was very clean and amazingly quiet! I loved that the floor didn't have carpeting. I adjusted the shower head so water didn't splash out. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was pleasant and it was all exactly what I needed for an overnight. Hurley's Irish Pub, a nice place to grab a bite, just a door away, which was also great. And I got a great price via Travelzoo!

Overall pretty decent, location is amazing but it sort of makes up for the more average rooms.Positives:- free cookie. Upon checking in we were given a complimentary warm choc chip cookie from this secret warm drawer behind reception which was beyond delicious.- room view/location. Overlooking time square at all hours of the day, even when you would wake up at 3am and see people, was something really special. Amazing access to an abundance of metro stops literally right down stairs or only a few minutes walk away.- empty refrigerator. This may sound like an odd bonus but in time square when nearly all food locations are ridiculously expensive, this allowed us to go to the nearest supermarket (surprisingly only a few blocks away) and stock it up to make more affordable meals, as opposed to having it chock full of mini bar things. - staff. They were pretty good when we stayed, they gave us complimentary cookies whenever we asked and the two guys that were on luggage duty were pretty funny and friendly - and were willing to lend me a luggage weigher after my third trip down to the lobby as I tried to cram all my belongings into my suitcase.negatives:- the shower/bath. Bit confusing to use but overall okay.- didn't feel as clean but it was still pretty okay. Also had some issues with the heating in that it felt like either the Sahara desert or Antarctic winds.The rooms on the overall were okay. Honestly the main point of staying in Time Square is to take advantage of that and go out all the time, so there really is no point in complaining about the rooms because you should be out exploring!Overall: 7/10

I'm actually just check in and I'm so disappointed at everything with this hotel I spend almost 1000.00 DSL for 3 days for a suite for my family and from the moment I come to the hotel the attitude of the employees are like if they are doing me a favor !!!! I come early and I just ask if reservation was ready and the concierge ladie was rude then when we got to SUITE the door in the bathroom was broken , the TV shut off by it self the Little refrigerator was not working and on top of the one of the housekeeping got in our room without knock in the door just open the door with her key looking for the person that was fixing the door to ask him for something . Horrible service !!!!! The only person that was very professional was the gentleman that fix the bathroom door .

When we first entered this newly renovated hotel, we were enamored by the brightly lit lobby with bar and fish tank and mosaic tiles. We thought, "This place is beautiful!" Don't be fooled! When we got out of the elevator on the second floor, it looked like we were in a cavern! It was so dark! The walls and ceiling are painted a steel or battleship gray! Upon entering our room, the same dark gray covered the ceiling and a not so nice darker wallpaper covered the walls. Because our room faced the brick wall of an adjacent building, there was not much light that streamed into the room. The bathroom was very nice and clean and updated, but there was only half a shower door, so the entire floor got wet when taking a shower . . . poor housekeepers that had to clean up that mess everyday! I would really like to meet the designer of this renovated hotel and ask, "What were you thinking?"

Like most reviews I've read, we arrived early and our room wasn't ready but that was okay as we just stored our luggage. If you're checking in, the hotel stores it for free, however, if you want to store luggage after you check out, it's $2/person. The entrance is very striking and conveys a different ambience in the day vs. the night. Luckily it wasn't busy when we arrived, but at our departure a tour bus of people arrived and it made for a busy and congested lobby. My friend and I stayed in a twin room and the beds were surprisingly comfy and roomy...can't remember the last time I slept in a twin bed. It's very dark and it's best to keep the shades closed day or night as the view isn't spectacular, at least not for us. The room doesn't have a luggage rack, but I used a small side table and my friend used the desk. It is a tight fit but once we arranged our things we got along okay. Our room's entrance also had a long hallway which allowed us some breathing space upon entrance where there was also a tiny closet and space to store your shoes.The bathroom barely fits one average person, and if your cleansing and hair items are in a hanging travel case it would help as there is not shelf or counter. The sink is all there is for storage. Point the shower head slightly towards the wall and the water shouldn't spray out of the stall as so many reviewers have mentioned the amount of water that escapes from the shower. Great water pressure and always hot water.Would I stay here again...only if I got a deal like I did this time as it's in the middle of Times Square which really isn't my thing, but my friend and I planned this trip spontaneously and were being tourists...usually I just visit to shop, eat and enjoy the big city life for a few days.btw...drinks are cheap at the lobby bar, and the wi-fi wasn't so bad.

Hotel has recently been taken over from best western by the Tryp chain. I stayed 7 nights and it was perfect. I was taking an exam and asked for a quiet room which was honoured. The room itself was really funky down to the headboard. Bed was a small double and the shower door was only a small door so the floor did get a bit wet, but overall I loved it. Really relaxing. Hotel is a pretty good location, only around the corner from Times Square and some good Irish bars around the place. The reception is funky too with a lobby bar and also an atm on site for convenience. Staff were lovely and really obliging. I also got pretty good value for 7 nights. The incidental charge is only $25 a day which is great compare to other hotels and also there is free WiFi. All in all i'll be back here for sure.

We had arrived really early to New York. About 10am on Friday and my husband thought we should just check to see if there were any rooms ready. To my surprise there was a room ready. The gentlemen at the front desk helped us very quickly. The lobby seems to be renovated but as soon as you are waiting for the elevator, its like you went back in to time. We stayed on the 4th floor where it looked like they were still in the middle of renovating. We got to our room, and it was more than what we expected. Very modern and new looking. Clean, and actually more spacious then the hotel we stayed in last time we were in New York. Our stay was very good until i had some questions about my bill on check out day. I spoke to a lady on our last day and she was so unprofessional. Chewing gum in my face, no eye contact and just as if I didn't pay to stay in their hotel. Not welcoming at all. Too be honest, everything was going perfect until I met this lady. She is supposed to be the face of the hotel, when people walk in and out, and she just ruined it.

I had asked for a room away from the street, but guess where my room was - right on 48th St. The room had been recently renovated so I hoped maybe the window had been soundproofed. No such luck. Sirens and horns all night every night - even the noisy air conditioner couldn't drown it out. How could there be so many emergencies? The bathroom was small, but I wouldn't have minded that if I had been able to get some sleep.

This updated hotel is lovely and modern. Our room, though tiny, had been recently updated with cool decor and lighting. The location was fantastic. I absolutely loved walking out of the hotel, making a right, and landing in Times Square. You can't beat the price when you consider this location. The only problem we had, which was a serious deal breaker, was the broken air conditioner. We were in town on one of the hottest weeks of the summer and it was miserable. After long busy days, I spent the evenings staring at the ceiling and sweating. If it weren't for the lack of air conditioning, I would have really enjoyed the experience.

Reasonably priced hotel very close to Times Square. Very noisy at night, I used earplugs. Twin beads in the room are really small. What is most ridiculous is that you need to pay for luggage storage and you need to have room key to access restrooms on the ground floor.

For Brits traveling to New York who are looking for a base along the lines of travel lodge this is the hotel for you! It is for people who want to be in the centre of New York and experience everything it has to offer. You turn right outside the hotel and you are in time square. You turn left and you are on eighth avenue which has restaurants, bars, pizza etc. There is a fire station, on the corner of 8th avenue and 48th street, so yes you hear fire engines but this is New York and part of the city experience. In fact, if you go down to the fire station and have a look around, you will see plagues of 9/11 colleagues and the fire officers will talk to you. The lobby is clean open and cool which is perfect relief from the baking hot sun. They even had ice cold water with fresh lemon everyday which visitors were welcome to have. The lifts are small, but the bell men were on hand to help people get to their rooms without delays or if lifts had problems they would get them sorted asap. The building is being renovated and they are doing a sterling job. The corridors do look a bit tired, but don't let this put you off I'm sure the hotel will get around to updating them and you can see the priority has been the rooms. We had a family room which had two double king sized beds and a good sized bunk bed. All reviews I've read said that room were small, but our room had plenty of space for a large family. I thought the bathroom was quite large, modern and very functional for the hardcore visitor to freshen up and get back on the New York streets. The air conditioning in the room generates noise, but we were thankful for it because we were perfectly cool all through the night and if you are experiencing New York properly, when your head hits the pillow you are out like a light. Our room was cleaned every day and we had fresh towels and bedcovers. I respect that people want to experience luxury, quite, pampering and people may like to spend down time in these surroundings. New York can offer this at a price! This hotel is comfortable, functional and there can not be a more perfect location for New York hot spots. In relation to cost, my Uncle paid 750 pounds for 3 nights (2 people) in London when I paid 1100 for 5 nights/ 5 people in New York. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant, but nip next door to Hursley's for some lovely food and the CHEERS experience (I know it was based in Boston!). Last but not least, every day we had fantastic sunshine but the day we left it absolutely threw it down. Our flight left at 22.30, but needed to check out of the hotel by 12pm. The bell men provide a service to store your luggage $2 per bag while you hit the shops for the final time. While I was at the shops my family decided to go to central park and got absolutely wet through. When we got back to the hotel the bell men took them out of storage for them to get changed and then returned them (extremely helpful). Although the hotel is very well linked to the metro I decided to avoid the pouring rain and book the hotel shuttle service to JFK. Unfortunately, due to an accident a couple of blocks away the shuttle got stuck in traffic. I'm sorry I cant remember her name, but a member of hotel staff got on the phone and gave us regular up dates. In the end she arranged an replacement vehicle, when it came to pick us up we were gob smacked! A white stretched limo! Thank you so much! We got the airport in plenty of time and it really finished off a fantastic time in New York city!.

They are still renovating--but that should be done soon. Rooms are small--bathrooms smaller. Smallest toilet bowl I can remember! (Brand is Toto--like the little dog in The Wizard of Oz) If you are a big person, this is not for you. They ask you to reuse towels, but the shower (which has good pressure and is nice) is designed so that you get water on the floor--that's where the towels have to go. My wife complained about the paucity of mirrors. Ai conditioner is a bit noisy--but that is true many places. On the other hand, we got a king bed and it was pretty comfortable.The small desk and chair were serviceable, the TV was good.On the positive side, we got used to the small room etc after a day. The bellmen were very accommodating and helpful checking in and out. The parking is only about a block away and reasonable for NY with the hotel's stamp. The woman who cleaned the room was pleasant and careful. The people at the reception desk were cooperative. sometimes they even did as requested. We tried to get a fridge in the room but despite three requests, it never came. Maybe the brownies for the grandkids will survive anyway. But when I advised that my wife had been hit in the calf while walking and there was no ice in the ice machine, a bellman with a bag of ice appeared within a very few minutes.Being on 48th St is not for me, it turns out. Too crowded. We stayed there because we were going to theater. And that was good. But I do not need the Times Sq area. Uptown and less crowded streets would better for us.So there is it. This hotel may be for you or it may not.

When I booked this hotel, I thought it would be just as good as the other TRYP hotel in Manhattan, located just 10 blocks away. Boy, was I wrong. I found the lobby to be actually quite nice, but the fun pretty much ended there. The elevator is more like a coffin than anything else, especially since you age a few years standing and waiting for it. I asked reception to not be put near the elevators in hopes of avoiding noise. So where did he decide to put me? On a floor that was undergoing renovations. Yup, RENOVATIONS. Nowhere during the booking process, or at reception, did anybody mention anything about renovations. They didn't even leave a letter in the room saying "Excuse The Renovations". For me, this is kind of inexcusable, especially in a place like New York City where hotel rooms aren't exactly cheap. Why should we pay all this money for a hotel that isn't 100% of what we were promised? Carpets in the hallway were dirty. Maintenance was being done on the walls. Door to my room was rickety and looked like one kick from a 5-year old would be the end of it. The most disappointing aspect was the room size. Rooms are about half the size as they are at the other TRYP hotel. Bathrooms were a bit of a joke, and a mess. It's pretty much impossible to take a shower without the bathroom floor getting soaked, due to the showers not having a door. I hung my towel on the hook on the back of the door and the hook broke off. I would understand these kinds of things if I stayed in a motel or something or an airport hotel for a layover, but not from a WYNDHAM hotel in the middle of Manhattan. The bed was a low-cost spring bed and one side was visibly higher than the other. Room decor itself was nice. Staff weren't exactly attentive or welcoming, with the exception of the guy who organizes breakfast, who was very nice. The thing that bothered me the most was that the maintenance crews were working in the small hallways and sometimes on the room doors themselves. If I can hear them, they can hear the guests. What if a couple was having an argument or private conversation? Or more? Nobody wants an audience. There are 2 different schools of thought about hotels. Some people say 'You're just there to sleep, so it doesn't really matter'; whereas other people, myself included, like to enjoy the hotel. Maybe one day I don't feel like traipsing around the city and I want to relax and enjoy the hotel (it is a holiday!), I want the hotel to be nice. It also bothers me that the manager's response to our criticisms is a cut-and-pasted answer that they put on every review, while saying that most of the reviews are amazing...which they're not.Most of the positive feedback about the hotel has been about the location, which is great, but that only gets you so far. Manhattan isn't even that big. Nowhere is more than 20 mins on a subway, and any hotel is bound to be close to some landmark. Isn't the whole point of a vacation to explore the city, anyways? You can't get away with sub-standard service and amenities simply because you've got a good location.Overall, I think if you're there for a night or two and just need a bed to sleep in, then fine, go for it. But if you're on a vacation where you want to relax, maybe have a friend over for a drink and enjoy the hotel...I'd go for the other TRYP hotel, or pay a few extra bucks and stay somewhere else.

I received an offer from Secret Escapes for a room at the Tryp. My sister and I wanted to take a quick overnight to NYC as a treat after a long weekend working at a craft show. It was such a good price I was nervous, but the room (small) was well appointed, recently renovated, small bathroom with walk-in shower, with a comfortable king bed and nice linens, clean. The hallways are still in reno state, but that did not bother me. The lobby is modern and has a small bar and a restaurant. The bartender had no idea what he was doing, so we ordered a glass of wine and took it to our room. The Concierge had all the info we asked for but was not particularly friendly. We went to the breakfast buffet ($20) the next morning, we were short on time, so it was nice to just walk in. Food was okay.It was a great deal and walking distance to everything. Would go back.

This hotel is not for any honeymooners where you will be served like in a island, still the service was good. This hotel is more for the tourist who plans to go to NYC and visit on vacation, business or pleasure which means the tourist won't be at the hotel most of the time. The hallway are tight, bedrooms and bathrooms are small (like any hotel in a big city), clean bathrooms and clean bed yes for sure, decor is modern. This hotel is nothing fancy or extremely high end BUT it is perfect just for what I mentioned previously. Excellent location, steps from Times Square and also the restaurant row which has plenty of restaurants on one street. Hotel is close to public transportation and taxis will stop any time here. Many attractions are within walking distance, will I recommend? Yes if you do not expect any butler service, but expect a clean room and washroom, also a location. I also will recommend this place if you get a very good price compared to the hotels in the neighborhood. Yes, I will stay here once again because I visited for pleasure and needed a clean, organize and well located place to sleep.

Nice hotel very central for theatres in times square. On entering hotel nice and clean but bit crampted. Staff pleasant well presented. Checking in effortless. Let us into room early very pleased. On entering the 1st of 2 rooms booked disappointed very very small. Walk in room and bed is upon you. 2nd room is much better double bed and bunk beds. Overall hotel in nice but let down by room size.

We booked this hotel for family of four with "premium" room with one double and two bunk beds. The room was adequate for the price in NYC and great location for theater and restaurant access but be forewarned that the front 48th street facing rooms are two doors down from the fire station and do not expect restful sleep especially on the weekend. Alarms went off every two hours. If you are younger and want to party all night than this is a better choice

Great hotel room,great location and great service! Close to Broadway easy to walk to time square but far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the city! Close to great restaurants,entertainment and very affordable! We loved our stay here!!

alphonso the check in clerk was very rude and uncooperative, was there an hour before we were sent to another hotel, they said it wasn't hteir fault but they had all our information including the new hotel which didn't make any sense

My two friends and I came to town for the two U2 shows. I was worried because I thought I booked the TRYP closer to MSG with better reviews.We had no problems. The room was clean. We didn't use maid service so I can't say much about that. We had a premium queen with two bunks and it was a good size. The bottom bunk was comfy. I'd stay there again. I have kids and it's a nice room for small families.Con - the elevator is slow, the halls are jammed with cleaning supplies and there's a fire house around the corner that's busy. Somehow the knowledge that they lost folks in 9/11 made their sirens every 2 hrs seem less loud. Really if you stay here - stop in the station and check the displays. The

My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We found a decent deal on travelzoo.com. We paid $159/night. Having seen that most hotel rates were $200+, we booked this hotel without hesitation despite an average review. Here are the pros and cons:Pros:- comfortable bed- clean room- great location - only a couple blocks away from time square (the room can be nosy but that was to be expected since it's so close to time square)- pleasant staff- nice room, cool decor- decent size room considering it is New YorkCons:- loud air conditioning - tiny elevators, waited a long time for elevator to arrive - hallways are gloomy and dark- shower water pressure was horrible - not enough water coming out of the shower head- no fridgeI would stay here again. If you keep your expectations low, this is a decent hotel. With the price we paid, I think it was a good stay overall.

The room was nice size with a King bed and Murphy bunk beds. The beds were comfortable, which is an important detail when you spend all day walking in NYC. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were on the fourth floor, which was good because the elevators were small and slow, so we took the stairs frequently. Other reviews have recommended higher floors because of noise, but we weren't bothered by noise. This hotel is near Times Square/Broadway, so if that is where you want to be, this is a great location. If you want to be away from this touristy area, try to stay closer to Central park or somewhere away from all the people. Also, we checked our bags with the bellhop the day we checked out since we had time before our flights to sight-see. It was a very smooth process and the bags were stored in a different room. For $2 a bag it was totally worth it!

I was on a bus trip with my sister and this is where we stayed! While the room was small, it was in fact very cozy. We loved it. The location was fantastic and we loved being so close to Times Square. The motel was very clean and our beds were very comfortable. I highly recommend this motel and hope to stay here again.

An A+ all the way. Construction is over. My room was five 0 eight. The room as shown was good size, extremely comfortable mattress and pillows and most important it was WHISPER quiet. The bathroom floor does get a "little" wet but just place a towel down for God Sake. (picture is shown regarding the design) The elevator was somewhat slow but nothing to get upset about. The shower was heaven, like Niagara Falls falling on your head. The lobby was beautiful, half check in and half bar with reasonably priced drinks. Staff was attentive, especially a woman named Cassandra who was extremely professional in her character as well as attire. Parking is $30/day, about 60 seconds walking distance at the Hilton Garden Icon Parking. Travel Zoo currently has a special for $159/night queen bed or $169 king until Sept. 2nd. Also literally directly next door is Hurley's Saloon (decent dine and bar) and on the other side is one of the most delicious Thai restaurants I have ever been to: Pongsri This hotels location is 10*. I will be going back. A quiet nights sleep is crucial in NYC and this place delivers. Thank you for an excellent experience.

The only reason to stay in this hotel is because of its location, the room that we got was very small, and when our neighbours closed their doors our wall started to shake. You could hear people having conversations or having a party in other rooms and in the hallway, which made it very hard to sleep since there were alot of partying kids in the hotel that weekend when we stayed there. The room was always very clean.

The hotel is 2 blocks from Times square, can be a little loud to sleep but this was not an issue for me. They have recently renewed the hotel but you can clearly see that it is still kind of old. The room was fine, except the bathroom door that had a broken knob. It is usually expensive because of its location but I got a big "reopening discount" so it was a great deal.

The most positive thing that I can say about my experience with the hotel was that it is in a good location. When arriving at registration we were greeted in a very curt manner which set the mood for the remainder of our stay. Our room was located on the 8th floor, the corridor was a construction zone...of which we were not aware until we got off the elevator...and it looked like we were in a very seedy hotel. The room was just adequate, the little bit of trendy decor did not cover up the poor workmanship. There was one small bottle of water for four people, no shampoo..we had requested to be moved to another room, reception was to contact us 20 min after the request...this did not happen. We expected the room to be small being in a high demand area however we expected a little bit more than what we got. The positives things that can be said is a great location and it appeared to be clean with comfortable beds.

Central to many theatres & close to Times Square & Broadway makes this a very convenient location. But in attempting to modernise an old hotel there are always comprises. The in-room air-conditioning system was unfathomable & noisy and the wall controls are useless. Bedrooms are clean, basic and functional. Beds are comfortable. Bathrooms are small with showers like waterfalls, but not always very hot. Staff are helpful and knowledgeable. If the price is right, the quirky aspects of this hotel are overcome by the location & value.

All rooms are updated but tiny and it is very loud. All you hear are sirens and horns 24-7. We booked through Travel Zoo and only paid $394 for the weekend otherwise rate is about $900. Their Staff (Sunny from Dominican Republic - as well as Jose) is fantastic and super friendly!!

Spent 7/18 - 7/18 at hotel. Excellent location in theater district. Nice modernization of lobby and rooms. Our room was small, very modern and clean. Size reminded us of European hotels. Could use a few more electrical outlets. AC worked great. Wi-Fi excellent also. A couple of hitches though. First hallways near elevators needed cleaning. Secondly, bellman does not have a clue about service. I wonder about this for front desk also. Good hotels will always call a cab for you, not so here. Asked for cab at desk. They directed us to go ask bellman to get us a cab. He pointed to the door and told us to flag one down on street. We wound up doing this on a hot oppressive humid day.I would give this hotel 4 stars if hallways were cleaner and we got better service in seeking a cab. Seems like a simple cure for management to improve this place. A tip for convenient food. We ate a "Hurleys", a pub/restaurant a couple of doors to the right as you leave hotel. Great food and drink at reasonable prices.

I took my teenage daughter to NYC to see some shows on Broadway. This location was fantastic. It was very close to everything we wanted to do while in NYC. We arrived about 6 hours before check-in time and they got a room ready for us in about 15 minutes. They kept our bags for us on the last day of our visit after we checked out so we could go to one more show before heading home. They were doing some remodeling and the bathrooms were tiny, but it was perfect for what we needed. Everyone was very friendly and I would definitely stay here again.

We went to New York (5 nights June 18/23 ) and stayed in this amazing hotel that is located in excellent area, but the price still affordable! Rooms are not luxury, but very clean and comfortable. They have a very small bar in the lobby area with the basic drinks, but thanks to the barman, I guess his name is Axel, that is very helpful & nice, the bar feels nicer and in few minutes all the guest there,we were enjoying a nice talk and cocktail as friends!! The maid, a Hispanic lady from Dominic Republic, was very nice too !!! Thanks guys for your help !! I can't wait to visit New York again & stay in this same hotel !!!
